reviews.review: The Very Best! Instanbul with a Local. I booked two Intrepid Travel ~ Urban Adventure tours while I was in Istanbul. The first one was the 'Half Day Sight Seeing Tour (Grand Bazaar, Suleymaniye Mosque and Sultanahmet)'. The second tour was 'Eat Like A Local and Cultural Tour with Dinner at a Local Home'.I used Intrepid Travel a few years ago in Nepal and India for a 12 day tour called 'Through the Footsteps of Buddha'. I had an incredible experience and have always been a fan of Intrepid Travel and I recommended them often to friends and family. I was really excited to know that they do city tours and specialty cultural tours through their Urban Adventures branch. Both of the tours I went on via Intrepid Travel / Urban Adventures held up to their incredible reputation and quality. After booking... the communications, logistics, etc. were easy to understand and follow. The pace was perfect. I never felt rushed or left on my own to figure out and learn about the various sites.A great tour happens only when you have a great tour guide. I was fortunate to have Ekrem Seyhan for both of the tours. Ekrem was not great, he was incredible! He makes you feel immediately welcomed, explains the plan for the day and is conscientious that everyone is understanding and enjoying their tour. Ekrem was open to discuss any questions regarding Turkey, the Islamic religion, politics, culture, values, etc. This made the tour extra special and everyone felt like they were included and I learned way more than expected. A guide like Ekrem makes a great tour an exceptional tour.I will value these two tours through Intrepid Travel ~ Urban Adventures forever and will recommend them to friends and family.Thank you!!

Istanbul Uncovered and Istanbul In Focus - The Olive Tree. While in Istanbul, I was able to go on two different Urban Adventures tours. I have toured with Urban Adventures in other cities, and know that they have a quality product. My first tour was In Focus, The Olive Tree of Istanbul. This is a new strand of tours for Urban Adventures and has a social element to it. I visited the Olive Tree center, which works with Syrian refugees. The program included a tour of the facility, dinner made by center members and a chance to talk with people that are currently being served by the center. It was a wonderful opportunity to talk with people displaced by the war in Syria and to hear their stories. It was also great to learn about the Olive Tree and Small Projects Istanbul, an NGO that runs the center. If you want to know more about what is being done in Istanbul to help Syrian refugees and to support this project (they had craft items available for sale made by women served by the center) this is a great way to do it. And the food was to die for. My second tour was the Istanbul Uncovered tour. I visited the Grand Bazaar, several side streets and nooks around the Bazaar and Suleymaniye Mosque (tip, it’s so much less crowded than the Blue Mosque and just as beautiful!) We also picked up amazing potato pastries outside of the Bazaar and stopped at a local shisha and tea house and talked more about local culture while enjoying our snacks. I had a wonderful time on my tour with Suileyman. He was knowledgeable, friendly and engaging. He was able to answer my many questions and helped me to learn more about areas in the city that I had visited, but did not have in-depth information about. It was a very worthwhile experience and I will definitely use Urban Adventures again when visiting other cities.

See Istanbul as the locals do! . We did a nigh trail food tour the day we arrived in Istanbul and it was the best thing we could have done! We came to Istanbul a few days after the failed military coup, not too long after some bombings and spending time with a local gave us such confidence to explore this amazing city!!! We learnt so much about local life in Istanbul, tried all the local flavours, sat and relaxed at a traditional tea shop, had amazing food throughout! It was the best possible way to step into a culture that we thought was so different! In fact we felt right at home after taking this tour! Our guide was fantastic (though I can't remember his name, he was in the middle of planning his wedding) and we had a great time.Tips and tricks - don't eat before you take this tour, when the guide says don't fill up on this, there's more to come BELIEVE THEM! You will not go hungry, you will most likely end up skipping one or two stops to make some room for the later stops! Don't be squeamish. I tried all the local delicacies and they all tastes great, don't think about what's in them, just experience it! Yes you will get to sit down. Bon appetite!

Food tasting tour of Istanbul. We went to the food tasting tour of Istanbul during the evening on 1st October 2016. Our guide Emre was very courteous and helpful, and stay with us for even longer than planned. We never felt rushed to go to the next site, and had an overall lovely evening. The spots were all great, and the experience was very memorable, I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is planning on going. My only criticism would be that I wish there was more information and details of the city, sites, and dishes. Other than that it was great!

Tasting Tour. What a fantastic experience. We got to try all the local favorite foods and see the sights at the same time. Our guide Emre was very knowledgeable and could answer all our questions about local customs, traditions, religions, foods, etc. He worked hard to make sure our tour was customized just for us. We will absolutely recommend this tour and Urban Adventures to our friends.

Fantastic tour in Istanbul!!. We were in Istanbul during the Festival of the Sacrifice, which meant that the tours we wanted to do were not available. Upon contacting the company, we had a "compilation tour" made to show us what they could. Cumali was our guide and he was fantastic! He had such great knowledge of the history and modern aspects of the city. We visited all the must see places and had the most delicious lunch on the Asian side of the Bosphorus. I would not hesitate to recommend the company or the experience. Don't be put off by recent happenings in Turkey. We never felt unsafe and had the most amazing time. I can't wait to go back and see more!Thank you again for helping us with our tour

In focus 'THE OLIVE TREE' - Tour, an eye opening experience!. We took the 'in focus tour' towards an ngo/community center called 'The Olive Tree'. Two fantastic ladies (volunteers) guided us through the Capa district in Istanbul, towards The Olive Tree were we were warmly welcomed by Syrian ladies. Had time and opportunity to discuss with both volunteers and the Syrian ladies, whilst enjoying a wonderful meal cooked by the Syrian ladies at the center. So sad to learn their stories. So heart warming on the other hand to discover amazing initiatives of the very few that make it their goal to create awareness for a humanitarian crisis that concerns us all! Plenty of food for thoughts after such eye opening experience!
Excellent. We took the food tour, and our guide Burak was cheerful and helpfulThe food selection was diverse and you get a taste of everythingWorth the price!

Home cooked dinner with a lovely turkish family . It was a beautiful evening .It was me and two awesome persons and our great guide Ekrem who intrdouced us to an amazing family with great hospitality . I enjoyed everything from the food to the various discussions we had . Sending my love and thanks to everyone involved :D .

Great sights around Istanbul. We had an interesting time with Ekram who guided us around Istanbul. He gave us historical information & showed us some sights we would have missed if we'd been walking through Istanbul alone

Awesone day on town. hey folks... just spent a beautıful and really nıce day around Istanbul, knowıng a lot of the hıstory and culture of the place... amusıng tıme... my lovely guıde EKREM SEYHAN, took all enjoyable places ın a tour that was just AWESOME, hıghly recommended, plus he would be goıng along wıth your crazyness. Most ımportantly, always havıng a smıle, patıence and explanatıon for everythıng... Wıth the bonus of havıng fun... YaYYYY... so, do not mıss the oportunıty to vısıt Turkey, you wont regret ıt...
Lovely time. It was a very nice morning with Urban Adventures. I enjoyed the opportunity to speak with a local and learn about life in Istanbul. A great idea for a solo traveler.

Istanbul uncovered. Ekram was a wonderful guide who got us somewhat off the beaten track to explore Istanbul. He shared insights of his country and provided candid answers to our searching questions. This is a terrific tour if you have already explored Istanbul and would like to experience something a little different discovering a new perspective through the eyes of a young enthusiastic local. Nice job again urban adventures!

Our Night Tasting Trail of Istanbul.. Just 2 of us and Ekrem the young local tour guide! I have been a frequent visitor to Istanbul and am a foodie myself. It was good to be able to ask a local some questions. For me, the tour was just the tip of the amazing cuisine that Istanbul has a result of my experiences during my stopovers. For me visiting a 'local' grocery store (not a big 'globalised' supermarket) to see some of the many ingredients. Olives and cheeses are a staple in this cuisine and we did not touch on them, or any desserts, pides etc I enjoyed the conversations that we had.

seeing the sights in ISTANBUL. this was an all day adventure our tour guides name was Atilla Ersan and did this gentalman know his stuff we saw the sultons pallace, the blue mousk the grand bizzare did a little shopping , horse square, the cankurtaran, also Ayasofya, at lunch time we ate at local restante and had an authintic muslium dinning experance

An enjoyable night spent with wonderful people at a Syrian refugee centre in Istanbul. Small Projects IstanbulWe were met by Jen, from Intrepid, at the tram stop and travelled to the outer districts to meet our guide for the night. We walked through the local streets and a wonderful local market to get to the Small Projects Istanbul premises. Here we were shown the facilities and work done by the teachers and refugees. A wonderful program assisting with language and work skills. We then shared a meal prepared for us before heading back to our hotel. This was about 2hrs 30 mins., comfortable shoes are a good idea for the walk from the tram to the premises. An enlightening night spent with Shannon, an amazing young volunteer doing wonderful work.I totally recommend this urban tour.

Fantastic and an experience of a lifetime. Tolga was fantastic! We ate with a delightful **real** Istanbul family, and it was eye-opening, to see and visit with real Turks in a real home in Istanbul. Tolga is a delightful, interesting, and friendly guide, and we enjoyed the time with Tolga as much as with the family. Tolga showed us parts of Istanbul a tourist wouldn't normally see and opened our eyes up considerably. Wonderful!

Amazing Eat like a Local Tour. This was such a unique and enriching experience. Definitely one of the highlights of our entire week in Istanbul. I highly recommend that anyone who has the chance to get to Istanbul make time for this tour. Our guide Ekrem was so inviting, frank, and informative and the experience gave us a great opportunity to actually gain some insight into the daily life for locals and the three of us on the tour together felt like we had gained a new friend by the end of the night despite having just met a few hours prior. Ekrem took us to eat at a local family's house and for nargile after. The host family were just as gracious and inviting as our guide and the meal Serey cooked for us of eggplant, soup, mezze, and tea was delicious. Despite the fact that Serey spoke only Turkish, with the help of translation by Ekrem we were able to have a great conversation about our respective cultures and at the end of the night she let us know, 'we now have a home away from home anytime we're back in Istanbul.'

Will miss our new friends :( . Me and my girl friend were in Istanbul for a day beforw we flow to Bodrum. After searching many tour operators , we decided to book our trips with urban adevntures. Because of that we knew the most visited sites in Istanbul , we chose their morning trip and night trip. Our guide was Tolga for the morning trip. He was very informative and friendly. He knew all the back streets of Istanbul and took us to many places where we couldnt find on our own. We loved Rustem Pasha mosque most. Lovely tiles. We ended in spice market and tried different types of Turkish delights. We were very sad to finish the tour with Tolga. Many thanks to him. We , later , met with Borak. He is just a real foodie. Ask for him if you want to know about Turkish street food. He took us to new part of Istanbul. We tried many street foods such as mussels , chestnust, meatballs , mezes and even lamb intestine. Dont ask what it is. You just love it if you dont know what it is. :) Burak was very friendly and expert on food. He responded all of our questions with a great patient. He was also very generous about his time so he stayed with us a bit longer and we kept asking him some more questions about the Istanbul and more things. We loved drinking their local beer and tried raki as well. Be carefull about raki :) Thanks to Urban Adventures Istanbul for making us have a great day in such a short time. Highly recommended.

Amazing Istanbul. Two days in Istanbul and two amazing tours with Urban Adventures. Our guides, who were both lovely young men, gave us an insight into the city, we learnt some history and local customs. We feel very oriented to the city now and able to explore further with recommendations on what to see and do from our guides. What a great way to get to know a city and become oriented.Our guides were polite, helpful and patient to our many questions and stops to look at something longer.Thoroughly recommend.

Money Trap. You can do this all just by reading reviews, they just take you in Istiklal Street about 3 hours walking and offer you foods just cost about 10-15$. Nothing special.For the family visit it was just terrible, you can see all from the pictures, they take you to the Turkish like 'traditional house' but as I am Turkish have never seen a such family in my life. They just choose the poorest family and show you about the real Turkish traditional family, never belive it. After visiting house they take you to the cafe that the worst i have ever been. If you do not smoke you cant breath, if you have childiren you are not going to be allow to your children to enter that cafe because of fume inside.Than in that cafe will be waiting you his wife that i couldnt understand why people do need to meet with her. These things should be told before you book.

Home Cooked Istanbul and Istanbul Conquered. Originally I had a day and a half in Istanbul on my own so I had booked the above two Urban Adventures to occupy my time. A friend ended up joining me and we both had a fabulous time on both tours. Our guide, Fatih for Home Cooked Istanbul was knowledgeable and friendly, he took us for tea, to a local house for dinner and then we ended up beating him at backgammon because his lessons were too good! The food was sensational, and I wish I had remembered to ask for the recipe. I'd highly recommend this tour for something different to do in Istanbul.Istanbul Conquered was a full day (~0830-1700) day tour, covering the major attractions of Istanbul. Our guide, Ju Ju was very knowledgeable and ran the day at our pace (we only had three members) with regular stops for refreshments and a chat. Although we could've 'seen the sights' on our own, the information from Ju Ju made everything make sense, we were also to ensure we saw a lot in a limited time frame. My friend was leaving at the end of the tour straight to the airport and Ju Ju even managed to arrange somewhere to leave her backpack during the day. We had an excellend day, thank you.

Istanbul Conquered, Picnic on 2 Continents and Istanbul Uncovered. What is the best way to orientate yourself and feel the purse of a new city? Take an Intrepid - Urban Adventure Tour/s of course! My husband and I have enjoyed our 3 tours with Cu Cu, Pinair and Suleyman. All 3 guides were understanding of our ignorance and queries as we endeavoured to learn and became enthralled by this astonishing, beautiful and fast paced city. Culturally....Istanbul presented us with lots of questions. Our guides answered us with historic facts, personal experiences and lots of smiles and assistance. We can't wait for our next Urban Adventure and look forward to savouring more of the culinary delights that Istanbul has to offer. Wes and Di Williams. Canada

Exploring Sultanahmet . Many thanks to Tolga for introducing me to the book bazaar, Istanbul University, the Sulemaniye and Rustem Pasha Mosques, and the astonishing views from the Mimar Sinan cafe, as well as revisiting all the lovely monuments/treasures I have had a brief taste of before, but never tire of seeing again. I enjoyed hearing you insights.

Great Food Tour. We took a food tour with guide Tolga, who made the tour really enjoyable. He took us to several different places to taste Turkish tea, Raki, appetizers, entrees, and dessert. Somewhere in there we even stopped for a couple beers. Another couple was also on the tour, so the 5 of us ended up talking a lot while eating and drinking. Tolga was really easygoing, and also had great historical background knowledge of many dishes and locales ("you've heard of the Young Turks from the early 20th century? So this is where they hung out, drank tea, and plotted their rebellion"). All in all, a really enjoyable night with a great guide. Highly recommended.

Olive Tree Centre of Istanbul Tour. This is a great way to go "under the tourist line" and meet Syrians and those who work with them. A Syrian family made a fantastic meal, though we would have loved to talk more with the cook and hear her story - - knowing this is probably as difficult to do emotionally as it is linguistically. This is a relationship building tour - not a sight seeing tour. If you love to hear the story behind the story, this is a good start.

Great way to introduce yourself to Turkish cuisine!. We did the night tasting tour with our guide, Tolga. No one else was on the tour, so ended up being personalized just for us. Tolga was great, friendly and easy going. It felt like having dinner with a friend, which was quite nice. He was informative and encouraged us to ask questions about everything Istanbul, not just food. He even stopped and let my Dad buy a jersey at the Galatasaray store that we were passing. He went out of his way to make sure that we were enjoying ourselves and that we were not being rushed to finish the tour. The food was good and it was a nice introduction to Turkish cuisine.

Fun and delicious food tour. Spent a great evening with Burak and one other solo traveler exploring smaller food joints in Istanbul. Burak was both fun and knowledgeable. It was an excellent way to spend the evening vs. having dinner on my own. Plus - I was able to explore much more than I could have on my own. I would highly recommend the 3 hour dinner tour.

Fun and thorough tour. I have to thank Suleyman for an amazing tour this past weekend. Despite the cold and rainy weather (and the fact that I was the only one on the tour!) Suleyman took his time showing me Istanbul, explaining the history of the country, and discussing Turkish culture. Despite the fact that the tour was 8 hours, it didn't seem endlessly long and I was sad to see it end. The tour was a great way to start my trip to Istanbul and I would highly recommend it to anyone. Thanks again Suleyman!

Cultural Immersion. Travelling has always been about enriching the self. With the advent of modern technology, though transporting ourselves has been much easier, enriching the self has become somewhat more difficult. We seem to be in a bubble and continue to do the same thing even in foreign land. Home Cooked Food in Istanbul provides the opportunity to learn a little about the Turkish style of living. I believe it has afforded me to experience something that i would not have had. I escaped the bubble, met lovely people and had great conversation. (With the help of the translating guide). Make friends and love people.

Wonderful tour despite terrible weather conditions!. My tour with Urban Adventures was a great one! I signed up for the Istanbul Uncovered tour at the last minute (late the night before), which was really easy to do on their website. I enjoyed not having to organize everything well in advance if I didn't yet know my plans and being able to do everything seamlessly online. Unfortunately for me, there was a sudden snow storm overnight and the city was a nightmare to get around in its wake. My guide, Pinor, very kindly called me the morning of to ask if I wanted to reschedule my tour, but because I was already on my way to the meeting point and leaving Istanbul the next day, I requested we move forward with the tour. She could have just said no because the weather-affected traffic made it too difficult to reach me, but she didn't. Her kindness and determination to make it to the meeting point on time were incredibly admirable. She even called me a few times to give me updates on how soon she would arrive!Despite the snow bearing down on us, Pinor still gave a top-notch tour. She tried to take me down as many of the paths that are included in the tour when Istanbul ISN'T freezing over and did her best to deviate the tour when necessary while still showing me the highlights. Her knowledge of the sites was enviable. I wish I could know as much as she does! Given that the tour was one-on-one, I felt really comfortable asking her all sorts of questions, ranging from things we were looking at to aspects of Turkish daily life. With regard to the highlights of Istanbul Uncovered, I would highly recommend the tour. You don't go into the main sites (the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and the Blue Mosque), but if you go into the those on your own, as I did, the tour is a great supplement. I learned a great deal about the sites that may not have been included in a tour taken inside them because they were little facts that needed to be recounted from the outside. Other highlights included a back street (I think -- the snow made it difficult to tell what it was, really) that led to typical Ottoman houses, the Spice Bazaar, and the Grande Bazaar. My only suggestion would be that the walk through the Grande Bazaar was more than just that: a walk through. We went in one side and out the other in under five minutes. If we could have wondered the streets a bit more and heard about the culture of the Bazaar, or perhaps stopped to take a coffee/tea in one of the cafes inside the Bazaar, it would have made the site feel more authentic. Though I understand that once you've seen one rug shop, you've seen them all, so there might not be much to examine in-depth. Thank you Pinor for your amazing tour and your ability to put up with that horrible, rare weather! You made my otherwise iffy time in Istanbul (stupid snow!) an experience to remember.

Beyoglu as only a local would know!. Booked this tour through Viator - about $10 USD more than what you can arrange through the Urban Adventures Tours website under the tour "Istanbul Night Tasting Trail".Beyoglu and the labyrinth of cobblestoned pathways that weave their way too and from Istiklal street is an amazing place to discover food, drink and turkish hospitality all within such a friendly and genuine atmosphere. But its not something that can completed on short stays - the help of a local really helped us to find and sample the staples.Pinar Kilic was such a sweet and attentive host that asked us for our culinary aversions and preferences and planned a trip based on that. She knew just which roads to take to bring us to the tables that locals occupy for foods that locals love. We so appreciate your kindness and follow up to our questions during and after our visit. We were able to sample delicacies and after pub food from "known" street vendors that we otherwise would not have tried due to concerns over content and preparation. Touring with Pinar really allowed us to let our guard down and depend upon the experience of a generous local.We'd love to return because in sampling in one concentrated tour, some of the favourites in snack and late night food, we came to realize exactly how much there is really remaining to sample - we saw only the tip of the iceberg.Thanks again Pinar!

Home Cooked Istanbul - Great Activity in Istanbul. I was very excited to do this activity on my first night in Istanbul. Unfortunately, I didn't take into consideration a few things like travel time from airport to Sultanahmet, etc before booking this tour, and I missed my tour. Luckily, the guy from my hostel helped me call Urban Adventure. Jen from their office was nice enough to reschedule me on my next available night. I met with our guide, Mahsum, and another lady in the Pudding shop for my newly rescheduled tour. I was glad that I got rescheduled that night since it was nice and intimate with just me and another person. We started with a quick walk to the Hippodrome. Then, we went to our host family’s house for dinner. It was a simple but authentic dinner, but I really enjoyed talking with Mahsum and the host family. I learned a lot about their culture and their life in Istanbul. After dinner, Mahsum took us to a bar where we had Turkish tea and took turns with smoking shisha. He also taught us to play backgammon. Time went by fast as we were having a lot. The experience was been great since we had a superb guide with Mahsum. Overall, I would definitely recommend this tour for those who want to experience something unique and extraordinary. It’s not for people expecting to do touristy stuff, but if you want to really to experience something authentic, this is for you!

Weary traveller uplifted by warm Turkish hospitality. We experienced a simple and tasty home-cooked meal that filled my belly and nourished my mind. I was charmed by Sarai's warmth and curiosity. This was one of the highlights of my trip. It was a privilege to be invited in the home of a Turkish family, break bread, and chat about some of the realities of our opposite worlds. Despite the language barrier, our lovely host Pinar helped make everyone feel at ease. It was a rich and nuanced cultural experience. I'm glad I had this opportunity to widen my perspective. Thank you for accommodating my toddlers. It was a fun evening for my husband and me to relax on the trip while our kids played with Sarai's childen.

Food tour and walking tour of Istanbul. Where to start, I booked a food tour for the Saturday evening 28th November 2015 and we had such an amazing experience. Small group of us, we met the tour guide Tolga who is a cool honest chilled guy and we headed into Istanbul. Tolga took us to a local house in an area of Istanbul I wouldn't have thought to have gone. The group was welcomed into the locals house and we enjoyed some awesome food. Fresh, different, variety, home made and just so so different to all the restaurants on the main tourist areas. We then headed for coffee and shesha at a local cafe. The entire night was a great experience. You need to try it. The walking tour was on Sunday it is called conquer Istanbul in a day. We had Tolga again as the guide. Early start to the day and at the end I knew why. Sooo much to see and experience that's why. We saw everything, visited all the major sites on the Sunday and even went to some of Tolga's fav places. The views just blew my mind. The architecture of the place. The history and the stories that Tolga shared just added to the day. Massive thanks to him and for urban adventures for providing such an experience without any fuss. Amazing. Nice one!
Great experience. Our guide Tolga was so kind that he translate our english to Turkish host. We could enjoy local meal with local family. It was unforgettable memories forus. Thank you Tolga!

A DELICIOUS EXPERIENCE. Tolga Kinas was our guide for a wonderful evening food experience in Istanbul. (Lively Taksim Square area)He went to a lot of effort to show us a good variety of local foods. Some we ate from food stalls and some seated at hidden away eateries off the beaten track. My husband and I ended up being the only ones on the tour (out of season) so it felt more like an outing with a friend. Can highly recommend
Good experience. Our guide was friendly and knowledgeable. This experience was unique and one of a kind. Highly recommended if you're in the area.

It's a family thing!. Booked onto the tour which took us to a local family home, and we enjoyed dinner in a Turkish family home, prepared by our hostess. It was a unique opportunity to question or hostess (English speaking translator available) on her way of life, and to get an insight into Turkey off the beaten track. An enjoyable evening, if a little pricey even by Turkey's standards or comparable experiences in different countries, although I think that is the result of going through a 'middle man' and it was essential to get the most out of the experience. The local experience made it worthwhile and our translator/guide was excellent.

Tolga was AWESOME!. We had a tour with Tolga in Istanbul which ended up being private. It was incredible. We were only in town for four days and after the tour we really felt like we had an appreciation for this amazing city and its people. We saw things we never would have found on our own. Tolga was easy to talk to and felt like an old friend. I was sad to part with him at the end of the day. We also did another UA tour in Athens with Mavea and again, had a really awesome tour. Both guides where thorough with history but not so much that we were bored.We also did both tours with our 1 year old son and both guides were totally understanding about our specific needs (however, we have an extremely easy and accommodating child). I will absolutely use UA the next time we are traveling in a city that they have tours!

"Istanbul Uncovered" and "Picnic on 2 Continents". Did these 2 tours on my 1st day in Istanbul, both with guide Tolga, both were very interesting and informative. Help you feel much more at ease during the subsequent days as not only show the sights / food / transport etc but explain how/why it works like this. Recommended for 1st time visitors. Oh, and yes, and you get to watch a great sunset while enjoying your picnic on the Asian side! ;)

Istanbul Guide Services. We had two different guides on two difeerent days. Both were friendly, knowledgeable and spoke excellent English. They wanted us to appreciate their country, culture, and the sites we visited. We would definitely use this service again.

East/West food tour. Good eating! Our tour guide Guven was good value. It was interesting to see him interact with the locals and he was able to answer our many questions with patience and efficiency. There was a lot of walking with this tour so if you have any physical issues, may not be for you.

Istanbul Old City Tour. Great tour overall, good young guide, passionate about city and trying to answer all questions I had. Didn't mind that the tour took some extra time, we were tired in the end anyway. Good experience!

An Unforgettable Experience. Homecooked Istanbul was the perfect local experience we were looking for. Our guide Tolga, was personable, knowledgable and we never ran out of things to talk about. My husband and I chose this tour because we wanted to experience Istanbul in a more local way. We went to a locals home and she made probably the best home cooked meal I've ever had (sorry mom!). As we learned from Tolga, this experience was created not as a money making one, but to help local families earn extra income. Tolga translated our questions as well, so we were able to learn more about our host family. After the meal, we walked close by for some more conversation and tried the Turkish water pipe. What a fantastic end to an all around great experience! Thank you Tolga for everything you did to make this our best Istanbul experience yet!

We enjoyed the walk and mainly the food!. We really liked walking through the market (even though it was crowded) and stopping at multiple places to get different local foods. The guide was quite shy though and didn't talk a lot. He answered questions quite quickly too.
Istanbul Night Tasting Trail. Great way to experience some of the lesser known parts of the city as well as enjoy some tasty food!

No show, no refund. We were about 7 minutes late for our tour start and the tour went on without us. I have no issue with that, as it's not fair to make others wait, however, since we didn't go on the tour, we don't feel we should have to pay for the tour. Numerous requests for a refund have been ignored.

Friendly and knowledgeable guide. There were only 3 of us on this tour,and our guide took plenty of time with us. He was very knowledgeable, explaining not only the historical context of the sights, but current events. He also took us to a local establishment for an excellent lunch.

Spice Bazaar Tour. My wife and I were treated to an amazing adventure in the spice bazaar. Are amazing guide was Ekrem Seyhan. This was our first trip to Istanbul Turkey so Ekrem took ample time to explain the city and the country. It was a true once in a lifetime experience with a great host. We would recommend urban adventures Istanbul especially, Ekrem to all our friends.

Good introduction to Istanbul. If you've never been to Istanbul and have no idea where to start, I highly recommend this tour. It gives a good orientation as well as interesting information about the city. We covered a lot of ground so be sure to wear comfortable walking shoes.

Great custom experience!. I booked a home cooked meal tour on Viator and LOVED this tour. My tour guide, Burak, was fantastic. I asked all kinds of questions, including religion, politics and education information about Turkey. He was patient and a wonderful translator for my hostess. We then went to a hookah lounge, and it was just a good time. I highly recommend!!!

Night Time Bite Size. Unfortunately this adventure did not agree with me. The tour leader was very pleasant and enthusiastic. This review is in no way a reflection of his abilities. However I was very sick at the end of the tour and when I got home I vomited everything I ate. I got the chills and hoped that I would be fine after a night's sleep. Thankfully I was, but my stomach was out of sorts for 3 more days. I think that the variety and order in which I ate the food affected me, I don't usually eat this way. We stared with a wet burger and ayran, then chocolate, then mezes with raiki, then stuffed mussels and lambs intestine sandwiches, then 3 kinds of baklava with tea, and finally some kind of layered pasta (I barely ate baklava and did not touch the pasta because by this point I was not feeling well). If I had to do it again, I would opt for a sit down meal in a home or as close to home-cooking as possible, where the freshest ingredients are used.

How to make history come alive. The four hour plus trip of hidden Instanbul was very interesting and informative. Nice to see areas that one would have not normally walked through and see how the locals live and work.

Our Istambul tours. We had a great time with the two guides on both of our trips that we took they made it interesting and more enjoyable. Their local knowledge in command of English was great and the made the outings very enjoyable for my wife and I. We would recommend you to all our friends thank you again Doug and Linda Stuart

A wonderful international evening in Turkey. It couldn't have been more wonderful or more diverse. We had a fabulous time dining with a local family and our newest international friends. One of the reasons we love to travel is to meet and get to know internationals. We had 2 Aussies, one Moroccan, 2 Americans and 2 Turks dining with a winderful local family. The food was great, the conversation invigorating and by the end of the evening it was as if we'd been friends for years. How good can it get! I wholeheartedly recommend this tour. Should I return to Istanbul, I'll take it again. Our guide was Tolga Kinas and he is an incredible guide. It was definitely a perfect evening.

Eat Like a Local food tour: Entertaining and very informative. Our guide, Salih, was very sociable, knowledgeable and we enjoyed the spontaneity and the range of tastes. The walk in that part of Istanbul was also very interesting. Highly recommended.

A fantastic day tour - An even better guide. Istanbul conquered was a fantastic day tour. Our guide Apo was extremely knowledgeable regarding both history and politics. The local lunch was delicious. This is easily the best way to get to know the city.

Loved our tour guide!!!. Güven, our guide, was warm, funny, well informed & patient. He has a degree in hospitality management AND Turkish history!!! The foods he selected were some of the best foods I tasted in Istanbul. I'm coming back next year with friends and I'll be sure to request him!

Great tour shame about the food. I went on 2 of their eating tours - big mistake as my mom is vegan and I am vegetarian. Spent a lot of money, tour was lovely but we weren't able to eat 60% of the food. I would go on another tour but not if it has food.

Home cooked Istanbul. Well worth a look - dinner at the home of city centre locals, lovely food and conversation while the kids did their homework! Then on to a shisha bar, more chats with amiable and insightful tour guide. Great way to orient yourself to the city centre a bit too.

Great tour with Salih. Did a walking tour of Sultanahmet with Salih - hippodrome, Bazaar, Sulemaniye and Rustem Pasha. Salih was so knowledgeable and it was really interesting to talk to him about not just the history but also what life is like now in Istanbul and Turkey. Highly recommended.

Istanbul Night Tasting Trail. It was a perfect introduction to our Istanbul trip. Our guide Sanem is very well informed about the backstreets of Istanbul. We tried some local food along the way(borek made by Turks from Bosnia and Herzegovina, my favorite kokorec, lamb intestine sandwich that my husband is very fond of, different flavors of Turkish delight(pomegranate is the best) and were introduced with the tradition of meze(try the little white fish with nuts) and learned the right way to drink the raki. I will never forget the Kurdish coffee with milk and pistachios, it's milder and has better taste than Turkish coffee. I tried to order it in other restaurants in Istanbul but it was not available. Because of this guided tour, we were able to visit the less touristic area of Istanbul, walk along the vibrant Istiklal street, ride in the Funicular, meet local people and the artists of the Istanbul street art, tried the local food for the first time and discover Turkey and its people in a different perspective. I hope I can go back to Turkey, and if I do, I will definitely book a tour with Urban adventures again!

Eat like a local tour. What a great way to experience a traditional Turkish evening in a family home. My husband and I were the only guests on the tour for the evening so it was extra special to get one on one time with our guide Caner who was very knowledgeable and easy to talk with. The family home we visited (a family originally from the Kurdish area of Turkey) were very welcoming in their home and provided a simple but delicious meal. This tour is a great way for tourists to see behind the scenes of the Turkish lifestyle and to also support local families who host dinners. Following dinner we visit a popular local shisha cafe set in a former Islamic school (Medrese), this shisha cafe was full of locals and not fellow tourists which again made the experience all the more genuine. I would highly recommend this tour for a different, and possibly more fulfilling experience than a traditional food tour.

Authentic home cooked food tour. Our tour guide was wonderful and took us to a local families home where they cooked us a home cooked meal and our guide translated out questions. Then we went to a local cafe in a mosque. I would highly recommend it if you want to have an authentic experience

Walking tour of Istanbul. Our guide Sanem was very knowledgeable and knew the history of the area.She took us to so many places of interest and also a roof top restaurant for tea. I really enjoyed her explanations of the mosques and the proper way to enter and pay respect

A foodies delight. I took the Istanbul foodie tour early on in my holiday. The tour was packed with both day and evening activities. Particularly the evening tours were very unique, including a street food crawl through Beyoglu. The guide was lovely, spoke fantastic English, was happy to alter the tour as required (which was at times for me due to allergies). I would heartily recommend this tour to anyone who loves food, culture and tours with a unique flavor. If you go eat plenty of stuffed muscles for me!

Home Cooked Istanbul Tour. Better than expected! I am always skeptical of organized tours, but this one caught my eye. We were a group of 6 with our guide, Himet. She was very friendly, open to any questions, and offered us great conversation. We had dinner in the home of Sarai, with her 3 kids helping out with the serving. The food was excellent, and we really felt we were getting a glimpse of normal life, away from all the tourist show. The hosts were gracious and also happy to entertain our questions. After dinner, we walked to a nargile garden for another Turkish experience. Himet then walked us back to the meeting spot, and then ended up walking and talking me back to my hotel, which was close to her tram stop. I'm really glad I did this! We walked to and from the home - a short walk on hilly/cobbled streets, so you'll want appropriate shoes.

Tour guide was nice but this picnic was not what we expected. We enjoyed our tour guide taking us through the market to see things. We didn't learn too much there as we mostly followed him as he shopped for some foods. Then he took us on a boat to the Asia side of Istanbul. He picked up some sodas and we walked along the waterfront to a park. We sat in the grass and shared a picnic which was a bit awkward. Most of the items were bread and cheese. It started raining while we ate which made it even more awkward. On the way back to the train station we stopped for some apple tea. WARNING: The only restrooms on this side are "squatters!" Our guide was a nice guy. We would have enjoyed less carbs and a picnic table!

Home cooked and night tasting. The highlight of my trip to Istanbul given the short time I was there were the two evening tours I did of the city that included "Home cooked Istanbul" and "Istanbul Night Tasting Trail". I preferred the second one a bit more but both were an awesome way to see the inner city and experiencing local eating delights!
Walk to Suleymaniye. I thoroughly enjoyed my walking tour and especially having time to wander around Suleyman's Mosque with all the extra background detail supplied by our excellent guide.

Best tour ever! Well done!. Thank you Tolga for the 2 great walks. Uncovered and Picnic walks were really great. We love the tastings and all secret place we discover. Perfect if you do not have much time.
Intrepid Evening Tasting Tour of Istanbul. Great way to be introduced to Istanbul. Loved sampling all the different foods under Tolga's guidance. The raki sampling added an extra kick to the evening!

Amazing Food Tour. We were lucky enough to have Sanem as our guide on the Evening Food Walking Tour. It was Fabulous!! Sanem is a perfect guide - very smart and full of information not only about the food, but about the history, culture, habits, etc of the people. She also has a great sense of humour, speaks very good English and is very hospitable - many of the locals we encountered knew her, which was fun for us. Make sure you bring a good appetite, as the food is delicious and plentiful. We try to do a food tour wherever we travel to, and this was one of the best.

Superb !!!. We did two tours with Tolga, he was great guide, knows his city quite well and gave us some recommendations about places where we should go and food that we should try, We were really happy to did Urban Adventures in Istanbul and meet with lovely people in beautiful city Istanbul. We highly recommend Urban Adventures and Tolga as guide.
Great way to discover Istanbul. we loved this little tour. Very knowledgeable and open guide (we were able to talk politics in a very interesting way!) and nice company as well

Super tour. We loved it. It was very interesting culture wise. We learnt about the habits and customs of the traditional Turkish family, visited a shisha shop and found out other interesting things about Turkey and its culture and politics.
Wonderful tour!. This was a wonderful walking tour with a friendly and knowledgeable tour guide. We saw beautiful buildings and learnt a lot about the history of the city. Magical-highly recommended!

Istanbul Home Dinner. It was a great experience just as expected. Tolga, our guide was awesome, he integrated the family with the guests (us) like if we had known each other for a long time. Tolga's English is superb, we really enjoyed the time with everyone. Thank you for this unforgettable experience.
Food tour. Had an excellent time! Tolga was very knowledgable. Felt like we were traveling with a friend. Awesome

Small group night tasting trail tour by Urban Adventures. Wonderful evening out tasting and drinking the Turkish way. Guide Tolga showed us parts of Istanbul that we would never have found. Plenty of food eaten in at least 6 different establishments, some very traditional Turkish. Can recommend this to all foodies who would like a Turkish Experience.
excellent tour!!. i recommend Channer guide! he was so friendly and he took us to the best places!! you have to walk a lot so be prepare for it!

Poor Customer Service - Old & New Istanbul Tour. I decided to book the Old & New Istanbul tour for my last day in Istanbul. The tour was to highlight European side of Old and New Istanbul. We met at the the old side by the Spice Market and proceeded to Taskim which is in New Istanbul. As promised we tried an Istak burger and turkish coffee as well as tried so chocolate. However, that was all that we did when the tour promised more.The tour promised for us to take the "perfect shot of 19th century architecture", having our coffee read by a Turkish fortune teller, and then back to Old Istanbul to see the fish market. None of these things happened and the tour ended an hour early where we were left at the Galata Tower. I thought it was unusual, but being that I did not have access to review the itinerary, I thought best to go back to the hotel and check to see if we missed out on things set further in the itinerary (which I confirmed these items were promised on the itinerary and we didn't do it). I subsquently emailed the Company, on 8/20/2015, which I received a response from Jen apologizing and saying that they would investigate the matter with the tour guide the following Monday and then will follow up with a response which I never received. I then sent a follow up email on 8/26/2015 as I thought it was adequate time to receive a response back, but I still haven't received a response since.As a customer, I am really disappointed of the level of service provided by the Company since I paid for a service that I received only half of. Also, the fact that the Company promised that they will get back to me and then have not has prompted me to give such a low rating as it is rather disrespectful to say you would do something and then not follow through. I did a tour with them a couple of days before which I had a very positive experience and I do think the tour guide for this tour, Ashe, was knowledgeable and very friendly. However, the overall experience negates this as I would not be taking any tours with this Company do to the lack of communication received.

Experience the tastes of Turkey. Our guide, Burak, was excellent. He had great knowledge and a passion for food. We were introduced to many culinary delights, and even found some unique food that we had actually walked straight past the day earlier and not even known about. This was a great way to get a concise introduction to the tastes of Turkey.

Eat like a local tour: awesome! . This is the highlight of our istanbul trip. The experience of eating home cook dinner is better than expected. It's a full course from appetizers to dessert. We made a quick stop to shisha place to try out 2 shisha flavors. If you love food, try this one out!!

Worth doing. This tour was worth doing but could be shortened by one hour. The first half hour was spent by the guide, Tolga, standing in front of a map and giving us a history lesson on Turkey from day one. This was way too much information and could just as easily be told as we walked to our first destination. The tour included the usual tourist highlights which are, of course, magnificent. It would have been nice to have some anecdotal information for exams about the huge cat population in Istanbul or human interest. It would also have been nice to have been offered a water and toilet stop instead of having to ask for one.It was a good tour taking in all the high spots and well worth it for first time visitors to this wonderful city.

Two Tours, Two AWESOME Experiences. I was in Istanbul for 5 days. On one of those days, I took the "Istanbul Conquered" tour with Abdullah. This tour allows you between 8:30 AM and 5 PM to see significant and memorable architectural and cultural sites of Istanbul WITHOUT waiting on the lonnnng lines. What is additionally great about Urban Adventures is even if only ONE person is booked on the tour, the tour still runs. This was my lucky case. I was the only one on this tour which meant I was able to set the pace and glean so much interesting information from my guide. Abdullah was fantastic, super knowledgeable and just an all around gem of a guide. For part of the tour, we stopped and had lunch at a local eatery and this was included in the cost of the tour. I feel incredibly lucky to have been on this tour and with such a fantastic guide Abdullah. On a different day, I participated in the Urban Adventure tour titled, "Picnic On Two Continents". Love this tour as well! Tolga was our awesome guide. You meet at the Spice Bazaar and meander through, tasting delicious delights and flavors as you go. Our guide Tolga collected food from the different vendors and then we took the ferry over to the Asian side of Istanbul. After visiting a food market on the Asian side, we enjoyed a picnic at a beautiful spot next to the Bosphorus. This tour was fantastic! If you are visiting Istanbul for a few days, I highly suggest going on any of the tours sponsored by Urban Adventures. Staff are down to earth and kind as well as super knowledgeable and enthusiastic about Istanbul. Thank you Urban Adventures especially Abdullah and Tolga.

Ancient Sites wrought with history. An all day walking tour sounds exhausting, however, it was full of interest and beauty. The meeting place sounds obscure however if traveling from a hotel across the Golden Horn or even in the center of Sultanahmet, mention the Hippodrome or Sultan Ahmet Square and the taxi driver will be certain to know the location. Taking pictures is a must to relive the experience and then go back to look up many of the facts that will be part of the sites. Our guide, Osman, was great - informative and patient with our group. We had lunch in a local eatery, Can Restaurant. The food was tasty and filling. Finally, the Grand Bazaar is open all days except Sunday and is full of glitz and bling. Some good bargains are sure to be found.For your trip back to your hotel, be sure to get a taxi fare set in advance and drive a hard bargain. Be prepared for a wild ride!

Well worth the price. Our guide Aynur was very nice. She answered every question we had and she treated us to some turkish specialties. The tour is well organized and passes through many points of interest. We had a great time.

Great walking tour with Aynur. Walking the backstreets of Sultanahmet, listening to stories about the history of Turkey told by our guide Aynur Gok and sampling the historical sites. A fine introduction to the old city of Istanbul.

Fabuolus way to experience Istanbul. A great mix of activities, key sights such as Haggia Sophia and the grand bazaar, plus the markets and lots of wonderful food.Intrepid provide delightful guides , who are knowledgeable and have a network of contacts that really enhance the experience.Have dinner at a local home was a highlight.there is no way we could have done as much in 3 days, really good value.

Picnic on two continents. What a lovely way to spend an afternoon in a new city. I was the only person booked on the tour, but Caner was brilliant; he was really knowledgable and friendly. He answered all my questions and helped me select foods for our picnic. The food was great and we were full by the time we arrived at the Turkish Delight shop. That didn't stop me trying the sweets or the tea! So nice not to feel that you have to buy something. Thank you for a great afternoon. So good I've booked onto the night tasting tour on Friday!

A great introduction to the city!. I did a half day (morning) walking tour with Osman - what a great introduction to Istanbul! Turned out I was the only person booked on the tour, so it became a private experience which was very nice. In addition to having good English and being very knowledgeable about all the sites etc, Os was of great assistance in helping me buy clothes as my suitcase hadn't arrived from Dubai.Overall a great tour and highly recommended - particularly since he also gave me lots of helpful tips for what else to see which wasn't covered on the tour, and helped me buy the 3 day Museum Pass so I didn't have to queue anywhere.Thanks Os!

Fabulous walking tour of old Istanbul with Tolga. Took a four-hour walking tour of Istanbul with Tolga, who was a lovely guide with a very good level of English and who demonstrates a clear love for his country and city. Got to see a lot of things I otherwise would not have and, just before the spice market, took us to a rooftop café with an amazing view of Istanbul and the Bosphorus. Just note that although the tour says "Blue Mosque," you don't actually go inside -- so if you want to see the inside just be sure to go back. ;) Great tour -- thanks Tolga!!

Istanbul picnic. Our guide Tolga was fantastic! He was so calm and informative walking through the craziness of The Spice Bazaar. He gave us information not only about Istanbul but after hearing of where we were travelling in Turkey gave us heaps of information about our other destinations and great suggestions on how to get there and what to do. Would highly recommend it to anyone travelling in a group or on their own, it was a wonderful way to spend the day and had we not done the tour I doubt we would have ventured to the Asian side of Istanbul.

Istanbul Uncovered Delivered On Its Promise. Our guide( young woman) led an efficient though unhurried pace. We hit several cultural high points that would have been difficult FYI find. We avoided the ones that were pre-hyped. Great stuff.

A fabulous introduction to Istanbul. We spent a morning recently on the "Hidden Istanbul Walking Tour" and what a great morning it was. Our guide Tolga was very interesting, had excellent English and introduced us to some wonderful sights in Istanbul. Unfortunately we only had a very short stay in Istanbul and this was an excellent way to get a taste of this amazing city.

"Istanbul Uncovered"- an amazing experience! Thanks to our guide -Suleyman. We booked this tour after reading amazing reviews on Trip advisor and thankfully it turned out to be an amazing experience. The tour guide Suleyman was really nice and informative. He spoke fluent english and was easy to understand. He turned up on time (0830 at the German Fountain) and briefed us (we were a group of 10) about what he was going to show us. Note to readers: As there are a few mosques covered in this tour and respecting their culture, please wear appropriate clothing covering head to toe. They do however provide clothing at the entrance of every mosque but its best not to draw too much attention by wearing revealing clothing).The tour guide took us to to the blue mosque, hippodrome in Sultanahmet before taking us to the other mosques via visiting the Grand bazaar and in the end the spice bazaar. He had interesting stories about each place and made it very entertaining. He also took us to his favourite local eatery shop and we tasted the most amazing Pide (a kind of pizza). He also stopped us after 2 hrs and took us to a rooftop cafe where you could look at the amazing view of the european side and the asian side of istanbul while sipping on lovely Apple Tea! The experience was complete when Suleyman had a souvenir for all of us at the end of the tour. All in all - a complete experience and it felt as though Suleyman was more of a friend than a tour guide! Kudos to Suleyman and Urban adventure for this tour!

Be a local!. We did the Night Tasting and Ramadan in the Park. Both guides were amazing! We were treated like and felt like locals. It was so nice to experience things in the same way these two lovely boys do every day! The people of Istanbul are so welcoming and open and it was nice to join them!

Istanbul night tasting trail. This is a great way to have the real Turkish food experience. Our guide abdullah was excellent and ensured we had great fun along the way. There is no way we would have discovered half of the restaurants or cafes tucked away down the little alleys and lanes. A great way to experience Istanbul. I could not recommend this tour enough. Money well spent.

Best foodie tour. I did the afternoon food tour. Was great. Had a great guide who was very knowledgeable and very friendly. We had so much to eat i did not need dinner and tried things i probably wouldn't have. Best way to see the old city and try great food.

Eat Like a Local. Dinner was delicious, and the whole outing was very educational. We were surprised, however, at the condition of the apartment where we ate. I know of others who have done similar dinners at locals' homes, so we didn't expect to go to a falling down place with no furniture. Two of our party had a difficult time sitting on the floor and getting up again, and one of them couldn't eat because it was too uncomfortable to bend over as he sat. If we'd known the situation beforehand, it would've been helpful, and we would've been prepared. Our guide was wonderful, very informative and helpful.

Night Time Food Tasting Trail. A must do in Istanbul great way to spend a night. Food was delicious and our Tour guide Tolga was friendly knowledgable and a genuinely nice guy. We walked through streets we hadn't explored yet and tried a mix of street and restaurant food. Tolga was passionate about his city and we enjoyed learning about it through the food and culture. Thanks for a great night.

Istanbul night tasting trail. What an amazing tour! Our guide was fantastic - extremely knowledgeable and a really genuine and down to earth guy - He created a relaxed and casual atmosphere right from the start. We tasted some yummy authentic Turkish food and saw some vibrant parts of the city that were completely free of tourists - I really felt like I was just one of the locals. Strongly recommend this tour to anyone going to Istanbul

Picnic on Two Continents and Istanbul Night Tasting Trail. I did the Picnic on Two Continents on my first day in Istanbul. It was very easy to find the meeting location outside the Spice Market and our host Tolga was very welcoming. Going in to the Spice Market with the guide was such a great experience as he had all the tips on where to shop and explained any food we were not familiar with. Having bought lots of goodies we made our way by ferry to the Asian side where we found a nice park to sit and eat our picnic. It was a great way to sample the flavour of a new city. The following night my husband also joined the Night tasting trail. Once again we had Tolga showing us the 'new' area of Istanbul. It was a delightful four hours+ of food adventures and exploration. He took us to places we would never have found or known about unless a local had shown us! For both these trips you definitely need your camera and some comfy shoes.

Hidden Istanbul. Great walking tour with the nice, young Guid Ekrem Seyhan. Kind and open-minded! Many informations about culture, history and the buildings as well as personal recommondations. Greetings from Switzerland, Michèle & Andrea.

A wonderful afternoon of food and culture!. I did the Picnic on Two Continents tour my first afteroon in Istanbul and it was a wonderful introduction to the city. Our guide, Iskender, was very informative- not just about our stops on the tour but about the city's culture and history in general. The Spice Market felt a little overwhelming, so I was appreciative to have a guide showing us the best things to try and the best places to get them- I went back to several of our stops later to buy gifts and souveneirs confident that I was bringing home something of quality! Taking to ferry across to the Asian side of Istanbul for our picnic was a nice way to end the tour and a great experience I otherwise never would have had!

You Don't Want to Miss this Tour! (Ramadan Feast in the Park). First let me tell you, I hate tour groups. But I did this one on a whim. I did the Ramadan Feast in the Park tour, and it was AMAZING. I don't think I can adequately sum up my night in a written review. My tour guide, Sanem Yücesoy, was perfect. Not only knowledgeable, but she knew the local craftsman. We saw one of the glass artisans at work, the people at food/thing stalls we went to paid special attention to us. The food was delicious. As a non-muslim Westerner you just don't know the type of festivities that happen! Thousands of people basically having epic picnic dinners, enjoying their evening, and spending time with family. This tour was something special and unique, that you should definitely do!

Picnic across two continents. Our guide was great, informative, spoke excellent English. We got to try a variety of food and had good company with the other people on the tour. It was a lovely way to see the city but also felt relaxed and away from the tourists.

Evening Food Walking Tour. I thoroughly enjoyed this tour for my first night in Istanbul. It was a perfect group size of @ 10 people. We got to sample many different items and our guide "Tolga" was very engaged. The tour was longer than expected and we were never rushed. Good introduction to Turkish cuisine and the area. The guide was also helpful in providing directions/getting taxis to take us back to our hotels. The only negative which has nothing to do with the guide is the meeting location. The meeting point should be changed to a more concrete location that is easier to find. In the confirmation it stated there was a bank beside it which caused confusion as it is no longer there. I was 15 minutes late for the tour because of this and hated that I kept everyone waiting. Otherwise, very good.
Great tour.. Great tour, really informative and took us to all the major tourist attractions of Istanbul. Great day for everyone

Inclusive Tour, Guide Could be Better. As a solo female travel visiting Istanbul for the first time I wanted a guide to help me find the sites and also give me a background to Istanbul's complex history, so I booked the Istanbul Conquered tour. Our guide was good and answered many questions but towards the end she was complaining how tired she was and that seemed very unprofessional to me. Although I loved the places the tour visited, I'd rate this tour much higher if our guide was more charismatic and passionate about her job. Thank goodness the other people on the walking tour where entertaining.

Two great tours to see the highlights of old Istanbul. We met our great guide Emre Aldeniz at the German fountain for our 4 hour walking tour of Istanbul. We were the only people on the tour that day, so we were able to see more than usual. We started with the Blue Mosque before the crowds arrived and then proceeded on our tour at a comfortable pace. Emre treated us to Turkish tea at a restaurant, and a baked pretzel from a street vendor he knew. Both were great. Emre spoke clearly and we were told numerous stories and listened to the history of Istanbul while we walked. When we ended the tour after extra time, we were given clear directions back to our starting point. Our second tour was the Hagia Sophia Museum with Aziz. We were met outside the museum by another couple from Austria. Because we had booked this tour, we did not have to wait in line for tickets as Aziz had them already, so we walked right to the security area and then inside we went. Our tour lasted a little longer than an hour, and we explored the entire building. Having a guide like Aziz made the experience so much more interesting and meaningful.

great day, great guide!. Our guide Tolga was fantastic! We had a great day wondering around the market and were pleasantly suprised to know that the food and drinks were all included included in the price. As 3 girls we felt really relaxed for the first in Istanbul! AND Tolga even emailed us afterwards withadvice on where to stay and what to do elsewhere in Turkey. Thanks for a great day Tolga!

Istanbul Night Tasting Trail. Wonderful night with Tolga from Urban Adventures exploring the night life and food tasting. Visited places we wouldn't have found on our own . Make sure you are hungry! Enjoyed the small group.

Picnic on 2 continents. Absolutely brilliant afternoon out - our guide was fantastic and we got to see loads of things we wouldn't have seen on our own. A great trip through the spice bazaar and a brilliant picnic on the Asian side. Thank you!

Amazing guide (Emre Aldeniz). Emre was fantastic! He took us a great tour of Istanbul's historic sites and was incredibly knowledgeable about Turkish history as well as current politics. We had an amazing day with him and couldn't recommend him more!

A delicate and surprising visit!. A nice walk around history , flavours , views and unknown corners....with great explanations!The city is full of beautirful mosques and ruines from all ages , museums , palaces coffees everything is fun to dicover and June is a great time for visiting Istanbul.Our guide TOLGA was great

Best tour my whole trip. Our tour of Istanbul was an eye opener to say the least, our guide was very informative at all the locations and never hesitated to answer any of our questions. He took us to some amazing places where we got to try the local produce and learn about the religion, as well as some historic artefacts. Can not wait to return to Istanbul! Defiantly my favourite place in Europe! Thanks urban adventures! BEST.DAY.EVER

Trip should have come with a warning for people with mobility issues!. On the plus side: Tolga was very personable and broadly knowledgeable about history and current events; the walk to and from dinner was through an interesting neighborhood and into a modest home off the tourist path; our radiant local hostess provided a good, ample dinner. On the negative: several people (including one who used a rolling walker) were surprised by the need to navigate fairly steep, narrow, cobbled streets, and others by having to get up and down from the floor to eat dinner. Although it wasn't a highly-informative "food tour" I was happy to see how a struggling, hard-working family lived in Istanbul, and to help them earn some extra income.

Thank you Tolga!. It was fun and informative to walk through the Spice Market, buying food for our picnic. Then we went on a ferry to the Asian Side, and sat with the locals to enjoy the food. This was a very relaxed tour, with an excellent guide. Tolga was so pleasant, with lots of information about Istanbul, and we had plenty of time to ask questions and learn about the local way of life. A very enjoyable afternoon!

Excellent tour guide on a tour of the Spice Bazaar followed by a picnic. My best friend and I did the Istanbul Street Food Tour and Picnic with Ekrem, an excellent tour guide from Urban Adventures. Ekrem is a young, friendly Turkish guy who lives in Istanbul and is very knowledgeable and open to answering any questions.We were pleasantly surprised to find that my friend and I were the only tourists for the tour on that day – which to their credit, they kept rather than cancelled the tour.Here’s what we did during the tour and picnic:■ First off, we had the introductions and a summary of what to expect.■ During the start of our walk, I was intrigued by a mosque near the Spice Bazaar – and no, it wasn’t the Yeni Cami (the New Mosque) but the Rüstem Pasha Mosque which is smaller and is famous for their beautiful blue Iznik tiles. So, Ekrem took us there for a brief visit – which felt special as it’s not a mosque that most tourists would know to visit.■ Next, we went to a few stalls (on the outside of the Spice Bazaar) to sample some food (string cheese, Turkish delights, candy, etc) including a sesame seed covered pretzel-like bagel called simit. I had been curious about that and it was OK – a little plain and dry.■ After the food samples and Ekrem had bought all the food (baklava, deep fried anchovies with some bread, Turkish pizza) for our picnic, we headed to the nearby ferry terminal where Ekrem bought and paid for the 1-way ferry ride to Üsküdar which was on the Asian side of Istanbul.■ The ferry ride took about 20 minutes to reach Üsküdar and we then walked another 20 minutes along the waterfront – all the while, looking for an open spot to sit and have our picnic.■ Unfortunately, that day was a holiday weekend and it was particularly busier than normal along the waterfront. Hence, it took a while to find some unoccupied cushions to sit on. We eventually found some cushions in an area facing the Maiden’s Tower island directly. (Check out the photos below) Beyond that in the distant was the European side of Istanbul. On a clear, beautiful day, I am sure it would be a sight to behold but with the cloudy, muggy weather that day – it was less impressive.■ Once we were seated, Ekrem flagged down some waiters. We paid for some cold soda (as it was a warm day) while Ekrem paid for some Turkish tea. Ekrem then took the picnic food out and we had our little picnic while admiring the views of European Istanbul in front of us.■ After 45 minutes of picnic and good conversation, we headed back towards Üsküdar to take the Marmaray train (instead of the ferry) back to the European side of Istanbul. Ekrem paid for these tickets and accompanied us to the Yenikapi station where we got off (as this was closest to our hotel) and said our goodbyes.Pros:■ It was our good luck to have a very personalized tour for 2 and to have Ekrem as our guide.■ Even though the Rustem Pasha Mosque wasn’t on the itinerary, Ekrem took us there for a short visit when he sensed my interest in seeing it.■ The tour was a very good value as it lasted over 4 hours and we got so much useful information and had all our questions answered. Even after I ran out of questions to ask, Ekrem continued to offer more historical, political and cultural insights into Turkey. At times, the insights turned personal which was great to hear especially since it provided us with insights not found in guide books.■ Having a guide with you to sample the various foods is a must because of the language barrier. Ekrem was also helpful when it came to helping us buy the best dried dates to take home.Cons:■ It took a little effort to find out Ekrem as the directions were a little vague. I had to ask around until I found Ekrem. A better way to identify a tour guide is if a sign or umbrella or some distinguishing item (a red balloon) was held up to make it easier to find the tour guide amongst so many people.In summary, we had a great time hanging out with Ekrem who treated us like friends rather than tourists. I highly recommend this tour – especially if you can get Ekrem to show you around.

Great walking tour of major sights. Abdullah was a fantastic guide- knowledgeable, well-spoken, and organized. We learned the history of the sights as well as local cultures and politics. Highly recommended to see the big sights of Istanbul.

Istanbul Uncovered - Top Value In Istanbul. This is the second Urban adventures Tour we have taken in Istanbul. Tolga's ' Istanbul Uncovered ' tour was well paced & informative. We did indeed discover hidden parts of Istanbul that the independent traveller would not normally find. Highlight was a drink stop at a local rooftop café with a panoramic view of the city.Well recommended & excellent value for money.

Great value. This walking tour was great to start our stay in Istanbull. Our guide, Tolga ,spoke good inglish, was very informative in the history of the area we walked and pointed places and explained traditions of historical interest..The tour is well structured, you ride tram & cable car to highest point,then walk down the hills. During the tour we had coffe sweets, and even a Turkish burger which was very nice. I strongly recommend

Unforgettable Evening. I was travelling on my own and the Urban Adventures "Eat Like a Local" (also called "Home Cooked Istanbul") evening walking tour appealed as a sensible alternative to eating by myself. It turned out to be one of my best evenings out ever. We met Tolga, our guide, as arranged and he led us through the back streets of the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul, to the home of a local family where we ate a superb meal. I was sceptical that this tour would really give us a taste of local life but it did just that and provided real insight into a different standard of living. We ended the evening drinking tea a trying a waterpipe (I declined this experience, but others enjoyed it, the waterpipes were tobacco-free by the way) Our host family and my fellow travellers were delightful company and I would recommend this to anyone who like to walk around cities, who can cope with short but very steep hills and is happy to eat sitting on the floor

Tolga was great!. Our group (10) had a very nice dinner with two Istanbul families sharing a small apartment: several courses, very tasty. We all sat on the floor with the meal spread before us. This was somewhat difficult for a few in our group who had various physical ailments making it difficult for them to get up and down. This was the only down-side of the excursion.Our guide, Tolga, was very friendly, funny, informative, willing to share opinions, descriptions of daily life, and serve as translator with the family. It gave us a window on actual daily lives in Istanbul. I came away feeling as if I'd made many new friends. All in all, I'd highly recommend it.

Night Tasting Trail. Before we head off to Cappadocia,booked Night tasting trail by Urban Adventures Istanbul. Definitely it was worth to do it. You should not eat too much before you start to tour. Guide took us around 8 or 9 different places included hidden local cafe to try variety of Turkish food. Meze restaurant and Turkish ouzo(aka raki) was amazing. Around 4 hours our guide Tolga explained food and life style in Istanbul. One of the best way to know real Istanbul, to book this tour and learn all from local guide lives in city. End of the tour promo code which we can book another adventure on another city in the world was given by him. We recommend this company to everyone.Thank you Urban Adventures

Better book with Culinary Backstreets instead!. Although this evening food tour was ok, it did have a number of points where it could have been significantly improved:- the meeting point was poorly described (including directions to a non-existent building)- the guide whilst good company, didn't go into much detail about the origin of different foods, ingredients, place in culture etc- rather than an "off the beaten track" experience, the venues were well trodden tourist venues- best not to go on a night when Fenerbace are playing....the guide was a bit distracted!This wasn't a bad night out. The two Americans I met on the tour made it a great evening. However, if you want a real Istanbul food experience, I suggest that you book with Culinary Backstreets in Istanbul who know their food with real passion.

An amazing way to spend a day in Istanbul. My boyfriend and I booked the Istanbul Conquered urban adventure in may and we absolutely loved it. We were in the city when a massive cruise ship was there, so we hit a few lines along the way. Our guide, Volka, was excellent and quick thinking: in minutes he'd rearranged the tour so that we dodged the crowds all day. We saw the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Topkapi Palace and more, and he was incredibly knowledgeable about the area and its history. I'd recommend this tour to anyone with limited time in Istanbul.

Street Food with picnic. This was a fabulous way of seeing something other than the tourist sites. Ekhram was both charming and informative and his English was very good too - much better than we encountered on another tour. As there were only 3 of us it was up close and personal. We thought it would only be for c 2 hours but it lasted nearly 4 hours. The highlight was definitely having a picnic with all of the locals on the Asian side overlooking the river. We found out so much from Ekhram about Turkey and the way of life that it was worth every penny.

Best Tour Yet. My friends and I went on the Home Cooked Istanbul tour last night. Ekram was an amazing guide - he was friendly, honest, and knowledgable. We discussed everything from the history of the Ottoman Empire to international politics to modern day life in Istanbul. Our Turkish house host, Bedia, was wonderful as well. She cooked us a delicious dinner of soup, salad, chicken, stuffed peppers, and a traditional Turkish dessert. It was an amazing night!

Food tour with picnic. The guide - Tolga - was friendly, spoke very good English and explained the different foods well which we bought together in the local market. The ferry trip to the Asian side and the picnic were fine. However, I found the price of 35 Euro high compared to other tours we had.

Dinner with a Turkish family. Our guide was excellent and we had an interesting an fun evening! After a walk through Sultanahmed we had a delicious traditional turkish dinner and went for shisha and tea with locals afterwards. I can definitely recommend it

A Well Informed Tour Guide. My wife and I had 3 very enjoyable days in Istanbul during which we went on 2 Urban Adventures tours. We found them both very informative and a great way to know more about the City and its history.

"home cooked Istanbul" simple meal was interesting but.... Our guide was disappointing. We had a small group of 4 one of whom had a mobility problem; the guide's response was to walk 20m ahead and urge on the speed.
