It was also clear the group was much more interested in the culture of the home cooked meal visit than the visit to the water pipe smoking den; 3/4 we ex smokers with no desire to restart the habit. The guide went on regardless when it would have been better to be flexible and do something else. In the home little effort was made on the guide's part to include the non English speaking hose in our conversation or us in their turkish one. We were hardly included in a family situation; it was just the wife of the family alone feeding a buntch of strangers. It was supposed to be 4 hours but we were dismissed after 3.

Night tasting trail. I had the pleasure of having Tolga as our guide - he was very knowledgeable and had an amazing appetite! I had been in Turkey for two weeks before doing this tour and ate food I had never heard of or even seen during my other travels. In between tastings we walked through beautiful streets and Tolga told us interesting stories along the way and was able to answer all the questions we had. We sat were the locals hangout and got treated like old friends wherever we went. I highly recommend this tour and if you are lucky you will get Tolga as your guide.
Very informative. The tour guide was not only very friendly but appeared to be also perfectly informed about the city and its history. We are very happy that we did this booking. Thank you.

Loads of info!. Spent a lot of time learning about Istanbul's history, mosques, education system, politics, etc. Because there were only 3 of us with our guide, we were able to ask a lot of questions. Great personalization of the tour! His knowledge and English were great! Wished we had more time in the spice and Grand Bazaar market to ask even more questions of things we saw along the way (eg. I didn't know gold bracelets are purchased for brides as their own financial security in a marriage. The husbands have no claim to it even if they divorce.) We even popped into a local store to look at traditional stacked teapots I could buy and not the tourist junk. Short tea break on a rooftop Cafe overlooking Istanbul was amazing. Highly recommended tour.

Old&New Istanbul. It´s a very good, valuable tour if you want a first impression of this huge, bustling city or if you only have a few hours time.We spent an afternoon with our well informed guide Osman and he gave us a good insight to the turkish culture and also told us what we could vistit afterwards.

Istanbul Undiscovered. Osman was our great guide! He took us trough hidden streets and wonderful Mosques. We saw the city from another point of view, less turistic and more turquish.....wonderful experience that we suggest to try as soon as you land in Istanbul!!!

Authentic evening of food, history, and hookah in Istanbul. My friends and I had an authentic and informative evening out in Istanbul with Istanbul Urban Adventures! Our guide Mustafa had lots of great information to share about our host dinner family, Istanbul's history, current politics and practices, the country of Turkey, and more. Our host cook was lovely, and the meal was simple, but tasty. My favorite part of the evening, however, was our time spent at the Corlulu Ali Pasa, the shisha house. Listening to the call to prayer while smoking shisha and drinking tea with other locals in a 300 year old location was truly amazing. Great experience overall!

Loved it, sheep intestines and all. A wonderful evening, experiencing places I never would have known to go without my fabulous guide, Alyshe (I believe...spelling?) We experienced half a dozen different Istanbul culinary experiences, from street food, to elegant sidewalk apertifs, to classical youth filled coffee culture (be aware Turkish youth are big smokers!) Lots of walking which I enjoyed, and a really good overview of Turkish treats.

Incredible Experiences and Highlight of Istanbul Visit. I did the Old & New and the Picinic on Two Continents tour on different days. Both were absolutely 10/10. Both guides, especially Ekrem, were so passionate, friendly and welcoming. The old and new tour was great - visited some really interesting places, ate wonderful Turkish delight with Turkish coffee and had our coffee sludge read by a fortune teller. As well as a great walk along Istanbuls amazing main street. The picnic tour was much better than expected. We got some amazing cheeses, olives, snacks and sweets from a market and then caught the ferry over to the Asian side, where we watched the world go by with our food and Turkish tea. Ekrem was an outstanding host, telling so much about Turkey and always more than happy to take photos. These tours were the highlight of my trip to Istanbul, enabling me to have authentic experiences that I could not have experienced by walking around myself or getting on some awful coach.

Istanbul Night Tasting Trail - great experience. We did the Night Tasting Trail tour on 27 April with a lovely tour leader, whose name we can't remember sorry. We were the only two people on the tour, and she catered to our very annoying food requirements (vegetarian and coeliac) with good humour and grace. We loved seeing the new part of Istanbul, and hearing about our tour leader's life in Turkey. Highly recommend this tour.

Istanbul night food walk. We did our walking tour on a gorgeous evening in Istanbul. Our guide Aynur was very knowledgeable not just about the food but about the history of the neighborhood we were walking through. I definitely tried street food that I would not have been brave enough to try on my own. I did feel the tour was a little expensive given the fact that we ate mainly street food and desserts.This is the 3rd tour I've taken through Intrepid and I continue to highly recommend them as an organization.

Exciting and VERY different - a home cooked meal. We visited a local home for dinner.............a wonderful experience.Our guide was Sanem and she was very helpful and very client focussed.We then visited a very popular local water smokiing coffee place which was an unbelievable experience and one that was completly new for us.We had a very exciting night and it further emphasizes for us the richness of culture, history and beauty that Istanbul is.

Awesome day out on Istanbul. Walking Tour & Picnic on 2 continents.. We did the walking tour on cold and wet day but İskender made it a fantastic day. We also did the Buy in Europe and Eat in Asia tour in the afternoon with him, we enjoyed it a lot and would highly recommend.

The walking tour. And great walking tour on cold and wet day but our tour guide Ali made it very interesting walk through the mosques hippodrome, the spice market to grand bizzar we even went to a local coffee shop that was selling everything you could want tea, coffee even rent a Hooka By the hour - well done Ali can highly recommend doing this tour

A great evening!. Did the home cooked meal tour in April. It was great to get into a local house and see how a real family live and talk about life for the average person in Istanbul. The philosophy of the tour was great - all the profit goes to the family, so its sustainable tourism. The meal was nice, not gourmet, but we weren't expecting that anyway. The host didn't really speak any English, so it was useful that the guide translated. The guide was excellent, knowledgable and able to talk about all aspects of life in Turkey as well as its history, archaeology, politics etc... This made the evening more interesting. After the meal we went to a traditional nargile bar to try a nargile pipe. It was a great experience and something we probably wouldn't have done without the tour. All in all, great value for money, and a real taste of life beyond the tourist traps. Would recommend.

Dinner with the locals.. I really enjoyed this tour. There were 5 of us for this tour and our guide was Suleimaan, who was very well knowledgeable, pleasant and professional. We started with a tour of the city with our guide explaining the historical significance of certain monuments in the city. We then went into the home of a family in Istanbul and was served traditional Turkish meals. Although the meals were modest, they were delicious. It was great interaction and a great way to understand the Istanbul way of life. We then finished off at a local place that had water pipes. I really enjoyed it and would highly recommend it.

Home Cooked Meal, Hookah and Experience. Tolga took the group to a local Istanbul family where we were treated to a home cooked Turkish meal in a real family environment. Great Food and Great company. We then went to a Hookah bar where we tried the waterpipe (Apple and mint) and discovered more about Istanbul and Turkey. This was an excellent way to learn about Turkey, it's customs and general way of living. Tolga was excellent in every way and it was a pleasure to spend the evening with him.

Tolga the tremendous tour guide. Tolga was fantastic. He took us on through a very interesting alley way where we went shopping for our picnic. We got to try all sorts of yummy food that we wouldn't have tried if we hadn't done the tour.Tolga was very friendly , knowledgable and had a great smile.He took us to the Asian side of the Bosphorous for our picnics. We sat down at a table on the waters edge in amongst the local culture. I thoroughly would recommend it. It will be a beautiful memory embedded in my mind for ever . My husband and two daughters both had a great time. Thanks Tolga for being an awesome tour guide.
Walking tour old and new Istanbul. Great walking tour - good to go further afield and Away from the tourist traps and have the benefit of great local knowledge!

Great walking tour!!. Iskender was a great tour guide and was able to offer a lot of knowledge about the sites and the history. We saw a lot of the "key" attractions and a lot of laughs along the way. We were tight on time so this 4 hour walking tour was a brilliant, fun way to see a lot in not a lot of time. Highly recommend!

excellent tour guide. I s k n de r i s very good tour guide to give us an general introduction of Istanbul on my second day here. This tour could be a startup point to your Istanbul journey.He took us around the city for 4hours and gave us insightful views of Islam religion. So I booked another tour of old and new city.

Istanbul Urban Adventures are fantastic!!. We enjoyed 3 Urban Adventure tours in Istanbul with Iskender as our guide - full day walking tour, night tasting tour and half day old and new tour. Iskender is an amazing guide and really helped us understand the history, religion and culture of Turkey and Istanbul. Perfect introduction to Istanbul for first time visitors, like us. Highly recommend day walking tour (lots of walking and steps) night tasting tour (tried raki and sheep intestines - it was surprisingly v good!) Iskender our guide was the best!!

The best way to see Istanbul without a doubt. This trip was the highlight of our holiday, without a doubt it made our trip more memorable and special. Our guide Iskender was fantastic, very knowledgeable & knew he stuff, he was always happy to answer any questions and made us feel comfortable, he clearly loves his job which makes it a nice experience as you felt like he was also enjoying the tour. As there was just two of us we were able to do things that maybe weren't on the tour, like sample some turkish ice cream, so he allowed us to customise it a little. He showed us places that we would never have found on our own & showed us the real istanbul. I can't reccomend the walking tours enough. He goes at a pace which is comfortable for you and you really don't feel like your doing much walking at all. We loved the wet burgers you get on this tour and my first game of back gammon & first taste of turkish coffee with the locals was a brilliant touch in the middle of the tour, a good way to rest. Our trip wouldn't be the same without this tour and as a travel agent I will recommend it to everyone.

Fantastic food on 2 continents. The 4 hour food tour of Istanbul is fantastic. My guide, Emir, was relaxed and made sure we bought plenty of excellent food. The view for our picnic was to die for, sitting by the Bosphorus on a gorgeous sunny day. I can't recommend this highly enough.

Istanbul Urban Adventures. This was a wonderful way to see Istanbul our guide Isknder was very knowledgable...and helped us understand the culture as well as seeing the sites...which is what we had hoped for!!! Highly recommend this tour.

4 hour Istanbul walking tour. We had the opportunity to experience a thoroughly enjoyable walking tour led by Iskender who shared his knowledge of the amazing city with ease and in a great amount of detail. I highly recommend this walking tour for any first-time visitors to Istanbul who would like to learn about its history and culture.

Home Cooked Istanbul. Lovely dinner with our guide Tolga and our host family in Istanbul. He did a great job entertaining our questions about life in Turkey and translating our questions to our host. The night ended with a visit to a hookah bar popular with locals which further added to our immersion in the culture.

Istanbul for beginners. For the English speaker, maybe they do other languages, this is a must if you only in town for a few days.
Iskander, the guide, gave a great tour full of bits and pieces if knowledge that only a local would know
It certainly beats struggling with your Marco Polo guide book all day long
A sensational day

Istanbul Night Tasting Trail. We had just finished a 15-day Turkey Encompassed Tour with Intrepid and had a Fantastic time. Our guide Iskender Us suggested we try the Night Tasting Trail tour since we still had some time in Istanbul. We were NOT disappointed. It was a wonderful evening experience that we will never forget! Iskender led us to a wide array of interesting and tasty Turkish food and drink including mezes & raki, stuffed mussels, baklava & Turkish coffee, and chocolate & tea just to list a few. Iskender is extremely knowledgeable of the history and culture of his country and is proud to share. Probably the best local tour we have ever done!!

Home Cooked Istanbul: different and enjoyable. We took the Home Cooked Istanbul tour with guide Süleyman Erköse our second night in the city. There was only one other couple taking the tour, so it felt private and exclusive. Süleyman took us on a brief 10-minute walk through the Hppodrome and past the Blue Mosque, through the residential part of the Sultanahmet district and into a private apartment (all the way at the top of some rickety stairs), where he introduced the lady of the house, Katriya, and her two boys, aged 7 and 9. We were ushered into a small living room and invited to sit on a couple of sofas. It was predictably a little awkward at first, but soon the conversation was flowing, aided by Süleyman's expert translation (the hosts spoke no English). We asked and answered questions about work and school, and shared pictures of children and pets. Food was served on a tablecloth traditionally spread on the floor; there was a salad, lentil soup, beans and rice, and pudding for dessert: a simple but delicious meal. After a couple of hours, we said our thanks and goodbyes (in retrospect, wishing we had brought something small for the kids - you should do that if you take this tour) and were taken by Süleyman out to a shisha (waterpipe) bar (another quick 10-minute walk), where we had apple tea, tried smoking an apple-flavored shisha, and (with much instruction from Süleyman) played some backgammon. It was a delightful evening and we recommend this tour to anyone who is outgoing enough and looking for a slightly different experience. Note: if you don't react well to lots of indoors smoke, the waterpipe part is probably not for you.

Wonderful way to get orientated to Istanbul. Istanbul uncovered -Our guide Iskender was very sincere and informative. He was able to give us many insights into Islam which I particularly appreciated. The tour took us to a couple of mosques, the grand Bazaar and the Spice Market. Iskender's insights and recommendations were very appreciated. It was a great way to start our visit of Istanbul and to gain the confidence to continue to venture out on our own.

Istanbul Night Tasting Trail. We had a marvelous evening sampling the food and drink of Istanbul and seeing a part of the city and night life that we had not seen. The experience was greatly enhanced by our wonderful guide Iskender who has an unparalleled depth of knowledge which he generously and enthusiastically shared with us.

Not To Be Missed!. Istanbul Urban Adventures was excellent, not least because of Iskender. After asking a probing question, Iskender revealed that he studied tour guiding for 4 years at university, and it showed not only with his hospitality, but with his knowledgeable historical and cultural anecdotes along the way. And if you’re worried that perhaps some things may get lost in translation, don’t be – Iskender’s English is excellent with a very listenable accent. He imparted with easy-to-understand commentary on the history of the city, its buildings, the people of Istanbul and the streets and food. We are so glad we booked to go on this tour, as it really set us up for the rest of our trip by being guided around an area we probably wouldn’t typically have explored. Not only that, of course, it was an easy way to try many foods and drinks in one night that we may not have consumed during our whole stay. The tour really kick-started our Istanbul adventure in the best possible way and I’d thoroughly recommend this one. Many thanks Iskender!

Awesome tours and tour guides!. Istanbul Uncovered - Great way to check out the areas off the beaten track!Istanbul Old and New - Nice to check out the Taksim area with a guide who can show you the best places!Istanbul Home Cooked Meal - The only way to actually meet and spend time with a real family. This was the best meal we had our entire trip! We're vegetarian, and it was organized so the entire meal was vegetarian!
Fun experience . Very fun experience it is a must try in istanbul it was very unforgettable and the tour guide was very informative and friendly he gave a very good history background of turkey

Great way to start your trip in Istanbul!. Great tour of Istanbul! Really felt acclimated to all the interesting sights and food around the city. Had a great guide who really knew the history and all the best restaurants and cafe's. Highly recommended for anyone who loves food and loves to try new things!

Great time exploring Turkish food and night life. My guide Tolga was excellent - he knew all about the history of the area and was able to modify the tour last minute to suit my eating preferences. Had a great evening of food and conversation - wouldn't change a thing!

Great experience, different than most tours!!. The "Eat like a local Tour" was a wonderful experience. To meet a local family and dine in their home is just something most people would never do but it was awesome to meet them and to do other local things on this tour. I would highly recommend this and the guide was very nice and knowledgable also.

It's totally worth it. It was one of my best experience with my wife at Istanbul, I've tried Eat Like Local Tour and it's worth every cent i pais, i recommend everyone to try it because its different experience from other tours specially if you choose Istanbul Urban Adventure agency as they were very cooperative and unique and you will be lucky if you have İskender as your tour guide as he was very helpful with us. For everyone, don't miss it.

Very interesting experience. We had a great time with our guide Tolga and the excellent local family. The food was very good and plentiful. Both Tolga and the family were happy to share their thoughts on Istanbaul, politics, sports and food. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone looking to do something a little different.

"Eat like a local" - awesome experience. It was exactly as promised and more. The food is great of course and you see a local nargile cafe; but the real highlight is to be able to interact with a local family. Now thats not something you are usually able to do and something I now wish I am able to do on every trip!

informative walking tour. We did the 4 hour walking tour with Iskander who was very knowledgable and had perfect English. He met us promptly and paced the walk well and he included all sorts of extra information about Turkey, including religion and their education system which made for very interesting discussions. We stopped for a complementary cup of tea on a terrace cafe with a great view and a good opportunity for photos. Going through the spice market we went via a Turkish Delight and spice shop which offered delicious wares but do beware not to be overcharged!All in all a great morning in Istanbul.

Excellent local and historical experience. Tolga was beyond kind, courteous, and knowledgeable. He tailored the day long tour over eight hours to our preferences, giving us an in-depth and insider experience of Istanbul's iconic landmarks. At the same time, he took us to several places that we would have never stumbled upon – from local markets in tucked-away alleyways to lunch at a home made shop, he was the perfect representative for this bustling city. Thanks so much!I would recommend Tolga and Urban Adventures particularly to first time visitors of the city. And go with him on one of your first days in town, so you can really get a sense of the city.

Instanbul "Eat Like a Local". One of the best tours we took part in while in Turkey. Our guide was extremely informative and helpful. The entire tour feels relaxed, casual and far more authentic than standard tours. Definitely something different to do from rushing to various landmarks. A very memorable experience. Everything took place on time, with no unexpected downsides. Great company and tour.

"Eat like a local - awesome experience". The best way to experience an authentic way of living in Istanbul. The family was hospitable. The food was awesome, however do not expect a grand dinner but rather focus on the experience itself. I believed that this is all about experience, interaction and knowing their culture.I agree that this is a must do for socially responsible tourist as this benefits people who need it. I truly recommend this experience. I'd rather call it experience than tour because it is up close and personal.Lastly I would like to personally thank our guide Mr. Iskander. He is way the best tour guide I ever met in my several years of travelling. He's articulate, accommodating, helpful and answers all your questions and inquiries. You can feel a good person in him.

Istanbul Uncovered. I had a great experience of Istanbul by doing this half day tour with Caner. In spite of heavy snow he turned up on time and enthusiastically showed me around Ottomon and Roman architecture and visited a breathtakingly beautiful mosque (it was not the blue mosque or Hagia Sofia).Well worth the walk around the grand bazaar and the Egyptian / Spice market too. Ideal for familiarising yourself with the historical area and geography of Istanbul. I now plan to do more targeted visit of individual places of interest to me.

Hidden Istanbul half day walking tour. A good way to get yourself orientated to the location the main sites and find out about the cities history as you walk round. Our guide Suleyman was knowledgeable and spoke good English. We enjoyed his Turkish hospitality and saw bits of Istanbul we would have missed on our own along with advice on other places to visit

Exceptional Experience and Best Food Ever!. Me and my husband did the Night Tasting Tour with Urban Adventures in Istanbul a few weeks ago. We have been doing tours with Urban Adventures in almost every destination we travel. Again our trust did not let us down! Our guide had an excellent knowledge not only of the food but also told us a lot about the history and culture of Turkey and Istanbul. He even provided us a discount card of %10 for any following Urban Adventure we would go on anywhere on the world. That suited us so well as we were travelling to Prague. We had several kinds of Meze`s with a glass of Raki, a savory called Borak, stuffed muscelles and even a delicious piece of break filled with intestines? Who would have thought that?! The Turkish coffee means a lot more to us know we got told about the part it has in the daily Turkish life and folklore. We even got told our future. The experience was unforgettable and we highly recommend this tour for any food lover that travels to Istanbul!

Istanbul Street Food. My husband and I just returned from a fantastic afternoon walking tour with local guide Iskender. We meandered through the spice bazaar sampling and buying a variety of foods for an outdoor picnic. Iskender takes his time to answer all of your questions and has so many interesting insights into Turkish history, culture and modern life. The ferry crossing and the views from the Asian side are breath-taking. Thank you for the lovely afternoon.

Istanbul Street Food, buy in Europe eat in Asia. A great way to get more knowledge about the wonderful food on offer in Istanbul. Iskender is a wonderful and knowledgable guide and helped choose a great range of tasty local foods. It was also a nice opportunity to visit the Asian side and eat with a view of the old city. Recommended for those that love food and conversation.

Istanbul Uncovered. We are a family of four and had a terrific morning with Iskender exploring some of the sights of Istanbul. Highlights included one of the mosques we visited and the rooftop tea in beautiful sun. Iskender's knowledge of this city, its history and lots of other things made the trip memorable and fascinating. All done with an eye to keeping the children involved too. It was also a great introduction to the city and gave us ideas on other attractions/places we might visit or walk around. Well worth the reasonable cost and we would recommend.

Waiting for guide to turn up in the rain. We waited 45 minutes in the rain for our walking tour, when he did turn up, we were too wet and cold to want to do it. They claimed they were told to wait in a cafe, but it was clearly printed on our ticket to wait by a monument. We asked for a refund and we got one.

Cultural etiquette at its finest. We had a fantastic dinner evening, stimulating conversations and mouth watering quality fresh food, definitely recommend the program and guide to anyone wishing to experience local culture and real people away from the tourist entourage.

Istanbul Conquered. We had a very very competent local guide, who showed us all the attractions included in the program. For the price we paid we received an excellent service that also included a good lunch. We are very satisfied and we highly recommend this tour.Simona
Fascinating and informative. The tour was great for discovering places that I would never have found myself. The guides were well informed interesting and friendly. Would highly recommend this tour.

Eat like a local - great experience!. We did the "Eat Like a Local" tour and had dinner in the home of a local Kurdish family. This was such an interesting, enlightening experience and is something I would love to do in every city we visit. Dinner was very good (though it was a little tough for my very tall husband to comfortably eat while sitting scrunched on the floor....but hey, that's what the locals do, so we dealt with it!), and it was interesting to hear both from our host and our guide about Turkish culture and everyday life. After dinner we went to a local place to try sisha and have tea. This was interesting and fun, and also provided us time to visit with our members of our tour who were all from different countries and share travel stories and tips. Overall a great evening that I would definitely recommend if you want to get past doing all the normal "tourist" activities and get insight into local culture.

great way to see the city. Had a great extensive tour throughout the city with an amazing guide tolga kinas. Would thoroughly recommend this tour to anyone wanting to see the city with a short time frame to do so.

Excellent dinner with local family. Excellent dinner in a private home of a kurdish family, with other foreign guests and leaded by a charm guide with a very interesting conversation through the whole evening. We learned a lot, not only with the good meal, but also with the conversation with the friendly guide. Fully recommended to get into local culture and genuine food.

The only way to really experience Istanbul. I don't think you can understand the depths of the city and the culture by visiting the city, but this tour makes it as close as you can get. The family we ate with were Kurdish and the love and happiness we felt there was different than what we felt as we walked the city. The food is also delicious and plentiful. After we even smoked a water pipe at a place we would have never thought to go. The people you meet and the places you go on these tours is once in a lifetime stiff and our guide Iskander was an amazing person in many ways. We even took a second tour with him to see the city. I could not recommend this enough.

Local family dinner. This tour wasn't really a tour but a 15 minutes walk through the old part to the apartment of a local family where we had a nice traditional dinner. The guide was very friendly and told us some nice stories about the traditional life in Turkey. The woman (cook) of the house was lovely and the food was much enjoyed by me and my children. After dinner we had another short walk to have a funny experience smoking the shisha and drank some (very sweet apple ) tea. I think this is a nice alternative thing to do in Istanbul .

Really enjoyable night. This was a great tour. There were only 4 of us (1 couple, 2 singles) and the guide so it was easy to chat and learn a lot about Istanbul. The food cooked by the family was delicious, and the bar we went to afterwards to try shisha was great.

Great experience ever.... I had really great evening with local family dinner. Our guide was very knowledgable and helpfull. I had just couple of days in Istanbul. I decided to book this 'Home Cooked Family Dinner ' tour via Urban Adventures and i highly recommend. I couldnt realize how time flew. Family was so lovely and food was great. After dinner we went to Sisha café to try sisha like locals. If you want to see how locals live and have food, just book this tour. I will come back to Istanbul soon.

Eat like a Local Tour. This was by far the best tour I've ever booked. My boyfriend is a chef, and he loves home cooked meals. So while we were in Istanbul, I thought this would be nice to do for his birthday. I booked this tour and it is something that is completely outside of my comfort zone. But it ended up being the best thing ever. Our tour guide, Tolga Kinas, met us at the Pudding Shop. We were the only couple, so it had a slight romantic aspect to it. We walked to the family's house, and although they did not speak English, our guide was able to translate for us. The family was lovely! We had a wonderful and my boyfriend the chef LOVED it!!! We smoked shisha and drank apple tea afterwards. I felt good because we were able to give back to a local family, and they opened their house to us and shared their culture with us. I totally recommend.

Eat like a local Tour. Very good tour and perfect for social-minded tourists looking for another way to explore the city. Our guide Tolga was awesome and we benefitted from his knowledge. Thanks for a good night Tolga!

Absolutely recommendable. We were only two couples and had the nicest evening: a little walk with tea and shisha and then head to the family's house to enjoy a meal with them. I was able to ask all the questions I had about their lifestyle and culture and the guide was kind to translate them to the family (they did not speak English).It was the first time I have done something like that, and I will sure look for similar activities on the next cities I visit!

Dinner at a Turkish home. This was my favorite excursion. Our guide, Beatrice, met us at the designated restaurant right on time and together we walked to the host's home. The host was gracious and welcoming. She took great pride in the preparation and presentation of our dinner, showing us a traditional Turkish meal. We were invited to ask any questions we wanted and Beatrice interpreted and shared so much information with us. We left with our stomachs full and with a greater understanding of life, culture and politics of Turkey. After dinner, we went to a hookah bar and had a fun and interesting experience there. I would highly recommend this excursion!

Nice Morning Walk + Private Tour. Tolga was so kind and patient with me. I was feeling a little weak and sick from my flight and I only had a short window of time to see Istanbul, so I was very grateful that he made himself available so early in the morning to accommodate me and my schedule. I was able to take a 2-hour walk with him and enjoy a private tour without worrying about missing my flight. I learned so much about Turkish culture in a very short amount of time, it was the perfect tour. I highly recommend Istanbul Urban Adventures and Tolga for your visit to Istanbul!

Istanbul Uncovered perfect way for a first discovery of Istanbul. our Turkish guide was fantastic and showed us Istanbul in a perfact way, going to several places we afterwards could visit ourselves. We got a fantastic first general view of this magnificent city.Our guide also told us about the Turkish culture and food , history, and about the islam

Really fantastic!. The tour I went on (dinner with a local family) was one of the highlights of my trip - Tolga, our guide, was very knowledgeable and friendly and gave us plenty of tips for the next couple of days of our holiday, and the dinner with the family was delicious - and the family themselves very friendly and welcoming. There were a lot of things I'd have had no idea about if not for going on the tour!

Night testing trail - a wonderful evening tour!. Excellent tour with our leader Tolga who is very knowledgable and passionate about Turkish culture. We really felt we were visiting the beautiful Istanbul with a friend. He took us in amazing local places were we discovered various Turkish specialties.

It was okay, but not as good as expected. I went on a tour to meet and have dinner with a local Turkish family. Our guide was very friendly, and the dinner was delicious. However, I have to be honest, I was a bit disappointed, because although the mother of the family was there to serve the dinner, we only briefly said hi to the father and the two kids. No persons in the family were apparently able to speak any English, so all communication went through our guide.During the dinner, only the mother was there, and she did not say anything. I would have expected a bit more interaction with the family as such, so I won't rate it more than average.

Brilliant tour. Really enjoyed my istanbul local dinner with a local family and shisha pipe experience! The tour guide was fab - professional, knowledgeable and friendly and I learnt so much about the local culture that I would not have experienced if I hadn't booked a tour! 5*

The best home cooked meal in Turkey. This is a great night out, and a great way to spend a free night. The tour starts off with a quick tour of the Hippodrome area, after a short stroll we arrived out our hosts family home. We were welcomed and shown around. the highlight is the food and the chance to talk with the family and learn about life in Istanbul.Dietary requirements were catered for. After dinner tea was served. Then we farewelled our hosts in search of Narglie - waterpipe smoking. this is seriously a great way to spend a night in Istanbul, great food, leaning about a new culture and experiencing the night life

Unique night out in Istanbul. Fabulous meal with a local family in old Istanbul given extra value by our great guide Tolga Kinas. Great food followed by a trip to Dervis for Nargileh. Amazing value 10/10.

A fabulous way to spend an evening.. After a short tour of the area around the old hippodrome area with our knowledgeable guide Caner, we were off to the highlight of this evening, a meal with a local family. As there were three vegetarians in our party we had checked before that it would be possible to have this catered for and there were no problems with it. The hospitality of the Kurdish family we visited was warm and open, with their excited children trying out a few words in English with us (and obviously understanding us well!). A delicious meal followed, with Caner translating our questions to the family and answering general questions about Turkish customs. It was then off to a hookah bar where some of us tried for the first ( and probably only ) time. A word of advice - whilst drinking alcohol was perfectly acceptable in other bars and restaurants, do not ask for an alcoholic drink in one of these bars. The experience was the highlight of our few days in Istanbul and I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Vegetarian meal with Kurdish family. The hospitality was wonderful and the food was delicious. The two families opened their home to 10 strangers. They worked very hard to prepare food that would work for vegetarians and we all enjoyed ourselves immensely.Jana was a delightful host for the evening - walking us to the home and then introducing many of us - not all - to the pastime of smoking with a water pipe. Thank you for an introducing evening!

Great First night in Istanbul. In a city of over 18million people, I knew I was going to be alone on my first night. I decided to book "Home Cooked Istanbul" right when I got off the flight. I called and mentioned I would be 10-15 minutes late. There was 5 including myself booked onto the excursion and no one showed up except me. We waited for 20 minutes. The issue was the family had cooked enough for that many people and so she was kind of upset when the other didn't show because the food would possibly be wasted. I felt really bad, but the dinner with the family was VERY authentic. The apartment was small, but it gave a decent understanding of what life is like there. The family had 2 young boys that were really cute and I learned that this year in Turkey, they started making English mandatory for the primary schoolers, instead of only secondary school. Therefore in about 10 years time, more Turkish people will be able to speak English. After a fantastic meal my guide, Burak took me to an authentic Turkish Shisha house. It is actually an old converted University and I was probably the only foreigner in the building. We had a great time smoking Shisha, however I was very tired and jet-lagged from my flight, that I made it a short night. Since I had no sense of direction, Burak was kind enough to walk me back to my hotel, although the streets of Istanbul are very busy and safe.Burak was a great guide and I really appreciated my first night in Istanbul. The cost was very reasonable, and if you are looking for an authentic night, do yourselves a favour and book this one

The best of Istanbul in a day. After reading some of the comments on Trip Advisor, we decided to book an Urban Adventures Tour, as we only had a short time in Istanbul.It was a great decision, as Tolga our wonderful guide, who had been recommended, lived up to the highest of expectations. He was such lovely company, full of interesting stories and facts, and really kept us on the move - never a dull moment. Had a lovely lunch at a local lady's home which was both tasty and a real insight into how the locals live.Tolga also spent time with us after the tour going over the map and suggesting places for our following day. I would highly recommend Tolga as a guide, and Urban Adventures as a tour company - with a difference!

Hidden Istanbul. I think the title is misleadingI thought we would be waking around more of the "back" streets of Istanbul rather than the usual places that can easily be accessed for example the Blue Mosque

Night Tasting Trail Istanbul - All the delicious delights of Turkey. We spent around 4-5 hours with Tolga Kinas from Urban Andventures on a night walking tour around Istanbul. Imagine having a friend in a big city that you have never seen before and they are taking you to all their great food places that only the locals know. The tasting trail is an adventure for your tastebuds. We spent the night having lots of local experiences from sipping Turkish tea with the locals and soaking up the atmosphere to devouring stuffed muscles on the street. Tolga ordered all our food for us and explained what each dish was or when locals would eat it from flavorsome meze and raki to the "wet burger" - a popular late night snack. I highly recommend the night tasting trail and Tolga as your friend in a delicious unknown city.

Great experience in Istanbul. Tolga was our guide for this wonderful evening. He was punctual, professional and knowledgable. After a short walk and discussion of local monuments, we arrived at our dinner venue in a nearby apartment. Our hostess had prepared soup, bean stew served with rice and salad and rice pudding. It was served with guests seated on the floor or for the less mobile on the lounge. No questions went unanswered, photos were permitted and the experience was not to be missed. Great insight in local family life. Following traditional turkish tea, we left for a nearby shisha bar for more tea and the opportunity to smoke shisha in a friendly and interesting environment. It was an unforgettable evening, made even more special due to Tolga.
Dinner with local family. Great experience with dinner at home with an ordinary local family in Istanbul. We learnt a lot about culture and familly life. Very good guide!!

Half day urban tours of Istanbul. Tolga was wonderful but it was only my Mum and I on this tour which made it a little less interesting.. Tolga was friendly and is a wonderful person but I felt there wasn't much history given about Istanbul or what we were doing. Tolga is a quiet guy so unless we asked questions he would very politely inform us and share but I felt the tour was not fast enough or made the most of the couple of hours. Where we walked were to places we could have done easily alone and we did so after the next few days. The coffee cup reading was ok but we sat in the bar waiting for the guy for i think nearly an hour or close to so i felt was a bit of a waste of time. I like to explore different and interesting places that we can't do alone and be told as much info, history, facts etc about the city visiting. Perhaps this is who ever is training the guides to be more informative.Also the meeting point on Intrepid notes needs to be much clearer and Tolga was not in an urban adventures shirt or with a sign or name tag so was impossible to know who he is? I had to call head office (on my phone which costs a lot internationally) and the lady had to describe Tolga, that is the only reason found him. The picnic ( street food tour) was ok, uynfortunatley the weather changed & started to pour with rain and storm. This is obviously out of the guides control but there was no back up plan given to him so we walked & found a spot in the park at a restaurant under cover..During that time not much info again was given about Istanbul, we mostly sat and ate. Which again Mum & I could have done our selves and we had already been to the spice market the day before..I would have preferred not to have paid for a "tour" we didn't pay for anything out of the ordinary although we had a really nice time with Tolga but it was more like we had just paid for his time to be there.I feel perhaps this isn't Tolga's fault but perhaps the guides need some strog training and back plans for tours especially if the weather is not great!

Eat with a Local. First off, our guide Tolga was fantastic! We couldn't have asked for anyone better. He's, personable, knowledgeable, and just all around pleasant company. He has great stories to tell and has a wealth of cultural knowledge. I think anyone that gets Tolga as a guide is extremely lucky.As for the tour, it was great! First, it's a tour with purpose. What I mean by that is that part of the tour's cost goes toward the family that welcomes you in their home for dinner. It great to sit in the home of locals and talk about literally anything you want to. The family we visited was welcoming and made enjoyable conversation - through Tolga's translation. The food was delicious. It's just an excellently planned tour with a nice mix in the agenda - brief history, dinner, sheesha. Overall, my girlfriend and I loved it! I recommend it to anyone. Thanks Tolga and thanks Istanbul Urban Adventures!!!

Great tour! Super knowledgeable guide!. Very very good first tour to do in Istanbul. Tour guide is very helpful, great to get a deep insight to average turkey life and get tips on the best places around Istanbul!

Diner at Turkish Family home a must!!!!!!!!!. I was on a trip with my 23yr old niece and chose this tour on our first day a week ago to experience a Turkish home cooked meal. We met our great tour guide Emir and 1 other couple. We walked around Sultanamet and Emir gave us a overview of the area. We then arrived at the family's house and met the lady of the house with her 2 sons. Diner was ready and sat on the living room floor. We started with a amazing soup with fresh bread. We were served a plate of mixed vegetable and chicken spiced to perfection and a side of turkish rice. A nice salad was served and then cake followed with turkish tea. It was a pleasant surprise of the experience with the family. The home is very clean and you can see how the family enjoys our visit.Emir then took us to a smoke house and even thou we are not smokers it was nice to experience it along with different teas to taste. We could not ask for a better tour guide Emir was very detailed and knowledgable of his culture.A must do experience!Sylvie and JulieCanada

Walking tour :). What a wonderful experience! My partner and I loved every moment. We explored the different mosques, experienced local tea and coffee (delicious), secret passage ways with amazing views. Our tour guide Emir had a lot of local knowledge, the best around!
Wonderful experience with concept. Excellent food, great guide and very kind family! Walked to the family's place, chatted a lot, ate and then went for tea and nargile. Valuable concept!

Awesome Experience. We totally enjoyed our tour of dinner with a local family. The local guide (Tolga) did an great job making us feel comfortable. We ate dinner first and it was a simple meal but enjoyable. The food was very simple, the family made us feel at home and welcome. Afterwards, we went to a local spot to smoke a water pipe. We discussed life in Turkey and Tolga answered all of our questions. I would recommend this tour to anyone interested in learning about Turkey from an insider's perspective.

Istanbul Urban Adventures. A very worthwhile tour. Our tour guide Tolga was very informative and great company. It was fabulous to have the opportunity to have dinner with a family in their own home and learn about life as it really is for a Turkish family who often struggle to make ends meet. We finished our tour with a trip to the Sheesha lounge - definitely an experience not to be missed.

Wonderful way to experience the REAL local culture!. If you really want to know what life and eating is like in Istanbul then this is a must!You will have a meal with a local family in their own home and then go to a local coffee shop to sit with a tea or coffee and a bubble pipe!The meal is simple, tasty and beautifully cooked. We went to the home of a poor family that had left everything to migrate to Istanbul from the eastern region of Turkey. They were living in a the room rented apartment in the back streets of the old city. Dad sells leather goods during the day, mum makes and sells scarves and flower tiaras around the Blue Mosque and the two kids sell various things on the street. They all work hard to make ends meet.We had a small group (3 visitors plus an interpreter) and I think that is near the maximum number. We sat on the floor around the table in the living room of the home and had a lovely 4 course meal.

Dinner with a local Family. My Wife and I were not totally sure what we had signed up for and were pleasantly surprised with the tour. We were met by a local guide at the prearranged place and then we did the smoking a water pipe side of the tour, this was interesting especially as we are both non smokers but had a go as you do not inhale so it was more for the aroma which turned out to be OK. This was followed up with a visit to a Mosque which was next door, this was an operational Mosque and was probably the best we had seen in all of Turkey.We then strolled to the house of our host and as it was Ramadan we sat and talked until sundown via the guide as the folks did not know any English. This was followed with a lovely meal and was very enjoyable, not only was the food tasty but we learned some of the local etiquette. We spoke about their family and what they did for a living and the effects of Ramadan on the cooking as our host could not taste test to ensure the meal was satisfactory. Also on what the children were doing as this was right in the middle of school summer break.I can highly recommend this tour.Mark and Joy.

Eat local with locals. One of the best tour in Istanbul, if you like to eat real local Turkish food with local family for great experience, book this tour and have good evening. Thanks guys to made my Istanbul tour great.

A Night to Remember. We visited the home of a Turkish family near Sultanahmet with our guide. We sat on the floor and ate traditional Turkish food prepared by the wife and neighbour. Although they had no English our guide Emir Sagir translated our questions to the family. It was great to be able to participate and meet the children and learn more about their culture. We then had a tour of their house and our guide walked us through the local shopping area to a bakery where we selected pastries and then walked to a small cafe to eat our pastries and enjoy our Turkish tea. The cafe was adjacent to the Little Haggia Sophia Mosque and after prayers we were taken inside to see the mosque. No other tourists just our guide and a one on one question and answer session. This tour was really well worth it. A must do when in Istanbul

Perfect for Quick Trip in Istanbul. This is the perfect tour to do on your FIRST DAY in Istanbul especially if you are only staying for a short time. It gives you good orientation of the old city where most of the tourist attractions are. You either pass by or go inside all of the "top 10 things to see in Istanbul" so you can go back to the ones where you want to spend more time after the tour. Our guide Erkan was really knowledgeable and helpful and I appreciated the way the tour took you on back roads and small streets so you got a good feel for the real community. Wear comfortable shoes. A few things to note:1) You go inside the Blue Mosque and Sultanahmet Mosque and the Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar but not the Aya Sofia or the Basilica Cistern. Those last two are right next to each other though so you can easily go back after the tour since the tour ends around 1. 2) You need a couple hours and a dedicated tour for the Topkapi Palace, we passed through the grounds on this tour but didn't go in - that's a separate event if you want to do it.

Street food picnic. Had a lovely picnic with bread rings, cheeses, olives, pressed meat, dried fruit and aryan gathered from the Spice Bazaar, as well has hot chestnuts and fresh orange juice picked up in the way to Gulhane Park. Thanks to Salih for gathering the picnic and sharing a wonderful afternoon in conversation about life in Istanbul and Turkey with us.

Eat Like A Local - Istanbul hospitality at its best. The 'Eat Like A Local' tour is definitely one of the highlights of our trip.Our guide Saleh met us at a mutually agreed location. Saleh is a very young, hard working, knowledgeable and energetic young man. He was able to answer our queries and provide suggestions for our remaining time in Istanbul.The tour takes us to a typical home of a Turkish family. The home we went to was nice and cozy, and the people there were very welcoming. As soon as we had arrived, around 7:00pm, the host started laying down the food for our dinner. Saleh was acting as a translator throughout.For starters, the had served a salad, which I was told is usually served around all the restaurants in Istanbul, but this had to be the best tasting salad that I would have had during the trip. This was followed by Dolma, the traditional dish of bell pepper or vine leaves stuffed with rice. The servings were plentiful to the point that I was unable to finish all that was served. The dinner concluded with servings of traditional Turkish tea. The food was delicious and I would have definitely made a second visit if I had the time during my trip.My wife and I were traveling with our daughter, 2 years of age. Because of our daughter, we decided to skip the smoking of the shisha pipe. Instead, Saleh took us to a coffee shop and offered us coffee and snacks.What I enjoyed most about this tour was the fact that we get to see and understand how people live their daily lives. The traditional Istanbul hospitality that you hear of is clearly evident during this visit. Definitely worth the time spent on this tour!!!

Heartwarming dinner with a Turkish family. I thought the "Eat Like A Local Tour" would be something interesting and cultural to do for a short time (about 3-4 hours) together with my sister who was going to Istanbul for work, while I flew in from a different country to meet her. In the end, a number of her co-workers decided to come along as well. We were divided into two groups of 10-11 persons each. First our guide Sukru explained to us that the Turkish family we will visit is poor and such tours help them generate income. We were led through neighbourhoods with old houses where interesting information were relayed to us. Sukru also tactfully suggested that we bring some small presents for the children and we stopped on the way to purchase sweets and chocolates. The family welcomed us warmly and allowed the group to look into all their rooms and take any amount of photographs. I personally found that slightly intrusive, but the visitors were curious and excited to be in the home of someone from a different culture. Our lady host was very open with answering our questions. Sukru was extremely patient with our barrage of questions ranging from education to healthcare to social security and courtship/marriage in Turkey, and exemplary in translating the conversations. The thing that touched me most was that our host apologised at the beginning for the state of her home because she was not able to clean house. Her sister suffered a heart attack earlier in the day and was admitted to hospital. I salute her for her professionalism in cooking for the lot of us despite a major personal setback. There were three dishes, as others have posted before, and tea at the end. Everything was cooked with heart and of course very delicious!The evening ended with a nargile (shisha) session at a big Turkish cafe where some people were playing backgammon and basically just chilling out. It turned out to be a fascinating experience for non-smokers and those who were game to try something new. I recommend apple and peach flavours. Children and people who are sensitive to a smoky environment probably should sit out this part.Priceless experience. Highly recommended.

Street Food Tours - Great Tour at Great Value!. My girlfriend and I did the Street Foods Tour in Istanbul in May 2014. We met our guide just outside the Spice Market and he took us on several stops in and around the Bazaar including bread shops, pizza, Turkish delights, delis, and more. It was a great way to experience some of the local culture and try some different food. The guide was very knowledgeable and helpful with questions. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Istanbul, a great tour at a great value!

Hidden Istanbul. This was an absolutely gorgeous tour of a lot of the main attractions of Istanbul that served as a brilliant opener to our week long stay there. I loved how personal it felt with it being a group of only 8 people including our guide and how we wandered freely from place to place without the restrictions that large guided tours would have imposed. I thoroughly want to recommend Salih who was a very friendly and informative guide and made sure that the pace was never too fast that we couldn't keep up. I got to see the obvious of Istanbul with its mosques, bazaars and spice markets and also got to see a lot of the hidden treasures kept away in the back alleys where no one would think to look ... the cosy tea room and the lunch we had in a hidden away place was a lovely touch and it thoroughly added to the experience. Would thoroughly recommend this tour as a great way to start a holiday in Istanbul and get you acquainted with just how much Istanbul has to offer. 10/10

Urban Adventures Tour...excellent experience!!. We enjoyed our Istanbul urban tour with our friendly and helpful guide Salih Çam. Without Salih we would never of discovered the hidden treasures in the city from a local tea/coffee house (best tea in the city) and a local food deli. It was great to hear the interesting history of Istanbul and local knowledge of the area. Thank you Salih!!

Wonderful Impressions. Got a lot of information about the Culture and Life in Istanbul.My great guide Salih had answers to all my questions.Would recommend everyone to join this tour for getting impressions one otherwise would never get.

Home Cooked Istanbul. My husband and I had no idea of what an interesting evening we would have when we booked this tour from our armchairs at home! Salih Cam and his friend Seldah along with 2 other guests took us to eat real home-cooked food with a real family in Istanbul. Lentil soup, raita, rice and (baked) beans and a bulgur wheat salad with delicious bread was washed down with water, our non-existent Turkish translated by Salih and Seldah. We were able to ask about life in Istanbul, play with the family pet ( a kitten) and encourage the older children with their rudimentary English. After supper and saying out goodbyes to the family to allow the children to go to bed, we were then taken to a traditional Turkish 'bar' where the men (and women) drink coffee and smoke water/hookah pipes. Not wishing to smoke or drink Turkish coffee, we did not stay but enjoyed the offer.This is the type of tour which helps the local economy, promotes social and cultural understanding and broadens the mind - well done Urban Adventures and Saleh for your undertaking of such events.

Old and New Istanbul. My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful if wet afternoon with Salih Cam from Urban Adventures in Taksim. We visited 3 Churches (2 Catholic, 1 Greek Orthodox) despite being told by a guide from another company there was only 1 Christian Church left in Istanbul as all the others had been converted to Mosques), enjoyed 2 coffee stops, had our fortunes told, walked miles and learnt how the trams operate. We were able to ask this enthusiastic, knowledgeable young man about the history of this fascinating country and it's future as a country with its feet in 2 continents and with cultural influences from east and west.

Fun Way To Get To Explore Istanbul. We did the Istanbul Street Picnic tour and really enjoyed it. Our friendly and knowledgeable guide Erkan showed us around the Spice Market of Istanbul, explaining local cuisine and letting us try lots of great street foods. This was a great way to start our stay in Istanbul, easing our feelings about trying all of he street foods and getting a sense of the Turkish appetite. I'd definitely recommend an Urban Adventure tour of Istanbul--especially if you are not already on an organized tour of the city.

Great Introduction. This tour does only cover the main tourist spots of Istanbul, but that's a good thing as it gives you a decent taster and allows you to decide where to spend more time. The guide, Can, was friendly and knowledgeable and we had a good time. You are out in the open a lot though so be wary of the sun/rain depending on the time of year.

Hidden Istanbul tour worthwhile for an Overview of the City. Our tour guide, Can (pronounced Jan) was knowledgeable, professional, friendly, and enthusiastic about his job. The tour is called "Hidden Istanbul" and is a walking tour. We were lucky enough to just have a small group which meant more access to the guide's knowledge. The name of the tour, however, is a misnomer as you hit the main tourist spots that anyone could easily find independently. This walking tour gave us a great sense of the general history of Istanbul and helped us to place ourselves geographically in Istanbul.

Ok walking tour . I happened to be the only person for the day when we did the Hidden Istanbul tour so effectively got a private tour.My guide was knowledgeable and very kind, but there was an extreme amount of information and I just felt like I was getting talked to the entire time. It also seemed to me that a large part of it was the regular tourist trail rather than 'Hidden Istanbul' and it seemed a bit pointless walking through the grounds of the palace and Aya Sofia when you don't actually go into these places as part of the tour.

Highlight of my time in Istanbul. My time in Istanbul was absolutely amazing however the home-cooked tour was definitely one of my favorite parts. Our tour guide, Tolga, was so nice and incredibly friendly. The family we had dinner with was so humble yet did everything to make us feel comfortable, I will never forget this experience. The children were adorable and so sweet. Not only that, but the food was incredible, I have never had such amazing grape leaves in my life! We ended the night at a shisha lounge which completed the entire experience. I highly recommend this tour to all, you will not only enjoy yourself but also eat great food and get a very authentic experience that is unforgettable.

Home-cooked Tour - An unforgettable experience with Erkan. Well, I was little sceptical initially when booking this home cooked tour in Istanbul because price was suspiciously low. oh boy, I was sooo vv wrong, we had one of the best experiences ever. We met our guide "Ekran" at around 6pm on 27th March. He took us around for a short walk, explaining history of all monuments on our way. on reaching this local family home, we found them to be v welcoming. My wife really enjoyed with their kids and we actually felt like at home. After leaving this family home, we went on enjoying Turkish tea and Sheesha at one of popular places. The whole tour in itself was a great experience. For us, one of the major highlights of the tour was the guide himself. Erkan and his friend (sorry I forgot her name) were great and fun guys to be with. From Turkish history to culture, and from education system of turkey to latest economic reforms and developments, they answered every question of ours very politely and in v detail. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who wish to visit turkey and see both sides of the picture.

Home-Cooked Tour. Had a fantastic time. We left with our tour guide, Tolga, for a short walk and then had the most amazing dinner with a local family. The family was so nice, their children were so sweet, and their food was incredible. A true Turkish experience! We ended the tour at a shisha bar, where I tried some apple. Very fun, very authentic. Would definitely do a tour with this company again! Thanks for the amazing experience!

Just Amazıng. There are many things that I would recommend in Istanbul but this is m number one recommendation. with my school we arranged a dinner with a Turkish family wıth our tour guıde Tenero. Before going, I really didn't want to eat in a families home, I felt like I was ımposıng. When we arrived, the family was more than welcoming and the children were just a joy. I ended up playing with their three ear old boy the whole time. When it was time for me to leave he gave me a bıg hug and a plastic flower to keep. When I said goodbye to his mother, she held m hands and gave me a long beautiful speech. I had no idea what she said but her words were so thankful and touching they brought me to tears. The people of Istanbul are so kind and hospitable ıt ıs overwhelming and wıll brıng out the best ın you. The program that thıs company set up chooses poorer Istanbul families and pays them to cook for tourısts. It helps famılıes ın need whıle gıvıng tourısts an experience the can remember for the rest of theır lıves.

The best of Istanbul in one day. We booked 2 half-day tours since we were only in Istanbul for one day. It was perfect - We had a 'private' all day tour with Tolga. He was wonderful. I wanted to see authentic arts & crafts and do a little shopping and he made sure we saw and did what we wanted in addition to his 'regular' tour. He guided to the best shops for quality and price. He made us feel very comfortable, he is patient and courteous and we fell in love with the city through his stories of the history and the sights. We would love to go back and spend more time and thanks to Tolga we would manage on our own. We also feel we made a friend. I highly recommend the tours to get a very intimate and local feel for the city and see things you might miss otherwise.
Good introduction. The guide is very informative and is a good introduction to istanbul. Highly recommended to those who come to visit istanbul for the first time.

Amazing introduction to Turkey!. My friend and I just spent the weekend in Istanbul and decided to spend our first night on an Urban Adventure tour. We were met right on time by our guide, Canero (who said we could call him John), and two other travelers who were in our group. Canero led us through the hippodrome and on the way to the family's house explained in great detail the history and significance of each statue there. Dinner was with a sweet Turkish family who spoke no English, but with Canero's help we were able to have a great evening with lots of laughs. The food was simple and tasty and included two different soups, a stew, rice, homemade bread, and tea. Canero explained everything in detail to us, including the ingredients of each dish,and the fact that it was traditional cuisine from the family's region in Turkey. He answered all of our questions and was incredibly charming and personable. I feel that he really tried his hardest to make sure that we all had a great experience. After dinner he took us to a local tea house for nargile, where he again did everything possible to make us feel at ease and have a good time. For me it was a perfect introduction to Turkish culture and cuisine, and I felt much less overwhelmed with all of the new sights and sounds than if I had not done this tour. Istanbul is complete sensory overload, but I think doing something like this helped me to feel more comfortable with everything and to have fun. I highly recommend this experience, especially if you can arrange to have Canero as your guide!

Dinner with a local family - fun time and an authentic experience. My wife and I were the only two on the tour that night. We met the guides by the Blue Mosque and walked through the old town to the family's apartment where we had soup, rice, a veg/chicken combo, and some rice stuffed cabbage leaves. The adults in the family didn't speak English and the young kids only a few words from school, so we had to go through the guides for everything. It was great having the home cooked meal and talking with the family. Afterwards the guides took us to a hookah joint and we chatted with them for a while over a hookah. Overall a great time and definitely worth the money! Of all the tours we've done while traveling this one felt the most authentic and is probably one of the cheaper ones too. Win win!

Brilliant tour with Semih. This was a great day. 6 of us in the group - a good number. Moved at a fast enough pace so that no one was bored but plenty of info along the way from our excellent guide, Semih.

Host family dinner - great experience!. Last night we had a great evening with Semih (our fantastic guide), our host family and the other tour guests. I would recommend this tour to anyone who would like to get a real insight into current Turkish affairs and have the opportunity to ask a local a lot of questions in a relaxed environment, which is not always possible while traveling. And of course anyone who appreciates delicious food, welcoming hosts and good company of an evening.The tour is great value for money (the food is simple and tasty but the experience is priceless) and suitable for all ages.Generally I am not really a 'tour person' - I just read up and check them out alone - so it's not often that I book a tour unless it's something unique and with this tour I was really impressed - all expectations were more than fulfilled!

Tasting the Spice Market was great!. We had a wonderful time on the Spice Market tour, which Semih guided. He has great English and was really fun! We met out in front of the Spice Market which was a bit difficult to find, but thankfully he was wearing a bright red shirt with the company name on it, so we spotted him easily.We went on a Saturday (in low season) and the market was jam packed, I am nervous to see this market in high season!! It was very difficult to navigate the narrow market streets and keep us all together as everyone was sandwiched in with the locals all moving in different directions. That added to the fun of it though. At one point Semih told us that he have to be rude and push through, as this is what they all do.We were initially led through some of the backstreets and were taught what and where the locals ate. Our first tasting was fried anchovies which were fresh and delicious. We purchased some food there to have on our picnic later. Semih told us all about the local delicacies, which was great. We also got to try a very local treat of tomato and garbanzo balls wrapped in lettuce. That experience was hilarious as the owner is a bit crazy. All part of the charm. Our favorite stop was at the Turkish delight, tea & spice shop. You will never look at Turkish delights the same again. We loved the pomegranate, ginger & lemon delights!!Our picnic in the park was lovely where we had the flatbread with spinach and potato, cheese, desserts, along with their local yogurt drink (which is salted!). For the price I highly recommend this tour, it was fun, delicious and educational. Plus Semih even helped us locate a place where we could purchase our bus tickets to Bulgaria, he was so helpful.You won't be disappointed, it is a wonderful tour!

Home cooked Istanbul - real life experience. This was wonderful experience. Whole concept of the tour is great. We first went to this 'hidden' cafe with amazing terrace and sea view where we had some turkish tea(if you wanna do what locals do, but it's bitter :D) or apple tea (tourist version - but delicious, try to resist ;)) where he taught us how to play backgammon which was great fun. Oooh, and we smoked shisha there, too. :) We all went back to this cafe next day because it is so near the tourist areas, but so peaceful and nice, but impossible to find out about if you don't know it...Then we walked around different neighborhoods where the guide was telling us a lot of stories and explaining about some sights, buildings but history and culture as well to finally arrive to our dinner place - highlights among the highlights :DWhat I loved about the whole thing that it is two way exchange - it is just not they serving you a meal, but we ate together which was an amazing interaction and great practice of your body language to communicate to them because they do not speak much english. Maybe this is what makes it even more precious experience. It's actually very simple to communicate if you let yourself being led by positive energy and feelings. It seems like this visits have a great impact on the family (not financially) but it brings much much more into their world too. The guide was translating everything, so we were able to have conversation and ask many question as the family did as well. Especially kids, who were also trying a lot to learn some english words and also thought us some games to play. This people open their hearts and let strangers come to their home, but when you leave, you're certainly not a stranger to them anymore(if you let yourself, of course :))Local guide, Semih was fantastic too. He was so knowledgeable, funny and entertaining that it felt more like having a friend showing you the town (and sharing his secrets) than being on a tour, which was my favorite. :) He is able to talk as much about history (if you are interested) or just the everyday life and all the random questions people from our group had about Istanbul and turkish culture. Just try to beet him in Tavle (backgammon)!And I am sure, some day when back in Istanbul, I will pay a visit to this wonderful family :)

A unique and pleasant experience!. I really enjoyed my visit to a family home filled with children, where we were served a delicious home-cooked meal made my mom, and served by the children. None of the family members spoke English, but the children knew a few words they learned in school. It was very interesting to see how local Turkish families live their lives, and I'm glad that I was able to support them in exchange for a glimpse into their daily lives. I highly recommend this experience!

Hidden Istanbul - worth it for the view alone!. I had a stressful time finding the Urban Adventures Istanbul office (they could use better directions on their site) and missed my departure. Fortunately, I found another Intrepid tour nearby and they directed me to the office. There, the Australian gentleman (whose name I have forgotten, sorry!) was very kind and tracked down Semih for me. Semih and the other woman on the tour met me outside within minutes. I am so grateful for the outstanding customer service they gave me!Semih was very informative and accommodating. We had to adjust our plans due to mosque closings for Friday prayers (take that into account when booking) and my fellow tour member's afternoon flight. However, we had a fascinating tour of the Hagia Sophia and Grand Bazaar. Semih also took us to several shops as requested. After the other woman left, Semih and I went on to a cafe terrace which had an INCREDIBLE view of the Bosphorus. I give props to Semih for being a good photographer too!Hidden Istanbul was a great way to see some of Istanbul's main sights with a native guide. I would recommend it to any solo travelers or groups. I'm looking forward to more tours with Urban Adventures and Intrepid!

Home Cooked Istanbul was a real find. Urban Adventures Home Cooked tour gave me the only opportunity I had in 4 weeks of travel to be invited into a Turkish family's home and to enjoy a meal with a family including children who helped serve and other members of the extended family that stopped by. The meal was simple and delicious. We were seated on cushions and food was served on a cloth spread on the floor. Our guide, Semih, translated so communication flowed easily.and I felt a real bond with these gentle people.After our visit with the family, Semih took us (a Canadian couple and myself ), to a cafe where we were introduced to the game of backgammon and the nargile water pipe. Being non-smoker, I was dubious about trying the pipe, but surprisingly for me, it turned out to be a rather pleasant experience.Tours like the ones Urban Adventures offers open us up to cultural experiences that are hard to find. My highest recommendation.

Spice Market/ Food Tour. Semih was a great gide with a very good command of English. He introduced us to traders within and outside the market and explained the Historical and Cultural aspects of the foods and market.We tasted and tried different delicacies. Worth doing this tour early in your stay in Istanbul as great advice on where to eat, what to eat and places to see. It was great fun as we saw the humour of the traders!!!

Wonderful experience with a local family in Istanbul. I can't recommend this tour enough. This was the one of the first things I did when I got to Istanbul. We first met Semih at the local Urban Adventures office is Istanbul. It was myself, Semih, and a couple from Germany. From what I understand, Semih likes to keep the groups small for this tour, which is great. We first went to the family's home for a meal. A real home cooked meal, this is a first for any tour for myself. They made all sorts of traditional foods like red lentil soup, dolmas, and so on, finishing off with Turkish tea. All the food was great. Semih translated for us, which was really helpful. We then went to a local hookah bar to try a hookah and play some backgammon. The hookah bar had a nice view of the Bosphorus and we chatted and played for about an hour and a half if memory serves right. This was a lot of fun too, capped off a great night.I learned later that the tour is there for the benefit of the families that cooked the meals and let us spend time with them for the evening, which is really wonderful. I mentioned that I was surprised they don't mention that in the tour itinerary, and I made sure to tip extra.All in all, a great experience, one that I'm still remembering.Semih is a great tour guide too, I can't forget to mention that.

Don't think, just book it!. The istanbul urban adventure tour was fantastic! A really special experience to be able to eat and chat with a traditional Turkish family. And just as fun at the water pipe bar! Our guide even taught us how to play back gamon like the locals. Semih, our guide, was the best guide yet in my travels. Super friendly, funny, knowledgeable and helpful. Is a real treat to have a local turk being able to show you around. This tour is a must!!!

Great local insight to life (and food) in Istanbul. Did the Picnic tour with Semih through the Spice Markets, surrounding streets and finishing at parklands outside of Topai Palace. I was the only person on the tour, so had a very personalised experience - Semih was very friendly and talkative so didn't feel awkward at any stage. Tour started in the Spice Market where Semih was able to explain all the different foods and spices and how they are used in Turkish cooking. At no stage did I feel pressured to buy anything from any of the vendors we visited. From there we wandered through the shops and stalls in the streets surrounding the Spice Market sampling foods and buying stuff for the picnic. Highlight was the small meatball vendor down a side alley that has a very unique style when it comes to serving his customers!From there we walked to the park outside of Topkapi Palace and enjoyed the foods Semih had purchased during the tour and had a great chat about life in Instanbul and Australia (very much a two way conversation and learning experience).The whole tour was relaxed and very informative - I'd definitely recommend it anyone.
