Old and New Istanbul. I took the Old and New Istanbul as it was slightly different to the more touristic places to see that I had seen previously when in Istanbul. I had never visited Taksim Square or even the other side of the bridge! I had a wonderful tour with Semih, he is very knowledgeable and also passionate about the city. He is a very friendly and happy to answer questions and help with photos as i was a solo traveller! I had an interesting experience getting fortune told from coffee, The info this guy can tell you about yourself is very surprising. One thing is already correct he told me regarding a friend of mines sex of her baby......who knows if he has a gift?A great tour and highly recommend it.

Amazing opportunity!. We spent a lovely evening with our guide Semih in the company of a friendly Turkish family in their home. We would never had an opportunity to see this side of Istanbul without this evening. Lots of people travel to Istanbul to see the sites, missing the opportunity to get exposure to the culture. The host family opened their door to us, so it was great to get some insight into their way of live. A very friendly family, the kids are adorable! Would definitely recommend this tour if you want to experience a bit of "real life" in Istanbul. 5 stars!!We also got to learn how to play backgammon... which followed us throughout the rest of our trip :)A wonderful eveningthanks again!

A great way to be introduced to Istanbul. A friend and I did this morning walking tour on our first morning in Istanbul. Semih (Sammy) is a really great guide and is so knowledgable as well as friendly. As there was only the two of us it was really personal and we could ask anything we liked. Sammie gave us some great tips regarding shopping, and lots of information regarding culture and day to day life in turkey! A visit to buy the best doner kebab in turkey completed a great morning!!!

Excellent guided tour of Old and New Istanbul. Our guide Semih (sammy) took us on a wonderful trip thru the back streets of Taksim. He explained history and architecture in depth and was very knowledgeable. He took us for Turkish coffee and we had our grounds read by a psychic, which was very fun!

Old and New Istanbul. This was a great way for me to get started, and familiar with Istanbul, in particular the Beyoglu area. The walking tour began at the Hippodrome and Semih, the guide is knowledgeable and obviously enjoys sharing the history of this area. We then proceeded on the tram to Beyoglu with introduction to Taksim Square and a great walk down Istiklal Cadessi, where many locals hang out. Semih has a lot of information on this area and it was great to walk around and about thru the small side streets that branch off of Istiklal Cadessi. This was particularly helpful to me as I returned several times to walk around and enjoyed lunch at a restaurant (not listed, not even a sign outside, and an elevator ride up to the top floor of this building on a small side street - nice to do something that is a little hidden and unknown) recommended by Semih. Oh, and there was a fun Tarot Card/coffee ground reading, off on a side street - a good respite from the walking. Semih is personable and patient, knowledgeable and is an example of 'new Istanbul'. When I return I will definitely take another Istanbul Urban Adventure tour!

Dinner at Local Family Home. Our trip to Istanbul in September was FANTASTIC. One of the most memorable moments of this week-long trip was the night of September 6th when we visited a Turkish family and had a GREAT meal with them. The food was simply delicious!!! There was enough food for you to have a second serving. I sure took advantage of that opportunity.The family was lovely. We were allowed to asked questions and they were answered honestly. The children were a pure delight.Semih and his partner were wonderful tour guides. They helped to translate, but one of the little girls was able to practice her English on us. She was pretty good considering she is just learning how to speak it.After dinner, Semih took us to a local cafe where we drank tea, used a shisha pipe and played backgammon. There is no need to worry if you don't know how to play backgammon, Semih is a wonderful teacher.We are in our fifties and the other couple was much younger than us, probably in their late twenties. They too had a great time.If you visit Instanbul, this is a MUST tour to take. It's inexpensive and trust me when I say that you will love every minute of it!!!BRAVO to whomever came up with the idea to create such a tour!!!

"Eat Like a Local - Istanbul". Very enjoyable. Semih, our guide, took us to a local family, who cooked dinner for everyone to share family style. Semih acted as our translator, he also answered all our questions about everything (culture, family life, transportation, politics, you name it), and he encouraged us to ask the children questions in English so they can practice. The wives were very hospitable, the children were playing. Afterwards we went to a cafe for hookah, and he taught us how to play backgammon. Overall, it was a very laid back, enjoyable evening tour, around 4-5 hours. I highly recommend it. Note that there is no sightseeing, this tour gives you glimpse and taste of local life.

Old & New Istanbul. This was a fantastic tour! Our guide, Semih, was friendly, extremely knowledgeable, interesting, and enthusiastic! It's a great tour to do after hitting all the key sights (Topkapi, Blue Mosque, etc.) as it shows you another side of the city. Can't say enough about this tour! It was perfect and I recommend it to anyone going to the city.

Hidden Istanbul. This tour was a fantastic way to have an introduction to Istanbul. Semih our guide took us through a number of the key tourist sites but then really introduced us to the local side of Istanbul. I appreciated seeing the city through the eyes of a local person and gained an appreciation of local culture. In the days that followed I felt 'at home' in the city thanks to the many insights that Semih imparted. If he and this tour are truly representative of Intrepid urban adventures then I will be taking them everywhere I go.

Home cooked meal excursion. Had a terrific time on the Home Cooked meal excursion. Semih, the tour guide took us to join a family at their home for dinner. The meal was delicious and we had great fun talking, with the help of Semih to the family and playing, with lots of smiles and laughter, with the children. After we went to a great little cafe where're smoked a water pipe and tried very hard to beat Semih at backgammon. It was a great evening! Provided a real sense of living in Istanbul.

A great walking tour!. Was in Istanbul in August and arranged a walking tour with urban adventures. Was so so pleased at having done so. Semih our guide was so nice, so knowledgeable and interesting . We visited the architectural/archaeological sites and also the bustling spice bazaar and grand bazaar. Plus had the best Turkish tea in an out of the way tea shop with a lovely view of the river and parts of the city. Visitors to Istanbul please note that there is no other way of seeing a city than having a great guide who informs you of the history/ geography and social conditions of each era.

Home Cooked Istanbul. I would recommend this option to anyone visiting Istanbul, even for a short stay. Semih, our guide ( there were 3 of us only) walked us through a hilly section of the old town which we would never have discovered. Then spending time in a tea house, overlooking the river, learning to play backgammon was fun.We fired heaps of questions to Semih, especially about Ramadan & local life. He was so knowledgeable. We learnt so much about Istanbul & Turkey. Semih has become like a "family member' with the local family we had a meal with. The children were very excited to see him. As Semih translated, we got to know the family & about their way of life. The kids were fun. A lovely meal was prepared for us which we ate sitting on cushions with the family. After our meal, Semih took us back through the "pop up" night market. set up during Ramadan.Semih was very patient, stopping, answering questions. The whole evening ( from 5pm I think) was at a relaxed pace

Urban Adventures Istanbul. What a wonderful insight Semih provided into his Istanbul! On our 2nd day in Istanbul we took a 4 hour walking tour with Semih to the Taksim area and surrounds and he was full of information and hidden secrets about the area that we would never have found out on our own. We were so impressed with the experience that we approached Urban Adventures about visiting other areas and were told they could design any itinerary we wanted. So we hooked up with Semih again for a whole day of exploring the Chora Church Museum, the city walls, Eyup. We took a ferry, bus, taxi, cable car and walked our way through a wonderful, informative and friendly day. Semih is knowledgable and passionate about sharing the secrets of Istanbul which is a treasure trove of a city!

An evening out and at home. We had a memorable evening with our host in Istanbul, Semih. We are still talking about what we learned from him about his country. He is very knowledgeable, and seems to have all the time in the world to answer your questions, tell you stories, and drink tea together. He let us win twice at Backgammon. Now that's a fine host. The family who prepared dinner for us is warm and the children are fun-loving. Thanks to Semih's faithful translations, we were able to bridge any differences in our backgrounds and feel that parents and makers of homes around the world share much in common.

Home Cooked Istanbul. My significant other and I signed up to take the Home Cooked Istanbul tour and we had an absolutely amazing time. Semih, our guide, took us to meet Sarai and her wonderful family. After, we visited a tea house and smoked Narghile, drank tea, and played backgammon. Semih was knowledgeable, fun, and friendly. Sarai and her family were incredibly welcoming. We talked about Istanbul culture and experiences. We learned about some of the history and the variety of geography. At the cafe Semih patiently taught us how to play backgammon and we had such a good time, we went to play every night were were in Istanbul. At the end of the rip, Semih gave us the name of his friend in the spice bazaar. We went to see him the next day and, upon mentioning Semih's name, we were treated like friends. Home Cooked Istanbul was by far my favorite activity in the city (and we did and saw many wonderful things).I recommend it to anyone even potentially considering it. It was a wonderful time and a great experience.

A truly authentic experience. I was the only person on the Istanbul In-depth tour for the two days and I loved it. My tour guide Semih was incredibly kind and would wait as long or as little as I wanted at each spot...being a photo fanatic, this meant that he had to wait quite some time for me at certain spots! Semih was incredibly knowledgeable about Turkey's history and easily answered every question I had. He was also very flexible, as I fell in love with the tile work at one mosque, so he took me to a special mosque that is not on the tour that was covered in the most beautiful tiles. I learned how to play backgammon while sipping tea and smoking a hookah. The dinner with a local family was the highlight for me. The kids are fabulous and we played so many games of rock, paper, scissors after the delicious dinner. The visit to the Hamam (Turkish bath) on day two is heavenly!

Intriguing Istanbul Adventure. I took the "Istanbul in Depth" with Semih whom was extremely knowledgable and informative in ancient and modern day Turkey! During the tour we visited many places, the favourite of mine being Taksim, where we took our time to look around and really soak up everything Istanbul has to offer. This tour provides the opportunity for you to really see what Turkish life is by being welcomed into the friendliest family's home for an amazing dinner, which is quite the surreal experience. Should you wish to also be pampered during your travels you are taken to a Turkish bath which will leave you feeling completely relaxed and ready for a big day of walking through the lavish streets of Istanbul.I recommend this tour for anyone of any age, whether they are travelling with friends, family, or even by themselves (like myself) as it is quite the experience and the perfect way to spend your time in Istanbul.

Touring Istanbul with Semih. The tour with Semih was perfect for our first time in Istanbul. He is very knowledgable and friendly. We visited famous attractions including the Aya Sofia, Suleymaniye Mosque, and the Spice Bazaar, but also experienced smoking a hookah and having a home cooked meal with a Turkish family. Having dinner was definitely a highlight, and one of my most enjoyable meals. The ladies in the family are talented cooks! I was the sole vegetarian among my friends, and they made an entree without meat for me. I definitely recommend Istanbul Urban Adventures. Ask for Semih as your guide, you won't be disappointed!

Very knowledgeable tour guide. We had a great tour with Semih - we don't normally do organized tours, but this was truly informative. The tour ended up being just three of us - Semih knew so much about the Aya Sofia - it really made it come live for my husband and I. He even took us to Istanbul University and the book sellers bazaar. It was an excellent opportunity to see Istanbul in a different way.

Informative and interesting. I took the "Hidden Istanbul" tour with Semih who was a great guide and really knows his stuff. I was lucky to be the only person on the tour that day and Semih was really flexible so we spent as little or as long as I wanted in each area we visited. The tour covers all the major highlights in the Sultanahmet area as well and lots of other places I would not have discovered by myself. Semih was great fun to spend the day with and was full of tips and other information that was really helpful throughout the rest of my visit to Turkey. Would highly recommend the tour!

Lovely evening with Istanbul family and guide. The Urban Adventures Home Cooked Meal / Family Evening tour was one of the best experiences of my recent Istanbul stay. The guide, Semih, is extremely knowledgeable and easygoing. We walked through a charming but authentic Sultanhamet neighborhood to a charming café where we smoked a hookah pipe, played backgammon and talked about life, family and Turkey. Then we went to the home of a delightful family where we had an absolutely delicious meal and talked. Warm, welcoming, flavorful Turkey at its best. Thank you Semih!

our experience with a local family in Instanbul+ home cooked meal. On our tour package we had an evening included with a local family and a home cooked meal. This turned out to be the highlight of our trip as we were warmly received by the family and felt completely at home. Walking the neighbourhood we absorbed the energy and friendliness of the local people. We would like to thank Semih for this excellent opportunity to interact with this wonderful family

Home cooked Istanbul-A real local experience. As a solo traveller in Istanbul, I wanted a way to experience the local culture and Urban adventures home cooked Istanbul provided a great opportunity that I would have never experienced on my own. Semih was an excellent guide telling us about Istanbul as we walked to a local family's house for dinner. We were welcomed by the family and able to talk to them about their life in Istanbul. Semih provided excellent interpretation and helped answer all out questions. They cooked a delicious dinner for is with plenty of food. After dinner, Semih walked us to a local cafe where we enjoyed tea, water pipe, and the local past time, backgammon. We got to talk to Semih and learn more about Turkey while I beat him in backgammon. Home cooked Istanbul is a great opportunity to really learn about the culture and life of people in Istanbul. And with a small tour group, we got all our questioned answered, learned a lot, ate some great food and really enjoyed a nice relaxing evening. Thank you Semih, for a wonderful experience in Istanbul!

Incredible Experience in Istanbul. My son's and I were recently on a cruise that included a couple of days in Istanbul. By far the best experience of our entire trip was spending the evening with Semih and our host family sharing a dinner, talking (with Semih providing interpretation), and wandering through one of the neighbourhood's around the Little Ayasofya. I enjoy travel, but haven't done alot of it, and what I like most is being able to spend some time in one place, walk it's streets, start to feel it's bones and get even a small sense of what the place may really be like. Try to form some kind of connection. With a cruise providing you maybe a day in any port this is incredibly difficult to do, however this evening really made that happen for me, and I think my kids.The original itinerary called for going to a family home for dinner and then out to a tea shop for tea, backgammon and waterpipe. As it was Ramadan the order was reversed so that, after meeting at the Urban Adventures office near the Hippodrome, we proceded to a tea house, with Semih providing us with lots of information along the way, both historical and current. We arrived at the tea house where we sat, enjoyed tea, smoked from the water pipes and learned to play backgammon. A very relaxing start to the evening, and a lot of fun. From there we went to our host families home for dinner, learning along the way from Semih abit about the community, and current day Istanbul and Turkey. We were greated warmly by the host family, her children, neighbour, and neighbours children. We were brought into their home and seated in a common area and chatted for a bit and then the best food of the entire trip was served and we all enjoyed our dinner together while continuing to ask and answer questions. Semih had told us that any question was an okay question, so it lead to a great conversation and the opportunity for myself and my kids to learn a little about life in Turkey. Dinner was concluded with tea, and after a bit more conversation we said our farewells, having already, very sincerely been told that we were welcome to visit them any time. Amazing. From there we were back out into the night and Semih very happily got us on our tram and headed in the right direction. He happened to be going the same way so we continued to chat and he made sure we didn't miss our stop. Truly an incredible experience and opportunity that I would recommend to anyone wanting to really get a taste of this marvelous city. Thanks Semih.

Great way to get under the skin of the city!. I joined Semih on Old& New Istanbul and Home Cooked Istanbul Urban Adventures and both were truly excellent! (If I had more time I would certainly joined him for the other Urban Adventures as well!)On the Hidden Istanbul tour we explored Taksim area and explored many of its gems…hidden streets as well as some key landmarks and we heard plenty of interesting facts along the way as well as tried typical Turkish coffee which was then followed by a session with a fortune teller. The tour was interesting, fun and interactive. I highly recommend it to anyone who would like to get under the skin of the city.During the Home Cooked Istanbul tour we had a chance to join a local family for dinner and to join the locals for a popular pastime activities: playing backgammon and smoking water pipe. Again it was great way to get a glimpse into local reality and Semih was very happy to answer all our questions and tell us some more interesting stories about life in Istanbul and Turkey in general.I highly recommend Istanbul Urban Adventures and Semih! Thank you for showing me your city and a great time! I would never be able to see so much of Istanbul in the limited time that I had if not for the tours!

Amazing experience in Istanbul. As first time lone traveler to Istanbul, making the decision to do a two day tour with Urban Adventures resulted in an amazing experience. Semih was a brilliant guide, and showed me an Istanbul that I would have never have discovered on my own. Together we saw all the amazing sights, the Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Spice Market, Grand Bazaar, as well as other things that I would have never thought of doing. We had dinner with a local family and got to practice my Turkish much to the delight of my young hosts, after which we sat overlooking the Bosporus, drinking tea, eating cherries and playing backgammon. Semih also showed me the wonderful district of Taksim and Beyoglu where the highlight of my trip was having my fortune told and then having a traditional Turkish bath in a 15th Century Hamam.Istanbul blew my mind and Semih blew away all my concerns about being a lone female traveler in Turkey. In the light of the Taksim Square protests, Semih was a wonderful guide, and never once did I feel unsafe. I would strongly recommend Semih as a guide, he is kind, knowledgeable and knows Istanbul’s secrets inside out. He will show you the most amazing time and experiences that you will never forget.

Hidden Istanbul worth finding. We scheduled the Hidden Istanbul tour at a friend's recommendation and were not disappointed. Having a guide for Aya Sophia was invaluable, and Semih's knowledge of the sites we visited was impressive. He tailored our tour to our interests and time constraints as we squeezed it in just before catching our flight home. We made one stop at a spice shop in the Grand Bazaar but did not feel pressured to buy. Much appreciated. The teenagers enjoyed the tour as much as the parents. Semih did a great job.

Wonderful walking tour. We had a great tour of the Taksim area, taking in the beautiful sights an cool hang outs. Semih was a great guy with lots of interesting insights, would highly recommend the tour!

Authentic and delicious!. You can go off to a mountain village in search of an authentic experience or you can book Home Cooked Istanbul and enjoy a delicious home cooked meal with a family. Seated on cushions we enjoyed tasty lentil soup followed by stuffed eggplant with pilaf with the family including children.We were greeted like long lost friends and felt truly welcomed. Semin, our guide, translated and communicating was easy. Prior to dinner we went to a tea house, puffed on a water pipe and aged backgammon, while we waited for the call to prayer to break the fast since our visit was during Ramadan.

A great walk and talk!. We did the Hidden Istanbul walking tour with Semih as our guide. Excellent experience! His English is great and he knows his city. Started with the usual suspects such as Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque, then got special with some side trips down alleys. No uncalled for side trips to stores other than the two we requested. Starts on time , finishes on time, altogether a great experience. Ask for him by name.

Fantastic experience. Having only a couple of days to see Istanbul, we decided to take a guided tour. Our amazing guide Semih took us on a walking tour around the new Istanbul. Semih is one of the most knowledgeable tour guides I've ever had. He showed us parts of Istanbul that we would not have otherwise seen or found. Later that night we headed to a local families house. It was an wonderful experience. They did not speak English but Semih translated everything for us. They food was lovely and they were very welcoming. We were so impressed with Semih that we decided to join him the next day for a street food tour. We bought lots of delicious local foods then took us to a park to enjoy it all. I could not speak more highly of this tour or of Semih. It was an all round amazing experience.

Istanbul Urban Adventures - Guided by Semih Onerbay. What an amazing adventure! This 2-day walking tour included one day in the Old City encompassing all the major sites: the Hippodrome, Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Sulamayne Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the University of Istanbul, the Grand Bazaar, tea in a sunken garden, the Spice Market, and the Local Market. The day ended with a cultural immersion experience of dinner with a local Turkish family in a nearby suburb (with your English speaking guide to translate), and a trip to a tea house/cafe and a few games of (optional) backgammon overlooking the sea. Day 2 was spent ostensibly in the New City (around Taksim) and included a walk through Taksim Square, the beautiful Art Deco Passages, a visit to a Turkish Hammam (never to be forgotten), an optional trip to a fortune teller and museum visits.My guide was Semih Onerbay - whom I can't rate highly enough! He was very affable, easy going, adaptable and has superb English language skills. It felt more like hanging out with a friend who had indepth local knowledge rather than a stiff formal guide. As it turned out, despite booking a small group tour, it was essentially Semih and I on our own for the two days. Although all the main sites were covered, Semih was flexible in his approach and gave choices of what to do next, which beats being frogmarched around a city by a guide any day! Semih has extensive knowledge on both the history and geography of this amazing cities evolution - there wasn't a single question he couldn't answer.Highlights - The dinner with a local family, the mosaic's at Topkapi Palace, the Hammam experience and the Art Deco Passages in the New City. A really worthwhile trip and a great way to see the city if you only have a few days! Highly recommended.

Unique way to see Istanbul. This was an amazing opportunity to see a side of Istanbul I would never have otherwise been able to experience. Semih, our guide for the day was knowledgable, friendly and and kept the tour interesting at all times. I did the modern Istanbul tour through the taksim area discovering the hidden secrets of the now popular shopping district including stopping at a local coffee house for Turkish coffee with fortune telling through the coffee reading. After this we did another tour option of a home stay dinner with a local family. I could not recommend this more highly. We had dinner at a local family,s house with them and their children. While they didn't speak any English, and we had no Turkish, semih wasa fantastic intermediary. To be included in a normal family dinner here was something I will never forget plus it helps support a local family. We were so impressed the next day we joined semih again for a street food picnic, buying our food from street stalls in and around ther spice market before sitting to a lovely picnic in the park. Thank you semih so much for introducing me to Istanbul, I will definitely be back.

Istanbul In-Depth: Guide Semih Onerbay. This is a great way to experience Istanbul, and our guide Semih Onerbay was outstanding. This 2-day adventure included experiencing major sites: the Hippodrome, the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the University of Istanbul, the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Market, and the Local Market. Additionally, it included a delicious dinner with a local family (they didn't speak English, but Semih interpreted and they were very engaged and friendly including their children); a tour of the Taksim Square, Istikal Caddesi, and the Tepebasi and Beyoglu neighborhoods; a traditional "full treatment" Turkish Bath at the historic (and very clean) Galatasaray Hamami (full treatment includes sauna, wash, massage, loofah scrub, and shower); and a picnic in the park behind Topkapi Palace, preceded by a tour of the spice and local markets learning about and buying our picnic foods. Semih was highly knowledgeable and engaging. Although this adventure was packed with the above activities, it never seemed rushed. As an extra bonus, Semih took us to the Archaeology Museum, which has some amazing artifacts, including the oldest love poem ever found (written on a stone tablet over 4,000 years ago), and some parts of the Gates of Ishtar from Babylon. Ask for Semih when you sign up for this Istanbul adventure.

Tour Old & New Istanbul - wonderful authentic experience. We made the Tour Old and new Istanbul with the guide Semih. We were only two people so it was a quiet private tour and he adapted the tour on our wishes. Semih showed us palces we would never have discovered on our own and always had a story to tell. It was great to see local areas and traditions like fortune telling with a guide who is so enthusiastic explaining and discussing them. He made us feel as we were going out with a friend. Thank you very much!

Meet the locals. Our guide Sammi took us through the back streets of Istanbul like a local to a home where we enjoyed a typical evening meal with a typical Turkish family.What a great experience it was. Our party of 5 plus 3 other Aussies (young ladies) were treated to a great meal and a wonderful insight how others live. And our host family did not speak English.Thank goodness Sammi did, and very well too.Bad luck our group didn't master the water pipe smoking bit though.Sammi also made sure we caught the correct tram(very good system)back to our ship.

Wonderful Istanbul adventure; ask for guide Semih "Sam" Onerbay. I traveled to Istanbul with friends for a medical conference, then added a couple weeks of fantastic tours. I'd heard that people have been recommending Istanbul for sight seeing for about 10,000 years, but didn't really appreciate the reason until now. I do not have sufficient power over the English language to fairly describe my experience in Istanbul during the last month. The place is absolutely enchanting. Urban Adventures guide Semih Onerbay ensured that it was all the more so by learning my interests and taking me places I could not have otherwise found. Semih graciously attended to us beyond the call of duty taking extra care of us and spoiling us. He met us for an extra day without charge to lead us to historical sights we'd added to our list at the end of the trip.

Wonderful Authentic Experience. Thanks to Semih for a wonderful tour through the residential area of Istanbul. We felt privileged eating a home cooked meal in the family home of a local. Sitting on the floor and chatting with the family and Semih was a wonderful experience. Also learning to play backgammon while drinking tea and trying the Nargile was very relaxing. Highly recommend this tour.

What a great way to genuinely see a great city!. Simple desription, totally lovely and heart-warming. From the warmest of welcomes of my guide Semih to the laughs and smiles of the family we had dinner with, this has to have been the best way to experience a genuine reflection of the culture of a visited country. You want to see the REAL city-life? This is how to do it. A guide with intimate knowledge of the city, a beautiful family to share dinner(and laughs) with and throughout you can ask tons of questions feeling perfectly relaxed covering all topics. I could have drank after-dinner tea with our host family all night.Tour of The Blue Mosque, followed by meeting the family for dinner, tea, back streets, visit to Little Haghia Sophia and then on to enjoy a nargile and a lesson in backgammon overlooking The Bosphorous. What more could you ask for? Well, winning more than one backgammon game would have ended it beautifully but I wouldn't change a thing. If you're a social, interested person you just have to do it. Thanks again Semih, Sarah, Mohammed and the rest of the family!

Dinner with the locals. I can highly recommend taking this little Urban Adventure.We thoroughly enjoyed our walking tour with our guide Semih, who was very knowledgable and understanding, having four senior ladies tripping through the enchanting cobblestone streets of old Istanbul, visiting the old mosques and meeting with a local family, and enjoying their hospitality and delicious meal. This evening tour added to the thorough enjoyment of our stay in Istanbul, and was one of the highlights of our fabulous tour of Turkey. Highly recommended. Jan Gray

Urban adventures Istanbul. Wonderful tour. I saw some of the most beautiful mosques, and thoroughly enjoyed the walking tour of old and new Istanbul. My tour guide, Semih was very knowledgable and friendly and made the tour really interesting. Dinner with a local family was one of the highlights, I felt very welcome and the food was delicious. Other highlights included visits with a fortune teller and the Turkish baths. Highly recommended

Hidden Istanbul. Semih, our tour leader is a real expert on the sights and attractions of old Istanbul. I appreciated his 'hidden' tips. He really made the sights come alive. Instead of following a heard of other tourists we got an insider's view of this great city as there were only 2 of us on the tour. In a word: amazing!

Excellent Old and New Istanbul walking tour. Loved the walking tour and our guide Semih was great. My friend and I had already spent a couple of weeks in Turkey and a few days in Istanbul. Even though we had already been down the Hippodrome on a different tour, Semih did a much better job and was way more interesting. The tour took us to Taksim Square and around Istikal Ave to have our fortunes told and see some historic churches, pubs and shopping spots. Would definitely recommend a walking tour to familiarise yourself with the area, public transport and the opportunity to ask a local whatever questions you want. You can book in advance or try your luck and walk in.

The Best Way to Sightsee. We went on the Hidden Istanbul tour and it was absolutely perfect for what we wanted. Our guide, Semih, made us feel like he was a friend showing us around rather than a guide following a script, and we really felt that we saw secret bits of Istanbul that other tours miss out.The best part of the tour was that we got to Aya Sophia before any of the cruise tours, and our guide knew an old entrance that was no longer in use, so our first glimpse of the most famous attraction in the city was completely people-free. Inside he pointed our various little quirks and nooks that other people and guides were blithely walking past.We also visited a couple of lesser known, but equally beautiful mosques - one was even bluer than the Blue Mosque inside, and without the crowds. We covered all the major attractions of Sultanahmed and got to see some extras like the university and bazaars, before having a nice turkish tea in a sunken courtyard.It was refreshing to have a guide that spoke to us like human beings, not from a script, and give new light on a city that is seen by so many. If you want to see all the sights of Istanbul while avoiding the crowds as best you can then do not hesitate in booking this tour.

Our best night in Istanbul. Considering every minute we spent in Istanbul was fabulous, this is a high accolade! I booked the Home Cooked Istanbul tour on a whim. My bf wasn't too keen on the idea but afterwards, he agreed it was one of the best things we did. Our guide Semih Onerbay was friendly and knowledgeable and keen to answer any questions we had about his homeland. He taught us how to play backgammon and we are now addicted! The family that we ate with were so welcoming and we really felt at ease in their company. The food was also absolutely delicious. I would thoroughly recommend this to any traveler looking for something slightly different but memorable from their trip to Istanbul.

bad customer relations. I sprained my ankle while in Istanbul, wrote them the day before asking if I could get a refund since obviously I wasn't able to walk and do the tour. They declined, asking if I wanted to do another tour the following day, as if they hadn't read my email in which I explained I couldn't walk. The whole exchange was just bad customer relations-- it was frustrating enough that I was alone in a foreign city with a sudden injury and barely able to get around my hotel room.... It would have been an easy courtesy for them to refund me on an activity I was physically incapable of doing. Small things that go a long way in a company showing how it views its client base.

Home cooked Istanbul. Visited Istanbul end of March 2013. We did the Home Cooked Istanbul tour. Anyone visiting Istanbul really NEEDS to do this tour. It was one of, if not the best, part of our journey. Our guide Semih Onerbay (aka Sam) was excellent. He braved the cold with us and taught us a lot about Istanbul that others generally miss. He's a natural!

Home Cooked Istanbul - Great first evening in Istanbul!. I booked the tour from Canada before I left for the evening I was arriving to the country. It's a great way to meet local upon arrival. Great tour guide, the office well located, they were nice enough to wait for me as my flight was delayed. Went to a very friendly home, had a great home cooked meal, then went to Marmara Cafe for Turkish waterpipe. You can taste traditional food, it was so good! You should totally book this tour, it's a great experience. I will book it again on my next visit to Istanbul.

Thank you to a very professional guide!. During our vist to Istambul last Summer my husband and I decided to go on a guided tour of the town to better appreciate its sites. We enjoyed the tour very much, all the places we visited were very interesting and very well explained by our guide Salih Cem, who, despite his young age and the fact that he had just started working as a guide, was very accurate, professional and full of entusiasm which is something that adds value to any description. We appreciated the fact that the tour didn t just give us an idea of the places but wanted to make us understand the uses and everyday life of the people there! Hope to find Urban Adventure in one of our next trips.Mirella e Giacomo

Urban Adventures Istanbul. I like walking tours with local guides and I took 2 different tours over 2 days with this company. The guide was Salih Cam and he was so energetic and informative, and even helped me find a small Museum that wasn't in the broshure, showed me the ropes with local transportation, etc, that I'm sure that I learned much more about Istanbul and Turkey than I would have in 2 days on my own (not to mention ate better food and had more fun). You have to be a bit "intrepid" to find the office since it's up a dark stairway, but everyone I dealt with was friendly and helpful.

Home Cooked Istanbul. We are a well travelled retired couple very used to finding our own ways around new locations and tourist attractions. We also require to meet and talk to locals and hence were attracted to the 'Home cooked Istanbul' evening. It was interested to go into a local's home and join them in their meal however the choice of family was not as interesting as we had hoped - we had hoped for a more complete family with father and grandparents so that we might have learnt about their life across the generations. However the whole evening was made very enjoyable and enlightening thanks to our excellent guide - Salih Cam. Once we got to the 'popular hangout' and learnt to play backgammon then the discussions between Salih and ourselves became very interesting and we learnt a lot about modern day life in Istanbul - if only through the eyes of one observant person. Salih's only restriction was his lack of knowledge of life outside his own country - but that unfortunately is a 'perhaps inevitable' failing of guides in whatever country we have used them. We would recommend anyone to ask for Salih as a guide.

I really liked the "Old and New Istanbul"Tour!. As a first time tourist to Isanbul, I really liked the "Old and New Istanbul" tour as an activity! The places we toured were helpful to show nice parts of Istanbul. The guide was so informative and friendly. He took time to explain and answer our questions. We were impressed by professionalism of our guide Mr. Salih ÇAM from İstanbul İntrepid Urban Adventures and I will encourage my friends to use the same guide and same activity in their future trips to Istanbul!

Fabulous Experience. I recently took the Home Cooking tour. It was such a great experience to meet the local family in their home, to enjoy a meal with them, and to learn about each of our cultures. The walk of the old town was very informative, the meal was delicious (lentil soup, then chicken and rice). The visit to the tea room was fun. Drank tea, smoking the nargile (Turkish water pipe), and learned how to play backgammon. All in all, it was a great experience, all at a very good price.Thank you for sharing your culture with me.

Fascinating introduction to Istanbul. We did two of the walking tours on offer. The first was a fantastic and indepth tour of the old city, taking us through side streets we would not have walked through on our own, with thorough explanations of the history, culture and religion. Salih, the guide, was patient, good-humoured, and eager to further our knowledge and answer our questions. It was certainly well worth the money and afterwards he took us to a place for lunch that, again, we would not have gone to otherwise. Groups are small, which is great.We also did the tour of Taksim, and again got to see parts we wouldn't have wandered through without being on the tour. It was insightful and interesting, and even included having our fortune told through the reading of coffee grounds.I would thoroughly recommend the tour, and would probably even do it again when we next (she says hopefully!) go to Istanbul.

Fantastic hidden istanbul tour. Being new to Turkey my friend and I booked in for the 4hr hidden istanbul tour for our first morning. What an amazing way to start our time in Istanbul! I'll never forget the first sights of everything, made all the more amazing by the commentary of our very informative guide Salih. Fantastic seeing all the sights plus plenty of 'hidden' gems easily accessible with a small group of four. Great wandering past the massive bus loads of tourists, felt very much like we were getting the VIP treatment! Would definitely recommend doing this tour, thanks again Salih!

Great introduction to Istanbul. We went on a hidden Istanbul tour with Salih and very much enjoyed it. This tour had the perfect combination of things for us: very knowledgaeble and friendly guide, walkable route and frequent stops for contemplation and refreshment. I learned a lot about historical and modern Istanbul and Turkey. Salih was very polite and informative when I asked him how young Turkish men and women meet (the question could so easily have been misunderstood). The only difficulty we had was in finding the office in Sultanahmet; maps are helpful up to a point but it's a small doorway and a verbal guide to nearby landmarks (cafes mostly) would be gelpful.

Perfect introduction into turkish and Istanbul history, the cities layout and local life. We had a great walk around into several mosques, hippodrome and local restaurant, where it was especially interesting hearing an introduction into the romeons here, the otomans and turkish history; some basics about the muslimic believe and having the traditional turkish tea at the end in a fantastic spot. More than recommendable!

Hidden Istanbul Walking Tour. I was fortunate to have a personal tour with Salih which was great! Although I had been in Turkey for a month already I was grateful to have a guide to show me another side of the city I would probably have walked past. I was also grateful for Salih's insight in to the Turkish people which I was very interested in. He was unbiased and happy to answer my questions regarding various topics. Tours such as this make the experience of a country more memorable and Salih has the energy and passion that make him ideal for this role.

Hidden Istanbul - walking tour. I arrived in Istanbul a day before my tour was scheduled to depart. Usually I don't mind exploring cities on my own, but I decided to give the Urban Adventures day tour a try. I'm really glad I did. Salih was a terrific guide and I learned things about Istanbul that I wouldn't have learned on my own. He took us to the Taksim neighborhood, which was a part of Istanbul that I wouldn't have seen otherwise.The tour was scheduled to end at Galata Tower, but Salih and I returned to Sultanahmet on the tram together. I really enjoyed having a few extra minutes to talk to him one-on-one and to learn more about the city and its customs from him.

Hidden Istanbul tour. Four of us had booked for this tour and ended up having the guide, Salih, to ourselves. He was really friendly and had heaps of knowledge, and it was really interesting to hear about his life, and the lives of his friends, as well. My favourite part of the tour was the talk about Islam we had while visiting one of the beautiful mosques. Salih also took us at the end of the tour to a little cafeteria he recommended, going a bit out of his way to show us. I'd recommend asking him to show you too, and get the lentil soup or the spinach dish!

Half day walking tour with İstanbul İntrepid Urban Adventures. Despite being a rainy day in Istanbul when I did the half day walking tour,our guide, Salih, made a concerted effort to arrange a most memorable tour. He was very knowledgeable and provided accurate and comprehensive information about the various sites we visited. His ability to converse easily in English was really appreciated.As this was my first trip to Turkey, it served as a very nice orientation to Istanbul. One word of caution. Don't challenge Salih to a game of Backgammon. He'll whip your butt!!Vincent

"Home Cooked Istanbul". What a great evening to begin my trip in Istanbul. Started off with a short walking tour through the Hippodrome with Salih, the tour guide, who was professional, enthusiastic and very knowledgeable. We then headed to a delicious dinner with a local family who made us feel so welcome in their home, a pleasure to spend time with. Salih patiently assisted with the language barrier, and I was able to learn about family life in Istanbul. The tour ended up at a tea house, smoking the water pipe and Salih endeavouring to teach me to play a successful game of backgammon. I highly recommend the ‘Home Cooked Istanbul'.

Hidden Istanbul Walking Past and Present. For me, the tour was perfect. The guide, Salih, knew a lot about the long and unique history of the city. Even more interesting was to learn about contemporary Turkey and the special place the city has in it. I've seen and learned about some remarkable corners in Istanbul. I've stayed another week afterwards, and felt a little extra connection every time I walked past one of them.

Hidden Istanbul walking tour. This was a fantastic tour for a first-timer in Istanbul. My husband and I really enjoyed this with Salih as our guide. He gave a good overview of the history of Istanbul as well as an introduction of the main sights. This is a real walking tour where you are on your feet for a few hours although there are regular breaks. Salih was friendly and knowledgeable and very willing to answer any questions we had. I highly recommend this tour.

Istanbul Urban Adventures. Having never been to Istanbul I did all three of these tours as an intro to the city and they were a great way to get a general feel for Istanbul in a short space of time. You definitely need more time to explore your favourite parts of the tour afterwards as the tour moves quite fast to cover the many sites and places you go. Favourite parts were wandering side streets and places I probably wouldn't have gone myself and the history and explanations of our very knowledgeable and passionate tour guide Salih as we wandered around. Salih was happy to share all things Turkey, historic and current, and was a really good source of general information on Istanbul and Turkey. All time favourite of the tours were drinking Turkish coffee in the sunken garden during the day and playing back gammon, drinking apple tea and smoking (an apple flavoured) water pipe while sitting in a cafe overlooking the river at night. Thanks for a great holiday Salih and team, it felt more like walking around with a local than on a tour.

Dining out in a Turkish way. Did this tour in September. Was fantastic. Picked up at hotel and joined another 2 ladies. Taksim square was amazing. Played a game with local men and drank tea. Had several stops for food (all traditional) great taste treats. Walked around Taoism square and saw lots of activity in restaurants and bars. Feast for the eyes. Thoroughly recommend this tour

Home cooked meal and backgammon. I had a great evening with Salih as my guide. We visited a local home and a delicious meal. Who knew lentil soup could be so tasty? Then it was on to a cafe for tea and backgammon. There was also the opportunity to try a hookah pipe, but I had done that elsewhere so passed on that. The cafe was great. Only disappointment was that Salih beat me at backgammon ( but I did give him a good run for his money). Salih was great company and we had a very good discussion about Turkey and its culture and society.

Hidden Istanbul walking tour. This walking tour was great. Our guide, Salih, was really knowledgable and helpful, and certainly knows his history of Istanbul. As the group was small we were able to ask loads of questions, all of which he answered in detail.It was really useful to be accompanied by a local to the mosques, as we wouldn't have been comfortable about knowing the etiquette etc had we gone on our own.The sunken cafe is a hidden treasure that we would never have known about if we hadn't be shown, and we went back again on another day as we liked it so much.I would recommend doing this tour on your first in Istanbul, to get a feel for the place and avoid doubling up on anything as it covers some of the main tourist attractions (as well as some that you may not visit otherwise).Thank you Salid for a great tour, I would recommend it to anyone.

Old & New Istanbul. This was a great walking tour of Istanbul both old and new cities. Salih was our guide, he was full of knowledge and very approachable - keep up the good work Salih!The fortune telling was a real experience, not rushed at all, but it did take the more than an hour for the four of us to have our futures told.Very enjoyable!

Home Cooked Meal in Istanbul. Salih was a great guide. He was very friendly and knowledgeable. At first we stopped at the Hippodrome, and he covered the history behind the obelisks and the German fountain, which were along the way to the family's home. The food was delicious and the hosts were very hospitable. Although there was a language barrier, Salih translated practically everything. After the dinner, we went to a small cafe where Salih taught me to play backgammon over a Turkish version of lemonade/soda. Overall, a very nice evening and a great way of getting to know some locals and learning of current life in Turkey.

An intimate introduction to an intriguing city. We could not have had a more inviting and personal introduction to a city which, at first glance, is somewhat intimidating. Salih was the perfect host and guide to help us engage with the markets, the mosques, the vendors and the people of Istanbul. His love of his culture, his knowledge of the history of Turkey, and his appreciation for the diversity of the city made this tour personal and fascinating. Salih was generous with his time, answered our many questions and invited us to join him over his lunch at a local spot we would never have discovered on our own. His time with us greatly enhanced our appreciation of the sights, sounds and tastes of Istanbul. Thank you Salih for your generous spirit.

Hidden Istanbul. Would recommend this as a great introduction to Istanbul - great value for money and a great guide in Salih. We were very grateful that Salih and the other four people on the tour waited patiently for us when we were 20 mins late arriving, due to having set off walking to the meeting point in completely the wrong direction! The tour ended up being nearly 5 hours long and covered a huge range of the old city from some of the main sights such as Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar to more hidden areas like the Book Bazaar and some winding back streets leading to a local mosque. We stopped for Turkish tea in a sunken courtyard cafe, ate Turkish delight at the Spice bazaar and had a simit from a street seller. At the end of the tour Salih even invited us to have lunch with him at a local cafe. As well as being a great introduction to the city we also learnt lots about Turkish culture and society and about Islam from Salih who was friendly and chatty and happy to answer any of our questions. Would definitely recommend the Hidden Istanbul tour and Salih himself.

Home Cooked Istanbul. We had a great evening on the "Home Cooked Istanbul" Urban Adventure with Salih. It was a great way to get the history of Istanbul without having to spend hours on a walking tour. The evening meal with the local family was delicious and even though there was a language barrier, Salih assisted and were we able to learn all about life for a familiy in Istanbul.The tour ended up at a tea house and Salih teaching us the finer points of backgammon. Thanks for a great tour, Salih.

Fantastic insight into Istanbul. Our tour began with a brief intro to the main attractions in the Sultanahmet area. Salih was our tour guide and his love for his country was absolutely contagious - he had great info and was very fun to spend time with. Then we headed to a tea house for nagileh and backgammon before dinner at a local family's home. The food was delicious and the conversation was even better. Salih translated between our small group and the family and we had a wonderful time and learned a lot. It was a truly memorable insight into life in Istanbul and one of my favorite things that we did. Totally recommend this tour!

Home Cooked Istanbul - terrific tour!. Our last stop of our trip away was a short stay in Istanbul. We decided to do the "Home Cooked Istanbul" evening tour with Intrepid, and it was a great tour - thanks to Salih! Started off with a short walking tour through the Hippodrome, and then headed to dinner with a local family. It was a great chance to talk to them and find out what life was like living in Istanbul - and also playing catch with their little daughter! After a yummy dinner, headed out to a local cafe to smoke some water pipe, and play backgammon. Also, thanks for beating me 3 times in a row Salih :) Would highly recommend this tour!

Discover historical, cultural and non-touristic stuff in Istanbul. The tour is interesting. I've learnt many things about Turkey's history & culture thanks to Salih's explanations (he's a nice guy btw, he takes his time). Also, u've got to discover some new ways to walk around Istanbul (no need to take the tram anymore!) and see & eat in local non-touristic restaurants.

Great introduction to historic Istanbul!. My friends and I went on the "Hidden Istanbul" tour our first day in the city and it was a great way to get oriented with the major sites. Salih is a very personable and knowledgeable guide. My one critique is that I felt we spent a lot of time in the Hippodrome but were a bit rushed at the end of the tour when we went through the Spice Bazaar. Otherwise, I had a wonderful time!

Home Cooked Istanbul. Wow what a fantastic late afternoon/evening tour! Our guide Salih was excellent, highlighting interesting facts on Istanbul as we walked our way to our final dinner destination. This was a genuine Turkish experience, with a local family. We were made to feel so welcome and the food was delicious. Smoking the water pipe and playing backgammon in a local cafe overlooking the sea memorable. Well run company and thank you for not having minimum numbers, the office can be a little difficult to find, but the locals were very helpful. It was a great night for the two of us and a wonderful introduction to Istanbul!

Great way to experience the culture of Istanbul.. Urban adventures is a excellent way to get insight into the history and culture of Istanbul. I went the Home Cooked and Istanbul Old and New tours with Salih as my guide for both. He was very friendly, enthusiastic and informative about the places we visited. We had a lovely meal with a Turkish family in the Home Cooked tour.The family was friendly but a bit shy when it came to conversation. Salih however encouraged us to ask questions about themselves and translated for us so we managed ot make some conversation. The real highlight of this tour was going to a cafe to drink tea, smoke narghile and learn how to play Backgamon. The Istanbul Old and New tour took us around Taksim where we visited several churches, learned about the the Turkish football team Galatasaray, and had our fortune read from our coffee cups. Thank you Salih for these wonderful experiences!

to be recommended!. I booked the "Hidden Istanbul"-Tour and was very satisfied. We were only two people that had booked this tour and the guided walk as well as the visits in mosques or at the bazar together with the guide, Salih, were all very enjoyable and informative. I was glad that the office does not set a limit of people booking the tour. Having a guided tour in such a small group definitely is an unforgettabe experience (and I did not envy any members of the many large groups we met on our way... ;-)) and I can only recommend it to people travelling on their own or in couple/small groups. The guide was very friendly and attentive and seamed to be very competent as well as committed to his job. There was plenty of information on history as well as on living in Istanbul today. And there was enough room and opportunity for our questions. I was also very glad that we started early, 08:30, because that allowed for some really special uncrowded moments even at the big sights. Some parts of the walk actully were less "hidden" than others, as other commentators have remarked, - but then I had studied the offer of the tour beforehand and decided that this was what I wanted to see. So no problem here!Thank you, Salih, for a great time and for a well chosen mix of prominent sights and special places! Whenever I will be visiting Istanbul again I will gladly book one of the other guided tours that are offered.

Really Great Experience - Salih Was GREAT!. Had a special day exploring Istanbul with Salih. He was very patient with our numerous questions and was warm and kind throughout. He clearly wanted to give us the best experience possible. We really had a fantastic day with him. HIGHLY recommended!

Sultanahmet, Dinner, and Backgammon. Oh my!. I did the Home Cooked Istanbul tour with a wonderfully charming guide, Salih. We walked through Sultanahmet square where he gave me some interesting lessons on Turkey's history and had dinner with a local family who were fairly reserved but so accommodating. It was such a humbling experience to feel so welcome in their home. Over a delicious dinner of rice, soup, chicken, and vegetables, I learned more about Turkey in such a short amount of time than I learned about my own homeland in 23 years. Afterwards, we went to a tea cafe for hookah (nargile) and I learned how to play backgammon. Quite possibly one of the best evenings during my stay in Istanbul.The best way to get to know a place is through its people, and this tour is a great inside look into the life of locals. I highly recommend it, and a huge thank you to Salih for a great evening!

Home Cooked Istanbul - A Real Turkish Experience. At first we were nervous going to a Turkish family's home. Were they going to like us? What if we said something wrong? However, those thoughts were immediately put to rest after meeting our guide Salih. Salih is a young energetic tour guide from Turkey who is very knowledgeable and passionate about Istanbul. The tour started by getting a quick history of Istanbul and learning some unique facts, which were much more interesting than the "on your right you can see..." tours. After that we strolled through the more residential area of Sultanahmet while kids played in the street and the neighborly families congregated together to talk about the day. After several confusing turns, which is very common in Istanbul, we came to an apartment building where we were to meet the Turkish family for dinner. We made the climb up a couple floors and arrived at their apartment. We were immediately met with smiles and laughter from the Turkish family. The wife, her two kids, and her sister were there for dinner, her husband, unfortunately, was at work. We had to talk through Salih to the family whom spoke no English, but this proved to be quite amusing at times because English, obviously, was not Salih's first language. We sat on the floor to eat dinner which is traditional in Turkey and talked and laughed our way through each course. We were very happy to get along with the Turkish family and did our best to banish the media's portrayal of American's.After we finished dinner and our fun conversations, we left their home and made our way to a nargile cafe. The cafe was called The Marmara Cafe and was located very well in Sultanahmet in relation to the Marmara Sea. The cafe was decorated in the Ottoman empire style, which is common throughout Sultanahmet, and large oriental rugs draped from the walls and ceilings. However, the best attraction was the back porch, which gave one of the best views of the Marmara Sea in Istanbul. Salih got us a table, order us some tea, a nargile pipe (hookah), and backgammon. For the rest of the night we laughed and drank tea and smoked flavored nargile and learned backgammon until were were deemed novices. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone. If you only have time to do one thing in Istanbul, do this tour! Its the best way to get acclimated with the city and get immersed into the culture.

Favorite day in Istanbul!. Salih was our tour guide and he was so great! We learned more from him than we learned on all the other tours we took combined! We also had a great time playing backgammon and smoking hooks at a local tea shop. It was really relaxing to take time out to learn about a local pastime and have fun playing. When we had dinner with the family, we felt like got a really authentic experience and I'm not sure our trip would have been complete with out it. I highly recommend this tour and tour guide. It's a really intimate experience where you learn so much and get todo things you would never have the opportunity to do on your own.

Hidden Istanbul. Our guide Salih was excellent, and fortunately for us we were the only ones on the trip that day. We were given a great insight into Istanbul and his knowledge and humour made for a great day. Salih took time out to answer all our questions as well as to ask us some about his curiosities regarding Australia. We would definitely recommend the tour to anyone visiting Istanbul to help get an idea of the history of this wonderful city.Dean and Karen - Australia

Great Time & Lovely experience. Istanbul Urban Adventures was so much fun :)We first met with Salih our tour guide who was very knowledgeable and fun, we walked around SultanAhmet and got some quick info about Hypodrome, then we went to have dinner with a local family, food was soooo yummy :)After that we went we a local Turkish Cafe , tried falvored nargile, which was SO good, played Backgammon and chatted about Turkey. If you are lucky, you might listen to Fasil music around as well :))I had a wonderful day and great new friends. Overall I'm totally satisfied and highly recommend it. Thanks Salih :)

One-on-one guide to the city. My partner and I went on the Hidden Istanbul trip - a 4 hour guided tour of the city. Salih was a great guide - warm, friendly and informative. We did this tour on our first day and it was a great way to get to grips with the city and see a lot of the main sights in one morning, leaving us more time to wander and relax.Downsides:The start time of 8.30 was quite early for us seeing as our hotel was in Beyoglu, so it took quite a while to find the office and everything. Luckily Salih had waited for us!I wouldn't really call this tour 'hidden' - you see the major sights and maybe a mosque you might not otherwise visit, but you don't really get an 'insider's perspective' on the city.

Great personalised tour experience. While in Istanbul, my husband and I did the home cooked Istanbul tour with Salih. He was able to reorganise the tour to fit in with a Ramadan schedule. The tour included historical sights, water pipe, backgammon lessons, and dinner in a Kurdish family's house. What we enjoyed most was the mix of historical information mixed with a modern perspective about life in Turkey. We enjoyed it so much we booked in for the Hidden Istanbul tour the next day, also with Salih. That was also a fascinating tour of the markets and mosques of the area, after which we got a bonus introduction to a perfect lunch spot.

Hidden Istanbul Tour. A fantastic walking tour with an amazing guide. The tour took us through places we would have never found ourselves and enabled us to see Istanbul from another perspective. The guide provided great insights along the way and with only two of us on the tour- it was very personal! THIS TOUR IS A MUST! We were laughing at the big tour groups - We had a guide to the two of us!!

Fun and educational tour of Istanbul. We participated in the Hidden Istanbul tour on the 6th of July and had a great experience. There were only four people in our tour and the guide, Caglar Gokgun, was excellent. Not only did he have expertise regarding Istanbul history, he was personable and a keen story teller who seemed to truly enjoy his job. the tour was $30 USD and lasted 4+ hours seeing several of the significant sites in the Old City.Additionally, he had fantastic recommendations regarding other sites to see in the city, restaurants, and advice for our other stops in Turkey.We would highly recommend Urban Adventures Istanbul, which also seems to be referred to as peakadventuretravel.com and Intrepid.

Walking tour of Istanbul's hidden highlights. We had a small group for this tour and our tour guide, Kiymet Aktaskiymet, was fantastic providing a brilliant insight into the history of the old quarter of Istanbul and more importantly for me, an insight into the culture of contemporary Istanbul. This tour was really personal due to the small numbers and a lot of fun. I strongly recommend!!!

Old & New Istanbul Tour. My partner and I did this tour in February. There were no other tourists in our group. This tour is great because there is lots of flexibility and our tour guide had extensive knowledge of the area.The tour guide was also very helpful by giving us suggestions of how to make the most of out remaining time in Istanbul. We probably would have never thought to go to Taksim without this tour, it is a really great modern part of Istanbul and is definitely worth stopping by.

Getting to know Istanbul. We visited Istanbul with 13 high school students and were most impressed with the passion shown for her city by our guide. She made the history of Istanbul come alive. In a separate tour by the same company, we went to a local home for dinner. Being 16 in total, this was no mean feat, but we absolutely loved it. And for one of our group, whose 16th birthday it was, it was amazing to see this cake brought out complete with sparklers flashing. The experience was well worth it.

Great time at family dinner and Nargile with Tolga!. We had dinner with a family in Istanbul, set up by Urban Adventures, and guided by Tolga. We had a wonderful evening. There were 4 of us in our group, We met at the tour office, convenient location, right in the heart of Sultanahmet, and had a little walking tour before the dinner (didn't realize we'd have this part, so it was a bonus.) Our guide, Tolga, was not only very knowledgeable, he was also so personable and a genuinely nice person, We had dinner with a local family. The food was delicious and we got to play with their adorable little girl. After dinner, we left the family and went with Tolga to a Nargile lounge, Smoked hookah for the first time and had a great time. Would definitely recommend this company and definitely loved Tolga! Thank you for the fun evening,

Old & New Istanbul. We had a walking tour with a decent guy through "old & new" Istanbul. The tour started on time, the fortune teller was fun, the coffee house a little bit worn down but authentic.The fact that our guide was more concentrated writing SMS messages during the entire tour than explaining anything beyond the obvious was increasingly annoying. So we ended with a feeling that the tour consisted of a 3 hour walk down the main shopping mile with a little bit info beyond.

A great way to fell the real atmosphere of Istanbul. On our guide we read about the tourist agency "Urban Adventures Intrepid"In Istanbul. It was mentioned for the organization of informal tour by foot or by pubblic transports. We were courios about one of their proposal: having a dinner in a private house of a curdish family.The day we decided, we met our "intrepid" guide, Salih, in front of the agency. Before the dinner he brought us walking around the city. The family who entertained us was very kind. Very good food, a very amazing time. After the supper Salih taken us in a "pub" and we spent there time drinking, having a pleasant conversation and smooking narghilè! Vote....10!!! We enjoied very much and it had been the best way to finish our holiday!!!Valerio e Margherita

Great time, LOVED our first day in Turkey. Akin Karakas was an absolutely amazing tour guide. My husband and I had the greatest experience seeing things we would have never found on our own plus the little stories and personal experiences he had to share made it even that much more interesting. If we get to return to Istanbul (the fortune teller lady said we would) then I would most defientely want to book another tour with them.Kate Drummond was the lady helping set us up. When we arrived at the office (a bit early) she sat and visited with us and told us even more interesting tid bits about daily life in Turkey. Even after the tour when looking for places for dinner she was extremely helpful in answering questions. I would love to spend an afternoon drinking tea with her, she was incredibly interesting.

Great for interacting with locals, avoid if you're looking for a tour with solid historical comments. One thing I need to aknowledge first of all is their great customer service: we forgot to confirm 24 hours ago as required on our voucher and they were very accomodating and offered to reschedule our tour for the next day.Now about our tour: the "home-cooked Istanbul" tour. There were two parts to our Urban Adventure experience: first a guided tour of a few monuments in Istanbul (Hippodrom, Little Aya Sofia), then a home-cooked dinner with an Istanbul family and our guide as a translator, followed by a drink at a water pipe café.The second part was by far the most interesting as it offered a good way of entering a typical and average Istanbul family home as well as sharing a meal and interacting with them.However we were very disappointed by the first part as we found out our guide didn't have a great command of historical facts (we found later through several of ours readings that a few of the historical information he gave us while commenting the monuments or answering our questions were wrong).As a takeaway, I'd say Urban Adventure is great for people who are looking for a way to interact with locals and chat with a local guide, but I wouldn't recommend it for people interested in historical facts and knowledge.

I will NEVER FORGET this walk!. Dear All readers, please consider this a MUST! We are 4 adults min 22 max 58 years and we all gave vote 10+ ! We had the honour to spend 4 hours (even more) with a gread person called Caglar. He shared with us special knowledge, and appreciated it very much. We will never forget what we saw and what we learnt, culture and fun walked with the five of us! I really do recommend this Tour, it really is worth it! These are one of those things that you would love to do again. Ciao To Everybody Elisabetta

Best Experience as a tourist to date!. If you like EXPERIENCES rather than hopping around looking at THINGS, book this trip. The hospitality, the conversation, the tastes will melt your heart and mark you long after your paths take you away from this spiritual place.

excellent. Loved the Urban adventure. Caglar was so knowledgeable on all things Istanbul. Taking the tram, walking through the streets, just going with the flow. Had a blast, I would definitely recommend this to my friends!

"Home Cooked Istanbul" was a real.... "Home Cooked Istanbul" was a real highlight of our trip. Every guidebook, podcast and article I had read before the trip lectured on the importance of meeting the locals whilst in Istanbul but often it isn't that easy. This tour provided an easy way to have a really unique experience which you couldn't possibly arrange any other way if you were only in the city for a few days. We were welcomed into a Kurdish Turkish families home for an evening meal and tea with our excellant guide acting as an intermediary translating our questions and comments allowing a real conversation to happen. It was a really relaxed and friendly evening and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Istanbul that wants to stray a little bit off the tourist track.

Hidden Istanbul ....Magical Istanbul.... What a tour, what a city! I can say that i really fell in love with this city, with it's beauty and with it's being so chaotic at the same time, with the heartiness and the kindness of the people... Istanbul where you can find life in every corner and even in the greatest trouble you can find calmness and peace... Our tour leader SALIH made it perfect, he did a wonderful job! We were all amazed about his knowledge. Thanks again for letting us know more about life & history and for getting in touch with it's culture ,what i haven't experienced liked that yet! We saw in this short time a lot that we'll never forget and it made our trip unforgettable... Tesekkür ederim Salih!

Never had such a bad guided tour in my life!!!. We made the “Old and New Istanbul”- Trip with Urban Adventures, and were completely disappointed!! Don’t waste your time and money with this tour!But let’s start at the beginning: The booking and E-mail conversation before the trip was very good and prompt. Our group on Saturday afternoon was just 3 people and the guide. So far so good, but then came our guide….She, I forgot her name, was completely unmotivated!!! First sentence e was that she is quite tired as she just came back from her morning tour. She just walked with us through the city and spoke a little bit while walking, which was also with only 3 people around her impossible to hear. The only informative stop of more than 3 minutes was at Galatasaray Square.Just one example from our tour: We were just walking down a street in Taksim, she showed us that there was a catholic church in an inner courtyard. We asked if it is worth a visit from inside. Here answer was: “If you want just go in. I was there already several times!” EH?!? At the end we felt that we would have seen much more, if we would have explored Taksim by our own. Really, never in my life I had such a bad guided tour!!!
Fantastic experience. Urban adventures offered an authentic and unique way of experiencing Istanbul. Personalised service and excellent guide made for a truly memorable day.

Rasim is a great guide!!!. Rasim took us through the Hagia Sophia and so glad we took him up on his offer! We buzzed to the front of the line which is always a plus. His knowledge of not only the site but relative history was something we couldn't have gotten from a map. Really enjoyed the extra tid-bits of the history and architecture. Highly recommended.

Awesome!. We met Rasim outside the Blue Mosque and were initially hesitant as we had been approached by many other operators. He was down to earth and we could immediately see that he wasn't there to take us for a ride! The price was reasonable and fair for the 5 hours we spent with him and it is most definitely worthwhile having a guide versus doing it yourself, especially if you have limited time. Best of all we got to jump the long queues, that in itself was worth gold! Thanks Rasim! Shaun and Shane from South Africa

ThopKapi palace , a must visit place. Yes if you plan to visit Tutkey and Istanbul is a must visit city. Lot of historical places , beautiful people, delicious food, Turkish blue beaches and great shopping places. Guide services are very good and helpful if you plan to visit historical places as you get the maximum information which is otherwise very difficult to get.
Istanbul tour. Enjoyed and learn a lot from Rasim (our tour guide)..it was done without rush and at our speed, friendly with good English...thank you
Very informative. The tour was fantastic and the information delivered was really useful. I recommend ISG. The tour was not too long and not short as well.

Sultaneh. Touristic perfect, after spending along day in sultan Ahmet area we felt very near. The guide Rasim was perfect.he is very good in English and full of information.... he clearified everything we asked. and it was acceptable price not expensive.
Insightful , intelligent. My husband and I met Rasim at Hagia Sophia entrance and were happy to have used him as a guide of this fantastic building. He was patient, knowledgable and friendly.

What a difference Rasim made to my visit!. I wanted a guide to show me Hagia Sophia and Rasim was perfect from the moment I met him.Professional, funny, smart, and reasonably priced.We walked all over the mosque for about an hour. I got to see it all and I learned so much. Rasim showed me details that I would have missed and told me stories I never would have heard had I not met him. If I had visited alone, I would have missed so much. Having Rasim by my side to show me around was loads more fun. I was very curious about everything and he was not only patient with my many questions, but knew the answers to all of them. He's incredibly knowledgeable and made all the difference in the world for my visit.If I'm ever lucky enough to visit Istanbul again, I'll be sure to reach out to him.

Short guide in Sultanahmet. We received a short guide tour from Mr Rasim with a reasonable price(since we're short of money) inside the Hagia Sophia. He was good enough to offer us his service and help us to skipped all the long queue. Even the guide was short, we manage to walk is thru the whole history and the routes inside hagia sophia. And he is also a funny guy.Overall it was a great exercise and thank you!

Very bright intelligent. Loved to talk,because that is what you want to hear from a guide Absolutely fantastic guide, had a very good time with him. he pointed out things other people guides didn't even know some were even interested in joining our private tour and leaving thier guides ;) wonderful time Well worth it
TOUR OF HAGIA SOFIA. Rasim was a very pleasant and informative guide for our visit to the Hagia Sofia. A great way to see this attraction and also enabled us to jump the queue.

Rasim Terzi is your Guide for Istanbul. When getting quotes from Istanbul professional guides, Rasim Terzi was the only reply quoting the legal tariff for a day-tour of Istanbul.
