Küçükayasofya ıs a truly beautıful churchç unıque example of Canstantınople relıgıous archıtectureö recently restoredç Around ıt ıs a tradıtıonal Ottoman era medresse devoted to tradıtıonal Turkısh artforms, ebru, calligraphy, textiles, painting, music, as well as demonstrations of traditional Sema, the turning ceremony begun by Rumi, the famous poet. the church demonstrates the importance of the congregational inclusion centered on worship, the main purpose of the Orthodox Christian dome, creating a common space under a common sky like roof or dome. the space becomes more horizontal than vertical. the floor plan based on a four armed cross with the dome creating the central common area. the structure creates a 'floating' illusion, emphasized by the horizontality of the windows. there is a lightness and airiness very different from Rome's Pantheon but a real sense of inclusion and unity unlike the Partenon or Egyptian temples based on a holy of holies. Greek Othodox churches of this period are a kind of holy space as a whole. wholeness as apposed to apartness.

Cute and worth exploring. One of my favorite spots in Istanbul. Never crowded, interesting history - thought to be a prototype for the Aya Sofya. In the medrassa area there are now little shops selling crafts and usually with the tradesmen in the shops. Opposite there is a calligraphy bazaar. It is all on a small scale so a nice change from huge monuments and crowds.

Good if you have extra time. As there are no good views to take photo, keep it for the extra days. there is a great painting art shop there, i bought a painting of istanbul from there. it is unique, however very little discount i got.
Small but good. This mosque is not as busy as the Blue Mosque and is much smaller; it has a small market of artisans around it to buy personalized Turkish art.

A hidden gem in Sultanahmet. I stayed right near this old converted church -- it is very beautiful and peaceful, and a local crafts group is located in an adjacent lot. It really DOES look like a minature Hagia Sophia from the outside!

History erased?. Average because of a renovation that has almost wiped out all the signs of its history. Inside it looks almost brand new, not 1500 years old. This building is in fact older than Hagia Sophia. It made me slightly sad, the sterile way they have worked on the interior, no matter how beautiful the interior is though. It just clashes with all that history.It is a peaceful place though, I was all alone when I visited and afterwards I enjoyed sitting on the benches outside, watching kids playing football. There are also some beatiful Ottoman grave stones around the building.

Our closest site. This former church, the "Little Hagia Sofia", was very close to our hotel (The Amira, excellent) and is distinguished by its lovely red and green marble columns and remains of Greek-script relief work. The surrounding areas and little park are currently undergoing extensive restoration work. By the time you get there this may all be perfect. A gem: also make sure to see the Sokullu Mosque nearby ... fantastic!
Little Agia Sofia. Also nearly 1500 years old, beautiful, uncrowded. Downhill by the Marmara Sea.

Historical significance aside, there is not much to see. Weary from two weeks of traveling Greece and Turkey, we came here as one of our very last stops on holiday. As such, you can't blame us for feeling a bit underwhelmed. Constructed in the era of Justinian and nicknamed "the little Hagia Sofia", it's a pretty little church-turned-mosque for sure. I understand that it's quite old and has survived many centuries, but it's not a major highlight. Thus, it could be easily missed.

Very beautiful and peaceful place. Pretty close to Blue Mosque (just go through Arasta bazar and you will see it, about 10 minutes walk down street). Great place to go to when you want time for yourself, far from usual noise and crowd of Sultanahmet.

Oasis of peace in the heart of Istanbul. This beautiful little mosque was originally a Byzantine church built in the 6th Century. It is one of the most beautiful buildings you will see in Istanbul. It has a little courtyard attached to it which has small workshops (handmade jewellry) and second hand stalls that are little gems - and not at all tourist traps.

A little quiet gem. I fell upon the former Church of the SS Serguis and Bacchus while I was wandering around Istanbul. The former church was dedicated to two Roman soldiers martyred for their faith. The Camii dates from 536. I walked inside and found this place to be a peaceful respite from the outside world. I was all alone and climbed up the very steep stairs to the balcony to get a better view of the interior. There I could see the lovely red and green marble columns. An intricate frieze which is over 1400 years carved in Greek mentions The founders of the church. Outside the mosque is a small cemetery and various shops of artisans where you can buy small articles. There is also a place to stop for tea underneath the trees.A little different than the Blue Mosque, but special in its own way.
Peaceful. A peaceful and silent place. Love to go there. Hope to be there more
Worth the descent. Just 10 minutes down of the Blue Mosque you can find this jewel, not far from another must: the Sokollu Mehmet Pasha Mosque. Take a look on the graveyards around.

Down the Hill But Worth it. Down behind Ayasofia and Sultanahmet,the little precursor of Justinian's church sits beside an old courtyard of shops. Not many tourists or anybody else between you and the great reach of time and events since this dome was raised. Beneath the buildings all around you the ruins of Byzantium's vast palace are buried.
another added bonus. this is a beautiful location with a frieze comemorating Justinian

lovely littile place. hidden in a little corner,actually a walking distance from Blue mosque,probably not more then 10 minutes walk.I like the pillars inside this mosque and the tile work obviously.Nice little cafe outside too to sit and relax.

Small and poorly decorated. We had a hard time finding the place. It is of a significant importance as a historical building but not much to see from an artistic point of view. If you are around, look for it, but don't worry if you miss it...

I loved it. mybe because it was a rainy day and it seemed a place far from the touristic sites (... even if it's just in the old town...). Quiet and spiritual, few people ... I loved it but maybe it doesn't match feeling of common tourists.

Genuine atmosphere away from the crowds. Not as known as Ayasofya, this one is more mystique. What I liked most was the cemetary at the back, with the traditionad tombs (fesi topped for men - flower topped for women).
try to find it. it is difficult to find any place in this district but you should try. interesting architecture, more interesting story.

Mini Aya Sophia. A very old church converted to a mosque, has been very well taken care of and maintained. The structure and interior gives a little glance of the advancement the early civilisations had. Nicely built and well preserved.

Small Gem. A wonderful small gem of byzantine architecture!
Don't miss the galleries!
(Beware of the local guides, they appear just helpful, but always want money).
Little Hagia Sophia. Imagine a smaller, but better preserved Hagia Sophia. Free entrance, nice courtyard with cay bahcesi( you can drink cay, or kahve and try nargileh).
Not as famous as most. Unexpectedly welcoming and charming. If you happen to be in the area, it is worth a stop

Stunning and amazing from the inside. The Hagia Sophia is a must see for any visitor to Turkey. Oddly enough, the building does not look that impressive from the outside; certainly not as balanced as the Blue Mosque does. However, the inside is stunning and has great beauty and elegance from the stained glass windows to the mosaics and wall decorations. Byzantine mosaics come together with Islamic decorations, a testament to the interesting history that has unfolded in Istanbul over the centuries.
It was a admiration palac. A place Wth good mangement. I losed the pocket of my camera there and they find it and sent to my hotel.
Do not miss this place!. Fantastic tea courtyard across the mosque...and some storytelling if you're lucky

A lovely little church-mosque.. A beautiful little church, once converted into a mosque, but now a museum. One of its secrets is a small square opposite its main entrance which is surrounded by small coffee shops and other arts and crafts shops. Still though, a very tranquil place to rest for a while.
Gorgeous!. Unlike its big sister, when we visited there was almost no-one there. This is a very beautiful building, quiet and calm and worth the short walk from Sultanahmet.
There is nothing like this. No other place I have visited has such a place like this one

See it. Make the effort.. Because it's not on the main drag not many tourists make it a destination but they should. It really isn't too far down the hill from the far end of the Hippodrome. It is very well preserved - even to the original Greek lettering around the ceiling. It has the original gardens in tact. An opportunity to see a Byzantine church turned mosque which can be appreciated without a million tourists in front of you. Bring a guide book though or you will miss a lot of the details.

Worth a visit if you have a spare hour-- different vibe than Blue Mosque. Agree with other reviewers that finding this one if the fun part and worth it just for that reason alone. We enjoyed that the mosque felt a bit more special with so many fewer people around.

definitely worth visiting. Not easy to find but getting lost in the neighborhood was a great experience! I really felt like I was in the real life of Istanbul. This mosque is very beautiful, and adjacent former madrasa has some real nice shops with authentic merchandise. I bought there a small plate that is absolutely gorgeous and the ceramic teacher who made it was there and we had a chat for a few minutes. The garden is lovely and quiet, a nice place to rest for a while after all the touristy places just 5 minutes away.

Worthy of the Risk of Getting Lost. This edifice indeed was the main church before Ayasofya was built in Byzantine times and naturally, it still preserves its grandeur. After the conquest of Istanbul, it was converted into a mosque and today it still serves as a mosque. It's quite hard to find and is definitely (and unfortunately) not a main touristic destination today but it really worths the effort to find and visit. The architecture is visibly that of a church but combined with Islamic additions after the conversion to a mosque, it's quite mystical in terms of atmosphere. Don't miss this beautiful edifice once you are in Istanbul....

A gem of a discovery. This ancient church, today a mosque, has recently been restored. The layout of the old church of Sts Sergius and Bacchus is clear and if you have been to Ravenna, it seems awfully familiar. The cleaned brickwork and attractive light make it a fine destination. The lack of many visitors is a dream after the bustle of the usual tourist sights. An upper gallery from its Christian era (today for female worshippers) gives excellent views down on to the main area of the mosque. Take a tripod to capture the best pictures of the inside. The caretaker is very proud of his building and will happily talk for hours, especially if you can chat to him in Turkish.

Interesting experience. This odd little church/mosque is located in a working-class part of town, somewhat off the beaten path--bring a map or you may very well get lost, although the building itself is hard to miss. The elderly imam/caretaker doesn't speak a word of English but that didn't stop him from talking to us for a good 5 minutes anyway. The building is beautifully restored and interesting to stroll through. All in all we found it worth taking the time to find and look at. Also, the ruin of Bucoleon Palace is close by, but it too is rather hard to find.

a jewel. This little jewel is hidden away, and takes some finding, but your efforts are well rewarded.Bult by Emperor Justinian before the Aya Sofia and dedicated to Saints Sergius and Bachus, it was converted to a mosque after the conquest. Recently renovated and recarpeted, the interior is stunning in its harmony and simplicity. Unlike the Aya Sofia which is dark inside, this is flooded by natural light. The garrulous old caretaker demanded baksheesh, but his performance made it worth the cost.We were the only visitors there and enjoyed the serenity which infused this sacred space.

Mr. Istanbul - Metin Yilmaz. Let me start off by saying....if Turkey ever has a contest for the best tour guide in the country, the hands-down winner would be Mr. Istanbul himself, Metin Yilmaz! Metin was assigned as our guide by the best travel agent in Istanbul, my friend Ozden Basak owner of Turkland Travel. Metin met us with a friendly smile on his face and made our tour of Istanbul one of the most memorable experiences of my travels around the world! The immense qualifications of his trade, was surpassed only by his knowledge and love for Istanbul....and believe me it showed! He was attuned to our every need and bent over backwards to not only show us so many exotic and fascinating sites, but shared his expansive knowledge of the history of every place we visited. Metin was so joyful & fun to be around...so kind, witty and personable! Everywhere we went locals would rush to shake his hand and give him a thumbs up.....such a friendly and admired personality. Want a great pictures to take back home? Metin has a keen eye for detail and captures the best photographs of you and your experiences to share with others. If you ever have an opportunity to visit Turkey.....ask for my new friend, Metin Yilmaz to be your guide. You won't be disappointed!!! Highly recommended!!!!

Ephesus and Kusadasi . Our group of nine adults had a fabulous day with Odzen as our tour guide around the Ancient City of Ephesus. Odzen was very knowledgeable, engaging and accommodating of the groups needs. Enjoyed his storytelling bringing the history alive. We loved the authentic lunch off the tourist track, the food and setting was enchanting. We liked the flexibility of the day's programme. The transport was top rate, air con, spacious and the driver was awesome too. All in all a great day, one of our more memorable ones on tour, would certainly recommend Ozden and Weka tours. We will use them again.

small group tour Ephesus + lunch + turkish carpets. Amazing day with Ozden. We (a group of nine friends from New Zealand, travelling on a Mediterranean cruise) had just one day in Turkey. Ozden met us in Kusadasi port and took us to Ephesus, House of the Virgin Mary and Basilica of St John, also to a local authentic Turkish restaurant and from there to a Turkish carpet manufacturer. Ozden was a delightful, knowledgable, informative and humorous guide. He provided interesting and relevant information at each location, not too little, not too much, well tailored to our group. We would love to come back and do a longer tour with Ozden in the future.

Istanbul Walking Tour. Esin met me at my hotel at 9am for the walking tour of Old Istanbul. This included Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hippodrome as well as pointing out other aspects of the history of Istanbul.What a wonderful experience. I was totally enthralled with everything . Esin's commentary and knowledge was excellent and her love of this city with its remarkable history was obvious.

Very professional and amenable. We had a wonderful trip in Istanbul, because our tour guide, Mr Ozden. He is a professional, friendly, and helpful man, also guide us to valuable shop to buy Lokum (Turkish Delight)...有责任感及专业的导游真的很重要，尤其在一个陌生的国度。我不能说土耳其很危险，不过城市难免有骗子，专门欺骗游客，若不是之前做功课提防，要不然就是让导游帮你 解决难题。他还带我们前往买好吃，价钱适中的土耳其软糖；之后自己前往其他地方试吃，味道真是差了十万八千里。

Beautiful Istanbul. I visited Istanbul last 3 days of July with a group of journalist from Bosnia. The reason of our visit was Istanbul Shopping Fest, actually closing ceremony. Visiting Istanbul during the Shopping Festival (from July 1st to July 31) is a good choise - you can enyoing the shopping as well as the city :). Istanbul is amazing, there is beauty everywhere, and the tasty food in every corner. Of course, a period of 3 days isn't long enough for such big and beautiful city, but our tour guide Ozden really tried to show us as much he could: we visited Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, Istiklal Street, Galata etc. We also had an amazing Bosphorus Cruise Tour, and visited Asian side of the city. Of course, we visited several shopping malls, as Kanyon or Istinya. Shortly, everything is great in Istanbul!

Old City. Our guide, Metin, was fantastic. His knowledge was exceptional and with a great personality and sense of humour, my wife and I had a great 8+ hours. I highly recommend the company but specifically Metin if he is available.

Perfect day. Our tour guide Murat was excellent ! Murat has over 20 years experience as a tour guide therefore he was extremely knowledgable and personable. My sons and I really enjoyed the tone and pace of his stories- added so much more to the tour. It was a packed itinerary however each site was timed perfectly with plenty of time for private viewing and taking photos. It was my second day in Istanbul and feel the tour really helped me familiarise myself with this beautiful city and culture. Murat even took the time out to suggest restaurants to eat at and helped me with getting a card for the tram system. When travelling to Istanbul I was a little apprehensive considering the Syria situation however it is a very safe city and such a great shame that tourist are hesitating to travel here. My advice to anyone considering visiting Istanbul is to book it- you won't regret coming here! Do not be put off by the bad media press and ' scare mongering' - it's more safer then London ( and people are more friendlier :) ) .. Thank you Turkland Tours and Murat for providing an excellent service .

Excellent guiding and support in Turkey. We spent a month on a private tour of Turkey which we could not fault. Two wonderful weeks in Istanbul including a long day trip to the Gobekli Tepe site with an excellent guide Yavus. If you are considering a trip to Turkey these are the guy's.

Brilliant introduction to this amazing city. Our guide Yavuz was brilliant and added so much to our experience of the major sites. I was in awe of his depth of knowledge and really enjoyed the tone and pace of his stories. It was our first day in the city and he really helped us understand Istanbul's hugely long and complex history. I know he was worried that he was giving us too much information but he wasn't - he balanced it just right and everything was so interesting. The tour programme was very busy with a lot to fit in but Yavuz also managed this really well so we managed to visit all the sites and didn't feel rushed at any of them. I was nervous that it was a lot to do in a day but am really glad I took the agency's advice as it worked out really well. It was so helpful to have a guide at each of the major sites and meant we found out so much more than would have been possible from the information onsite. We were completely exhausted at the end though!He was also really helpful in helping us plan our week. Other sites we should do and how to do them. Particularly his advice on which hamam and Bosphorus cruise to use and getting us set up with a public transport payment card was really helpful so we could make the most of our time in Istanbul. His customer service was great throughout the tour.

Rich and Rewarding!. We had a day tour with Turkland Tours that was unforgettable! Despite, the cold, rain, sleet and occasional snow flurry, we were able to see the areas of old Istanbul's Christian quarter that we longed to see. Without the help of our guide and driver this would have been impossible to do in one day. The Galata tower and Chora Church were an absolute highlight, but simply walking through this district with our guide's extensive knowledge, commentary and enthusiasm, allowed us to make the most of our time in very enjoyable and fulfilling fashion. I highly recommend Turkland Tours for squeezing the essence out of your precious travel time. Definitely come equipped with comfortable walking shoes, camera and coat or umbrella in the colder months. Many thanks to our wonderful guide Evren and our driver for the day.

Ugur, a great guide. . A fantastic day tour of the Old Town of Istanbul. Our tour guide Ugur was extremely knowledgable, personable and timed each venue perfectly, with plenty of time for private viewing & photographs.

Interesting and flavour-full. We had a wonderful day on our Turkland Travel Culinary Tour. Not quite sure what to do on our last day in Istanbul, our independent guide Ugur suggested Turkland Travel's Culinary Tour. We are adventurous eaters but had read mixed reviews of culinary tours in many places. Nonetheless, we decided to give it a go. So glad that we did!Very ably led by Neslihan, we thoroughly enjoyed tasting many different foods from soups through to sweets, from breakfast through to main course. We also enjoyed hearing how foods are prepared, where they come from and Turkish dining customs. The program was excellent with sightseeing, walking through streets not normally on the tourist trail as well as the tasting. Enough exercise to make a little space for the next culinary treat. The time flew.Thanks to Ugur and Ibrahim for organising this for us at the last moment and special thanks to Neslihan for a most memorable day.Ray & Alanah

amazing history tour of Istanbul. We had an amazing experience on two guides two era private tour. Firstly Ibrahim was very responsive and it was extremely easy to set up the tour. Ibrahim also replied to all our questions promptly before we arrived at Istanbul. The tour itself is extremely detailed covering both roman and ottoman influence on this city. A lot of information is given but in an easily comprehensible form and in a way we can visualize mentally. History buffs will really love it. Both the guides answered our questions about history, religion, political life and social life (past & present) in Istanbul in great depth. It wasn't JUST a history tour. A lot of information was also given on architectures of ottoman empire and influence of Sinan. Guides also elaborated a lot on how history has shaped modern day Turkey. We were taken to a very good local restaurant serving good authentic Turkish food. It was pretty much all day tour starting at 8 and ending at about 5:25 with lots of walking and interesting conversations. Both guides were very jovial, informative. They gave us very good restaurant recommendations as well for the rest of our stay in Istanbul. Ample amount of time was spent at each historical landmark. I would highly recommend this private tour for any body visiting Istanbul who is eager to learn about history, architecture and political/social life in Istanbul

Memorable visits to the most beautiful attractions in the Old City of Istanbul.. My first time visiting Turkey in January 2016 and since planning was quite a rush, I didn't do much homework before I left. Alhamdulillah my friend invited us to join her guided tour of the Old City. Our guide, Evren was informative, kind and most importantly patient with four bubbly ladies! I really appreciate the bits of information that he shares, which I would probably have missed by only reading from websites and it is always good to talk with a knowledgeable local.

Best Food Tour EVER. The customer service was excellent. I had booked the tour late and they responded very quickly which was greatly appreciated. It was the highlight of my trip. The guide Yavuz was excellent. He's very knowledgeable and explained everything well. He obviously knows his way around and is very easy to talk to. The tour I thought was perfect, better than I could have imagined. It was exactly what I was looking for. Local foods that I wouldn't know where to go for or what it was and safe foods to eat. There was a lot of food to eat which was great. I love food and to just eat all the time. There was such a variety of different tastes in Istanbul it's crazy. It was also nice from all the other tours I was looking at because most of the other ones were only like 3-5 hours long but this was all day which was nice. If you love food this is a tour to do in Istanbul! Also got to see little history, inside of the Mosques and of the city. Got to see the city in a different way which wouldn't have been possible without the tour. I would definitely recommend this tour to everyone I know that goes to Istanbul. I truly enjoyed the day with Yavuz and please tell him thank you for everything.

You should Go to Turkey and You Should Use Turkland Tours. TURKLAND TOURS DID AN EXCELLENT JOB!Just returned to the States from a 6 day tour of Turkey (November 19-24) including Istanbul and Cappadocia. We were there just after the Paris attacks and while the tension was building with Russia. We felt very safe and the Turkish people were very friendly. We were taken care of from start to finish by Turkland Tours. From an easy pick up from a hectic Istanbul Airport to our arrival back at the airport on time. The guides provided by Turkland Tours were one of a kind with many years experience. We enjoyed our one on one visits to learn more about the culture of Turkey,its people and religion. A must do is the Hot Air Ballon ride in Cappadocia. It was breathtaking! We had Five Star treatment including wonderful hotels and good local food. Tourism has been down because of world wide issues but I would not hesitate to recommend going to Turkey. When you go you must use Turkland Tours!

Fascinating country and excellent tour experience. We visited Turkey over the Thanksgiving holidays and found it to be a fascinating country and culture with more biblical history than we expected. Our experience with Turkland Tours made the Trip effortless as Ibrahim did a fantastic job of choosing and booking hotels for us, making arrangements for transfers and arranging two very knowledgable, friendly tour guides. We went to Istanbul then to Cappadocia on the six day tour. Our hotels were first class in both cities, and Ibrahim even had both rooms upgraded without us even asking. In Cappadocia we stayed in a cave hotel that had just recently been completed. Our hotel in Istanbul was new and very modern within walking distance to Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Our guide in Istanbul, Murat, has been in the business for over 20 years and was very friendly and knowledgable, always open to answering questions about Islam and their culture. In Cappadocia Umut was our guide. He was also very friendly and knowledgable open to doing anything we wanted. We were sad to leave them both as they made us feel like family when we were with them.I would highly recommend Turkland Tours. Every detail was taken care of and Ibrahim gave us his personal cell number to call anytime day or night if we encountered a problem. We were a little reluctant to go to Turkey with all the news about Syria, but once we got there we felt completely safe and never felt insecure. We loved our experience, especially the hot air balloon in Cappadocia. Go to Turkey! It is a fascinating county. And use Turkland Tours. You will be glad you did.
Day tour Istanbul. Our guide, Yavuz, was amazing, super knowedgeable and nice. The tour company was highly organized, prompt and tailored the day exactly as we wanted. Superb all the way around!

Tour of Gallipoli with Turkland Tours. After many hours of research we finally settled on Turkland Travel to organise our trip to Gallipoli and I am so happy we did....From the first enquiry, the actual booking then the trip everything was managed exceptionally. We were picked up at our hotel and had a smooth journey to Gallipoli. Our guide was exceptional and was very knowleagable, courteous and allowed us plenty of time to explore Gallipoli. Being Aussies, we really appreciated the history and often at times sad stories of the battle played out in Gallipoli The day unfortunately was very wet, and the guide even organised umbrella's and wet weather gear for us, which was a nice touch..thank you.Special thanks to Ibrahim, our tour manager who constantly kept in contact with us throughout the booking and his organisation was first rate. Thank you Imbrahim and the team at Turkland travel. If you are looking for a private tour of Gallipoli I would highly recommend this company

One day Istanbul private tour. Great customer service. Our guide 'Flower' was lovely and extremely knowledgeable. Our driver too was fantastic in getting us back to our ship right on time! Customer service while arrangeing beforehand was excellent.

Istanbul - saw all the sites!. We loved Senem and her tour. She kept the energy level high and tailored the whole trip to us. It really was a great experience! I found the whole thing from the customer service, the tour program, the quality of the guide and the transportation as just perfect. Thank you so much for making our trip to Istanbul so memorable.

5-star travel experience!. We were looking for day trips for Cappadocia and Ephesus and Turkland Travels did a fabulous job. Ibrahim, our tour manager, was very professional, helpful and honest and gave us great travel tips. All the tours were well run, very reliable and high quality, which meant a lot to us given our tight itinerary. Highly recommended!

Istanbul Tour. Our guide, Ali, did a wonderful job showing us the sights in Istanbul including the historical background of this fabulous city . Loved seeing the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome, Basilica Cistern and the Grand Bazaar. Ali was prompt and very personable. One of my favorite guided tours. While booking the tour, Ibrahim could not have been attentive responding to my emails. Highly recommend.

Great way to see Istanbul if you have limited time to explore. We had a short time in Turkey and using Turkland travel was the best tip I received from a friend of mine from Turkey. The company is first rate and Ibrahim, our guide was knowledgeable, friendly, funny and just a joy to be with during our travel around the city. I would highly recommend this company and especially Ibrahim to anyone.

Amazing Day Tour of Istanbul Highlights -- Great insight/great value!. My husband and I took the Full Day Istanbul Byzantine & Ottoman Relics Tour in early Sept. 2015. Designed for 6-8 people, we ended up with only another couple so it was very intimate and customized for our pace. (we spent time at each site based somewhat on what the group wanted to see) -- our guide, Yavuz, was amazing! He was the Wikipedia of Turkish history -- he knew so much and delighted in sharing his vast knowledge and his quick wit and clever humor. We had a great overview of each site...and the tour was even more than we expected.. we started at 9:15 and were done at 5:30! Yavuz took us to a great local place for lunch and ordered for us...the food was amazing and we almost fell over when we got the bill... 20 TYL per person including beer! Bravo to Ibrahim for his great follow up when we were making arrangements and kudos to Yavuz for a great and memorable tour!

Hassle free travel using Turkland. We had a short time in Turkey and wanted to take a side trip to Cappadocia. Ibrahim was very responsive from the start and took care of all the aspects of the trip including all transportation, accommodation, hot air ballooning and guide in Cappadocia. Our guide Umut was very knowledgeable and tailored our itinerary to our needs. Everything went smoothly and right on time. We couldn't have pulled off doing as much as we did without their help. I'll be recommending Turkland to all our friends and wouldn't hesitate to use their services again.

Fabulous time in Istanbul using Turkland Tours. I booked two full days of private touring through this organization. Customer service was phenomenal, the tour package was solid, the transportation provided reliable, and the guide (Yavuz Gezmis) amazing. In every situation, this company and this guide exceeded expectations. They took input from us real time and tweaked the itinerary to accommodate our nebulous changing interests. We benefitted so much by having Yavuz at our side. He is extremely knowledgeable about the history, people and geography of Istanbul. He made great suggestions as to where to dine, he helped us plan our itinerary for a day he wasn't with us, took us to off the beaten path places that we requested to see, helped us get to where we wanted to go and was incredibly gracious throughout.

Superbly organised with brilliant guides. A great company. We booked this trip by e-mail and the communication was superb, we always had an e-mail back quickly. They organised four days of our holiday for us, including airport pick ups. We spent two whole days in Istanbul and then visited Gallipoli and Troy. The company arranged hotels for us and lunchtime meals, all of a high standard. We had a private guides in Istanbul and Troy, both with great knowledge and passion for their subject. We joined a group tour in Gallipoli but again the guide was very good. We would never have learnt so much on our own.The organisation was smooth, everything ran exactly as our itinerary stated and to time. We can't fault this company.

AWSOME !!! The best!!!. I am writing you from the plane after spending three weeks in Turkey!! We loved your country!! Our experience with your company was excellent!Our guide YAVUZ Gezmis was the best!! After a couple of hours we felt we knew him from ever.. He is very knowledgable, funny and discovers very fast his customers interests!! All the family felt very comfortable with him. He gave us advice with the shopping, with the must do's ., and took us for lunch to real Turkish sites and cuisine. Transportation was great and always on time. I recommend your services to any visitor to Turkey!! If I new you before .. I would have used your services in Izmir area also!! Next time!! Thanks for helping us enjoy your country!!

2 wonderful days in Istanbul!!!. My wife and I had a wonderful time and definitely enjoyed our visit to such a fabulous city, We can't stop talking about the sights, food, and people we encountered through out our two days touring. Tankut was an excellent guide and really helped us understand a lot about the Turkish culture from both an everyday life side of things to the religious side, to the government interaction. He was very knowledgeable about the history of Turkey and how it has changed through out the years. He was also able to take us to some great vantage points of the city that we would have never found on our own which was very cool. This was our first time with a tour guide and it went above and beyond our expectations.1) Customer Service -- Excellent. From the very beginning, when I first contacted Ibrahim, responses to emails and questions were timely and easy to understand. Working with Ibrahim on the itinerary was very easy. My wife and I appreciated Ibrahim personally looking into the couples Hamam Bath and making the reservation once he knew it was available. It's also worth mentioning that after our first day, Tankut called our hotel to make sure everything went well during the day and that we had arrived back as planned, which was very thoughtful and appreciated. Even when we made changes to the itinerary on the fly on the 2nd day, adjustments were made and everything went smooth.2) Tour Program -- Excellent. What may be cool, and not sure if this is even already in the works, is a program where if you like major tourist sites you do this program. If you are more into food you do this program, visiting local shops and restaurants with great food, or if you like shopping you do this. It may be easier for people to choose a program and alter accordingly than try and come up with everything they want to see on their own. But overall, where we went and the time spent at each location was fantastic.3) Guide -- Excellent. As mentioned previously, my wife and I had never done a tour of a city with a guide and weren't quite sure what to expect. Tankut was very personable and we were sad to say goodbye to him after only two days of touring. I really enjoyed our discussions surrounding politics and religion and as mentioned before, he really helped me understand the Turkish Culture and the people that make up such a vibrant, energetic city. He was able to explain things in a way that was easy to understand and relate back to our life. I would highly recommend Tankut to any of my friends traveling to Istanbul. 4) Transportation to and from each point of interest was fast, effective, and easy. My wife and I had no problems with how we got to where we were going and the drivers drove in a safe manner given the situations.Overall my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Istanbul and a lot of that goes to Tankut and the itinerary Ibrahim's company put together, so thank you!!
Istanbul full day tour. The tour was fantastic! Murat was an excellent guide and it was such a great experience to be able to see Istanbul from a local's perspective. Would fully recommend this tour.

Outstanding- definitely the best way to see Istanbul (because you avoid the queuing!). We emailed several of the top ten daily travel guides in Istanbul but Turkland travel was the first to get back to us- and the only one willing to customize our trip for us. We went on a Sunday and because the Grand Bazaar was closed we negotiated an alternate route to the Basilica Cistern (which is an absolute must see!) for a small price adjustment.Service was outstanding as mentioned- Ibrahim would email back promptly and we had the whole trip sorted out in just a couple of hours.Our guide himself (Ulash- sorry not sure of the spelling!) was everything you could want in a guide and more. Courteous, humorous and friendly- he seemed to know most of the other tour guides we would pass! Not only was he comfortable to be around but his knowledge was so impressive. He studied for five years at university including history of ancient societies- which showed in the way he seemlessly delivered the history of the sites we saw and could answer our questions of anything we asked.Forget the long lines- our guide got us through all our destinations with little or no queuing! We felt the envious stares of the queues that stretched two blocks as he led us straight to the entrance and through security with zero fuss- that was worth the price of the tour alone! But accompanied by the fascinating history lesson it was truly the best way to experience Istanbul.

Great services all around! . I landed in Istanbul yesterday end of the day - it was closing of Ramadan - and tried the top agencies on Trip Advisor to organize a tour today knowing it was very short notice. I only had one day in town so really wanted to do it. Out of all the top agencies listed on TA, Turkland was the ONLY one that answered the phone and offered a tour customized for me (the group ones were sold out) and very promptly. Ibrahim was great in offering options, very fast in exchanging and finalizing the arrangements, and in providing an excellent service all the way with a personal touch. He asked me if I had any specific requests related to the tour, and I mentioned that I love history, culture, arts and a local, authentic experience when traveling. Ibrahim was very considerate making me feel very welcomed in my first time in Istanbul/Turkey. I just finished the tour and had a fantastic day. Murat - my guide - was everything I had asked/hoped for and much more. He is SO knowledgable - impressive education and cultural background - which was very unique and inspirational. He made me wanting to know, read more about diverse subjects related to the sightseeing spots, and certainly made me wanting to come back to Istanbul and Turkey again. He took me to a great authentic ottoman cuisine restaurant and a local tile shop (upon my request) and the whole experience was terrific (very different from some recent tours to other cities in the world recently). Net, planning to use both Turkland and Murat services a next time and already recommending to my friends. I highly recommend to everyone.

Nice overall tour of Istanbul. We rented a driver and car for the day for a very reasonable price. I believe the guide's name was Yousef, but he said it so fast and only once, that I did not really catch it. His English was good, knowledgeable and he is used to giving tours to Americans. He does not normally work for Turkland, actually does longer tours (21 days) but Turkland Tours asked him to take us around. He did a good job, but he was not passionate about the city and I don't think he really understood what we wanted...we wanted the not so touristy sites, which I did list out and we discussed. But we were done early and he just had us hang out at the spice market for extra time (not the most exciting place to hang out, but it is worth seeing). (I would give our tourguide 3 stars, he was nothing exceptional).I was very thankful that we were able to avoid the large crowds. We went to Dolmabahce (the last Turkish sultan's home), Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, and the Spice Market (versus the Bazaar--same thing, just different, they run into each other). I had also hoped to get away from the touristy restaurants for lunch, but we were taken to one right up the street from the Hagia Sophia. It was good, just not off the beaten path.I did book this on short notice due to extenuating circumstances so all of the people recommended in these reviews were taken. That is not Turkland's fault, but mine. I am thankful that Turkland Tours decided to find someone rather than just say they could not help. For that I give an extra point.

Great Experience, Location, and Customer Service. Turkland has a great location in the old part of Istanbul and is within walking distance of all the major historical sites in that part of the city - we would highly recommend them to anyone visiting Istanbul! Below are some highlights from our visit and interaction with the team at Turkland:Customer Service - Excellent. We really appreciated all aspects of this, especially the personal attention upon arrival and during our time in Istanbul Tour Program and Guide - Excellent. Our guide (Emrah) was fantastic - great knowledge of all sites and we really felt like we learned a lot during our time with him....it was a really fun day with him and we would highly recommend taking a walking tour of the old part of Istanbul!  Trasportation - Excellent. Eveyone was on-time, knew where we were going - this made it easy for us to enjoy the views and not have to worry about logistics.

Smooth Perfect Logistics - Superbly planned & executed by Ibrahim of Turkland!. When traveling solo, there are many concerns and especially if the trip has been planned impromptu, one is a bit nervous. So since Turkland was recommended by the place I was staying at - and that they were not just a random off-the-street travel agency but connected to my hostel, it made me feel comfortable to book through them. Through several discussions Ibrahim worked around my budget and time constraints patiently and came up with a workable plan. [Later I was told by others that such a low price is usually not possible - so I realise that he went out of his way to make my trip happen]From the moment I was picked up from the hostel to the moment I was dropped back I probably was transfered across several independent operators i.e. taxi service in Istanbul, airline, taxi service in Cappadocia, travel agent in Cappadocia, bus tour operator, hostel in Cappadocia and then finally the two taxi operators on the way back to Istanbul. The micromanaging required was quite extensive but the marvel is that not ONCE did I feel like there was no one in charge - not once did I feel nervous or worried. I know that had I booked independently, I would have been fatigued by having to make all the arrangements on the spot. But with Ibrahim & Turkland everything was smooth and perfect. I told others later that it felt like I was DHL parcel - barcoded and even though the package changes hands many many times, everyone knows exactly what to do with it! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

You get so much more out of your trip with a great guide.. We were referred to Turkland tours by our hotel (Empress Zoe). They proved to be first rate in every way.We had communicated with Turkland’s manager before our arrival and agreed as to what we were going to see. We made requests and he counter-proposed with other interesting options. We were with our guide, Yavuz, for 2 days: the first and third days we were in Istanbul (sightseeing can be tiring, so taking a break and having a “slow” day in between is recommended). He has been a guide for 26 years and seems to know everyone in the city. And having a senior guide delivers benefits like easy access to everything.The first day was all on foot as our hotel was close to many of the top sights; the second day we were carted around in an air-conditioned van.Yavuz was special because he was so knowledgeable about the history and politics of Turkey and the region. We spent considerable time discussing the current middle east problems, as well. We can unreservedly recommend him and his delicious sense of humor.

Perfect for our short stay in Istanbul!. We cannot speak more highly of Turkland Tours Istanbul Day Tours and specifically our guide, Esin! Our tour was fantastic and she was very passionate, knowledgeable and friendly.She gave us excellent insight into each of the locations without being intrusive and she ensured with we understood and appreciated each place for its unique beauty and significance.She was patient and gave us time to explore whilst making sure we had time to see everything throughout the day. The itinerary was ideal for our short visit to Istanbul and to have Esin by our side made all the difference.For lunch we went to a local restaurant which was very nice and we got to enjoy some delicious turkish meatballs!We would definitely recommend Esin as a guide and Turkland Tours Istanbul Day Tours. We hope to be back to again soon!

What an experience. Ibrahim organised our whole trip from Istanbul, to cappadocia, pamukkale, Kusadasi, Ephesus and back. Everything was hassle free, shuttles buses to and from the bus station to tours and the ballon ride in cappadocia( a must!!). It was so easy. We had the most amazing time on our trip and it wouldn't have been possible without their help. Thank you so much for such an excellent and unforgettable experience.

Fantastic tour of Istanbul highlights. Our family of four really enjoyed the all day tour of Istanbul! Our guide, Emrah was so knowledgeable and helpful. We were especially impressed that the owner, Ibrahim, made the effort to meet us in the morning and check in with us at lunch to make sure we were happy. We don't often see that level of attention! Lunch was a standout too! We would highly recommend this tour to anyone.

Wonderful insight to the old city. Cicek, or Snow Flower, gave us a wonderful day exploring old Istanbul. She gave excellent insights into the past and present day and made history come to life and make sence.The day flew by with interesting stories, tips and as Snow Flower was organised with tickets etc we did not wait to get entrance into really popular sites. She was an extrmely knowledgeable and friendly guide. Thanks Flower!Would gladly and highly recommend Flower and your tour to anyone seeking an excellent insight into the past and present of old Istanbul.

Amazing tour. Tours were amazing and having Vamuz as a guide was d best ever,he becamepart of our family and helped us sort whatever kind of challenges wefaced.We learned a lot about istanbul in just two days,the cruise on Bosporuswas so amazing.His knowledge about d topkapi palace ,blue mosque etc we're amazing.All in all best best tour we've experienced.Vamuz is d best!!!!!!!!Thank u guys so much

Private guided tour of Istanbul Old City. We spent a day with Esin on a private guided tour of the Istanbul Old City. We scheduled the tour for our first full day in Istanbul/Turkey to help us to orient ourselves. Esin is warm and enthusiastic and catered the tour to our interests. We saw the main sights of the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cisterns and the Grand Bazaar. Being with a guide meant we didn't waste time in queues such as at the Cisterns and Esin altered our day's intended schedule to avoid an uncommonly long queue at the Blue Mosque in the morning (she was able to find out the mosque opening times by dialing and listening to a recorded message - something we wouldn't have known about!). Esin was able to provide us with the historical and social context of these places and tailored the information to our level of prior knowledge. She showed us some hidden eateries and spent time helping us to plan our visit (including very useful advice about public transport) and source some musical instruments. We felt very cared for and Esin was able to fill in the gaps left by the guidebooks, which can never give the amount of detail a person can during conversation. She helped us learn some more Turkish and by the end of the day I felt confident to find my way in and about Istanbul. She was exactly the kind of guide I had hoped for.

2 Fabulous Days in Istanbul. We had just 2 days but with help from Turkland we made the most of it. We had both an itinerary to include all the main highlights and some time to explore on our own. The hotel recommendation in the old city was a fabulous location. And, their thoughtful anticipation and planning included getting admission tickets in advance so we never had to stand in a line! Thank you Ozden and team!

Excellent Istanbul, Cappadocia and Konya tour!!!. We had a great time recently when we went on a trip to Turkey on our spring break!! Ibrahim from Turkland Tours had made all the arrangements for hotel, tour guide, sightseeing, restaurants and shopping!! I had an excellent service in all the areas and everything was wonderful including the guides and restaurants. The food was amazing and places we visited were incredible!! I would highly recommend using them for booking your tours and can't wait to back and visit Turkey again:)) It's an amazing place to visit!!! Delicious food, beautiful mosques and mazing people!!

Amazing experience in Turkey. Took the family for a trip to Ephesus and Istanbul....great itinerary, transportation and guides organized by Ozden and his company Turkland Tours.Very knowledgeable guides, all the arrangements were as promised, great attention to detail and we had a great time. Couldn't recommend using Turkland enough if you're going to Turkey.Well done!

First time Turkey Trip. We visited Turkey for the first time in March 2015. Before our visit I tried to research for various travel agencies on the Internet. Eventually my wife settled on Turkland tours based on their ratings. From the time we contacted them for the first time to the time we landed back in the USA, our experience with the company was nothing but exceptional. We mostly dealt with Mr. Ibrahim. He was excellent in planning our itinerary. All the services provided by his company were very excellent. From the moment we landed in Turkey to the time we left, he personally made sure that all our needs were met.  The tour guides provided by the company were also very good specially Mr Göukhan who took us around in Cappadocia and Konya. He is very knowledgeable and extremely courteous. We were treated with great respect and love. He even gave my Dad an expensive Persian copy of the Masnavi by Rumi as a gift. When leaving Konya, he refused to leave the airport till he personally checked us in on our flight to Istanbul.  Mr Ibrahim kept on checking with us on every stage of our tour to make sure that we were comfortable and also made last-minute changes in our itinerary based on our request. We what are all highly impressed by the professionalism of Mr. Ibraham and his team. On our last day in Istanbul, Mr. Ibraham personally came to our hotel to make sure that we were satisfied with our tour.I will definitely recommend Turkland tours to all my friends and family that may want to visit Turkey in future.

Excellent tour for Bursa. We had a wonderful weekend trip to Bursa and Cumalikizik (a village listed in UNESCO World Heritage) with Istanbul Bar Association Travel Club and the trip was organized by TURKLAND TOURS. Buses were new and had wi-fi. Guide had tremendous knowledge about history and local culture and the hotel was simply fantastic. It had thermal facilities and exccelent food.We will not hesitate to use Turkland for future trips. Thank you !

excellent and hassle free. I was in istanbul for 3 days last month and seeing the great reviews of this company I decided to try them. I was in touch with Ibrahim Basyesil who was very helpfull. I had gone for a day tour in the old city on day one and the second day i spent in izmir to see the ephesus for which all the arrangements were perfect from the propmt replies to my emails , the transfers to the airports and the guides for both the tours were also very knowledgeable. All in all i had a great time and would definitely be going back some day.

Excellent and hassle free. Turkland tours were a pleasure to deal with. I only had 2 full days in Istanbul and wanted to make the most of my time away. I inquired about 2 tours, the city day tour and a trip to Gallipoli. Ibrahim responded to my email inquiry within minutes of it being sent. After a few exchanges back and forth via email I was booked in to both tours of choice. Upon my arrival into Istanbul I received an email from Ibrahim welcoming me into Turkey and to confirm all tours. He also provided me with his mobile number if there was a need to get in touch with him. Both tours exceeding my expectations and would most certainly use Turkland Tours upon my return to Turkey.

Great choice. My friend and I toured Istanbul for two days with Turkland Tours and it was a wonderful experience. We are not normally the tour guide types but Istanbul is a city where you should have a guide. Ibrahim Basyesil from Turkland Tours hired Esin Yasar for us. She was not only knowledgable but extremely nice and accommodating. They let us customize exactly what we wanted to do and she was very flexible. For example, we had heard about this place for lunch and she didn't mind going out of her way to take us there. Even at the end of the tour, Ibrahim joined us and we went to Taksim area had enjoy our dinner together. We thoroughly enjoyed our time with them! I highly recommend them!
excellent service. excellent service . Everythink was perfect with tem. TOUR ISTANBUL + CAPPADOCIA AUGUST 2014. KEEP IT UP ;)

Excellent Customer Service and Follow-up. Hasan at Turkland Travel Agency is very focused on making sure that you enjoy your trip. Trips are not ran by/hosted by Turkland, they act as a wholesaler and book your trip. What was great was that Hasan followed up several times prior to and after the trip. He gave us his mobile numbers in case there were any issues. Only thing, don't be alarmed when you go to the Turkland office, they share space/businesses with the rug store next door. I was skeptical when Hasan said he ran both, but everything was right in alignment. Thanks Turkland Travel Agency for helping to add to the great week in Istanbul!

Excellent Service. My husband & I were in Istanbul in January & wanted to do a day trip to Gallipoli. I contacted Turkland Tours & was advised by Ibrahim that they could supply a private tour. I was after a group tour & Ibrahim took the time and effort to find a local agency & arrange a booking for me. Ibrahim was very professional, emailing me with details & even phoned the night before to confirm our booking, times etc. The agency he organised was excellent & our trip was fantastic. Turkland Tours & Ibrahim were a pleasure to deal with & I thank them for all their assistance. I would highly recommend using Turkland Tours when organising travel in Turkey.

A reliable travel agent. Am a travel agent from Kenya and my experience with Hasan was very good.for one i called him within a very short time during Christmas for him to book my clients in a hotel and transfers from the airport and arrange tours .the response i got was so quick,i had to send money through western union and believe out of trust that i trusted him with large amount of money he made all the payments.the response i got from my clients was all good and they really enjoyed his company.my clients stayed for 7 days in Grand beyazid hotel.turkland is a good, trusted,experienced people.try them ..Hasan is a fantastic guy!i will always use them from Kenya.

BEST EXPERIENCE EVER. Unforgettable experience with Mr. Ibrahim and his travel agency. He took care of us for all our trip. He is very helpful, kind and professional! I really hope to meet him again and I really suggest his agency of all the tours and suggestion you may need. Trust in him, he is really the best! .- Elisa

"Courteous and Professional". I chose Turkland based on a friend's recommendation and had already referred a few other people since I came back. I have to say this trip was definitely a pleasant surprise as far as the logistic, hotels and tour guide concern. The transition from place to place and all connecting flights are smooth and impeccable orderly. Though we have a small mishap but it was quickly noted and with great follow through.Turkland is one of the BEST agencies I used so far. Especially Ibrahim who is courteous and professional. He always has his customer best interest in mind, and has make every effort to follow through during our trip. The most impressing thing I can see is that Turkland is constantly trying to make improvement and they truly value their customer opinions.We spent 3 days in Istanbul first (did our private tour with Yavuz, very knowledgeable and exceptionally alert when we are at crowded area.), then we flew out west to Cappadocia for 2 days (group tours for 2 days, I will recommend private tour especially if you go during peak season.), then flew south to Izmir (private tour with Naizamettin Adsiz, another excellent tour guide) where we stayed at a resort hotel (see pix) and visited Ephesus and Pamukkale.Turkland’s tour guides are accommodating and they know where the bargains are, yet they are not pushy nor tricky (which many tour guides do to just make their commission worth).Over all remarkable and outstanding Service which I have referred quite a few people already.

An excellent moment. I spent 5 days in Istanbul with my mum, it was the first time for her so we decided to book a tour to be more relax about our holidays. We booked the Bosphorus tour with Turkland, Hasan was our interlocutor, he was very helpful, patient, professionnal and attentive to our needs. Everything was well organised. The guide of the tour, Aziz, was very nice, he explained to us the history of the places (in the egyptian bazaar and during the boat tour) it was so interesting. He recommanded many good foods and things to do in istanbul that we were pleased to try. We spent a really good moment in Istanbul, thank you so much.

Caring & Professional. I chose Turkland based on a friend's recommendation. This was my first time in Istanbul, and I had some certain preferrence. Before I left for Turkey, Ibrahim and I had exchanged emails and he helped revise my itinerary several times according to my requests. The final one worked out perfectly. And I owe special thanks to my private guide Flower. The elegant lady is the most knowledgable and caring guide that I've ever met. Seems she has a historical libarary in her mind. She has made my experience of Istanbul 10 times greater.

Friendly, knowledgable and caring. My wife and two daughters recently decided to travel to Isanbul from Greece for a three day excursion. Since this was to be our first visit to Turkey, we were quite apprehensive about it. We were connected to Ozden Basak through a mutual friend and thank goodness we were. He literally handled every detail impeccably from transportation, to ticketing, to our hotel arrangements. He made the entire experience so very enjoyable. He acted as our personal guide for one day and told us information that only someone who is intimately familiar with Istanbul could know. On the second day he introduced us to Ufku, who was equally knowledgable and fun to be with. Both of them took a real interest in our family and made certain that we made the most out of our time in the city. I can't say enough good about Ozden, Ufku and the Turkland Tours team. They are the best there is in Turkey!

We had excellent time in Turkey!!!. We went to Istanbul on November.We took long holiday suddenly ,so the preparing time was not enough.We did not decide where we would go,book hotel.But Ibrahim and Esin took our concerns away.They arrangd everythings.They transportations and explained about histrical place...For example,next day, we planed to go Kapadokia,but as I said,we did not plan what we did,and went.We discussed it with them , then they arranded the plan which was very exciting.They had good footwork and could understand what we wanted.When the trip was finished,we awared that we had the best trip in our life.In my opinoin,there are many things we can watch and learn in Turkey from the viewpoint of history and personality.But some persons wonder what to do in their trip...I recommend you shoud contact them and believe your trip will be happier...

Ozden knows Istanbul!. We had the pleasure of having Ozden as our guide for a brief couple of days in Istanbul. He was able to take us through as many highlights of the city as we could reasonably expect in so short a time. Ozden is truly knowledgable about all the ins and outs of Istanbul and life in Turkey, and he shares his knowledge freely with a good sense of humor. We enjoyed getting to know Ozden and his city!

Fabulous Turkey Vacation. My husband and I used Turkland Tours for our trip to Turkey in October and we could not have been more pleased with the services. Ibrahim at Turkland Tours arranged all our travel from Istanbul to Cappadocia to Ephesus and back to Istanbul. Each city provided us with a completely different experience. In Istanbul, we spent two days touring with Elgiz, a fabulous tour guide who was extremely knowledgeable about the culture and history of the Old City. In Cappadocia, Ibrahim arranged for us go hot-air ballooning over lunar-like landscapes at sunrise (an experience not to be missed). He also arranged tours of the area which included visits to spectacular geological formations, ancient cave houses, churches and monasteries that are carved from volcanic deposits, and even an underground city. At Ephesus, we visited extraordinary Roman ruins in the company of yet another extremely knowledgeable and thoroughly charming tour guide (whose name, unfortunately I cannot remember).Ibrahim provided us with a detailed itinerary, including information about our domestic flights, airport and tour transportation. He made all the arrangements. Except for two days off that we had purposefully built into our trip to Turkey, we really didn’t have to do anything – Ibrahim had arranged everything for us. Everything went exactly as planned. We had transportation to and from the airport and to various sites in Cappadocia and Ephesus; tours in every city. Everyone was always on time, or even a little early!We had a lot of personalized attention and not just in terms of the tours. But also, Ibrahim talked to us at each stop in our trip to be sure we were not having any problems and also met us on our last day to make sure we happy with his services. He doesn’t need to be worried about that. My husband and I had and extraordinarily wonderful vacation. If we go back to Turkey, we for sure will make arrangements through Turkland Tours.

Book with Turkland Tours!. This small travel agency is the one to book with when traveling in Turkey. They are professionals who know the lay of the land. They helped us with all our arrangements in Istanbul and Cappadocia. They had good suggestions regarding what to see and how how to get the most out of the time spent there. All arrangements went exactly as planned. Hotels were great in terms of location and service. In addition to the major sites, you will also explore other parts of Istanbul to get a truer feel for the city. Because they are a small agency, they can give personalized service. All our arrangements were made through email. They were prompt and very helpful in responding to all our inquiries. I would highly recommend them to help you make the most of your visit to Turkey.

Our Immersion into Turkey. Originally we contacted a US travel agent when planning our trip to Turkey. Big mistake. That agent wanted to put us in hotels we could find in the US and estimated a ridiculously expensive vacation that included no meals. We wanted a more affordable and more Turkish experience for our vacation. Luckily, we had friends who had visited Turkey. They recommended we contact Turkland Travel and they were right.Thanks to that recommendation, we spent 16 (affordable) days in four different regions (Istanbul, Cappadocia, Izmir and Bodrum) of this amazing country. Each region was different in weather, food, history and attitude. Sometimes we had private tours and sometimes we were in small groups. We were met by a driver at every airport. Breakfast was included with every hotel and every tour included lunch. Some guides were AMAZING and some were just OK, but that happens with all travel.In Istanbul we were provided with knowledgeable guides who explained the culture and history of the Old City and other days we leisurely self-explored neighborhoods near Taksim Square. In Cappadocia we stayed in a cave hotel, went hot-air ballooning over lunar-like landscapes at sunrise and visited an underground city. In Izmir we experienced Ephesus (but missed visiting Pamukkale which was our mistake); we were guided into the countryside and saw frescos in a cave from 6th century BC. We relaxed by the gorgeous Turquoise Coast in Bodrum before returning to Istanbul for a few more days. Turkland Travel is based in Istanbul, but Ozden has contacts in every region of Turkey we visited. When we did run into a problem, we called Ozden and he IMMEDIATELY (within 10 minutes) had someone there to get us back on our way. Knowing that he was reachable by phone anytime, for any reason, was a huge plus.

Istanbul private guide. My partner and I were totally saisfied with Turkland Tours for our 2 full days of private touring in Istanbul. Both Ozden on Day 1 and Essin on Day 2 were full of information on the history as well as the current situation in Turkey. Not only did we do the standard sights, but we also did a cruise up the Bosphorous to a small town where we had an amazing fresh fish lunch. There is so much to see in Istanbul...the only way to do it is privately and with Turkland!

Great Trip to Istanbul!. Choosing Turkland Tour was the best decision I made for our holiday. We visited Istanbul with family and friends and engaged Turkland Tours during our stay. It was a really smart decision. Ozden was our guide and he is fluent in English, is very funny, and knows the history and interesting facts about Istanbul and its many sites. Plus, Turkland Tours gets you and your group to the front of the line at all the sites and this was some good given that we were a group of 10 people. We saw everything in the Old City and visited Taxsim. We got to know so much about the history and places in Istanbul. Ozden’s suggestions about restaurants was perfect and we never had a bad meal. He was also so helpful about everything and making arrangements for our stay and tours. Don’t miss the Bosporus Tour, with a great lunch. Also, definitely shop with Ozden, expecially the Turkish specialties like rugs, Turkish lights, and sweets. He arranged our airport transport which was great and so helpful as well as suggesting accommodations. We will definitely use Turkland Tours on our next trip to Istanbul.

Excellent Company and People. I recently returned from a trip to Istanbul. When I was there I had the pleasure of booking a tourof Ephesus with Ozden and Ibrahim from Turkland Tours. I can not say enough about the terrific service that these people provided. I was picked up at my hotel in Istanbul, driven to the airport, met at the airport in Izmir, driven to Ephesus where my guide was waiting for me. The guide was witty, knowledgeable and as eager to share his passion for the ruins as I was to hear about them. After the tour there was a wonderful lunch, a visit to a couple of merchants where there was no pressure to buy anything. I was then driven back to the Izmir airport, picked up in Istanbul and driven back to my hotel. These guys called me to make sure everything was good and were willing to do anything to make the trip better. Let me also mention, that I was supposed to make this trip in 2013 but I got sick and could nottravel. Turkland totally understood and worked with me and credited me 100% of the costs. They could not be more understanding.When I came back to Istanbul I was so impressed with the trip to Izmir that I had Turkland arrange a tour for me in Istanbul. Again, they took care of everything and provided me with a knowledgeable, low key guide that fit my personality perfectly. Turkland Travel is a great company and I would recommend them highly.

The best experience!!!. I just came back from the best 13 days vacation I ever had... I'm so happy that I choose TURKLAND TOURS, ibrahim was great and he helped me with everything since day one, checked my well being till the end.The one day tour Old city Istanbul was great. Every hotel was amazing, and the staff as well... Don't think twice, the best thing you can do its book through Turkland Tours..

A brief 2 days of ancient history in Istanbul. I have had 2 days to spare and asked Hasan Birdal of Turkland Tours to get me a personal guide because I cannot walk fast but desperately wanted to see as much as I could. A charming young lady, Melek escorted me looking after me with as much care as if I were her grandmother . She told me the history of the Hippodrome, guided me through the beautiful Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. All the time giving me details of the past. As an antophogist I was interested in her life. We had lunch with Hasan and took the afternoon Bosphorus boat tour pase so many beautiful homes and palaces. The second day we explored Tophapi Palace and the Archaeology Museum. I could gave spent days there. I was impressed how the people of Turkey respect their history and past. I must say a special thanks to the taxi driver who took me to the airport. He left his van, took me in, found someone who showed where the handicapped section was and deposited me and my suitcase apologizing for not staying longer. First class. I hope to come back again. I would add I am 82 and traveling on my own.

Highly recommended. Our tour with Turkland tours was organised by friends who live in Istanbul- My husband, myself and another couple from Australia toured the Blue Mosque and parts of the old city. Ozden - was our guide and he was extremely informative, interesting and amusing. Lunch was included in our tour which was delicious and at a highly recommended restaurant close by the Blue Mosque.Another tour taken was to Gallippoli and Troia - we were collected from our hotel in Istanbul and travelled 4 - 5 hours to Gallippoli where we met our guide who had exceptional knowledge and interest in the history of Gallippoli and Troia.this tour required an overnight stay in a hotel of very high standard and very comfortable. We were then delivered back to Istanbul to the front door of our Hotel.I highly recommend Turkland Tours for any tour in Turkey. We found the guides to be very professional, spoke great English, easy to get along with and made our tour very easy and comfortable and also at a reasonable cost.Thank you so much. We will recommend Turkland to anyone planning to travel to Turkey.

Fantastic. My wife and I considered renting a car and touring Turkey on our own. We are glad we had Turkland (specifically Ibrahim and Ozden) organize our trip instead. We saved a ton of time not having to plan our own excursions, figure out directions, and we even got to skip some of the long lines for some sites. They took care of everything and checked with our drivers if we didn't show up on time at our next destination. We used Turkland after my parents first met them 7 years ago and my brother and sister-in-law used them a few years later. Both strongly recommended them. After our trip, we will strongly recommend them to friends that are considering a trip to Turkey. Thanks for a great trip Ibrahim and Ozden!

Highly Recommend. Ibrahim & Ozden at Turkland Tours truly made our vacation a wonderful and unforgettable experience. With very short notice, Turkland pulled together a vacation very much custom tailored to our requests. We had originally considered undertaking this trip on our own, however our last minute choice to book with Turkland was no doubt the best choice we could have made. Both our parents and our brother's family have travelled with Turkland at different times and it became quickly obvious why they both recommended Ozden and his group. We travelled by bus and plane throughout the country, from Istanbul to Capadoccia, Pamukkale and Fethiye, taking in a mix of adventures with both private and larger tour groups (our choice). We were taken care of literally every step of the way, no issues with bus transfers or anything else. Hotels that Turkland selected were very nice and all provided great food options. From a Canadian traveller, I recommend Turkland Tours, Ozden and Ibrahim for anyone travelling to this great country. Best, Christina & Devin

Successful Tours By Turkland Travel. We had one of those successful tours organized by Istanbul Bar Association’s Travelers’ Club and Turkland Tours last week.Bozcaada was a very interesting island and the guides had all the information both about the history and also about the places to go for a swim and food.We sure will use Turkland again for our next cultural expeditions inside Turkey.

Highly Recommend. Had a great time with the tours. Emercan, our guide, and I might have misspelled her name, was really knowledgeable and friendly. We got so much for our money. I would definitely do it again.

Very Helpfull!!!!. We stopped in to ask a bunch of questions and only booked one thing. We book a Gallipoli Tour which was fine, but Ibrahim Basyesil was so helpful with information and suggestions about everything else. Even when he knew we were only booking one thing he still spent lots of time talking to us about other things to do. These are good, honest, helpful folks.

Very Professional Tour Company. . We took a private all day Istanbul Tour + car service from Turkland. From planning the trip until the actual tour were handled professionally. The guide that they assigned us, Mr Hassan U. was good and pleasant. He was very knowlegable about the history of Turkey and the sites that we visited. Also, we were impressed with his management of time. When he saw the line for Aya Sophia was very long in the morning, he made the decision to switch to other less crowded site and came back to Aya Sophia after lunch so, we didn't have to wait in line (to enter) for a long time. Also, having private tour meant, we controlled the time we wanted to spend at each place and had all the tickets prepared so that we didn't have to queu to get tickets. The only minor glitch, we experienced was about the drop off at the airport. The driver dropped us off at the wrong airline area, even though we told him about our flight before, and I was sure that the office had also told him. We had to walk all the way to the end of the terminal to find the correct check in counter. (A rather long walk especially, with heavy luggages). I guess, I had expected to be flawless service especially the rate that this company has charged us. As I said above, this was minor and could easily rectified for convinience of future clients. Overall, my husband and I were satisfied with our experience with this company and highly recommend it.

Tour to Bursa. We had the most wonderful experience with Turkland Tours to Bursa :) we had a lovely guide "Bora", the bus driver picked us up on time and the planner "Ibrahim Basyesil" is so kind. He helped us planning our journey day by day. Thank you :)

Exelent Turkland tours the best service!. Very good service. We even had a problem with the tickets at the bus station in cappadocia, and they resolved the problem very fast! I recommend it 100%. The hotels they arrange also very good. With them u just need to relax and enjoy your travel. Thank u for everything.

Wonderful Tour of Istanbul. Turkland Tours and our guides, Ozden and Sherif, were excellent. We are a family of 5 (three sons, 10, 9 and 7) from the US. We spent 3 days with a Turkland guide each day. Our three guided days were special and worked for our family because the guides structured the pace and each day based on our family. The kids asked so many questions and the guides were knowledgeable and kept them interested. We set up the guides via email before we arrived. Ozden and the other folks at Turkland Tours were really helpful. The guides were great with our kids and really set up or days to work for our family. We never would have had the same experience in Turkey if we did not use Turkland. The Turkland guides are professional and prompt. They really go the extra mile for clients. For example - we left a cell phone in the van one day and were really nervous when we discovered it missing that evening. With one call to Turkland, they located the phone and had it delivered to our hotel the next morning. I would recommend Turkland Tours to anyone who is going to spend time in Istanbul.

Turkland Tours made our trip to Turkey a fantastic success. I feel like I just cannot say enough good things about Turkland Tours and I would wholeheartedly recommend them for all your travel needs in Turkey. Their service is highly personalized and exceptionally attentive. Ibrahim Basyesil arranged everything we asked for, always made himself available for any questions or concerns we might have, and personally checked in during the trip to make sure all was going well. He responded so quickly to every one of my pre-trip emails, I knew right away that we were in good hands! While in Istanbul, I had truly the most wonderful day tour (Ottoman Relics) with guide Esin Yasar. She was extremely knowledgeable about all the sites and the history we were seeing, as well as wonderfully entertaining. I enjoyed myself thoroughly the entire time.During our trip, we had multiple transfers to and from airports and hotels in different parts of the country and every time, the driver was there, waiting and ready for us.We also joined group tours through Turkland of Ephesus and Pergamon. Both were excellent.I will be telling everyone and anyone who will listen about how wonderful this agency is, and urging them to use Turkland Tours when traveling in Turkey
