We enjoyed that, and found lodging with them in Sultanahmet, Taksim Sq and Cihangir during our time in Istanbul. In addition, we coordinated tours and transport when we took a trip to Cappadocia. Everyone we encountered was friendly, funny and thoroughly interested in making sure we had a great time. I miss them all dearly and look forward to my next trip to Turkey!

Turkland Travel. I recently visited Turkey for the first time with a couple of friends. We wanted to spend most of our time in Istanbul with a few days in Cappadocia. We linked up with Turkland Travel through a friend in the US, and Ozden and his crew were great! They helped set us up with places to stay in a couple of different neighborhoods in Istanbul so we could experience different parts of the city, they set up transport to and from the airport that was always on time with friendly/helpful drivers, and they got us started with a tour in Cappadocia. Each of us arrived on a different day, and someone from Turkland called while we were driving from the airport to welcome us - a nice touch. We explored Istanbul on our own, and though the staff were quick to provide recommendations when asked, we didn't feel pressured to sign up for organized tours. They were incredibly knowledgeable about the city and always eager to help make our stay a good one. The staff really went above and beyond in terms of hospitality, and we were sad to have to leave.

Outstanding Service. A friend and I spent 6 days in Turkey; Istanbul and Esrus. Our tour guide, Esra was outstanding and provided us with timely and accurate information. She greeted us every day with the most pleasant disposition and took all of our needs very seriously. She and Turkland made changes to the itinerary as necessary and always accommodated our requests. All transportation arrangements were always handled expeditiously. The value for this tour was excellent. I can't commend Esra and Turkland high enough.

Solid tour. I first inquired from their website and enjoyed a swift reply to my request for a short notice all-day tour (just a couple days in advance). In my case, they didn't ask for any online payment, just saying I should bring the cash with me. On tour morning, my bus driver arrived about 3 minutes before the 8 o'clock agreed-to time, and off we went to a staging area where people in different tours got into their specific buses. The guide was easy to understand, very kind and knowledgeable about the great history of Turkey from the early Greeks and Romans to the Ottoman and Byzantine periods up through the 20th century. He kept us moving to stay on time as we went to various mosques, museums, palaces and the lunch date (which, by the way was in the Olive restaurant's rooftop room and was a nice lunch). After we finished up, several of us decide to go visit the Basilica Cistern as recommended by our guide.

Magnificent agency. I contacted Turkland Travel Agency by email and received very prompt response from Ibrahim. My friend and I only had very limited time in Istanbul and wanted to see the city without wasting time finding our way around. The Turkland Travel Agency give us a tour on the first day, take us to the hotel, pick us up the next day for another private tour. Our guide Ozden was extremely well informed and had a good feel for our interests and the pace at which we wanted to see things. He chose wonderful local restaurants for lunch . He was a very interesting person and a pleasant companion for the two days in Istanbul. We learned a lot about Turkish history and culture from him. At the end of the tour, which made us feel very special , Ibrahim met us to ensure everything went as planned. He took a very personal interest in our having a great tour. I would highly recommend Turkland Travel Agency anyone who want to come Istanul / Turkey

Istanbul and Ephesus for Our Honeymoon. My husband and I were lucky enough to spend 5 days of our honeymoon in Turkey and booked a few tours with Ibrahim at Turkland to help us make the most of our time. I made the booking inquiry rather close to our travel dates, and Ibrahim was very prompt and helpful with getting us booked quickly. He was able to accommodate flexible tours (e.g. private vs. group, other cities--Ephesus). And he took time to come out and say hello to us during our first tour.We took four different tours (three tours and one dinner activity) with four different guides and they were all good experiences. Beyond the sheer beauty of the sites, I found the guides to be personable and passionate about what they do. They were professional, knowledgeable, and often willing to show us something a little extra if we asked. They even did their best to keep my husband--who is not particularly interested in history--entertained (especially our Ephesus guide). Everyone, from Ibrahim to the drivers, were very pleasant to deal with.One note about Turkland (and I'm not sure if this applies generally to other tour companies as well): Three out of the four tours that we booked with them were actually run out of other companies/establishments. I didn't have any issue with this, but had anything come up it might have been confusing trying to figure out which company and person we would have needed to deal with. The fourth tour was with what I believe was an independent guide who works with Turkland, but not exclusively.Overall I was satisfied with Turkland and would consider using them again, as well as recommending them to other Turkey-bound travelers.

Ozden's Istanbul. Ozden and Turkland Tours arrangement of our recent visit to Istanbul was outstanding. The attention to detail, reliability, as well a warm, welcoming and personal style coupled with his great experience and contacts in the city gave our whole group a great view of Istanbul, including a memorable boat tour, visits to both traditional & modern restaurants, shopping excursions as well as a memorable experience of the legendary Istanbul nightlife. Next time we’re in Istanbul, we shall be using Ozden and his team again!!

Turkland Travel Agency. My family and I toured Turkey using this fantastic travel agency. And by my family I also mean my three-and-a-half-year-old granddaughter. We toured Cappadocia, Ephesus and two Istanbul city tours with them and couldn't be happier with our choice. Ozden Basak is the owner and our tour manager was Ibrahim Basyesic. Throughout the two-weeks, all drivers, tour guides, flights and accomodations were superior. Literally, there were no hassles and given that we were traveling with a young child, this was amazing! The gentleness with which they treated my granddaughter was touching. I will use them again when I travel alone or with a group of friends. And I highly recommend them for family travel. The guides were first-class and were truly knowledgeable without being boring. We were sad to see the day end but happy to know that the next day would bring about more fun. There are many touring agencies in Turkey. Last year I booked a week-long trip with one only to have the tour cancelled two-days before we were to depart. It was so disappointing! Not with the Turkland Travel Agency. Everything went as planned and the end result was that my family could enjoy the beauty of Turkey without the hassles. It was a rewarding experience!

Tours with Ozden in Turkey. I am have been having Ozden arrange tours for me for over 10 years and love him. He is personable, reliable, knowledgeable, and honest. He goes out of his way to insure everyone has a good trip. And, if you are in the market for a Turkish rug, he is also the one to see. I, and many of my friends, have beautiful carpets adorning our homes because of Ozden.

Introduction to Istanbul. We spent four days in Istanbul with our adult sons and a close friend to celebrate my husband's birthday. Turkland tours provided us with a guide to introduce us to the main sights on this, our first visit to a very beautiful city. They were extremely helpful, flexible, fun and informative. We would certainly use them again and have recommended them to friends.

3 Wonderful Weeks in Turkey. Turkey is our very favorite country we have visited.This is due in a great part to Ozden and Turkland Travel. Through Istanbul, Cappadocia, Pamakkule and the western coast including Ephesus, made our 3 weeks complete with a good overview of the country.He is excellent on suggestions, putting one in touch with very informative people, and his attention to detail provides a complete service.We highly recommend Turkland Travel!

Great tour agency. Ozden Basak booked accommodation and an all day tour for my father and I in Istanbul. It was the perfect experience for our one night stay. We still talk about it all the time, and it inspired me to return to Istanbul several times. I highly recommend that if you are going to travel to Istanbul that you contact Turkland tours to make arrangements.

Ozden Barak Tour Guide Istanbul. Ozden did a great job in taking us around the old city of Istanbul. He is very experienced and knowledgeable of the sites, history, people and culture. He is also very pleasant and fun to spend time with.

Turkey Istanbul to Marmaris. We travelled to Turkey to experience some of the vast scenery and diverse culture to celebrate my husbands 60th birthday... AND THAT WE DID, WHAT AN AMAZING PLACE! Our trip was booked through Fairy Chimneys Travel Australia (Anoush Seifoddoni) ++++. Arriving in Istanbul unexpectedly 2 hours early resulted in our guide not being their to greet us, however such is the grace and politeness of the Turkish (we would not have had this treatment at home!) and a phone call, we were whisked away to our hotel by a most accommodating fellow with much apology along the way.Later in the day we met up with Turkland Tours - Ozden; he was our guide for the next four days of our Istanbul Tour. Charming, charismatic, extremely knowledgeable and FUN are words best descriptive of this man. Our daily experiences of Istanbul in his company are etched firmly in our memory. We experienced the Spice Market, cruising the Bosphorus, Beyler Beyer Palace Istanbul Old City including the Blue Mosque - Hippodrome - Haghia Sophia - Topkapi Palace - Grand Bazaar and much much more. He took us to places 'off the tourist' map ( he read us immediately identifying that we would be up for the experience!) - eating in local restaurants (Sembal Meat House) to allow us to better experience first hand the wonders of this gorgeous city.We left Istanbul after a week with Marmaris as our destination. If you ever get the opportunity to drive the west coast heading south to Marmaris - jump at it. We had a personal guide, Mehmet Küçükbayram, another great person full on knowledge, and entertainment. We took in sites along the way such as Ephesus,Gallipolli, Canakkale, Kusadasi,Pammukale, Izmit, Denizli.This was such an amazing trip; I personally highly recommend to any age group, there is something in Turkey for everybody.

excellent guide. Ozden is one of the few trusted tour people in Istanbul. His advice were valuable. He organized a tour to Cappadocia region and it was really worthwhile, the price was very reasonable. He knows the city extremely well and he treats his clients like his family. I highly recommend Ozden and his travel business.

Made Istanbul Come Alive!. My husband and I had never been to Istanbul. Although we travel a lot, we've never booked a tour anywhere. We are so glad we did in Istanbul. Ozden Basar of Turkland Travel was our guide. He has an encyclopedic knowledge of the city...its architecture, its history, rugs, and on and on. We weren't interested in visiting the Grand Bazaar and Spice Market with him, correctly deciding we could do that on our own. So we spent the day walking around old Istanbul, visiting Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, and other sites. By the end of the day, we were good friends with Ozden and plan to see him again, either in the States, where he travels frequently, or in Greece, where we have a house on the Peloponnese.

Turkland Travel. A group of 4 couples travelling to Istanbul we wanted private transport and tailor made tours. Ozden at Turkland Travel was perfect for us, he was full of good advice and extremely accommodating to our needs. The meet and greet service was perfect, the vehicles prompt, clean and drivers courteous and helpful. Our tour of Istanbul with Ozden was just the right mix of historic content, cultural information and humour. Ozden followed up on everything to check we had all we needed and we knew we could call him anytime for information. Thanks to Ozden and |Turkland Travel we had an amazing trip.

Great tour of Istanbul with Ozden!. Our group of four from California spent a day in Istanbul with Ozden as our guide. We had an interesting, informative, and fun time with him. He was friendly, accommodating, knowledgeable, and had a great sense of humor. Ozden gave us lots of interesting insights about history and local customs. He patiently answered our questions in great detail.Ozden took us to lunch at his local haunt. He hooked us up with a great tour guide for Epheses and a follow up for a meal with one of his law school buddies who owned a Turkish rug company. He also made arrangements for us to have dinner in Istanbul at a restaurant owned by a friend of his. All of these "extras" were completely above and beyond the call of duty for a tour guide. All told, Ozden gets an "A+" from us. We would highly recommend him for your travels to Turkey!

Turkland travel made a memorable trip magical.. We are so blessed to have met Ozden and his crew at Turkland Travel. My husband and I went to Turkey a couple of years ago and Ozden is like family now. Our circumstances were a bit unusual: beyond just a vacation, our trip was also to begin the search for my father's family. My father was born in Istanbul but hadn't been back. We'd been trying to get him to go; until he was ready we decided to go first. Well Ozden took us to the neighborhood in which my Baba grew up, we found his street, took photos of his school, immersed ourselves in his old life. Ozden also set us up to go to Cappadocia, Epheses, and Fethiye on the coast. We took a gulet (sailboat) and traveled around the Med. Everything Ozden suggested and arranged was beyond amazing. We even dined with his family on a restaurant rooftop overlooking Sultanamet! Sadly my father passed before he could come back with us, but Ozden is still a cherished part of our lives. He is even helping me find my Baba's family, something I've prayed for for years. And my husband's upcoming business trip to Istanbul with his colleagues will be facilitated by Turkland. Yay! Ozden and Turkland embody all that is this country and this city of cities: warmth, hospitality, authenticity, essential beauty, and wit. We love Turkland and we love Ozden.

Best tour in Turkey. Every aspect of my dealings with Turkland Tour was excellent! It first started with e-mail communications with Ilker to inquire about the Ephesus tour in Kusadasi. He was always poilte, courteous and communicated effectively and quickly. I also liked the fact that he was willing to work with our group to make slight modifications to the itinerary so that we can see all that my group of 14 people want to see. We were on a cruise and Istanbul was our first stop. We all took a boat tour in this city and weren't too impressed. We figured that Kusadasi would be nice, but overall, we'd feel the same way we did in Istanbul. Thank goodness we were wrong. I think a big part of the reason why our tour was So much more enjoyable was because of Ozden (tour guide extraordinaire!). We had a long list of places to visit and he somehow timed our visits so that it was never crowded or felt rushed. Can you imagine...we were one of the first groups in St. John's basilica with tour buses approaching as we left, no line whatsoever at the virgin mary house, i'd say only a handful of people were at the ephesus ruins. It was so nice to have pictures without throngs of tourists in the way or blocking the view. One of the highlights I have to say on this tour is our private lunch in Ozden's friend's estate where they make and sell carpets. OMG, the food was amazing and the service was superb! We all could not stop eating and teh food and drinks just kept on coming! The dishes were so good, I cry about the fact that I forgot to ask for the recipes. I drool in my dreams about that food. The carpet demo and sale was not pushy at all and if I had some money to spend, I would have bought one. Some people in my group did buy a carpet and they actually received it already, so they were actually faster than their estimated delivery time. I also wanted to note that we had a private shuttle that was clean and very comfortable for my group of 14. After our tour with Ozden, all I could think about was how we are hoping to go back to Turkey and take more tours with him. Thanks for an amazing tour!

Love Istanbul!. I was in Istanbul for a conference and was able to take in several outings. Ozden was SO accommodating about working around my schedule. He knew exactly the right kind of sights to show me and what was the most important. The excursion that stands out in my mind most was the Bosphorus Cruise. We got off at a quaint fishing village, had the most fabulous lunch with a view, and toured the local shops. Ozden's personal knowledge and method of story telling is above reproach! Turkland Tours made all of my hotel arrangements and suggested all the best restaurants and of course included a walking tour. One can't say you've been to Istanbul unless you've been to the Spice Market. Ozden's attention to detail and customized offerings will keep me coming back and referring all my friends.

Istanbul at it's best!. Thank you to Ozden for sharing Istanbul with us with wonderful narratives, humor, and heart. He made our first experience in Istanbul a lasting impression. We haven't stopped talking about our new friend Ozden and have taken away with us a broader view of Turkey, the beautiful people, and life there - in the past and the present. If you do one thing while in Istanbul, don't hesitate to take a tour with this man....he will make your visit feel alive. Thank you for treating us Californian's with such kinship and ease....it was a spectacular experience that we will recommend to all our friends.

Two day tour of Istanbul with Ozden. In late September my wife and I visited Istanbul for the very first time. We are an older couple with some physical limitations. Although we have traveled extensively for more than 50 years we have never used a tour guide. Consequently we were quite uneasy.Ozden came very well recommended by a Turkish friend and a hotel keeper . So we took a gamble and arranged, via email, for 2 half day tours. We consider ourselves very fortunate indeed. Ozden met us, on time, at our hotel and took us on tours of the major sights in Sultanahmet. We was attentive to my wife's needs, he was personable, knowledgable, and spoke English perfectly. We can not imagine a better experience.We would recommend Ozdn without any reservation.

2 day tour. We enjoyed a great 2 day tour with Ozden in Istanbul last August. We were a group of 6 that arrived in Istanbul a few days before we departed on our 10 day Oceania cruise. Ozden met us at our hotel on the first day, took us on a terrific walking tour, set up a dinner that was a highlight of our trip. We travel a lot and hate ending up in the "tourist trap" restaurants. Ozden set up a restaurant that was clearly for locals with fantastic food. He was very eager to ensure that we were taken care of during our visit including transportation around the city, a great boat tour, lunches etc. We also enjoyed Ozdens personable, friendly attitude. He is an easy going fun guide who is well informed about his city and country. He certainly helped get our "trip of a lifetime" off to a great start! Thanks Ozden!

Istanbul tour with Ozden. After spending 12 days on a Silver Seas cruise, we ended our trip with three days on a tour with Ozden. He made our hotel reservations at a wonderful boutique hotel in Sultanahmet, took us to lunch where many locals eat and created a tour that left us quite pleased. He knows the history and answered every question captivating our interest and appreciating the peaceful Muslim country. The Blue Mosque, Haglia Sophia, and booking appointments at the Haglia Sophia Turkish Baths were just a few of the highlights. But, truly the best was Ozden hosting us at a dinner on the holiest day of the year, Ramadan. We also purchased a rug from him which we love. Ozden made us feel so safe and welcome in this beautiful city.I have recommended him to friends, and hope that anyone that travels to Istanbul, gets in touch with him to make their experience as wonderful as ours.

Istanbul with Ozden - A MARVELOUS TWO DAYS. We ended our Windstar Cruise in Istanbul and met Ozden on-line through Trip Advisor. We could not have found a better, more personable, warm, well informed tour guide than Ozden at Turkland Travel. He met us at our hotel, the Biz Cevahir just down from his office in the old city of Sultanahmet. First day we walked and saw all the places of interest, Blue Mosque, Haggai Sophia, Topkapi Palace and other sites. We didn't have to wait in lines, he took us right in! It was evident that he was well known and respected. With wonderfull English, he gave us every detail of every major stop on our tour.He really knows the history of Istanbul! Then on day two he picked us up in his Mercedes and after stopping at the spice market and meeting his friends at a great shop there, we all boarded a ferry for a trip up the Bosphorus to Sariyer where we had lunch. Then back to Istanbul for a visit to the Chora church. In short, if we get to Istanbul again, Ozden will be our first call! He should be yours as well. You will have a wonderful time and more importantly, you will have gained a terrific new friend who cares about you and has your satisfaction as his top priority. By the way, while we are not extensive travelers, we think that Istanbul is the most interesting city we have ever visited. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! Talk with Ozden on line before arriving for an absolutely stress free stay in Istanbul. (See our separate review on the Biz Cevahir hotel) Dave and Brenda, Landisville, Pa.

Custom Tour. Ozden custom tailored our tour to include the sites that were not coverd by the cruise ship tour. I loved hearing the history and Ozden's person views of the sites and culture. Like explaining the grafity at the base of the pillars at The Blue Mosque. He took us to lunch, recommended great restaurants for dinner and planned out next day activities. Great sense of humor. He was the best guide we had on our 2 week 7 different guide vacation through the region.

Private Istanbul and Ephesas tours. We were travelling as a group as part of a Mediterranean cruise with stops in Kusadasi and Istanbul. Ozden and his driver met us right off the ship in Kusadasi and gave a very informative tour of the region and Epheses. Lunch was provided in a beautiful spot known only to the locals. The next day we were in Istanbul and Ozden met us and drove us to a central location. From the we walked around Istabul and toured the top attractions including Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, bazaars, etc. He was informative and had a good sense of humor. Ozden made arrangements for us to be picked up at the ship and driven to a fantastic restaurant for dinner then on to a few clubs later that evening. He also arranged for us to go to the Ayasofya Hurrem Sultan Hamam (Turkish bath) for the next morning.

Ozden and Turkland Tours made my solo travels in Turkey wonderful!. In 2008, I traveled solo for eight days down the western coast of Turkey. I came to Ozden on the recommendation of my sister (who had raved about her time in Turkey and how great Turkland Tours had been). I, too, was very happy that I had come to Ozden! He set up a great trip for me, on which I saw many of western Turkey's wonders (classical and geological). The organization of the tour was superb and the guides extremely knowledgeable. I have sought Ozden's help on travel matters in Turkey since then, including this year (2012) in order to visit more cities on Turkey's coastline, and have never been disappointed. He's great and his staff are kind and professional! Ozden and Turkland Tours have my highest recommendation!

Excellent service from Ozden's Turkland Tours. My 19 y.o. son and I just returned from a first, rather short visit to Turkey; only 1 week - :( But, Ozden's group really made it special for us. Serif provided a wonderful full day tour for us through the primary sites in Sultanahmet. His knowledge of the Topkapi Palace and the other major sites (Hagia Sofia; Blue Mosque; bazaars; etc.) seemed expansive. We enjoyed the anecdotes and his sense of humor throughout a long, hot day. Serif is certainly recommended as a top-notch tour guide! From Istanbul, we went to Ephesus for 2 nights. Ozden arranged for our Istanbul hotel pick-up to the airport, for our guide and driver from Izmir to Ephesus and the drop off from Ephesus to the hotel near Izmir. Everything went like clock work!Our guide in Ephesus was an absolute delight. Her name is Melis Basaloglu and I would suggest requesting her services for any tours in that region or elsewhere. Originally, we had planned on spending two days at the beach, but we had such a good time with Melis that I called Ozden and requested her services for tours of Priene, Miletus and Didyma. Truly, at the last minute, Ozden made the arrangements and Melis showed up at our hotel right on time. So, Thank You, Ozden, Serif and Melis for sharing your fascinating country. Next time we return to Turkey, we will definitely call you - Cappadocia next time???

First-class touring with Ozden. We had the pleasure of spending two days with Ozden after we had completed a 10-day organized tour of Turkey. We had tacked on a couple extra days to spend in Istanbul on our own, and we wanted to make the most of it. And did we ever! Ozden took us to some wonderful sites that we had missed on the organized tour – the most impressive being the Church of St. Savior in Chora with its breathtaking mosaics. It’s in an out-of-the-way neighborhood and truly a hidden gem of the city that we may have missed if we had been wandering on our own. When we mentioned “shopping,” Ozden came through again, escorting us to shops and stores where he knew we could get good bargains. He pointed out the best vendors in the Market, and so our craving for beautiful souvenirs of our visit was more than satisfied. And he took us to two wonderful local restaurants. We can’t say enough about the attentive service that Ozden and his driver gave us. His love for Turkey comes through loud and clear, and we came away feeling the same!

Ozden really takes care of his clients!. Ozden gave my family and me a great one-day tour of Istanbul that was limited in time by our cruise ship. We saw, ate, and shopped much more efficiently with him than we would have on our own or on a group tour. When we returned 7 years later to stay several days, Ozden recommended the best Bosporus cruise and the best Turkish bath in town. Both trips we appreciated his excellent English, love and knowledge of Istanbul, and accessibility. If you want to buy ceramics or rugs, Ozden can advise on reasonable prices, saving you serious $-- he kept me from paying 3x too much for a large ceramic bowl! He is a great travel advisor for a new or returning visitor to Istanbul!

The Best!. We spent 6 days in Istanbul in August 2012, our second trip to the city. On our first (only one day), Ozden showed us around some of the important sites and gave us shopping advice. When we decided to return to Istanbul this year, we immediately contacted Turkland Tours and Ozden. This time, Ozden arranged our lodging and gave us extremely helpful advice for seeing more of the city. He set up a tour of the Bosphorous for us, and also arranged our first visit to a hamam. We would easily put any trip in Ozden's hands; he knows what he is doing, he is prompt and responsive, and he is very thoughtful about your needs. He has a first class operation, and it is wonderful to have a trusted advisor in an unfamiliar city.

Thank You For The Best Week in Istanbul. Turkland Tours was recommended by friends who had visited Turkey a few months before us. We had a Monday to Friday stay in Istanbul and asked Ozden and his team to just arrange everything. Never having been to Istanbul or Turkey before we were a little nervous. It's a huge city after all. Ozden arranged everything to perfection! Personal driver waiting at the airport, wonderful boutique hotel in Sultanahmad with roof top bar and view of dolphins in the Sea of Marmara, two days of privately guided city tours - with Ozden and his A license we passed the longest lines of tourists waiting at Topkapi and Blue Mosque. As my husband noticed: "Living like a Hollywood star!". We felt like A-list! Ozden shared his personal restaurant tips and we fell in love with Sembal Meat House, across from his office. We ended the fun days of sight seeing with apple tea at his office. We spent our last day browsing around on our own, shopping at the spice market, taking lots of photos. By then we felt like locals. We hope to come back to see more of Turkey. We whole heartedly recommend Turkland Tours to make your stay a total success.

Turkland Tours. My wife and I reccently returned from a memorable vacation in Turkey.Our guide, Ozden Basak from Turkland tours was awesome. He was knowledgeable, interested, enthusiastic.Given our short time frame, Ozden created an itinerary that enabled us to see all the improtant sites, provide time for shopping and was tireless in his efforts to teach, educate and provide us with a flavor for the city

Marvelous Experience. We had a marvelous experience in Istanbul, thanks to our guide, Ozden. He is a wonderful guide who showed us around all of the sites for two days. Our only regret was that we we not able to stay longer. He is extremely knowledgeable and his mastery of English is excellent. Not only did we visit the historical sites and museums, but he catered to our individual needs by taking us on wonderful shopping excursions and to authentic Turkish restaurant, all of which were great. It was a fabulous experience and we cannot wait to return.Hope Lefeber

Day trip around Istanbul. We had a day out in Istanbul with Ozden and it was brilliant. We were keen to see a few of the sights ... but also experience the city itself and go off the beaten track. He was brilliant in getting the right balance - and we had a cracking day. Likewise, Turkland couldnt have been more helpful in setting us up for the rest of our trip around Turkey (booking hotels etc) and also helping get my sisters wedding gift back to the UK. All round, fully recommended. Mark S

Ottoman Relics tour and Bezantine Relics Tour. We spent two days in Istanbul prior to our cruise of the Black Sea. We arranged an afternoon tour of the Ottoman Relics for our first day which was Saturday and a morning tour of the Bezantine Relics for our second day. Both tours were booked with Turkland Travel. I checked their web sight descriptions of the tours and the afternoon Ottoman relics tour included the Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar as highlights. I wanted to visit the Grand Bazaar on Saturday because I read that many of the shops are closed on Sunday. Our tour guide informed us that the afternoon tour will not visit the Grand Bazaar. I was very disappointed. After our visit to the Topkapi Palace our tour guide graciously had the bus driver drop us off near the Grand Bazaar but after our visit we had to make our way back to our hotel on our own. That was an adventure and very tiring. The Bezantine Relics tour the next morning did include the Grand Bazaar even though most of the shops were closed. Having already been to the Bazaar we skipped that part of the tour and again made our way back to the hotel on our own.

Wonderful Days in Istanbul. After a National Geographic tour of Turkey, we wanted to spend an extra couple of days in Istanbul. A friend recommended Ozden Basak of Turkland Tours and he agreed to be our guide for those two days. What a wonderful way to end our visit to Turkey! It was a completely customized tour--taking into consideration what we had already seen. Ozden has an amazing knowledge of the history, art, and architecture of Turkey--and especially--the food! He selected wonderful restaurants for us--of different kinds. We all enjoyed the meals immensely, and his help in the bazaar was essential. With Ozden, we had more than a tour guide. We made a friend.

The Turkland Travel Experience. The Turkland travel experience is one the you will cherish for a lifetime. Of course, Ozden and his team are knowledgeable about the history and grandeur of Turkey. But more importantly, what you get with Turkland Travel is a much deeper and more meaningful experience than you will get from other tour organizers. I have traveled extensively with Ozden within Turkey and with others around the world and the Turkland experience is truley unique.What make Ozden so special, is the real personal investment that he makes in you. It was clear from the begining that this was not about money. Tourism in Turkey is not his his job, it is his passion and you feel it when you are with him. Also, while you do see the important historical sites and receive all the knowledge about them that you could every want, he takes the time to take you into the heart of Istanbul and the country as a whole. You go to the places he goes to...you eat drink and play in places that the locals love. You experience Turkey in a way that goes way beyond a guided tour. I can also say that after spending time with Turkland, you will have friends for life. You will become part of the family....and this is what makes them stand head and shoulders above the rest. Of course, it does not hurt that their prices are also great. (-;

Istanbul in June. We had a holiday in Turkey in June. We used Turkland Travel as we had a recommendation from a friend that said great things about this company. We had a private guide in Istanbul called Ozden who was fantastic, very informative and friendly with a great historical knowledge and witty humour. We also absolutely appreciated the suggestions for our spare time and the restaurant suggestions he offered.Also, we were travelling with a small baby and Ozden was always very patient if we needed to stop and attend to our little one. I think Ozden being a family man himself could appreciate our position and we never felt like we were imposing on his time. This was hugely comforting to us.They also organised a trip to Gallipoli for us which was great.

Turkland Tours. My wife and I, along with a set of friends, had a day and a half in Istanbul before leaving on a cruise. We were referred to Turkland Tours by a friend in the States. Ozden, our tour guide, met us at our hotel (Seven Hills) and spent the day showing us around Istanbul. I can't imagine a better way to see all that we saw, both the actual sights as well as the culture. Ozden has spent a lot of time in the United States and was able to make a number of references (including one Seinfeld reference) that help to put the differences in the cultures into perspective.We spent the day visiting Topkapi, the Blue Mosque, the Cistern, the Grand Bazaar (including a number of off the beaten path shops) and had a wonderful lunch at a local (no tourist) restaurant. Later that evening, Ozden dropped us off in Taksim to wonder through the pedestrian walkway.To top things off, the following morning, he had one of his associates meet us at our hotel and walk us to the Aya Sofia to purchase our tickets for us (accredited tour guides don't wait in line). I would thoroughly recommend Turkland Tours and their staff for your needs in Turkey.

Instanbul Tour With Serif and Ozden of Turkland Travel. We were referred to Ozden and his organization by a friend of ours in the states - We spent two long fabulous days with Ozden and Serif - it was the highlight of our trip to Turkey and Spain. I am certain we saw many things we would not of without them and their knowledge of the area and of the history of the historical sites was exceptional. If anyone and I mean anyone goes to Istanbul (I am sure this would be true for all of Turkey) and does not spend time with Ozden and his organization I am certain they will hav emissed a great opportunity. A trip to Turkey must incude tiem with Ozden!

ALWAYS THE BEST!. I have referred many friends to Ozden and to Turkland Tours for different excursions etc. I have friends who used Ozden's and Turkland Tour's services for Airport pick up drop off, daily or multiday Istanbul tours, scuba diving tours, historical tours to many other cities (Ephesus and vicinity, Cappadocia etc) and they all give the highest ratings to his professionalism, his knowledge and his tour programs. He also arranged a tour for me and my husband when we were accompanying a friend visiting from the US. Everyhting was arrnaged according to our wishes with input from Ozden. All we needed to was to pick up our tour packet from his office. We flied to Cappadocia, stayed at a cave hotel with his recommendation, did two days of tours then flied to Izmir where we were picked up and transferred to our Hotel at Kusadasi, Then we did two days of tours in Ephesus, Virgin Mary's house and many other sites. We were then transferred to Bodrum for the last part of our vacation. We were able to do s many things in such a short period of time thanks to Ozden and Turkland Tours. He is "the" choice for any activity for ourselves or for our friends. Thanks Ozden. See you next year...

Great tour. Four of us spent 15 hours with Turkland Tours as we travelled to Anzac Cove and back on the same day. The car was a spacious air conditioned people mover. We were accompanied by Ozden and his driver. The trip was first class and thanks mainly to Ozden - his knowledge, humour and friendliness was outstanding - the 15 hours was not at all tedious. Stops and meals were well planned and enjoyable. In my opinion he would be a great asset for any tourist requirement.

Really outstanding service , a highlight of our holiday. My wife and I were recommended Turkland travel by the hotel we were staying at in Sept/October 2011We undertook a half day city walking tour – Blue Mosque, Sofia Museum, and Cistern.Ozden from Turkland travel was informative, and professional, displaying knowledge, cultural awareness and a keen sense of humor.On the basis of that experience we booked a further 4 day tour to Gallipoli, the Aegean coast, Ephesus and back across country.All arrangments were well prepared, the right balance between information imparted and self discovery was struck and we laughed a lot.An added bonus for us was that Ozden is also a foodie and seems to know all the local specialties in each town we stopped – not tourist restaurants but the popular local favorites – one of the highlights of our holiday.After 4 days with Ozden we had established the basis of a mutual respect and friendship, have corresponded since, and look forward to our next visit.I can unreservedly recommend Turkland to add comfort, safety, knowledge and fun to your holiday in Turkey

Professionals and very friendly. I visited Capadoccia and Galipoli Peninsula with the great help of Turkland Agency, recommended by a friend who spent many holidays in Turkey. It was a great surprise to feel like a member of a family, with really helpful staff and incredible knowledge about Turkey and Turkish history. They had answers to all the questions I had concerning accommodation and transport around the country. I can't wait to go back and see my friends from Turkland!Ana Mihailescu, Bucharest

Knowledgable, Practical, and Friendly. I went to Turkland Travel to help arrange a trip from Istanbul to Cappadocia. Everything Ozden and Ilker set up was just awesome, including the travel, accommodations, and tours. It was an incredible trip, one I'll never forget!But, even more important than the travel logistics, Ozden and Ilker were so warm and friendly—they actually spent time with us. They taught us about Turkish rugs, Turkish history, the people, all after our return to Istanbul. They are a real treasure and highly recommended!

Amazing trip and service!. My experience in Turkey was made easy yet magical through Turkland tours. They set me up with everything that I needed and more, which allowed me to feel safe and confident traveling as a single young woman. Ozden arranged everything I wanted to see in a beautiful package which allowed me to relax during the entire trip. I met friends, ate at amazing restaurants, saw incredible monuments and experienced the vibrant culture of Turkey and Ozden made it all possible. I cannot give more praise to him and my experience and will absolutely use Turkland/Ozden's services in the future!

Turkland Travel - The Best of Turkey. Merhaba! Ozden Basak and his associates at Turkland Travel are wonderful! I was fortunate enough to hear of him through a referral who gave his company high praises. (I should have checked Trip Advisor first!) Ozden handled a number of my travel needs including tours, transfers, and lodging. My trip was flawless and amazing! On the hot air balloon ride he arranged for me in Cappadocia, I learned that the price I paid was over $100 less than what other travelers in my group paid. The guides that he arranged were excellent; spoke perfect English; and added those small but important cultural teaching points. Later, I referred friends to Ozden and he did a private tour for them for two days. They were ecstatic about Ozden's knowledge, friendliness, and professionalism. I would not tour Turkey without Ozden. I will be back as I wish to visit Gallipoli during observation of the centenary memorial services.

One word to describe our experience-- AMAZING!!. Let me start out by saying that my husband and I have traveled the world...and there is no place like Turkey.... and no better person to show us this most fascinating place than Ozden. His historical knowledge and love of the culture was infectious!!! We fell in love with Turkey immediately. We did a private 2 day tour and was able to really take it at our own pace, and really feel the pulse of the city and the vibrant energy that filled the streets. With Ozden's contacts we were able to go behind the scenes and see things off of the beaten path that most would not even know existed. It was an absolutely Fantastic Experience...so great that we will be going back next year ....and will use Turkland/ Ozden without question!Deanna and Joe

Ozden and his team at Turkland are fabulous. We received Ozden / Turkland information from the hotel we were staying at in Istanbul. The experience in Istanbul and later in Copadacia was perfect - due to the professionalism provided by Ozden and his team. I have recommended Turkland to other friends and they also share the same sentiments. In addition, it was wonderful spending time with Ozden, Sam and additional members of the group. We learned a lot, enjoyed ourselves and made wonderful friends. I highly recommend working with Turkland on your trip to Istanbul and Turkey.

great days. Turkland Travel Wow, what a find: Turkland travel and Ozden Basak. Last September my daughter and I booked a two day tours to Gallipoli and Troy which including an overnight stay in Çanakale. In each case the guides were fluent in English and had a comprehensive knowledge of the sites including political, mythological, historic and geologic information which made the experience so much richer. There were two different day tour operators contracted and the transition between the two was seamless. An overnight stay in a five star hotel was arranged and the price came out to be less than that of three star accommodations. There was one mishap in the trip; my daughter was taken ill 12 hours before the start and could not come along. Ozden, through his deep familial and business connections in Istanbul and the travel community, arranged for a full refund of the operators fees for her fare in spite of the short notice. This is almost unheard of in the travel industry.I had a great time and will recommend Turkland Travel and Ozden Basak. P.S. he can also get you amazing deals on quality hand-made carpets. E Richard Power

Absolutely outstanding. We spent several days with Ozden and other members of his company. We generally do not like tours but this was truly outstanding. We got to see a very personal part of Istanbul along all of the memorable famous sites. Ozden is a professional as well as enjoyable to spend time with. I would recommend Turkland and Ozden with no hesitation.

Istanbul - Byzantine & Ottoman Tour. With short notice Turkland Tours was able to put together an 8 hour tour that gave us a chance to see the major points of interest.Ozden our guide was very knowledgeable (he has been giving tours for 22 yrs.) & also very informative about details which we found interesting.His enthusiasm about Istanbul & Turkey shows throughout the time we spent with him. Also his great sense of humor added spontaneity to the day.Ozden took us to one of his favorite local restaurants - they spoke no English & I believe we were the only Americans in there - food was great - neat experience!!We made a new friend in Turkey today- Ozden.I would have to say this was the best tour we have ever taken!!!I would recommend Turkland Tours to my friends & family if they come to Istanbul or Turkey .

Attention to Detail - Best & Reliable knowledge. We are one of the most active Turkey Travel Specialist operators in Australia. All our arrangements in Istanbul, and some in other parts of Turkey are handled by Turkland Travel. Both Ozden and Ilker are true professionals in their roles. We know that we can always rely on them for our clients. They are accessible 24/7 and no request is too hard for them. Anyone wishing to receive 'in depth' service and attention to detail, the address should be Turkland Travel. Thank you guys for your continuous support!!!! Marcus from Melbourne.

Istanbul on the quick. Oz was great. He's helpful, attentive and informed. His commentary on the various sites we visited was peppered with useful analogies of American/Western people/places and things which contextualized and enhanced our appreciation for the sites we were seeing.

An Amazing Day with Ozden in Old City Istanbul. My 19 year old son and I may have just completed our last father-son trip alone. Ozden gave us a trip of a lifetime. He provided us with the most amazing 7 hour tour of the highlights of old city Istanbul. Of course, the sights (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and the Basilica Cistern) were incredible. However, far exceeding the sights themselves was Ozden Basak himself. Without a doubt this was the best guided tour that I have ever been on and Ozden was the best guide that I have ever had. His knowledge, pace, humor, and kindness put him in a class all by himself. Ozden, thank you for providing my son and me a trip that we will forever cherish.

Walking Tour of Turkey. Ozden Basak was our tour guide for a day tour of Istanbul. He was an amazing guide with a good sense of humor, in addition to an encyclopedia of knowledge to do with Turkey and the major sites we visited. He goes at your pace and we had a delicious seafood meal at the Seven Hills Restaurant overlooking the city. He even helped us in buying carpets. Thank you for an unforgettable trip.Emily & David

Istanbul With A Friend. Turkland Tours came highly recommend to us. We opted for two days with a private tour guide. Our experience far exceeded our expectations. From the moment we met Ozden Basek our guide for the two days we realized that within minutes we were with a friend in Istanbul and not a guide. Through the next two days we saw Istabul in a way that would not have been possible otherwise. We even saw some sites off the beaten path. Ozden was attentive to what we liked and quietly adjusted the program to our likes and dislikes. We ended our time enjoying a wonderful dinner together. Turkland is really a people oriented company. Thank-you Ozden. You are a friend for life.

Istanbul - Constantinople. I booked a day's guided tour of Istanbul direct with Ozden following sight of 'Excellent' reviews from other tripadvisor members. I was not disappointed - Ozden's knowledge of the past and the present is superb, be it a complete interpretation of the mosaics in Chora Church or where to eat the best kebabs without another tourist in sight. All this and a great sense of humour and empathy with the needs of the client. Turkland's office is ideally located in Sultanahmet and a great place to chill with some apple tea. I will be back soon and next time intend to take some of the longer tours Turkland offer to places such as to Gallipoli.

Ozden is an expert for travel in Turkey. My daughter and I booked a trip to Turkey (with only a month advance notice after we had a change in plans) through Ozden and Turkland travels on the advice of good friends who had traveled with him before. We were delighted with his detailed plans, including being met by a driver in new locations. We had an excellent day touring Istanbul with Ozden, and so enjoyed his sense of humor and knowledge about Turkish history, architecture and culture. As our friends had assured us, we also felt like Ozden was a great friend by the end of our trip. He was always available by email or cell phone if we had any questions. We appreciated his near insistence that we go to Cappadoccia (I had not been that keen on it beforehand), It was magical!! We did the early morning balloon tour, which was breathtaking - wonderful photos! Take an SLR camera with 200 mm zoom if you can, which helps with the landscape as well as getting closeups of people.I would love to go back to Turkey, and would definitely contact Ozden again for help with arrangements, knowing we now have a great friend in Istanbul.
Fantastic experience!. Friendly and knowledgable, Ozman (Turkland Tours) made Istanbul's rich history come alive.Jorge Chicago, USA

Ozden started as our guide and ended up a friend!. Ozden is a great guide. He knows and loves Istanbul and he loves sharing it with visitors. We really enjoyed our day with him. He made the sites of Istanbul really come alive. I enjoyed talking with him about history and the sites but also about the every life in Turkey. I learned so much and would highly recommend him as a guide! Well worth it!!

The best experience. My husband and I traveled to Istanbul last fall. Turkland Travel was recommended to us by our hotel, Seven Hills. This was the best experience we've had in any country. Ozden is a very knowledgable guide and answered myriad questions we showered him with. Very importantly, he is very passionate about Turkish history, culture and art. He is also an extremely skillful guide. We had a very full program one day. My mom has been a professional guide in St. Petersburg, Russia her entire life. I appreciate what it takes for a guide to present "material" in meaningful way without overwhelming, and finish on time. I don't know how Ozden did it, but we never feeled rushed, although our program was extremely full and busy with visits to mosques, neighborhoods, fortresses, bazaars, museums, etc. and we still managed to have a nice relaxing lunch in a fishing village, smoked hookah and did a bit of shopping. Wow! Our very last day Ozden took us for a tour of the Museum of Islamic Art. It changed my entire perspective on Muslim art. I must say, before that I did not know much about it and preferred western art to anything else. The tour, conducted by Ozden himself, helped me discover and appreciate the Islamic art and see it in social context. Did you know, you can "read" a woman's life story by looking at the rug she made? Not only rugs are stunning pieces of art, they are also communication devices.Ozden made out trip and we are thinking of going back. He will be the first to know!

Ozden showed us a New World that was exotic and historical!. My wife and I were taking a cruise from Istanbul to Venice, but came in early for a tour of Istanbul. It gave us a great 'taste' for such a beautiful city. Ozden showed us the traditional sites, but also took us to some out of the way places and shared personal stories about life in the city where East Meets West. His attention to detail and customization of our short touring time (2 half days) maximized our experience. Ozden's 'boutique' approach to touring made us feel like a long lost friend had come home to family with his warmth and graciousness.Ozden was patient with us as we took many pictures, preferred to not walk too much, and like shopping over museums. He made it all happen on very short notice. One of these days we will return and see more of Istanbul and Turkey!

Visit Turkey with Ozden Basak.. Istanbul is a beautiful city that is surprisingly easy to navigate especially if you have Ozden as your guide. We met Ozden just as we arrived in Istanbul. He served us hot apple tea, made our dinner reservation and familiarized us with the neighborhood. The next day, we were able to see so many sights with Ozden in a shorter amount of time than it would have taken on our own. His love of history and his knowledge of his country's culture and traditions provided so much insight. Ozden genuinely cared that we had a wonderful, safe trip and helped us for the duration of our stay whether we had hired him for that day or not. Most importantly, we had a friend in Turkey and a friend for life.

Wonderful guide and an unforgetable trip!!. Our tour with Ozden was hands down the best part of our trip to Turkey. His knowledge of Istanbul and the things we saw with him kept us in a constant state of amazingment at our surroundings, and his charming personality and near perfect English put us at ease. We feel like we left Turkey with the knowledge and comfort of a local and a new friend.

Simply the best tour operator in town!. We contacted our hotel regarding tour companies in Istanbul and they gave us several options, including Turkland Tours- I got a reply from them within hours regarding my visit and they were so kind and arranged the most amazing private day tours for my husband and I while we were in Turkey. Their prices for private tours were reasonable and our tour guide was incredibly knowledgeable and so professional. We fell in love with Istanbut partly because of the great service. They coordinated everything from airport transfers to a New Years celebration for us. I cannot wait to get back and have them plan some more adventures for me in Turkey!

Golden Review for a Golden Host - Ozden. Ozden and Turkland travel have never led me wrong during my 3 visits to Turkey. Each and every tour is packed full of information, fun and adventure. There is no one that I have met that has more knowledge nor anyone who enjoys the sites more. Even though you know that Ozden has visited thse sites perhaps hundreds of times - nothing is stale! I visited the Blue Mosque, Topaki Palace, Haggia Sophia, and went on a lovely Bospherous Cruise. All were included in the price of the tour. There are tremendous photo opportunities (don't try to take a photo of the gold in the palace - read the signs :)You will need a good pair of running shoes and light jacket if you go when it is not summer. Each place was fully described entertainingly and with wit and wisdom. If you go - say a big hello to all from me!

A friendship created out of the attack at the Istanbul airport. We had reserved and paid a deposit for a 2 day private tour of Istanbul at the end of our cruise. But the attacks happened at the airport and our cruise line rerouted our trip. Azru, the owner, was great about the cancellation. As it turned out she offered some tours and transportation in Athens so as an exchange, she arranged a driver to pick us up at the cruise ship and gave us a lovely tour of Athens before taking us to the airport. That worked very well and didn't have to spend unnecessary hours in the Athens airport. Because of all these changes and the sommer events in Istanbul we exchanged many emails including photos of each other' families. My sincere hope is that we can again travel to Istanbul so I can meet my new friend. This was the terrific result of NOT traveling to Istanbul which is a bucket list for me. We have even discussed some politics!Bev Trojan
Dinner tour & day tour. We took 3 tours with this company. The 2 day tours were fine with Arzu. The evening dining experience was over priced ($125 Am) for poor food and not much information.

Istanbul, the city you want to keep coming back to. I booked the two day walking tour with Walks In Istanbul as it was my first time in the city and I had no idea what to expect. It turned out to be the best decision ever. My guide, Arzu, was amazing, full of knowledge and helpful tips. This did not feel like a regular touristy tour but more like catching up with a friend who shows you around her city. I could not recommend it more.Ps. I booked my ticket 1 day before the coup and I was considering canceling my trip, but I'm glad that I didn't. Going to Istanbul in 2016 turned out to be the best decision I made. Because of a low number of tourists you get to experience the real Istanbul without hordes of people wondering about. You will be able to access all of the attractions without standing in lines for hours and have more freedom as you won't have to plan anything in advance.

Istanbul in August 2015. Our guide Chetum ( sp?) was outstanding, knowageable , sense of humour , perfect english . Always on time. She made the difference for us in enjoying all the sites of Istanbul! WE recommend her and walks in Istanbul highly, Our visit was August 2015

Tour with a friend. Our days with Arzu were like being with a friend who shows you where she lives. It was so low keyed but yet we learned so much. I would recommend her to anyone. She will customize the tour to what you want. Lana

Asian meets Europe. I and my husband booked a two-day trip in Istanbul. We scheduled a private tour with Arzu, who is the founder of Walks in Istanbul. Arzu was an amazing and knowledgeable guide and showed us the whole historic Istanbul on foot. She was full of knowledge about this amazing historic city and she was very enthusiastic about answering all of our questions. Great shopping and great lunch in famous Grand Bazaar. We definitely fell in love Istanbul thanks to Arzu. She was friendly, fun and informative. Thank you so much Arzu as you made our trip unforgettable. Highly recommend Walks in Istanbul!

A local to introduce you to this wonderful city.. Independent travelers, we signed on for the "Express" session for our first afternoon in Istanbul. The Express Tour includes a walking survey of the heart of the old city, an introduction to the fine public transportation system and advise about managing the rest of you visit. Very helpful. Next day we spent a full day with our guide Arzu, doing a Bosphorus cruise and a visit to the Asian side of town. It was an ideal way to start our 5 day stay in this magical city. Highly recommended.

The only way to see Istanbul. Forget the big busses and tour groups. Walking historic Istanbul is the only way to truly experience this wonderful city...and "Walks in Istanbul" does a tremendous job of giving an intimate and thorough introduction to this city of many faces. Our guide, Etem was knowledgeable, friendly, helpful, and fun! Highly recommend!

Excellent experience in Istanbul!. We booked two days with Walks In Istanbul and now are on our way to Cappadocia to discover more of Turkey. Istanbul proved to be a great destination and Walks In Istanbul team made our visit a great success. We recommend their personal services and friendly guides with confidence.

More than I ever expected...it was delightful!. Despite the terrorist attacks the first part of the year my husband, myself and two small children booked two nights in Istanbul for mid-June. Istanbul had long been on my husband's bucket list, and we decided the risk was minimal. Well the first week of June another bombing took place and fear almost won out. After multiple conversations with Arzu, and absolutely no pressure...only sympathy, we decided on a private tour. On June 16th at 10:00 a.m. our full-day adventure began...be sure to pack your walking shoes and take a water bottle. Ebru took us on a wonderful tour of the old city (Constantinople). The kids ran around the Hippodrome, my husband and I marveled at the Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque, and the kids clung to us as we lurked through the Basilica Cistern. The entire time we felt comfortable and were continually amazed at Ebru's expansive knowledge, patience and winning spirit with the kids. We look forward to hopefully returning to Istanbul and seeing more of its wonders with Walks in Istanbul. Arzu and Ebru were a pleasant reminder that we often let our fears of evil override the vast kindness of people and, at the very least, the statistical unlikelihood of being a victim of terrorism.

Full Day Istanbul Walking Tour - Fantastic Experience!. I was recently in Turkey for 2 weeks and spent 4 days in Istanbul. I wanted to see as much of Istanbul as possible in such a short time and scheduled an all day, small group, walking tour that covered a some of the major sites such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazar with a delicious lunch break and finally a short cruise on the Bosphorus. Our Walks in Istanbul guide, Erkut really made this all day tour an exceptionally memorable experience. He was extremely knowledgable, friendly, professional and very considerate towards everyone in our group. I was very happy to have scheduled this tour and highly recommend it to anyone interested in learning more about Istanbul and some of the fascinating sites that make it so special.
A great day in Istanbul. We had a very good experience in Istanbul. We booked Grand Tour of Istanbul 2 days. It included everything we wanted to see. We highly recommend Walks In Istanbul.
LC . We Enjoyed very much the tour and Etem was an excellent guide!A piece of advice : don't have breakfast on the day of the tour ! Allow for many and interesting tastings.

Discovering Byzantium. As an Istanbul native residing in the US, I thought I knew about Byzantine history around the Golden Horn. I realized how wrong I was after our wonderful guide Etem Ozturk amazed us with his vast knowledge of Byzantine history and architecture, not to mention where to get the best coffee and food.

Such a great guide!. We spent 2 days with Arzu in December 2015. She sat with us and got to know about our interests, and then built a custom tour around us. We spent 4 days in Istanbul (the first two with her) and she even gave us suggestions for things to do on our own after we finished the tour with her. We had a great time - we got to see so much and she gave us a great overview of the city and history. She took us to some lovely restaurants and gave us suggestions for other places to try (I can't remember the name of it - but she pointed us in the direction of the best coffee shop near a synagogue - delicious coffee!). It was important to us to support local businesses owned by women, so she made sure to take us to excellent places where we were confident about spending our money. My parents were quite nervous about going to Istanbul, but Arzu helped them to get their bearings and feel safe in the city. They fell in love with Istanbul too and had a wonderful time. I can't say enough about Arzu and her tours - really excellent.
excellent. had a wonderful tour with Arzu - the leisurely pace with the occasional diversion made for an easy and enjoyable morning wandering around Fener and Balat. Will do more walks with her

Fascinating Istanbul. Wow - a day really isn't enough time to explore this amazing city but our walking tour with Walks in Istanbul was a great start! We arrived by cruise ship and we were so fortunate that Holland America decided to stop in Istanbul. The tourism industry in Turkey and especially Istanbul has taken a very hard hit lately and it is unfortunate. Arzu met us at the port and spent the entire day with us explaining the intriguing history of this culturally rich city. We visited all the top sights with very little waiting time - Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, lunch and the Grand Bazaar. Arzu is incredibly professional and knowledgeable. The passion she has for her city was evident. The pace of the tour was perfect - we saw a lot but never felt rushed. We were back at the cruise ship well before all aboard. At no point in the tour did we feel unsafe.Thanks for the great day - I really hope to get back to Turkey. If you travel to Istanbul, I would highly recommend booking a tour with Walks in Istanbul!

Istanbul Tours a spectacular highlight not to be missed. I attend the culinary tour and was introduced to a number of different Turkish special dishes as well as seeing the historical places of interest that Istanbul is famous for. The four highlighted both the tastes and sights of this beautiful city.

Great experience, tailored to our wants. Met us at cruise ship and took tram to mosque. Tram Good ice breaker and got us before mosque crowds. After that God all the highlights and covered items we we not that interested in quickly. Nice retardant for lunch.

Excellent tour with Esin !. I had a great walking tour of Istanbul with Esin! With a limited amount of time, she tailored the tour to my interests. She took me to some lesser known mosques that were absolutely beautiful. We also spent time at the Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar, neither of which I would have ever been able to navigate on my own! Esin clearly loves Istanbul and sharing this love during the tour. She is a wealth of knowledge and her tour was one of the highlights of my visit to Istanbul. I highly recommend Walks in Istanbul. I can't wait to return to Istanbul to explore more of the city with Esin and Walks in Istanbul!

Walks in Instnbul. Our tour guide, Azur met us at the cruise ship, and we started our excellent tour of Instanbul.It was a walking tour which allowed us to see the highlights up close and personal. Our guide was very knowledgable and interesting. She made the history of Instanbul come alive for us. Some of the highlights our our day was visiting the Blue Mosque,the Grand Bazaar, having lunch at a local Turkish restaurant and riding the tram. A very memorable day, and we would highly recommend this tour. Our visit to Turkey exceeded our expectations.,

insider's view of Istanbul. We had two half day walks with ths company and enjoyed them both. They were in depth, personalized and led by a highly intelligent guide. I am a professional guide myself and know what excellence looks like!

Istanbul. This tour encompassed most of Istanbul's most important historic sites and was totally fascinating and really well organised. We were picked up and dropped off by an air-conditioned bus - quite important. Our tour guide managed the group with skill and her knowledge of the history for each venue was clearly explained and really fascinating. I highly recommend this tour.

Fully satisfied!. It was way more fun than I anticipated! I was thrilled at the amount of information, the interesting way in which it was presented, all that I learned, and how Istanbul came alive for me and my group of 12. I thought the guide did an excellent job, including how she kept us all together in very thick crowds and was flexible depending on our interests. I would recommend Walks In Istanbul to anyone!
2 continents. delightful, informative, fun!! We were stuffed when we finished, had seen a lot of Isbanbul and would recommend this to anyone even tho it was a bit pricy.

Istanbul Walk. This walk covered the Grand Bazaar area, and so much more. The leader was knowledgeable, and considerate. I joined a small group of individuals who had registered for the walk, which worked out well. Ii was a comfortable and interesting day.

Informative and enjoyable walking tour. Arzu proved to be an outstanding guide to Istanbul: knowledgeable, friendly and accommodating. Our walk took in all the main Istanbul attractions from Hagia Sofia to the Grand Bazaar, to some less well known sites and eateries that we might well have passed by had it not been for Arzu. Highly recommended!

A great guide for a great city. My partner and I toured the old city and our guide was knowledgeable and empathetic to our personal needs. Our guide made what is a truly beautiful city even better. We highly recommend Walks in Istanbul

Amazing walk from Taksim sq to old Istanbul. Very easy to set up guided walk. Our tour was all based on one email I sent to Arzu while in the us without any payment needed upfront and lo and behold someone met us at the designated time at our hotel there ready to go! Very much enjoyed the professional tour and highly recommend !
History of Istanbul. My husband & I did a good walking tour- very enjoyable , informative , however we did feel pressured to pay for guides meal

Topkapi Palace. We did a private tour of Topkapi Palace. Our guide, Arzu, met us at our hotel and we walked to the palace. She was very knowledgeable and friendly. We learned so much more than we would have on our own.

Arzu was great!. We had terrible weather when we were in Turkey - it's was pouring rain and then it started snowing! We had made all these arrangements with Arzu from Walks in Istanbul, and nothing could happen as planned. She managed to make everything wonderful anyway, and she accommodated our very diverse group wonderfully. She was warm and personable, as well as incredibly knowledgeable about every place we visited. When we go back to Istanbul, I will definitely call her again.

Fantastic day abd a half spent in the company of a most knowledgeable guide. The pleasure of a most enlightened and knowledgeable guide, Arzu, greatly enhanced our visit to Istanbul She was personable and very informative. She engaged with us and adjusted her tour to our specific interests. She was a delight to get to know. My only regret is that we weren't able to spend more time with her!
Extraordinary Tour. Arzu was the finest guide we have had in many years. She tailored our tour of Istanbul exactly to our interests, needs and requests. It was excellent.
Still our hands down favorite!!!. We walked with Arzu for 3 full days - our children were 7, 9, and 11. We all loved every minute of it - can't wait til we return!!!

Worst value "food tour" I've ever experienced. Hundreds of USD to be told "this is Turkish delight" and then have to still pay for lunch and any "tastings" on top of this. Don't bother. You could have a much better experience walking through the market yourself and finding your own lunch.

Istanbul - tasty goodness. We enjoyed a great culinary and cultural tour with Arzu, who was generous in sharing her knowledge of this wonderful city. She also gave us lots of handy tips for the rest of our stay in Istanbul. Recommend doing one of the Walks in Istanbul tours early on in your visit and that way you'll maximise enjoyment for the rest of your stay.

Amazing source of information. I set up two days of tours with Arzu, walking around sites in Istanbul for my family of 7. She was perfect. She is wonderfully knowledgeable, very articulate and incredibly attentive to everyone's needs. Everyone was greatly impressed by her and learned more than we would have in a week on our own. Since I have been home, I have referred two other groups of friends to her and they both felt the same way. She has great pride in her beautiful culture and an exceptional knowledge of its history.

Istanbul Walk Tours. Our tour with Arzu was fantastic. We communicated with her before our trip and let her know what we wanted to see. She went above and beyond our expectations. She took us every place that we wanted to see and also recommended places to eat and what to try. Would use her again if we ever returned to Istanbul.

Best way to get to know Istanbul!. We did the two days Grand Tour of Istanbul and can not speak more highly of the experience. Our guide was totally a gem, highly knowledgable and very approachable. As a small group of 6, we visited the major highlights of Istanbul in a very efficient way, we did not lose a minute. This tour is perfect to get your bearings in this massive city and learn about its history. Our guide was also very knowledgable and interested about the current political atmosphere of the country. We recommend Walks In Istanbul whole heartedly.

Walks in Istanbul - Tours are excellent. Azu was a great guide with a lot of knowledge about Istanbul. The Culinary tour was awesome. We got to try a lot of delicious food. We got to see a lot of very nice areas, streets, shops, restaurants, places. It was a great experience.

Very fortunate to have found Walks In Istanbul. We had a great time in Turkey and the two tours we had with Walks In Istanbul were fabulous. We could not have asked for better guides in Istanbul and in Ephesus. There was no comparison between our time spent with Walks In Istanbul and the other tours that I saw people on. We feel very fortunate to have used their services, we want to say a big thank you!

Wonderful day😊. A great way to appreciate Istanbul. We did the one day Byzantine Istanbul along the Golden Horn.  Our guide was very experienced, very personal and a joy to be with. Her sense of humour, her approach to our requests was something we never experienced in our travels so far. This tour took us to places in Istanbul we never even heard about. We loved the itinerary because we had been to the city three times and this time it as with our parents so they loved the introduction. We received great service from the office as well. We highly recommend Walks In Istanbul. :)

Istanbul Express was a Great Start to our Trip. On our first full day in town, we met Ezel at 9am. First off, she showed us how to get a transit pass, and how to navigate the trolley line-indispensable! Next, she took us into the old town and navigated us through all the major sites. As the tour description promised, we didn't go in, just got our bearings. We were able to return to the sites later in the day after deciding where to spend our time. We were walking down a street and all of a sudden she led us into a quiet courtyard for tea and then helped us mark up our map with ideas for the rest of our visit. A walk through the spice market capped off the tour. We left her at lunch time, and she dropped us off at a very nice restaurant with a great view of the Bosphorus. I was a bit afraid it was going to be "food with a view," but it was quite tasty and not very expensive. We spent the afternoon visiting the sites she showed us, really taking our time. We watched a whirling dervish show she recommended and then grabbed a light dinner at Namli, a kind of mezze deli she also recommended. What a fantastic way to start our trip!

Shore Excursions in Istanbul and Ephesus. Perfect!. The most coherent tour guide we've ever met on our travels so far. With 3 children at tow, we weren’t an easy group to tackle around in Istanbul. Our guide was just on time at the dock with a huge smile, he had our tram passes ready and as we saw our fellow travellers sitting in big buses, we were in Sultanahmet in no time! We were the first ones in the Blue Mosque… you don’t want to be in that line when the busses make it to the old city. It’s been an outstanding experience. We took their guide in Ephesus as well and this time we had a private, comfortable vehicle at our disposal. Our guide has been living in Izmir all his life so he was an expert moving us around and bringing us back to the dock on time! Highly recommend Walks In Istanbul.

Arzu is the best guide ever!. My girlfriend and I did a tour of Istanbul's key historic sites as well as a delightful excursion to the Asian side with a delicious meal at Ciya Sofrasi. We were booked for a group tour but the other party dropped out, so we had Arzu all to ourselves for 2 terrific days!Whether at the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace or the Spice Bazaar (and many, many others), Arzu provided as much historical background as we could absorb while seamlessly supplying context that showed how each stop is relevant to everyone living in and visiting Istanbul today. Arzu's fantastic English, talent for navigating tourist areas, and generally superior approach to her craft - combined with a winning personality that makes her a delight to hang out with in general - makes her the best we've ever seen.When we return to this beautiful city, our first email will be to book more time with Arzu, and we would recommend the same to anyone else planning a visit.(refers to a trip that actually occurred in December of 2014 - sorry for such a belated review!)

Excellent morning with a knowledgeable guide. We emailed Walks in Istanbul asking for a half day tour (we have small children and a whole day is not really viable for us). Arzu responded very quickly and set us up for a tour with Adnan Duvenci - he was great! He met us at our hotel and started the day by helping us work out a small issue we were having there. From there we went to the Blue Mosque, the Cistern, the Grand Bazaar and to lunch. It was the perfect amount of time for us, and Adnan was an excellent guide. Our lunch was delicious - he ordered a variety of local dishes that we had not tried yet. Adnan took great care of us - even calling the next morning with a lunch and itinerary suggestion (which we happily followed). Can't recommend him enough.

Best tour of Istanbul: Walks In Istanbul makes Istanbul come alive!. This was our first time in Istanbul and during our trip we took private or small group tours with 4 tour companies and also did some sightseeing on our own and Walks in Istanbul provided, by far, the best experience introducing us to this magical city from a local's perspective. Our guide (Arzu) was not only knowledgeable and delightful but her love for her country truly brought the city to life. We travel a lot and have taken many tours but this one really stood out: maybe it was our guide's over 20 years of experience as a tour guide, her professionalism or her passion for sharing all of Istanbul's secrets but whatever the reason the day was just magical.Our guide shared with us a wealth of knowledge that was not just relevant but interesting.
