My friend was very interested in the current situation of the country and she was very gracious answering many questions and sharing with us not only Istanbul's glorious past but also it's complicated present bringing the complexities of this marvelous city into perspective and we felt that we got a deeper and more meaningful understanding of Istanbul.Walks in Istanbul tailored the tour to our specific interests and as we learned more about the city and became interested in specific aspects of it's history our guide added sites to our tour that we had not even considered (or knew existed) and even thought the direction of the tour kept changing she always has a wealth of information and anecdotes to share about each site.From the moment we contacted Walks In Istanbul by email they were extremely helpful answering questions, giving recommendations and sending us a list of useful information about the city which was very helpful, specially for someone visiting for the first time. Like I mentioned before we had tours scheduled with different companies and from the moment we booked Walks In Istanbul stood out by their level of professionalism and their sincere interest in ensuring we had a wonderful time in Istanbul.Our experience was so fantastic that my only regret is that we did not book more days with Walk In Istanbul. We did however take their private guided tour on our trip to Ephesus and Tan, our guide there, was also marvelous. Thank you Walks in Istanbul for an unforgettable experience!

Istanbul - Historical background and highlights. Our private tour guide from Walks in Istanbul, Esin Karo, was outstanding. With excellent English, a beautiful manner, and a deep knowledge of regional and local history, Esin was delightful company for the day. I would thoroughly recommend this company if you want to get up to speed on the best of Istanbul in an enjoyable and engaging way.

wonderful guide!. I was impressed with Arzu from our first email exchange, and I'm very glad I followed my instincts about working with her. She is very intelligent, insightful, communicative, and genuine, with a great love of Turkey. She appreciates and understands Turkey on many levels, and her enthusiasm and enjoyment of travel is infectious. We spent the first part of our 6 day visit to Istanbul with Adnan, one of Arzu's colleagues, and he was warm, helpful, enthusiastic, and very positive. Our two days with Arzu were wonderful as well. Any traveler interested in understanding and experiencing Istanbul will greatly enjoy working with Walks in Istanbul.

Guided Tour with Perfect English Speaker. We visited Istanbul around December 21-25, 2015.After watching some Rick Steves videos on Turkey, I decided that getting a licensed, professional local tour guide was the way to go. It's an affordable option and highly interactive way of seeing the major sites. We went with Arzu on a private tour. She led our family of four (my kids 16 and 11) on a 3 hour guided tour of the Blue Mosque, Hippodome, local streets, and Grand Bazaar. The time went so quickly that I wished we had spent the entire day with her.The difference between reading about the history of these sites or listening to it on rented audio devices is the ability to ask questions and get further comment. You can't that with books or MP3s. Nothing can substitute local knowledge and the interaction you get with someone who grew up in Istanbul. I appreciated not only her knowledge but love and pride for this city. Too much bad stuff is happening and being reported in the news. I really needed to meet someone from Istanbul and someone who geniunely loves their city and country. For me, visiting a country a big part of my experience is talking to and making new friends in a new country. We may be different in culture and speak different languages but we all share the same hopes and dreams in life. Meeting Arzu and having her share about the history of a few important places is something I will always cherish.I highly recommend taking a local tour and I recommend Arzu without reservation because her English is perfect and her ability to communicate with fact and passion come out in her tour.

Simply MARVELOUS!. In mid-October, 2015, my husband and I spent three days touring Istanbul with “Walks In Istanbul.” Our pre-trip arrangements were professionally made online with Arzu who promptly answered all of our questions and concerns. Since we had been to Istanbul before and done the “A” list we wanted to see another side of Istanbul. We did, and it was great. For 3 days and one amazing evening, our guide was Etem. Touring Istanbul with Etem provided us with more insight and appreciation than we had from any other guide during our recent one-month trip. We wish we could have had the entire month with him. He is so thorough with profound detail in his commentary, but there is a coherence and eloquence to his delivery that creates a sense of wonder, awe, and appreciation. Because of Etem, we knew how to look at the artistry and meaning of tiles and carpets; we understood what to see and what to look for in a mosque. His pacing is brilliant; it allowed us to absorb details to create firm memories and understanding rather than just see, listen, and rush to the next destination with only a vague recollection of where we had been.  He introduced us to the foods of Turkey and the Monday, “Deep into Islam at Night” venture will be an experience we will never forget. Any and every question we asked received a thoughtful, complete answer that painted a canvas broader and deeper than a mere factual sentence or two. His own appreciation and knowledge of his country and culture was contagious. What's not to love about time with Etem? He's a treasure, truly. After he subtly helped a young American couple who had received terrible advice from a local while riding the tram and whose conversation we overheard, the young woman asked me if he were my son. I only wish! Needless to say, we were more than pleased with everything “Walks in Istanbul” provided us on this trip. When we visit Istanbul again, our first contact will be Arzu.

Tailor made. Great tour with Arzu, we have a boisterous 6 year and she designed a tour to accommodate him and our needs to understand the history of the places we saw. She gave a thoughtful, insightful account of the places we saw and their history and introduced our son to an old Turkish toy that sometimes displaces the iPad. Highly recommended.

Inside tips by a ocal who loves her city!. My friend Melissa and I went on a walking tour with Arzu yesterday, mainly to discover some of the mouthwatering food that Istanbul has to offer. We were 2 minutes in the tour and already entered our first stop, where we had that amazing buffalo creme with honey and a tea. Great start of the day and the tour. It only went uphill from there :-)Arzu is passionate about her city Istanbul and eager to share her knowledge, her views and opinions. And this is what a really liked about the tour... a guide who feels like a friend taking you out and showing you around.As a fulltime food traveller, I go on food tours regularly and this tour I definitely recommend when you are in Istanbul!

The best and only way to see Istanbul. If you want to see the "real" Istanbul, it's history and culture, be sure to contact Walks in Istanbul. Thay will tailor make a tour to meet your needs, completely different from the standard tours which are done by so many other companies.If you have a desire to see some of the older parts of Istanbul as well as the astoundingly beautiful tourist attractions don't hesitate in contacting them. We did a full day walking tour around Istanbul and got to see the beautiful old church of Saint Salvador de Cora with the unbelievable Byzantine artwork as well as Santa Sofia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Cistern just to mention a few.

Ebru Gokteke, as good as a tour guide can be. We arranged for four days of private touring with Arzu Tutuk. Arzu was very prompt and helpful in designing itineraries for our tour days. As we neared our departure date, there were some issues that arose for Arzu and she asked Ebru to act as our guide. How lucky were we! Ebru is extremely knowledgeable about history, architecture, religion, current events (and, I am certain, many other subjects). She provided us with such a grand introduction to the incredible city of Istanbul. She speaks English beautifully. She is energetic and engaging, knows many, many people in the city, and has an incredible knowledge of the streets of Istanbul. Our itineraries were rather full, but Ebru found ways to adust things to provide us a first rate time. She introduced us to our neighborhood the first day (this was an impromtu addition to our schedule) and she added to, and subtracted from, the initial schedules in small but useful ways. She took us to excellent restaurants for our lunches and pointed out various other good places to eat. Ebru's love of her city is evident at all times. She has a great talent for reducing complex matters to understandable, intellectually digestible portions. Then, if you want more detail, she is ready to provide those details. Obviously, she knows much more than we could absorb, but her guidance made our trip to Istanbul so much more than it would have otherwise been. In addition to providing a truly first rate touring experience, Ebru was also a very delightful conversationalist with opinions and insights. While private tours are not cheap, the cost for the tours was very reasonable given how much we learned. If you can, hire Ebru or Arzu to guide you through Istanbul. It is more than worth it.

World-class Tour Guide.. Arzu of Walking Tours in Istanbul offers incredible value for money: our time in the city simply would not have been the same had we not done this. Read on.We asked for a tailor-made tour: a quest for lost Constantinople. Not a tour of the Top 10 most famous sites in Istanbul but a walk off the beaten track. It turned out to be far more substantial than we could have imagined and I would encourage anyone to ask her to repeat it: Arzu knew exactly where to find the ancient city today; the areas and places where the descendants of the Greeks live and worship now, and the remains, that you overlook but were once crucial.Starting with a cab ride from Fatih along the Bosphorus to our starting point by the Byzantine city walls, Arzu, a native Istanbulite, told us of the change the city and she has seen in modern times and what it was like just 20, 30, 40 years ago.Going further back in time, on our walk along the walls she brought to life the siege of Constantinople and heroic tales of the assault and defence in this struggle to the death for supremacy of one of the most beautiful capitals of the world.Our visit to the Chora church was equally vibrant and enlightening as she interpreted the story told by the mosaics and the true significance and meanings of Orthodox Christianity at that time, drawing parallels to religion and concepts of faith over the centuries.For all I know, Arzu is probably secular and an atheist but, as she pointed out, she can believe in people believing, and how that makes the miraculous come true (for them). She literally opened doors, including into a closed-off Greek church to see what is said to be the Pillar of Flagellation; brought to Istanbul by Empress Helena, I think, this is the stone where Christ was whipped. The sanctity was palable and the place certainly revered by the old janitor.Passing the last remaining Greek school and the residence of the Patriarch of Istanbul, Arzu told us of the political and cultural exception this community benefitted from under the sultans and, indeed, to this day. She also explained the challenges it faces as the numbers of men called to priesthood grow rarer and of the difficult and complex search for a new patriarch.Walking the Fenel and Balat neighbourhoods, she pointed out how each is distinct and how the heritage can change dramatically from street to street. With Arzu we saw the development some of the most conservative areas undergo; young hipsters would suddenly replace traditionally dressed elder gentlemen and working women. (In one street we came across several good-looking coffee bars and one micro-roastery, The Coffee Department, which I can strongly recommend).We had seen Hagia Sophia, the Basilica Cisterns and all the major sites on our own, but with Arzu we saw the Istanbul I liked the most. One we would never have known otherwise.At the end of the day we went back to Fatih to squeeze in a last minute visit to the Grand Bazaar: again Arzu’s suggestions (a fine craft department store (with an excellent and great value for money roof top restaurant) and an outstanding antique dealer) by the entrance to the Grand Bazaar were really so much better than the well-known destination.Arzu didn’t just give us plenty of value for money: she’s a great lady, very, very smart and knowledgeable, and really, really nice.I can’t imagine returning to Istanbul without going with Walking Tours again, and I will tell anyone I know going to get in touch and book Arzu.

Special, insightful, a true delight and well priced!. We had a great experience with Walks in Istanbul. Our communication was flawless, rapid and in depth. Arzu really worked on every detail: she provided us Museum Passes, Transport Cards and FREE internet access. Her recommendation for the birthday dinner of my partner was delightful. She was our personal concierge for Istanbul which made our visit so easy. We had three guided tours in Istanbul.Topkapı was overall our favourite, our guide took us to the Harem while all other tour parties waited at the Treasury to see a single diamond. Our Hagia Sophia visit included the Gallery ( again many tours just didn't climb up) and we were able to see the magnificent mosaics. Our guides had access for priority admission so we never waited in lines. We had a life-time experience in Istanbul, thank you!

Istanbul tour. Arzu and Walks In Istanbul are great. Arzu is professional, knowledgeable and friendly. We thoroughly enjoyed the two days we spent with her. On the first day she met us punctually at our hotel and guided us through some of the highlights of the city. On the second day she gave us a fabulous tour of more highlights and we also got a great tour of some quieter sights. Walking and using public transit was a terrific way of getting a real feel for the city. Arzu's impressive knowledge of Istanbul and Turkey's history really enriched our time there. We highly recommend Walks in Istanbul.

Amazing! Simply Amazing!. Unquestionably the best guided visit to a city we have traveled to. We just got back from a five day visit to Istanbul and can't say enough good things about Walks In Istanbul . The pro-active service from Arzu has been excellent. From beginning to end, we felt her personal touch. The website is easy to use, booking a tour is speedy and we were able to enjoy one tour in privacy and one tour as a shared small group. We loved both. The small group was only 4 people so it was still intimate. On both occasions, our guides were wonderful and engaged us immediately. They have a passion for Istanbul and a huge knowledge of the culture, history, architecture and the local customs. They are locals from Istanbul.Overall, we loved our two tours and will recommend Walks In Istanbul to anyone! Go for it.

Incredible and off the touristy trail!. Arzu is the owner of this company. She provided my husband and I an insightful tour. She is very knowledge and thorough. Her English is perfect. She checked in with us and since we were staying by the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topaki, she suggested we could do that on our own and more of a less touristy route. It was Perfect! We strolled down the Hippodrome with the Obelisk.She took us to a cemetery headed towards the Grand Bazaar. We went to Sulyeman Mosque which was not crowded inside. She pointed out all the essentials motifs inside, the rituals so we were now equipped to understand any mosque we entered. We had an amazing lunch by the University area. We taxied to the Church of Chora, which had beautiful murals and well worth the trip. We walked towards the Ottoman Wall and took the Golden Horn Ferry back. We had gone on our own to the other touristy sites. I am so glad Arzu skipped them. They were crowded and beautiful but we would have missed out on an intimate tour. Thank you Arzu!!!

If you don't do this tour you will miss so much of Istanbul. This was our second visit to Istanbul in two years so we had done a lot of the typical first time tourist things.This time we had three days in Istanbul and wanted to spend one day seeing things behind the tourist areas.I had some idea of where we wanted to go and left Arzu to provide me with a proposal.She arrived on time at our hotel at 9 am and full of enthusiasm about the day's activities.She showed us how to use the public transport system using the equivalent of the London Oyster card and this saved us money and time.Everything that other reviewers have said about Arzu was our experience. She is a delightful person with years of experience in the tourism business and she knows Istanbul and Turkey. Her knowledge of history and an ability to explain the politics and religious mix in this complex country was so informative.We wanted to see the old Jewish quarter (Balat) and all three of us actually learnt something new. We visited Greek churches that pre date the Ottoman Empire and were certainly not on the tourist trail.We had lunch a local cafe and learnt so much about the local culture and life challenges.Arzu took us to the Asia side and we were blown away by the vast difference in living. Although I can't recall the name of the boulevard suffice to say that it was nothing like anything you see on the European side and certainly not on the tourist list. This was local Istanbul and the contrast to the European side is unbelievable.If you can make time to book a tour with Arzu you will come away with a more fulsome understanding of this amazing city.We have done a few local tours in cities and this is one of the best.

3 day tour in Istanbul. I spent three full days in Istanbul and we had Arzu as a tour guide. She was exceptional. Arzu is really knowledgeable about Istanbul's and Turkey's history. She transmits her knowledge in a way that wakes up one's curiosity about Turkey and all the history surrounfing it. Arzu is also very flexible on her tours, and she can tailor them around your own interests. I really recommend her. She made our time in Istanbul very special.

The highlight of our Istanbul experience. Sure you can wander through Istanbul's historic treasures with a guidebook in hand (or even use an audio tour in some,) but a day with Arzu is so much better for so many reasons. First of all, her knowledge brings the history and art alive. We learned so much from our time with her about both Turkey's past and present She shows you things you would never see on your own. She helps you see more because she knows how to avoid the lines and tour groups. And she gave us advice for things to do and see on the days we were not touring with her. She is smart, fun and flexible-- and her English is perfect. We highly recommend Walking in Istanbul.

Ebru Goktekeis...an amazing guide. My reviews of Istanbul may be sounding a bit repetitive but there must be a reason. And that reason is people like Ebru. She was absolutely amazing! She is an authority on the history of the area and was never at a loss for an explanation for any question we had.She was punctual, friendly, and scholarly. She was literally an encyclopedia of information. I believe that if I had attempted to see the historical sites of the Blue Mosque, Ayasofia, and Topkapi Palace on my own I would have wasted my time. There is just no way I could have learned that much on my own. Because of her narrative I was able to see these 3 places in one day instead of two and not only saw them but experienced them. I paid for a private tour so it was a little pricey for just two people but I would have to say worth every penny...there is just no better way to see these sites than with a guide of this calibre. Thank you Ebru for an unforgettable day.

Best way to see the parts Lonely Planet can't give you. We spent a fabulous day with Arzu walking through Balat and Fener. As an Istanbul resident, I'd seen much of what we saw before -- however, doing the walk with Arzu made me to see it in a new light. She was informative, patient (we were with a five-year-old), accommodating and, most importantly, knowledgeable and great company. We went to Cora Church and she told us the fascinating stories of the mosaics - both, their construction and the stories held within. We visited the city walls, and churches / mosques we had no idea existed. Truly, outstanding. Your day and your visit of Istanbul will be enriched with a day walking with Arzu.

Informative and Enriching. We are 2 couples in our 60's who have just completed 2 1/2 day walks with Etem - A Culinary Tour and The Topkapi Palace and Harem. As a result, we have come away with an incredible amount of knowledge on this fantastic city.Etem is a walking encyclopaedia! His stories on historical figures brought familiar names and places to life. We quizzed him about everything from Turkish politics to food to architecture to history and he gave easy to understand, objective explanations that gave us the ability to put Turkisk history and life into perspective.Our culinary tour introduced us to amazing spices and how to properly use them; the best places to get street food like pide amd stuffed mussels that were mouthwateringly delicious; the Turkish restaurants that cook "home style"; and where to get the best sweets such as Turkish baklava and Turkish delight. A morning of pure gourmand heaven!The Topkapi Palace covers 3.5 square kilometres. Etem took us into amazingly interesting parts that I am sure we would have missed and gave such insightful explanations as to the "Infrastructure" of a Sultan's life and lifestyle. We felt we had a far better understanding of how Turkish history evolved.We will return to Istanbul at some point in time and when we do, Walks in Istanbul will be top of the list. Thank you Arzu for your extremely helpful suggestions and Etem, thank you for 2 incredible days.

Ebru Goktekeis a Great Guide. We arranged for Ebru to take us on a full day tour of historical Istanbul before we left home. She kept in touch with us until we arrived and turned up promptly on the expected day, and spent the whole day with us. She was so informative and so helpful. She showed us around the 4 main sites - the Hippodrome, the Blue Mosque, the Cisterns the Topkai Palace and the Hagia Sophia, and then gave us really useful suggestions on where to go next. Even better - she took us to a fabulous restaurant for lunch, away from most of the tourists with fabulous food and very reasonable prices. It was at the top floor of a very classy Department store and Art Gallery, and we would never have found it on our own. Ebru's knowledge and her enthusiasm to share it made our visit to Istanbul a great success

Walks in Istanbul is like visiting an old friend. I recently traveled to Istanbul with my mother for a quick three-day trip around the city. We were introduced to Walks in Istanbul and Arzu by a close friend in the United States and weren't disappointed. In my opinion, there is no better way to see a city than with someone who is local to the area. Not only did Arzu show us the best of what Istanbul has to offer, but she also made us feel like we were old friends and made herself available via WhatsApp to answer questions and offer up recommendations as we continued our trip through the city.

Excellent service in a fantastic city!. We had just two days to spend in this wonderful city so on the recommendation of a colleague we contacted Arzu. She was extremely helpful in answering all our questions prior to the trip and she arranged an excellent guide for us in the person of Etem. He was extremely knowledgeable and conveyed this knowledge in an easy and clear manner such that those of us not as au fait with Istanbul history as we perhaps should have been were suitably enlightened. He also took us to two excellent eateries, one on the European side and one on the Asian, where we sampled local cuisine we would have almost certainly not ordered had we been left to our own devices - and we would have missed out on delicious food!All in all I can only recommend Istanbul. A real mix of cultures and history seeping out of the walls. To get the full value from a short visit (not to mention the ability to skip long queues) a guide is a very valuable asset. Arzu and her team are the perfect choice in this regard - you need look no further!

A wealth of knowledge with the ease of friendship & a touch of humor. My adult daughter and I spent a full day with Arzu on our first full day in Istanbul. Being in business for 17 years she has a wealth of knowledge, love of the history of her country tinged with the ease of a traveling companion. By the time we finished our day with her we had visited 3 major sites, learned about the culture, spent time having a leisurely lunch in a garden ,and shopped at the Grand Bazaar and Spice Market visiting high quality, very helpful, fun, shop owners. She provided us with suggestions & public transportation tools for our 2nd day. Felt we had made a friend by the end of our day.

With only two days, we enjoyed a variety of sites, tastes and aromas. Arzu was a wonderful guide, taking my husband and me under her wing and, at the same time respecting my pace ... sometimes I needed a rest stop and sometimes needed to take the time to get the right photo. She was knowlegeable but knew how to choose interesting details rather than overwhelming us with them. She arranged for us to enjoy an evening culinary tour with her colleague, Adnan, who was equally well-versed. What I liked most was how both of them tuned in to what we were saying, and proceeded to go on with the tour while flexing the schedule to our needs.

Fantastic two day walking tour with Etim. Istanbul is a fascinating places with a huge history behind it. You can stand and look at all the buildings but if you don't hear about their histories you a missing a huge part of the enjoyment of being there. Having a great guide is a a great help. We witnessed some not so good guides leading other groups giving very basic explanations. In Etim we had a guide who knew everything about everything. We were a group who would ask alot of searching questions but he knew the answer to everything. It was something he just learned off. He knew the information and was able to put it in great context. His English was perfect. Would pass as an American no problem. I thought I knew a fair bit about Istanbuls history but I came away learning loads more. We had two lovely lunchs. The whole day was paced really well. Really I couldn't even suggest an improvement. It was from 09:30 to 16:30 and picked up from the hotel. Thats about a perfect amount of time. You get great exercise without wearing yourself out. I'll have very fond memories of Istanbul. It's an exotic city. Real east meets west. Alot less hassle than I thought it might be. People are friendly. Prices are great. Food is very good. It's a buzzing metropolis a mixture of the ancient and modern. It felt safe. The Aya Sophia is amazing, the great Mosques are splendid and the Topaki palace is a beautiful spot.

Family Vacation in Istanbul Amazing!. Walks in Istanbul tour, was the highlight of our journey the fantastic guides were professional and loved their country and it showed. Having a private tour is the only way to see this historic city from the Blue Mosque to Asian side it was breath taking. We never stood in line and their expertise in maneuvering around this busy city was awesome! We never felt rushed and could truly enjoy every stop, If your planning a trip to Turkey I highly recommend Walks in Istanbul, Arzu and her team are a class act!The Phalan Family

Amazing two day walking tour. My husband and I had an amazing time exploring Istanbul on our two day walking tour with Arzu as our guide. Arzu provided us with more than just a history of the places we visited, she also gave us insight into Turkish culture and Islamic practices today. We loved that she took the time to recommend restaurants near where we were staying and teach us how to use the public transport system. It was a great two day tour. I would recommend Arzu's tours to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Walks in Istanbul is a great way to see Istanbul. Walks in Istanbul is a real walking experience, unlike other companies in Istanbul. With Arzu you see and feel Istanbul. She and her team are very experienced guides and knowledgeable locals who gave us an insight into life in Turkey.She is very generous with her information, suggested less touristy places to visit and where to eat. Arzu is very professional, speaks flawless English and never pushes for more business. Of course, you are likely to do more tours with her because her tours are so interesting.

Excellent tour with an excellent guide. We did a half day private tour of the Blue Mosque and enjoyed it very much. Our guide Ebru was very knowledgeable, insightful and friendly. I appreciated the fact that she wasn'the afraid to share her opinions with us, both positive and negative. Arzu in the office was communicative and helpful in organizing the tour.

Fascinating day in Istanbul. We had the most wonderful and informative day on a walking tour in Istanbul, with Etim as our guide.He showed us some of the highlights of the Bosphorus, on a boat and ferry tour, then took us to the Spice Market and Grand Bazaar. Etim is incredibly knowledgeable.A graduate in economics with a special interest in architecture, Etim has an in- depth knowledge of everything related to Istanbul, from cuisine and architecture, to history, transport and economics. He opened our eyes to features of Istanbul that we would never have found on our own or on a more general tour. Highly recommended! Our only regret is that we did not engage Etim's services for two days, instead of only one.
Great Tour. We had two days of private walking tours in Istanbul and it was fantastic. We covered so much ground and had a very knowledgeable guide. Highly recommended!

Excellent in-depth tour of Istanbul. My husband and I spent two fact and fun filled days in Istanbul with an outstandingly knowledgeable guide. We learned about the long history of the Ottomans, about architecture, the finer points of making carpets, the best place to buy jewellery, a delicious shish kebab restaurant - in fact there was nothing our guide didn't know. I can heartily recommend the guides and service given by this company

Hire a private tour !!!!. How often will you be visiting one of the great cities in the world. We wer three people and our private day tour cost us $ 350.00. It was money well spent !!!! We went to both mosques and the underground cistern as well as the palace. Wonderful look at the culture with a great guide.

Perfect first day in Istanbul. We spent a wonderful first day with Adnan in Istanbul. He was knowledgable in all cultural and historical aspects of Turkey and was very responsive to our interests and preferred style of travel. Simply getting to the front of the lines at popular landmarks was great, but Adnan added the texture, perspective and richness to maximize our experience. I would highly recommend Adnan and Arzu's staff to anyone visiting Turkey.

Probably the best way to get around in Istanbul.. We have booked a one day private tour and visited the Sultanahmed Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome, the Underground Cistern / Sunken palace, Galata Bridge, Grand Basaar, Rustem Pasha Mosque, and some spectacular rooftops. Our guide Adnan has made this day was a very special experience with lots of insight information. We saw so many interesting places in short time, learned a lot and also transport between locations worked seamlessly. No stress at all - it could not have been any better, especially as Adnan was so flexible and accommadating all our wishes. We had great food and enjoyed the day very much - we will definitely get back in touch with WalksinIstanbul when we are in Istanbul next time.

Best of the best sites with Arzu!. I am a guide for an American company that takes small groups overseas and this was our second time to Istanbul, in which we used Walks In Istanbul to see Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Bosphorous boat tour, and Spice Market with Arzu. Again, fabulous! Dependable, knowledgeable, enthusiastic, and.... so good that my parents will be using Walks In Istanbul when they visit next fall.

Ensure you walk with 'www.walksinistanbul.com'. We were visiting Istanbul for three days before joining our cruise and allocated one day for doing the 'tourist attractions' but wanted to do something 'off piste' and on friends recommendation contacted 'wwwwalksinistanbul' who offer a 'culinary' walking tour. This proved to be an absolutely fascinating way enjoying many food experiences with an excellent, knowledgable, guide, including having our Turkey coffee cup 'read' by our guide.Great way to spend a day in Istanbul Ols Town

Fabulous walking tour with Ebru. We did a custom tour of Hagia Sophia, the Cistern, Spice Market and Bosphorus cruise with Ebru. My family of four found Ebru smart, knowledgeable, and very fluent in English. In addition to sharing her knowledge of the historical sites, we learned so much about the politics and social undercurrents in Turkey. It was fascinating to listen to Ebru about her life in college and how she is perceived as a woman in Turkey today. Our lunch at an the Deraliye Ottoman restaurant near the Sultanahmet tram stop was a real treat. It was a great day and we were entranced with Istanbul by the end of the tour.

Exactly what we were hoping for!. Short version: We had an outstanding time with Adnan! Details: My wife and I were ending our cruise in Istanbul and wanted to spend a few days exploring the city. I started out looking through Trip Advisor and after reading many reviews, I decided that I liked what others had said about Walks in Istanbul. I sent an email and within a few hours I had received a response from Arzu. Arzu asked about what we would like to see and do, and with that, made recommendations. We decided on two days, and since our hotel was not within walking distance of the sites, she recommended that we also get a private vehicle. Arzu used PayPal for payments which made the transactions quick, easy, and painless. When we were on our cruise we discovered our friends had not made any plans for their time in Istanbul so I fired off a quick email to Arzu to ask if I could add two more to the tour, and of course I heard back right away that it would be no problem.Adnan was our guide for the two days. He picked us up at our hotel and as we drove to meet our friends, I could tell right away that Adnan was a perfect guide for us. He has a wonderful personality that fit wonderfully with our group. Adnan not only took us to the major sites (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace, Spice Market and the Grand Bazaar), but to the quieter Asian side where we meandered through the streets, explored a few shops, and even had morning tea like locals. We thoroughly enjoyed his knowledge of Turkey, the city and its people, along with his in-depth understanding of its history and his ability to communicate that in a style that we all enjoyed. In addition to the tour, Adnan made reservations for us at Turkish bath (hamam) at the conclusion of our second day. He also recommended and made reservations at a great rooftop restaurant where we had the most excellent fresh sea bass. This was perhaps our best meal of our trip, with the excellent back drop of the Bosphorus on one side and the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque on the other; all at sunset! Perfect.I highly recommend Walks in Istanbul and our guide Adnan Duvenci! It was an experience we will not soon forget! Thank you for sharing your city with us.

Informative and friendly. Arzu's guide Ebru was extremely knowledgeable and informative with very pertinent and tailored coverage of content. Her educational background afforded her the ability to really share deep insights into the Islamic faith through Turkish history as well as the contemporary context and its relevance to current politics... fascinatingAlthough marketed as full day tours I think both days ended up finishing reasonably early. Food was always delicious!

A very enjoyable and stimulating learning experience!. My husband and I, who had previously visited Istanbul twice before, spent the few last days of a wonderful cruise tour in Istanbul. We spent two full days with Ebru, our guide, and another traveller, discovering more about culinary Istanbul as well as the non-Ottoman part of Istanbul. Ebru was an extremely knowledgeable guide, concerning Turkish cuisine but especially about the history, religious influences, and political issues of Istanbul and Turkey. It was wonderful to discover other parts of this fabulous city with someone who could give us a much deeper appreciation of the sites of Istanbul. ! We would fully recommend her!

Great intro to Istanbul with your own guide!. We chose Walks in Istanbul because they use native Istanbullus AND you pay for the guide - not per head – 250 Euros for our morning culinary tour – a great intro to the city. The lady Arzu Tutuk who runs the company responded quickly to my initial email and anything else – the whole experience was very straightforward. We really liked Esin our guide – cool, intelligent, knowledgeable, and she spoke very good English.We visited/ ate / bought stuff at a: • Simit stand• Fish market in Karaköy • Tripe soup restaurant in Beyoğlu• Coffee shop in Beyoğlu – the one where the bull can stand on the coffee • Coffee store – Mehmet Effendi in Eminönü• Pastrami Deli in Eminönü• “White tulip” Bakery in Eminönü• Ayran(yoghurt drink) and pizza café in Eminönü• Lokum(Turkish Delight) and spices from the Spice market Top stuff!!

Ottoman sightseeing. Overall we enjoyed our experience with Walks in Istanbul Tours but we were disappointed that Arzu was busy on the day our tour was scheduled so we took a tour with a friend of hers. Our tour guide was mostly kind and incredibly knowledgeable, taking us to many wonderful sites and great restaurants. At times however, she was cold and combative, at one point even accusing one among us of being ‘close minded’ for asking a question about street dogs. Arzu is clearly an amazing guide based on the reviews here alone, so in retrospect we are disappointed that we didn’t end up getting her as our guide. I would encourage others to take this tour, but ensure that Arzu is going to be showing you around.

The best way to see Istanbul. We had 2 days with Arzu who was our guide - she really brought Istanbul to life. She's so happy to share all she knows about this fascinating fast paced city; took us to really good local restaurants for lunch - walking is the only way to do it. Thank you

Leopards in the Old City and Asia. A large number of the Australian Army Rugby Union Old Boys Leopards touring party conducted a special 'off the beaten track' tour of Istanbul. Many had visited the larger and more popular tourist attractions so at short notice the tour guides made plans to conduct a back streets and food tour of Istanbul that included the Old City and across the Bosphorus to Asia. Our guides were friendly, courteous and knowledgeable and made sure that we missed nothing along the way and in the process avoided queues and people. Maree and I would say that this was one of the best days we had in Turkey and the history lessons and clarifications were superb. We would highly recommend Walks in Istanbul to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Excellent Tour. We did the 1 day walking tour of Istanbul. We walked about 12 km and saw everything. The guide explained everything as we walked. I would recommend this to everybody who visits Istanbul.

Wonderful introduction to Istanbul. Thanks Arzu for a great day walking the beautiful streets of Istanbul. Azru was able to cater to our groups wants and take us off the beaten track and across the Bosphorus to see how the people of Istanbul live. I thoroughly enjoyed her knowledge of the city and its people along with her in depth understanding of its history. Azru has an infectious personality and is able to fluently converse with her walking group. She was a pleasure to be around and I would absolutely recommend her private tours. Thank you Arzu.

Oustanding Tour of Istanbul. Simply outstanding. Arzu was great in communicating with us prior to the tour and then on the day. We had a large group and she arranged for our group to be split in two with another outstanding guide. She also accommodated the fact that many of us had been in Istanbul for a few days and seen many of the 'core' attractions and quickly re-jigged the schedule and route to provide us with a different tour of Istanbul from what we had originally booked. Throughout the tour she gave great insights and managed the competing interests of the group very well. The day ended with a ferry ride to Asia and a walk through the markets - which was a great way to finish the day and see a bit of Istanbul we might have otherwise missed. All in all a great day had by all.

Brilliant introduction to Istanbul. I booked a two day tour as I would be on my own during that time, it was great, Ebru gave us the history of the city and it's ancient buildings and insight into the social, cultural and religious side of the country, her love and enthusiasm for the city was infectious. She chose fantastic places for our lunch and explained all the food so we could try authentic Turkish food. The icing on the cake was a visit to a Turkish bath she had recommended the following day, bliss!I will certainly book again when I return to Istanbul for another visit.

Learn about Istanbul's history and backstreets from a local expert!. Arzu Tutuk led our group on a two-day tour of two historic neighborhoods of Istanbul on her 'Constantinople before the Ottomans' tour and historic Sultanahmet tour. The first tour took us to the Chora church, past the Theodesian Walls and through the bustling Balat neighborhood plus the Sulimanye and Rustem Pasha mosques. This tour was made so very fascinating by Arzu's in-depth knowledge of the sights and the religious and historical context that they fit into. We particularly loved Balat and the homes and shops still so active in local life. The next day took us to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi palace and Basilica cistern. Arzu was able to move us around the tourist hordes and focus our time on the most interesting and important aspects of these places. Her english is impeccable, her passion for Turkey, Istanbul and its history shines through, and she gives it the very personal touch of a local resident who truly loves the place. I would highly recommend her tours!

Great Introduction to Istanbul. In spite of the pouring rain, Arzu's energy didn't flag and through the window of Istanbulu foods, we learned about the multi-cultures of this great city. We were introduced to the Spice Bazaar, her favorite seller there, the only one run by a woman, and were welcomed by the lovely family that ran it. Tea and tastes. The nearby Rustem Pasa çamii, the Sulymanye were also visited and enjoyed. A highlight was the Ali Baba restaurant, where we ate lunch inside at the 'kitchen' - delicious white beans, moussaka, dolmas, pickled cabbage, and the incomparable pumpkin dessert. So much did we love this that we returned during a sunny day to eat outside and re-visit the mosque. Brava to Arzu and Walks in Istanbul. Arzu is attractive, lively, knowledgeable, and open.

SIX stars. Thank you Arzu and Ebru for an incredible experience. I had fallen in love with your city the instant I stepped out in it; spending two days with your guidance deepened my understanding of it's fascinating history and culture. I have never been one for guided tours, opting to wander the streets of the World and just absorb. I didn't feel comfortable to do that in Istanbul so I sought you out. My apprehension was misguided; I've never felt safer as a woman alone in a city as in Istanbul. Nevertheless, that apprehension lead me to an experience I will never forget and for which I will be forever grateful to you both. Thank you for sharing the wonders of your city with me. There were so many wonderful experiences ... too many to list ... but one stands out being sitting on the carpet in the Rustem Pasha Mosque listening to Ebru talk about one of her favourites. I will be back!!! Hopefully in a month or so. Whilst I'll enjoy spending a day back at Aya Sofya, Topkapi, and Suleymaniye quietly on my own, I'll be booking a couple more days with you; there is so much more to see and do. I will be recommending you two friends who will visit Istanbul this year.

Fantastic Choice for Istanbul!. We are doing a "Round the World" Trip with two adults and four children. As travel agents, we are used to planning, organizing, and booking everything ahead of time, however, because of the nature of our trip (14 months long), it is not always possible to plan ahead. This was the case in Turkey, as we had just not had time to pre-plan anything!Since we are also writing a blog, a travel agent colleague (also a trusted professional and friend) contacted us when she realized we'd be in Istanbul. She connected us to Arzu and Walks in Istanbul, highly recommending their company for efficient, interesting, and trustworthy tours. We immediately wrote Arzu an email and within a few hours, she had responded. By the end of the day, we had plans to connect the next morning and were really looking forward to meeting Arzu.Of course, you never know what to expect, but because we trust our travel agent colleague and friend, we had high hopes. Arzu did not disappoint. She met us at the entrance to the Hagia Sofia and our lovely day began. Arzu was relaxed, informative, and friendly, offering us great insights into the culture, history, and religion of the area. She answered questions and made sure to know what we were most interested in. While we were able to enjoy some of the typical highlights of Istanbul, Arzu also took us to a less touristy area as well (as requested), and we were able to meander through the streets, explore the shops, and even dine like locals. We had a truly wonderful time and were so glad we had gotten to connect. I would highly recommend Walks in Istanbul and will be sure to connect my clients with them as well! Thanks, Arzu and Walks in Istanbul, for a lovely day.

Fascinating walking tours -- Wonderful experience. Our two private tours with Walks in Istanbul were the highlight of our trip. Some of our group had been to Istanbul before so we were looking for walking tours that might take us off the beaten path. Arzu spent a lot of time in advance emailing with me to set up the perfect itineraries. Our guide, Esin, was fabulous and did a great job of showing us parts of the city we might not otherwise have seen while still providing plenty of background for everyone. We did the Deep Into Islam at Night tour, which was truly a highlight of our vacation. We also did another full day tour in the more modern part of the city that my two teenage boys just loved. Esin was very flexible and worked with us to make sure we covered everything on our walks. Next time we are in Istanbul (hopefully not too long), I will plan to do even more of the walking tours. Highly, highly recommended!

Wonderful tour guides!. We met Arzu in 2011 when she spent three full days touring us all around Istanbul. As travel professionals, we are paying attention to so many small details that we anticipate our clients will need/want. Arzu and team always meet those demands and we've sent all of our Istanbul clients to Walks in Istanbul since then! We adore them!

Well done!. Arzu and her walking tours came well recommended such that I made no comparisons before signing up. I was not disappointed in the least! Arzu- and another guide Ebru -provided their thorough knowledge of the sites and Istanbul in engaging and interesting ways. I learned a great deal and had fun doing so!

Great tour in Istanbul. We did a private 1-day tour with Walks in Istanbul for 3 friends. The great customer services started with the planning with Arzu via email. She really worked with us to plan the perfect 1-day tour for us. We were unsure whether we would be able to fit 2 days of touring into our schedule, and Arzu was very flexible. Our guide was Ebru, who was excellent! She punctually met us at our hotel, and we started walking. Ebro was a true professional and was very knowledgeable about the history and culture. We had tons of questions, and Ebru never seemed to tire of answering them. Ebro provided the right amount of practical information (buying tickets, etc.), history, culture, religion, and personal insight. I would definitely recommend Walks in Istanbul!

Superb tour in every respect. I had only one free day to tour major sites in Istanbul during a business trip, my first time to Turkey. On the basis of a glowing recommendation from friends, I arranged a walking tour with Arzu. She truly was an ideal guide. She made all the arrangements extremely easy, picked me out of the crowd at our meeting spot, and instantly won me over. She is easy going, speaks superb English, and really knows how to pack the most into a day. I shared the tour with a nice German couple, and we focused on the big attractions (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi). Arzu had a remarkably deep and broad knowledge of the historical, architectural and cultural significance of the sites, but I especially liked the way that she wove site-specific narratives into a broader understanding of Turkish culture and identify. She had a very sophisticated understanding of the interactions between religion, ethnicity, history and politics was quick to pick up on our particular interests, enriching the narrative accordingly. She has passionate interests of her own, a great sense of humor and an upbeat style, but she leaves you plenty of room and time to admire and wonder in silence as well. I learned so much from her! I recommend her with the highest enthusiasm. You won't be disappointed!

Istanbul essentials. We did a tour with Arzu in January and covered the main highlights of Istanbul in one day (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace). Arzu was very nice in accomodating our wishes in planning the tour and she responded very quickly to our emails. She was very knowledgeable about the history and religios aspects of the places we visited. We were very tired after the day, in her offered tour packages the "Istanbul essential tour" takes two days and may have been a wiser choice. Nevertheless, we were very happy with the tour and Arzu was a friendly and professional guide and we really enjoyed the tour! Thanks a lot Arzu! Kristina & Simon

Excellent Walking Tour Along the Golden Horn. We contacted Walks In Istanbul and we want to thank our guide for taking us around yesterday and making it such an interesting and memorable day. The walk showed us through so many different districts and layers of history that keep us informed but never overwhelmed. Her easy going manner was perfect for us and we enjoyed the lunch together in particular- such a perfect spot to take time out after walking up the hill.We also enjoyed learning how to catch a ferry and where to position ourselves in a queue! So much more to learn though, and so much more of Istanbul to see. We also went to the hamam near the Grand Bazaar on the way home - just loved it! We're getting ready to head to Canakkale in the morning, with Arzu's travel tips in hand.We'd be very happy to pass contact details and website to any friends we hear are planning a trip to Istanbul. So lovely to meet Walks in Istanbul and share such a great day with their guide!

Great Tour Guide for Istanbul. My husband and I had a great experience with Arzu Tutuk. She had listened carefully to our interests and came up with extras that were in line -- such as interesting food locations and destinations that touched on Judaism. She was fun, knowledgable and a joy to spend time with. We had the very best time and wish there is an Arzu in every city we visit!!

Best Way to Go. We are a family of four, including a 14- and 11-year-old, and have limited experience traveling abroad together. The guide was perfect for us. I couldn't recommend the company's services any more. Our two girls were highly engaged, learning more than they ever would have with a travel guide book. What's more, after our guide was finished (we hired her for four half days), we felt comfortable enough with the city to explore other parts on our own. We also wanted to buy a Turkish rug, and the guide introduced us to several reputable, fair dealers. She gave great restaurant selections, too.
Outstanding! Go!. Great guide, lovely person, just perfect. Knowledgeable, friendly, flexible, always on time and managed a moving itinerary with great skill.

Insightful and fascinating.. I toured Istanbul with Arzu as part of a school group and find myself hugely grateful that we had Arzu as our guide. On school trips there's often a tendency to go through the motions in terms of visiting the most obvious places and come away unchanged and uninformed. Thanks to Arzu, my experience in Istanbul couldn't have been further from that expectation. Without her, I wouldn't have been able to stare out at the panoramic view of the Bosphorus from the roof of the Grand Bazaar (no less), dine on authentic and incredible meals or gain a whole new insight into a world I had known virtually nothing about. She certainly made good on her promise to show us Istanbul as through the eyes of those that call it home. Perhaps most memorable for me was her quote; "The history of Istanbul is like a cake, with layers upon layers of civilisation." When you're guided by Arzu, you can be sure to see more of those layers than you thought possible. Please travel with her for the best Istanbul experience you could hope for!

The best way to see Istanbul!. I chose Arzu to lead our four day tour of Istanbul because she seemed to offer a more personal, insightful service compared to the other companies out there. I was not disappointed and could not have wished for a better guide: she gave clear descriptions of the main sites, placed them expertly into their historical, religious and cultural context but did not forget the interesting anecdotes that really bring a place to life. She was never dull and never went on for too long with crushing, dry detail. As a native of the city, Arzu also knows the places off the beaten track like the back of her hand; we saw so many things and experienced so many foods that we would have missed out on without her personal touch. If you really want to understand the many layers of the city, and get beneath its modern skin, I cannot recommend Arzu highly enough: she is fun, witty, charming and excellent company! Don't miss out!

Walks in Istanbul. My son and I had two terrific days exploring Istanbul with Arzu.She is obviously very knowledgeable, but was really good company for 2 long days!We had a great time, and would recommend her.Two days was great....one day would not be enough....its a huge city!!

Walks in Istanbul day tour. We spent a great day with Arzu in Istanbul. She 's an experienced, kind, laid-back, knowledgeable and enthusiastic guide. She was flexible enough to handle the fact that one of the other participants arrived late and another one couldn't make it. Hiring 'Walks in Istanbul' is definitely something you should do if you really wish to explore the city. It adds a lot of value to your visit!

Knowledgable, friendly, and insightful!. We had a wonderful experience with Arzu, who was recommended to us by a friend who had traveled to Turkey multiple times. Arzu not only gave us a tremendous tour, she also helped me (a teacher) plan an itinerary for an upcoming trip I am taking to Istanbul with a group of students. We will definitely seek her out again, as her poise and presentation skills make her a great choice for my group of high school students. Arzu is not your average tour guide; she is will cater the tour to your needs, offer up entertaining anecdotes, and show you Istanbul as you've never seen it before. She is not to be missed.
Walks in Istanbul Tour. We had an excellent tour of the historic sights in Istanbul. Our tour guide, Ebru, was very knowledgeable and informative. I would highly recommend her for a tour of Istanbul.

Intimate view of Istanbul with Arzu. We spent spent two fascinating days with Arzu, one half day was Non-Islamic Istanbul and the other eating our way round the Spice market and over on the Asian side of this wonderful city. Arzu was interesting, knowledgeable, caring and fabulous! We appreciated so much Arzu's excellence and her ability to share with us aspects of life in modern day Istanbul which we found fascinating. With a good guide you not only get information but a friend for the time you are with her. The two days with Arzu was time well spent with an EXCELLENT guide! We also appreciated the fact that she combines people together so that you pay only your share of her fee. I am a professional tour guide also and I cannot recommend her highly enough.

Two walks with Arzu: enriching experience. Over the course of seven days in Istanbul, I joined Arzu first for a half-day walk, and then later for a very different full-day walk. As an older woman travelling alone, I found that Arzu’s guiding services made the experience so much richer and more enjoyable. Arzu took me to places I would not have seen – tiny maze-like alleys which alone I would not have entered, daunted by the prospect of never finding my way back out, and into buildings whose exteriors gave no hint as to what lay behind the street frontage. Her knowledge of Istanbul was extensive, personal and deeply caring. Along the way, she bought me an Istanbul Pass and gave lots of informative tips so I then felt empowered to explore on my own, happily utilizing the excellent public transport system. The full-day walk with a small group (five others) followed a ‘food’ theme, rightly starting at the wonderful Spice Markets and ending in Kadikoy after a ferry ride to the Asian side. Both outings with Arzu were excellent - full of surprises, very informative - and her friendly company provided a happy counterpoint to my solitary travels.

Great private tour by Arzu!. We booked a VERY last minute private tour with guide Arzu and had a marvellous time. Arzu is knowledgeable, pleasant, speaks perfect English and she clearly knows her city very well! Spending time with her almost felt like strolling around a city with a friend, who just so happens to know a thing or two about the surroundings. Very enjoyable. Higly recommended!

Wonderful Tour!. We're a family of 6 adults and are so pleased to have found Arzu. She met us at our hotel early in the morning and completely looked after us for the whole day - We wanted to see as much as we could and she couldn't have fulfilled the brief any better.We took the tram into the old city (Arzu sorted us out with a transport card which we went on to use on the buses and the funicular). We visited The Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern and Haghia Sophia. Arzu used her local knowledge to avoid huge queues and provided a rich and interesting commentary along the way.We had lunch at Medusa Restaurant on her recommendation and she even chose a good range of dishes for us to try. Absolutely delicious!Arzu is personable and reliable and tries hard to identify individual/group needs and tries her best to match them. We couldn't recommend her enough!

Learned so much!. We just returned from a fabulous trip to Turkey with our 3 children aged 9,11 & 13. We first found out about Arzu via the Luxe travel guides which we have found very useful when planning overseas travel. Initially, we had contacted package tour companies, but we have found that travelling with kids it is better if you can set your own pace and agenda. Whilst we initially contacted Arzu for just a tour of Istanbul, we found that she was a great resource for our entire trip due to her nationwide tour guide contacts and knowledge of accommodation throughout the country. We had two enjoyable days in Istanbul, where we explored the city's highlights and then travelled to Capadocia, Ephesus and Galipoli. At every stop we were met with a patient, knowledgeable guide and driver who not only informed us of the local sites, but gave us insight into the rich history and political realities of Turkish life, which we all found fascinating. The accommodation that Arzu recommended was perfect, a great mix of comfort and local personality -- something you don't find when staying in international hotel chains. We cannot thank Arzu enough for all her help in making our trip to Turkey just perfect.

Arzu - An expert guide who should be a teacher. We (9 senior adults) had Arzu as a guide for 2 half day tours. We decided on all the highlights we wished to see from research and her advice prior to our arrival in Istanbul. The correspondence with Arzu on the internet was prompt and in fluent English. We achieved all we set out to see and more. We thoroughly enjoyed Arzu's expert knowledge that was delivered in a story-like manner that made the history of Istanbul extremely interesting. Arzu should be a teacher to children and adults. She also gave us an educated insight into the Islamic faith, and we thank her for that. We saw a sensitive side to her that touched us very deeply. We highly recommend her as a guide.

Great way to see Istabul. We had Murat as our guide for 2 full days Aug 13 & 14. he took us to the Sophia Church, Blue Mosque and Topkapi palace in Sultananmet on day one. And day 2 to the Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, Jewish quarter via Galata Bridge and other parts of the Horn. We ended up buying (1) a beautiful lamp stand which just arrived back in NZ for us and (2) a lovely vase which also arrived safely. We were tempted but didn't buy one of the carpets. I suspect we will wish we had because the quality at the place Murat took us to near the Bazaar was excellent and the silk ones were superior to those we bought in China many years ago.Murat was very knowledgeable about the district, its history and Turkey and the people in general. He also had a very good sense of humour. The pace was just right!This was our first visit to Istanbul and I have no doubt that our time was used much more efficiently and with no hassle than if we had tried to go it alone. We did do a third day by ourselves but by then had learnt the ropes!Highly recommendable.

Great choice for our guide in Istanbul!. We were in Istanbul for 5 days and had Arzu as our guide for two full days (3-4 adults) and one of her partners for an evening tour with 8 adults. Arzu was on time, personable, very well informed and completely able to share her knowledge in fluent English. We were extremely satisfied. We were able to select the sights we most wanted to see and the pace was our own. Her choice of luncheon restaurants was great---as was the very traditional dinner for the evening tour. Planning before we arrived was great as she answered all our many questions promptly and completely. I noticed a few (VERY few) others were disappointed in the tour of the Grand Bazar. Arzu was our guide for the Bazar (4 people) and we were not disappointed. It may be a matter of the Bazar's overwhelming nature---it is huge and complex. Additionally, Arzu cannot shop or barter for others. Obviously, she has to wait while shoppers make their comparisons and decisions. She can point out particular shops (and did a great job of that) but her recommendation is always, "decide what you want and what you are willing to pay then go ahead and buy"---that is great advice but could be given in writing. There are better uses for Arzu's many talents. Thus, my suggestion is to tackle the Bazar as an experience on your own and use Arzu's incredible expertise where it is most useful in the explanation of history, architecture, food, culture, etc.Our visit to Istanbul was memorable and enlightening in great part because of Aruz.

Great choice for a personal guided tour. I had a great experience on my tour with Arzu, who is very service minded. She gave really good information up front via email, and handled it very professionally when I was 45 minutes late for the start of the tour and had to meet up with the group after they had visited the Blue mosque. She also gave me an extra tour of the Blue mosque after the tour ended for the rest of the group. Arzu is very knowledgable about the history of Istanbul and Turkey, all the sights, and have excellent english skills. And is also an enjoyable person to spend time with Thank you for making my one day in Istanbul enjoyable and interesting.

Arzu is friendly, well informed and experienced. My seven year old daughter and I spent a whole day with Arzu. She was very friendly and flexible. As we were walking with a seven year old we had to take frequent breaks which she was nice to accommodate. Arzu is very fluent in English and she is well educated and informed. She was able to relay the information and history of Istanbul to my seven year old in a way to make it interesting for her. We had amazing time seeing the wonders of Istanbul and spending the day with a very pleasant and personable guide, Arzu. Thank you for a wonderful day!

Istanbul's Best Hosts. My wife and I recently returned from our first visit to Istanbul. It's one of the most interesting cities I've ever experienced and I cannot wait to return. We were incredibly fortunate to have found Walks in Istanbul. Prior to our trip, Arzu and I worked together to create a custom itinerary for 2 half day tours. Arzu always returned my emails promptly and was so helpful in sharing her ideas.Ebru joined us both days and we loved her as a guide! She is friendly, outgoing, trustworthy, intelligent, patient, flexible, consistently on time, and speaks a perfect English. Her knowledge about Istanbul's history, architecture, culture, and cuisine is vast. With Ebru, it felt like we were accompanied by both a history professor and a friend. She answered all our questions and tweaked the itinerary based on our level of interest.We cannot wait to return to Istanbul and unequivocally endorse Walks in Istanbul. It's the perfect complement to one of the world's greatest cities.

walking in istanbul. We have just spent five days in Istanbul. We had a fabulous time with our 12 year old son. It is an amazing city and the food is wonderful! We had arranged 3 mornings of walks ... we didn't really mind where we went. Our guide Ebru met us at our hotel and we got started. It was great, Ebru is highly intelligent so we learnt lots but there was also practical advice on the trams, where to go for lunch lots of interesting information. I can highly recommend the tours.

Arzu is the Best!. It was a pleasure to see you again after 4 years. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our Istanbul tours with you in 2010 and that is why I recommended you to my daughter and her family for this recent trip.When I asked my youngest granddaughter (age 9) what she liked best about Istanbul she shouted "Arzu!" Our entire family agreed. In fact, I think you may have spoiled everyone because now all they want are "private tours just like Arzu did." Istanbul is such an amazing city and we were able to realize it's wonder because of your excellent skills. You are an outstanding tour guide and one of the most delightful people I have met in all my travels. Thank you for all the special memories of your beautiful city!

excellent tour of istanbul. Arzu was great! I am writing this as we head off to Ephesus just after she left us at our hotel room. We had three days to spend in istanbul and contacted Walks In Istanbul. Her correspondence was flawless, accurate and rapid.Our first day, she met us at the port, made the effort of explaning about public transport, introduced us to the tram, a very effecient way to get us to the old city from our ship.We did a two day " Essential Istanbul" and then one day " Markets and Shopping".Arzu knew her stuff, she was very well educated, we learned a great deal about history, Islam and modern life in Turkey.Her experience made us feel we were getting something that exceeded our expectations.We liked the way she handled our Grand Bazaar tour. Arzu gave us an introductory walk, showing better shops, back streets and then gave us ample time to wander and shop at our own pleasure which we think is superb. We can recommend her services with comfort.

Incredible Istanbul. We've just returned to Melbourne from a month long trip to Istanbul, Israel/Jordan and Istanbul was absolutely one of the highlights – it’s such an incredible city! We arranged two half day walking tours with Arzu and thoroughly enjoyed both of them.Day 1: Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern and Grand BazaarDay 2: Sultan Ahmed Mosque (Blue Mosque), Topkapi Palace and the Spice MarketThanks to Arzu we managed to see (and learn) a lot in a short space of time, but at the same time she provided a relaxed and fun experience. We saved a lot of time by not waiting in queues, and Arzu even provided us with excellent bar/restaurant recommendations.We had a number of other guides throughout Israel and Jordan and can say with confidence, you’re in a league of your own Arzu!

Exceeded expectations. After some initial correspondence with Arzu before we left Australia we settled on a half day tour as we had visited the key attractions from a previous cruise stop over. Ebru from "Walks in Istanbul Tours" met us on time in our hotel lobby and we sat down and agreed the itinerary based on our expectations and Ebru's strategy to meet those expectations. In short Ebru took us on a half day walk through the old and new cities from a locals perspective. Other than a short stop for some local Baklava and coffee Ebru pointed out historic sites, buildings, favoured shops and restaurants, including rides on the tram and cable car as required. It was like being with a personal friend sharing interests and experiencing the history of Istanbul. At no time were we left on our own for shopping that would come later in our own time as this tour set us up for the rest of our stay. We suggest a full day tour for new visitors to Istanbul as half a day would be required visiting the key tourist attractions, Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque etc. We spent a wonderful week in Istanbul, including the Anzac/ Troy tour and rated Ebru's walking tour our top highlight.Phil & Susan - Australia

High Expectations - Disappointing Reality. Arzu met us at the port, took us on the tram (3 Lira) to the Grand Bazaar. At the Grand Bazaar we walked around for a few minutes and then she got paid $42 US for each of us. Talk about an expensive tram ride!Arzu's partner met us later and we walked through the spice market. This was much more enjoyable and we felt like we actually got a sense for the city.But we (and the rest of our group) were disappointed in the Grand Bazaar tour. Would encourage others to explore on their own. Don't pay for a tour.

Extraordinary experience with Arzu in an extraordinary city.. I and my husband spent a week in istanbul. Arzu was our guide for three days. We enjoyed every moment of this trip. It was very exciting to see this unique city on foot.Arzu was a terrific guide, she was knowledgeable, communicative , friendly and experienced. Also, she had a great sense of humor. She knew all the secrets of this city and we feel quite happy as she shared them with us. Not only she took us to the historic sites but also she showed us the modern side of Istanbul. Thanks to her we ate excellent food, visited lots of unique places in a short time and discovered Istanbul on foot. I definitely assure you that if you choose Arzu as your guide you will never regret. It was an unforgettable trip in a unique city with an excellent guide

A great disappointment and such a pity. Yes, something did go terribly wrong with this much anticipated tour.I went by the reviews here when deciding to use this company, and I must say I was very impressed by what everyone had written and also with my correspondence with Arzu. The price seemed fair for a four hour tour, and people agreed to it. I was so sure it would meet my expectations.What went terribly wrong, was that all it turned out to be, for most of the group, was a babysitting tram ride to the market, with brief commentary, and then a pointing out of the different stores. This took all of about an hour and a half. Arzu then said we could shop on our own and come back and drop things off at a coffee shop when we were done, and she would be there. Where she went very wrong, was that she asked for payment at that point, and said that if people wanted to come back at 5pm, she would get them back to the ship. At that point, most people were really fed up at having to pay US$42 per person for what was basically an hour and a half of the tour guide's time. At no point did she make it clear that everyone had to return for a continuation of the tour en route back to the ship. Had she done that, people would have been content to pay what they did. Meantime, we tired of the shopping at 4pm and returned to the coffee shop, and there was no one waiting there, as was promised. I have no idea what happened, or where Arzu was, but another guide, Ebru, arrived at 4.55pm, and found four of us sitting there. She took the four of us on a wonderful walking tour through the spice market and back to ship, all the while filling us in with the history of the buildings and other anecdotal information. It was wonderful and very worthwhile, but we felt very bad for our group who had had enough of the tour, and went their own way/made their own way back to the ship. To be honest, only four of us got our money's worth, and of course the following day, the news of the rip - off tour had spread around the ship like wild fire.The miscommunication came from the guide. The tour participants cannot be blamed here. They were asked for their money, and given an option to return to get back to the ship. Had the guide been clear that the tour would continue for the allotted time of four hours, I have no doubt that everyone would have come back to the meeting point to get what they had booked for.Arzu is an intelligent woman and an experienced tour guide, and her English is flawless, so there really is no excuse for this kind of miscommunication. A four hour tour, must be just that - four full hours. Pointing out the different shops, even if she does not get commission, does not cut it as a walking tour of the Bazaar. There must be so many fascinating stories and secret places and history of the building, that could and should have been shared with the group. Her colleague, Ebru managed to enthral us on the walking return to the ship, so this could have been done on the way to the Bazaar as well.I think what tour guides need to ask themselves, is," would this tour have satisfied me?". If they honestly cannot answer in the affirmative - and I am sure Arzu would not have been happy with this tour and price had she had it in another country - then something is very wrong.It is a great pity that a company's otherwise stellar reputation has been tarnished by this one tour, and one can only hope that this really bad experience will not be repeated with other tourists. I would have loved to have given Arzu an excellent rating, but in all honesty, that simply is not possible.

A big disappointment!. On reading the previous reviews of this company, I feel we must have met Arzul on a very bad day for her as our experiences were nothing like this.We joined a walking tour of Istanbul arranged through a fellow passenger on our cruise ship. It was supposed to be for four hours from 2 to 6 pm. There were fourteen of us altogether. It was going to cost $42 or E30 per person.However, the tour proved to be the biggest let down of our cruise. In fact it was the worst value for money tour we have had in twelve cruises.Arzul met us a bit later than the allotted meeting time as she had gone to another area and then we all set off to get the tram to the Grand Bazaar. A short walk to the tram and then another short walk from the tram stop to the Bazaar. She gave us some brief information along the way.We were then taken a walk round the Bazaar for about half an hour by the tour guide with a few comments about the shops etc. and she suddenly announced she would leave us there for an hour and a half and pick us up at 5 pm to take us back on the tram to the ship. She then asked for payment!Well I think we were all so shocked we did actually pay her, something that I later really regretted. At the very most we should have just paid 50%.It was not a walking tour at all and we could have easily made our way to the bazaar on the tram or by taxi for a very minimal cost. I know the organizer has written directly to Arzul with her views but I would strongly recommend not using this company as it was a total rip off.I am pleased to say we had an excellent tour guide the following day from a different company and we were all so delighted after our disappointment of our first experience in Istanbul!

Two days with Sanem of Istanbul walks. We recently spent three fantastic days in Istanbul, not the least due to the services provided by Sanem of Istanbul walks. For the first day, we had booked her as private guide and she guided us with great authority through Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque,Topkai Serail and showed where us the James Bond Skyfall motorbike scene was shot. We had book a full day Bosphorus tour for the next day and she was our guide again. What a treat!We can certainly recommend Istanbul Walks and Sanem as a guide for Istanbul.

The best way to experience Istanbul. Our group of 12 women had a day and a half to see the best of Istanbul and Arzu didn't disappoint. She was knowledgable, informative and current. She took time to explain about local history and show us the best of Istanbul. She had great humour and how on earth she managed to keep us all together in some crowded areas, I'll never know; she was great at organising us and getting us to the next thing to see. We'll be recommending her to our friends. Thank you!

Excellent tour of 'Old Istanbul'. A group of 7 of us hired Arzu for just one day - we were only spending 2 full days in Istanbul. Her incredible knowledge of the local history and politics made for a day that none of us will forget. Her easy manner and sense of humour contributed to make the whole experience really memorable. On the practical side, having her with us saved us from having to wait in long queues for tickets, and just generally saved us from wasting any precious time on our short trip. Will definitely recommend Arzu to friends and family.

A superb introduction to Istanbul. My husband and I booked a day's tour with Arzu to "do" Byzantine Istanbul in the morning and a food lover's Istanbul in the afternoon.
