The day was pitched perfectly, going at the right speed and stopping when we wanted to to either rest or just look for longer. Arzu's expert knowledge is gently shared. Her English is impeccable and we never misunderstood or didn't hear clearly. She also introduced us to Istanbul's public transport system which, as we were staying longer, was enormously helpful. You can share a tour or you can treat yourself to the luxury of a completely private tour - we chose the latter and despite the expense, are very pleased we did. Thoroughly recommended.

Walking Tour on 1/28/14. My 16 year old son and I visit Istanbul for our first time on his semester break. He loves history and his studies of the Ottoman Empire. We arranged our tour through Arzu and our guide on our day was Ebru. Ebru grew up in Turkey and is a student of history and theology, she provide outstanding perspective, history and details throughout the tour. We visited Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, the Cisterns and Grand Bazaar. She also took us to a great cafe for coffee and tea on the cold day, plus an outstanding hot and hearty lunch at Medusa.On our last day we returned to the Grand Bazaar to buy gifts to bring home. Thanks to Ebru and the vendors she was able to direct us to and introduce us to on our tour day, we made some outstanding purchases and definitely help us sift through the maze of the bazaar. We bought some beautiful scarfs, soaps, saffron, coffee, Turkish delight and moreThanks again to Arzu and Ebru, they made our visit a memory for a life time. Even though it was cold at this time in Istanbul, it didn't stop us from seeing anything. It is a great city, great people and should be high on anyone's list of places to visit.

Wonderful tour from a great guide. My wife and I were spending a week in Istanbul and were overwhelmed by the amount of things to do, so we decided to have a guide take us for a day-long tour at the beginning of our week to take us to some of the main sights as well as some of the less touristy places, and to also help us plan our itinerary for the rest of the week.Arzu was not available so Ebru spent the day with us instead. Ebru is a great guide - very knowledgeable, and also friendly, helpful and flexible. She met us at our hotel and took us all over the city, telling us all about the fascinating history of Turkey and Istanbul; she also gave us a great insider's view of Istanbul.I would definitely recommend spending a day with Ebru for a tour of Istanbul.

Ebru is terrific. On our recent trip Arzu was unavailable and referred us to her associate, Ebru Gokteke. Arzu promised we wouldn't be disappointed and boy, was she right!Ebru is all you'd want a guide to be: charming, knowledgeable, flexible, and caring. She had a gang of six first-timers-to-Turkey to shepherd and fascinate, and she delivered. Whether it was the history of Hagia Sofya, how to beat the crowds at the top attractions, the meaning of the mosaics at the Chora Church, or the ins and outs of the Gezi Parki protests, Ebru made us all feel like real insiders. Next time in Istanbul I'll make a point of asking for Ebru. She's the best!

Arzu - Amazing guide, resource and foodie!. Arzu took us on an incredible tour of Istanbul which included not only the mosques and churches, but cafes, vistas and hidden corners. We had such a great time learning more about the thousands of years of civilization and populations that were born, migrated or conquered here. She also encouraged me to try a local hammam (women's spa and Turkish bath) which was a once in a lifetime experience. Most of all, Arzu is an intelligent, warm and enthusiastic woman who wants to share her passion about Istanbul. Don't miss out on walking around with her!

My favourite person in Istanbul!. After reading the glowing reviews on this site, I got in touch with Arzu to book two days of guiding for a group (we were six people between the ages of mid-20s to mid-60s). She wasn't able to take us but she offered her colleague Asli. I was hesitant at first since all the reviews I read praised Arzu but I took a chance and I am so glad I did!Asli was fantastic. We spent two days in her company seeing all the usual tourist sites (Topkapi, Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque, Suleyman's Mosque - don't miss this one, by the way! - The Cistern, Spice Market, Grand Bazaar etc. etc.). She also took us across the water to the market in Kadikoy (not very touristy area of town where the locals live and shop) and I loved it so much that I went back at the end of my trip and spent an evening wandering around among the locals.Asli knows what she is talking about. She was able to answer any question we had and patiently gave us a run down of Turkish history (in fact she had to repeat this history lesson again and again because some of us had a hard time getting all the complex comings and goings straight - Turkish history is not straight forward!). She shielded us from the tourist hordes by taking us down quiet back streets, getting us into fast track lines, using her guiding pass to skip ticket buying lines (this is really such a valuable part of having a guide....we visited in late April and already the lines were insane and in some cases, people were standing in the wrong lines). With Asli to guide us, we made the most of our two short days and saw a lot. She also knew some very good spots to eat.The price per day was $350 USD (we were also given the option of paying in euro or lira). This was the price for the whole group, not per person. Our days were meant to be 9:30 to 4:30 but on the first day, we went way overtime and Asli did not seem to notice or mind. And on the second day, we started half an hour early. So I really appreciated the flexibility.350 USD is not a small amount of money but I would argue that it was worth every penny. Here's why:1. Our group ranged in age and we all equally enjoyed Asli's guiding and what we saw and did. 2. The tour was entirely bespoke. We customized it before and during, on the fly. 3. On our own, we would never have been able to pack so many sights into two days. The lines alone would have made it impossible (and remember this was in April, not high, high season). There's a good chance, given our group, that we would have gotten lost, become annoyed with each other etc. etc. Instead, with Asli to lead us, we were able to relax, look around, soak up the city and enjoy ourselves.4. After two days with Asli, my husband and I were prepared to tackle the city on our own and we spent four days wandering around on our own at the end of the trip. We'd already done all the things that benefit most from a guide and we had a good mental map of the city.5. Sometimes you get what you pay for and as I said, Asli was incredibly knowledgeable and was also willing and happy to answer our questions about more local matters (the political situation in Turkey, for example, something that is interesting at the moment, to say the least). She was candid in a way that guidebooks never ever are. There are many, many completely useless guides around and I think this was money well spent.A note about Arzu: I communicated with us before the trip and she was also prompt and helpful in her relies, giving me recommendations for things outside of Isanbul as well.

Best day we had in Istanbul!. My husband and I recently went to Istanbul for the first time, and stumbled across Arzu online. Arzu wasn't able to take us on a walk the week we were there, and we were a little hesitant to agree to a walk with her colleague, Murat. In the end, we were SO happy with Murat and the tour we had. We walked the Golden Horn back down to the old city (was a huge amount of walking - tiring, but worth it!) and saw a lot of the real Istanbul. Murat has been guiding for 20 years or so and knew a huge amount about all of the places we saw. He was funny, laid-back, personable, and knowledgeable. The day of our walk ended up being one of the best days we had in Istanbul, and I would highly recommend going this route if you want to see parts of Istanbul that you wouldn't normally see, from an experienced and licensed guide. I would highly, highly recommend Arzu and Murat to anyone who plans on visiting Istanbul.

Book Arzu for the best customized tour of Istanbul!. My niece and I went to Istanbul for a girls' birthday shopping weekend and we booked Arzu for a half day tour of the Hagia Sophia, The Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace grounds. She tailored our tour to our specific needs - we wanted to see as much as we could on our first morning in Istanbul, then spend time shopping in the Bazaar and exploring the Beyoglu area. She was extremely knowledgeable and told fascinating stories along the way. She took us to her favourite rug shop in the Bazaar and directed us to textiles shops, jewelry shops, restaurants/bars for the evenings and told us the best places to buy baklava and Turkish Delight. She recommended that we stay at the Witt Istanbul, which was fabulous and a very stylish hotel with large, gorgeous rooms and close to everything. Arzu is very personable and it felt like we were walking around Istanbul with a very knowledgeable friend. We have recommended her to all of our friends and would definitely book her again. Book your flights, your hotel and then book Arzu!

Arzu Knows Her Stuff. On my recent trip to Istanbul I had prearranged three half day tours with Arzu, however upon my arrival, I had urgent family matters that i had to return home for. Arzu was very helpful and very flexible. She showed me how to navigate a Turkish keyboard, and was a great asset in helping me rearrange my flights. As it turned out I had some time to tour, and it being the slow season Arzu was able to modify her schedule to match mine. The Chora chuch session was incredible.

Arzu was fantastic. Did a half day tour of Hagia Sofia, cistern, and spice market. Arzu tailored everything to our questions and interests-very flexible! My teenagers and 11 yr old really liked her explanations and more importantly, felt very comfortable asking questions. She went the extra mile for us and we highly recommend her!

What a great way to visit Istanbul in such a personalized way!. I had a great time with Arzu Tutuk visiting various neighbourhoods of Istanbul and getting a glimpse of the diverse aspects of the city's past and present history. Arzu has a great personality, she is knowledgeable in so many aspects of the city and gives generous explanations. Since she personalizes her tour, I could visit the sites, sounds and tastings that interested me most. It was also of great interest for me to exchange ideas and perspectives with her over so many subject. It helped me get a better idea of this incredible culture and attractions. I highly recommend her as her contribution added an unvaluable wealth of information to my visit.

Best way to experience the world's most fascinating city. Istanbul is a place to see on foot, and the best way to do that is to hook up with Walks in Istanbul and guide Arzu Tutuk,. Arzu has a way of seeing things as though she lived through them, whether watching the chariot races on the Hippodrome in 800 AD, attending the Ahrida synagogue in 1550, strolling through the Grand Bazaar in 1600, entering the Chora church in 1200 AD, or besieging the city walls in 1453. You'll see Istanbul through the eyes of people of the time, all in the person af a charming, imaginative, poetic, and funny personal guide. You'll love her. And the walks.

Great Time. Travel Store Turkey such a amazing place they was so kind and lovely persons . We took a Cappadocia tour and ıt was a amazing the ballon ride and wives was amazing Thanks for every think Travel Store Turkey .

Turkey is wonderful and we had a great time. Erkan from Travelstore helped us to organise our trip around turkey. It was a 6 day trip and he manage since get us from the hotel in Istanbul in the morning, guided tours, hotels during the trip, shuttles. Special point was the route to visit beautiful and historical places in a trip that we will keep in our minds and our hearts forever.Turkey is a safe place and everyone should reserver a holiday to visit this wonderful country.Different from what the news said, there is no terrorism and no fear in the streets. The government added extra polices and extra safe after what happened in the past and I felt really safe here, even in a big city like Istanbul walking during the night in the center.

GREAT SERVICE. great option for organize your turkish trip....they booking us a trip to Kapadokya and everything was perfect: fly, balloon and hotel wIth the best price and kind and fast atention! Ask for Murat Acikalin...Hariká!

Excellent and Friendly Service!! :). It was really been a dream of mine and my mom to visit Cappadocia, Turkey due to it's magical and paradise-like view!! We just fixed the tour online and gladly, Travel Store is so accommodating and they were answering all of our questions and concerns! They never hesitate to answer our emails and calls! They gave us a very wonderful service from tours, food and kind tour agents!!! ❤️ I'm sharing these pictures of ours to express how incredible the place and tour was!

In a simple word, awsome!. I have been in Istanbul about 30 years ago with my wife so I decided to come back with my son Lorenzo in order to let him visit Istanbul and Cappaocia. We arrived in the city and we looked for a travel agency. We found Erkan and Dilek, two worderful people! We have organized together our tour along Turkey! I spent great time with my family thanks to them. In Istanbul we have seen Basilica Cistern, Aya Sofya, Topkapi Palace, Ayasofya Hürrem Sultan Hamam, Blue Mosque, Istanbul Archaeology Museums, Turkish and Islamic Arts Museum, Galata Tower, Spice Bazaar and Grand Bazaar. After a week we flew to Cappadocia landing in Kayseri and sleeping in Göreme. There we visited Göreme Open-Air Museum, Underground Cities of Derinkuyu and Kaymakli, Avanos, Ürgüp, Hisars: Ortahisar and Uçhisar, Zelve Open-Air Museum. We also did one of the most amazing thing, hot air balloons.I will never forget all those places.

Amazing experience!. Instambul and turkish people are the most friendly and kind people I've ever met! I went to Kappadocia 2 days and Instambul 3 days... It seemed like paradise.. I loved the sound of mosque that resounded in all over the city. I Also loved so much the 'grand bazaar', very typical place. I suggest to try turkish narghilè, very good! Have a nice experience ❤️

Wonderful, Professional, Friendly Service - Our Guide Was More Like A Friend By The End Of Our Trip!. Our trip to Turkey was made even more amazing by the wonderful service provided by Murat, who became more of a friend than a guide. They have a team of experienced people who had coordinated all the bookings of Hotels, Sightseeing, Pick Up and Drop from the Airport. The tour went as planned starting with Istanbul. We were accompanied by our Tour Guide Mr Turgay Polat (incidentally his name also sounds like tour guide which was confusing at first as we kept asking him for his name).On the first day we visited the Hippodrome, The Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, The Hagia Sophia and The Grand Bazaar.These sites have amazing history and was diligently explained by Turgay without whom it would not have held so much interest to us being from another country.In the evening we went to a Dinner Cruise on the Bosphorus Strait. This Cruise includes Dinner, drinks and also Cultural Performances by their Troupe.On the second day we went to the Spice Bazaar to buy the local Turkish Delight, The Turkish Coffee and some Teas and Spices. I think the Grand Bazaar was better experience from photography point of view and Spice Bazaar from purchase point.We had lunch at an Authentic Turkish Restaurant and also visited a Hammam that was 350 years old.Evening was spent in the Takshim Square which is both lively and full of night life.The Third day we went to Anatalya by domestic flight and stayed at the Spice Hotel and Spa, a beautiful property.On the fourth day we went for the Day tour to the Duden Waterfall and to visit the Old Town of Anatalya with a beautiful little Harbour.I think I have so much to write. In the end i would like to Turgay and Travel Shop Turkey for the excellent time we had in Turkey.RegardsSumit Aggarwal

Great time in Istanbul thanks to Travel Shop and our guide Hasan Oral. We (My family and I) spent 9 days and 8 nights in Turkey visiting Istanbul, Ephesus, Pamukkale and Cappadocia. The three day stay in Istanbul was nothing short of ephemeral thanks to the organising by Travel Shop and the guide provided by them, Hasan.Hasan was our guide throughout the stay in Istanbul and he was a treat to be around. Not only is he knowledgeable about the history of Istanbul but also well informed about the current world affairs. He had an answer to every relevant or irrelevant question we shot at him. On the first day of the tour, we visited the Hippodrome, the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Taksim Square. Along with us we had another British couple in the day tour who were fairly old and the lady had to be pushed around in a wheel chair. Given all the walking demanded on that day, Hasan was kind enough to push the lady around giving the Gentleman some rest. He was polite, amiable and ensured that we got enough time at each place to admire the beauty and take the grandeur all inside. He organised the tour impeccably ensuring that we nibbled food at the right time and suggested great places which would cater to our taste. He also advised us to ride the local means of transport and get an experience of the same, which in my opinion was wonderful. He gave us clear directions which ensured that we faced no hassle. On the second day of the tour, we went for the Bosphorous cruise and then to the spice bazaar. Since he picked us up early, he took us to the highest point in Istanbul which had a surreal view of the whole city. It wasn't a part of our itinerary and I am glad he made it happen since view was dreamlike from the top. Given how friendly he is, he was more than glad to answer our not-so-imperative questions regarding the movies, sports, education in Turkey. It felt like we were spending the time with our friend rather than a guide. He is hysterical and ensured that our time on the cruise was informative as well as fun., He was patient enough to put up with our shenanigans when it came to clicking pictures. (Thanks for that Hasan!) He catered to the different schedules of everyone on the tour impeccably and ensured that we got dropped off at the airport on time. TL;DR : I highly recommend Hasan Oral for a tour guide. He is friendly, kind, laid back and extremely knowledgeable about all walks of life. I'm certain he'll make your stay pleasurable with his warm approach and abundance of patience. :)

But they failed to arrange a hot air balloon tour for which I paid them before the tour started due to bad weather . Let's see whether they return back my money back or not. Overall I would recommend everyone to take travel shop turkey as their tour partner while travel tofurkey Dr. Rashimul Haque ( rimon)Dhaka, bangladesh
Islamic tour. Travel shop Turkey is organised and so helpful. Our tour guide Mr torguy was kind and explained the tour really well. Thanks

Not so satisfying trip to Turkey and Greece. We had Travelshop organize a custom 14 day trip to Turkey and Greece for a part of 8 (7 Adults and a baby). First let me highlight the positives, the tour guides were very good and friendly. They had great knowledge of the areas and shared a lot of information with a lot of passion. The private airport transfers that were organized were spacious and nice and very comfortable. Now I want to share the not so good feedback that I experienced. We were a large group of 7 Adults and 1 Baby and needed a lot of coordination. Hence I was in touch with your agents two months before the trip, to make sure all the details are taken care of. Unfortunately that did not happen. Here is the list of things that did not go according to plan for us:1. Our tour package provided said Breakfast included every morning. We landed in turkey and next day in the morning waiting for breakfast but were told, sorry no breakfast included. That was a mistake2. The tour times were not communicated for Cappadocia and Greece and we were left wondering what do we do for the day3. I had told the operator that my Athens (place of stay) has changed four times. He told me that he will take care of it. I land in Athens and the driver took me to the old address4. My ferry tickets from Santorini to Athens, I had requested an upgrade. I was told by the operator that they were upgraded. We go to the boat to find out one ticket was not upgraded. My ticket was not upgraded and it was a huge inconvenience to manage my infant sitting in a different seat.Overall the written communication by the staff was not very good and most of the assurances were not right. The Greece leg was badly planned and if Travel shop turkey could not do Greece the agent should not have committed to doing it.
Honeymoon. Amazing tour. Well organised and perfect arrangements.. Ramazan and Raza were my tour consultant. Great job!!

City tour in Istanbul 1 day. Before coming to Turkey, i booked this tour via email with Ms Deyra. And Mr Coskun(tourguide of Travelshop) was waitting for us over 1 hour. (from 5h30am - 6h30am)Then, he continued to wait for us at our hotel till 8am and starting this tour from there.This tour was so nice, Cos gave us all the historical details of each location that we visited in Istanbul.Istanbul is a beautiful city !It was my pleasure to attend this tour.Thanks Travel Shop Turkey !Quynh Nguyen.

Fethiye 28 Aug 2015. Very good serviceI contacted with Ms Derya before traveling to Turkey, she gave me a lot of valueable information, and gave me some good tour in FethiyeTours in Fethiye of Travel Shop are so goodDaily boat tour is very quiet, relax, comfortableThe captain should give us exact time before boarding, so we will have much time to go to Butterfly Valley or climb to top of St Nicholas MountainParagliding is very goodTour door to door to Pamukkale and then drop off Selcuk is very good tour, the tour guide is very enthusiastic, who explain every places we visit.

Istanbul day. The second day (5/9/2015) it was a great day in Istanbul. I would like to thank Travel shop Turkey for the service that they give us and I would like to thank Mr.Turgay for helping usRegards.

Excellent. Our trip was awesome, we visited 4 cities all tour guides were friendly. The hotels were good and the buses/tour vans were always on time. Unforgettable Vacation thanks to TravelShop Turkey. I found TravelShop Turkey in the web, while searching for All Inclusive Vacations to Bodrum, Turkey.I contacted them by email, back in May, inquiring about their services. The next day I received an email from Me. Murtaza Kalender, the CEO of the company, explaining their services and their credentials.Two days later, I received another email. This time from Orhan Kalender. Orhan explained in details their services and vacation packages. When I told him that we were going to spend 1 week in Istanbul, prior to going to Bodrum, he even offered his helpin finding a suitable hotel for us there. I haven't booked our vacation to Bodrum from the states. Upon arriving in Istanbul, we went to TraveShop Turkey offices to book our All Inclusive Vacation in person.There, we were greeted by the Manager of the company, who showed us to Orhan's office. I have to say that I was impressed by Orhan's hospitality and his eagerness to make our vacation a memorable one. He had 4 of his agents working on making all the necessary reservations for our vacation, plane, hotel , attraction tours, while Orhan himself tried to find out what tours would we enjoy most and all the while entertaining us with drinks of our choice. He even treated us to lunch while his agents we scrambling to put our package together, as we wanted to leave for Bodrum the next day. After a few hours of real hard work of all the staff involved, our vacation was booked.The next day, Orhan sent an SUV to pick us up and take us to the airport. The same thing happened at the Bodrum airport, the driver and the SUV were waiting for us to take us to the hotel.At the hotel, our room was overlooking the pool and the ocean - BREATHTAKING VIEW -.Everyday, Orhan would call us to confirm the next day's tour and the pickup time. All the tours we hadwere private tours-just for us. The drivers/guides were very professional and knowledgable about the attractions.Orhan has put together an unforgettable vacation for us. The best money I have ever spent!!!Thank you very much, Orhan, for everything!!!I will definitely recommend TravelShop Turkey to all who are planning to visit Turkey.

16 Day Tour - 100 Year Anzac. Awesome trip Guler our guide was amazing with so much knowledge and passion for her country. Cool group to hang with. Lots of great and new experiences. Would thoroughly recommend. Travel Shop were easy to deal with and efficient.

The best thing we did to make our trip a great trip was to hire Travel Shop Turkey. This is a very organized company, before the trip we were constantly contacted to make sure the itinerary was the right one. During the trip we were treated very well by our tour guide Turguy, not to mention his bast knowledge of Turkey. Always on time and very well planned private tours.

Hassle Free Five Day Private Tour: Ephesus, Cappadocia and Istanbul. We used this agent to book us trip to Turkey including a private tour of Ephesus with pickup at Kusadasi port and one night Kusadasi, drop off at Izmir airport after the tour, flights to Kayseri, three nights Cappadocia and hot air ballooning, flights to Istanbul and one night in Istanbul.It was a special occasion trip (20th wedding anniversary) and the travel agent communicated this to all our hotels and we had great rooms and some complimentary touches like champagne in Istanbul and a cake from the Ciragan Palace plus very nice views and rooms from our other two hotels. We were also very pleased with the hot air balloon company they chose and the private Ephesus tour arranged. We do not usually use an agent to make bookings but book online ourselves but in this case we wanted to have a hassle free holiday and someone else taking care of all the details and this is exactly what we got. In terms of price I do not believe it cost us any more to use an agent and in fact we seemed to get better quality rooms than if we had booked independently. All our transfers were included. We used regular email and mobile phone contact to get in touch to get pickup times and this worked well. I would recommend you have a mobile phone with you so the agent can call you to advise updates on pick up times. There was an initial confusion over our Kusadasi port pickup but this got sorted fairly quickly once we called the agent. All in all we would recommend this as well as hassle free way to go. Just make sure you specify exactly what you want and what quality room you expect and ensure this all goes down in your quote if you are making a private tour arrangement since particularly in Cappadocia the rooms vary widely. We had a Fairy Chimney Suite which was magical and particularly requested it since there are limited suites available and every guest wants one.

An impressive tour in Istanbul. From the beginning the reception was organized in perfect order by tour operator Travel Shop Turkey. Our guide Hasan Oral was waiting for us at the airport and from there till to the hotel he did wasted no minute explaining and showing us curiosities about Istanbul. This attitude continued during all our visit in Istanbul, and Hasan showed to have extensive knowledge in history and culture of Turkey. I can not avoid mentioning the sense of humor which characterized Hasan. Although our staying was a short one, we had the chance to visit Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Great Bazar, The Hill of Lovers. We had the chance to have a dinner on boat associated with a magnificent show, another dinner under the bridge of Gallata with sea food and another one at tavern Tasan Arkat associated with an unforgettable show. We also had the chance to experience a boat trip during the day in Bosporus Straight ... hey I can not name all the activities we did there but I can say for sure that was worth it for the money we paid. Hasan Oral our guide at the end of the tour has become part of our group that much that when we parted at the airport we told him, of course joking, "Are you not coming with us". Hasan Oral is a very honest, respectful and intelligent guide I have ever seen up to now, and a great ambassador for Turkey to the world of tourism, and I thank him for that and also suggest him to others as a guide.

DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY. I booked the16 day tour of Turkey. We were there for the Anzac Day 100th anniversary. Unfortunately we did not get tickets in the ballot. I booked before it was decided that there was going to be a ballot. When it was first mentioned that there was going to be a ballot I phoned and spoke to a guy that said " it is our land we have been taking people to Anzac Cove for over 20yrs. We would not need a ticket in the ballot because we were booking direct with a Turkish travel agent. Well that turned out to be not true. I sent emails enquiring about what would be offered for those that did not get tickets in the ballot. I then phoned and spoke to a guy who told me that they were going to be hiring a block of land near the site and that they were going to be setting up big screens. I was told that the broadcast would be from ABC in Australia. The problem with Travelshopturkey is that they are very bad in returning your emails. TravelshopTurkey did not provide what they had said. We were in a hall. There was no grass outside and the big screen was very small. The connection kept dropping out and it was a very badly organised event. My husband is an Army veteran of nearly 24 yrs and he had been looking forward to this for many years. The next morning we left at 9.00am to go on the coach to pick the Aussies and Kiwis up. Our guide originally told us that we were leaving at 1.00pm. This was a total waste of a day. This is not how I expected to spend our Anzac Day. This was the worst Anzac Day that we have ever had. There were 6 of us who did not get tickets to the ballot. We actually left one guy behind who was not at the hall at 9.00am. The guide said he has my number. The bus had broken seats on it from the start of the tour. When my husband told the guide that there were broken seats she was very nasty and said that they were not broken at the beginning of the tour. She said that they must have been broken when they took people to Anzac Cove. The bus driver got lost several times and he did not adhere to the road signs. He went through lots of reds lights and stop signs. The first couple of days of the tour we did not get to the hotel until 9.30pm and later and then we had to have dinner. When I got back from the tour I sent a review of my tour to Ozcan. He was very slack in replying to my emails. He then said that he had to check things with our guide. This is when things turned ugly. The guide accused my husband of deliberately breaking the coach seats so that he could complain. This is not true. The guide also said that we had lost a relative just before our tour and that was why we were not happy. This is also another lie. I phoned Ozcan and spoke to him. He then told me that the reason why we were not outside was because of the cold. He said that in the years 2012, 2013 and 2014 they had to take people to the hospital because of the cold. Well we expected it to be cold we even hired sleeping bags which cost us 25 Euros each. All the other people that had tickets in the.ballot were outside!!!! Ozcan can not be trusted he tells you one thing on the phone then does not do it. He has so many excuses for not replying to your emails. Some of his excuses are he had problems with his computer. The final straw came when he emailed on Saturday 25 July and asked me to contact another person who was on our tour and to ask them to remove their review. He said that I had until Tuesday 28 July or he was going to contact TripAdvisors head office. That is very unprofessional. Turkey is a beautiful country and I recommend everyone to go and visit. The only thing I would advise is to not use TravelshopTurkey. This review is 100% true.

12 day hop on / hop off private tour. From the moment we arrived in the hotel until the day we left Istanbul we had a fantatic time with the help of TravelShop Turkey. Staff were very friendly and we received a phone call everyday to ensure our trip was memorable. We selected 4 star hotels and they were lovely and clean and in good areas close to amenities. Our favourite hotel being the Specluna Cave hotel. Transport was mainly in a mini bus, and our guides were friendly and knew the history. Loved every part of this holiday. THANK YOU TRAVELSHOP TURKEY - highly recommended!!

Amazing Istanbul Trip with Travelshop Turkey.. We first contacted Travelshop Turkey back in May while thinking about a trip to Istanbul.At the time we were not sure it would be possible to visit Istanbul as we had two weeks booked at the Palmin Hotel, Kusadasi. To be honest I did not believe it would be possible to do it and it would probably cost a fortune. We are a family of 3 and the cost was a big factor for us.I emailed Travelshop Turkey after comings across their website. I can honestly say from the first email I received back from the CEO Mr. Murtaza Kalender this company really looked after us.He appointed Ms.Ozlem Binay to correspond with us.Ms.Binay was brilliant sorting a 2 day Istanbul Tour for us.On 8 July at 5am we were collected from our hotel and driven to Izmir Airport.The driver was a gentleman. We flew to Istanbul with Turkish Airlines (breakfast included on 50 minute flight). We were collected at Istanbul airport by our tour guide. We had one stop to collect 4 more people and our tour began.The tour guide was excellent (not to forget our wonderful driver who gave us plenty of water) and we got to see the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the Topkapi Palace. We broke for lunch and then went to the Grand Bazaar. We were driven to the Dedeman Hotel for our overnight stay.The next morning after breakfast we were picked up from our hotel and brought to the highest point in the City to see the wonderful views. Next we went to the Spice Bazaar (Egyptian Bazaar). Then we were taken on a cruise of the Bosphorus. After lunch we were driven to the airport. We flew back to Izmir and collected by our driver.The driver stopped at a shop and bought water for us. We really felt this was a really nice thing to do,especially as our flight was delayed and he had to wait over 2 hours for us.We arrived back at the Palmin, Kusadasi, at 11.50pm,after a wonderful trip.We also booked Travelshop Turkey to bring us to Izmir Airport when returning home.We cannot praise this company enough. Thanks to all at Travelshop Turkey. True professionals. If going to Turkey check this company out.They really look after you from start to finish and our Tour Consultant,Ms Binay kept in contact by phone and email to make sure we were happy.

Worst tour I have ever been on.... I went on a 16 day tour around Turkey for ANZAC day 2015.Problems started from when the ballot system was first announced. Was told conflicting information, told the information I was getting in NZ was incorrect. (Actually was correct, tour company has incorrect information )When the tour finally started the stress just increased. Bus driver got lost going to every hotel, tour guide even got into an argument so bad with the driver she went to throw her phone away. Guide didn't know what we were doing the next day most of the time and would be on the phone calling head office. When you enquired about your extras, half the time she had no idea. I was made to feel like I held the group up because I added on an option. When I tried to add on the Turkish bath in Istanbul I was told all afternoon was not enough time, to find out that evening a group had gone at 2pm.... We had a free day and were given no options from our tour guide as to what there was to do. You were expected to do your own research and make your own bookings. Isn't that what the tour guide is for.... Overall the worst tour company I have ever dealt with. I even left the tour with mouth ulcers. After I returned home I raised my concerns with the company but overall I did not receive satisfactory response. Once they have your money and you are gone they couldn't care less.DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY. Especially if you want a relaxing low stress tour.

Very good company. Excellent service Nurgul was always on time. We took 5 days trip and it was amazing . Amazing service, excellent tours, everything just perfect for our honeymoon!. Travel shop Turkey were excellent in every way. Best Service Provider in turkey!!. I have been dealing with Travel Shop Turkey for long time & always delighted with their good services!!

private tour to Pumakkale and Ephesus. I found Travel Shop Turkey on the internet while searching for a travel agency that would take us to Pumakkale while our cruise ship docked at Kusadasi for 12 hours - quite a few Turkish travel agencies would not do this due to various reasons. From the moment I contacted Travel Shop Turkey to the minute we finished our private tour, we received prompt, professional, patient, knowledgeable services. Agent Onur Koc replied my enquiries with details and patience. He made careful arrangements that suited the needs of my parents (in their mid-80s) well. The owner/CEO of the company, Murtaza Kalender, followed up on my enquiries even though he was tending to his business in India. Tour guide Birol Goksudelik took a 12-hour bus ride from Istanbul to take us on our day trip to Pumakkale and Ephesus. The agency made arrangement for Birol Goksudelik to receive us because he speaks Chinese (my parents are Chinese nationals). He did not disappoint us. In fact, he impressed us with his knowledge of the sites, the region and the country, his personable approach and his professionalism. He was very curteous and accommodating towards my parents. We very much enjoyed our private tour due to the excellent services from Travel Shop Turkey.

Lovely Family Holiday in Istanbul.. Me & my family were visited Istanbul in May 2015 & were introduced to Travel Shop Turkey for our hotel bookings.I was impressed with the prompt replies got from them, especially Mr Abdullah Arin. Since we were travelling on standby tickets in May2015, which is high season from India, it was difficult for me to confirm a hotel room because I would not know till the last minute if we would be boarding the flight. I explained my situation to Mr Arin and he told me not to worry. When I boarded the flight all I did was send him a whatsapp message & that was all I had to do, I couldn't believe when I stepped out of the IST airport, I seen Mr Arin waiting for me with my name placard. What followed after that was a very pleasant holiday in Istanbul, we enjoyed our stay at Hotel Momento which he arranged for us and also the tour which was provided. Three cheers to Mr Abdullah Arin for his wonderfull support & efforts.

Perfect Honeymoon Tour. It was Our honeymoon tour and where u want everything perfect, timely and the best which I got from them. Good, knowledgeable, informative and lastly friendly staffs and guides in all the places. Thank you for being a part of our memory Travel Shop turkey. Thank you.

100th Anniversary of Anzac. My son was fortunate to win a ballot to be part of the Australian Contingent for the Anzac commemorative service at Gallipoli and took me along. Golden Gallipoli Tour. I have just returned from a wonderful week in Turkey, including the 5 day Gold Gallipoli tour with Travelshop. Perfect. Very well planned and executed. No problems at all. Friendly staff and informative guides. 5 star service.

Golden Tour. I was on the 5 day gold ANZAC Tour 2015. I was very happy with the service provided by Travelshop and the care taken. Memorable holiday in Turkey!. I had taken tailor-made 10 days tour with Travelshop Turkey including internal flights. The overall experience was good I have suggested many friends and family to visit Turkey with Travelshop. My Travel agent Riza was very polite and patiently answered all my questions. The hotels were nice and centrally located. They have their own tour guide and vehicle in Istanbul but for rest of the places they arranged with different tour agents. From entire trip, 3 tour guides were very good and had excellent knowledge on the subject. Yuke (pronounced as UK) in Istanbul, Nizam in Ephesus and Zu in Cappadocia. Istanbul day tour was good. Yuke is really very kind and helpful girl. Both the days she suggested very good restaurants to us. She is very sensible and professional - We had a family (couple + small kid) with us in the tour and during Bospherous cruise they wanted to sit inside and my husband and I preferred sitting outside but Yuke made sure that she attends both of us though it was bit of an extra efforts for her to explain everything to both of us separately. If you take a day tour in Istanbul then ask for Yuke to be your guide and you will be pleased and satisfied with her service :) The only reason I have not given Travelshop 5 star is because of few issues I had which could have been avoided. If you are booking with them - take care of these points1. Because no tour guide would travel with us, I was concern how to contact Travelshop if anything goes wrong? I was been assured that they will give me mobile so I can contact them whenever I want. Unfortunately that was a false promise! I was not given any phone and couple of times it was difficult to confirm tour pick times etc. I am a perfectionist and this was bit annoying for me at that time. 2. I was promised that max group size will be 15. However, on Green Tour in Cappadocia I was part of the group of 26 people in a bus which I would definitely not except from Travelshop.I thought someone from Travelshop would contact me after my return and ask for my experience but no one did that! I could not do balloon ride so I was expecting a refund into my account but it has been more than 2 weeks since I am back from turkey but I still don't have refund. But there is a positive point also that when I reported that, they apologized and promised that refund will be done soon so it should be fine.Turkey is a very nice place to visit..Happy holidays!!

Unforgettable memories of Turkey with Travel Shop Turkey and TURGAY POLAT. Last week my family and neighbors visited Turkey for the very first time. Amazing 12-day tour of Turkey. When I was initially planning my trip to Turkey, I compared different tour companies, including Travel Shop. I was very happy with how quickly the tour agent would reply back to me. The prices were pretty good as well, and I liked that they showed the price for single occupancy as well as double occupancy. Since I was travelling alone, it was nice to know all the prices up front. I booked the tour after a few emails back and forth to confirm all the details of my trip.When I got to Ataturk airport, I was hoping someone would be there to pick me up, as this was confirmed in my email before leaving for my trip. And yes, there was someone there to pick me up =). I was given a cellphone that I could use locally throughout my trip, if anything were to happen. All the tour agents phone numbers were on the phone as well. The day tours were great. I was always told at what time I would be picked up by my tour guide, and they were usually on time. All my tour guides (yes, I had different tour guides for the different cities/regions that I visited) were incredibly insightful and spoke good English. The day tour groups were no larger than 10 people, and for my first couple of tours, I was alone, so I had private tour! After each tour, I would always be driven back to either the same hotel or to the next hotel that I was to stay at. I was worried that I would always be carrying my luggage around, but they store it in their van (used by the day tour).For the bus ride to Cappadocia, and then the one back to Istanbul, I was always given a bus ticket by the tour guide, or given clear directions on where to go to get my ticket. Although I had the option to take the plane to go to and from Cappadocia, I chose the bus. I would not do that again though. It wasn't really comfortable, and got either really cold or really hot on the bus (it was the Metro bus company).I was also staying in Istanbul for a few days after my tour ended, and my tour operator gladly booked and included that price for me. There were absolutely no surprise fees during my stay. Any extra fees (such as drinks, or buying dinner at the hotel) was always explicitly stated by the tour guides.Overall, I am really happy that I went ahead and booked my tour with Travel Shop Turkey. I was honestly expecting some mishaps to happen, but nothing went wrong! I thoroughly enjoyed all the locations I visited (Istanbul, Gallipoli, Troy, Ephesus, Kusadasi, Canakkale, Pamukkale, Goreme, Cappadocia region). The best one is Cappadocia though, in my opinion. I think I will probably come back to Turkey and visit all the other regions I didn't do, and I will definitely use Travel Shop to organize my stay in the future.Thanks!

Awesome new days at Istanbul. it was a wonderful trip experience for us to Istanbul with a best guidance of Ms Yuke Celik , she is a tour guidewith full dedication, punctual and has got a very way of explaining all the highlights of Istanbul, ByJayakrishna Abu Dhabi,UAE

6 Days Christmas Holiday Istanbul. Headline - Not what is says on the Box.....My partner and I just spent the week on the Travel Shop Turkey Istanbul tour.The trip was 6 days over Xmas and included a raft of different daily activities, Travel shop sorted the hotel, transfers and then each days activities.Summary - Istanbul is an amazing place but one that in 6 days I feel we could have done so much better had we not been on this tour, as it was we finished the week feeling short changed. By far the best things we did were the during the time we had to ourselves. In fact so much so we blew off the last day of the tour (Bosphoros Cruise) and instead did a backstreet food tour, best day on the trip!Positives;- Hotel Momento was very nice and in a great location. Room was very small (only open suitcases on the bed) but this is common throughout Europe. Staff were nice, hotel was modern and well decorated. Great location in the old city only a few hundred meters from the Grand Bazaar. Be aware though that there are limited food/drink options around here at night, most of the variety and better options are over in the Taksim area.- Bus drivers were all very good, on time and sociable even through language barriers.- We were given a local mobile phone with numbers to contact anyone we needed.- Couple and their son who we spent most of the activities with.- Entertainment at the Gar a Turkish dinner and show evening. The Food was very poor compared to everything else we ate but the entertainment (dancing, singing etc...) was good enough to make up for it.Negatives- No continuity in people we dealt with. On the activities that were guided we had a different person each time and none of them had any idea what the rest of our itinerary involved.- One day involved a 'city tour', however the main destination the Topkapi palace was closed even though it was advertised on our itinerary. Given the days were set around Xmas well in advance this should have been known. Although we did get to see the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque nothing replaced the palace and we were therefore finished by around noon. Day had started at 9am when we spent an hour on the bus after being picked up to collect the other people only to start the tour about a 10 minute walk from our Hotel.- Tour included a guided shopping day, a quote from the itinerary; "We will make a shopping tour in which you will be aware of the ancient arts of Turkey like carpet weaving, leather manufacturing and jewellery. As this will be a guided tour, you will avoid being hassled which will enable you enjoy the shopping experience whilst gaining the knowledge of the ancient craftsman." What this was in practice - Dropped and left at a mall for 2 hours and then taken to the Grand Bazaar where we were taken to one overpriced Turkish delight store. This was definitely a waste of a day and a low light of our week.- Turkish baths although a great experience didn't know the women were coming and had to spend 10 minutes getting the driver to call people to talk to them to sort it out.- The itinerary also stated that on one day "Enjoy a big xmas feast of rich Turkish cuisine and party the night away with your new friends" but this actually meant feel free to organise and pay for your own meal. The next day had something very similar written and this was an organised dinner with Turkish entertainment.

Travelshop Turkey Tours. We are a retired couple from Toronto and went on line to find a reputable tour company, that has been around for several years, to organize a nice upmarket tour of a few regions within Turkey covering 14 - 17 days. We narrowed it down to 3 tour companies and got proposals from each of them. In the end we chose Travelshop Turkey, because of : Service Quality, Price, Tour Ideas, Reputation from tour reviews by various travellers.Derya Cetin organized our tour and she did a great job. We made specific requests (e.g. no jewellery shops, pottery shops, carpet shops, etc so we didn't waste valuable time in tourist traps that used hard sell techniques. We also asked for private tour guides, flights (not buses) between cities, focus on historical and cultural visits, specific hotels. All our requests were accommodated without exception. Its nice to work with someone who listens to their client so well.We spent a total of 15 days in Turkey: 7 in Istanbul (5 at the beginning and 2 at the end), 3 in Kusadasi, 2 in Antalya, 3 in Cappdocia.We can highly recommend the Four Seasons Hotel in Sultanahmet -- great location in the old town and easy walking distance to several key spots (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Grand Bazaar, lots of great restaurants). Fantastic staff who are well trained and will do everything to make your stay special. Its well worth the extra cost vs. other hotels nearby. Ask for a room overlooking the courtyard.In Kusadasi we stayed at the Korumar Deluxe Hotel. Photos were great when we picked the hotel, but after our stay we give it a thumbs down. Not that clean and in need of some renovation / updating. Also, the staff were not helpful. Its a shame as the location and views are fantastic. In Antalya we stayed at the Rixos Downtown hotel. Very nice hotel and would also recommend this one. Its more of a business hotel, but it has nice facilities and a nice pool in a park setting. Ask for a sea view room.In Cappadocia we stayed at the Argos Hotel. Really unique place with a great restaurant. Built into the the large hill side in village of Uchisar, it has magnificent views. Very helpful staff. Ask for a room with a view.In Cappadocia, we went on a hot air balloon ride arranged by Travelshop Turkey with Goreme Balloons. Very professional group with good equipment, we had a very experienced pilot and a good safety briefing before hand. Highly recommend this experience.The guides assigned to us were:For Istanbul Part : Coskun For Kusadasi Part : Bahar For Antalya & Cappadocia Part : Ozgur All of them were excellent. They were very knowledgeable about history of their respective areas, restaurants, specialty shopping including artwork. Ozgur, in particular, was special -- we really enjoyed his passion for his country, as well as his exceptional knowledge about culture and history.A nice surprise thrown in by Derya was the private boat trip around the Bosphorus. We were expecting to be on a boat with lots of other tourists, but on arrival at the boat it was just us. Didn't expect that so it was a nice treat.We were driven around by very experience drivers in clean, fairly new Mercedes vans with lots of room.Overall, I would highly recommend Travelshop Turkey and Derya Cetin to organize your tour in Turkey. However, make sure you do your homework first so you know what kind or a trip you want and were you want to go (and not go) so that Derya tailors your trip to your specific preferences. We found Turkey to be a wonderful place to visit with very friendly people and tremendous history to explore.

I would suggest asking for Hasan as your tour guide. He was our guide for two days and we had a lot of fun thanks to him.

2 day istanbul tour-flew in from marmaris. we booked online before travelling to turkey. the service was great and even gave the option of slowly paying the tour off over a few months.our holiday was in marmaris 20/10/14-27/10/14. i was eager to visit istanbul! east meets west and to see the famous istanbul scenes from skyfall and taken! and to see the blue mosque! all my wishes were fulfilled! our istanbul tour was booked 21/10/14-22/10/14. somebody came to pick us up from our hotel in marmaris at 1.30am (we had not been told the pick up time, stuff on papers said 4am), later found out 4am was the flight from dalaman to istanbul. just felt let down for not being given an exact pickup time as we had to do a quick ten minute pack at 1.30am! the driver went at superspeed and got us to dalaman airport within 20mins with plenty time for us to check in! phew!flight from dalaman to istanbul just took over 30mins-served free food and drinks! leather interior and spacious seats.once we landed and finally found our tour guide-hasan oral. we went to our impressive hotel and had a few hours relaxation before the long walking day ahead. unfortunately topaki palace was closed on a tuesday (wish i knew this when booking i would have booked for another day) . we visited the blue mosque-extravagent!!! hagai sophia, underground cisterns, grand bazaar. alot of history and information from hasan. i really really enjoyed this tour even though i was ill from food poisoning from our hotel in marmaris. Hasan's hospitality and Knowledge was excellent! he made the trip worthwhile! i would definately recommend his to fellow travellers! the history and culture and knowledge you will experience is worth it all! day 2 was experiencing the bhosphorous tour and looking onto european turkey from asia turkey! this was breathtaking! our trip to spice bazaaar was expensive though! we spent £63 on a small box of turkish delight! we had no idea we had over paid until we got back to marmaris and realised turkish delight was offered at around 15 Liras for a small box! a little annoyed that Hasan had promised us over the two days to take us to his cheap shops for gifts. not cheap for us then!overall as long as you dont do the stupid act of paying for turkish delight for its weight in gold! lol! worth the sightseeing and historical knowledge you will gain! i wont visit turkey again but i will definately recommend this tour to others. when we got back to marmaris we told everyone we met about the tour and many people were shocked as they had been coming to marmaris for over 10 years but never knew about trips to istanbul!

Amazing 15 days in Turkey. From the very moment I came across the advertisement for the 12 days tour of Turkey, I instantly made up my mind that I am going for it...! We were a group of 20 adults and 5 children very warmly received by Orhan Kalendar at Ataturk International airport in Istanbul. Our next stop was the Travel Shop Turkey offices as we had to wait for the rest of the group who were travelling from Mombasa to arrive. Welcomed by Murtaza Kalendar and after our first cup of Turkish Tea, Orhan took us to breakfast at a cafe near their offices and thereafter to the shopping area nearby to kill time before we returned to the airport for our flight to Antalya. We met our guide Turgay at the airport and Orhan, Turgay and Sadik checked us all in while we comfortably waited. This was just the beginning!!The next few days we spent in Antalya visiting the Aspendos Theatre, Old City Kaleici, a boat trip out onto the Mediterranean Sea and we also opted to watch Fire of Anatolia the theatrical musical which was well worth the extra fee!We moved on to Kusadasi and visited Ephesus, the ancient city, Sirinche village and finished off with our visit to a Turkish leather factory and Turkish carpet weaving centre which also provided a lot of knowledge and insight in production of the two commodities eventually moving on to an onyx factory where we saw various end products of this beautiful stone and even indulged in buying some gemstone jewellery! Next on our agenda was Pamukkale,the beautiful blue and white calcium terraces surrounded by the ruins of the Hierapolis which was original founded as an ancient spa.From Kusadasi, we returned to Istanbul where we visited Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, Suleimania Mosque, the Ancient Hippodrome where one can see the Obelisk of Theodosius, The Serpentine Column and the Column of Constantine, the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Market. Also on our tour itinerary were the Bosphorus Dinner cruise and the Turkish 1001 nights Dinner show which included great entertainment.All in all we had an awesome trip and even extended it from 12 days to 15 days which enabled us experience a trip to Prince's Island and enjoy the horse carriage tour around the island, Eyup Sultan and a ride in the cable cars up to Pierre Loti Hill where we could view all of Istanbul.Thank you Orhan & Sadik and everyone at Travel Shop Turkey for an amazing experience and a big thumbs up to our awesome guide Turgay!! We will definitely visit Turkey again soon,

“Travelshop Turkey - A Rafting Trip To Remember. Our rafting trip at Melen river was one of a kind. Everything from pick up to drop off went smoothly.The staff were welcoming, meals were delicious, and the facilities were good. Our guide "Orhan" was a real professional. His kind demeanor and genuine hospitality made us feel special !I highly recommend Travelshop Turkey, and I will definitely book my future trips to Turkey with them!

Travelshop Turkey - rafting trip on Melen River. We booked our rafting trip on Melen River with Travelshop Turkey and had an amazingly wonderful experience. While planning/booking the trip, communication via email was clear and prompt. Our guide ORHAN was excellent!! He met us at the meeting point on time, and drove us to our destination in a VIP van (which was an experience in itself!). He spoke English very well, he was friendly and he always made sure we were comfortable.Upon arrival, he gave us a nice bit of time to walk around and explore the beautiful surroundings of the area. The area is green and lush. We had the advantage of picking fruits and berries right off the trees!! Orhan personally took photos of us from the moment we arrived till the moment we left and later on offered us the photos on a CD for free!!! There were over 500 beautifully captured photos. While viewing these, we were speechless!! We cannot thank him enough. This was a huge bonus!!!!The facilities were excellent. They consisted of beautiful wooden cabins, a sitting/eating area and clean bathrooms.The package we purchased included breakfast and lunch, both of which were delicious, fresh and filling. Breakfast was traditional Turkish, and lunch had a bit of everything (salads, pasta, rice, barbecued chicken, bread, etc..)After breakfast we were taken to get our wetsuits and rafting equipment, we then had to sit and wait for a while till the mini bus came to transfer us to the river bank. The ride was nerve-wrecking to say the least. The bus was literally on the edge of the winding road and the driver was speeding like crazy. Orhan was not driving here, but someone else. This was by far the worst part of the trip.Another letdown was the fact the the pre-rafting safety instructions were given only in Turkish. As non-turkish speaking people, this left us a little uneasy, especially those of us who were about to go rafting for their first time. Nonetheless, we managed to get the basics translated to us by a fellow traveler and things went fairly smooth.The rafting trip itself was obviously the highlight. It was lots of fun and the rapids were nice and strong in some areas, and slower in others. Although the water was murky, we went for a little swim in the very cold water!After rafting, there were somewhat primitive shower facilities available, which were O.K.Our guide Orhan waited for us near the cabin area and met us once we were done rafting. He had previously allowed us to store our belongings in his van and assured us this was safe, which it was. After cleaning up and getting dressed, there was the lunch buffet just as mentioned in the package description on their website http://www.travelshopturkey.com/Orhan drove us home and was even kind enough to offer us another outing the following day which we took him up on. He took us to a nice fish restaurant in Kumkapi, on which I will write a seperate review.I am so glad we booked our rafting trip with Travelshop Turkey. They are very friendly and highly professional! I would recommend their services to anyone planning a trip to Turkey. Orhan's hospitality blew us away! He let us take our time and we never felt rushed! Thanks to him, we had an amazing experience from begining to end.

Mind-Blowing Experience.... Our 12 day trip to Turkey (14 teaching staff and 3 school students)was the perfect mix of sight-seeing, relaxation and cultural immersion. Ozan is a fantastic tour guide with just the right balance between professionalism and approachability. His in-depth knowledge and obvious dedication to his country and his heartfelt portrayal of its beautiful and rich culture and history helped to personalise the trip for us and gave us a greater appreciation of everything that Turkey has to offer. Turkey itself is a country located right on one of the most important water way trade routes in history. So here you have a taste of all the histories and architecture that the neighbouring European and Asian civilisations have to offer in a place that is really quite inexpensive to get to and to visit!I highly recommend the 12 hour bus trip from Istanbul to get to Kapadokya, the hot springs and a dip in Cleopatra's Pool in Pammukale, and if you're an Aussie or a Kiwi, the Rememberence services at Gallipoli are certainly a once in a lifetime, must-see-and-do experience. Highest on my list of things to do though, is an authentic Turkish Bath (Hamam) experience. I can promise you, Turkey is TOTALLY worth it!

Travelshop made Istanbul stay and sightseeing enjoyable. We stayed 5 days/4 nights in Istanbul. Travelshop took care of everything for us. We were picked up promptly at the airport on arrival and transported to the hotel. The sightseeing tours were planned and executed well. Even though it was a group tour, there was only one other couple with us. The tour guide was extremely knowledgeable in the history of Istanbul. It was very important to know the history since most attractions have a long history. The tour guide gave us enough time to spend at the attractions so we were never rushed. We could have done without the visits to Leather and Ceramic shops. The ceramic demonstration was good, We enjoyed and were flattered by the Leather/Fur jackets fashion show done for just four of us. But we were in no mood to spend $500 or more on the items in these stores. On the last day, Travelshop Van was at hotel on time to take us to the airport. Please note that at Istanbul airport, the carts are not free even at baggage claim on arrival. I had to exchange currency at airport just to get 1 Lira coin to pay for a cart to carry our 4 bags.

Wonderful planned tour.. We took a 10 days tour in November 13 which was fully organised by Ms Nurhan Ozbek of Travelshop Turkey. We travelled to Cappadocia, Antalya, Pamukkale, Kusadasi and Istanbul. We were total 5 family members and I should say that the tour organisation was very professional and superb. My ratings are based on following points:1) Logistics/Transfers/Pickups: Whether you are arriving at any particular destination late or before time, you will always find a Travelshop representative waiting at the gate for you. This is so important because in a foreign country if your tour agency representative is not present then a sense of fear creeps in. 2) Communications: The BEST. Replies from Nurhan were immediate and she was very accommodative, always keeping our comfort on priority. All the queries before tour were replied in time thru Skype. Also, during the tour, she was constantly in touch thru Skype & Whatsapp. Once during the tour she was available for us even at 9.30 in the night. That's amazing service.3) Hotels: We took the 5 star hotel package and the hotels were upto the mark, except in Antalya where the hotel-Sea Life was not so great.4) Mobile: The agency went one step ahead & provided a mobile phone with sim & credit in the phone for us so that we can communicate with our tour operator at any time. The phone had all the numbers pre-loaded in it. This was so thoughtful of Travelshop.5) Food: We opted for Jain Vegetarian food for our family. Proper full course Jain veg food was available 50% of the times. Rest of the times it was manageable, but no complaints.Finally, Thank you NURHAN OZBEK and Travelshop team for making our trip to Turkey a memorable one. Hope to see you again in future.

Great Trip, in love with Hagia Sofia :). Hiii friends.. ☺Our tour was arranged by Travelshop Turkey. It was a 12 day tour and we had a blast. Thanks to our tour guide Ozan Baykara, who made the trip very interesting by sharing the cultural and historical significance of the places we visited. Hot air balloon in Cappadocia and exploring the underground city in the vicinity was a wonderful experience. In Antalya, ruins of Aspendos theatre, Perge and Apollon Temples were breathtaking. We got a free day in Antalya, that is the time we went for scuba diving, which added excitement to our trip. Our 3rd destination in Turkey was Pamukkale, initially we were apprehensive about the place.. but I must say if you are in a big group and you want to chill out it is one of the best place to go. Pamukkale is known for its calcium rock formation and hot springs or say thermal pools, it is stunning to look at and is a great tourist spot. We reached Istanbul during Sacrifice, the city was adorned with lights. The Blue mosque and Hagia Sophia are the places I fall in love with. They are great architectures and a unique mix of Roman & Ottoman culture. The mosaics, ottoman treasures, the Arabic literature (I did not understood much but thanks to OZAN he made me understand few things) amazed my imagination. Last but not the least, thanks a lot to our tour guide Ozan, who make the trip much more interesting. He gave us enough time to relax and also told us what to buy and where to buy.. He Saved our Money ☺ . He is one of the best tour guides I have ever met..

Travel Shop Turkey private tour. Hello from Canada!On behalf of our small group of five from the Ottawa area, we would all like to thank-you and congratulate you on the excellent job your agency did concerning our private tour consisting of Istanbul, Fethiye, Antalya and Cappadocia (September 13 -27, 2013). Cappadocia and Istanbul September 2013. We had a spectacular time in the Capadocia region and Istanbul. The Spelunca Cave Hotel was amazing.,The town of Goreme could not have been nicer. The tours we went on to the underground city, Lahare Valley, the Outdoor Museum were extremely well done by the guides (Farouk and Ujel). The hot air ballons and ATV excursions were simply wonderful. We even were able to see a cave home as our guide, Ujel brought us to his mother-in-laws cave home to see an actual lived in dwelling. The Goreme area is extremely reasonably priced !Istanbul was an amazing city! The old city around Sultanamed was awe inspiring. Topkapi Palace, The Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome and the entire area was a trip back through the ages and extremely well explained and traversed by our wonderful guide Nurgul. Don't miss the Basilica Cistern!The only disappointment on the entire nine days we spent inTurkey was the trip to the city of Troy ruins. It was a very long (four hours plus) bus ride each way for a 90 minute tour. Too much time for only one place.As a note, the people of Turkey could not have been nicer or more friendly to Americans. Most people spoke some English and we felt very welcomed in their country. Turkey is relatively inexpensive and you truly get tremendous value for your money.

Wonderful staff; Overall, great tour company. My sister and I booked the "Taste of Turkey" 12 day tour through a local travel agent in Arizona. Straight away I had a good feeling about this tour; when Mr. Sadik met us at the airport upon our arrival, he handed us a bag with our itinerary, some local information and a company mobile phone with staff numbers taped to the back. We ended up needing this phone a lot, and we were very grateful to have it. Our driver from the airport to our hotel was Mr. Salih (he was by far the best driver we had during our 2 weeks), and though he didn't speak much English, he was very friendly and warm. He even taught us a little Turkish that came in very handy during our tour! Istanbul is a terrific city and our tour guide Ms. Nurgul was very knowledgeable, friendly and handled any special requests that were made.We flew to Ankara that second day, and had another smooth transfer from airport to hotel. We were picked up promptly the next morning by our guide for the rest of the trip, Mr. Hafiz. As a tour guide, he is probably one of the most knowledgeable I've ever come across. Listening to him was more informational than watching a documentary. Some other passengers on our tour double-checked his facts and dates and said that he was spot on. We visited the gorgeous countryside of central Turkey; Pamukkale, Cappadocia, Kusadasi, Troy, Ephesus... The list goes on. In my opinion, the region of Cappadocia and the ancient cities of Hieropolis & Ephesus were by far and away the best parts of the tour. To make a long story short; the itinerary is excellent, the staff is friendly and helpful, and Turkey is an absolutely wonderful country.

Very good experience. My family of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids of 6 and 8 years old) just finished a 10-day private tour with Travel Shop Turkey to Istanbul, Ephesus, Pamukkale, Cappadocia. It was a very good experience.I spent quite a lot of time skyping with their boss, Murtaza, to plan for this trip, and that was one of the reasons why the trip was so successful.The tour guide Ozan was very responsible and knowledgeable. He could explain very well about the attractions, be it religious, nature, history, or others. My kids liked him a lot. My daughter left her backpack with an ipad at a hotel and Ozan immediately called the hotel and found it. Great !The tour itinerary was fabulous. We visited many beautiful places, and I particularly liked Pamukkale and Cappadocia, which are unique in the world. The drivers were on time and always dropped us off at the closest points to the attractions.We paid for 5-star hotels, standard rooms. Out of the 4 hotels we stayed, we were upgraded to the suites in 3 hotels. What a delight !On Day 1 and Day 10, our arrival to Istanbul and departure were very early and very late respectively. This means we had full days in Istanbul. We visited the places of our own choice and they were organized very well.We had a break out to Greece at Kusadasi for 4 days on our own between the tour Day 4 and Day 5 (that means we left the tour after Day 4, then spent 4 days in Greece on our own, and re-joined the tour's Day 5 afterwards). That was well taken care of. Travel Shop Turkey booked the ferry tickets for us, and helped us resolve a lot of logistics.We had some ad-hoc requests from time to time, such as crossing the Bosphorus Strait by car ferry, and dinner at an island we saw on the way. They were well taken care of.If I have to say some negative experience about the tour, that would be (1) during the planning, the responses from their staff were quite slow sometimes, (2) their driver had forgotten 1 piece of our luggage during a car change, (3) Visit to the spice market was planned to be on the last day, and we only knew on that day that it was a holiday and the market was closed. If planning was better, we could have done it on a previous day.After all, it was a great trip. Thanks, Travel Shop Turkey.

Wonderful day in Pergamum!. My wife and I visited Turkey and Greece for the first time this November and it was also our first cruise. Not only were we able to book a tour through them to Pergamum for about what the cruise line was charging but we had our own personal minivan, guide, and separate driver! What a blessing!We also had our tour booked to Pergamum for Nov. 2nd but then our ship delayed departing because of people trying to get out of New York because of Hurricane Sandy. Again I panicked but when I contacted travelshopturkey they said it would be no problem and they'd meet us on the 3rd. We found our guide waiting on us with a sign with our name on it as we disembarked.Our guide was named Nizamettin Adsiz. He spoke fluent English and was very knowable and enthusiastic. We learned so much about not only the ruins at Pergamum but also what life is like in Turkey now. It's just neat to be able to ask question after question without thinking you are taking up the guide's time or interrupting anyone else. We also ate lunch with him and the driver and we were able to learn some things about the driver's life even though he spoke no English.We felt pretty smug going around the big tour groups from our cruise ship! lolWhat a wonderful experience!Pergamum is a "must see" and I'd highly recommend it through travelshopturkey.comDugald & Nancy McMillanWoodland, Al USA
