Ilker was simply awesome. Istanbul has so much to offer tourist and we would have liked to stay a day or two more.We then flew to our next stop, Kusadasi, which was just as awesome as Istanbul, Nizam our tour guide also proved just as capable and knowledgeable. The trip to the Ephesus was eye opening, with amazing discoveries, lunch was great and all the travel arrangements work like clockwork. The disappoint part of this leg of our trip was the accommodation, Hotel Dirasi, just did not cut it, it is rated as a four star hotel, but it’s more like a two star, would not advise anyone to stay there. We soon forgot about the hotel and moved on to our next stop over, Coppadoaccia, again everything was on time, we had two incredible tour guides Kubra and Kisma, both well spoken, very well versed on the attractions and very helpful. They all just made the trip worth it. Our main coach driver, Mustafa was friendly and helpful. His coach was very clean and neat. A final thanks to the senior manager at the Travel Shop, Mr Adnan, he kept in contact on a daily basis and made sure we got our monies worth. The Travel Shop were great. Thanks to all.

5 Day Muslim Tour. Hello,I did the 5 day Muslim Tour - solo. It was a terrific experience. The itenerary was as following:Day 1- Pick up from airport, drop off to hotel, check in and enjoy the day. This was setup very well. I was looking for the individual for about 15 minutes at the airport and he took me to the van and from their to the hotel for the quick check in. Sadaq was the Tour operator and Saleh was the driver. Both did an exceptional job of making it a smooth journeyDay 2-Was picked up at the stated time (8:45am) and from their was taken to the other tour sites. Luckily it was just me and another individual. We did all the tour sites except for 1 which I mentioned to Travel shop and the were able to accomodate it the following day. Our tour guide was Murrat for that day. He was a good tour guide. He provided a high level summary of the tour sites and their historical siginficance. I would suggest that if you want detailed information (dates, purpose, uniqueness, then do the research and then ask the questions). I would imagine different tour guides provide different historical input. Day ended at 4pm and was dropped off to my hotel.Day 3- It was luckily just me today on the tour and it was terrific.- picked up at 8:45am. We visited all the sites, including the one missed yesterday, and were able to fit in a chai break over the Golden Horn and then lunch on the Asian side over looking the Bosphurus to Istanbul (European side). Day ended around 5. Saleh and Murrat were very hospitable and kind during the whole trip. Murrat was able to give an evening itenerary by Tram and it worked out perfect! Murrat did a great job today! Tell him Merhaba from me :)Day 4- We started the day at 6am. Ayub was the operator for today. He kindly picked me up and took me to the Ferry near Kabatas and had me checked in for a 2 hour trip to Bursa. Arrived their at 9 to be picked up by local operator. He took us to another location to be picked up by the central operator and then we went and picked up others. The day was great. The unfortunate aspect was that it was the wrong tour guide for me that day but luckily I was able to see the Uludagh mountains which made up for a lot. Though I was not the in right tour guide, it was partially my fault as they announced the day's itenerary before starting and I did not say anything as I thought it may have been slight modification/mis interperations. Nonetheless, when I noticed by 3pm we were not on the intenarary, I told the tour guide Furize and she setup a pick up to take me to atleast the Ulucami Masjid (I was able to catch my prayers their as well). So net net it went well. Dropped of and checked in to Ferry by the local operator and picked up by Ayub in Istanbul. Dropped to hotel by 8ish.Day 5- Today was a solo day. Thecheck out was by 12 at the hotel: Princess Old City Hotel, which by the way was terrific as well. The service, the food, rooms and the cleanliness. Was picked up by the tour operator at 1:30 to be dropped off at the airport :(So as you can see, though things were not 100% in line, as soon as I brought it to the Tour guide's attention they did whatever they could to resolve it. I definetly will be using their services again and now knowing how things work, I will be able to ask proper questiosn as well. I.e, when I arrive at the airport, who should I call? On the day's iternary, ensure you are in the correct tour trip. I do have to say that the tour guides could have been more informative, but then again you should find out before hand if it is a detailed inforamtion tour guide as everyone may not want that. Great exerpience, smooth check-in's /outs, great accomodation, very kind/hospitable/polite. Great great great!!!Look forward to visiting Turkey again.Thanks Travel Shop.Muddassir

I LOVE TURKEY <3. We visited Turkey in August with TravelShop who put together a customized package for us. After countless emails and requested changes I put them through I was a little worried about how it all would turn out, but it was the most memorable vacation we had :D Many thanks to the amazing travel agent Ozcan Aytac and our guest relations agent Sadik Kalender who put it all together and made sure that we were happy with our accommodations etc. We spent 16 days traveling the country and truly enjoyed every minute of it. The agency made sure we were always picked up on time and notified us by provided cell phone when we need to be ready for our next destination (now thats what I call a vacation, we felt like VIP's) As with everything in life there were a few minor hick ups but you can't sweat the small stuff, you are afterall on vacation and if you are a few hours late who cares! Turkey never sleeps ;) I fell in love with Istanbul and look forward to visiting again soon :) I would highly recommend letting Travelshop organize your tour, I know I will :D Çok teşekkürler Beyler!

Best Tour Guide... Ilker Sahin!!. We recently returned from tour of Istanbul. Our guide, Ilker Sahin was the very best! He was extremely knowledgeable about the attractions and provided interesting cultural and historical information as well .His English was flawless and he was polite and very professional.

Istanbul. On the first day it took the Travel Shop driver a long time to find the hotel, and this was discouraging. As we arrived very late in the evening we had to drop our luggage quickly and go out to find somewhere to eat dinner without anybody to guide us. We had to accept a three star hotel for the first three nights but it should have been a four star. By eight in the morning we had to be ready to leave for the tour and this was too early for the first day after arrival. We were tired, had no time to eat breakfast, and were told we would be left behind if we took time to eat then. The bus did not make any refreshment stops, so lunch was not offered until two thirty, which was when we arrived at Bursa, two hundred and twenty kilometres from Istanbul! After all of this we did actually enjoy very much the sea crossing to Bursa and the guided tour we were given there. We took a tour on the cable car, visited the museum, the old market places and some facinating historical sites. The tours over the next few days were also very enjoyable. We went all around Istabul, explored the Asian and European areas, Aya Sophia Mosque, Sultan Ahmed, Suleymaniye, Abiu Ayu Al Ansari, the beautiful Grand Bazaar, the Egyptian Bazaar (or Spicy Bazaar) and so much more than I can say here. Many thanks to Mr Ozcan Aytac and Sadaq for the help they gave us each time we called them using the mobile phones they supplied to us on our arrival. Thanks also to the helpful driver from Travel Shop. We were easily able to extend our stay through the Travel Shop Agent. Despite the difficulties I would recommend this Travel Shop Service to my friends. The service could easily be improved with better management and some training in communication with foreigners. They also could improve their awareness of the needs of visually impaired people.

Travel Shop Turkey Disaster. Unfortunately we did not share the wonderful experiences other travellers had with Travel Shop. Our giude "lost" us on the first day of our tour. Our Hotel was changed on the second leg of the tour without notification to us or our travel agent. The cell phone provided for us to contact them did not work and they did nothing to rectify it even though it was advised on Day 1. Lunch 'provided' on one of the tours offered NO choice, take the pie or that is it. Trip to Ankara was a disaster, wrong ticket provided to us and we had to sort it out. When we arived in Ankara at midnight no one was there to receive us. Overall I would not use this company again nor would I recommend them.

7 day Turkey tour. We had a wonderful time in Turkey. Travel shop Turkey. We had an absolutely fantastic trip. It was a 7 day tailor made tour and Travel shop Turkey made our tour easy by fitting all that we wanted to do and see in those days. Communication (given mobile phone on arrival at airport) and response was excellent. I would certainly recommend for a hassle free trip....Enjoy

Great tour overall with a bizarre twist. At very short notice, TravelShop Turkey organised a 5 day tour of Turkey including 2 days in Istanbul and 3 days in Cappadocia. We had an excellent time and the staff of TravelShop Turkey and our tour guides were informative and helpful, although sometimes a bit too quick on their feet to keep up with in the Istanbul crowds. Our 3 days in Cappadocia were especially wonderful, with accommodation in a fantastic luxury cave hotel, 2 full day tours, lovely guides and delicious lunches in local restaurants. Our 2 day tours in Istanbul were also fascinating, but slightly marred by the rather bizarre fact that half the people on the bus had one itinerary and the other half had a slightly different itinerary. Both groups had to fork out an extra 25 Lira per person to be allowed to visit all the sites on the agenda for the day, otherwise they'd have to wait while the other group visited the Hagia Sophia or the Topkapi Palace, both of which are among the top attractions of Istanbul. It seemed like some kind of 'divide and conquer' strategy to get us to fork out extra cash - and it worked, but left a lingering bad taste in our mouths... We've never encountered such a weird tour situation anywhere else in the world.Apart from that, we did really enjoy Istanbul and we did appreciate the friendly and helpful attitude of both our driver and knowledgable guide and the very efficient organisation of transfers, flights and accommodation.

Thank you TravelShop Turkey. My experience was fantastic in Istanbul with TravelShop Turkey. Their transport is so nice and clean and with air condition. Also they have really good drivers. I would also like to thank Ms. Hannah Dale from TravelShop Turkey who replied to my emails at earliest and for her help. Thank you TravelShop Turkey for a great experience!

Travel Shop Turkey - fantastic tour!. We have just returned from a 7 day tour of Turkey which we organised through Travel Shop Turkey (Mrs Canan Saka). We went to Istanbul, Kusadasi and Capadoccia. My Review is about Travel Shop Turkey. I will evaluate Travel Shop Turkey in general, since I had a private guided tour with them, where I visited Istanbul, Pamukkale, Antalya, & Cappadocia. Istanbul to Cappadocia trip. My family and I were vacationing in Istanbul and I woke up one morning wanting to go visit Cappadocia on a whim. The problem was that I only had 2 days left in Istanbul so I had to cram a trip to Cappadocia within 2 days. I contacted several travel agencies that day. Despite such short notice, Travel Shop Turkey provided exceptional service with the best price and the best customized itinerary within a few hours. Because my schedule was so restrictive, I had to have a customized itinerary to accommodate all the activities and tours I wanted to do in Cappadocia. Travel Shop Turkey was the only travel agency I found that could deliver this for me! I had a very packed, rigorous schedule which included 2 flights, a regular packaged tour, an extra private tour to the underground city, stay at a cave hotel, and hot air balloon ride. I was very impressed with how smoothly everything went for me despite such last minute preparations. Ozcan, my travel consultant, arranged everything within 12 hours--what excellent service! I could enjoy a hassle-free, stress-free visit to Cappadocia because he had taken care of everything. I worried that after my hot air balloon ride, I would not make it to the airport on time for my international flight because there is no way to tell where you will land after a hot air balloon ride, BUT after I landed a car was there ready to whisk me away to the airport! During my brief sojourn in Cappadocia, Ozcan also called a few times to check up on me and my family to make sure we were enjoying our trip and to allow me to voice any concerns or difficulties. I appreciated this gesture to make sure that we were well and happy--this is also an indication of how much they value their customer's satisfaction. I thoroughly enjoyed this trip, which has contribute to my fond memories of Turkey.I highly recommend Travel Shop Turkey and am confident that they will provide services that would satisfy your needs!

Reliable and responsive travel agent. A great holiday with a great company. My husband and I booked a 9-day holiday using Travel Shop Turkey, and it included round trip transfers between Istanbul, Cappadocia, and Izmir (Kusadesi), as well as hotels with breakfasts in all three locations and guided tours for 7 of those days. Our initial airport pick-up was a little late but luckily our Tour Consultant Defne, was always a phone call away and was able to resolve the issue fairly quickly. After that, everything went fairly smoothly. We had guided tours of Istanbul, Cappadocia and Kusadesi. We asked for 5 star hotels in all three cities and were given better hotels than we expected in Kusadesi, (The Charisma Deluxe Hotel) and Cappadocia - (The MDC Hotel) but our hotel in Istanbul was slightly below par (The Central Palace Hotel). Our biggest complaint with that hotel was that we were given a very small room with 2 single beds, non-English speaking staff, and the hotel didn't provide irons for guests, instead they charged a lot of money for ironing services, and returned your clothes a few hours later smelling like smoke. Our tour guides in all three cities were very knowledgable but there were 2 guides who didn't speak English very well and we had a difficult time understanding what they were saying. Travel Shop Turkey was very prompt and reliable when it came to arranging the very comfortable and private transportation, and they also gave us some free meals which we found out during the course of the trip. Their staff was very friendly, nice and and reliable and we would definitely plan a holiday with them again.

A FIRST CLASS OUTFIT. We have traveled a lot and no where we experienced any as good as you. So, be proud and know that your philosophies and attitudes are recognized and appreciated. Many thanks to the company,especially to our tour consultant Ms.Defne Hacer Gonultas.Warm regards,Eric & SandraFRANCE

Superb Tour. Travel Shop arranged a superb 10 day private tour for my friend and myself. It was very well organised in a short period of time, thanks to tour consultant Mr. Ozcan Aytac. He was extremely helpful, friendly, patient [we asked him soo many questions :)] and kind and made the tour possible for us. Turkey is a beautiful country and the tour offered was brilliant and very informative - thanks to our well informed and entertaining tour guide Ozcan Davascan and our very kind and friendly and safe driver Cemiz [think that's the spelling :) - We enjoyed the tour and our entire trip to Turkey and would recommend anyone visiting to use Travel Shop Turkey. This was my first trip to Turkey and we hope to visit again soon. Anne

Princes' Islands Tour was... eh... okay. My wife and I were staying in Istanbul and looked into a tour guide to take us to the Princes Islands for a day outing. The islands themselves were quite nice - very laid back, restful, and attractive scenery. The tour itself was another story. Our guide, Hakan, picked us up at the hotel at the proscribed time, and escorted us to the boat terminal. Once we got there, however, it turned out that the boat schedule had changed and we had a 1.5 hour wait until the next boat would depart. The guide basically told us we were "free to hang out" while we waited, and went off to talk on his phone for a while. My wife and I were stuck twiddling our thumbs while we waited -- Hakan apparently hadn't checked the boat times before picking us up, and didn't attempt to find something else to help fill the time (there's got to be stuff around nearby we could have taken a walk or drive to look at while we waited). Once the boat did arrive and we boarded, the ride out to the islands took about 90 minutes, I think. The trip went fine, and Hakan talked with us some about the history of the islands, the buildings on the shoreline, etc. But, he also spent a lot of time checking his messages and in general looking bored. When we finally reached the islands, he booked us on a horse carriage ride, and said he'd meet us at the boat terminal when it was time to head back to the mainland. The horse carriage ride was nice, but having a guide along to answer questions about what we were seeing would have been nice. It seemed odd that we were spending so much time away from the guide we were paying to guide us.My wife and I had lunch when we returned from the ride, and then spent some time shopping and looking around the island. We happened to run into our guide near the boat terminal again and he invited us over to have some tea; we sat and talked with him for about an hour while we waited for the boat. He then helped us get back to the mainland, and then escorted us back to the hotel. The ride back went a bit better - Hakan seemed more engaged with us and we had a nice conversation for the ride back.I was happy that we decided to see the Princes' Islands, and enjoyed that part of the day. The "tour" however, felt more like someone helping us more with the transportation details than actually taking time to introduce us to the cultural history for the sites we were seeing. It's possible this was supposed to be a larger group tour, and it turned out we were the only ones attending for the day? Not the best tour we took in Istanbul, but also not the worst.

Excellent tour guide took excellent care of us. We had a wonderful time in Cappadocia and Istanbul. Our guide in Cappadocia was incredible. She was very attentive and was happy to modify the schedule on short notice and even kept us longer than scheduled. The underground cities, cave churches, balloon rides and many side trips were incredible. The travel agent also was able to contact our driver on his way back from the airport and have him return with my passport which had fallen out in the van! What a relief! They do what it takes to make sure you have a great vacation!

Truly spectacular. My son and i done a 15 day anotoilian tour with travel shop turkey.when i booked this trip i was not sure how it would end up. As a rule when i travel, i always prepare for the un expected. We were picked up from the airport with airconditioned transport and friendly staff.We were taken to our comfortable hotels to relax . We were taken to all the places that was listed on the artinery and more. The hotels that was organised were breath taking and no expense was spared by the tour operator. The tour guide Hakan was a delight whom exeeded our expectations. We were well looked after at all times and he made sure that we were treated like royalties. hakan new all the places to take us and didnt push us to go to places we didnt want to such as a pottery factory. The bus driver Nail .also took pride in making sure his passengers safety was always his first prority. He was very friendly and curtious at all times. He kept the bus in tip top condition and very clean at all times. He had a can do attitude which made our travel even more fun.the only complaint i have is the trip finishing after 15 days. I wish i had more time to travel around with these professional people. I was that impressed with travel shops staff, i had to go personaly to their office in Istanbul to meet them all in person. I was pleased to meet all the staff and to thank them all in person for organising such a great trip for us. I met the owner murtaza kalender and notified him of my happiness with his team. I was suprised that his team was made up of young and keen people whom care for their guests.Thank you Travelshop turkey and Murtaza well done.Looking foward to seeing you all again soon.

Wonderful Vacation for whole Family. My family and I met Elite Turkey Tours team at Istanbul Airport. Even though we were so tired of 15 hr flight from LA to Istanbul with my 2 kids, I relaxed at the moment they take us from the airport. The Driver and guide was pretty friendly and tolerant for kids. We joined 3 day Cappadocia tour with amazing hot balloon ride. Plus, 3 days Private yatch cruise from fethiye. I have always loved Mediterranean sea with its pure, clean, clear color. It was even better with exotic Gullet boat. Children enjoyed small islands that We stopped. I recommend everybody to stay at least 2 night in a Gullet. It is romantic, joyful.

One day with our own local expert.. We were fortunate to be able to spend a day in Istanbul with Serif. We had seen the major sites on an organized tour but wanted to experience some of the neighborhoods with a local. Serif was very accommodating when we asked to add a tour of the Chora Church to our planned day on the Asian side of Istanbul. We got an expert tour of the church's wonderful mosaics. Serif then took us by taxi through the Balat neighborhood to the Marmaray Tunnel to experience the rail ride under the Bosphorus. He took us for a tour of a mosque by architect Sinan in Uskudar and then a tour of the market there. He showed us many of the local specialties and was able to enlighten us on foods and products that we were not familiar with. He provided us with a unique experience of a "dolmash" ride to Kadikoy to visit the market there and have a most wonderful lunch at Ciya restaurant. He pointed out the best shops for coffee and Turkish delight! Then we strolled the neighborhood among the locals away from the tourist vibe. It was like visiting the city with a new friend.

Istambuł tour. We also had the privilege to go on the tour with Mr. Yenen, who picked us from the hotel and gave us deep insight in the history of Turkey and the mentality of Turkish people.We strongly recommend going on the city tour with such a competent and nice guide. We were really delighted.Couple from PolandOktober 201

Like exploring the city with an old friend. I loved the time I spent with Serif exploring Istanbul. I told him what my interests were before I arrived and he tailored the trip to suit my tastes. The tour was the perfect mix of learning about the incredible history of the city, sight seeing and eating. Serif was able to take me to places I would not have known about had I gone by myself and he did it all while explaining the city and it's customs and traditions in an interesting way. I highly suggest when you visit Istanbul that you contact Serif to arrange your own tour of the city!

Grand Bazaar. I had some free time after a meeting and decided to do a tour of the Grand Bazaar with Serif.As expected from past review, it was excellent, professional and friendly.Serif is very knowledgeable and provided interesting comments and anecdotes about sights we saw.He was also able to show some hidden parts of the bazaar, worth visiting.In short, highly recommended! And don't be worry about security, always felt very safe.

2 day private tour with excellent guide. My wife and I were in Istanbul for two days and had a wonderful time thanks to our guide Yavuz.We got to see the major monuments and historical places in both the European and Asian Istanbul. We also got a glimpse of the back streets and alleys and lesser known places in the city. Overall, I would highly recommend this tour.

Great experience with short notice . My son and I came into Istanbul for the weekend before heading to Africa. I was very nervous about the state of affairs and safety so was hesitate to go around the city but decided to take a chance. I contacted Serif late in the evening (~10pm) and he was very responsive. Although he was not available he sent an amazing guide, Fulya, early the next morning to take us out and about. Fulya was extremely professional and full of knowledge about Istanbul. She was accommodating to my 7 year old son and really tried to capture as much as possible with the time we had (and with his patience). We ended up requesting her to join us for a few hours again on Sunday. She made our trip comfortable and memorable. Next time friends and family are in town, we will def. request to use her again. Thanks for making a nervous time into an unforgettable stop.

One day in Istanbul neighborhoods. Sherif, in his knowledgeable and entertaining way, showed us neighborhoods in both European and Asian Istanbul, helping us experience how people live. On a previous trip to Turkey with Sherif as a guide, we had seen the usual places of interest in Istanbul, as well as Eastern and Central Turkey. I cannot imagine a better guide anywhere; he has become a friend. Elwood and Ellen Parker, Greensboro, NC, USA

Wonderful Tour of Istanbul. Serif was a truly excellent guide. His knowledge of the city and sites is incredible - and he can speak to all ages in an engaging manner. We only had one day with Serif and wish it could have been more. He was incredibly professional and well spoken. He took us to all the sites we wanted to see and to a great lunch spot as well. He recommended a wonderful guide for our family in Ephesus, Ayca. She was lively and knowledgeable and also incredibly professional and well spoken. Both are gems and I would highly recommend their services.

Serif and Istanbul--Perfect Together. Serif was a perfect choice. He chose the hotel for us, was with us from 9 to 5 each day for 3 days and took us to everything we wanted to see and more. We enjoyed small cafes and restaurants not in any guide book and sampled many local dishes. Personable, knowledgeable, fun to be with and considerate of our wish to see Istanbul behind the scenes. When we said goodbye after 3 days it felt like leaving a good friend behind.

One day tour in Istanbul. In 8 hours with Serif we experienced exactly what we wanted, every-day Istanbul away from major tourist sights. We explored several neighborhoods in Europe and Asia on foot, by ferry, by route-taxi (dolmus). We had probably the best meal ever in Turkey (my 4th trip and the food has always been outstanding.) We experienced the daily lives of people in a way few tourists get to do. Serif's love of and expert knowldege about the city made it an unforgettable day.

Best Professional Tour Guide. Last April my husband and myself had the privilege of going on a day tour with Serif Yenen. He picked us up from our hotel and immediately we went over the history and geography of Turkey then discussed our itinerary in the beautiful city of Istanbul. He is very professional and indisputable very knowledgeable of his country and world history, that was a plus, specially for my husband that he loves world history.Besides the highlights of the city that we were interested in, such as the Blue Mosque and the Ayasofya among others, he took us to eat authentic turkish food, we also went to a carpet store (I even tried to knit a carpet but I was not good at it), we also went to the market. Honestly his tour is well worth it. He gave us a map (his own edition) and some exquisite well made brochures inside a beautiful bag. We travel a lot, we have been in about 40 countries and we always take tours and by far he has been the BEST TOUR GUIDE that we have ever had. Serif I apologize that took me this long to write a review. We felt safe during our stay in Istanbul. If you ever have the opportunity to use Serif services don't hesitate.

Excellent walking tour and more!. Serif came highly recommend by friends and we quickly learned why. He's an expert guide and even publishes his own guidebooks and maps (which he gave to us). We didn't have much time in Istanbul, so our walking tour focused on the must-see locations such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern and Grand Bazaar. Along the way we had a great lunch together and learned about local food in Istanbul. We never felt rushed, which is important when you have kids along. Also, we arrived in Istanbul by ship, He and a driver met us at the dock that morning and he arranged for a van to bring us to the airport on our departure day. Serif is one of the best guides we've ever had, without a doubt. We recommend him highly.

Stop Your Search Now, You've Found Your Guide!. Serif took us on an amazing adventure of food and culture through Istanbul and truly made our visit a great experience. We learned so much more about the city, country, and culture, all while tasting fantastic food through Istanbul. I was blown away by his knowledge of the city and was such a cool guy to boot.

Fascinating Istanbul food/culture tour. We spent 6 hours on foot with Serif exploring both the Asian and European sides of Istanbul - although this was booked as a food tour, we got so much more! Given the slow down in tourism this year, it ended up being a private tour. Serif has a wealth of knowledge about the history of both the city and the country as well as Islam. We thoroughly enjoyed everything we learned about this amazing city and all of the food we sampled was delicious! We loved going off the beaten path and exploring the lesser touristy neighborhoods of the city and found ourselves returning to some of them later in our trip and hang with the locals. Overall an incredible experience and highly recommended to anyone with a passion for food and culture!

Creme de la creme!. Istanbul is a mega city and I am lost in translation. Found Mr. Yenan's info online and he showed me the city exactly the way I want to enjoy it. He has an extensive knowledge of history, culture, architecture and art - and could answer all kinds of questions that I asked along the way. I am not sure if it is something to do with his background in literature, but his way of explaining things is both surgical and poetic. I would definitely strongly recommend his service to anyone who plans to come to Istanbul in the near future.

Fantastic!. We booked the half day culinary tour and it was just brilliant. Serif is a delight to spend time with; just so interesting and we learnt so much and got to try so many different things. Definitely worth booking!

Explore Istanbul with one of the most knowledgeable and passionate locals. As the CEO of MeetJune, a global travel community where we connect travelers with passionate local people for unique travel experiences, I consider Serif as our most passionate and knowledgeable guide (local) in Istanbul. This is the 2nd time (in a year) that he takes me out to explore the hidden gems of this amazing city and I loved it once again. His tours truly give you an in-depth insight into the cultural, historical and culinary highlights this city has to offer.Serif, many thanks again, all my best and we'll keep in touch!

Discover the Istambul that you will not find in the guides!. A tour with Serif was the best way possible to spend our first half-day in Istanbul. We went off the beaten path to discover the city through the eyes of a passionate and knowledgeable local. As we went through the Sehzade and the Süleymaniye Mosques we had a glimpse of the history of Islam, learned about the Ottoman Empire, its great Sultans and architectonic highlights from an expert. The short stop at a local Boza bar was the perfect moment for a refreshment and a completely new experience - savoring boza (sort of a very creamy beer smoothie) among locals in a business established in 1876. Lunch was another highlight, a traditional and very tasty Turkish meal in an unpretentious local restaurant. After approximately 4 hours, in a rooftop facing the Bosphorus, our tour came to an end. We left loaded with the best local tips, information and inspiration to enjoy the rest of our stay to the fullest. Thank you Serif for this amazing experience!

Exceptional 1/2 day culinary tour with Serif. As the title suggests we did the 1/2 days culinary tour with Serif and it was a fantastic way to see a different side of the city, Serif took us to some out of the way places that you'd never find on your own, all the while giving us loads of information on the food we were tasting, the local area and history generally.Absolutely brilliant way to spend 4/5 hours, all the foods were good but the fish sandwich and the Kokorec were amazing plus Serif himself is a lovely guy - 100% recommended!

A friend and guide indeed. My wife, daughter and I had the pleasure of spending a better part of the day with Mr. Yenen last week. He is a soft spoken giant of man who quickly won our 12 year old over and had her hanging onto his every word. We felt like we were hanging out with a family friend. He was very informative and full of entertaining anecdotes. He presented the city to us as only someone who loves it can. Further, he was able to pace the day wonderfully. We had wonderful lunch at his favourite joint. I emailed him on several occasions thereafter for advice and received very prompt responses. He is a great way to start your trip in Istanbul. Full marks and more. Hope to meet you again Serif.

Serif himself is very good. We had 2 days with this company. On the first day, we had a guide who was an employee (and not Serif himself) whom we found a little hard to follow as she was too eager to download information without stopping to see if we were listening. We also seemed to have missed some parts but she did not say why, so later, we were left wondering why some areas mentioned in the guide books were not covered. We could tell she was getting tired mid afternoon and was hurrying us through some of the last places. On our second day we had Serif himself and he was much better. We started the day with a brief history of Istanbul so we could understand the city's metamorphosis over the centuries. He was very sensitive to our needs and gave us an insider's tour and told us what we wanted to know and not just the standard tourist information we could read for ourselves. We had a very unique walk through the spice market, a traditional Han, old craft shops, the roof of the Grand Bazaar; and had an initiation into Turkish street food. This proved very useful for the rest of our stay in Turkey. Although the food experience was good, I think the extra charge of US$40 per person for food was too high for small snacks bought off street vendors.

A thinking-person's tour. Short story - Serif is THE MAN. I reached out to Serif when we began thinking about a short layover in Istanbul. He was amazingly generous with his time in helping us plan things well outside his role: hotels, airport transfers, recommendations on food. We met him for a two-day gig at our hotel. Our immediate impression was that Serif was a cut above your typical (and generally acceptable) tour guide; he is a true polymath, which became apparent in our conversation at the hotel before we headed out. He asked some questions of us to help him understand what our interests where, and like a talented musician changing key to blend with the orchestra, his comments and suggestions melded with our interests. He's a sharp, sharp guy who can take disparate data points, facts, figures and dates and weave them into a narrative that made the day fly by far too quickly. On Day 2, we worked with an associate of Serif's - which he told us would be he case when we booked. While no Serif, our day-2 guy was also a cut above, with a near-encyclopedic knowledge of the city and it's history. Also a great guy, it was apparent that Serif has set a programming methodology with his associates, training them to give the same high-touch, custom experience that we had on Day 1. As a veteran of dozens of these sorts of tours, I would put Serif and his organization in the top 1 percent of all our tour experiences. Add his willingness to help with things outside his purview, I (in the words of Rick James) wish I had more hands, so I could give him more thumbs-up.

Enjoy the Knowledge of History . We aked Serif for an Arabic speaking tour guide, & we were lucky to have Muhammad, he was great!!He had a wide knowledge of history & he stayed with us from early morning till 8 pm with his beautiful spirit. Actually that was one of our best days in Turkey.

Great overview of Istanbul. If you want a guide with experience and knowledge, you can't go past this guy. He knows all there is to know about the city. We only had a day in Istanbul and were so glad we chose him to take us around, he not only showed us the main sights, he took us to a few more obscure areas and certainly gave us a deeper insight into Turkish history and culture. Thank you Serif!

Istanbul - speed tour!. Fulya was an absolutely wonderful guide and was brimming with historical facts and knowledge. Our cruise ship changed the itinerary so we only had half a day instead of a full day but Fulya helped us get in all we could. We were able to see the Blue Mosque, the underground basilica, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. Fulya told us so much information about the culture in Turkey, the moslem faith, the history of all the places we saw and it was the most fantastic way to start our trip. I'm very late writing this review, we travelled in October, but we have nothing but good things to say for this tour! Wouldn't hesitate to recommend!

Uniceo Tour . More than a tour, more than a guide, this was a genuine experience. Serif knows and loves his town. Off the beaten track, full of lore, history and culture, he provides an in depth cultural experience. From good food to fast tracks you will be in good hands with Serif. Enjoy memorable moments in an amazing city.... Thanks Serif!!!! Klaus
Top guide with great culture and humor !. we were a group with Serif , and we had fun and a deep knowledge about history in Turquey tru the tour and visit !
Great guide, great tour, great experience! . If you want to discover Istanbul, I strongly recommend you to do it with Serif. Thanks to him, I will never forget my visit in this beautiful city!
Very good. Serif is a very good guide with perfect knowledge of the country and the history and a perfect english as well. Furhermore a very nice person and pleasant to be with.

Amazing day spent in Istanbul with Serif. Serif is not only a great person, but an excellent guide. He knows all the hidden corners and all the secret stories, and he speaks perfect English. If you need a guide in Istanbul (and maybe all Turkey?), I strongly recommend him! :)

The Most Knowledgeable Tour Guide in Istanbul!. Serif was invaluable to me and my BBC crew when we were recently in Istanbul to film a travel show. He is incredibly friendly, gracious, knowledgeable and speaks perfect English. He has a fantastic pedigree, is an accomplished author and very well connected both offline in Istanbul and online via social media. I cannot recommend him more highly for anything you might want to do or learn in Istanbul: food, drink, art, music, culture, travel, etc. He knows everything and everyone!

Amazing food tour!. We were in Istanbul last week, and took a food tour with this company. Wow! Our guide, Nursal was amazing, and took us all over the city to find the most amazing foods. We visited the Spice Market, the outdoor produce markets and saw the most variety of cheese we have ever seen! The restaurants and other places we ate were all top notch and unique. This was hands down the most interesting and fun tour we have ever taken! What a great way to get a feel for the real heart of the city!This is a must- do for anyone who loves food.

You Simply Can't Beat This Experience. My girlfriend and I are the kind of people that like to discover local places on our own. With that said, we were thrilled that we decided to have a tour guide with us during our stay in Istanbul. The city is so rich with history that unless you have local expert explaining things to you, much of the experience will get lost. Serif is the best tour guide I've ever had. His pacing was great, and provided the perfect amount of information at every stop we made. He is authentic, kind, and you can tell he has a strong passion for what he does.

Fantastic tour of the city with an exceptional guide. When my parents returned from their trip to Istanbul, the highlight of their trip was a tour of the city with Serif. Naturally, when my fiancé and I decided to go to Turkey, Serif was the first email we sent. Sadly, Serif wasn't available during our dates, but he put us in amazing hands with his colleague, Sebnem.Sebnem helped us experience Istanbul. We could have seen many of the places she took us to on our own, but her insight, guidance, and knowledge of the city allowed us to feel the city in a way that tourists usually can't. That's what you want when you take a guided tour! We interacted with people and places in ways that we simply could not have on our own. Sebnem also helped curate our day so that we visited places that were both on and off the beaten path, something that we really appreciated.We loved our day with Sebnem and have recommended Serif and his team to all of our friends that have gone to Istanbul.

Amazing Istanbul with Serif. My family only had 2 days in Istanbal. Based on these reviews, we asked Serif to be our guide. He is amazing and a top of the line expert in his field! We navigated through much of Istanbul in a short amount of time. And besides visiting manificent sturctures, we learned about history, archetiture, photography, commerce, food, culture, customs and the transportation systems. Istanbul has been a central site for tourism for hundreds and hundreds of years. We now understand and appreciate why. Our visit was safe, manageable, and unforgettable. We would not have gained so much without this tour.

Fantastic adventure with Serif Yenen. We organised a tour of 15 people around the Historic Peninsula of Istanbul. Although we have been working on the area for around 5 years, it was surprising to see how fascinating area it is and still an enigma for all of us. For the history lovers Serif Yenen is treasure!

You have not visited the Grand Bazaar if it was not with Şerif Yenen!. We took a walking tour with a group of 20 people, specifically to conquer the Grand Bazaar but also the near by surroundings. I say " conquer " because it is really a big bazaar just to wander in and find the best shops on your own considering 4400 shops within. We were scheduled to gather at 10 AM in "Corlulu Ali Pasa Medresesi" so we did and had cup of tea, coffee, some of us tried the hookah/nargile and we had an short introduction session to know each other better. Mr. Serif handed us a copy of the Grand Bazaar plan which belongs to his own publications. Please be advised that he wrote the first guidebook of Turkey ever written by a Turk. This may give you an idea about how knowledgeable he is not only about Istanbul but all regions of the country.We first climbed on the bazaar's roof which is not always possible and requires pre-authorization. The scene was amazing, this is also where they shot the James Bond's Sky Fall scenes. He told us the story of the bazaar, the reason why it was built at the first place and how it served people and camel trains back then.He took us to several shops, for example, to a rug and fabric store, cashmere scarves store, jewellery store, to the man called " Gramophone Father " who loved gramophones and fixes them and watches for living, to handicrafts-men's shops and they were all so welcoming not only because they have sincere relationships with Mr. Serif but because that was the way they were. They all told us about their crafts and family stories.We had lunch at one of the local restaurants within the bazaar, Bahar Restaurant, food was delicious. Prices are okay. Then we went to " Buyuk Valide Han " where every one takes great photos especially by hopping on the dome of the inn and keeping the beautiful Istanbul view behind. So we also did :) Then we went to couple more inns and he informed us about the history of them all as well.I do not want to give you all details and sabotage the joy you will have but what I can say is that, at least 1 tour in a life time with Serif Yenen is a must. I thank him again very very much !

Excellent Tour. My wife and I were traveling from the states, Serif came highly recommended to us and although he had prior engagements booked during our time in Istanbul he hooked us up with one of his associates, Goren who was amazing. Goren was incredibly knowledgeable giving us a true locals glimpse into Istanbul culture and history. We began the day taking a ferry to Üsküdar on Asian side and later Beylerbeyi Palace. We had lunch near Beylerbeyi Palace in a lovely setting on the Bosphorus. Goren then took us to Dolmabahce Palace and later a cruise on the Bosphorus. We finished the day at the Spice Bazaar where he helped us find the best vendors. The day was wonderful, we had many great conversations and truly felt at home half a world away. The time spent was meaningful, tour was "turn-key" and customized to our specific interests, very enjoyable...our expectations were exceeded...would highly recommend!

Unforgettable Tour. This review is long overdue but I wanted to make sure that I wrote it to let everyone know that this is a fantastic way to get to know Istanbul in a unique and intimate way. Our tour guide Esra was amazing and tailored the tour for us to see what we wanted and show us more than we ever imagined! The food was amazing and catered to my dietary restrictions (allergies). We had an amazing time and made a new friend along the way. Thank you TC Esra Cantürk!!

Best guided tour ever. We've spent a wonderful day in Istanbul in late December with Serif. It was educational and fun at the same time. The way Serif presented history of this unique place was not just packed with facts but also very interesting. We've managed to see all the highlights and also some very interesting places, learned about Ebru art technique, pottery, and carpets. Serif was also extremely helpful in suggesting places where to buy some souvenirs, baklavas and other stuff. Thank you!

Incredibly Knowledgeable with a Great Network of Locals. Serif is an incredibly knowledgeable guide who is passionate about what he does and it shows in his tours. He's also very well connected with the local community and introduced me to many locals. This led to great conversations and a meaningful learning experience ranging from carpets, to gramophones. I've never had a tour like this that focused on the locals so much and made it so meaningful. I'd highly recommend him.

Fantastic - Fun, Friendly and Informative. We just spent 4 days with Serif - touring the major sights and some lesser known ones in the city of Istanbul. It really was fascinating and a lot of fun. The tours were designed specifically to fit with our interests. The pace was perfect - being a private tour meant we stayed longer where we wanted. Serif is so knowledgeable and shared many, many little details with us that we would not have had the opportunity to learn about if we were on our own. Great restaurants, lots of tastings, lots of history, lots of spectacular sites. Serif is a delightful man and we enjoyed his company enormously. At no point was he intrusive and we honestly felt like we were seeing the city with a friend. Whether you have 1 day or 1 week in Istanbul, he can fill your days with the wonders of this amazing city.

Very professional. Serif helped us with our hotel reservation and got us a better rate at a major hotel than I could get directly or through any web site. His response was clear and fast.We used his company for a 2-day visit and it was one of his female colleague who acted as a guide. Not cheap but everything went smoothly and professional. They targeted our visits according to our family needs and the language proficiency was perfect.They also made some further recommendations for the rest of our trip (restaurants, activities...)
Excellent!. Had a really nice tour in istanbul, the guide has a rich historical background, tour was fun and friendly and better than expected,Hundred percent would recommend!

A true insight into Turkish culture and cuisine. Serif is one of most knowledgeable and personable guides I've ever met. He organized a customized day trip through Istanbul that exceeded my wishes and expectations. He gave me a true insight into Turkish culture and cuisine. We've visited multiple major highlights as well as the hidden gems on both the European and Asian side. I would highly recommend Serif to anyone visiting this magical city!

A trip to the roots of human civilisation. It was a great trip to Şanlıurfa, Harran Plains and Göbeklitepe, in Southeastern Turkey, the Northern Mesopotamia. It was a well balanced itinerary lead by first class experts. I am looking forward to the next trip to travel with Nezih Başgelen, one of Turkey's leading archaeologists.

Historic Peninsula tour. With the great guidance of Şerif Yenen, I organized a Historic Peninsula tour for my dear colleagues from EMBARQ Turkey and our board members in a cold December day. As an İstanbulite I have never seen Historic Peninsula from this side. Because the group was visited all the historic places in the Peninsula before, Mr. Yenen took us to the secret places of Peninsula. We were visited hidden aqueduct, small ateliers inside the Grand Bazaar (the one I couldn't forgot is the gramophone store). We ate at the delicious Bahar restaurant inside the Grand Bazaar. It was a lovely day for all of us. Thanks to Mr. Yenen for this unforgettable day. Now we are planning to have a new tour with Mr. Yenen.

Beautiful scenery and well-informed, cheerful guide!. I highly recommend Serif for a tour guide! Not only is he well-informed about all aspects of Turkish history and culture, but he is also kind and cheerful, answering all of my questions. I can't wait to see more of Turkey!

Nice tour in an old city!!. I have found his book before ı came to Turkey.His book was Turkish Odssey after i read it i feel like come to istanbul visit the historical sites with my family.We spent an amazing few days in Istanbul with our kids (8 and 10). Our guide was Serif, and he did a fantastic job of showing us around this incredible city. I was particularly impressed with how Serif engaged with our kids and explained everything in way that was clear and easy to understand. We quizzed the kids about everything we had seen and they actually remembered more than I did (I am a bit embarrassed to say)!

Real experts of Gobeklitepe & Harran. I have just returned from a weekend tour to Gobeklitepe and Harran in Sanliurfa. We traveled with Serif Yenen Travel, a fantastically entertaining and informative way to spend a weekend in late Fall. Despite being regular visitors to the city of Sanliurfa, we learnt lots of new archaeological facts about the Neolithic age and found ourselves in places completely unique. Our two guides were archaeologists with a lot of knowledge. This tour is highly recommended if you want to visit one of the earliest sites in history. Being in a small group and delicious local foods made it even better.

Excellent walking tour in Istanbul with Serif Yenen. We had a small group walking tour with Serif focusing on Architect Sinan's works and sampling various street food. It was a full day tour. It covered mostly off-the-beaten paths. Serif's style is so convenient. He is more like a friend. He does not push you to anything. He just tells about topics in his friendly attitude with lots of stops here and there. On this tour we were able to visit three mosques built by Architect Sinan: Sehzade, Suleymaniye and Rustem Pasha. We tried so many different street food samples from the famous Suleymaniye beans to kokoreç (lamb intestines) and desserts. I would recommend touring with Serif to all those people who would like to try different routes, off the beaten paths and local delicacies.

Trip to Sanliurfa. I have traveled to Sanliurfa in South Eastern Turkey with Serif Yenen Travel in a small group. I had the opportunity to understand the historical and cultural heritage dating back to 10,000 BC from two expert archaeologist-guides, taste the delicious local food, interact with the locals and shop authentic products. Beehive houses of Harran are so unique. Every detail of the trip was very well arranged. I have returned with great memories. Thank you Serif!

Great opporunity to interact with locals and the most delicious food.. I traveled to Gobeklitepe and Harran with Serif Yenen Travel in a small group. Every small detail in the tour was planned so well. The local foods that we had were among the best. We had the chance to interact with locals, sampled lots of local details from the culture, food, markets and music. We had great photography opportunities. Above all, the site that we visited is Gobeklitepe, and it is the oldest known open-air sanctuary going back to 12.000 years ago. Serif arranged two expert archaeologists to lead the tour. Göbeklitpe became even more meaningful when seen with two expert archaeologists. I highly recommend Serif and his tours. I will always travel with them.

Exceptional over and above service. We were really fortunate to book on a tour on a very quiet day. So quiet it was just us! Our guide asked where we wanted to focus our tour. I was concerned there was a little too much on the agenda but we meandered through the sights with fantastic overviews given of the history, current affairs and everything else too. We were out an extra hour and were so grateful for the attention and received tonnes of advice for the rest of our tour. Thanks so much, and please pass on a personal thank you to Nursal our guide

Exploring Istanbul the truly local way. Serif Yenen was only one part of our 4-day business trip - but a very crucial one and without doubt, the side programme of our trip was massively enhanced by Serif's input, creativity and great sense of service. Having had a tight schedule of business events and meetings, the time during our 4 days was limited, however, with the expertise and professional approach of service, we definitely pulled out the maximum of time available and made 3 tours possible within just those four days. What will stay in our mind most of all is Serif's great ability to respond to the specific needs of his clients, and to pro-actively deliver ideas around the request he is sent and to even create highlight moments spontaneously while on tour. The so-called "surprise effect" - has brilliantly worked with us. Cok teşekkür ederim, Serif!

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED: Fun, Personal & Educational Tour!. As seasoned independent travelers, my wife and I thought we could do Istanbul on our own. But after landing in the city and getting the lay of the land, we quickly realized we wouldn't be able to fully appreciate Istanbul's historical significance without a guide. So we contacted Sherif (at the last minute) and were able to arrange a private tour with one of his guides, Gokhan. I can't say enough good things about Gokhan or our customized tour that started with Turkish breakfast at a restaurant we wanted to try, followed by the major sights: Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Topkapi Palace and Grand Bazaar, with a couple detours here and there. It was a ton of fun and we learned so much. Cost was $200 + museum entrance fees, transportation, tip for an all-day experience. Very worth it and highly recommended!

Turkey AGAIN!. Somehow Turkey has become my favorite place to visit. The food is fantastic, the places memorable, but the people are what make the country so special. Each day with my "seasoned" guide had great highlights, especially since I did not need to worry about safety, value, or time wasted. Serif can be trusted to address any issue relating to travel in his COUNTRY.

Fabulous Visit To Ephesus and Area While on a Cruise. As arranged by Şerif, Sibil, our private guide for the day, was waiting for us as we disembarked from our cruise ship in Kuşadasi. As there were just the two of us, she made suggestions that allowed us to make the most of our day. Şerif had arranged for a driver and van for our exclusive use. We had a better than excellent day, spending lots of time at Ephesus, and visiting the Ephesus Archaeological Museum and the site of the Temple of Artemis. At lunchtime she took us to Biz Ev Hammeli, a family run restaurant specializing in traditional Turkish recipes, served buffet style. Of all the meals we had during a month-long trip, this was the best. Having a knowledgeable and personal private guide was well worth it. Having also traveled with Şerif in other parts of Turkey, I highly recommend that you allow him and his team of professional guides to enhance your visit to Turkey.

Outstanding Three Days of Sightseeing in Istanbul. We visited Istanbul in September and were fortunate to have Serif asour guide. Three days of touring around the city were mesmerizing. Thesightseeing was coupled with the detailed commentary about the originsand history of every landmark. We have also made detours off thebeaten path and visited more secluded places, enjoying views over theGolden Horn from the roof of the old han, savoring genuine localcuisine alongside the shopkeepers at the Grand Bazaar and trying thebest Baklava there is.My wife and I were traveling with a 10 months old daughter and we hada lot of assistance from Serif with our little one so that all threeof us had a great time. A local guide can open up the world of a cityor any other place to you and Serif fulfills such role perfectly.

Excellent Grand Bazaar Tour. As we planned our trip to Turkey, we knew we would need a guide to ground our experience and place the proper lens on how to view this historically rich country. We found Serif on Trip Advisor and Viator and both sites had glowing reviews from many of his patrons.We signed up for the Grand Bazaar tour as it mixed both my wife’s passion, shopping, as well as my own, great photo opportunities. Serif was punctual when meeting us at our hotel. He was extremely knowledgeable about Istanbul, its own history and its role in the wider Eurasian history.During our tour of the bazaar he made sure that we not only observed the massiveness of it, but also its nuances. At each stop, Serif allowed us to explore as much as we needed; we never felt rushed. Although the purpose of the tour was to view and experience shopping in that environment, we never felt pressured to purchase anything.We highly recommend this tour if you’re interested in experiencing commerce in Istanbul.

Three Wonderful Days - Well Worth It!. Contacted Serif based on the reviews on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. He contacted me via email prior to our visit and asked what we would like to see in Istanbul - I said we wanted to see it all. Well Elvan, our guide, tried her hardest to get all the top sights in while not rushing us through anything. We saw amazing sites, tried some great street food and kept her busy answering all our questions about life in Turkey. We thoroughly enjoyed our time with her and would not hesitate to recommend this company, and especially our guide, to anyone travelling to Turkey.

Two beautiful days. We chose the Istanbul Highlights and also the Oriental Side day tours. Serif was very fast and professional organizing the agreements and the guide he chose was very nice and competent. Seljuk brought us around in a very fast yet relaxing pace. It was the best solution to visit the most important locations without cues or worries, and exploring less popular corners of the city. We were just the 3 of us and everything was very friendly. We talked a lot, about Turkey and about Italy. We ate delicious food and also spent time in some book stores to check music and films. These were really enjoyable moments.Markus & Saverio

Turkey with Serif Yenen and Nursal Kocak. My wife and I traveled to Istanbul for our first ever visit to turkey. On our first morning we were met by a smiling Nursal Kocak who then took us "by the hand" and provided us with an in-depth view and history of Istanbul and of Turkey. She was both forthright and knowledgeable, answering our questions regarding archeology, history or politics. She was a wonderful traveling companion for the three days we were with her and would recommend her highly to anyone visiting beautiful Turkey.

Excellent Tour Experience with Serif Yenen. We were a single couple with a couple of free days in Istanbul before a cruise and were referred to Serif by some other couples who had had a terrific experience with him. He designed a tour (by car, boat and walking) tailored to our interests and was able describe and give context to all the sites we encountered and freely answered all our questions. His command of English was excellent and at the end of our touring (two days) he provided us with copies of his own publications pertaining to some of the sites we had seen. He also referred us to Meltem, an excellent guide in Ephesus. We would highly recommend Serif.

Excellent Istanbul Tour Experience. We had an excellent Istanbul experience. There were four of us (2 couples) who arrived in Istanbul a couple of days early before departing on a cruise from there. We had engaged Serif Yenen-Tours via a recommendation of the Turkish Culture and Tourism Office in Washington DC. Serif's people suggested and booked a hotel for us and arranged transfers from the airport to the hotel and later from the hotel to the cruise terminal. They designed a 2-day personalized tour for us according to our interests. Our personal guide, Sebnem speaks excellent English and did an outstanding job showing us her city. Now we want to go back!

Food Tour with Serif Yenen; Excellent Experience!. I am Turkish living in the US. I booked a food tour in Istanbul with Serif Yenen for my American friends. They were two families taking the food tour with Serif. They enjoyed it so much. They came back raving Serif’s tour: “He was such a knowledgeable guide speaking excellent English, teaching us all about Turkish culture and food. We never knew Turkish food was so great. All choices were excellent. We tried so many different things which we would never be able to taste if we were by ourselves. It was the highlight of our stay in Turkey.”I would highly recommend this tour and Serif.

"ONLY WAY TO GO". Highly recommend Serif for your trip to Turkey. He was so accommodating, and never tired of my questions before we even left home. Gokhan, our guide, met us at our hotel, and led us on a one day walking tour of Istanbul that included everything that we wanted to see. He started the tour by asking us what we wanted to see, and then customized our day to accomplish it all. He was so knowledgable about the city and it's history and the Turkish people. I would compare him to the best history professor one could have. He even took us shopping in the Grand Bazaar and pointed us to reputable stores.We also went to Ephesus, where Serif provided our guide, Meltem. Again, we could not have had a better guide of the city. Personable, knowledgable, and the ability to communicate every aspect of life in the city at the time it was in its heyday! We can't wait till we can return to Turkey-we will call Serif again!

Nursal was a fantastic tour guide. Nursal was our tour guide and I cannot possibly say enough good things about her. We contacted Serif who we found online, but was busy that day and arranged for Nursal to be our tour guide. She was great at guiding us through the city on foot, taxis, trains, boats, to get efficiently from place to place. She spoke english extremely well, and did great with translations in the bazaars for shopping. Apparently tour guides get to skip many of the lines with their clients in Istanbul which sped things along (and we were informed prior that they do not have this privilege at the Blue Mosque so we did that on our own another day to save time on the day we had Nursal with us ). Serif was also great to deal with by email to advise us on what to see and timing for different decision. The whole experience went very smoothly. We then went on a cruise through Greece, Malta, several stops in Italy including Rome on several cruise tours, but by far the best tour was with Nursal in Istanbul. Ken H

Serif Yennen reveals the magic of Istanbul. Serif is the most knowledgeable and personable guide we have ever had. He customized our trip to our needs. The van he used was perfect for getting me close to things without having to do much walking (I am mobility-challenged) and he assisted me with navigating the cobblestone streets with a walker. He concentrated on our interests--history and Iznik tiles--and told us in depth about the Byzantines, Islam and Turkish culture and cuisine. We visited Topkapi palace, Hagia Sofia, Suliemaniye mosque, Sultanahmet mosque, Rustem Pasha mosque, the Basilca Cistern, the Hippodrome, the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Market, took a food tour (on both the European and Asian sides) and saw how carpets and tiles were made. His associates gave us excellent tours of the Turkish and Islamic Arts museum and a cruise on the Bosphorus, as well as a day at Ephesus. Serif gave us very useful materials that he has developed on most of the sites we visited (and don't miss his video, "Istanbul Unveiled" for a different view of the city. Over more than 25 years of guiding tours, he has developed a smooth style of presenting history in a very accessible manner in excellent English. The associates he arranged for us were knowledgeable, flexible and spoke outstanding English. The bus driver was very helpful and arranged to pick us up close to the sites without lots of walking. We would recommend Serif and his group to anyone wanting to have a magical experience in Istanbul. He became a close friend in just a few days. You will enjoy his open personality and friendliness.

Istanbul highlights beyond Sultanhamet. My son and I were picked up in a private car by Serif on 23 October 2015. We had previously toured the main attractions in Sultanhamet with Serif and wanted to see more of Istanbul. Serif had planned a wonderful day for us. We first drove to Asia via the Bosphorus Bridge. Morning tea was enjoyed by a gleaming marina in Kalamis. We then drove through the very upscale Baghdad Street. This is well described as the Beverly Hills of Istanbul. We had visited Kadikoy previously so we were taken to Uskudar Food Market to browse and have a delicious Turkish lunch. For main course we had the famous Iskerder Kebap followed by a Kunefe dessert. As well as the shopping and sampling of food, this area includes the Mirimah Sultan mosque built in the 16th century. There is a ferry pier and great views across the Bosphorus.We noted there were very few tourists there and we enjoyed observing the local people relaxing at a favourite place.We drove along the Bosphorus on the Asian side, crossing back to Europe via the Fatih Bridge. We then drove along the European side of the Bosphorus.Our final destination was Ortakoy where we had a tea break. The Ortakoy Mosque is magnificent and the area was full of other historic buildings, shops and the excellent ambiance of its' waterfront location.Again, there seemed to be relatively few tourists which of course is in contrast to the Sultanhamet tourist area. In summary, we had a marvellous day with Serif. All day he pointed out interesting sights and further enriched our knowledge of the history and people of Turkey. Naturally, we got to eat delicious food with him. Serif is always very good company and is truly a friend to us. I am looking forward to planning a multi day tour with him for when I can next return to Turkey.I highly recommend Serif for both day tours in Istanbul or longer tours through Turkey.

An amazing day in Istanbul!. ....more like a day in the city with a friend than with a tour guide...great historical insight...hitting local spots...personal attention...couldn't have been more pleased!

Excellent Istanbul guide. Serif is a pro, reveals the hidden gems of Istanbul that most travelers don't see. Bright and amiable fellow, insightful takes on life in Turkey today. Unlike many guides, he doesn't just unreel a canned spiel about this mosque or that museum. With Serif, it is always a conversation. Ask questions, dig deeper, and you will be richly rewarded. He is good company. Highly recommend, book early, he's in high demand. Reasonable fees.

Very professional business, refund quickly given.. We had to cancel our tour with Serif due to political instability in our final destination country. He responded quickly to our email and returned the funds promptly through PayPal. I would not hesitate to call upon him again for any future tour needs in Turkey.

Eyeopening insight into Istanbul and Turkey past and present. I knew I wanted to see Istanbul and found what I thought would be the best guide for 2 days. Serif exceeded our high expectations. The Aya Sofya cathedral (916 years) /mosque (416 years)/musem (since 1934 as decreed by Ataturk), the Topkapi palace, the Blue Mosque,, the Cisterns (for water supply to the city under seige) and the Turkish and Islamic Art Museum were presented as more than just tourist attractions. Serif placed them in the sweep of the Ottoman Empire's history. But each visit was interspersed with visits to the bazaar or the huge markets or a favourite cafe or restaurant. Serif was as knowledgeable about the vast array of spices or fish in the markets as he was about the culture of Turkey.The only element of melancholy arose from the bombing inAnkara whilst we were there and his concern about the turmoil in the country.

Wonderful!!. My husband and I contacted Serif for a private tour while we were in Istanbul. He was able to arrange a tour for us with his colleague, Yesim- she was fantastic! Yesim was very knowledgeable and personable, and made our tour so much fun. She was able to have us visit all of the places we had requested to see, and even took us for a Turkish coffee and tea afterwards. I would absolutely recommend her to anyone traveling to Istanbul. Thanks, Yesim!- Sarah and Jon

Amazing tour guide and historian. I just returned from a fascinating tour of Turkey with my partner and several friends, and the day we spent in Istanbul with Şerif Yenen was one of the absolute highlights. It was our first full day in Istanbul, and Serif’s extensive knowledge of Turkish history and culture gave us the perfect orientation. I recommended him to our group because of the books and guides he has written about Turkey’s ancient sites, and later learned that he also introduced his documentary film on Istanbul with a lecture at the Smithsonian! But we also discovered is that he is delightful company and a born teacher. He collaborated with us about interests and preferences then took us on a full day trip to historic sites and fascinating neighborhoods on the European and Asian sides of the city, including stops for tea and lunch. We were driven from place to place in a comfortable van and were able to see more because we could be dropped of one place and picked up another, so that we didn’t have to retrace our steps. I would tell anyone who wants to learn as well as be entertained to go straight to Serif. He was perfect!!

Private guide worth the cost. Serif was a wonderful guide for 2 of our days in Istanbul. He has published guides and videos on turkey. He has also been a guest lecturer for the Smithsonian Institute in Washington DC. We covered the historical part of the city in detail. He is very responsive on email and met us at our hotel on our first day. He will tailor the tour to your interests. Highly recommend his services.

Elgiz is a great tour guide who takes great pictures too. We only had about a day in istanbul so we just wanted to see the highlights. Elgiz was very good as a tour guide and even took great pictures, there were places where there were tons of people around us...and when I look at the picture she took for us, those people are magically gone, she really knows how to take good pics. She even recommended a few pics in the market that made it seem like we were actually buying stuff, it made for excellent pictures.She is also flexible and adjusted our tour on the fly, we wanted to end our tour early since we had a flight that night and wanted to rest, and end it early we did, but we did not miss a single sight on our list.

UNBELIEVABLE GUIDE. Our group of 6 spent 2 days with Serif. We learnt new things about the places we had been to before and discovered the most amazing new areas that we had not seen before. We can highly recommend Serif to anyone interested in seeing Istanbul through his proud eyes. Even the rain did not stop us seeing the beautiful colours of the buildings and hearing the history of this great city. The food was amazing. He knew exactly what we wanted to see and do. Thanks Serif for the most fantastic 2 days in Turkey.

A new Istanbul !. I was in Istanbul before but this time I wanted to discover some of its hidden parts, so I asked Serif to arrange me a mixture tour to visit local markets and do some food tasting. I will never forget the experience.My guide Aysem was a food fanatic and a knowledgable lady which I realy enjoyed her company. We visited some local markets and tasted different kinds of food and now I think I have discovered a new aspect of Istanbul.Thank you Serif and Aysem.

Excellent 2 days in Istanbul with great guide!. We booked a private tour for our two days in Istanbul and really enjoyed our time with Selçuk. He picked us up at our hotel and talked with us to ensure he understood what we wanted to see in the old part of the city. Selçuk has a lot of experience guiding and we could tell that he really enjoyed showing us his city and sharing the history and culture. It was an excellent way to spend our time and I strongly recommend it if you are traveling to Turkey.

Excellent tour guide in Istanbul. We spent three wonderful days with Serif in Istanbul. We had arranged a private tour for a group of four, two couples. It was our first trip to Istanbul, so we let Serif set the itinerary with some back and forth emails on interests and preferences. Serif did a great job and I think we covered all the highlights of Istanbul at a leisurely pace. His knowledge of history and culture was beyond our expectations and his English is fluent without even much of an accent so he was totally understandable. One of the big advantages of touring with Serif is that he is so well known and connected. Everywhere we went, he had friends and acquaintances. Tour guides generally have an advantage at the attractions by skipping the long lines for tickets, but Serif had advantages beyond that. At restaurants, he got us great tables and service. He is flexible and accommodating with a very engaging personality. I can't imagine a better guide in Istanbul. Highly recommended!Be sure he takes you to the top of the Grand Bazaar. I don't think many guides have access, but the view is fabulous.

Excellent !!! Wonderful !!!! Fantastic !!!!!!!. Serif handled our emails himself! He was personable and hugely attuned to all our needs as grandparents, children and grandchildren traveling together.Our tour of Sultanahmet was excellent and timed to excite but not be too long!!We had another day with a beautiful van, nice driver and Amazing guide named Kurtulous! He was such fun, knowledgeable and was open to finding a market that I really wanted to visit!! We found it !!!!!Serif had reserved a yacht for our Bosphorus tour but emailed back that he had found a better one and we agreed! WOW!!! He was right that the yacht was spectacular and the trip on the Bosphorus was great!! Kurtulous was our Bosphorous guide also and I have officially named him my new Turkish son!!! He rocks!!!Thank you, Serif !!! You are the Best!!!!

Wonderful 3 days in Istanbul. We hired Serif's company for a two-day private tour of Istanbul. We lucked out with Seden as our tour guide. She is extremely knowledgeable, very personable and pleasant company. We visited all the regular highlights around Sultanahmet on the first day and adjusted the second day's itinerary to fit in the Chora Church after Seden learned how we enjoyed the mosaics in the Topkapi Palace and the Hagia Sophia. We have hired tour guides in many places around the world and Seden is definitely one of the best.We highly recommend going with Serif Yenen tours.

Discovering Istanbul with Serif Yenen tours. Unfortunately Serif was unavailable to guide us around Istanbul. However, Esra, a companion of Serif was available to guide us around the many sites of Istanbul. She was simply wonderful from the first minute we met until our parting hugs of friendship some 9hrs later. Our time was short ( one day), but Esra provided us with a comprehensive and interesting tour of the main sites, her warm & friendly nature made our day one to remember. She has certainly whetted our appetite to return and explore more of the wonderful city of Istanbul.

Shopping with Senem. We had two days in Istanbul on our Mediterranean cruise. The first day we booked a tour from the ship, but the second day we took a tour of the Grand Bazaar with Serif Yenen's tours. Our guide, Senem, was terrific! She listened to what we wanted, including adding the Blue Mosque after the scheduled tour (it had been closed the day before during our ship tour). We never felt pressured in any of the shops to which she took us. The proprietors were friendly and funny. The merchandise was just what we were looking for. Senem was patient, kind and knowledgeable.

Excellent day tour. We recently arranged for Serif to show 4 of us the main sights over 1 day in Istanbul. Serif met up with us near our lodging and showed us how to navigate the tram and purchase tickets. We then we guided through the Topkapi Palace learning about things along the way. Afterwards, we visited the Hagia Sofia and underground cistern. We had a wonderful lunch in Sultanhamet with great food. Then we proceeded to have him show us some of the shops in the Grand Bazaar that provided us to make some purchases as well.Serif was an extremely knowledgeable guide and was able to teach us quite a bit in one day about the history of Turkey and Istanbul in particular, as well as provide lots of details about the sights we chose to visit. He provided us with fold-out guides he has produced as well. He has a great sense of humor and made us all feel at ease in the city. His English is excellent making it easy to understand as he explains. And he was more than happy to share his assessment of current issues in Turkey.
