He was also able to provide recommendations for sights to see on our own in the following days, places to visit, restaurants to try, etc.I would highly recommend contacting him if you are looking for a guide for a custom tour of any of the sights in Istanbul.

Our Istanbul Experience. My husband and I had a chance to visit Istanbul last week. We had never been to Turkey but had heard many wonderful things especially about this city. We booked two days with Serif Yenen and they were both perfect. By the end of our visit we had fallen in love with the city and with him. He is an outstanding guide. He is full of information and is articulate and thorough.He brought the history of the country and the city alive. He made each day so easy to navigate because he thought of everything ahead of time. I cannot recommend him highly enough. If you plan on going to Istanbul, you must book your tour with him!!!

Easy way to consume Istanbul. Spent 2 days with Serif this past June. What a delight. His English is impeccable and his passion for the city obvious. He was ready to go as deep as you wanted on the history lesson. We might have seen the same things without him but we understood so much more with him. Just follow the hat and soak up a great city

Brilliant guide - absolute gentleman. We had never used a guide service before and we're excited to read that Serif was Oprahs guide while she was in Turkey. Unfortunately Serif was busy but his colleague Kenan was amazing. He was fantastic, took us everywhere gave us great advice and was a pleasure to spend the day with. I would highly recommend booking with Kenan when you are in Turkey. Istanbul was definitely the highlight of our 3 week European trip and the tour was a highlight of Istanbul!

Quick stopover. For our 48 hour stopover in Istanbul, Serif arranged a private tour for my wife and I that covered all the highlights of Istanbul. I highly recommend having a knowledgeable guide who can speed you from place to place and past the normal tourist lines.

Truly discovering Istanbul. We had Serif for a couple of days in Istanbul at the end of March this year and we don't regret a moment of it. There is nothing to add that hasn't already been said in other reviews. Serif's knowledge is unparalleled, his passion for the city unmatched. Tell him your interests in advance and leave the day planning for him to work out and take you around this great city. We also appreciated the local restaurants where we ate over the 2 days. We were very clear that we wanted to eat where the locals ate and didn't care if they were small hole-in-the-wall joints. The food was phenomenal!We also included a trip to the Grand Bazaar and contradictory to another reviewer, did not feel pressured at all to purchase anything from any of the stores there. All in all, highly recommended.

Discover Istanbul & Turkey with Serif Yenen Private Tours. We booked a two day tour with Serif and had Ozden as our guide. Our first day was spent in the old city and we were able to see all of the major sights with a lot of great insight and at a reasonable pace. Oden was extremely knowledgable (he has an advanced degree as a guide) and incredibly nice. He showed us places we didn't even know about with our first visit to the city more than 20 years ago. The next day we had a car so we did a boat ride down the Bosphorus, ate a fantastic lunch in a small fishing village and took the car back to see a few more sights that are a bit farther out of town. Serif also arranged really nice transport to/from the airport (a fraction of the price the hotel wanted to charge us).

Excellent services, even on short notice.. After being let down by a different provider of private tours, we contacted Serif Yenen with a request for assistance with less than 24 hours left. Even though Serif wasn't personally available he offered to make arrangements for a different tour guide (Esra) to lead us in what turned out to be a professional, pleasant, and well-organized series of activities in Istanbul. Most importantly, Serif was straightforward in advising against the use of a car & driver (something I was being royally charged for by the other tour operator) for the simple reason that cars can't get too close to any of the specific attractions we would be visiting (e.g. Blue Mosque, Hagya Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Cisterns, etc. -- just to be clear, ours was not a 'foodies tour'). While this sort of recommendation is unusual (i.e. it essentially meant we would be paying less money for Serif's services) it made perfect sense once we actually went to those places. A car & driver would have been such a waste! Besides, our guide (Esra) made the logistics of using public transportation a breeze. Bottom line: we're grateful to Serif for delivering great services on short notice, making an honest recommendation that saved us money and – last but not least – pairing us up with an excellent tour guide, who actually made our day in Istanbul truly enjoyable and memorable. Highly recommended!

One day foodies tour of Istanbul. My friend and I arrived a day early for a 10 day tour of Turkey after booking on line with Serif for a private 1 day walking food tour of Istanbul. For two women traveling alone it was a very safe way to spend a thoroughly enjoyable day. Serif met us at our hotel and we walked from Europe to Asia discovering the real Istanbul while savouring beautiful food along the way. Serif is very knowledgeable and professional and Provided an insight into the history and culture of Istanbul while we enjoyed a continuous supply of fresh local food. I can't recommend this tour highly enough. Thanks Serif.

Serif simply the best Private Tour Guide in Istanbul. My wife and I booked on line before a cruise . Serif meet at the terminal exit for our 1 day private tour. We checked out Topkapi Palace , Basilica Cistern , Chora Monastery and the Bosphorus Strait . Serif's knowledge is 100%. We booked Serif , a car and driver . He produces his own quick guide booklets , fantastic, as a private tour the information and time you get is far better than a organised tour . His widespread knowledge of Istanbul , Turkey , lifestyle , cost of living etc. we thoroughly recommend hi services . Many Thanks Tony Jennifer

Wonderful way to see the real Istanbul.. We spent 10 days in Turkey and our one day with Serif doing a culinary tour was the highlight of our stay. Serif was a wonderful guide with lots of local knowledge and showed us a side of Istanbul and its food that was wonderful. It was a very personalized tour done at an enjoyable and relaxed pace. Would definately recommend a tour with Serif.

Inspired Indulgences in Istanbul. What an amazing day for my sisters and I over the early May bank holiday weekend 2015. Being foodies, this was a planned highlight of our trip even as a pescetarian which was not an issue at all. Serif went out of his way to make our day brilliant since we had to rearrange due to labour day demonstrations and he personally came to meet with us to plan and prepare. We went with Serif’s colleague, Aydin the next day. The whole day was relaxed, personalised to what we wanted and experienced with great knowledge. History, facts and figures are all great but what we enjoyed most was Aydin’s personal real life approach. It felt like we were hanging with an old friend. We sampled lots of savoury foods including borek, pide, muscles and so so so much more. Lots of tea & coffee stop, baklava, amazing hand-made delights which we would never have found, nargile to finish the afternoon. We kept walking and eating sampling anything that caught our eye, meandering through various markets, organic foods shops, areas of upbeat and trendy Istanbul (karikoy) which we were then able to revisit the next day and buy a truck load of amazing local biscuits we tasted, tram ride over the galata birdge, a ferry ride across to kadikoy was included in the trip so we managed to cover a lot of sightseeing at the same time. There was no time pressure and we ended our day at the friends meeting café in Cihangir (another trendy part of town) with Serif and Aydin recapping the day. The local way was the best way to experience this diverse city. The locals we met on our tour were great and always happy to share and sample food – key to the Turkish way of life. We went to a recommended Hamman the next day and were very impressed. I highly recommend Serif and his colleagues for the most personalised tour you could ask for.

Great Guide. Serif is a very knowledgeable about all things Turkish. His facts about Istanbul are enormous. The best thing is that he does it in a very fun and humorous (sometimes really emotionally). Well worth using him

Discovering Istanbul with Serif Yenen-Private Tours. Serif Yenen is one of Turkey's most knowledgeable and professional tour guides, with an enormous knowledge of Turkey, and of course Istanbul. Serif can quote all sorts of interesting facts and stories about Turkey's history, and about Turkey today. He will keep you spell-bound during any tour you do with him. I also thoroughly enjoyed his company. Well done, Serif!

Remarkable tour guide. Serif is a brilliant and kind man who will entertain you, enlighten you, and enhance your experience beyond measure. You will be in very capable hands as you travel through Istanbul and Turkey. We spent two days with Serif in April 2015 and our experience of Istanbul was very special.

Great tour BUT lots of commission based upselling. Our tour lady that we had was very knowledgable, and all the sights of Istanbul that were on the tour are incredible to go and see. However we were alittle disappointed in how many times we were "suggested" to buy from or eat in certain places. After we had seen most of the sights it was basically a sales pitch to all her local vendors. I get that they make a commission and we really did expect some of this... it was just a bit much and kind of left a bad taste in your mouth at the end when you had to keep saying no thank you and then were taken to the next place.... once again the tour was awesome but could have toned down the upselling...

Hooked on Istanbul!. Our family spent the day with Serif and was one of the highlights of our two week vacation. Serif's extensive knowledge, presentation and organization wasinvaluable, kept our attention and piqued our desire to learn more about this beautiful & unique country. Not only did we savor 5,000 years of history but we ate traditional food and capped off the day with a personalized shopping adventure at the Grand Bazaar. The only regret is we needed more days with Serif. We will definitely go back to Istanbul!!!

Private Tour of Istanbul Highlights. Our guide "Mrs Esra" met us at out hotel in the heart of old Istanbul at 9.00 am.One of the biggest advantages of having an "official guide" was that Esra was able to "jump the queue" at every attraction, saving much wasted time. Another advantage was that for a little more than the cost of joining a "small group tour" we, as a couple, had a dedicated guide who went at our speed, without waiting for the slowest person and inconvenience of a group.All the main historical attractions in the old city are within an easy walk of 2 km / 30 minute radius. In the morning we visited the attractive surroundings of the Topkapi Palace with stunning views over the city and Bosphorus. Then the Hagia Sophia mosque. Unfortunately this grand and splendid mosque was spoilt inside by one half being filled with scaffolding.A short walk took us through the Hippodrome, a wide open boulevard with little to show of it's history other than an Egyptian obelisk.We were then lead to see how the finest carpets were made. An interesting demonstration by a very skilled weaver but we then had to endure a 40 minute sales pitch. It was nearly an hour before we came out although they did provide refreshment. In the afternoon we visited the Cistern Basilica. A beautiful columnated underground reservoir originally built in 650AD to provide water for the palaces. Then a 5 minute walk to the "blue" mosque which is stunningly attractive with it's minarets and colourful interior. Our guide then helped us book a traditional Hamman, a Turkish Massage at the oldest and best, the Ayasofya Hurrem Sultan Hamami for the following evening.There are many beautiful parks and gardens, and it seemed each one had a dog asleep in the shade. We didn't see one dog on a leash during our 4 day stay !The cleanliness of the city was remarkable.Finally we caught the tram (10 mins) to the Spice market. Colourful, vibrant and filled with wonderful aromas. With advice on where to buy the best Turkish Delight made with honey, not sugar syrup, we bought a small box before saying goodbye to Esra at about 5.00 pm. Esra was extremely knowledgeable, helpful, friendly and polite and we would strongly recommend her to other travellers.

Best Tourguide in Istanbul. We did a private tour with Serif Yenen on May 7th of the historic district as well as some of the hidden treasures. He is incredibly knowledgable and has a great pace. We later found out that he is the President of the Istanbul Tour Guide Association and has been doing tours of Istanbul for over 20 years. You can't go wrong booking his services.

The ULTIMATE tourist guide!. Thank you for being a great person! You made an impression of Turkey and Turkish people overall very hospitable and friendly. Thank you for sharing historical knowledge that moves and inspires. Thank you for the great experience and the feeling of wanting to explore more of your great and rich country and culture.Best,Yusuf & Aliya

Possibly the best tour guide we've ever had. I've taken many tours and hired many private guides and Serif Yenen is probably the best we've ever had. Our family learned so much. We did two days with him in Istanbul and he also arranged a trip to Cappadocia for us. He was completely trustworthy. He is rather famous in Istanbul - he was the tour guide for Oprah and also for the Pope. Yet he is easy-going and very flexible. He answered all my son's questions and helped me negotiate in the Grand Bazaar, which was very helpful. If he is available for the days you are in Istanbul, grab him. He has written two books about Turkey and you will enjoy his knowledge and his love for his country.

Lovely man, very knowledgeable, reacted to what we wanted. I was recommended to Serif by a Turkish friend -- we wanted to use public transport and wanted to see a few things in particular the Chora Chora monastery and the cisterns as well as the standard areas of Topkapi, Mosques etc.. Serif understood our requests and was a most knowledgeable and efficient guide while managing to organize our limited time without excessive pressure.He also had developed his own quick guides on each of the attractions which he gave us and a great guidebook on Istanbul available from Amazon and we used the useful phrases quite often during the rest of our Turkish tour. Quite expensive but well worth it for the day

Excellent Tour Guide. Serif Yenen is an Excellent Guide!We had two full days in Istanbul (March 15, 16) and thoroughly enjoyed our time due to Serif's expertise and knowledge. We discovered Serif through positive reviews on TripAdvisor, and as promised, he is an excellent guide and quite enjoyable. Serif met us at our hotel in the historical district, Four Seasons Sultanahmet. Before starting the tour he gave us a brief overview of Turkey, including geography, history of ottoman rule, and discussion on different neighborhoods and districts. Istanbul is most interesting but can be confusing due to its layers of history. He was able to put this in perspective. Serif set up a 2 day itinerary that ensured we saw the most important sites but also included local cuisine and color. We rode the ferry to Asian side for lunch, he took us to best baklava bakery in Pera, we rode public transportation, he knew the best shops with finest quality goods in the Bazaar. We really experienced the city and discovered its best attributes thanks to Serif Yenen. We look forward to our return and will book him again.

Tour with Serif. Serif Yenen came highly recommended and I am so happy that I booked a day with him! Serif started our tour with a brief history of Istanbul and of the sights we would be seeing that day. My first impression of him was that he was very knowledgeable, friendly, and warm! He is very much in love with Turkey! We learned so much, had lunch with him and by the end of the day we made a new friend! We didn't feel rushed and we certainly felt safe with him. I highly recommend booking your tour with Serif, my only regret is that I only booked one day with him!!

6 Star Guide. i recently spent 9 days travelling in Turkey with my 17yo and 20yo. Serif was incredibly knowledgeable about ancient through to modern Turkey. He knew where to go and what time of the day to minimise crowds but also took us to villages, markets, great restaurants and even to a friends' home in a spectacular location. Serif quickly became a friend whilst still ensuring our greatest enjoyment. He also generously fulfilled the role of a great concierge - there was no difficulty he couldn't rectify and we only had to mention a wish or a need, and it was organised. He was available 24/7 with genuine care for us. I highly recommend Sherif for any planned tour in Turkey. You can say where you'd like to visit and then completely relax knowing Sherif will organise everything and you will have a wonderful time.

Serif Made Istanbul More Interesting Than We Thought Possible!!. We (2 couples) hired Serif for two days of private guiding in the beginning of our October 2013 stay in Istanbul based on the recommendation of our neighbor at home. We have recommended Serif to other friends who have traveled to Istanbul since then. We all agree - Serif is THE BEST!! He speaks perfect English (we don't know any other language). He tries to understand what our interests are and tailors the agenda to match. Incredibly knowledgable, personable, and communicative. Serif made our experience in Istanbul far more interesting than we thought possible. So enjoyable that we are returning to Istanbul and will spend one week there again in October 2015. We thought Istanbul would be an interesting city, and Serif made it fantastic.

Amazing guide!. Serif is the best of the best! He knows everything about Turkey and is passionate about his country. Serif goes above and beyond to make sure that you are having a great experience. I highly recommend touring with him.

Well worth hiring Serif as a guide.. Myself and four friends hired Serif for a day of touring through the Sultanahmet area. He was absolutely fantastic -- giving all kinds of information and history. He is super knowledgeable and very flexible in accommodating what you would like to see. He provided us with copies of his own mini-guides to the attractions and Istanbul.

Cultural tour of Istanbul - & fun in the snow!. Our day's tour with Serif started off with a fascinating overview on Istanbul and Turkey, helping put what we were going to see into context. Serif also produced his own literature for us to take away. His knowledge of Istanbul along with the culture, architecture, history and politics was superb. We couldn't have asked for a better guide and one who brought fun to the day too, particularly as it was snowing and freezing! He pitched his tour to meet our individual needs, and again this helped on such a cold day, spending the afternoon under cover in the Bazaar, visiting some incredible shops. It seemed everyone knew Serif and held him in high regard, so you really felt you were in safe hands. He also helped us book our New Years Eve restaurant where we were looked after like royalty. We are definitely going back to Istanbul, when it's more sunny, and will be going back to Serif for more cultural experiences.

Day trip to Ephesus. We had a fantastic day trip to Ephesus with Serif Yenen! Serif is extremely knowledgeable about the history of Turkey, and is passionate about sharing this knowledge with his guests. He was able to bring Ephesus to life, describing the culture and customs of the time, pointing out all of the interesting and important features, and also the signs of everyday life. Serif is a very warm, friendly person and enjoyable to spend the day with. He made all of the arrangements for our flight from Istanbul, rental car, etc. and kept a pace that was easy to keep up with, while making sure we saw as much as comfortably possible. Serif Yenen is a wonderful guide and ambassador for his country. You can count on a terrific experience with Serif as your guide!

Tour of Turkey. We are seasoned travelers and wanted to visit Turkey. We booked a tour that captured all of the highlights. When we arrived and met our Tour Guide, Serif Yenen, we knew that we were going to have a wonderful cultural and educational experience. Yes, the itinerary was perfect, but without the direction and interpretation of Serif Yenen the trip would have been an experience of just "checking off the boxes". Serif Yenen has the skill and knowledge to bring the history, culture, and people into a modern perspective. You will not be disappointed with the time you spend with him.

Our Favorite and Most Knowledgable Tour Guide. Serif brought the life and excitement of Istanbul to us. We only wish we had more time to visit there with him. He is an expert in the history, culture and people of not only that magnificent city but of the entire country. He combines immense knowledge of and passion for his country with a most friendly and competent demeanor. Highly recommended.

Discover Istanbul & Turkey with Serif Yenen-Private Tours. Our walking tour with Serif was a major highlight to our 4-day stay in Istanbul. Not only did we cover many major sites (which we customized to our interests), but Serif brought the history to life and gave great perspective to the politics and culture in Turkey and around the world, then and now. His delivery of information is in depth and fascinating. Serif was very flexible, allowing us to spend more or less time at places as we pleased and he introduced us to foods and people we very likely would not have encountered on our own. Having taken other tours one can easily see the level of quality in Serif's tour. His love of what he's teaching is evident and our trip was enriched by having spent the day with Serif.

Extensive Turkey tour. I found the sites visited in areas around a vast portion of the country to be very interesting; at least as much so as Greece, if not even more interesting. I would never have thought to visit Turkey on my own but when I received a call to join a friend, I thought "why not?" I couldn't have asked for a more interesting and enjoyable tour, nor for a better guide as Mr. Yenen. He was extremely knowledgeable and showed all of us an excellent time. I've raved about the trip to many others, and still highly recommend it as one of the more interesting countries I've visited to date. You won't be disappointed.

Travel Turkey with Serif Yenin. I traveled to Turkey with some of my favorite friends in Oct/Nov and I wanted them to see the Turkey that I love. I have traveled to Turkey many times and lived there for a time. But I had not seen everything that I wanted to see and had to return. We were so lucky to have Serif Yenin for our guide. He taught us so much about Turkey as he showed us his beautiful country. He brought life to the history of Turkey. I actually felt like I had taken an advanced college course on Turkey after traveling with him.  You will be very happy and impressed with Serif if you choose him as your guide for Turkey. I hope to be able to return to see more of my favorite country and my good friend Serif. You will feel that he is your good friend too if you travel with him.

Extremely knowledgeable guide. I credit Serif with providing me and my husband with the best travel experience possible in Turkey. We spent two weeks with Serif and he made certain that we were exposed to the people, the customs, the culture, the cuisine, the religion, the government, the history - everything it seemed. Serif's understanding, knowledge and love of his country was obvious. He relates well to foreigners and is patient, kind and warm.

Excellent guide and program. Serif is an excellent guide to Turkey. He is knowledgeable and narrates history like a good story. Serif gave a great deal of depth to whatever place we visited, be it a major tourist site or a humble village. Serif is also organized and fun. He helps you see and experience and gain insights about the country and the people. I have recommended Serif to several friends and hope to be able to travel with him again. We traveled with Serif for 2 weeks along the coast of Turkey and in Istanbul.

Extraordinary Knowledge and ability to bring a group together. Serif Yenen has to be the best tour guide I've ever experienced and I have toured the world. His knowledge of Turkey is extraordinary. Our group even clapped after one excursion. He is humorous, gentle, warm, and has the capacity to make a group cohesive. Anyone who travels with him travels with the best.Maria Costa

Serif Yenen. We toured Istanbul for two days in December 2012 with Serif. Our party included two adults and 4 young adults between 18 and 22. Serif was very quick to pick up on the different interests and attentions spans in our group and was flexible about the pacing of the tours to accommodate our group. He was happy to answer all kinds of questions ranging from history to the hottest nightclubs. He arranged a car and driver for us, including airport transfers which worked out very well to maximize our time in Istanbul. I would definitely tour with Serif again in the future.

Responsive and Resourceful!. We received a glowing recommendation for Serif and -- once we saw Istanbul with him -- we have unhesitatingly recommended him to several friends, all of whom thank us profusely. Two of Serif's characteristics make him a truly standout guide. First, he was incredibly RESPONSIVE to our interests and needs. We had three days to see Istanbul, and had a long list of sites and Jewish interests to explore. Serif helped us put together an on-the-spot itinerary that made the most of our time, and adjusted along the way. He was knowledgeable and personable, and we enjoyed getting to know about his family and Turkish life over lunch almost as much as we did learning about the history of Istanbul. Second, we will never forget his RESOURCEFULNESS. My smartphone stopped working the minute it connected with the Turkish network, and I needed to get it working before leaving on a two-week cruise. Serif helped me scout out one of the few Blackberry specialists in Istanbul to save my data and then took me to where I could replace the phone with something more reliable before we left. On our last day in Istanbul, my wife woke up ill and had to miss touring with Serif and me in the morning. Knowing what was most important to her, Serif turned our itinerary upside down to make sure that she could experience them. Serif is a rare breed -- knowledgeable, humble, and totally committed to making sure that what he does each day creates a lifetime of memories for his grateful clients.
Best Possible Guide . Excellent plan, total knowledge, great connections, thorough documentation, careful pacing and instinctive timing.

Absolutely ideal guide; was extremely knowledgable, friendly and fun.. I can't recommend Serif more highly. You will not be disappointed. He is passionate about Istanbul and its history, and even though he is a renowned expert guide who has served the Pope and Oprah, he is down to earth, personable and humble. He also knows the secret spots and can bypass all the queues. Our small group made fast friends with Serif, and I will most definitely call him the next time I visit Istanbul.

Guide Services with Serif Yenen. Serif Yenen is an outstanding and knowledgeable guide for Istanbul and beyond. We have utilized his services on more than one occasion, recommended Serif to our friends, and all agreed the he's indeed very special...and a nice guy too.When we plan our next adventure to Turkey, we'll definitely be contacting Serif to guide us once again!

Simply The Best. Serif is by far the best guide I have ever had the pleasure to engage. He is knowledgeable, meticulously prepared and comfortable in discussion of current events. His pleasant demeanormakes him as much a companion as guide which has led to many days together on numerous occasions. I have recommended him to various visitors with varying backgrounds and he never fails to receive superlative accolades.When only the best will do, Serif is the choice!Richard Higgerson

In-depth exposure to Istanbul with Serif Yenen. One cannot experience Istanbul on one's own - it is just too big and has so many important sites to visit. So based on a recommendation of a friend we contacted Serif Yenen. What a difference he made. For two days Serif exposed us to not only Istanbul's top sites but also some out of the way places that we would not have explored on our own. The experience was delightful and educational. We learned so much about the history of Turkey and Istanbul. Serif clearly has in-depth knowledge of the city. And Serif's value goes beyond just talking about the sites. Serif would constantly point out the significance of the art painted on virtually every wall and ceiling of the buildings we visited. But what really made this an outstanding experience was Serif's style - he was easy going and approachable. We never felt like we were on a "tour", it was more like a good friend was proudly showing off his city. We have recommended Serif to friends who planned a visit to Istanbul. If we are fortunate enough to visit again we will definitely engage Serif to take us around to experience even more of this wonderful city.

None better. I can imagine no better way to see Turkey than with Serif Yenen. While the entire trip was great, we particularly valued Serif's contribution to our experience. We engaged guides at a few of our other destinations on our voyage, and while we would recommend all of them, none quite measured up to the very high bar set by Serif. I hope you appreciate the incalculable valueAnyone touring with Serif will benefit by his incredible knowledge of history, culture and the arts -- as well as his seemingly effortless sense of the best way to blend activities to provide exposure to such a rich mix. We left after three days feeling like we could not have had a more effective exposure to the wealth that Istanbul represents – a tall order for a city that offers so much to stimulate the senses! And separate from all the experiences, we also very much enjoyed Serif's company (a bonus!). We have been singing his praises widely, comfortable with the knowledge that we were credible in doing so. Of all the places we visited across the Mediterranean, Turkey is at the top of our list of places to return. While our experience in Istanbul was so fulfilling, it served as only a tease for what the rest of Turkey must contain. We hope we will be fortunate enough to connect with Serif upon our return.

Real expert with an approachable style. I had the pleasure of taking an incredible Istanbul city tour from Mr. Serif Yenen in April 2014. The tour was organized in the honor of a world-renown management scholar, Prof. Nancy J. Adler (McGill University). Nancy is an expert in cultures and cross-cultural interactions. Serif’s full-day tour in the Old City provided us with the most important highlights of the Turkish history, heritage and culture. I don’t think that our long and complex history could be explained in such clarity, wit, and wisdom by anyone other than Serif. Depth and scope of Serif’s knowledge has reflected his expertise and experience of many years. Serif was the expert but with an approachable style. He welcomed questions and comments; responded in the most respectful and friendly manner. I firmly believe that if we had more experts like Serif in Turkey, the distorted image of our beautiful country would improve in the world scene. A heartfelt congratulations and thanks Serif Yenen!

He's the guy who wrote the book/travel guides!. Serif has written several books, made a movie, put together handy pamphlets of the major sites (see at amazon.com), and heads the tour guide association in Istanbul. After seeing his movie/presentation at the Smithsonian in Washington, D.C., we contacted him by email. He helped arrange a fabulous trip and he was our private guide for two days as well.We felt very fortunate to have had this experience. His knowledge, communication skills, command of English, and passion for his work made Istanbul come alive. We(a group of six), unanimously agreed....best tour guide ever! Book him....you will be so glad you did!

Private Tour of Istanbul. Serif arranged transportation and guidance for 4 covering the major sites in Istanbul. His command of the English language and expert knowledge made for a fascinating trip. I would gladly do another tour with him. A first rate educated and polite individual.

Serif was wonderful!!!. We travel fairly often, but have never had such a knowledgeable, personable, and helpful guide as Serif. He explained the basics of Islam and the differences between the Sunni, Shia, and Sufi variants; the history and politics of modern Turkey; the history of the Eastern Roman Empire and the intervening centuries between the fall of Constantinople and Ataturk's reforms. All in all, he made our very brief trip to Istanbul a richly rewarding experience.

Tour guide of Oprah Winfrey in Istanbul. We had a valuable guest from USA to visit Istanbul. She wanted to visit historical and culturally important places with a guide. We asked Mr. Serif Yenen to guide our guest in two days. He was excellent and very professional guide. He is witty and fun person as well. You will never regret having his service in Istanbul or any place in Turkey. We found out that Serif Yenen was the one who guided Pope Benedict XVI, Oprah Winfrey, Princess Michael of Kent, and many other VIPs in Istanbul. He has vast knowledge of Istanbul and Turkey as a result of 25 years of experience. He was proud of lecturing three times at the Smithsonian Institute in Washington D.C. as well as being invited speaker for the Penn Museum in Philadelphia, the Boston University and many more. He is also the director of documentary called “Istanbul Unveiled”, which he has won 6 international awards.

First rate guide to Turkey. Serif Yenen is highly qualified to introduce you to Turkey. He is a former English instructor, fluent in English with years of experience as a guide for both groups and individuals. Serif is very knowledgeable about the history and culture of Turkey and possesses a rare sense of humor which was very helpful to me and my travel companions in our exploration of Istanbul, Ankara, Cappadocia, and Turkey's eastern provinces.

Best Guide Ever!. We spent a month touring Turkey with Serif and not only was it the best trip of my life ( all due to his guide work), it was a lesson in history. No one is better versed in the history of his country than Serif. He is simply a true professional and great person. We were treated better than family. No requestwas too hard or left un cared for.In fact I tell everyone he is who they want for a guide in Turkey. Simply TOPNOTCH!I am visiting again this December and Serif will be taking on tour!You never be disappointed with him.

Besa tour guide in Istanbul!. We brought our 3 children to Istanbul (ages 14, 12 and 8) and Serif was our guide for 2 full days. He did a wonderful job of talking through Turkish history with our children and showed us all of the best sights. He had a comfortable vehicle and driver available for us and we also walked around the city. We have traveled quite a bit and he is certainly the best travel guide we have ever had.

Incredible Personal Tour of Istanbul. My husband and I and our two daughters (ages 5 and 8) had the most incredible experience in Istanbul with Serif as our personal guide for 4 days. He met us every morning in our hotel lobby and we set off around Istanbul from there - either in a private air conditioned vehicle (which he provided), by taxi or by foot depending on the agenda that day. Before we had arrived he sent us extensive emails outlining possible itineraries; what he would recommend in one day, what was best for the children, etc. We had to do NO planning whatsoever which really made the experience so relaxing for us. Serif's knowledge of Istanbul and Turkey's history is extraordinary (he writes his own guide books). Every site we visited he was able to provide every detail - there was no flipping through guide books or trying to read pamphlets. He is such a kind and gregarious man even my girls loved spending time with him each day. He made learning about Istanbul and Turkey interesting even for them each day. Another incredible benefit of touring with Serif is that everyone knows him! Every spot we went people happily greeted him. We were whisked to the front of lines and always granted easy access. This was essential when traveling with two small children as waiting in long lines in the heat of the summer is no fun for them. We love to eat and discover the best local food and every day we had the most incredible lunches with him at places he recommended. I truly cannot say enough about our experience with Serif. After spending 4 days with him he truly felt like family to us and we still keep in touch with him one year later. We look forward to returning to Istanbul in a few years and further exploring with our dear friend Serif. Do not hesitate to book with him, you will absolutely love the experience he provides!

An excellent guide for Turkey. My wife and I joined Serif for a tour of Istanbul, Cappadocia, and a number of sites in Eastern Turkey. We have done a fair bit of traveling and this tour ranked among the best. Serif is very knowledgeable about many things about Turkey and the various places we went. He passed on this information in a very understandable way. That he has written a number of guidebooks about various places in Turkey, and even produced a movie about Istanbul, is not surprising. We did a lot of traveling on our tour and he coordinated it in a very efficient way. Despite that he was willing to deviate from the plan if a special opportunity presented itself. He did that a number of times on our trip allowing us some very special interactions with the local people. Not speaking Turkish would have made travel very difficult in the Eastern areas. In the end he had taught us a number of essential phrases and words. I really enjoyed talking to Serif about many things. I especially valued his insights into the modern history and politics of Turkey and how it interacts with it's neighbors in a very complex area of the world. I highly recommend Serif if you are planning to visit Turkey.

Turkey with Serif Yenen. We had the most amazing time in Turkey, with Serif as our guide. Of course, we hit all the highlights, of which Serif is extremely knowledgeable, but he some how introduced us to lots of little adventures and discoveries, that made our trip to Turkey, a trip we'l never forget.

Fantastic Insider View of Istanbul. My husband and I recently traveled to Istanbul with 4 friends. Although we are usually content to wander around a new city without help, a friend strongly recommended a guide he had used there. Based on the recommendation, we contacted Serif and spent two days under his expert wing. We learned so much about the city and its' history and current place in the world that we would never have gotten on our own (not to mention the ability to move to the front of the line at crowded attractions and help ordering lunch!) Serif had the perfect touch with us - just enough info - plenty of snacks and breaks. All members of our group were totally taken with him and the experience. We totally recommend spending a few days with him when visiting Turkey!

Best Guide in Istanbul. We just returned from Istanbul where, for the second time, we spent three days touring the City with Serif Yenen. We travel quite a bit and Serif is without question the best tour guide we have ever used. He really knows his home town as evidenced by the many brochures and maps which have been authored by him which are in addition to his tour book. He knows where to go and when to be there, and he knows which tourist traps to avoid. Wherever we went, other tour guides greeted him. We have referred numerous friends to Serif and all of them came home raving about him. After this most recent visit to Istanbul, we can say Serif has become more than a guide - he has become a friend and we look forward to touring with him again.

Turkey, Ancient and Modern. My husband and I were fortunate enough to travel not just to Istanbul but to many parts of Turkey with Serif Yenen, guide extraordinaire. We speak no Turkish, so having a Turkish guide was very helpful. Serif speaks impeccable English, and imparted his vast knowledge of beautiful and intriguing Turkey with humor and depth of understanding. Serif took us to places we never would have found on our own. He introduced us to artisans, farmers, and families; to food and culture; to history and modern politics. We made unscheduled stops to meet local people doing every day tasks. We visited schools, meeting teachers and students. Turkey is a remarkable country that we highly recommend for both a leisurely visit to Istanbul and the west coast, and a more intrepid journey to the ancient sites of the east. And we know that either or both types of trip will be great if you go with the best, most knowledgeable guide ~ Serif Yenen.

Turkey. If you plan to visit Istanbul, or any places in Turkey, especially for the 1st time, I heartily recommend Serif Yenen as your personal GUIDE. He is so friendly, efficient, knowledgeable, patient. He knows exactly how to make the best use of your time, money and energies. For SURE you will want to come back to Turkey after seeing the sights through the eyes of this special man.

Exciting, informative and captivating experience of my trip.. Serif, is an excellent guide. Knowing the command of English was very helpful to me. He is knowledgeable without being stiff and formidable.I loved the sites we were shown and appreciated not being taken to local rug shops, as is so often the case.

The best way to experience Istanbul. Our trip to Istanbul would not have been anyway as wonderful as it was without Serif! He was (is) so informative, and approachable! He allowed us to plan our own schedule, but always offered suggestions if he thought we were over/under planning for a given day. We opted to use a driver as well, which really allowed us to move from place to place with little hassle. I really enjoyed his personal insight into the culture and current events in the country. I feel that he would be able to adapt a tour to whatever a group wanted/needed- which is to me, a sign of a great guide! We have recently started to use tour guides when we travel abroad, and this is one of the situations where it truly became the highlight of the trip-- it's so nice to not spend all your time and energy identifying monuments and hoping that you're reading out of your guide book about the correct spot. One of my favorite parts of our entire travel experience was his insight into the Islamic faith and its links with Judaism and Christianity- not to mention the changes that have occurred over time. I think all of us in the group hope we can someday make it back to Turkey and see Serif again on another one of his tours outside of the amazing city of Istanbul!

Outstanding!. Spent a great day with Serif, who clearly imparts his vast knowledge of Istanbul and his love for the city. We left with a feeling we know a lot more about Turkey, its culture and its people.By the way, Serif also authored an easy to read, easy to use guide book plus beautiful collateral pieces on the major sites. With Serif there was no waiting on long lines to buy tickets at Topkapi Palace and knows where to eat and where to stay depending on your interests. Istanbul is big and busy and Serif made it fun and rerwarding. Highly recommended.

Like touring with a friend. In all sincerity Serif is the best guide I have ever toured with. It felt like I was hanging out with a friend - a very interesting, very knowledgeable friend! We started by sitting down and talking about the city and from that conversation Serif custom designed a tour based on my interests and the amount of time I had. He showed be the typical tourist highlights that I needed to see but also showed me real Istanbul. We would arrive at a famous site and Serif would share his knowledge and insight - truly give me a sense of not only the facts of its history but the stories/folklore of what happened there - and then he'd give me time to wander around at my leisure to make the experience my own. I can't recommend Serif enough. Thank you my friend!

A terrific guide. Our most enjoyable day in Istanbul was spent with Serif Yenen. He is the uber-guide for the city, with several guidebooks to his credit. Knowledgeable about the sights and able to tailor his tour to the interests of the visitor, I cannot recommend him highly enough.

Best tour Guide in Istanbul. Only had a short time in Istanbul. Serif was amazing! He made a customized schedule to make sure we were able to see all of the important sites and we skipped most of the lines. Everyone in the city knows who he is and he has fantastic knowledge of not just the famous sites but, the local areas all the way down to the best restaurants. If you are going to Istanbul he is the only person to contact and also can arrange for security as needed.

A must for anyone going to Turkey. I consider myself a world traveler and have taken many, many, private and group tours over the past 30 years. Mr. Serif Yenen was by far the best guide I have ever had. He led us through Istanbul for three days explaining in a calm, friendly, well paced, and safe manner, the cultural, historical, and religious customs of his country. We not only saw all of the highlights that Istanbul had to offer, but Serif guided us to local sites few would see including a wonderful restaurant on the Asian side of the city. Everywhere we went (skipping all lines) fellow countrymen said hello to Serif who we learned is the president of the tour guide association in Turkey. I was impressed with the fact that he did many presentations in the Smithsonian as well as his incredible handouts that he provided. If you are going to Turkey, Serif Yenen is a must.

Experienced professional. Turkey excels all others in its preservation of history. The monuments, the ancient ruins, the customs! It's a treasure not to be missed. I would recommend that you see the underground Basilica Cistern (the Sunken Palace), along with the top-ranked sights, because it is so unique. Being underground is actually a pleasant experience here.Serif Yenen is the most knowledgeable and professional tour guide I have encountered on my many trips abroad. History and culture are strong points, along with his excellent command of English and his wit. He is passionate about his country. As you can see, it has rubbed off!

Amazing city with a great tour guide. Our Greek isles and Turkey cruise ended in Istanbul where we extended a day to be able to tour the city. Our tour guide Sofiye was thankfully a half hour early as we cleared customs very fast. We were driven in a well appointed van to our hotel to drop off the luggage and then began a walking tour. We started with the Hippodrome and then Blue Mosque. Sofiye new both sites very well and also gave us a general education on Turkey. I have reviewed these sites separately but will add again that they are magnificent. We then walked to the Topkapi palace to beat the crowds and also do a site that takes more time to see. I had been laid up with illness and was still struggling so Sofiye really paced the tour well for me. The Topkapi is a beautiful place with large grounds and has many artifacts. It is a museum as much as as an architectural visit. We were educated on many of the areas and also given free time to walk around. We then headed to Hagia Sophia, the old Christian church that had been converted to a Mosque. It was under construction but we still saw much of its beauty and history. We then had a traditional Turkish lunch that is not included but was very good and came to only $26 including picking up Sofiye's meal. Sofiye then took me to a pharmacy to get some cold medicine which really helped me get thru the rest of the trip. We ended with the Grand Bazaar which was impressive to see but we were not looking to buy anything. I loved this tour and Istanbul and I hope many people come to this great city to see its incredible history and people.

Istanbul private tour with drop-off at airport.. Gizem Tuyce Can was our spirited guide of the historic area of Istanbul and she did a really great job of giving us the needed history and setting for the various sites we saw. We opted not to do the Bazaar, but instead did the Mosque of Suleyman instead. We still did the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sophia and were able to go down into the Underground Cistern as well (extra entrance fee). With each site, she gave us background information and then gave us time to see things on our own. Tuyce also took us to a very nice place to eat real Turkish food and also took us to see how traditional Turkish pottery is made. The day was delightful.The only downside of our tour was that our driver was driving a stick shift Mercedes and going through the winding streets caused me to become very car sick. I think automatic shift is a better idea!

Excellent tour of Istanbul!. While on a cruise stop in Ephesus, we took a private tour with Ephesus Shuttle and the tour was outstanding. So, we decided to use Curio Travel (the same company) for our tour at the next stop on the cruise: Istanbul. We are very happy we made that choice.Our tour was fantastic. Our tour guide, Gizem Aka, was fabulous. She is very knowledgeable and she really enjoys her job. We learned alot about the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and other places as well as very interesting points about Turkish life and culture. Gizem took us to an amazing restaurant for lunch, the Pudding Shop, where we had a traditional Turkish lunch. It was absolutely delicious.After our tour, we stopped for Turkish coffee, which was also delicious.Not only was our tour a private tour (just the two of us!), but it was also cheaper than the tours offered by the cruise ship. (And we didn't have to get drug along on their group tour- we went where we wanted to go- and stayed as long as we wanted at each place.)I highly recommend Gizem Aka and Curio Travel.

Istanbul. We arranged a day tour from Curio Travel when our cruise ship docked in Istanbul and had a really enjoyable day. We were met at the dock side by our lovely tour guide Seda Cengiz and a small group of 10 people were taken to the heart of the city in luxury Mercedes mini bus. Seda was very knowledgable about the history of the country and the city and was happy to help and advise us when we visited the bazaar or places to eat. It was certainly a much more enjoyable experience than the normal cruise ship tours as it was a small group which gave us much more flexibility on our day in Istanbul. I would certainly recommend Seda and Curio Travel to anyone visiting this area.

Group Istanbul Day Tour. Having had a wonderful experience with Ephesus Shuttle a few years ago, I had no hesitation in booking through the same company for Istanbul when we visited last week. Everything this company does is efficient and professional. There is always a concern if you book independent excursions when you are cruising that you might not return to the ship in time for sailing. The Cruise lines know this and prey on people's fears. What they do not realise is that Tour Companies know precisely the timings and have contingency plans in place to get you back in time as you may read from other testimonials. We were met at the pier in this amazing City by the equally amazing and beautiful Seda Cengiz. She is a very passionate and knowledgeable guide and imparted so much information. I should add that this was a group tour but we were the only couple on this trip. Very Good for us; not so good for this Country's tourism. They are suffering and I get very angry at the stupidity of some people who allow themselves to be put off travelling when in fact there are threats everywhere. In some cases the country they are leaving is just as bad! Finally there is a very good reason for booking independent tours. They are of course so much cheaper than the equivalent tours offered by the Cruise Lines and overall, much better value. I will return.

The highlight of our Mediterranean cruise!. We really dislike expensive cruise ship shore excursions that involve being herded around, slowly, with a busload of other passengers. I booked an Istanbul Walking Tour with Tram through Curio Travel. A guide met us at the ship and took us via tram directly to the Hippodrome and Blue Mosque. After the Mosque, we walked to Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, the Cistern, the Grand Bazaar, and the Spice Bazaar. At the end of the day, our guide took us via tram back to the ship. Our guide was professional, pleasant, very informative, and very accommodating. The absolute best day of our 24-day Mediterranean cruise! We highly recommend skipping the cruise ship shore excursions and booking with Curio Travel.

How a tour provider is supposed to run.. Suzan, who we dealt with exclusively by email, was extremely prompt and professional in handling our tours. She caught a mistake on our travel dates that we missed, and also offered us an Istanbul package after we had booked with them for Kusadasi. I had some concernts because we were booking last minute, but our guide Gizem Aka was excellent, and she gave us a lot of options to fully enjoy our short day in Istanbul. Two thumbs up.

Istanbul . On our trip to Istanbul last month we had the pleasure of being shone around the beautiful city by Gizem Aka. She was a wonderful tour guide. She was very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The tour company was very easy to deal with. We'd definitely use them again.

Cruise excursion private tour. I had arranged two private tours in Kusadasi with Ephesus Shuttle( division of Curio Travel) and the agent Suzan informed me she could arrange a custom tour for my husband and I while we were in port overnight in Istanbul. I wanted to include a tour of the old Jewish quarter as well as a visit to the Ahrida Synagogue and she was able to arrange this for us. Our guide Tyfun was wonderful. It was a crowded chaotic day at the most popular sights and somehow he worked his magic and got us to the front of lines and in and out before big tour groups arrived. We also had the flexibility of adding and making some changes to the original itinerary as we went along. Tyfun took care of every request and stayed with us every step of the way....even through the Grand Bazaar! When we return to Turkey, I will be contacting this agency again.

Wonderful day tour of Istanbul. We enjoyed very much our day tour of Istanbul with Mustafa Duru. He was very knowledgeable about the major attractions and I enjoyed chatting with him about the history as well as the current events in Istanbul and Turkey. We felt very safe with Mustafa and our driver. We visited a smaller Mosque (Blue Mosque was closed), the Spice Market, the Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, the Roman Hippodrome and had a wonderful Turkish lunch at the Pudding Shop Lale restaurant.

Tour Guide. Our guide Gulay Gunay was better than excellent. She spoke excellent English which was much appreciated. Gulay was very informative (excellent grasp of the history included in our tour) attentive and answered all our questions, courteous and helpful throughout our tour. She met us at the port, took care of our luggage, and made sure that we got to the airport for our flight to Paris after our city tour. Our van driver even took us into the airport and located the correct check-in desk for us. We felt very well taken care of and thoroughly enjoyed everything we did with her, especially our visit to the tile store where we had apple tea and Turkish coffee, and our granddaughter got to throw a pot. She very adroitly steered us through the overwhelming Grand Bazaar so that we got to do some fun shopping in a short time. Of course we saw The Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, and Hagia Sophia, so our guide planned the time very well to fit so many places into the time we had available. We highly recommend Gulay and the company for which she works. Tom, Marge, Heidi, and Jordyn. Visited on July 16, 2015

Day tour of Hippodrome Square, The Blue Mosque & Topkapi Palace in Istanbul. We had an excellent day seeing the sights of this beautiful and extremely interesting city. Seda Cengiz was are guide, she was full of knowledge of the city and of Turkey in general, she made it such pleasureable day. Afterwards we visited a leather manufacturers where there was an excellant choice of leather goods all very well made, but if this is not your choice then they will take you elsewhere. There was a fair bit of walking, but nothing to strenuous. I would advise flat or walking shoes and not sandels. Take a sunhat, a camera and a bottle of water.

Private day tour in Istanbul with two littles.. We can't say enough about how wonderful (and accommodating) our guide, Gulay, was on our day tour of Istanbul. We had been on a 11 night cruise that wrapped up in Istanbul. Our guide met us at the port and was super helpful in getting all of our luggage and our exhausted kids (4 years and 10 months) loaded up into a van for a day of sightseeing before the trip back to the airport. Our kids were pretty wiped out so we had to improvise. Gulay was incredibly knowledgable and very happy to point out the most interesting points at the different site and even found us a kid friendly place for lunch. We will absolutely use Curio Travel again and will request Gulay. She was AWESOME!

2 days in Istanbul with private tour guide. We had a wonderful experience in Istanbul with our amazing tour guide, Gizem Aka. She was incredibly knowledgable about the history of the various sites and she also gave us insight into the modern culture in Istanbul. We went to the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, underground cistern, Hagia Sophia, ferry tour of Bosphorous, and a visit to a small bazaar (Grand Bazaar was closed for holiday). We made a friend with Gizem and hope our paths will cross again soon!

Tour in Istanbul. I can't say enough great things about our experience with Curio Travel and our tour guide Gizem Aka. We used them for the day during our port stop in Istanbul. She was fantastic from start to finish. She made sure we got to see everything we wanted (which was quite a bit for a short amount of time) all while being very informative about the places we were at. If you are looking for a good way to see Istanbul in a day I would highly suggest calling Curio Travel and ask for Gizem Aka. You will be in great hands!

My wonderful time in Istanbul . I had the most wonderful time visiting the dynamic city of Istanbul. I went with a study abroad trip through my university. We visited three counties and had many different guides. The guide we had through Curio Travel was outstanding. Her name is Gizem Aka and she made our stay in Istanbul the best of all the countries we visited. She took the time get to know us, to give us the experience we wanted. She made sure we were learning, but she was still very fun and approachable. No question was a stupid question. Gizem wanted us to really experience the city. She took us to ancient sites and modern marvels - from the spice market, to the Grand Bazaar, to the Hagia Sophia, Gizem was with us the whole time. She even introduced me to some of the best food I have ever had. I could not have been more pleased with my experience and I have her to thank!

Spend your day with Betul! It will be the best ever!. We spent a wonderful and educational day touring Istanbul with Betul Basak from Curio Travel. Betul was the best guide ever. She was friendly, spoke excellent English and had in depth knowledge of all the sights and history of Istanbul. We chose to tour taking public tram and Betul made it easy for us to get from place to place. We had a fantastic lunch and she helped us shop at the Grand Bazaar for a collectable knife by guiding us to an honest and reliable shop. Betul is one of the best guides we have had in our various travels and we look forward to touring with her again when we return next Fall.

Private Istanbul Tour. We visited Hagia Sophia Church, the underground cistern, Rustempasa Mosque, the Spice Market and then did a leisurely Bosphorous cruise. What an amazing day. Seda was a wonderful guide who was knowledgeable and fun to be with. The Rustempasa Mosque was an incredible gem - beautiful tiles and few tourists. We had it all to ourselves when we visited. All in all a perfect tour of Istanbul for a second visit to the city.

Ask for Nahide Sahin to be your guide. You won't regret it!. Nahide Sahin is the best guide I have had for a very long time - her qualities make such a positive difference to the traveller's experience. With her enthusiasm for her country and history, and her extensive knowledge, plus excellent english, boundless energy, and an almost magical way of arranging things, she is the best thing you can do to make your day tour work out well for you. I recommend that you request her specifically. She works out of the Kusadasi office, and specilises in tours of Ephesus. She does plenty of other leading also.

Excellent Private Tours. We used Curio Travel to book two private tours on our recent cruise. The first was a day tour in Istanbul with Tayfun who was a wonderful guide. He met us at our hotel and took us immediately to the Blue Mosque so that we got there before the huge line ups. Our day in Istanbul had been cut short by our cruise line but Tayfun easily adapted and made sure that we got to see everything on our wish list including Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. We appreciated how knowledgeable and passionate he was about his city and the sites he took us to. Tayfun also made sure that we got to our cruise ship on time. Our second tour was from Kusadasi to Ephesus with Deniz. We had booked with Curio Travel because the cruise excursions did not include everything we wanted to see. On this customized tour we got to see the House of the Virgin Mary, the Ephesus ruins, the Terrace Houses, The Basilica of St. John and the Temple of Diana/Artemis. Once again our guide Deniz was very knowledgeable and adaptable to our interests. Both tours were very professional and we thoroughly enjoyed them both. Suzan in the office was fantastic at making all of our arrangements and even advised us that our cruise time had changed before the cruise company did. So glad we booked with Curio. Highly recommend them.
Istanbul tour. For the best private tour of Istanbul ask for hulya who speaks excellent English knows how to avoid the long lines & knows the best restaurants

Highly recommend. ..Ephesus & Istanbul . We had wonderful, custom tailored tours with the guides from Curio during our cruise. Our first day was touring the ancient sites in Kusadasi/ Ephesus with Emre. We had a wonderful local lunch, bought Turkish rugs and Iznik tiles directly from the craftsmen.our second day was with Mufassa in Istanbul. We were limited on time, due to our cruise ship being late but he stayed late to ensure special experiences for us at the Grand Bazaar and Spice Market in addition to the beautiful Hau Sofia, Blue Mosque and Underground Cisterns. Thanks to everyone at Curio, who patiently answered questions and attended to our every detail!! Highly recommend, can't wait to go back and see more with Curio!

Excellent Personalized day tours. We had booked out Istanbul city tour through Curio Travel. Initially, I was hesitant being unaware about the city. I had few e-mails and phone conversation and Susan ( at Curio Travel) set up excellent itinerary and airport pick ups. She is very friendly and knowledgeable, very straight forward and honest. No hidden cost. Drivers/Guide were always on time and very courteous. Our Guide, Tayfun was very accommodating, patience with our slow speed, and detailed historical explanation. I highly recommend this tour company and will not hesitate a bit to have my other family members plan tour with this company!!!

A Fabulous Day in Istanbul. We had a one day stop on our cruise ship in Istanbul, and we were lucky enough to have Tayphun as our guide. Tayphun got us to the Blue Mosque thirty minutes before the large crowds arrived, and then had us ahead of everyone else to see the Topkapi Palace. We also visited the hippodrome, the Hagia Sophia and the Grand Bazaar. Tayphun obviously knew how to help us maximize our time while there, but was also knowledgeable of the history of this amazing city, and was also funny and easy to talk to . We will not forget our short but amazing day in Istanbul!

Walking tour. We had a walking tour with our guide Mustafa. He has good knowledge and speaks perfect english. We saw everything we wanted to see and got a lot of information about Istanbul and the turkish way of living. Mustafa also gave us good tips what to do in the evening and where to go. Thank you Mustafa for a great day in Istanbul!

Amazing Several Days in Istanbul. Gizem Aka was my tour guide through Istanbul. She was full of life and made every part interesting and relatable. I loved walking through the spice market and seeing all of the unique and delicious delicacies. Our first boat tour cruising around the water was beautiful and relaxing. We were able to see all of the sites that we would later take tours of. The Beylerbeyi Palace was amazing to walk through and learn about. Other favorite sites on this trip were the Basilica Cistern, the Blue Mosque, and the Hagia Sophia. The overall trip was breathtaking and was made so much more interesting and fun due to our wonderful tour guide. If you have the chance, allow Gizem Aka to take you on a tour of any part of this magical city!

Great tour guide - substantial, interesting, worthwhile. Gukce, our guide, picked my father and I up from the cruise ship, and escorted us to a very large and clean minivan for our tour. Gukce, who speaks excellent English, gave a very substantial tour of Ephesus. We was friendly and interesting. She would often tell us "This is what the guides are supposed to say, but I think it is more like that..." In short, she would give us the evidence behind different theories behind Ephesus. Then she took us back to our ship. Everything went really well, and we were happy we booked with Ephesus Shuttle!

Ephesus Shuttle/Curio Travel tour. We did the Walking Tour with Tram, which was great. We booked very easily by email and our guide, Volkan, met us at the cruise terminal and took us by tram to the Sultanahmet district. Much more interesting than going by bus or car! We visited the Topkapi Palace and by special request included the Harem Section. We also visited the Hagia Sofia and Grand Bazaar. Unfortunately the Blue Mosque was closed to tourists while we were there because it was a Friday. Volkan was great, very informative and interesting and he was able to answer all our questions. He also recommended a great place for lunch!

Excellent half day tour of Istanbul. I travelled on a cruise with my sister. We booked a 4 hour tour of Istanbul through Cruising Excursions. The company was Curio travel and the guide Mustafa was very professional, had terrific knowledge of the city but didn't overdo it. he had a terrific command of the English language and gave us down time to wander alone and visit the restrooms

Carole and I (Kevin) arrived in Istanbul and were met at the airport by Mustafa Duru for a six day private tour.. On our first day we visited the various and famous Mosques, Underground Cistern, Hippodrome and of course the Grand Bazar and the Spice markets. Mustafa was very informative and interesting talking about the sites we visited. Our tour to Kanakkale and Gallipoli were moving and Mustafa's accounts on what happened were moving and respectful to both side of the conflict. After visiting Troy we went on the Bosphorus cruise and then to show and dinner. Mustafa on a number of occasions stayed late into the evening with us taking about life in Turkey and about his family. Very enjoyable saty.

Istanbul Tour. When we arrived by cruise ship in Istanbul we were met by our tour guide Gizem. It was a welcome surprise to find that we were the only two on the tour. Gizem spent over 8 hours giving us a very comprehensive and informative personalised tour. We had a wonderful day and I would highly recommend it.

Excellent day tour from cruise ship. Gulay met us on time at the ship and proved to be an excellent tour guide. We visited the main areas, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar. She was very informative on all subjects and a very friendly person. We enjoyed the day immensely.

Fabulous day tour. As first time visitors to Istanbul we were lucky to have Tayfun Yalgin as our tour guide. It was like walking around with an historian but with a contemporary outlook on things. We did lots of the typical sites you might what to cover such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, the Hippodrome Square and he was also more than happy to take us to an added one we wanted to see - Basilica Cistern and the day ended with a guided tour of parts of the Grand Bazaar. He also left us for free time at places for photos and shopping etc. He gave us a great tip for a restaurant for dinner as well and also told us some tips for shopping in the Grand Bazaar! Great day and would highly recommend Tayfun as a guide.

Excellent private tour of Istanbul. We only had 2 days in Istanbul at the end of a cruise. We arranged with Curio Travel to pick us up at the ship, drop our luggage at our hotel and then we had a 7 hour walking tour. It was Tour 3: Topkapi Palace, St. Sophia, Blue Mosque, Hipodrome and the Grand Bazaar. Seda Cengiz was an excellent guide. She was very knowledgeable. Even though we had done some prework (not necessary because Seda gave such good background information) and she was able to answer all our questions. She put things in historical context but also gave us much more color on the cultural aspects. She gave us time on our own in most sites so that we could go at our our pace. With a guide we were able to skip many lines - we saw so much more than we would have on our own! In one day with Seda we probably covered ground that would have taken two full days on our own. After that we were able to spend our second day at our leisure and had a better idea of what we still wanted to see and do. I would highly recommend this tour. And a great value! Thank you Seda

Very professional. Serves with pride.. Our visit in Istanbul was cut short to only half a day, but Curio Travel helped us hit some of the local highlights: Blue Mosque area, Underground Cistern, Grand Bazaar. Istanbul is a city with very interesting cultures. Hulya is a great guide. She waited for us the whole morning with no complaint (our Island Princess cruise arrived late because of mechanical problem). She was very knowledgeable about the city and was very flexible with our request. Professionally handled our group of 12 people. From beginning to end, Curio left us with the impression that it serves customers with professionalism and pride. For sure we hope to come back again.

One Terrific Tour Guide. When evaluating a tour group or service, which I have never done, I don't think you're evaluating the places visited, i.e., the itinerary. They're probably all pretty much the same with all tours. No, what you're evaluating is the tour guide. Our guide, Gulay Gunay, took us to pretty much the standard places, e.g., the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar, and more. She was excellent, outstanding, and terrific! I don't know what other adjectives to use. You could understand her (my sister-in-law had a tour two days after ours [don't know which company] and could barely understand their guide). She knew her history and architecture, and that's what a tour of Istanbul is all about. She asked for questions; she knew the answers. She was personable and extremely pleasant. What a great introduction (on our first day there) to a fascinating city.

All of the Sites, None of the lines. Our private tour with guide Mustafa seemed perfectly timed to see the sites, learn a lot, and AVOID LINES (or queues). It was an unbelievably great value and use of our time. We saw the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Hippodrome Square, and the Grand Bazaar. Mustafa was very knowledgeable and loved teaching. We learned a ton about the history, religion, and culture of Istanbul. He was passionate about his city and country. We had just one day in Istanbul and I can't imagine a better way to spend it.

Istanbul Tour. We (two couples) did a 1 1/2 day tour of Istanbul. Our guide Gizem Tagce Can was excellent. The tour was well paced and our guide was very knowledgeable. Even though Istanbul was very busy our guide timed our visits to the major attractions to perfection, avoiding long queues. At the end of our tours she helped us catch the tram back to the bazaar and gave us instructions about the best way to return to our ship.

Curio Travel Private Tour of Instanbul & Ephesus, Turkey. Visiting a foreign country for the first time can be overwhelming...Having a Curio Travel private guide was the best decision that we could have made. They were reliable (always showed up when and where they said they would); the guides were knowledgeable; friendly; flexible when necessary; and extremely informative. As a Travel Management professional, I work with many similar companies all over the world, and Curio Travel definitely exceeded all expectations! I highly recommend them when traveling to Turkey! Terri D.

Curio Travel in Istanbul, Turkey, with "Seda". We were a party of six on the 12-day Grand Mediterranean cruise on the Island Princess cruise ship (27 June to 9 Jul 2015), from Barcelona, Spain to Venice, Italy. We used the “Tripadvisor” web site to pick the highly-rated tours that suited us best and then we pre-arranged all of our port call excursions via email before we departed on our vacation.We had a great time in Italy and Greece before departing for Istanbul, Turkey. Due to a mechanical problem with the ship, we arrived in Istanbul around 5 hours behind schedule (~1:00pm instead of 8:00am).In Istanbul we had Seda for our tour guide (Curio Travel) -- we were so happy to see Seda at the port terminal patiently waiting for us all morning. With the duration of our tour cut short from 8 hours to 3.5 hours, Seda was able to negotiate on our behalf for a reduced price with Curio Travel avoiding any up front arguments over the price. Seda spoke fluent English. She knew our time was limited, so she tailored the tour in response to our desires allowing us to visit the Hagia Sofia (inside), the Blue Mosque (outside), and the Underground Cistern (inside). With time running short, she managed to squeeze in a 20-minute visit to the Grand Bazaar for some memorable photos before returning to port (no time to do much shopping).We had a great three and half-hours with Seda. She was very punctual, very knowledgeable on the history of Turkey and she had so much information to share with us during the 3-½ hour tour. Istanbul was one of the highlights of the cruise. We were very disappointed that we only had a short time to spend in Istanbul (due to the late arrival). However, that was not Seda’s fault. We had a wonderful experience with Seda – she turned our disappointment into joy given the circumstances. If we ever return to Istanbul/Turkey again, for sure we will pick Curio Travel and ask for Seda again.

A perfect day in Istanbul.. We were a little apprehensive because the day tour was not organised by the cruise liner, in fact they didn't want to know. But the moment we stepped out of the port area, we were greeted by Mustafa holding a board with the Curio travel logo.We had originally booked in UK a half day tour, but gladly converted it into a full day. We had a personal tour with one other couple of the hypodrome, the blue mosque, St Sophia's Church/mosque/musium, followed by the Topkapi palace and finally the grand bazaar.The transport was very comfortable, and the guide spoke clear English, with the inteligence to explain all the details and answer all our questions, including the reasoning for the ceremonial washing or the transition from the gambling at the hypodrome (Greek for horse stadium) to the horse trading when the city became Islam (Muslims don't gamble!).We had some helpful advice on how best to make the most of the Bazaar, resulting in several bargains before the day ended with a safe return to the cruise liner.If Curio have other excursions in other parts of the world, we shall certainly use them. Thank you again.

Excellent , and beyond expectations way to visit Istanbul.. My husband and I had limited time ( 7.5 hrs) in Istanbul on a cruise port of call. This city has been on my wish list to visit for many years. Having researched it, read reviews and spoken with fellow travellers I was resigned to fact that if we visited a few of the top sights we would be lucky. One of my work colleagues had only time to see the Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar, but the way everything worked out was truly wonderful.The guide Mustafa, met us at the port at 08.15. There was only another couple in the group. So a good start already- only 4 people. It really felt like a very private tour. As it was during Ramadam I had some apprehensions about being able to access the Blue Mosque. However, Mustafa brought us straight there. On the way he provided us with historical , architectural and cultural information about the city. As he is an official guide we didn't have to queue except for a short duration. Because it wasn't a prayer time we could enter straight away. Cloaks are provided for anyone whose shoulders and or above mid leg are exposed. Females must cover their heads with a scarf, or a hood in the provided cloak. Shoes must be removed and a plastic bag is available to hold them.We were allowed as much time in the mosque as we needed and points of interest were shown to us by Mustafa. On our exit the queue had extended itself dramatically, and we were told that it would now take people 1.5 hours to enter ! After some time in the open space, and historical architectural places being shown to us we walked the short distance to Agia Sophia , with time to photograph the Blue Mosque from a an amazing vantage point. Again at the church we had a detailed tour, and had some free time afterwards. There are drinks and toilet facilities easily available outside. ( ladies note there is a queue so get there quickly !)
