Following this , we were driven to Topkapi Palace where we were fortunate to see a loud but wonderful musical/ historical procession with people dressed in very colourful ancient looking costumes. This event happens only once each month, or sometimes once in 2 months. Again we felt very lucky. Mustafa gave us the historical background to the Palace, and brought us to specific sites of interest. We pointed us in the direction of interesting rooms - kitchen area, Harem area, and armour area. We set our own pace in viewing these. Following that , we then went to the jewel room. There is 1 room where a very unique gem is on display, which we could have queued to see, but that would mean limiting our remaining time. The 4 of us decided to skip that, so he showed us another jewell room where there are many exquisitely beautiful jewels on display. For anyone who has seen the Crown Jewels there is some similarity, and it's well worth visiting.There was no queue to this room and Mustafa said it was because the others didn't know about it. Atfterwards we were driven to the Grand Bazaar, with places of interest being shown to us en route. After some information and a short tour we were left to our own devices. I was pleasantly surprised that the shop/ stall keepers were not aggressive in their approach and didn't hassle us. Having been to Morocco, Tunisia, and Egypt I expected to want to run out of there. We took our own time in browsing and just looking and did the usual ( expected) haggling. When we took photographs the shop owners didn't hassle us for money. My husband and I split the time so that we could have a relaxing lunch in a restaurant, already shown to us, which is a short distance outside the Bazaar. I thought as it was Ramadam it might be inappropriate to ask for alcohol, so was delighted when a wine list was made available, and sure enough we toasted to a fantastic day.We met up with Mustafa and our fellow travellers at the pre allocated place and time, and were taken back to the ship in plenty of time for our 16.30 departure.Mustafa said that during Ramadam is a good time to visit Istanbul, as many Turkish Muslims do not go out to the Bazaar. He informed us had it been another time he could not guarantee such a successful day. Tesekkurler ( thank you) Mustafa and the chauffeur for a memorable and wonderful day, and it was certainly the highlight of our cruise.I would highly recommend this company.

Fantastic Way to See the City!. My husband and I took our first cruise this July and added some extra days in Turkey prior to leaving. I'd booked a couple of other private tours through this company for our cruise excursions and when they suggested a package deal for booking Istanbul, too, I couldn't resist. I knew we hadn't allowed this magnificent city enough time to truly do it justice so we really need a guide to help us understand as much as we could.Our guide Hatice Aydin was absolutely spectacular. She was a little early to pick us up at our hotel which was fine by us. We were really excited to get out and see the city. We stayed at the Magnaura Palace (see our review about that for info, too) so the location couldn't have been better to start our walking tour.Since we were right around the corner from the Blue Mosque, I assumed we'd start there, but Hatice had a better (and much, much more strategic) plan in mind. We started with Topkapi Palace and spent the rest of the day just blown away by everything we saw and learned. Hatice was not only extremely knowledgeable and professional, she was also funny and charming and savvy. If she saw a line forming or another tour approaching, she'd steer us a different way. At one time, she managed to get us around a long line entirely whihc probably saved us an hour or two waiting in the heat! In a single day, we saw the highlights of the Topkapi Palace, the Hagia Sophia, the Hippodrome, the Blue Mosque, the Basilica Cistern AND had a fantastic lunch. We even managed to spend some time in a rug store at her suggestion.I have to say, buying a rug or even seeing a rug presentation was just about the last thing on my to do list for Istanbul. I'd just heard too much about it and didn't think it sounded interesting at all. After some encouragement from Hatice to visit Topkapi Carpets, and assurances that it was no pressure/no obligation, we agreed to go. I can't say enough how incredible this experience was and how happy I am we did it. The shop owner was friendly, polite and obviously quite knowledgeable. From explaining how they harvest silk to watching a rug making demonstration to viewing their antique rugs (some from the 13th century!), we were just captivated the entire time. Needless to say, one of these antique gems came home with us.If your time is limited in Istanbul, or if you're at all overwhelmed by the vast and rich history it offers, I highly recommend hiring Hatice at Curio Travel. She filled our day in a way that never felt rushed or formulaic. She answered all of our questions with great understanding. We had a wonderful day exploring this beautiful city with her. Thanks Hatice! Amy and Andrew

Istanbul Tour. We really enjoyed our tour in Istanbul with Mustafa Duru! He was an excellent tour guide and we really enjoyed all the information he shared and the places we visited. Highly recommend Mustafa and Curio for your tour in Istanbul!

Incredible guided tour. We had an incredible day in Istanbul with Seda from Curio travel. We spent the day visiting the sights and getting oriented on our first day in Istanbul during our recent week long trip. This would also be a wonderful way to spend your day if you were stoping in Istanbul on a cruise. Seda met us at our hotel and we set of walking through Sultanahmet to be the first in line at Hagia Sofia. Seda was kind, funny, and full of information. My husband is a world history teacher who asked many specific questions throughout the day. Seda easily answered all but one of them and then proceeded to spend her lunch time looking up an answer from him on the internet. She was also very flexible about how we wanted to spend our time, even adding in a stop for Turkish coffee to satisfy our curiosity. When the Blue Mosque line stretched around the building, she gave us the option of going to the Underground Cistern instead which allowed for a much better use of our time. Seda talked to us about Turkish customs, food, and culture which was interesting and put us at ease. Seda made us feel very comfortable in a new city and started our trip off on a very positive note. I would highly recommend booking a tour with Curio travel.

Day tour of Istanbul. We booked a day tour of Istanbul through Ephesus-Shuttle. Our guide (Mustafa Dura) was very friendly and knowledgeable and consequently the whole day was very relaxed and enjoyable. We were never rushed and had time to explore on our own as well as being guided and learning quite a lot about the history of Istanbul.As we were ahead of schedule our guide also took us to the Suleiman the Magnificant Mosque which we wouldn't have otherwise visited.It was an excellent way of seeing lots of istanbul in one day and we got a lot out of the attractions.

Curio Istanbul Tour. Used Curio Travel for a guided day tour with my family aged 14, 12 and 10. We had the pleasure of the company of Mustafa Duru for the day. He proved to be an excellent, informative guide who chose our days destinations perfectly. He explained the historical background to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Dolmahbace Palace, Grand Bazaar and Yerabatin Cellar, making it entertaining for the children. Will definitely use again to visit those sites missed on this trip! Highly recommend.

Best Layover Tour Ever!. My 8-year-old son and I had a 16-hour layover in Istanbul, and instead of wasting away in the airport we wanted to explore the city.Curio Travel did an excellent job of giving us the grand tour of this beautiful cities rich history, culture and the allure of its present existence.Our tour guide, Gulay Gunay,was wonderful! She was waiting for us when we arrived outside of customs. She gave us time to freshen up and even helped us resolve an unforeseen luggage issue. We were off to the old city after some coffee.Gulay showed us all of the sites we were interested in, and shared a wealth of information on the city's history and the Turkish way of life. She was extremely patient with us too... My 8-year-old son was a little moody at times and she always had great solutions to help us make the best use of our time there.We were extremely happy with the whole experience of booking the tour with Serkan, to Gulay's tours of the sites and the driver who gor us everywhere we needed to be in a timely fashion. This was well worth the money we spent!I would call them again if I was to have to the opportunity to visit Turkey again, and I'd highly recommend them to anyone who wants to soak in all Istanbul has to offer!

Excellent 1.5 days in Istanbul. What a fabulous time we had in Istanbul, with many thanks to our guide Mustafa and the great driver from Curio travel. The service provided was excellent. Our guide was there to meet us at our cruise ship, he knew which sights to see first and asked what our needs were for the first half day, then full second day. Mustafa's command and comfort with our English language was wonderful. We even spoke a few words in Italian with him since we had just come from Venice. He really showed us all the sights we were interested in and was in tune with our needs and pace. On the second day, he recommended a great luncheon restaurant, where many locals eat as well, so we felt like we were getting an authentic experience. We really had a great time with him! It was so nice to be in a private tour with all the entrance fees already included and more personalized attention than we would have received through the cruise line and at a more reasonable cost. We thank you so much for everything and would highly recommend your services. Thanks again!

Half Day Tour of Istanbul. Our cruise ship arrived in Istanbul at 1 pm. Our tour guide Hakan and his driver met us when we disembarked the ship. Hakan gave us an excellent tour of Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and a quick look inside Hagia Sophia (which we had already seen on a previous trip). We then spent about 50 minutes inside the Grand Bazaar. Hakan was very knowledgeable and he was even able to avoid the long lines to get us into the Blue Mosque. It was so nice being able to take a private tour and not waste time taking a ship's tour with 40 other people. We saw so much in a half day and we highly recommend Hakan and Curio Travel!

A day and a half tour of Istanbul. We spent a wonderful day and a half seeing all the major sights in Istanbul. When I booked a tour with Ephesus Shuttle, Suzan offered me a 20% discount to book a tour in Istanbul as well. Our ship docked in Istanbul overnight before we had to disembark. Our excellent tour guide, Hulia, was waiting for us at the port. We spent a full day seeing the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. Hulia was a pleasure to be with and was extremely knowledgeable about all these sites. She even helped us make reservations for a Turkish Bath for the following day. The next morning Hulia was again waiting for us as we disembarked with all our luggage. We had a pleasant drive in the Golden Horn area before we stopped at the Spice Market, Underground Cistern, and another smaller, lovely mosque. We were then dropped off at our hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our tours with Hulia. Being taken to our hotel with our luggage was an added bonus! We highly recommend both Ephesus Shuttle and Curio Travel.

Excellent day tour of Istanbul. My husband and I just completed a beautiful day seeing the sites of Istanbul with Tayfun Yalcin of Curio Travel. What a fantastic guide. We saw all the biggies- Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Grand Bazaar, etc. Tayfun moved as quickly or slowly as we wanted, clearly knew the subject matter and was a fun, friendly guide. Pick up at our cruise terminal was seamless and he walked us to our hotel at the end of the tour. That was especially appreciated as we do not know the city. It's worth every penny to have someone who knows the area, the best times to visit certain sites, tucked away restaurants, and even the less busy bathrooms. Well done.

Hard Day but very informative. We did a tour with Ozan in Istanbul. I give him a solid A+ on his knowledge of Istanbul. His English language skills were outstanding. On a scale of 1-10 I would rate his knowledge and ability to get information to the client a 10.The vehicle in which we were picked up was a Mercedes Tour Van. The driver was amazing in the crazy traffic of that city. Definitely a 10 out of 10.The places chosen for our tour, especially the Blue Mosque, the bazaar, and Hagia Sophia were all amazing, and Ozan's knowledge of these areas was outstanding.This is not a trip for people who have trouble getting around. I have health problems with my heart and issues with my back and this was the hardest day of my European trip. Ozan kept us going but I am really paying for it today, but this was far from his fault. I think he would have slowed down if we had asked but he wanted to get all the sights in for our tour.Overall I would rate this a solid 10 out of 10 with highest compliments to our guide!

Instanbul City Tour - Half Day. Seda Cevgia did a wonderful half day tour for my daughter and myself of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar etc. Seda is particularly interested in the historical aspects of the City and shares these in a friendly and interesting way. Highly recommended

Istanbul City Tour. Fabulous city - full of great historical interest. Blue Mosque; Topkapi Palace; Hagia Sophia; Hippodrome; Grand Bazaar and Spice Market. Wonderful, friendly, helpful, people. Great food, too!!Guide on time at cruise port - very knowledgeable and enthusiastic.Fair bit of walking and some stairs.Our guide was Tayfon - great sense of humour!!

Half day tour -Istanbul. Fantastic time spent with Ozan who was there to collect us from the cruise port as arranged. A tour of Hagia Sophia, the blue mosque, the Hypodrome and the spice markets with a comprehensive explanation of the history of each place in extremely good English. Thank you for sharing the colourful background of this ancient city with us! Highly recommend this tour!

Outstanding 2-day private tour of Istanbul. Thanks to our guide Mustafa Duru we experienced all the tourist highlights! But, more important to us in addition to the past and present history of the city - Mustafa shared local street food, markets, Artisan shops and a couple of wonderful resturants in our time together...everything tailored just for us! We came away with not only exquisite examples of Turkey (tiles/silk/saffron); but with a true feeling of the warmth of Turkish hospitality.Jean & Don B

Much better than Cruise ship tours. My husband and I used Ephesus Shuttle (part of Curio tours) for a private tour of Ephesus, and for a small group tour of Istanbul. Both were excellent and covered more sites than any of the excursions offered by our cruise ship, and at a much lower cost (about $75. each). The guides made careful use of our time in both places and considered our wishes on what we wanted to see. Do not hesitate to book tours with this company; they are very professional, honest, and the guides are fluent in English and very knowledgeable. In Ephesus Ayse was our guide and Aatice was our guide in Istanbul. Because it was very crowded in Istanbul and the lines were long, we would never have gotten into the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque all on our own. In fact we heard from others on the cruise ship tours that they were not able to see inside of all these main attractions as we did. Due to the small size of our group (10) and the skills of our guide, she was able to maneuver us through the crowds much easier than the huge groups of 40 that the cruise ships have. Have a better experience by booking tours with Ephesus Shuttle and save money too!

Turkish Delight - great day in Istanbul with Gulay Gunay - highly recommended. Collected from the cruise terminal exactly as arranged and had tour [with four others] of Hippodrome Square, Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, and the Grand Bazzar. Gulay spoke English well, was organised and most informative and answered a diverse range of questions with a passion for the city and with a genuine interest to please. In the afternoon we were on our own [so we had a private tour] of Topkapi Palace where once again she showed intimate knowledge of the history of the Sultans and the various rooms. She allowed time for taking pics everywhere and throughout the whole day she was a Turkish Delight. My wife and I cannot recommend her enough - thank you Gulay.

Private day tour of Ephesus. We had an absolutely amazing day. We flew down from Istanbul to Izmir where our wonderful guide, Emre, met us at the airport. Firstly I would like to say how fantastic Curio Travel were from the minute we started making enquiries from home about the possibility of doing such a tour. We were not on a cruise and just wanted to do the tour ourselves and nothing was too much trouble in helping us organise the day tour. Suzan Paprat in the Curio Travel office was very quick to respond to any questions and was extremely efficient. On arriving into Izmir, Emre met us and walked us to our van and driver. Both the vehicle and driver were exceptional. The Mercedes van was very comfortable and our driver was always courteous and we felt safe with him. He always stayed with the van so we could leave bags or valuables inside without any worry. We thoroughly enjoyed our day tour which included Ephesus, Virgin Mary's House, St John's Basilica and the Artemission Temple. Ephesus was absolutely amazing and we were very happy we had a guide to explain what we were actually looking at. The Virgin Mary's House was also a very interesting place and well worth the visit. The other two sites were ruins only but still good to see. Emre took us to a lovely place for lunch (cheap and fantastic local food, great wine) that was attached to a place that made/sold Turkish carpets. We only went there because we had told Emre we were interested in seeing how Turkish carpets were made with the intention of buying one if we found one we liked & the price was right. There was no pressure to buy one and the whole experience was very pleasant. Absolutely fascinating the work that goes into them and it's great to see how they are made before the long process begins on negotiating a price that is agreeable to everybody. For the record we bought 2 carpets and were extremely happy with our selection. Emre and our driver then took us back to Izmir airport and we flew back to Istanbul. It was a fabulous day and we would highly recommend this company to do tours with. We would definitely contact them again if we are to return to Turkey to see what else they can help us with. Very impressed with their service and efficiency.

Private tour of Istanbul and Ephese. My husband and I had a wonderful day visiting Istanbul with Hulya from Curio travel. She is very professional, nice and listening to our needs. If you are planning to visit both Istanbul and Ephese they can offer their service with a reduction of the price if you take both tours. Our guide in Ephese, Dicle Gundem, was very good too and she speak french very well. Many thanks to them for those beautiful days.

Fabulous Tour Guide Seda Cengiz. We booked a day and a half tour of Istanbul through Ephesus Shuttle, which I gather is affiliated with Curio Travel. It was extremely easy to book and communicating via email was a breeze. Our guide was a lovely young woman named Seda Cengiz and I cannot say enough good things about her. So smart and knowledgeable, as well as sweet and lots of fun. Our first full day in Istanbul was crazy - it was May 2 and a Turkish holiday, and between cruise ships in town, other tourists, and Turkish people enjoying a lovely, warm day, Istanbul was packed, and the lines for all attractions were daunting. Somehow, Seda managed to get us into various places (such as Hagia Sophia and the Underground Cistern) without having to wait in the horrifyingly long lines. She has a real passion for what she does and for her country and made both days so enjoyable. We were able to see so much of Istanbul in a day and a half and learned so much - something we could not have done without Seda. We certainly would not have enjoyed our time as much without her. I felt the price paid for a private tour for two was quite reasonable, especially given all that Seda did for us. There was an issue with transport back to the ship the first day (not the fault of Seda or Curio) due to an unbelievable traffic jam that developed late in the day (no cars could get through). Seda took the tram with us to the ship to make sure we got back - while she did not need to do this, she insisted on making sure we were ok and was so sweet about it. (PS - we enjoyed the tram very much - ended up using it the next day.) My highest recommendation for Curio and Seda - truly professional and great service.

Private Tour of the Highlights of Istanbul. My friend and I booked a 1.5 day Istanbul Sightseeing excursion with Curio Travel and we were so glad we did. The company, especially Suzan, was incredibly responsive to any and all questions we had before our cruise ship arrived into Istanbul. Our guide for the two days was Mustafa Duru and he was absolutely incredible. He met us promptly at the port each morning with our private van and driver and had our itinerary all worked out so that we could maximize our time and not have to wait unnecessarily on the entry lines at the most popular tourist sites. His English was excellent and his knowledge of this amazing city was wonderful. In addition to the "must see" tourist attractions, we also added the Dolmabache Palace that was excellent - the Versailles of Turkey. We were able to see a carpet making demonstration that was fascinating as was a demonstration on ceramics. There was never any pressure to buy in these shops, but rather to give us an understanding of how these products are made. He also took us to a great place for lunch where the locals eat -- absolutely amazing and fabulous kebabs. We would highly recommend Mustafa in a heartbeat and cannot wait to return to Istanbul. Thank you Mustafa for a wonderful 2 days.

Shore excursion: Historic Istanbul Private Tour. Do yourself a favor and book your Istanbul tour with this company! I used shorebee to book my excursion online. When we got off the cruise our wonderful guide Seda Cengiz was waiting for us. We had a private van take us to the center of town and from there proceeded to visit: the Ancient Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, Ayasofya,Basilica Cistern and Grand Bazaar. Seda helped us understand the complex history of this beautiful city. She was very knowledgeable and easy to follow. She also made sure to tailor the tour to what we wanted to see and helped us find the best places to buy truly unique art to bring back home. Overall Seda made our trip Fantastic ! We will be back for sure !

Istanbul Tour. For the price we paid, this really was good value. There were only 5 on our tour and the guide Mustapha Duru was knowledgeable, polite and very entertaining. He made this a memorable visit and would recommend him anytime.

Historic highlights tour of Istanbul. We enjoyed a fascinating tour of Sultanahmet and the area around the Grand Bazaar, which included among other things, Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome and the Cisterns. Our guide, Mutafa Duru, was very knowledgable and entertaining, and provided us with many fascinating details of the sites we visited. He spoke impeccable English, and was able to answer any questions we had. We highly recommend this service to any visitors to Istanbul.

Day tour of Istanbul. We had a wonderful day tour of Istanbul, including the Topkapi palace and Harem, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern and Hippodrome, Suleyman Mosque and Grand Bazaar. The guide Gizem was knowledgeable and energetic and had a great disposition and sense of humor. She made the day with her wit and remarks and was very accomodating to our every needs. The only downsides were the horrible traffic, which were not anyone's fault but given how close we were to our Eminomu port destination she probably could have suggested leaving the van and just walking a few blocks instead of waiting 40 minutes to cover two city blocks. I also did not like that the travel agency person Suzan insisted on payments in USD at above market conversion rates after the entrance fees and parkings were paid in Turkish Lira - it seemed rather petty given the significant costs of the tour and given that they took a different approach with their sister company Ephesus Shuttle in Kusadasi. Nonetheless, they are a very good company and I would not hesitate to recommend them.

Absolutely amazing experience. I travel a huge amount with work (150,000 miles flown in 2014) and was in Istanbul for just a few days en-route elsewhere in April 2015, so decided to book a one day guided tour through my hotel (the St Regis, Istanbul). Given that I did not have the time to research all that Istanbul had to offer, nor did I have the time to make the usual tourist mistakes of getting lost in a city I'd never been to, I booked with Mustafa. In one day, Mustafa guided me around the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, Topkapi Palace, Saint Sofia Church, the Underground Cistern, the Grand Bazaar, Mahmutpasha Market, the Spice Bazaar, Istiklal Street and Taksim Square. It was exactly the whistle stop tour that I wanted, tons and tons of interesting facts as we went along, and perfectly timed to my short attention span.A truly amazing day with a fantastic guide, and an itinerary that was exactly what I wanted. I cannot speak highly enough of Mustafa, so much so that everytime I mention Istanbul to anyone, I always mention Mustafa! I have a few more photos from my tour on instagram: @t_j99

Great time in Istanbul w/ the best guide!!!. Signed up for a 1.5 day tour with pickup at cruise port (full day tour) & drop off @ airport after a half day tour - Ephesus Shuttle (Curio Travel). Suzan, who responded quickly with options & changes. The airline issued that we needed to be at the airport 3.5 hrs instead of the usual 2 hrs.. So I wanted to make sure that I can fit everything. Airline was correct, check-in/security at the airport took forever! plus my baggage ended up not leaving the airport until the next flight out! (that's another story)My party of 6, we alway start out early -- try to miss the other large tours & hopefully beat the crowds. Seda Cengiz, our tour guide was there to meet us & off we went. She spoke fluent English & full of information. She led us to all the perfect spots for photos & got us to must see areas before the huge crowds came along. Everything was timed perfectly. We had a full schedule where we saw about everything we should (all the major highlights- Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrom, Spice Market, Grand Bazaar, Underground Cistern, etc). All planned accordingly to miss waiting on long lines, etc. Of course you can save a lot more if you did this on your own (everything is walking distance) but I don't recommend it. With the guide, you know where you're going & what's the must see places. We also had limited time here We also wanted to pick up certain items & she made sure we got what we wanted -- recommended stores. I love talking with her. Seda Cengiz-She's like my best friend!!! wished I had more time in Istanbul.Thanks so much Seda!!!

Tour with Curio travel. We booked a one day tour with Curio travel for Istanbul. Our guide was Seda Cengiz and she was excellent. She was very fluent in English and very knowledgable of the sites around Istanbul. We felt like we had made a friend in Istanbul by the time we were done with the tour. She met us at the dock and made us feel comfortable and secure immediately. We saw all the mandatory sites and for lunch she showed us to a delightful cafe where I experience my first cup of Turkish coffee and wifi. Then on the way back to the boat she showed up the most beautiful small mosque that was much more beautiful than the better known blue mosque. Seda was a gem. My wife thought she was one of the best guides we have ever had in all of our travels.

Istanbul Splendor. Istanbul is one of the world's most beautiful and unique cities, and our guide, Gulay, made our full-day tour just perfect. Gulay was very knowledgeable and always extremely courteous. She was also very flexible with our group of four and adapted to our needs/wants. This included spending some extra time in the Grand Bazaar where she even helped us to negotiate with the local vendors. Would highly recommend this tour. Also not, Istanbul is the type of city that "doing it on your own" is not easy.

Our tour and guide were AMAZING!. Booked this private tour for our 1-day cruise visit and it was a very full plate. Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome and the Grand Bazaar. Our guide Gulay was a gem and she worked us through the city like pros. She offered to shuffle the agenda around to try and increase our odds of getting into everything by avoiding the main groups and it worked out perfectly. Even with the full agenda, we were able to have a little free time to shop the Bazaar as well as share a nice local lunch. As the day was wrapping up, it became clear that traffic was going to be an issue getting back to the ship in time. Gulay changed the plan the use the metro, which bypassed the whole mess and had us there with plenty of time to spare. Other tours were not so well taken care of and the ship was delayed leaving. Her enthusiasm for the city and showing it's treasures off to us was infectious and made a great visit that much more enjoyable. This was the first of 2 tours I had booked through Ephesus Shuttle (Curio Travel) and I could not have been more pleased with either of them. All of the positive reviews were well supported and I would not hesitate for one second to book with them again. Thank you!

Can't be beat - Excellent. My wife and I arranged the Istanbul tour (for a two day cruise ship stop - Norwegian Jade) with Suzan by email. She helped us arrange a combination for Ephesus and Istanbul customized for each location with a wheelchair to assist my wife who has difficulty walking long distances and dealing with long lines, etc.The tour in Istanbul was great and the guide "Mustafa Duru" and our driver were great. We also stopped for lunch at a place near the Hippodrome recommended by Mustafa and really enjoyed it too. We even managed to "short cut" the lines and get good handicap access with Mustafa's knowledge and contacts. It really helped a lot. NO COMPLAINTS and MANY COMPLIMENTS.....We've done many tours around the world and this company rates with the best of them.

A Very Unique Travel Agency We Enjoyed.. We booked with Curio Travel in Kusadasi. Their guides were proficient in their knowledge of history. And they all speak what I consider are the major languages of the tourists. I heard Chinese, Japanese, Russian, English, Spanish and French from their guides. Pretty nice company. We enjoyed their private vehicles to visit the sites.

Ask for Gizem. I will only echo the positive reviews and add our guide's name. We sailed Norwegian Jade and Gizem gave us a 1 1/2 day tour of Istanbul. She is young, full of life and very knowledgable on the area. I am handicapped and she made every allowance for me to get as close to each famous place as possible, to cause me to have less walking time. Very nice. She also took us to a FABULOUS restaurant for a lunch of local fare (grilled lamb, veggies, and the BEST hummus I've EVER eaten, as well as the puffy pita bread). To end the 2nd day, she not only took us to 'a' baklava restaurant, but 'THE' baklava restaurant, where we savored this mouthwatering dish, with a fine cup of tea. All in all, we would use this company and this tour guide again in a heartbeat!

EXCELLENT!!. We did the Curio Travel (Ephesus Shuttle) Tram tour of Istanbul. Our goal was to see the Topaki Palace and Harem, Blue Mosque, Underground Cistern, Hagia Sophia and see some of the Grand Bazaar besides taking a Bosphorus Cruise all in one day. Mission accomplished along with walking into the Spice Market and buying some beautiful Turkish pottery. Since we were with a guide, we walked right into the Underground Cistern (skipped the line), don't miss the Cistern, it's beautiful. We were also able to skip some of the line into the Blue Mosque. Our tour guide, "July" was excellent. She found us a wonderful restaurant for lunch and made sure we saw everything. At the end of the tour, we were hugging and saying goodby to a friend.She was excellent! This tour was the highlight of our 14 day trip.

Ephesus Shuttle Does it Again. We used this company last year based on a friend's recommendation, and it was great then. We went back to Istanbul and used Ephesus Shuttle again. In one word: fabulous. They tailored our tour based on what we had previously seen. Our tour guide, Hulya was a joy to spend the day with. She without a doubt knows the history of her nation and was able to answer all of our questions. And not to fear, each time we were returned to our ship in plenty of time. These tours made it even more of our hope that we can return some day. Very affordable and well below cruise ship prices. And it was just our guide and my wife and I. We will not look elsewhere to tour Istanbul. Great job!

Ephesus In 1 Day Shore Excursion. Our ship was late for its scheduled arrival in Kusadasi, so we were concerned that our guide might not be waiting for us or that we might not have sufficient time to see all of the highlights of our tour itinerary. Needless to say, we worried for nothing. As we arrived, Ayse, our tour guide, greeted us very warmly with a big, reassuring smile. Ayse communicated very well in English and was very knowledgeable concerning everything we did and everything we saw. She answered all of our questions and made certain that we understood everything that she was telling us. We never felt rushed and Ayse never showed any sign of impatience, even though I stopped frequently to take a million pictures. Ayse was charming and composed throughout the tour, and we felt as if we were being guided on our tour by a friend or relative rather than by someone we just met. We could not imagine a more perfect tour guide than Ayse nor a better tour experience than the one we had in Ephesus. We saw everything we wanted to see at a relaxed pace and still made it back to our ship with a safe margin of time before departure. Before we left the United States, our friends who had been to Turkey before told us that there was no possible way that we would go on a tour in Turkey without being taken to a rug weaving demonstration, a leather shop, or some other type of merchant selling opportunity. We told them that we had arranged with Curio Travel not to have any such stops on our tour. Admittedly, Ayse gave us a chance to see the rug weaving if we wanted, but there was no high pressure, and we chose not to go. The fact that we saw and did more on a private tour for 2 for far less money than we would have spent on a cruise shore excursion with at least 40 other people was absolutely amazing to us. Why anyone on a cruise ship would choose to go on a large group tour for much more money rather than a private tour from Curio Travel is incomprehensible to us.

The best way to see Istanbul!. We booked Ephesus Shuttle for our Ephesus tour and then asked if they did tours in Istanbul. They do both as Curio Travel for Istanbul. We were very pleased that we booked both tours.It was a pleasure having a private guide plus a driver. We did a day and a half tour in Instanbul. They were able to fit in every site we requested. We found Istanbul to be a fascinating city. Our guide explained many things to us plus allowed us some free time to explore the various sites. We were able to bypass many lines and see much more then if we had been on a bus excursion. Their prices were reasonable, the guides very knowledgeable, the vans extremely comfortable! We would definitely use this company again.

Istanbul in 1 day. We arrived in Istanbul as one of our cruise destinations in September 2014. We were met at the docks at the allocated time then transferred to a mini bus for an 8 hour tour. Our tour guide was Seda who was a delight to meet , she was very knowledgeable and her English was excellent. We were left with very pleasant memories of Istanbul and if we are ever to return we will have no hesitation in using this firm again.

Curio travel excellent. Sep 2014 as a couple we took an 8 day tour around Turkey with Curio travel, Istanbul, 7 churches, Cappadocia. From the booking to the last drop off at the airport we felt totally cared for at a very competitive rate. Curio travel was very helpful adapting to our requests prior to the trip very efficiently. Our guide in Istanbul, Mustafa Duru was extremely knowledgable, and informative in a very captivating manner, a joy to spend time with in his enthusiasm for the history of the country.The Daphne hotel in Singapore was also very helpful and convenient and had wonderful breakfasts.. We do not hesitate to highly recommend Curio tour company

The only way to see Istanbul. We came in on Celebrity Constellation with an over night Istanbul before departing for our hotel. We arranged a 1.5 day tour with Ephesus Travel a part of Curio travel which included drop off at our hotel on day two.We were met by our guide Kahan at the ship, and the first day did a tour of Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, the Hippodrome and the Grand Bazaar. Kahan went everywhere with us explaining what we were seeing, and providing the history and information that made it all so much more interesting. The second day he picked us up, with our luggage and we had a full day seeing Dolmabahce Palace (an absolute must, especially with a private guide so you don't have to join a large group), the Blue Mosque, underground Cistern and spice Bazaar. At the end we were dropped off at our hotel. Kahan even went in with us to make sure everything was alright before he departed.This was a wonderful way to see Istanbul. The price included entry in to all the attractions, the guide, and a driver for the two days. It was money so well spent. We feel we really got to understand the history of the country, the interesting information about all the sites we saw and had all our questions answered.We recommend this tour, and Kahan to anyone who wants to really begin to get to know Istanbul

Curio Travel's guides made our visit so memorable. In April 2014 my wife and I took a cruise with Holland America that visited Istanbul and then Kusadasi/Ephesus. On a friend's strong recommendation we contacted Serkan Pastutmaz of Curio Travel to quote us for day tours of these two destinations. We received a prompt reply and a most reasonable quote which we accepted. He recommended the itineraries for the two days which, with minor amendment, we accepted. We were met at the ports as arranged. To our delight we were greeted by the most vibrant, warm young ladies. In Istanbul Ms. Melike was our guide. We had the most delightful day. We felt as if we were being escorted by a an old friend. She walked us through the Topkapi Palace, Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, and the markets and she took us to her favourite local restaurant for lunch. Then she helped my wife buy a lovely leather jacket. We wished we could have spent more time in Istanbul with her as our companion guide.Then on arrival in Kusadasi we were similarly met - this time by Ms. Melike. We toured the Ephesus ruins, Artemis Temple, and Sirince Village. This village in the mountains exuded such old warm charm. Melike took us to a restaurant with amazing views and warm hospitality. Sitting with Melike and her driver again felt like luncheoning with old friends. We said a warm farewell and re-boarded our ship.Their Mercedes mini-buses were immaculate and their drivers very pleasant. Both these guides were so impressive with their historical and local knowledge. But their vibrant warmth and personalities made the tours unforgettable.We had the chance to go by the office and meet Serkan who runs this professional and reliable firm.

Private tour of Ephesus. We thoroughly recommend this tour company our guide Selguk and driver Hanefi were excellentSelqguk's explanations and attention to detail were a delight and it wad also very good value for moneyMuch better value than the cruise ships large tours where you have to visit places on route that are of no interest to you This tour did exactly as much or little as was asked for

Ephesus Shuttle/Curio Travel - Great Day in Istanbul. We booked through Ephesus Shuttle who is owned by Curio Travel in Istanbul. We were taking a 12-day Mediterranean cruise on NCL and were using Ephesus Shuttle for a day tour from Kusadasi. They gave a special deal if you booked both so we decided to use them for Istanbul as well. We chose the "Tour 3: Private Ancient Hippodrome - Blue Mosque - Topkapi Palace - Hagai Sophia - Grand Bazaar". It was absolutely wonderful. Ipek was our tour guide. She was a free-lance guide who lived in the area. She waited for us at the port with a sign that was easy to identify. She took us inside all the sites. She was very knowledgeable about the area and gave us both history and current information about Istanbul. She was very bright and had a bubbly personality that made the day very enjoyable. She was very prompt as was the driver. The driver was very safe and knew the area well. The tickets for the sites were pre-paid and were provided by her as we entered the area, so no need to wait in lines. It was a well-paced day. There was no rushing and the wait times at the were reasonable - the time passed quickly conversing with Ipek. I would definitely use them again and would highly recommend them.

Istanbul even better with a great tour guide. We had a overnight off a cruise ship so I wanted to do a shore excursion. Rick Steves says you can do it yourself. Maybe if your young and nothing hurts yet but we had 6 in our family from 21 to 80 years old. I only knew of this tour because I booked an Ephesus Shuttle and they told me they did tours in Istanbul also. So the cruise ship was going to cost 140 per person for a 4 hour tour with 50 other people. For our family of 6 that did not make financial sense. For less money I got a private tour with a fantastic guide named Gulay. She was our teacher for the day and we learned so much about the history of the area and the sights we saw which included the Hippodrome, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar and even where they filmed a James Bond movie back in the day. So we had a private tour guide, customer care and we left that country with a great respect for the culture and people we met. Ask for Gulay she is awesome.Great job this was the best tour ever.

Wonderful Day in Istanbul. My students and I had 24 hours in Istanbul on the way to a school trip in Nepal, and we were fortunate enough to spend the day with Gizem, our guide from Curio Travel. She was absolutely wonderful, extremely knowledgeable (as a history teacher I really appreciated that!), and gave us a fantastic whirlwind tour of this magnificent city. Many thanks for a delightful day!

Fantastic tour and guide... worth every penny!. It's great when you discover a gem of a tour and tour guide. We found Curio Travel through Shorebee.com and were so pleasantly surprised. We arrived to receive a private tour for 2 of us, transport in a luxury van, all of which was very well priced compared to our ship excursions. Our guide's name was Pinar (make sure you ask for her!!!). She was friendly, knowledgeable, and by far one of the best guides we've ever had. Our only regret was buying a rug instead of giving her a tip. Her time and input was more valuable to us than the rug (although a beautiful rug). So if you get her, please think twice about what you spend your money on. Ephesus was also more amazing than Athens!

Great company for booking you Turkey Tour!. Curio travel helped us book an ~ 2 week tour of Turkey (we worked with Nursen). They worked with us so we could see all cities on our list and we even squeezed in a visit to friends in Ankara.We had a great time and all the arrangements you made the trip very enjoyable. Everything went according to itinerary with no issues! I want to especially mention the tour guides (Tayfun in Istanbul, Suat in Cappadocia, and Melih in Ephesus & Pamukkale) who were fantastic.The hotels were also very good, especially the Cave Hotel in Cappadocia.I will definitely recommend to any of my family & friends.

curio tours istanbul and kusadasi. we recently returned from a 21 day mediterranean cruise on the Ruby Princess. Before leaving Australia I booked all our tours. I decided to book with Curio tours as they catered for both Istanbul and Kusadasi. We were picked up promptly at both ports. In Istanbul we had a fantastic tour guide Volkan. We visited most of the major sights and he was extremely knowledgeable about all the sights. We had plenty of time to visit the Grand Bazaar.In Kusadasi we were picked up by Tan and taken to the ancient ruins of Ephesus. He was extremely knowledgeable at this sight. We had plenty of time to walk around. We were taken to a wonderful pottery outlet where we saw how they hand paint the pottery. We then went up to a mountain village for an authentic Turkish lunch. Tan chose for us what he thought we might like and it was all delicious. We went with two other couples. We all had a wonderful time on both days. I can highly recommend Curio Tours for Istanbul and Kusadasi.

If you want to see Turkey at your own pace with a secure and reliable service, this is the company to hire!. I have used Curio's service for two years in a row ( Oct 2013 and Oct 2013) and will use them again when I return to Turkey. The company has their act together, they are serious, prompt, no hidden agendas, discreet, reliable and the best tour guides to fit all needs. I have used other companies but I know I will never go wrong with Curio. I have used their private tour services (tour guide, driver and van), which is the best way to see and know Turkey if you are a first or second time traveler or have language challenges. They will even check you in at the hotels you are staying at and even help you with airport check in at the airport. They are also flexible in the daily itineraries and will accommodate to your needs. In other words, you are not subject to a group itinerary where the group determines your schedule. Also, their staff is soo caring and will go out of their way to make your stay a pleasant and wonderful experience. If something out of their control goes wrong, they will do everything in their power to make it it right. I did the Seven Churches tour with them in Oct 2012 ( 5 days). In Oct 2013 I did Bursa, Çanakkale( Troy), Pergamon,Pamukale, Kusadasi, Bodrum, and Antalya including Aspendos and Perge ( 9 days). I also did Rhodes on my own but Curio arranged the hotel and they stored my other luggage so I didn't have to carry all of the baggage with me to Rhodes. There was storm at Rhodes and we couldn't sail on departure date to Marmaris where Curio was waiting to resume the tour. Curio arranged for an extra night at the hotel without a problem. Everything was to my complete satisfaction. Getting to know the real Turkey, its people, food and customs was a priceless experience. Curio guides did not make me feel a stranger in this country and am encouraged to repeat the experience of knowing more with them. I will do eastern Anatolia with them the next time. Every cent you pay you get your money's worth. You can't go wrong with Curio.

Great for travel in Turkey. We have now used Curio travel twice once in May 2012 and then in October 2013. They provided private tours with a guide and a min van for me and my wife. We toured with them in the Izmir, area including Ephesus, Pamakulle, Aphrodisias, Pergamum and many other places in the same region.Mr Fevzi Turhan, the manager worked with us to design the tour based on our preferences and needs. In May 2012, my wife had some knee problems and they arranged for her to visit all the places in wheel chair with the driver and the guide pushing the wheel chair at places like Ephesus which has ruins and uneven surfaces. Not for a moment did they seem inattentive or tired. On both the trips we had the same guide, a young man named Bunyamin.He is full of energy, knows the places and the history and really enjoys being a guide. For those wishing to have a private personalized tour, I recommend them highly.

Only Average. We toured with Curio Travel in Istanbul (the sister company is Ephesus Tour in Kusadasi, Turkey, through whom we also purchased a tour) in June 2013. We were in Istanbul as part of a Mediterranean cruise that also included the port of Kusadasi/Ephesus. For the money, I don't think our tour was that spectacular. Our guide was knowledgeable and friendly, and the driver very adept at navigating the huge traffic obstacles in Istanbul. The tour guide did not accompany us into many of the sites - he told us about them before we went in and then let us walk through at our own pace, which was nice, but did not help when we had a questions. Our tour was scheduled for 1.5 days; however, we could have completed the tour in a whole day. After taking our tour, I believe there are other options that help tourists better achieve their goals in seeing Istanbul. Most cruise lines offer transportation to the main tourist area of Istanbul for a nominal fee if you feel comfortable traveling it on your own, which did not seem that difficult to do, especially with detailed tour books. For the same price, most cruise ships offer tours that will allow you to see more than we saw through this tour with Curio Travel. Also, be aware, that if you want to see the harem portion of Topkapi Palace, be sure that you ask for it ahead of time. We assumed it would be included in a private tour, but we were wrong. That was disappointing.

Curio Travel Turkey Tour. I recently returned from a terrific ten-day tour of Turkey arranged by Curio Travel, which included hotels, flights, vans, and sights in Istanbul, Cappadocia and the western coast. We were a group of four and our guide, Emre Dasdemir was first-rate. He was knowledgeable, fluent in English, accommodated all our requests and imparted his love of Turkey to us. All we saw of Turkey was beautiful, but my favorite part of the tour was the days we spent visiting the ruins on the coast. Emre's knowledge of the history, culture and architecture of Ephesus, Miletus, Pergamon and Troy made for a fascinating experience. Highly recommended.

Wonderful tour!. We recently used Curio Travel to book a shore excursion in Istanbul. Hussein was our tour guide. We were driven around in a very nice 14 passenger van (and there were only 4 of us!). Even though the traffic in Istanbul is terrible, Hussein made sure that we had a day that was packed full of sights and experiences. We saw the Hagia Sofia, The Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. Hussein has a vast knowledge of all things Turkish and he was amazing at making the many things we saw come to life with history. When it was time for lunch, he gave us several options and styles of food. We chose a place away from the "touristy areas" that made fresh kabobs and served only authentic Turkish food. It was definitely the right choice! There was only one small glitch in the day when we arrived at the Hagia Sofia, Hussein told us we needed to take all of our backpacks, etc with us (on the other 13 tours we had taken during the cruise, we were able to leave our belongings in the vehicle if we wanted to). We later found out this was because we were not being picked up by the same vehicle at the pick-up point. So, my advise is do not bring anything you don't want to carry around with you during some extensive walking times. All in all, it was a wonderful day and I'd highly recommend Curio Travel for private tours in Istanbul!

Easy, good value and informative . For me at least, it's a bit of a no-brainer to do something like this the first time I visit a city. I get to see the highlights, learn a little something and get my bearings.Hard to fault Big Bus Tours in this regard as they did everything I needed them to do for me.Bus was clean and the staff friendly. Particular thanks to Faruk who was very helpful.Cost around 110TL which gave me 24 hrs plus a bonus 24 hrs free. There are two tours..the red stays relatively central but also crosses the Bosphorous into Asia. The blue tour is less frequent (at least in winter) but travels a bit further. The sound quality of the guide through the free headphones was good and informative without being too "heavy." Free WiFi on the bus was handy and relatively quick. Would absolutely recommended this if you're a first time visitor and/or short on time.

Best way to travel around Istanbul. I prefer going around the city in hop on/hop off buses wherever available and i must say that Istanbul Red bus are one of the best in its category.They are in plenty and normally on time. The cheapest way to travel the city and spend time in place of your interest and getting up in the next available bus for the next destination.Multilingual voice recorders for sightseeing and clearly marked route plans. A must try option.
Excellent . Best value for money. I took two days deal. Staff excellent polite. Faruk stood as a very helpful guide. Felt like an old friend.

Nice. The tour is good, around the most important parts of Istanbul and the audioguide is also good in more than five languages. The price was really unfair: we haid to paid around 150 dollars for four people

trip to istanbul. We are verry lucky and happy that we found bigbus and bought a 48 hours tour. It helpedus seein the city and knowing the history of each place in our language. Special thanks to mr.Faruk for help and advices.
Fantastic trip. Trip was very helpful and illustrative, all staff were decent and polite specially Farouk he was very helpful and supported us many times during our trip

Big bus tour. Faruk is the best guy around! He helped us out a lot with the big bus tour :) the tour itself is amazing, great sights, comfortable bus and free wifi. Definitely a must do if you're new to the city and not sure where to start!

Wonderful place, Turkey Pakistan zindabad . I met Faruk Bay, on the big bus it was a wonderful experience. Big bus is really nice specially the trip was fantastic. I wish Turkey all the best and raise high in Muslim umma. Love you Turkey. Maj Retd Aamir Rahman Syed Pakistan.

Great way to see Istanbul. We had 48 hour ticket, courtesy of our children. Liked both routes, commentatory with lots of info about historic sites. Didn't like lack of signage for bus stops as well as lack of timetable. There is lots of traffic in Istanbul and I guess it would be impossible to predict when bus arrive and this is fine with me. Overall I enjoyed it and would do this again as this was a great way of exploring city.
Big bus wonderful. Big bus is the good company and it easy to see the city bayram he reccomend thr good easy way to see the city

Big bus very nice. We buy 48 hours ticket we get free wifi free drink hard rock...nice kind guy n handsome bayram...recemended to everybody enjoy big bus....staff friendly n istanbul awesome n amazing city

Bug bus perfect. Yesterday i been with my friend and i meet a one name from staff big bus ( bayram ) he sell ticket and he a very good and nice guy to help foreigner and he said give a free wifi, free drink hot at hard rock cafe.. Bug bus i recommend everybody..

Wunderfull tour - excellent service. We enjoyed the tour very much. Thanks to the staff - nice people, who gave us good advices. Mr. Rahmi and his team helped us a lot. We appreciated it. It was really a great tour. We saw the whole city and got very good explanations to every monument. Magnifique tour, on a vu toute la ville. Merci et grosse bise à M. Rahmi. Wundrebare Rundfahrt. Man erhält einen perfekten Eindruck von der Stadt. Kompetente Beratung durch die Mitarbeiter. Besonders von Herrn Rahmi waren wir sehr angetan.

Commuting in Instanbul (Big Bus: Rahmi). Excellent way to move around the city...One can Hop-on and Hop-off at any stop, any number of times. The bus frequency is at every half and one hour.....Rahmi, one of the staff of Big Bus is awesome. He gives you all required information.

Perfect Tour - don't miss it. Simply you can't have such a great tour by any other way , combined outdoor bus with carefully selected route and voice guidance program give me a unique experience in Istanbul I like it a lot , thanks to friends crew specially FARUK !

Staff. This is an amazing hop on bus tour of a fascinating city. We got a great deal for two day ticket and may even do it again, its the perfect way to cover so much ground and make sure you don't miss all the treasures of Istanbul. The staff on the buses are really friendly fun guys. Would like to give a shout out to Faruk for being so helpful. Awesome job Big Bus.

great way to see the amazing Istanbul. I took both the red and blue trips in July 2016 and loved it. The trips are an excellent way to overview the city, visit Asia, and plan visits to specific places.The bus is clean, friendly, with great multi-language narratives. The route is well-planned to showcase as many highlights as possible.The staff is friendly, not too pushy, and is of a great help in setting up itinerary and additional trips.Thank you Rahmi for helping us to add a boat tour of Bosporus and for answering our many questions. The tours are money well spent.

A great tour and service - just watch the Taksim scamsters. Overall this is a great way to see Istanbul given the hellish traffic. It stops at or near all the main sites, especially the Red route. The Blur route heads out to Cape Horn and some of the sights around there which are more the entertainment parks.The bus drivers are polite and helpful and it is worth getting a 48 hour extension to spread out your trip, just plan your route or be prepared to take another form of transport to get you back.The only downside was at the stop at Taksim there is a scam where a man (not working for Big Bus) entices you with a book about Istanbul (good for kids) and then asks for 40TL for it or to cover his breakfast. Even if you try and give the book back he demands money. We got scammed out of shock the first day and I let my displeasure be known and he still tried it again the second day which I politely ignored. It is a shame Big Bus allow this to happen on their watch!

A must. The big bus tour in istanbul is a must, it's a summary of the city in 2 simple routes. Both are amazing and cover prime locations in the city with excellent narration of istanbul and it's history. Next time I'm visiting istanbul I'll book it again :)

Kindest bus staff team!. My husband and I left a mobile phone on the bus after our tour & we fly home same evening. Faruk arranged for us to ride last bus to depot. He was assuring and even called depot to make sure we were ok. Suat bus driver took us there and even walked us to bus stop out of his way, spoke with public bus driver and made sure we found our way back to hotel safely. It was clear all they wanted was tourists like us to have a good trip to Turkey and is give a good review for his company so the tourists will come back. They have given us a strong impression of good service, dedication and kindness of Turkish people.

Amazing Tour and Personnel. This is my first time to visit Istanbul and Im so glad that I take the trip by the Big Bus Tour, it takes me all over touristic places in Istanbul. All the personnels are very friendly and give very complete information and assistant. Special mention to Faruk, he is such a nice and funny personnel. He can even speaks and sing my language.

A good way to get your bearings in the city. The big bus offers two routes and either a 24 hour ticket or 48 hour ticket for a little more. You are given ear buds which you can plug in to hear the description of what you are seeing. The buses are double deckers. The easiest place to pick up the bus is near Hagia Sophia. Will take credit cards

A great way to see Istanbul. I loved this tour, both red & blue routes were really informative and entertaining. I loved the music too. We chose to do the tours in the morning as the traffic seems to be heavier of an afternoon. Faruk and the team are very friendly and helpful. We booked an additional guided walking tour including Hagia Sophia & Blue Mosque. Thank you to our guide for a brilliant tour.

Big Bus perfect for tours. Very friendly and very efficient the service and experience is amazing and they make you feel very welcome My family and myself enjoyed every minute of the tour and especially the guide from Bayram who made us feel very welcome and spoke great English.Also there is free WiFi to enjoy on the big Bus...Worth a visit and try the combo tour to include Hagia Sofia, topcapi... Definately recommended and would use again...Love Istanbul and the great people.

Big Bus Tour Istanbul. We went on the big bus of istanbul and met a tour guide named Faruk and he is very kind and helpful ! I would advice anyone who wants to have a good tourism experience of Istanbul to book ASAP a tour bus session (the red one is the best) ! Enjoy!

First big bus tour experience. This was great! We Did not expected to see and learn a lot but this was great experience. On the bus we had free Wi-Fi what was unexpected but great!We were given free headphones so that we could listen to a guide commentary.The staff was kind and polite. Guide was very informed so it was completely right choice to choose this kind of the tour. Thank you!

Big bus tour. Today we went on the big bus of istanbul and met a tour guide named Faruk and he is very kind and helpful and told us about everything in istanbul and he told us alot about the secret places here ! When u come to istanbul look for faruk ! Enjoy!

The customer service is 10/10. Fantastic views of Istanbul city, The staff were really helpful overall amazing experience. Also there was a lovely gentleman called Faruk standing near stop number 1 we had a little issue with our tickets which he was more than happy to sort out for us, Definitely will recommend everyone to hop onto BigBus! :)

History of Architecture . The Sultanahmet is an Architectural masterpiece. Had a wonderful tour round the edifice with Bayram. Istanbul is a rich city in terms of Ancient Historical building sites and monuments.

Great!!. We always do this kind of touristy bus tour in a new city to orientate and see alot in a short time. Of the many such tours I have been on this was one of the very best. This is due in part to the beauty of Istanbul of course but also because the commentary was excellent, buses kept to schedule (for hopping on and off etc), and there was even free Wi-Fi! We took both routes on successive days (which you can do on one ticket). I can't remember the price we paid, only that when buying I thought it was a bit pricey but afterwards thought we actually got great value. The interval music on the recorded soundtrack got a bit much at times but this is a very very minor quibble. If you have a short break or stopover in Istanbul be sure to do this tour.

Excellent way to better know Istanbul. It is the best way to explore Istanbul. The two lines (red and blue) helps you more easily explore the city and tourist attractions. There simultaneous translation in several languages, using headphones. Wi-fi is free on all buses. I recommend buying a ticket for 48 hours.

Big bus Is your best way to see the whole of istanbul . Me and my wife had a great time seeing all the beautiful locations and sights via big bus istanbul we bumped into a guy called bayram speaks perfect English and has top cockney banter and not to forget he has a good birmingham accent tooBut on a serious note if you want to see the whole of istanbul then big bus is the one it stops at various locations where you can jump off and walk around also there is a bus every half hot on all the locations so you can hop back on the bus and go onto another location
Big bus. Bigbus is so nice i like it faruk really helpful and good personThere is nice place in Istanbul. they have hop on hop off .they have 8 language and free WiFi .thank you for everything.

Worth Doing. This is a UK based company. The service by the staff were a HUGE contrast to the usual aggressive ones we came across especially in the shops and bazaars. Rahmi was jovial, humorous, cheerful and gave information happily. Adnan was very clear in telling us what was and was not included in the tour and did his best for us.This is worth doing as it takes you around the area for a very reasonable rate. We would suggest taking the 2 day one as we stopped at the Dolmabahce Palace and that took up almost 3.5 hours due to a 20 min wait (if you wish to visit the harem part of the building too and don't miss the tour that happens right after the tour of the main palace.)There is also quite a bit of traffic along certain stretches of road depending on travel times. So we only had time to get off at one place when we would have liked to stop off at other areas.The tour use to end at 630pm and they have recently cut it down to 5pm (until?) due to the bad traffic conditions. We paid for the bus and added on turkish bath (entry fee only) and entry plus free English tour at the Topkapi Palace. Unfortunately, we missed the Topkapi tour as we were waiting at the wrong spot (at the Palace itself), the correct spot is to wait at the main square in the Ayasophia area. However, Rahmi was quick in arranging a refund for the palace entrance fee for us which amazed us - this is unheard of in Turkey from our experience. Rahmi should open a badly needed company specialising in hospitality and service training for the other vendors in Istanbul.He's one of the handful of people in Turkey that made the travel in Istanbul pleasurable and heartfelt - even if it was only for 15mins of our 12 day, fairly traumatising vacation there.

Big Bus. Visited Isantbul from Pakistan and had an amazing experience implying Big Bus tours Istanbul... They show Istanbul from a whole new perspective and the staff and attendants are really friendly and courteous.. And shoutout to Rahmi, the most friendly persom I met during my stay in Istanbul.. Funny and kind are cracks amazing jokes.. Also to Faruq, courteous and friendly and both of them were really down to earth... Look forward to meeting them again and having another ride in big bus

Amazing!. Farooq and Rahmi are amazing tour guides. Very hospitable and friendly. In fact the entire staff was very nice. Lovely highlight of our Istanbul trip. One of the best cities I've seen and big bus added to the fun. Cheers
Big bus is very nice. Amazing tour. Bayram is a wonderful tour guide. Hope on hope off 24/7 free wifi Amazing experience. Long trip. Staff is friendly. Free headset ans free drink at hard rock cafe
Big bus perfect . Istambul is absolutely safe. We enjoyed our visit here. We took big bus, it showed us all around it is very good. Bayram the supervisor was a good guide and very helpful.

Great . It was a wonderful experience doing a city tour on a Big bus. I also bought lego land and istanbul aquarium tickets from them. Big Bus representatives Junait and Faruk really provided me excellent customer service and sorted out every inquiry of mine. Jazak Allah khairan Junait and Faruk.
Istanbul. I am very happy to have such an experience. The bus company was very efficient especially Mr Bayram he kept me engaged. Also With 24 hours service and best of all wifi service :)

Sightseeing i Istanbul. Rahmi and all HIS companions gave us all the help and information about the tours.the blue tour goes around the city and the red tour takes You in to Asia.you are supplied with earphones and the information is in many Langeues and very interesting,each tour takes about two hours and You can hop on and off as You like.

Great experience. Great trip around Istanbul, all staff very helpful Rahmi especially.Travels 2 routes around the city, both are needed to get a good picture of the history of the city. Free wifi too!

Mr. Mubarak. Very nice experience. It was hugely revealing in knowing the city. The staff are really helpful. Thanks to the exquisitely mannered female staff and supervisor Faruk our problem regarding other bookings were solved. Happy to be here.

Red & Blue routes. Although they are not cheap, these open top buses offer a good way of seeing a lot in a relatively short time. We has a 24 hour tickets and did the routes on consecutive days. The ear-bud commentary in many languages was acceptable although difficulty to hear at times. Worthwhile.

Great Experience!. We booked the 48 hr tour the same day and took the blue tour. The service was great! It was easy to follow and easy to use with the hop on and off. We spoke to Bayram and Rahmi, the two workers, and they helped us a lot. Great experience! I would do it again.

The best useful way to start your trip . Every time you visit any city start you first day with the Big Bus. It is helpful way to plan your trip. The staff where helpful here in Istanbul. We have been helped by Sevilcan she was nice and helpful.

Always a Winner. I like to use Big Bus when I am in new cities, as they generally give you a broad view of the city itself as well as the benefit of stopping at the main attractions.Big Bus in Istanbul was no exception. They have a couple of routes, and we booked a 48 hour pass - which was perfect for our plans. They stop at the main attractions, and if you keen on a relaxing drive between the Asian and European sides, then this was also great - especially if the weather is playing along.I find the staff very helpful and pleasant, and in this case Faruk was the guy we dealt with - very good and helpful.The hop on hop off facility just add to the ease of getting around Istanbul at a fairly reasonable rate.

Red Route of BigBus. Managed to cover almost all the historical sites in Istanbul city area. Wonderful staff, special thanks must be made to the chief officer at Sutanhamet Square, Mr. ISMAIL, Who was very cooperative and extremely helpful. It was a wonderful experience.BigBus is the best and cheapest option to visit almost all the important tourist places in Istanbul city area.Athula Wijayasundara

Istanbul is beautiful. The tour is a great way to get to grips with the city and plan out where to visit during the rest of your stay. The Big Bus tour allows you to get off and back on along the route with frequent buses and friendly drivers looking after you, we felt safe and in control during the whole experience. On our first day in Istanbul we were approached by Bayram outside the Blue mosque. Bayram did a great job explaining the services on offer and made us laugh with his cockney rhyming. We decided not to take the tour straight away, but there was no pushy sales pressure which is why we decided to take the tour the next day. The audio tour is easy to follow in different languages and well timed. You get to see loads of points of interest, both old and new. We got a 24 hour ticket and did both the blue and red routes in one day. I would suggest buying the 48 hour tickets and doing the 2 routes over 2 days, as it's a lot to take in and although the seats are very comfortable I did start to become restless towards the end. We caught up with Bayram as we finished the tour and we were surprised he remembered us given the amount of people in the city during the Eid celebrations. Would not only recommend but would definitely do it again the next time I'm in town

Big Bus Tour extremely perfect!. We booked for a 2 days trip to view all the nice spots here in Stanbul and over all satisfied with the services and the rate so affordable! Thanks to Mr Bayram who I introduced us! Super duper recommended!
Very trustworthy . I lost my phone and Faruk, who works with big bus, found my phone and returned it to us. I would like to thank him for his kindness and politeness.

A nice vacation in Istanbul. We are a family of 5 and we arrived couple of days back and till now I can say that we are having a really nice time in the city. We tried the big bus tour which I've already tried in many cities before and as usual I'm never disappointed. It takes you all over the city where you see many of the landmarks that you would've missed without it. Strangely, We arrived at the time of Bayram (Moslin festival) and met a very friendly and helpful big bus guide called Bayram whom we thank a lot. Advice to everyone to plan for a great vacation in Istanbul. There is something for everyone.

Great way to see city. This is best way to see sights of Istanbul. Very kind & helpful staff who are very knowledgeable. We were assisted by Rahmi and he was really excellent with lots of tips and advise on the routes etc.Thoroughly recommend.

Bus tour. Very kind and helpful crew!I've been in Istanbul last day and met Sevilcan. Very helpful and kind who helped me with free wifi and a good deal for a daily tickets.Very recommended experience!
Amazing trip . The big bus in In Istanbul is very nice, 24/7 ticket, lovely tour guide sevilcan she is very nice girl she help me to much big bus very nice tour

Great and quick way to see the attractions. It was a great to experience the attractions very quickly. Given our short time, we decided to take the tours without getting out in every stop. After that we chose the top attractions that suit us and went there dependently. We had some issues first, because of rush and poor organization from our side, but we got a great assistance from the team supervisor, Faruk. He was a great help along with all the drivers who amazingly kept calling me by name as if they all knew me.
Definitely worth it! . Interesting way to explore the city, and get to learn about the historical aspects surrounding Istanbul. With informative services from tour guides like Mr.Bayram.
It's a must.. Got the 48hr ticket and as expected, a great introduction to the city. Used it second day to hop about a bit.

Great service thanks (Mr BAYRAM) . It was great service Mr. Bayram one of the supervisors was so helpful and provided us all the info we needed we had great experience. Thank you Big Bus & and Bayram for the great tour and service.
Great People!!!. I really like these tours. The drivers and staff are always helpful, especially Bayram. It's a great way to see the city and use as a way to get around!!!

Great Service, I highly recomend. All staff were very helpful especially Mehmet. I think it is the best way to see a city. You get a view that you won't see from ground level. Get an idea of the layout of the city on first trip then use the rest of the time to hop on and off at the locations you want to explore further. Had an added walking tour in our 48 hour ticket and our guide that day was excellent.
Excellent! . Went with my family today and yesterday and had a lovely time. Attendant Bayram helped us out a lot especially..........

Good humanity. I and my friend are touring Turkey, Istambul. We took a tour of Big Bus for two days.First day itself, we hop off on one of the point of blue line. My friend found out that he lost his phone, he recollected that he left it on the sit. When we hop on the next bus and explain the driver what is our problem. Mr. Eral, this is the name of the driver, called to the manager, Mr. Bayram. They connected with the driver of he bus, where we left the phone and when we arrived on the end station they returned phone to us, There is a greatest side of service, hospitality, attention to the tourist. Should tell that all other guys are too very friendly, politely, joyful and sensor. Also this is a good example of humanity. We are greatful to the team of Big Bus tour. Of course we enjoy the tour and Istambul itself. And separate greeting to the tourists, who found the phone and hand over it to the driver. Thanks for all good people. With love from Ukraine,

Well worth it- made our holiday in Istanbul!!!!!!. Our trip would not have been the same if we did not do this hop on hop off bus tour!!! Absolutely awsome - saw things you simply cannot see on foot and got a whole feel of the city!!! Must do!

It was good. Staff Serhat hepled us a lot. It was great, we could even see the night view since we used the last bus. I had used this when I was in England and Portugal too and I also enjoyed the tour. ThankYou
4th June 2016. Amazing views! Friendly staff. FARUK very good! #HopOnHopOffDefinitely a must do!Free wifi that actually works, 24 hours ticket
Must visit. Great way to see European and Asia side of the Istanbul. Stops at Taksim square which is a must visit shopping and dining area. One ticket allows you blue and red route.
Amazing experience!!!. What an incredible way to see all the sights, sounds and thrills of this vibrant city. Great guide Mr. BAYRAM!!!

Best way to go. With only a short stay in Istanbul, the Big Bus Tour was the most effective way to get a good view of the city and the sights. I loved that it also made the crossing over the Bosphorous in Asia. The staff were friendly and so welcoming. I had a great time. I met Rahmi who made me feel quite at home, he was obviously made for this tourism business. Big up to Rahmi. My only concern is that with such heavy traffic the tour takes a while to maneouvre and then with the long time between buses it is kind of a disincentive to actually get off the bus except for the main stops in Taksim Sq and Sultanahmet. The bus was clean and well equipped and I loved that I was able to get my phone plugged in and charged.
Great way to see the city in hot weather!. It was really good to see the city with this bus tour. The red tour covered almost all the main attractions and our tour officer, Mr. Bayram is Awesome!!!

Istanbul tour. Today we really enjoyed our Red Tour around Istanbul. We met the guide Mr. Bayram from Bigbus Tour. Service was awesome. Tomorrow will continue our Blue Tour. We bought the 48 hours ticket.

Great Way to See the City. We find that the bus tours are always well worth doing as a great way to see new cities wherever you are in the world. Everything was in English and we heard all about the history. The guides were lovely and very helpful.
Super cool!!!. Amazing views! Friendly staff. Bayram very good! #HopOnHopOffDefinitely a must do!Free wifi that actually works, 24 hours ticket
Amazing tour. Thank you FARUK for your advice and explanation for the Tour , its realy amazing we cover almost all important places in istanbulThanks

Don't let terrorism win !!!!. Spent 5 days in Istanbul, 1 disabled and require assistant, found the big bus tour with the 2 routes, blue and red, found it the best way to see the wonderful city of Istanbul. Staff especially Bayram were very friendly and helpful, felt extremely safe everywhere we went.
