Would highly recommend a holiday to this wonderful city as the people of the city are hurting with the number of tourists staying away.

Fantastic weekend . The 2 bus tours are excellent to get a feel of this huge city the guide Rahmi was very helpful and informative even with the amount of traffic slowing the bus down this gives you time for photos

Big Bus From Sultan Ahmet. It's a good value for money, friendly and good guiding staff. Specially, Mr. Bayram was very helpful. Enjoyed free cinema, a very good 3D short movie. Hop on and hop off a very good feature but I suggest that few more stops be added.

Amazing istanbul . Amazing country with friendly people. Perfect for family holiday using big bus hop on hop off. Great experience with the hospitality from mr. Bayram. Its an irreplaceable holiday and i recommend everybody.

A great hop on hop off tour. We try to do these tours on arrival to orient ourselves with a city. The Big Bus Tour Istanbul was one of the best. It has 2 routes a red and a blue. The 2 together take about 3 1/2 hours and they are well worth the time. This is our second trip to Istanbul and we saw places we hadn't seen before not to mention seeing things from a different perspective. Our hosts were sensational. Great job!

FABULOUS!! . We did a one day hop on hop off bus tour! Fantastic! We made a mistake and did not take the blue bus( different route) .The company still allowed us to do it!! Thank you!! A special thanks to "Cuneyt"! Just fantastic!! Very professional and helpful!!( not sure how he puts up with the tourists,as some can be difficult!!) I would HIGHLY recommend this tour!! Gives you a really good picture of the city!! JUST DO IT!!!

Amazing Istanbul and must do! . You will get the chance to see all places and landmarks in Istanbul.. It was a lovely sunny day and really enjoyed it! I recommend you do on first days of your trip to mark places you wish to visit later on..

Great help from Sevcan in Istanbul.. Today we had some difficulties with our tickets and Sevcan of Big Bus was of great help in securing our tickets thus making it possible to continue our second day with this company. Great job and thank you.
Istanbul Trip. Had a nice trip with my family roaming around Istanbul with the guide of Bayram (hop-on/hop-off for 100lira) :) free internet & wi-fi . Highly recommended!

Vacation. Been in Istanbul Turkey. Took a big bus for a day. Hop on and off for a day. We took the red route. Had a very amazing day. Had a free internet. The supervisor guide - Bayram, such a friendly and good guy.
Big bus tour, fantastic your!. Nice big bus tour, lovely facilities and lovely staff Bayram, free wifi, two routes, u will see the whole city just by taking this big bus tour:) Highly recommended
Tourism. Highly recomended . .Bayram is excellent. Very helpful. .free internet , hop on hop off, Love istanbul. .

Good experience for Hop On/Hop Off Bus. Except of rainy weather and horrible traffic we got stuck for more then one hour on the Red Route everything was perfect.Friendly and helpful staff - especially Faruk.
Great way to see Istanbul. Make sure to take the red route in the morning to avoid the huge traffic jam going to the Asian side on the afternoon.

Mr. Chen . The BIG BUS in Istanbul is excellent. Friendly service men and women, especially that man called BAYRAM, is so kind! This big bus/hop on hop off give you the wonderful sighting seeing in Istanbul both in Europe and Asia sides. Wifi free!

Staff Helpfulness. On Jun 3rd 2016, I took the Big Bus (Hop On Hop Off) tour of Istanbul. The tour was outstanding, the city is truly a sight to take in and I only wish I'd had more time to explore it.While getting off the bus in a rain shower, I left my phone on board. I returned about 15 minutes later to discover that the Blue Line bus I was on had already departed but the Red Line Bus was there with some Big Bus Istanbul staff on board. I explained that I had forgotten my phone and was quickly reunited with it by Faruk. He was helpful, pleasant and made sure that it was in fact my phone before handing it over and he confirmed it was my phone by making sure I could open the phone.Without the staff's help in locating my phone, I would have lost many pictures of the day's journey but also run into a bunch of complications with travelling.Thanks again Faruk.

Hop On Hop Off Bus Ride. Hop On Hop Off is the best way to see the major attractions in Istanbul in one go specially the red line. The ride over the Bosphorous bridge joining Europe with Asia is the most mesmerising experience of the tour. One can not get the best effect in a car or a taxi. Its best experienced in the Hop On Hop Off ride with beautiful music playing and commentary being done in a clear dialect in flawless English language.Faruk at the starting point at Sultanahmet is one name I must specially mention. My wife and I found him very friendly, energetic, cheerful and helpful. they are lucky to have him on board.Another name who deserves a mention here is Nael at the Taxim square Stop. He helped us in organising our trip to the Ephesus at reasonable rates. I chose his offer after doing detailed market survey from other Tour operators. Iadvise all visitors from India to have faith in these 2 guys.

Love Big Bus Tours. BBT Istanbul have information about the city that I wouldn't know from walking around myself. It covers huge areas, is cheaper than taxis, there are additional savings adding other attractions to a ticket. We saw The Bosphorus by boat had a traditional Turkish Bath and an informative walking tour of the major attractions all at discounted prices. The staff are all welcoming friendly and extremely helpful.... Suat (the Genie with the blue earring) looked after us and I believe genuinely cared for our welfare. Thanks BBT for increasing my love for Turkey even more

Great way to see Istanbul . Great way to see Istanbul above it all. Good driver, on time,enjoyed getting off to tour. Easy, clean, and the recording worked. I got some good shots of the city sitting on top. Stopped at all major sites--did not mess with parking or taxis.
AMAZING TOUR!. We love BigBus Istanbul. Staff is very helpful especially Bayram. Use this to see every attraction in the city.

The best way to see the City!. We are very happy to use BigBus Istanbul. Thankful for Bayram because he is very accommodating and helpful. I recommend everyone to use this when touring in Istanbul. With free wifi on board.

Well worth it. I have always enjoyed a big bus tour, and have used them in London, Rome, Monaco, and now Istanbul. The trip was good, and there was a choice of routes, selected stopping spots were good, and the audio guide well presented. I would recommend a trip on the big bus in Istanbul.
Nice way to start your visit. Nice way to start your visit to istanbul , it gives you a review about the places & where to go next , & how much time you need to spend every where...

Great way to see Istanbul!. Booked a 48 hr pass and used this the first two days I was in Istanbul. A great way to familiarise yourself with the city and to see where everything is. The guides when we got to Sultanahmet Square gave loads of great information and were quick with issuing us our actual tickets to get on and off the bus tour. Big shout out to Ismaiz and Adnan for all their help!
Fantastic first impression of Istanbul . Best way to discover lots of history without getting tired of walking.Thanks Faruk for all your help and tips!Marion and Deon from South Africa

Getting an overview. New to Istanbul, and potentially confused (two continents, three stretches of water; three land masses), Big Bus provided an opportunity to get an overview of this intriguing city. Thanks to Bayram and his colleagues for making the process easy and stress-free.

The Big Bus Tour. I went for the big bus tour in Istanbul. We were taken on a tour of the eastern side and European side of the city and the views of the places on the bus on the suspension bridge was fabulous. I would strongly recommend this and also comment that Bayram our guide was very friendly.
Bigbus very nice!!!. I've been on the trip, and it's super nice!! You get to visit two continents at once. Also met this cool guy Bayram!! Free internet, not expensive. I recommend!

Big Bus. We bought two days on the big bus - for a few extra lira you get a 48 hour pass. We paid for it as we had visited the Spice Market early in the morning - go here early! We took the Tram and when we went to go back to Sultenmart there was the Big Bus! It was the line we had gone on the day before - the Spice Market I'd the last stop on the Blue Bus - the buses stop at many good places - the day we went on the Blue Bus we got a shocking driver who was really rough on the brake and excelerator - who did not stop at a couple of stops and then went off the route -! To avoid traffic we think - - it was a good way to get to The Dolmanche Palace and it was really good going across the Bosphorous Bridge - another "must do" in Istanbul. The blue bus stops at the outdoor museum which if you are into cars and trains and transport stuff is a must do.
Great experience . Really enjoyed the trip and it was a great experience with an amazing team and management Special thanks for Mr. Faruk for his assistant Best regardsFatma dubai
Best tour of the istanbul . Great experience & very helpful staff with information about tours & sites Thanks to Mr.Faruk & Mr. Adnan

Nice staff, good quality, great city!. One Day Tour might be enough, although the second day is pretty cheap. Walking tour was nice and relaxed. Not too many people in the group. Specials thanks to Cuneyt!

Definitely worth the money. The Hop On Hop Off bus, like in most cities, serves a tourist market that wants transport round to the major tourist sites with commentary on what you are seeing. My wife and I fit into this market and found the HOHO buses excellent value. The Istanbul Big Bus Tour is no exception.What we tend to do is do a complete circuit of the routes offered. This allows us to listen to the history of the city and sites without the distraction‎ of hopping on and off. We then go round hopping on and off as we visit the sites we are interested in.These worked perfectly well for Istanbul - we got a history of the city plus transport to the tourist sites we wanted to visit.However, if all you are after is simply transport from one site to another, you will be better of using public transport. Public transport in Istanbul, namely the trams, will be significantly cheaper.‎ Likewise, if you want a real personal guide to interact with, the HOHO buses aren't for you - you'd be better of hiring a guide for the day but will be more expensive.

Great tour - thanks Mazllim. Really enjoyed the tour- Mazllim( hope I've spelt his name correctly) carefully explained the set up of the tour- he was very friendly and helpful. He even gave me the correct money to use the public toilet near the bus terminal- I was very grateful - what a kind gesture!Interesting and informative tour - a really good way to get your bearings in any city . Istanbul is a beautiful and fascinating city- so much to see !
Big Bus Istanbul. Serhat, Faruk and Ismail is a very helpful and friendly staff.. we enjoy the trip and wonderful free wifi in the bus.. places was interesting and great!!

Great experience and friendly service. Great way to see the city on a short visit. Guides were very friendly, especially Cunege who told us that a 7d cinema experience was included in our ticket and took us from the bus to the cinema! Definitely recommend using big bus when in istanbul.

FANTASTIC FARUK AT THE BIG BUS TOUR ISTANBUL !!!. Simply loved our 2 day tours on the big bus. Faruk was so wonderful and was eager to please and helpful in every possible way - giving us directions, which stop to get off for what? - he treated us as part of the family !!!! we were 3 senior citizens and used this bus tour as transportation to get to places to see. At the Taksim square, there was another guy who took the time to explain and guide us as to how to use the "TRAM" system. We would highly recommend the Big Bus tours to everyone. We travel a lot and usually use this tour in every new city we go to - very beneficial !!!! Thank you big bus !!!

Start Early. There are so many things to see on these 2 routes red and blue. For 100 Lira you may as well get the most of it. I picked it up at Taksim Square and headed straight for the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the Sultans Palace. The supplied headphones and narration over the bus sound system was great. An early start is necessary to get your moneys worth. The drivers are very flexible with drop off if you need to stray off the beaten track.

Good way to see the city. For my first time in Istanbul this was a good way to get my bearings. There are 2 lines - red and blue and both are worth doing. The only issue is the Istanbul traffic which can't be helped. But it does mean even though the buses leave their start points on time, if you are catching a bus later down the line you might be waiting nearly an hour rather than 30 mins in busy times. The WiFi works great and the info on the speakers is quite interesting. The best part of the red tour is the northern bit that goes upto the new bridge. If you do this at sunset the views across the Bosphorous are amazing. Quite good value if you buy tickets online rather than on the bus, but more expensive than other Big Bus tours they have in other cities and also doesn't include an option for a boat ride like the company usually does in other cities. At Blue Mosque, Faruk was on hand each weekend to help and give travel advice, and supervisor Bayram was good at local sight seeing advice also.

Big bus service . Big bus istanbul is an excellent service .We enjoyed our whole day trip which includes red bus and blue bus .The staff was friendly and helpful especially the staff member faruk was a real good person /guide .
Very nice idea to explore Istanbul . I booked the BigBus tour very nice to go around. People are helping. Bayram is very friendly. Tour guide was very helping!

Amazing trip & experience *****. Great service, great way of getting around all the important historical attractions! Hop on and hop off perfect for tourists who need to get around and explore! A big thank you to Bayram, a great asset to the company. Very friendly and knowledgeable!
City Tour. Sehr schöne sehenswerte Tour durch Istanbul! Sehr nette guides. Bayram and Adnan were incredible!! Thanks for everything

Hello. It was great over here...!!Had a great time in this tour..!!Especially mr suat helped us a lot..!!He is very kind and a good person helped us for two days it was superb time with the big bus and him...!!He is the bestForget the rest...@mr suat

Istanbul Big Bus Tour a Disappointment. High Price. Low Value. They charge exorbitantly high for Istanbul standards. 100 Turkish Liras or 33 Euros per person, for which we could have taken private taxis to the areas of interest.We had a very good team which offered and helped us during the pre-boarding. Cunaide was very helpful. However we do not recommend this to general tourists. If you have a few days to spend in Istanbul, just take the cabs or the trams and you will be very much at ease and save a lot of Euros. Secondly the place near Hard Rock Cafe, was away from the main area and we waited for over 45 mins to get the bus. Very sorry for having chosen the Big Bus. We just used two hops and then gave up, and went on our own by tram, which is cheap at 4 Liras and takes you around half of Istanbul.

Big Bus Istanbul. I just returned from an amazing trip to Istanbul, a country that is suffering with the lack of tourism because of the incident that happened earlier this year. I found the people, and the country to be very safe. I took a tour of the city on the Big Bus the tour manager Mr. Bayram was extremely informative, polite and helpful and made us feel at home. I wish that more people would visit this lovely city and not be afraid. Istanbul is a safe country. I will be going back because 4 days was not enough to enjoy such great hospitality. Thanks Istanbul for 4 great days.

Killing time. This is my second time using Big Bus Tours. First was in Miami, good news is I got the same impression taking it. Thank you for the hospitality from every agent.. they're so friendly, informative & helpful.. especially Adnan (nice meeting you anyway)! It's a perfect option to take a short trip around the city with many interesting stops!

Great tour . Blue route is great for old istanbul views and building that took played a great role in the development of isntanbul from the far north west where the golden horn begins to the east to tokapi palace- the red route is great for views of Bosporus and the famous buildings that formed istanbul both in the new age and the old, from the Bankalar Caddesi where the Ottoman Empire began its financial district to the new commissions office who looks after the wealth and income of Istanbul's businesses and many companies. Great overall experience for any tourist or local person as this tour gives an insight in many historic and new buildings, great views and places of interest.Faruk was a great tour leader and a great leader overall with local knowledge of istanbul :)
A faire . Very Nice Tours!! Beautiful Time in the bus very friendly and profesionnal!!!Thanks Bayram is best guide thbest guide

Not totally satisfied with Big Bus Tours Bosphorus boat tour. I'm a fan of hop on/hop off bus tours, and the Big Bus Blue and Red routes are well worth doing. You'll no doubt see more of Istanbul than you otherwise would, and if you tend to walk everywhere when sightseeing then the bus tours can be a restful break. What I didn't care for was the way in which our package was sold to us. I felt the Bosphorus boat excursion was misrepresented. We were led to believe that after meeting at Sultanahmet Square we would board one of the Big Bus busses to the area by Galata Bridge to catch one of the many Bosphorus Straight cruises. The Red and Blue lines go right past this spot and have it both marked on the map and announced as a hop-off point for catching a cruise. What actually occurred is that guide walked us in a group to a small pier on the Golden Horn where we boarded our boat. At the end of the tour everyone went their own ways with most trudging back up the hill to Sultanahmet Square. At the very least the trip could have been timed to return when a Big Bus would be passing by, if not a bus dedicated to return passengers to the starting point. Not a huge deal for us, but I am not sure those much older we are, or who have difficulty walking, or those with younger children would be able to manage. I felt the whole thing was a bit deceptive, more cumbersome than it should have been, and I would suggest trying a different company for a Bosphorus cruise.

Great ride! Bayram is the best!. We did this tour on our first day at Istanbul. We were here on our honeymoon and Bayran treated us to a special gift. He was amazing and really friendly. I highly recommend the tour both red and blue. It shows you the amazing city of Istanbul and gives you a good idea of the places you would want to go to. Definitely a must try!

Worthwhile if you want to see all of the city. It's true that in a few areas the traffic is in near stand still e.g. near Taksim Square, getting into Sultanahmet. But, overall well worthwhile it, because one can see all of the city without having to walk those very very steep streets! I took both lines - red and blue. Obviously the red line has the most tourist attractions, but I thought the blue line was also good because I probably wouldn't have ever gone that direction whereas the red I would have regardless of getting Big Bus or not. And I'd recommend going early in the day. (Evening rush hour in Istanbul is the worst.) The audio function can be temperamental, so I'd recommend swapping seats even if you get looks from other tourists. Oh, and when I went in Sept '15, it wasn't 24hr service as billed. From memory, the last "day" tour ends around 7pm, and thereafter one has to pay for a separate "night" tour. Which was really annoying as it says 24hrs on the ticket!

A poor service. We usually find the hop-on, hop-off type buses very good, enabling us to see quite a lot relatively quickly and more easily and more cheaply than by other methods. However the Big Bus Tours of Istanbul left an awful lot to be desired. They were very disorganised and the commentary was uninformative. When we paid, we were told that we had to do the transaction in front of the bus in the street as they were taking photographs of us paying, and that if we refused to do it in the middle of the road, the driver would be in trouble. The Big Bus guy in Taksim Square also said that we had to get on and off the bus where there was a 3 foot drop from the bus to ground. Actually, all a real disappointment.

Him and his friend, Beyram were very friendly & helpful through out it. All and all, very2 good..keep it up..

Good bus tour, only buy tickets from the official staff. All round fairly good bus tour. One important point though:In previous cities we always bought our tickets from staff in 'Big Bus' shirts/uniform. On this occasion we were waiting to get on the bus at one of the smaller stops for the first time. This rather dirty looking guy in scruffy clothes kept pestering us, trying to sell us tickets from his little tourist shed nearby. We eventually decided to get on the bus and pay at the main stop (Sultnahmet Square). However when getting on the bus another guy, who was wearing a shirt, claimed to work for the Big Bus company although he had no logo/uniform. He told us we should get off again and buy the tickets from the original scruffy guy even though the driver didn't seem to mind and had already told us to take a seat. We got off, bought the tickets, but the bus left before we could get back on it, even though this other guy in the shirt said it would not. All very frustrating and not the best way to start the day.The tickets seemed to be genuine enough, and were accepted, however on arriving at Sultanhamet (Stop 1) there were signs saying ONLY buy tickets from uniformed staff. Long story short - stick to your guns and don't be swayed by unofficial salesman. You can catch the bus from anywhere and ride it to the main stop to pay!

Good for Getting Lay of the Land - Beware of Rush Hour. Review: Glad to have done it; great to get a sweep of the wider Istanbul areas, to see different areas, cross the bridges and learn some historical points. I made the mistake though of taking the Red Route (below) at 4:30 p.m. around rush hour. So, as we headed through the 'new' side of Istanbul toward and over the Bosphorus bridge - we joined the thousands and thousands of cars doing the same. I have now memorised the music they play between stops on the bus - as it seemed we were mostly between stops once in that part of the city. But, at other times of day, it is brilliant and is great for getting to key points of interest over the 48 hours usage period you get per ticket. Background: The Big Bus Tour is a hop on and off tour option with two routes; both have some Old City exposure but one (red route) focuses on the 'newer' side of Istanbul (still the European side) over the Galata Bridge (it also crosses over the Bosphorus Bridge to the Asian side and loops right back without stopping) and the other route (blue route) does a loop up along the Golden Horn water way. It is 100L (30-33 Euro) for essentially 48 hours unlimited hopping on and off. They give out earplugs that you keep and then use each time you hop on the bus; with audio descriptions in multiple languages of places you see along the route.

Not easy to use. It is billed as 'Hop on Hop off', but hopping on is not easy as the bus stops are not marked. You are given a small scale map marked with numbers to show stops, but in the absence of street signs it is difficult to hop on

Worth the Ride . My daughter, son in law and I visited Istanbul in March of 2016. We totally enjoyed the Tour with this service. Friendly and hospitable . First time in Istanbul great way to see the city Faruk was very informative . Only downside is the last bus is at 18:00, for a large tourist city they should run longer.

Great way to see the city! Great company!. I booked the big bus tour to see the city and decide what I wanted to do. After doing the red line, I hoped onto the blue line route. I decided to stop at one of the bazaars, and about two minutes after Igor off, I realized that I had left my camera on the bus. I waited for the next coach to pull up and asked the driver to call and let the company know about it. By the time he got through, they already had found it and we're holding it for me. Faruk met me and handed my camera back to me. What excellent service! Honest and all around awesome! I have used this company in Budapest, London, San Francisco and New York, but the Istanbul operators are the best (thanks again Faruk!).

Thank you Big Red Bus!!. We spent 2 days travelling with the Big Red Bus company in Istanbul covering 2 routes. It was the best value we had in the city!! They covered all the major sights and more!! great tour. Big Bus Istanbul is a great way to get a wonderful overview of the city of Istanbul. BigBus Istanbul. What a great City with a great Company BigBus, very friendly staff specially Mr. Faruk who is very accommodating & very professional..

Istanbul Big Bus. It was our first visit to Istanbul. We heard so much and wanted to see Istanbul as much as possible. Walking was the best way but after a few hours we were exhausted and thus decided to take the Big Bus tour following the Red Route. And boy are we glad we decided to do it as the ride was very enjoyable inspite the traffic at some locations. The bus took us to nearly all of Istanbul highlights. Even though we did not manage to hop off at all the places but at least it introduces us to their locations and thus enable us to make better plans for our own tour on the following days. One thing that stands out was how friendly and helpful the staffs were. One person worth mentioning is Faruk. I think he is the supevisor at the Sultanahmet Stop. After many unpleasent experiences as tourist in many other places we were pleasantly suprised that the staff of Big Bus Istanbul, especially Faruk genuinely wants to help and sincerely care that we have the best deal and experience. For all future visitors to Istanbul, this hop-on hop-off bus service is a near must. And look out for Faruk at Sultanahmet Square. He is always there with a big smile and a warm heart always ready to help. A shining example of what Istanbul has to offer.

Big Bus Tour Istanbul. This awesome staff name FARUK is the best ever guys i meet in Istanbul.. Guys go and search for him he will make you laugh until you die.. I rate this Big Bus service 6 stars.. Will come here again and do some lots of fun here.. Awesome!!!
Nice views. Great views especially from the bridge connecting Europe and Asia and guide Faruk was very friendly and funny! "Welcome to Miami!".
The only way to see Istanbul. I never tire jumping on & off the bus' along their routes. A very convenient and safe way to see all the sites in Istanbul.

2 hrs in a traffic jam!. Well if your idea of sightseeing is to sit in a traffic jam for two hours with dodgy headphones blasting out ear splitting music this should suit you fine!Istanbul is a fabulous place but this is not the way to see it; boat or tram is a much better option.Don't bother!

Big Bus Tours of Istanbul. There are two routes through the city of Istanbul, one which takes you across the bridge to Asia. Both cover the city well, and were very good. They pass everything important in the guide books, plus lots more.

Oh how we enjoyed the Big Bus!. The travel agencies will hate my review but the best way to experience Istanbul is by taking the Big Bus. They bring you where ever you want to go. You can take the blue and the red route and hop on or off all the places you want to see or be. The BB-team is so nice and helpfull and they speak gooed English which helpes a lot!

Great value for money. We recently visitied istanbul and decided to take the hop on hop off big bus tour from sultanahmet square. It was 100 turkish lira per person and ticket was valid for 48 hours. They offer 2 routes a red route lasting 2 1/2 hours and a blue route lasting 1 1/2 hour and your ticket covers both. Both tours were very interesting and the running commentary which is in 8 different languages offers plenty of useful information. If visiting istanbul then i would highly recommend taking this tour

Fun Istanbul on a Big Bus. Big Bus Istanbul is awesome! The service is impeccable, the tour super convenient and it made me enjoy sights of every day life in the city that I would have otherwise missed. My chosen tour was the red one, which I believe is the best for getting the big picture.They also propose another route, the blue one. Both leave and finish in Sultanahment.On the red line, I chose to hop off in Takism, grabbing the possibility to walk down that popular part of the city during the afternoon. Besides, apart for having a second day free (to take the same or a different ride), they offer so many extras. It was the way to go. What else did I get with my tickets? All buses have WiFi available, you can get a free drink at the Hard Rock Cafe and their free phone app proved very useful. The tickets can be sent directly to your Smartphone, and the maps are very detailed. From the open-top bus I was even able to take pictures while crossing the Bosphorus, pictures otherwise difficult to get.

Great experience, even greater team. The team members are so kind and helpful. Tours are very well organized and always on time. They helped us retrieve stuff we forgot on the bus. Faruk was very kind and helpful. Ata was very prompt at responding to our email and helped us recover our lost belonging. Cheerful team I can say. The tours are well designed. You can see and visit most of the touristic sites on the diverse stops then hop on another bus and see more of this beautiful and rich city. Thank you for making our visit to Istanbul a memorable one Big Bus Tour team!
Great way to see Istanbul. Big Bus Tours has 2 routes which is a great way to see and experience Istanbul. And the ticket is valid for 48 hours!

Exciting City Tour on an Open Top Bus. This tour is simply amazing. You can pick two routes: the Red route which going pass the City in the European side of Turkey, and the Blue route which going pass the rural area of Istanbul. Both routes are equally interesting. You can see many sides of Turkey with those tours. While the bus is on its way, you can listen to the explanations (in 8 languages, including English) by a headset the priovide. They visit Turkish famous infrastructure like goldenhorn bridge, the spice bazaar, Taksim Square, they even recommend a famous pastry shop near the Sirkeci area. If you want to know more about Istanbul, or if you want to go somewhere to Istanbul but you have no idea, this tour is highly recommended. Also, you can hop in and hop off the bus as you want for you two days, for both routes ! So, you can get down on a stop, and catch the next Big Bus Tour for an hour (red route) or half (blue route). Really practical ! Oh, and they also have friendly-English Speaking crew, mine was Faruk whom I met onFebruary 16th. Really friendly and funny. He sings in Indonesian for our group !
great experience. we spent 1 day in istanbul with big bus tours and the experience was superb!good stops, staff were helpful and friendly. we'll surely be recommending it.

Big bus tour istabul. I am on a family holiday to Istanbul. I have taken the advice of the Big Bus tour sales advisor @Faruk" who was extremely professional and really helpful. I managed to purchase a daily hop on & off ticket and we all had a brilliant time taking in the breathtaking views from the top deck of the sightseeing bus and then taking short shipping breaks in the beautiful markets and also taking advantage of praying at the splendid Mosques. It was the most easiest and cost effective way of travelling around Istanbul. A Best Buy tai key for everyone. So see Faruk and take use of this 5* star service.

Excellent trip. This is an outstanding bus tour service which takes you around Istanbul and the staff are really kind and I hope to use this service in other countries. The Bus trip advisor Faruk was also outstanding, professional and very helpful. I would advise any person visiting Istanbul to make use of the hop on hop off service to see and explore Istanbul in at your convenience. It was a pleasure travelling on the bus taking in the views of the exciting and beautiful places in Istanbul.

Istanbul in 3 days. A splendid way to see Istanbul and amazing service by the staff. I am glad we bumped into Mr Farouk who was really friendly. His grasp of Bahasa Malaysia came as a surprise. Well done. He also told us abt the free coffee in Hard Rock. If he hadn't we would have missed exploring that part of the city. BBT Istanbul needs more staff like him.
Services. Best services and respect for Mr faruk he's friendly person and he's can speak bahasa and enjoy talking whit him

Start of 2016. Amazing way to explore Istanbul, Turkey. I would definitely recommend everyone to travel on the Big Bus Tour to get an inside history of Istanbul, Turkey. Great price for what is offered.

Great tour and people. I want to spend few words to mention the people of Big Bus Tours in Istanbul, always very nice and friendly. In particular, I want to mention Mr. Faruk who helped us in many ways. If you are going to Istanbul, I suggest to take this bus to see the city and enjoy the kindness of the people.

Great way to see this incredible city. We did this on our return to Istanbul after touring Turkey. A fabulous way to see this incredible city and all its highlights. Our drivers had an amazing understanding of the city .. We were able to see areas we hadn't seen on our first visit to Istanbul. We had to wait some time for a bus at one of our stops but no point being grumbly, it gave us the opportunity to slow down, people watch and take in the hustle and bustle of the city. I would highly recommend doing this bus tour.

Amazing experience. Just went for a short break to Istanbul a couple days ago, took this big bus tour since they offered a good locations to hop on and off from the bus. It was an excellent choice coz they had two different route and both are amazing and special thanks to Faruk that was really helpfull and offered an example of how hospitality was.

King faroukh and the fantastic big bus crew. If you are sightseeing and around Sultanahmet, go see Faroukh and the big bus crew. Warm, friendly, hospitable with fantastic drivers! You will see the best of Istanbul and enjoy the journey.

Good and High recommend for Big Bus Istanbul service. was enjoyed our tour during my short vacation in istanbul, Big bus Tour is one of my choice to take us around istanbul. Excellent and service welcome from Mr. Faruk Akturk as big bus employee there, the way his explain before we ride there . and I'm really appreciate for all the staff. Mr ferric and Adnan See you again

So nice way to explor istanbul. We are inside the bus now for second day .. it is wonderful bus to take you around istanbul .. nice staff and big thanks for Mr. Faruk who is a decent man treat us and my kids by frindly way and helped us during the two days before we ride into the bus .. thanks again for him and the big bus istanbul ... see you again :)
Istanbul . We enjoyed our tour with mr faruk he was same our brother we go 48 hour tour we like istanbul me and my family
Great Staff specially Mr Farok & right way to see all sights. Big Bus trip is the best way to see all locations of Istanbul and we can use this bus stop to stop for 2 days

Big Red Bus tour of Istanbul is a great way to see al the sights of Istanbul and is not expensive.. If you are only in Istanbul for one day, as i was then this tour is, in my opinion, the best way to see the sights of Istanbul. being such a large city, the main sights are spread out. This tour enables you to see them all and then decide which stop you want to get off and explore. We saw the Dolmabahce Palace, Hagia Sophia, The Galata Bridge and of course the Sultan Ahmed Palace. One day is nowhere near enough time to visit all the sights but on the Big Red Bus I was able to at least see them. Some of the headphone sockets on my bus werent working so I had to swap seats a couple of times to find one that worked. The commentary was very informative and overall I say it was well worth it.
Great staff and views! . Big Bus NEVER disappoints. Loved the views. You get a tour of both continents, Asia and Europe. Staff was awesome here. Thanks Furuk! :)

A must do in Istanbul. Should you visit Istanbul, it's advisable to book a long enough pass on the Big Bus Tour. The convenience of having access to all historic sites, without having to stick to a specific group is great.I really enjoyed my trips for the two days I was in the city.

Wonderful experience. I highly recommend taking Big Bus Tours to get a good overview of the entire city. Through the audio guide we learned more of the history of Istanbul. It was also convenient crossing the Bosphorus bridge to Asia.

I love Big Bus Istanbul!. These guys are awesome...everyone at the "office" bus in Taksim was extremely ninice and helpful, the routes cover just about everywhere you want to go and the price is definitely reasonable. I bought two tickets, for a total of four days - you pay 100 Turkish lira for two days, less than 20 bucks a day! On my fourth day I left a bag on the bus, I thought I could just forget about it, but the next day it was waiting for me in Sultanahmet and they even let me ride there and back to Taksim free! Oh and I could communicate both in English and Italian. Teşekkür ederim!

Worth the money. Allows you to visit the main attractions over 2 days. Was worth the money to get us familiar with the places to visit over our first 2 days. Bayram, who sold us our ticket was very helpful and gave us a reasonable discount.

Big bus tour is a must in Istanbul. Did the big bus tour and it is a great way to get to know a new country. The big bus takes you to all the famous tourist attractions. While we were here we got a two day ticket for theprice of a one day ticket and it was a great deal. Easier than trying to figure out the public transport and cheaper than using the cabs.Faruk and Rahmi deserve a special mention. They are excellent guides, friendly and kept us great company at Sultanahmet.Would definitely recommend the big bus tour to anyone.

Interesting & Useful Service. We decided to take this bus on New Years Day in freezing cold icy conditions as really little else to do. If it were not for the freezing cold and our sitting in the open part on the top so as to be able to take great pictures, I am sure we would have enjoyed it more.In the morning we took the Red Bus from Taksim to the Blue mosque. We then got off and took some pictures and got our feet thoroughly drenched in freezing cold slush. We then took the Blue Bus to the cable car, and went up the mountain where we found a cafe with a wood burning fire on which to try and dry out our footwear!Returning down the mountain, we did not have long to wait to pick up another blue bus, and almost got off at the miniturk but decided not to as was near 4pm. We returned to the Blue mosque and picked up another red bus to take us back to Taksim. The bus was very full so we had to go back on the open part upstairs! Big mistake as blizzard, and it went off over the Bosphorus bridge which was freezing, so at that point we preferred to stand downstairs. Eventually the tour got us back to Taksim, cold and wet. Not their fault, but quite an adventure.On 2nd January we headed to Vialand by public transport, only to be told on arrival that it was shut yet again due to bad weather, so we got a cab to the nearby miniturk and from their picked up a Blue Bus that we knew stopped at the Egyptian Bazaar from the day before! The good thing is that when you buy a ticket directly from these guys for one day, you can also have free travel the next day, so that really came in useful, as by that time we kind of understood our bearings!!!They give you headphones to plug in. You can then select what language you want and I think there was a choice of 8. The speaker does go on a bit about "Peace be upon him" etc, but actually it was a good tour, albeit the music stays in your head as a bit repetitive!

Highly recomended. We went on both the red and blue tour, the red route was probably most impressive which takes you over the Bosporus bridge ( very cold and windy on top deck)Great guided tour via head phones ( provided) and you can hop on / off when you like.Would thoroughly recommend for day 1 of a trip to Istanbul

Best bus tour in Istanbul!!. We were both very happy with the service and comedy value of the tour. Very good and helped my partner walking in icy conditions - Faruk is an excellent representative of the Big Bus company!!!

Fantastic service . The service was great. Me and my wife thoroughly enjoyed the trip and the service by the team in particular Faruk was very well lead and reassuring . Would recommend this journey to anyone.

Istanbul adventure . Had a great time staying in Istanbul. Big Bus Istanbul showed us all the nice places along with all related historical facts. Experience is truly amazing. All the staffs were so friendly and accommodating especially Faruk. He assisted us on every queries. We are definitely recommending everyone to avail this unique tour package.

An awful experience. All was well with the tour to begin with in fact until we tried to find a bus stop after lunch. Stop nine on the red route is so badly mis-labelled that it took us more than 30 minutes to find it and almost 30 minutes after that for the bus to arrive. By this time we were very cold. The screens along the sides of the top deck were so badly worn that we couldn't see out of them

Best way to see Istanbul. There are two routes on one ticket and you have two days to use them. This tour combined with a Bosphorus Boat tour will get you everything in Istanbul. We had a cold rainy day, but this tour was great. I would recommend this to all.

Highly recommended - especially thanks to Bayram!. This service is great - the bus stops at most of the major landmarks in Istanbul, for a very reasonable price.The staff are all fantastic, but the supervisor, Bayram, deserves a special mention! He was very welcoming, friendly and helpful. He went out of his way to make sure we got the most out of our trip. I was particularly impressed with his fluency in English and his strong British accent despite having never visited the UK!I recommend this tour bus to anyone visiting Istanbul. Ask for Bayram - you will not be disappointed!

An Awesome Journey to Remember Thanks to Bayram. So I went to turkey on December 1st 2015 and we booked big bus tour which was very convenient and completely worth for the money. it was around 470 for two people for sight seeing hop of hop on facility blue mosque guided tour topkapi palace guided tour, Hagia sophia guided tour and grand bazar tour. There was a guy name Bayram (GOOD ENGLISH SPEAKING) he helped us alot about the place and our tour destination.. very friendly and helpful guy he was.. loved everything about this country and bigbus.. Thanks Salman

Good to get around. We had ticket for one day did both bus tours used it to stop a couple of times which was ideal for us Not cheap but easier than trying public transport Better if use it for 2 days better value

Big Bus Tour. The Big Bus Tour in Istanbul has two routes which will take you around the Golden Horn and the Sultanahmet District. It is very reasonable and the audio guide works well. The only problem is that it stops very infrequently and you end up waiting quite a long time for it.In fact, I suspect that there may only be one bus for each leg of the tours, because I was waiting more than 40 minutes to be picked up---about the time it takes to circle the Golden Horn. Nonetheless, it was quite reasonably priced and I used it, instead of a taxi, to get tothe Chora Church (which would have cost the same) and plus got the rest of the tour.It's very nice, but keep in mind that it's not simply hop on hop off, it's more like hop off and then wait a very long time to hop back on.

AWESOME!. I travelled through the big bus of Istanbul, and it was an amazing experience! The manager, Bayram, helped me a lot, he is a very nice and kind person! This was an amazing experience and I enjoyed it a lot.
Big Bus Tours in Istanbul🇹🇷. Big Bus Tours gave us pleasant, satisfying and lovely journey to historical Istanbul. There, you will be accompanied by a friendly tourist guide called Bayram

Big thank to big bus tours & Bayram . I recently visited Istanbul and wanted to make the most of what the city has to offer . What better than a big bus tour, at first I was apprehensive as I was expecting to have difficulty in understanding the staff on the tour. I was pleasantly surprised especially once I met supervisor Bayram Who spoke perfect English :) he took his time and explained which tour would be best for my interests, he was patient and polite. I enjoyed the tour and would definitely recommend it, if you are visiting Istanbul. I could not of been happier I came away feeling refreshed and full of knowledge about Istanbul. Thank you big bus tours and a big thank you to Bayram you made my trip !! :) i

Bayram was amazing. I sent customers from Altinkum to Istanbul for a couple of days I contacted bayram who was very helpful , from start to finish , customer service was amazing , my customer met up with him and he made their stay very special they enjoyed every part of the tour when they came back to Altinkum they stated they would use this company again and to send a very special Ty to bayram which I would like to do on here so thank you once again

Amazing experience. This is the best way to see whole of Istanbul.. Rather than travelling several places through different means, you will get the chance to see everything in one day..They have 2 difference routes. Its upto you to choose as per your interest..Istanbul tour is incomplete if you dont try this..

Big bus tours Istanbul. As we were staying close to Taksim Square which was one end of the Red Tour, there is a Blue one, this worked for us, just about. Being out of season in December the second day was free but when you go back to Taksim Square it takes the long way round to cross the bridge from Europe to Asia as an experience then back round re crossing the same bridge. A great experience once but with Istanbul traffic this can take an extra 45 mins before you get back to the start point.Doing that again on the free or cheap day two, is repetitive and you can spend time in a wiser fashion.

Highly recommend it. Fantastic way to explore Istanbul. Friendly staff especially Rahmi who was very helpful. We enjoyed the ride, the audio service was available in different languages and we found it informative.

Rahmi is the man to see!. Great option to see all of IstanbulCheap considering the number of stops it makes and the convenience of hoping on and off at each stop is great. We got off at each stop, explored the area and then went back on for the next location.Rahmi was a great help, he is very friendly and can guide you with everything in Istanbul

HIghly recommended - best tour company I have used!. I do not usually go on bus tours as they are all usually very much the same - expensive, boring, unreliable and guides who cannot communicate with you in your own language. So you can imagine how pleasantly surprised I was when I found myself having a conversation in English with Bayram (one of the supervisors of the Big Bus Tour) outside the Blue Mosque in Istanbul. He was dressed smartly, was informative, friendly and professional and, best of all, his English was superb. I asked about the two different routes the buses took and he took the time and trouble to find out what things I was interested in seeing before recommending which tour I should take. The Big Bus Tour itself was great and I am sure that I would not have been able to see so much of the city during my trip had I been trying to navigate around Istanbul on my own. It gave me the chance to make a note of places that I had seen to be able to go and visit them in more detail later in my stay. The audio supplied throughout the trip was clear and full of interesting facts. The staff on the bus were friendly and helpful. My husband and I came away from the trip knowing more about Istanbul. My husband was particularly pleased with the price! Not the cheapest tour but certainly the best we have been on of its kind and well worth the money. To top it off when we got back Bayram directed us to a local restaurant where the food was cheap but absolutely delicious. Top man!I would certainly recommend this trip to anyone looking for a good sight seeing tour of the city at a reasonable price and with good customer service. Well done Big Bus Company and a big thank you to Bayram :-)
Faruk is The Man!. Big Bus is an excellent option to cover all the most important point in Istanbul. Great Customer Service. Good People. Faruk is The Man !

Great if you like a hop on/off tour. I always find hop on and off bus tours helpful in any city, especially if you have limited time or know you're going to be doing a lot of walking. It's a great way to see the sights and only dive deeper in to some if you choose to. The Istanbul Big Bus tour was great - we got stuck in traffic one the evening but, that's unavoidable. The on board wifi is super helpful. The only sights you can't reach on this tour are the Grand Bazaar and the Süleymaniye Mosque.

Excellent Service. We had a really great experience. Bayram one of the supervisors was extremely helpful and provided us with good information of the local area and the bus services e.g which routes and timings.Free wi-fi on the bus was great too:)

The best way to get to know Istanbul. Booked the 48hr pass via Big Bus website prior to flying into Istanbul. We stayed near to Sultanahmet area hence we are strategically located to take advantage of the service.Was sceptical initially on the service level but found a gentleman who can speak good English and explained things well. So we hopped on and had a great adventure. 1st day on the Red route and the Blue route the next day with a stop in Miniaturk.The audio was helpful and the Ottoman music haunting.My good experience with Istanbul hop on hop off bus tour enticed me to try similar services in other cities next time the travel bug bites!

Great tour!!. It's nice to see the beautiful turkey espciaslly the connection between europe and asia, there's alot of souk you can see and the historical place of Hagia Sophia. The tour was amazing you can hop on and off and the bus came on time. Shout out to big bus turkey!!

Biggest mistake. Only for those who have trouble walking . We booked since our friends had a good experience with big bus at Dubai. But at Istanbul things are very different. This is advisable for people who don't prefer to walk around.Now there are only cons:1. Frequency in one of the route is hourly. We did know this while booking but the worst part was that you don't know from what time to calculate the hour like from the start point or where it dropped last. No idea. Least they could have done is that put up a chart of timings on each bus stop. 2. Public transport is very well linked that you need not get yourself stuck in traffic forever in this bus. 3. Few Drivers drive so slow that they literally wait for the traffic light to turn yellow so that they can sit and relax. We were sitting right next to driver, first row and it was very frustrating. Such rude behaviour continued even after we informed the driver that we had take a cruise, which was also booked with big bus.4. Not all Drivers understand English. So don't expect answers all the time 5. They don't have a designated office. Once you book with someone, chances are that you wouldn't see that person again. Hence, don't know where to complain 6. Ohh to add, we took the walking tour guide as well. That was a disappointment as well. Our guide wasn't informative at all. We heard other guides, who knew so much about the place. For the Walking tour of the old city even the audio guide is a better option.In all, if you are planning to hop on hop off like us, don't go for it. Public transport is amazing and locals are so helpful.

Connecting Europe & Asia. Great touring experience covering majority of European Istanbul & part of Asia. Start point is 'Sultanahmet Square' near Hagia Sophia Mosque/ Blue Mosque/ Sultanahmet tran stn. Both red line & blue line start & end at the same place, but cover different route. Price for 24hrs tkt is 30euro adult, 15 child 5-15yrs, 75 for family of 2+2 children. Same tkt can be used on both lines on hop-on hop-off basis any time during the operating hrs. Tkt can be easily purchased in cash or by card on-site (few travel website offer online purchase too)

Efficient intro to a huge city. A great first thing to do after arriving in huge historic Istanbul, especially if you have limited time and are traveling independently. You'll save time and money and see everything (3 bridges are crossed) on a most pleasant drive on this 3-hour "red bus" city tour. You can repeat tour or any part of tour within 24 hours and get off on one or two selected sites: such as the Spice Bazaar/Galata Bridge, or the modern art museum. Open air, bring a jacket with hood to cover your ears when you travel close to the sea. They supply an easy to read map also.

Absolute rip off!. Wanted to take the 2 tours on our last day and were shocked to discover the cost -100TL about £25per person for 3hours if not used for hop on hop off which is so overpriced compared to everything else in city. Glad we got the trams with our own tours as cost 4TL per trip and cover most areas!

Interesting tour of Istanbul. Very interesting tour of many areas of Istanbul on 2 tours - a great way of seeing the city and the sights without having to walk. The ticket covers 24 hours so the trips can be separated - ticket essential for 2nd tour! Driver Ozcan was excellent and and the team were friendly.

An excellent way to learn about Istanbul and its terrible traffic. As usual to learn about a city we took one day hop on hop of bus ( London, Berlin,... ) starting from the Blue Mosque area combining the two lines ( Red and Blue ). Wonderful experience seeing so much of the city and its surroundings even driving 2 times over the famous Bosporus Bridge and seeing the Byzantine walls at the far end of the city at the exact spot where they were shot open by the Ottoman artillery. Good experience to learn about the heavy traffic in Istanbul, especially at the Galata bridge area, taking in consideration the bus drivers that have to pass there every day! Good guiding comments although some of the headphones are not working well (should be checked and updated). Hopping of the red line at Galata bridge we had to search for the hop on for the Blue Line. Indication of that spot is bad and should be better indicated, there is no timetable, so you have to wait and hope that a bus comes soon (we understood that with the traffic jams it is almost impossible to have an idea about the time schedule ). The bus ride is the best way to have an overview of the city from the inside, for the outside take the boat trip that brings you in the Golden Horn and the Bosporus so you can see this beautiful city from both sides. An excellent attraction, but it needs better indication at and information for the blue and red line switch and audi equipment should be top at all times. We recommend this manner to see the city of Istanbul. We learned and saw a lot.

Big Bus tour, great but watch your ticket.. I really recommend these tours, both of them. Great way to see the city of Istanbul, and you can take the chance to rest your legs and get on and off wherever you like. But be careful, they tried to cheat me with the tickets to get a more expensive one and what was advertised.

Nice tour. The bus staff were very nice and helpful. However, I did not like the schedule service, when you want to make the transfer from the blue route to the red route at the stop #1, you have to wait one hour. It was a wasting of time for me because I stayed only one day in Istanbul and I did not have a lot of time to wait for transfers and I was not able to visit some interesting places in Istanbul. I recommend to you to buy the two days tour because It is cheap and you can use this service per two days. There is a lot of traffic in Istanbul and one day is not enough time to go around the city and visit the interesting places. Buy those tickets in advance at their website. It is cheaper.

As ever, a great way to see a city.. Big Bus tours are always a great way to get an overview and this one was no different. The two routes gave a great experience of the old and the new, the Asian and the European and all for such a reasonable price, especially for the 48 hour ticket. This worked our as being the same amount as we saved by booking on line. If you have the time then this is highly recommended.

Good value. Pretty good value. You definitely needed to be ready to get off the bus as the stops weren't long! But, as long as you're looking ahead, should be fine. Also, a few of the headphone jacks were not working. But overall, still a great experience. Cool way to cross the bridge (but bring a jacket, that part gets cold!), see the major sites, and actually snag some good pictures of Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque, since you're up a little higher than you would be on the ground.

Best was to WAST your holiday. Hi we have used big bus for 24hars and have took both walking tour with them. Experience was more than horrible.1st bus runs every 1hour on blue rout and every 30min on red route. But on middle station time varies as per traffic condition. When you reach bus stop there is no clue weather you have just miss the bus or it's about to come. If u reach little late u wast your time waiting for bus and if u r early u r waiting anyways. Atleast we expect an indication on bus stop staying next bus in -- MinsFurther no Entery fee is included in your ticket what u r paying is only for bus drive and audio inside. Which is very easy in Istanbul any ways and just not required.Traffic is bad in whole of Istanbul and so u wast your time in traveling instead of enjoying the spots. And to make it more bad big bus drivers driver extra slowly even when road is empty and no important spot is around.AVOIDE AND SAVE YOUR HOLIDAY

true way to see istanbul. This was one of my best decision to take Big buss two days tickets for Istanbul city tour. You can see entire city with your own view and decide where to go. The tour is divided into two route and both routes are enjoyble.

Waste of time. Using a hop on hop ff bus in istanbul is a waste of time as traffic is one of the worst in the world. I spent two hours crossing a Bridge. Much better to use metro and cable.....or boat.

bravo to Mazzur of the Big bus B Red Line. On our first day visit to Istanbul, Mazzur of the Red Line helped us in deciding to take the Big Bus tour of the city. He was very helpful and kind. He was also so right. If youhave never visited Istanbul before, you must take the Red Line tour! It gives you a terrific overview of one of the most alluring and beautiful cities in the world. This wasa great day and we thank Mazzur (Mazzum?)Patrick and Terry

Great way to get to know Istanbul. Only with 4 days in istanbul we started the first 2 with this Tour.Great way to have a general look and after you can focus on what you are really interested.Stops in the most important landmarks and one of the tours takes you to the asian part os istanbul crossing the Bosphorus bridge.
Two different routes one amazing experience. I highly recommend taking this tour, they offer two different routes that can be done in one day, one of them crosses to the Asian side of Istanbul.

owsom tour. You will save 5 Euro if you purchased tickets from big bus web site, 48 hours ahead. Sit on right hand side on both red and blue route, as you will get good views for pictures. Buses are clean, but some headphones plugs are not working.
Great Way to See both Europe and Asia. We should have gotten on the bus 2 days earlier. Friends told us it wasn't worth it. We found that it was! Take it if you can.

What a poor experience!. Thought this tour would give an interesting overview of the city. However, it lasted not 2 hours but 3.5 (traffics awful). The commentary was not insightful, often mistimed with the place of interest. Terrible background music, which looped at least 5 times. Relatively expensive compared to other forms of transport so was expecting something more special. Only 2 saving graces quite good free map and free wifi!

Great Idea but Istanbul Traffic Makes it Difficult. With limited time in Istanbul, we thought this bus would be perfect. It went by all the main tourist sites, and you can hop on/hop off as you wished. The ticket we purchased gave us a 24 hour window of opportunity which should have been enough for us to see what we wanted to see. We didn't take into account the congestion of Istanbul's streets. We spent more time sitting in traffic than actually doing anything. I believe it took us more than 4 hours to complete the red route - and that didn't include our one stop at Dolmabahce Palace! The cost was quite steep and neither of thought it was worth it.

Big Bus tour way to start your Istanbul visit. Good way to start a visit to Istanbul with the Big bus hop on hop of tour. We bought a two day ticket and did the red and blue tour on day one. We did the same the next day and visited several attractions on the route. The commentary is good with lots of information on Istanbul and Turkey. Start from Sultanahmet square. Take enough water.

Great option when weather is bad. We took the 2 day pass with this bus and had a good time, as the weather was rather cold. It gave us the chance to see a lot in a cozy bus! For example, we got off in Asia and has nice foid there at the seaside.Negatives are that they stop running around 6/7 and traffic jam can be annoying.Staff is helpful (Faruk).We recommend this tour! Have fun!

Big bus tour was the best experience to see the great city. I looked at the bus and thought leave it..and then the supervisor approached me mr Bayram Sarikaya ..the way he talked to us I thought he was from East end of london was so pleasent so respectful and so helpful . He showed us a map guided us through the big bus tour plan and I said yes please:) the staff on the bus were great .Bayram told us the tour was for 48 hours,and he met us next day again by the bus explained what we will visit and what we should see. He then got us a guide to take us to the topkapi palace. I have never met anyone with so much spirit. And he has never been to the uk which surprised me. Next year I will be taking my son and definently going on the big bus.the good thing about this trip was that it's a hop on hop of look around and catch another big bus very enjoyable tour.

We should have tried the Blue Route. Took the tour as we've found it useful in other cities to get an overview. We took the Red Route - mostly it skirts round the interesting bits; the headphones and sound system are ropey; the short trip over the Bosphorous Bridge into Asia was VERY windy on the open top deck - I was afraid my specs would blow away. I'd say get an Istanbul Kart (travel card, available from machines at all tram stops)) and travel at will on the trams, much cheaper. On the other hand, maybe the Blue Route (included in the ticket) would have been more interesting as it goes up and around the Horn. But we didn't have time to try it.
Enjoyable tour. Good commentary, we passed many of the great sights of Isanbul. We only had a short time-so just did the tour we were very impressed.

Enjoyable trips. Two routs give an interesting overview of the most fascinating points of Istanbul. Enjoyed the red one more, because of crossing the bridge to Asia. I even regret that bought only 24 hours...

Great way to see Istanbul. There is to much to see in Istanbul but the big bus tours covers it all with the 48hours ticket. Its worth doing their walking tour as well... The free WiFi was a bonus (for when you get caught up in traffic). Definitely the best way to get the history of all the places and the best way to decide where you want to stop... My recommendation take the blue route first and then the just ride through the the red route.

Great way to see Istanbul. My hotel was located a mile from the Blue Mosque and the first stop for Big Bus Tours Istanbul. I purchased a 48 hour pass. What a great way to see the main attractions in this very crowded, very busy city. The red tour took about two hours to complete and the blue tour about an hour and a half. I jumped on and off the red tour to visit sites that were interesting to me, including the Hard Rock Café where I picked up my shot glasses and had an apple cobbler. The cost was very reasonable for the tour when you compare it to the cost of taxis. Highly recommended!!!

Great way to experience the sights & sounds of Istanbul. We've done Big Bus tours in many cities that offer it and were glad we joined the Istanbul city tour. We only had 1 full day in the city and the red route allowed us to see so many sights without having to navigate public transport or deal with taxis. This red route takes you past Galata Tower and Topkapi Palace and then across the Bosphorus to the Asian side of Istanbul. The views as you drive towards the bridge are just spectacular and the English language commentary was very detailed. Very well-wun operation, unlike some Red Bus tours we were able to buy our tickets directly from the driver and even negotiated an on the spot discount. Great way to see the sights of this great city.

Big Bus is the best way to see Istanbul. We had a limited time in Istanbul and the 2 day pass was the best way for us to see the entire city on both the Asia and Europe side. The staff were very friendly and answered our questions at our stops. They made great recommendations for places to eat in the stops, as well as suggested some amazing tours to do. We bought one walking tour of Prince's Island through the Big Bus agent and it was amazing! The hop on hop off allowed us to take our 3 and 5 year old girls all over the city in a short amount of time. The audio/headsets and commentary were clear and easily to understand. It gave a great history about parts of the city that I would not have normally recognized as being significant.Hands down this is the best way to see Istanbul, don't miss it! It is well worth the month.

Best way to see Istanbul. We had 5 days in Istanbul, and used big bus for two days. Thanks to Adnan for recomending it. Best way to see town as bus has two routs, red more central and blue around golden horn.

Great to get a feel of the city. Hop-on-hop-off bus tours are excellent for orientating yourself in a new city....working out which attractions you really want to visit & whether they are a walkable distance to other sites . Istanbul's tour offers two separate routes...the red & blue routes...which both pass numerous sightseeing must-do's across this vast city. Naturally you have the opportunity to get off as many times as you wish but even using the 48 hour pass, you must consider the horrendous traffic problems that you may well encounter at pretty much any time of the day! Personally, we used the bus to look around the city in one trip & then shortlisted our must-see priorities....but we were blessed with ample time in Istanbul to explore it's beauty.We purchased a combo ticket which covered both routes over 2 days & a Bosphorus Cruise which we could use anytime during that week. The cruise departure times had been slashed to only two choices (10am & 2pm - picked up from Taksim Square) but it appeared we were added into another company's cruise itinerary...which was still a lovely way to spend around 2 hours but did not include all the sites we had expected to see after reading the company's brochure.Overall, these tours are good value...especially when you consider the size of this city & the risks you take using Turkish taxi drivers to get around (we found often the fares were unfairly high...a popular scam here apparently)

Great to see a lot in a limited time.. This was really inexpensive and , having limited time in Istanbul this is a great thing to do - also it was raining and therefore walking was not a great option. We saw lots of things we could do if we returned. They have two routes - the blue and the red. They overlap a bit at the start but still great for letting you get you bearings.

Interesting but time consuming. We love the concept of hop on hop off but in most metropolises the traffic makes the journey onerous. Our 1 :15 hour tour took closer to 3 hours as we were repeatedly held up in traffic. That was the Blue tour. The Red tour ran into the same problems plus we were rerouted. I want to say take the tour but it will eat up a day without even getting off the bus. Tough call.

Very convenient transport to the tourist sites. You need to consider the cost against the experience. Provides an overview of this large city with opportunities to visit many sites in one 24 hour period. Can be a very good means of transport if you do your research and plan beforehand. Information available on internet where you can also prebook/pay or most hotels will sell you a prepay once your there and sure your going to do it.Covers off two routes through the city with some variance depending on what you want to see (or for the same price you can still do both routes). Beware: can be very hot on the top of the bus out in the sun all that time.

Better than we expected. We chose this company on-line before our trip as we've done these in other large cities. This was a fantastic way to pre-view the city (we chose day 1 & 2 of our trip). They give free headphones and a nice map with everything marked. On our first day, we stopped to get air in a tire and then 10 min. later we stopped as we had a 'flat' but a new transfer bus appeared in less than 10 minutes and we did not feel inconvenienced - despite this, they signed our receipt giving us an extra free day of touring which made 3 for us… It was fantastic as we used it to get to some of the further places we wanted to see instead of using public metro or taxi… The tour has open air upper deck (great visibility) with covers that are easily released during rainy weather. We highly recommend this as a way to begin your sightseeing in Istanbul.

Doesn't compare to Big Bus in other cities. In comparison to some of the Big Bus tours in other cities like Belfast, Dublin, Budapest this tour was of fairly poor quality. We ordered the tickets online but they did not get sent to our mobile phone. I sent an email to the company and we heard back 3 days later. Thankfully the attendant on the bus used the wifi to verify our ticket and print it on the bus. Other Big Bus tours we've been on used live commentary (real person on bus with microphone explaining sites) whereas this tour only had the option of listening to the recording with the headsets. I find when it's a person who's passionate about the place their showing and have their own personal spin on the history and sites it makes for a more interesting tour. The also drivers seemed very disinterested.The blue route was not very exciting and the red route was only marginally better. Normally we rate Big Bus tours are great because they help you get your bearings in a city and it's an inexpensive way to see the main sites before branching off on your own. The Istanbul bus is not in the category. I would just read a travel guide and enjoy the local ferries to different destinations instead.

totally recommended. If you want to visit the most common Istanbul attractions, this is the service to take. With their live commentary audio service, it is worth to hop on it and just hop off where you want to stay.I paid a bit extra and took 48 hour family ticket, which was good as I had more time on each location

Must do if you have no idea where to start. Whenever I'm in a new city, and have no idea whatsoever on what I should do and where's my bearings, I'll take the easy way out by joining these bus tours. The best way to get a feel of the city and narrow down the choices of things to do. Very effective.

I won't be talking about the big bus tour , i would be talking about their agent. So we know the big bus from Dubai, it is an amazing way to see the city.however in istanbul it is handled by an agent called hop on hop off, the agent offers other tours other than the big bus tour, we have had 2 tours booked by this agent, and both ended up badly, 1- The first is the dinner cruise in the bosphorous, at first they sat us in a table at the end of the boat by the door, when we tried to explain that we can't be there because of the kids, we didn't find any response and the people were rude.2- the second is the trip to bursa, The bus came late 45 minutes, they tour had gone through multiple shops that were expensive, and at the end the bus didn't drop us at the hotel as agreed.the above is not the issue, when we tried complaining, the persons in charge were dismissive and rude. I guess you can use them for the big bus tours , but i warn you , don't pay them premium for the other tours, they are not worth it!!!!!

Poor. It was extremely crowded and felt like a long History lesson! The tour takes you to some nice places. We got off at one stop and when we came back, we had to wait 50 minutes for the next bus to arrive.

Good for first time visitor. It is a very good tour through whole Istanbul with a 8 language audio guide.If you are visiting Istanbul for the first time try to take the tour first day you arrive. It will guide you to all historical places and help you to arrange your trip.

Great way to get an overview of the city....... We have used the red bus in many cities but can say with confidence that the service offered in Istanbul has been by far the best.There are two routes - the red route and the blue route and the starting point is at Sultanahmet square - frequent buses. We did both the routes and and had amazing views especially when crossing into the Asian side on the Bosphorous bridge. The stops are right next to the places of interest and despite the heavy traffic, our two buses appeared to move along quite comfortably. There was never a wait longer than 25 minutes at any stop.Staff are very friendly and very helpful. Audio guide (and music) on board was good and it was checked by a member of staff before the start of the journey.For good photo opportunities, sit on the right hand side of the bus (especially for views from the Bosphorous bridge and for views across the Golden Horn).

A great way to get an overview of a new destination.. I always do the Big Bus Hop-on-hop-off Big Bus tour when I visit a new city - it gives me a perspective of the city and helps me decide where I want to spend more time later in our trip. Buy your ticket online at a reduced price. The bus drivers are helpful, the commentary is good and the buses are clean. The red and blue routes are good, but if short of time, give the blue route of the old city a miss. Traffic is terrible, so often the route takes longer than expected. Be sure to wear a hat and sunscreen. When you exchange your confirmation slip for a ticket at the embarkation spot you will receive a map of the blue and red routes and personal earphones. Be aware of the men selling "discounted" boat tours of the Bosphorus, while you are waiting for the bus at Sultanahmet. They are not affiliated to the Big Bus Tour organisation, and their boat trip is disappointing at any price.

Two day ticket is very good value. 115 Turkish Lira for 2 days, though they have to be consecutive days. The red route started in Sultanahamet by the Haghia Sophia and went to Eminonu then part way up the Golden Horn, and across the Bosphorous bridge, which was excellent, and then into Beyoglu and up to Taksim square,which is an excellent place to get off to walk down Istiklal street down to the Galata tower and onwards to the Galata bridge, and back to Sultanahamet. The blue route goes up to the top of the Golden Horn where I got off to go to the Pierre Loti cafe, by Cable car, both give excellent views of the Golden Horn. Buses comfortable, and staff pleasant. The audio was helpful. Good way to get an overview and to reach some of the main sights particularly as I found the taxis expensive and Istanbul is big and I though difficult nagivate by walking. I did both routes first thing in the morning, the first red route was at 9 and the first blue at 9.15. No particular traffic problems

Good trip. If you are visiting Istanbul for the first time it will be great to try Big Bus tour at the 1st or 2 ms dayIt show you almost all the important places in Istanbul Try to come early to seat in the upper floor but don't forget your sunglasses I advise you to take the 2 days offer as you can go down at any place & go back to the bus again when you finishWhen you finish the red line tour don't forget to go to the blue line tour that is included in the same price

A great way to get oriented to a city. This really is a good start for city orientation purposes - but depends on traffic conditions (sometimes too slow in congested traffic in Istanbul), the enthusiasm or boredom of the driver (not getting the audio/commentary timing right on the route).The commentary provides good information that might take time to source otherwise when you dont have good access to internet or travel guides.The wifi didn't work the day we used the bus.We had a driver on one leg who just changed the route and was getting impatient in the traffic.

Great way to see the city. I did the big bus tour as I was on my own while my husband was at a conference. I really enjoyed it. The commentary was informative and the 2 routes seemed to take in all the main sites. Traffic was a bit sticky in the afternoon but in the morning there were no issues. I had a really good idea of where I wanted to explore further on foot after doing the tour.
Good bus tour. Amazing bus tours Nice to be summer weather to be nice With winter it's very hard to see All tours are very interesting to be visited average price try it with 2 days

Good idea to get the "feel" for a city. Came to Istanbul June last year and hadn't realised there was a tour bus.This is excellent value for money and gives you an insight into where to go when planning your stayI did the whole tour from Taksim and had a 15 minute wait at stop 1 where the tour begins on the red route.For 5tl extra your ticket is valid for 48 hours and not just 24.Intend to tour again tomorrow to visit Basilica Cistern.As stated in other reviews, this is a good way to get round as "taksi" drivers can overcharge as I experienced last year.
