I had started out the tour on the top, but going over the bridge it became much too windy and cold. I went down to the lower level, where there was heat. However, there were only 10 seats, and all were filled. So in order to stay warm, I sat on the stairs, but then had no audio. After reaching the Taxim Square stop, a few inside seats opened up. I went to plug in my earphones, and they would not insert all the way. So now, I had a warm seat, but no audio. I rode to the spice bazaar stop and got off. I was so aggravated over this whole scenario, that I actually paid 4 TL to ride the tram back to the Sultanahmet area.So beware: if is cold rainy and windy, there will likely not be enough indoor seating for everyone. And why can't the people in charge check all the audio outlets daily to be sure they all work? How much work would that take?Overall, I feel that this was a waste of my time and 35 Euros.

An easy way to see a lot. It was a cold and wet day and I was travelling with elderly people so this was a great activity to do. The bus moved around through a very busy city quite well. The traffic is alway horrendous in Istanbul but the bus made good time around the circuit, not to fast not to slow. The commentary was interesting and seemed to play at the right pace according to where we were. I will definitely bring more friends to do this bus trip.

Yes, go!. Bus tours are a great way to orient yourselves to a new city. This one ( take the red line first near aya Sofia) has all the usual ups and downs, but they are frequent and cover a large area of the parts of the city you want to see. At $15 approx, it's great value for 2 hours, though most people don't hop on and off, but just stay on all the way round. It's amazing ( and a little scary) how these buses can weave in and out of the traffic! The red line goes across the bridge into Asia which is neat if it's your first time there.

A spectacular way to see Istanbul. Big Bus Tours offers a spectacular option to see the beautiful city of Istanbul if you like visiting at your own pace or if this is your time visiting.The staff is particularly attentive and courteous. Most importantly, they are highly professional and patient with not only explaining how Big Bus Tours operates but also with addressing any questions tourists have regarding the sites along the routes or in general about Istanbul. The fact that the staff is multi-lingual makes communication easy. Also, Big Bus Tours offers two different routes to suit your time schedule as well as what sites you hope to see. The recordings on the bus that describe the various sites are available in many languages.I had the wonderful opportunity of meeting Adnan, a staff onsite on the day I decided to sightsee with Big Bus Tours. Adnan not only suggested the 48 hour pass for economical reasons (only 5 Euros additional for another 24 hours), but also that the additional 24 hours will allow me to explore Istanbul and all the sights that it has to offer at a more leisurely pace. Although I don't disagree that traffic in Istanbul can be heavy, having purchased the 48 hour pass, there was less time pressure and sitting in traffic just gave me another opportunity to absorb all that Istanbul has to offer as I gazed out of the window. Adnan was also very friendly, helpful, and humorous, all of which contributed to my positive experience with Big Bus Tours and Istanbul in general.All in all, I highly recommend Big Bus Tours for all of the reasons stated above. Big Bus Tours provides tourists with a wonderful slice of Istanbul and an excuse to return to Istanbul in the very near future ...

great way to hear the history and see the sights. I love the big bus tours of the various big cities. its a great way to see a city, unfortunately the traffic is a nightmare in Istanbul. what can be seen in 35 minutes takes 2 and a half hours. we chose a very windy day as well.

A great option to tour the city. This is a great option if you want to tour the city on your own. It stops at all major attractions and historical sites, you have a bus that passes every 30 mn, so you can enjoy your time at every stop. This is a nice option if you don not like the guided tours, and you like to wonder on your own. It has wifi, and explanations in 8 languages. You have the option on 1 or 2 days passes. Highly recommended if like me, you like to wonder on your own. They have 2 lines red and blue, and they take you over the bridge to the asian side of the city, so u can enjoy the view from above.

Ticks all the historical places to visit. Standard open top bus tour with multilingual commentary that makes several stops near all the major must-visit places. Regular schedule and trip across the Bosphorus bridge and back justifies the price of 30euro. Be prepared to take in Istanbul traffic jams at times.

Istanbul Bus Tour Company. Routine is to take city tour first to recon the tourist spots. Then categorize what to see based on days eft in trip (4 days) for us. Drivers incredibly talented to maneuver traffic. Narrative good. We took Red Route and Blue (Golden Horn). Then planned detailed sites to,visit based on time. Metro excellent but takes 1 ½ days to figure out, but it's the only way travel if you don't want to spend your vacation In traffic.

Big Bus Tour Istanbul. Thank you to Simon who recommended the Big Bus red tour. It is a great way of getting your bearings in the city. The commentary was very informative and we thoroughly enjoyed the time spent on the Big Bus.

don't skip this tour. the city of Istanbul has a lot to show off. So sit back and let it.This tour is a must. We found it expensive for us so we were hesitant about it, but man it was worth every lira, i'd even pay more for it. especially that u can use ur ticket for 24 hrs so u can use it as transportation also.it takes u around the amazing Istanbul like no other trip. and shows u beautifullllllll places varying between history nature and modern civilization...DON'T forget ur camera.لو مصرى لازم تروح و تشوف الجمال اللى اتحرمنا منه :D

Waste of time and money, extremly dissapointing. I wish i had read the reviews on this company before i decided to waste 190TL. What a terrible terrible company and tour. I usually love hop on and hop off buses and i have done them in most countires i have been too as this is a fantastic way to see a city. This was not even close to what i have ever expreianced before. I did not pay to sit in traffic for 2 and 1/2hrs only to have the driver who spoke no english to have a small tamtrum and road rage and then made everyone get off the bus whilst we were only half way around the route, even though it was supposed to be a 2 hour round trip. We were left in some part of Istanbul that we had no idea where we were and had to get a taxi back to our hotel therefore spending more money. I cant agree more with other reviews they are more than keen to get you on the bus and take your money but thats where it ends. If i could give this tour a negative rating i would. I will also be writting to the company as this kind of service is just not accectable. Please do NOT spend money on this bus and company !!!! There are plenty of other ways to see the beautiful Istanbul, definitely not this bus!!

Exactly what it said on the tin. Great trip around the European side of Istanbul, perfect for planning any sights you want to see on foot, included a crossing over the bosphorous bridge to Asia and back, well worth the price.Thank you muchly.

Very poor value. This bus is overpriced, slow, and impossible to see out of in the rain. The circuit is covered only once an hour so it can be a long wait between buses. The fee must be paid in euros and it's very high for what you get. Frankly, Istanbul doesn't work well for an open top tour. There just aren't enough places of interest outside the Old Town to warrant the cost, and the traffic is horrendous.

Good Overview of Istanbul. During a recent stay in Istanbul, we utilized the Big Bus Tour to tour the city and used the bus service as transportation from and between the major sites. The tour is well operated; provides adequate commentary (in a variety of languages); the buses operate frequently and the staff is helpful. Good job; there are two lines with the Red line being a bit longer and more interesting. We had no problem getting on and off the bus, and getting seats once on the bus, even though its always busy in Istanbul. This service is not expensive and a good way to see the sites and get an overview of this very large city.

Great way to hit Istanbul's highlights. We booked the full bus and boat 48-hour package and it was well-worth the price. The price was for both the "red and blue" lines and included the boat tour of the Bosphorus. If you just wanted an overview of Istanbul, the 24-hour bus package would be O.K. ...But if your plan is to hop-on/hop-off you will need the full 48 hours. To ride both lines would take approx. 4.5 hours. The buses can be crowded and at times the lines can be long to board. We purchased our tickets online without issue and saved 10-15%.There was some confusion regarding where to meet for the boat tour and when we spoke with the BB representative, Simon, he was very understanding and accomadating.***Be Warned...for the boat tour you meet at stop #1, near the Blue Mosque, and as a group of approx. 200 persons, walk down to the dock, which is approx. 10 minutes away. You do not board the boats at the main boat terminal, which is stop #2***

Good value and it has improved !. There used to be many companies offering HOHO sightseeing tours leaving in front of Hagia Sofia but in 2014 , BIG BUS Tours seems to be the only one left ! We had taken a similar tour in 2013 with City Sightseeing Tours and we found that the one offered this year to be more interesting and a better value for the price . The itineraries are very interesting and they now include a more complete tour of the Golden Horn and a quick incursion on the Asian side . The audio guide is reliable and the commentaries in English , French and Spanish are quite clear ! The only areas not covered any more are the walls and the fish market ! We also found the time table to be reliable as we stopped at 3 different locations !

Red Bus. Highly recommend Red Bus Tour, takes you around a much bigger & different area to the Blue Bus. Everyone does Sultanahmet Square by foot so it really isn't necessary to do the Blue Bus expensive for the price & just not worth it so ditch it as it takes you around the square & a little away from it. Red Bus passes Dolmabahce Palace, Grand Bazaar, Egytian Bazaar ,Asian side & a lot more so one can hop off & hop on after seeing these. Worth the price & enjoyable!

Rainy day saviour. We were in Istanbul for 7 days and there were two days when it rained quite a lot. The Big Bus tours came to our rescue and we went on both the Red and Blue routes. The Red route is ideal for visiting the Spice Bazaar, Dolmabahce Palace and the Bosphorus Bridge amongst many other places. The Blue route doesn't have as many of the main attractions but is good for the cable car and the Rahmi Koc Museum which, as far as we're concerned, is a hidden gem.

Good idea worked for us. Firstly having seen the volume of people on the trams and having a husband where he has to toast in the sun when ever he can this was ideal for us.Yes we fought our way on to the bus to pay (see review below) and sat in the sun upstairs. Yes the driving is erratic but the traffic is erratic in Istanbul like Cairo but more polite.We got off pottered about and then got back on later having witnessed more even stranger driving!!Worked well for us.

Only if you're happy to sit in traffic jams!. Traffic in Turkey is horrendous, and the buses, both red and blue route, get totally hemmed in due to it. The first service of the day doesn't leave Sultanhamet until 10am, so by the time it got to Taksim Square (where I was staying) it was 10.45am, then another 30 mins into the Grand Bazaar, so almost half the day gone. The service, if one can use that word, needs to begin at 8.00am. And the traffic heading back to Taksim at 5.30pm is worse than horrendous. Stop start all the way. It does give one a feel for the layout of the city. And as for the incessant Turkish music between the commentary - too much of a good thing will always spoil it. And I agree with previous reviewers in regard to the cost - expensive given the lack of service. The drivers are a mixed bunch, some very friendly and others clearly forgetful that we tourists are providing them with employment. Having said all that, there's not a great alternative to get around as much of Istanbul at a reasonable cost - paying for a taxi to sit in the same traffic jam seems quite pointless.

Can very much recommend. We needed a lazy day so took the red tour in the morning, had lunch and then did the blue tour in the afternoon (both came on the same ticket price). We saw so much of the city and were able to get a good perspective of where places of interest were situated, plus it took us over the Galata Bridge. The commentary was very good.

great way to see the city. We rode on both routes. Were disappointed that they stopped so early as we would have enjoyed seeing the sunset over Istanbul. Helpful staff: one driver was excellent, the other later in the day seemed in a hurry to get home!!

Good way to get overview of Istanbul. Very convenient as the bus was outside the ferry terminal when we arrived. Had bought tickets online to save some money which worked well. The headsets were a bit dodgy and didn't work in all the seats but the commentary was OK. We travelled round both routes which gave us a good overview of the city. The traffic varied so speed of the drive varied, but as traffic was heavy in the more central areas which gave plenty of time for photos etc. If you only have a short time in Istanbul this is a good way of seeing everything, then knowing where you want to go back and visit in more detail.

Not worth the time and money. So we took the bus tour...no headphones offered to listen to the commentary, wifi didn't work. Drive felt speed was the way forward as we alternated between acceleration towards stationary traffic and slamming on the breaks. Hopping off was taking you life in your hands as the ride was so jerky getting down the stairs was a risk! Expensive for very little benefit!

Great tour and transportation. We spend 3 days on this bus. We got on and off often. This is the ideal way to see this entire big city. We took both the Blue and Red tours and used this to go to the Asia side of Istanbul. We never waited more than 10 minutes for the next bus to arrive. The information and history lesson were very valuable. We used this instead of taxis and loved it.....highly recommended.

Forget the Big Bus, the Istanbulkart is the way to go.. Having misguidedly bought a ticket and suffered through the red route for a couple of hours with earpieces that only worked intermittently, I can recommend an alternative that is vastly cheaper and covers a much greater area of Istanbul. The Istanbulkart (the public transport pass). Buy one from a newspaper kiosk for $7, load it with credit at a tram stop - not difficult - and you're good to swipe your way onto trams, buses, ferries and even the funiculars. Istanbul is your oyster, for the amount a Big Bus ticket costs, you can criss-cross Istanbul many times on land and water and get a good feel for this wonderful city of 15 million. A tram trip costs a mere 3 TL whatever the length of the journey and it's much the same on the other forms of transport.One handy extra of the Istanbulkart is that it can swipe you in to public toilets which are otherwise inaccessible.No-brainer? Be brave, strike out on your own and see greater Istanbul.

Great day except ......... We did enjoy the two trips we did on the big bus but - it was a very hot day so wondering why the shade was not pulled across. The seat was very hot initially and the two hours (red route) and one half hours (blue route) was very exhausting in the sun and very uncomfortable. Also the audio did not work all the time - very frustrating! We were not the only ones who had problems!!

Pretty terrible. Managed to get on the bus and buy a ticket after getting past the guys hassling me to get on the bus and buy a ticket (I know that does not make sense but you will understand if you try it). The top deck was full except for 2 seats. The bus was old and poorly maintained. The headphone jacks did not work so we had no audio tour. Tried to get off at the next stop and get the next bus but there were so many people fighting to get on our full bus that we didn't want to risk getting stuck so could't get off. So if you want to pay 45 USD to sit on a bus for 2 hours and watch Istanbul go by then this is for you. Mind you it would be cheaper to just buy a ticket for local bus and sit on that. I would not recommend this tour to anyone and would give it negative stars if that were an option.

Traveling alone, it was the best choice to take this bus. Buying the ticket is a small investment because you can use it a couple days for the two routes. The traffic not always helps but it was safe and not too crowded in february. The view from the bridge that goes to Asia ia the best.

great tour!. very helpful, always on time, there is always places on the roof. helpful explanations in many languages for the landmarks you pass by. and the great news: WIFI AVAILABLE FOR FREE ON THE BUSthe only problem is that it doesn't stop everywhere (like the grand bazar)

Great way to see Istanbul - and at €25 if you booked on-line for 24 hours great value. The buses take you right round the Golden Horn and over Ortekoy/Bosphorus Bridge to a museum on the Asian side. Passes most of the main attractions in Istanbul, the commentary worked and was reasonably comprehensible. Staff helpful. Free wifi on the route so take your mobile/cell/iPad etc to catch up on emails and news at no extra cost. Frequent service, last trips begin at 17.45 (Blue Route) and 18.00 (Red Route). Best place to change routes is at Sultanahmet (between Hafia Sophia and the Blue/Sultanahmet Mosque, although you can do at Eminonu but you have to walk further and it is more difficult finding the stop (we did both). Enjoy.

Great for those wanting to see the traffic of Istanbul!. Sadly, given the poor traffic in Istanbul you could literally waste hours sitting stationary broken up with the odd site worth noting. We did the red route at around 4pm and it took nearly three hours to get to Taksim from the Blue Mosque, a trip which would of taken 20 minutes on the tram and metro.You would really be better of taking public transport and getting off to take pictures where necessary.At 30 Euros each, it is also very poor value.

Not reliable they change the timing with no regards to tourists schedule. Those people have deceived us. They said that we can use it for 24 hrs; however they did not say that the bus stop at 7pm and they said it will start at 9am however it will start at 10.30 am!! Those people stole our money and time. .The manager and the staff are not helpful they said that they are not responsible for anything and we should call the company! ! The agent took our money so the agent should solve the issue. . We told the manager u said it starts at 9am so he replied that that was yesterday but today at 10! They change the timings as they wish with no regards to tourists scheduleNot recommended in Istanbul

A great tour of Istanbul. One of our recent cruise destinations was Istanbul and thanks to the power of Trip advisor I was able to find and book the Big Bus tour of Istanbul prior to us going. Got off the ship and walk 2 minutes to the bus. The accepted the paperwork and off we went. We did both tours with excellent english audio guide and we got off in several of the paces and got on the buss after. It is the best way to get round a big city and still se all the sights.

Traffic. Took the tour on the spur of the moment as the lines waiting for the attractions in Sultanhamet Square were terribly long. Yes it is expensive and there are probably better options such as using public transport so if the money is a worry, don't go. I found the commentary okay, it was damn hot though on too of that bus when caught in the unceasing traffic. Take plenty of water with you and sunscreen and a hat. It serves the purpose of giving a good overview of Istanbul and it can drop you off ag some of the more remote places which are much quieter.

An excellent way to see the city. The big bus in Istanbul operates two routes named the red and the blue. Purchasing a ticket entitles you to use either route and you can hop on and hop off as many times as you wish to visit attractions along the routes. The tickets are valid for 24 hours or for 48 hours (which is the better value) from the first time of use. So by buying a 48 hour ticket at 16.00 hours on a Wednesday for example you can use it all the following day and up until 16.00 hours on the Friday.Starting from near Hagia Sophia,the red route passes Dolmabache Palace, crosses the Bosphorus bridge to the Asian side and then comes back to the city via Taksim Square. The blue route also starts near Hagia Sophia and goes around the Golden Horn. Earphones are provided so that you can enjoy one of the audio guides which are available in several languages as you tour the city. If you are on a short visit to Istanbul the big bus tours are an excellent way to maximize your time.

Great! Never waited more than 10 minutes. This bus company was parked outside the Blue Mosque and the worker in oerfect English told me the routes and times etc, 30 euros for the day...perhaps steep but as I only had one day in Istanbul I was fine with it. The bus left promptly, the free headphones allow you to listen to informed commentary in your language and the free wifi helps too. Got off one bus back at Blue Mosque and straight onto the second route! Had a storm but the stsff quick to cover the roof and side windows.Cannot complain at all!

Reasonable, good service, reliable. A good and reliable option for exploring Istanbul. I tried the same service in NYC. Vegas, Amsterdam, Paris and London. It does what it should do; covers the city along two routes, shows you the main attractions. Waiting for 30 minutes, instead of the usual 15, was not such a big deal. Traffic was reasonable across the day. I'd certainly recommend it especially for 48 hours at a small difference of price compared to the 24 hour ticket.

Poor knowledge. I have tried this tour in all over the Europe but this one was the worst. The tour only covers a very small amount of attractions among all those beautifull attractions. All othere countries have a bus in the station every 15 min but theirs was evey 30 min. The staff working there had no knowledge of the attractions. Even when I showed them an adress and asked them which stop is the closest to the area 5 of them could not answer me.unlike europe non of the buses had live guid and the recorded guid was not educational and informative at all.

Bad experience. Waist of time and waist of money. Big bus team didn't respect their customers. I bought ticket from taxsim square for 90 lira and salesman told me that bus is coming every 20 min. I waited for more than one and half hours without any bus coming. When I asked the Egyptian salesman to return my money back he start screaming and speaking bad word "if you want your money go to police, they will not help you" this is what he said.I complain to bigbus in the official website for more than one month without replay. They take advantage from other bigbus in other city. My advice don't waist your time and money.

Expensive and you go to Asia!!!. Hola all, We didn't have much of a game plan getting off our cruise ship in Istanbul, we knew this bus was an option or that we could easily walk over to the Hagia Sofia and Grand Bazaar ourselves. We didn't want to waste a lot of time walking to our destinations and thought we could see more of Turkey with the bus. If you were only going to take the bus over to the Hagia Sofia and Grand Bazaar, save your money and walk or get a cab. There is a ton to do in this area and the bus would not be good value for you. For cruise passengers, the bus is waiting for you outside the cruise terminal and takes you to stop 1 (Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque). From here you can grab either the blue or red line. We walked around, had a lunch and then hopped on the Red Line. We didn't get off at any stops (due to time, there were about 4 or 5 that interested us) and were so excited to go to Asia (red line only). The sound quality of the tour and headphones were great and we learned a lot on our 2 hour tour. It was more expensive than other ho ho buses we've done, but the tour was excellent and gave us a brief view of Istanbul that we couldn't have done on foot.

A great way to see Istanbul and also go briefly into Asia!. Surprised at the negative reports for this service. It is a bit more expensive than the red buses in other cities but we felt our 30 euros each for 2 days was money well spent as over the two days we went on the two routes - the one we did twice. The buses come to the dock gates and on the first day took us straight to the old part without doing the full circuit into Asia. The only wind noise we had with the earphones was going over the Bosporus bridge into Asia but it was exceptionally windy. Otherwise the headphones worked fine, sometimes you needed to pull the plug out a little to get good contact. Drivers and other staff very helpful.

BIG WASTE OF MONEY BUS. Staff friendly enough when taking your money but that's where it ends.Audio quality very poor + stopped completely on left side of bus when only 20 mins into the trip.At that point staff didn't understand English + totally uninterested,not even advising new people boarding the bus.Have written 2 emails to complain but not even an acknowledgement .AVOID + save your money.

worked great for us!. I am amazed that someone thinks 30 euro for TWO DAYS worth of hop on/off in a city as big as Istanbul is too expensive. We were able to visit the European side and Asian side using only BigBus and the awesome ferrybots. We bookedBig Bus at the hotel , took the first tour with our headphones (helped alot to get your bearings and the names of different spots) and used it as a way to decide where we wanted to return to or not. Rode it like a taxi thruout the day. Drivers are very nice and even dropped us right at our hotel each time. Next day we took the second tour and AGAIN decided what we would want to return to and what was a miss. If you use the service correctly it is way better than cabs or the public transport.

Not so bad. Take a day tour with them to have a general over view of the city, they provide you with the ear phones, so hear the details in 8 different languages. I preferred traveling on my own with Metro and buses, you really don't need this service. Not a bad choice if you are a solo traveler. They charge you less if you book through online.

Beautiful twin tours but expensive. This tour gets you around Istanbul, gives you the feel of the city but it is expensive compared to other cities. You can see many places but almost no service. The driver was helpful though. If you take the tour during the week in early hours you will not hit the traffic. Can be tried but only once if you agree to pay a high price.
Istanbul Big Bus. Give it a miss!! You spend too much time in traffic. The cost of 30€ is too high. No value for money.

Screwing the tourists. A bus organization which offers daily 1-2 hr tours through the town..A terrible experience:1-They charge you in TL 90.- liras..( the official price is 30 euros=84.-TL !!) So you will be screwed 6.-TL just by exchange rate !!2-The busses are not clean enough and no water etc on board..3-The tours can variate up to the rush hours etc..Better forget it and keep your nerves .....

Just get a taxi to sultanahmet square. As per the title just take a taxi to sultanahmet square, you can walk from there to anything of interest. The tour commentary is often a commentary for the sake of it. Sound quality is poor. The traffic is terrible and it just rakes ages and apart from the square it's pointless

Waste of time, traffic was horrible!. Wend for a full tour on Saturday afternoon, it was nightmare. The total tour was about 3 hours for a loop !!!The staff was not helpful, did not have any information about Istanbul cities and place to visit.

Expensive plus Istanbul traffic does not lend itself to a Bus Tour. 30 Euros pp which is expensive compared to the Hop On Hop Off Big Red bus tour (20 Euro and a better route!)Istanbul traffic is horrendous - best to use trams to get around. The audio quality is sub standard (annoying filler music is louder than the audio which and is VERY annoying).2 routes available - blue and red (50% of blue route is same as the red route)Main start point is near the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque which is fine - but you get NO info on these on the audio guide unless you remain on the route for the entire journey (last legs they are mentioned!)I have been on several bus tours around the world and this was the worst by far. Istanbul does not lend itself to buses and this is evident on the route which simply cannot pass 2-3 large attractions. The sheer volume of traffic in IST means it can take several hours to do the route.Disappointing and expensive for what you get and poor levels of knowledge on the audio guide not always provided at the correct time (prob due to traffic jams)

Worthwhile!. This may seem like a lot of money at 30 Euros, but it is in fact two city tours which you can take within a 24-hour period and we found it well worth the money. We stayed on the bus but it was our choice. On another occasion we visited the Miniaturk park which we had discovered while on the tour. Use the earphones offered to get descriptions of places along the way in the language of your choice.

Total waste on time and money. As the traffic in Istanbul is terrible (at least in Saturday afternoons, when we tried to have a tour), our bus stood in jams mostly, total red line trip took much over two hours until it became dark. At first we tried to listen to the audio guide, which actually talked about sights that had not arrived yet due to the traffic jam; then the audio guide played local music and finally, when it was dark outside and cold in bus (February evenings are cold in Istanbul, too), it stopped alltogether. Probably the drivers' working hours also had stopped as there were no comments form his side as well as no stops any more. As we finally noticed a recognizable sight of the Egyptian Bazaar, we demanded a stop and fled from the bus.Afterwards we joked, that if the three of us would have paid the total cost of three tickets to some decent taxi driver, we probably would have got a much better overview of Istanbul. On the other hand, where to find a decent taxi driver in there...

Useful but infrequent off season. This is a good idea but if you get off to look at a place of interest it can be three hours before the next bus comes. This may or may not be okay depending on your plans.Drivers very helpful but please treat them with respect. One lot of tourists were unpleasant when through their own fault missed their stop. When the driver did stop for other group of tourist as soon as it was safe to do so, the tourist did not even thank him!
Good audio. I used this as a way to see the city. Go on these the first day - don't expect to really hop on and off. The audio part was great.

good way to see the city quickly. We enjoy the bus rides as a way to get an overview of the city and see where we want to visit. This tour showed us the city but really made few allowances to hop off to visit. The bus was clean, audio sets were good. We made a lot of loops around the same places though. It seemed like the stops were rather random and disorganized.

Hopped Off, Couldn't Hop Back On. We hopped off at the Egyptian Market, strolled around for awhile and returned to the bus pick up spot...we waited for over an hour and no bus came. We got fed up and just walked back to our hotel by the Blue Mosque. Why pay when you don't get a full round trip drive??

Great variety of most of Istanbul. I can,t believe the poor reviews, we went on the bus yesterday and thoroughly enjoyed it. The audio transcript was very good and very clear, perhaps it has been upgraded since the last reviews.The bus went past most sights and gave interesting information about each place.do go it is a good introduction to Istanbul.

It is what you make of it. Having just left the gorgeous city of Istanbul, I wanted to put down my thoughts on the City Windows 'Hop on Hop off' tour - we took the blue route, which offered us a two hour two around some of the major sites - it allowed to check out what was available and gave us a perspective on times to reach locations, etc. The tours guides were knowledgeable and helpful, and we bought a ticket that gave us 48 hours of usage, and included a Bosphorus boat cruise as well - while the price of 45 Euros per person might have seemed steep - to cover all the locations by cab, would have cost more, so we felt it was worth the money - particularly the two hour boat cruise.So despite everyone's negative comments, would like to give them a thumbs up for being what we needed for our trip. The buses were clean, comfortable and the audio tour was helpful.Only negative would be that the music between the commentary was an irritating loop, but that's all.

Not the red bus tour. In a number of cities we have used the red hop on bus tours and have been very pleased I tried to book for Istanbul before we left but was informed they had been suspended . On arrival in Istanbul we thought we would try the only alternative but were not impressed we only took the 1 hour trip and if the 2 hour was the same we're lucky I have never been on a hop on that went so fast.

Not worth the money. Be careful if you use this service because the traffic is so bad that it doesn't run to a timetable. We only got off twice to look at 2 palaces and it took all day. At one hop on stop we waited for an hour and a half in the rain for the bus to return. When it did, it was totally packed and I got squashed in the door. People were not game to get off to see sights because you had no way of knowing how long you would have to wait to get the next bus. On the day we used this service I would not say it was value for money.

A complete waste of time and money. We got conned into thinking this and the associated boat tour would be a good way to get a feel for Istanbul, something that we've found useful in many a city. Unfortunately we could not have been more wrong. We started with the boat tour which involved a very large group of people being herded along a not insignificant distance to the boat- the fact that the boat had a limited capacity and therefore a limited number of tickets should be sold did not seem to occur to these con artists (even though one of the ticket sellers tried to scam us into believing there was pre-allocated seating). Having been shepherded on board with not a seat to be had we ended up having to stand in the full heat of the sun for 2.5 hours. Whilst this would have been unpleasant enough, all those who wanted a smoke on this NO smoking boat trip were then steered our way as well. So for 2.5 hours we stood in the sun, the smoke and the noise without being able to hear a word of the commentary and counted the minutes until it was over. Then, having already paid for the blue line tour, we made our way back to where the buses departed from. As other reviews have mentioned there is no timetable for the buses (they only leave when the bus is full) so you really cannot use this as a hop on, hop off service at all. The early signs here weren't promising either- first the departure was held up while we waited for a Spanish couple's 2 teenage daughters to show up (it seems waiting for the bus to depart didn't appeal to them so they'd just wandered off). Secondly, all of 2 mins into the tour we pulled into a petrol station where we spent 10 mins filling up. Finally we were seemingly on our way, only we weren't because the traffic was so bad. The commentary was virtually non-existent, the route was terrible and all in all this was just a horrible waste of time and money. Save yourself the time and frustration and find a better option.

No't good no matter what they said. It wasn't exact as i've expected, although ihave another experience in other country and I know what's like going in a trip in one of those kinds of bus, this bus was so fast we could't even see the places especially when we drive by the Tourist places as I know before we reach the tourist plces they have to say it and to stop when we reached it, but they just drive faster and they simply going nearby it and keep driving this is really not what they have been talk about it in the Web or in the brochure so they are a group of thieves. I was really annoyed there's alot more than this but I think this enough.I don't recommend anyone to go with this company for tourist Buses. hopefully this will lightening up your travel even a littile.

Not worth the money. Normally when we go on city breaks we find the best way to see the city is by using hop on hop off bus. Unfortunately this is not the case in Istanbul. We didn’t do any research before buying our tickets otherwise we wouldn’t have bothered. There are 2 routes a blue and green which we did on two different days. One takes 2hrs 15 min and the other 1hr 15min. The longer route actually took 4 hours due to sitting in traffic jams most of the time with very little to see. The short trip lasted the stated time but we didn’t really see anything more industrial areas.I would not recommend using this form of transport as everywhere that you would want to see can be accessed by either the tram or other public transport.

Don't waste you money and your time on this bus. We always take a Hop on / Hop off city tour in any city offering one as it is usually a fantastic way to view a large area in an efficient way, with the flexibility to get to tourists sites that may be hard to do independently and bus tours of this type are usually value for money. Beware - NONE of those things apply to the City Windows Travel Hop on Hop Off Bosphorus Sightseeing. There are two main routes, the Imperial Peninsula (Blue line) and the Golden Horn Tour (Green Line). The ticket sellers (touts) assured us that if we handed over our €20 each fare, we could travel on either route - not so - we had to argue with the Green line bus "host" and he had to get our tickets altered by his boss before we could get on our chosen bus. Beware also that not all the stops marked on the glossy flyer are actually stops at which you can get off - the bus only stops at some unless you ask the on board hostess to ask the driver for you. There is also no timetable at all printed on this glossy - no start or finish time for the tours and no idea of how many buses are running hour. We particularly wanted to see two sites Eyup Sultan Mosque and Aynlikavak Palace so negotiated a stop at each. After visiting we sat / stood for an hour at each stop waiting for another passing bus. The headphone commentary is OK but as the traffic holds up the route considerably often the voice was out of synch with the view from the window, also you had to constantly turn the volume up or down as the musical interlude between speaking was so much louder than the voice track. One driver was in such a bad mood that we had to hang onto our seats as he shot along some of the few free running parts of the roads and there was no hope of taking any photos as we approached attractions that were not stops as you could not hang onto your seat and use your camera at the same time. I could write more of this but just believe me this is a total rip off - use your €40 for something else. I had read the Tripadvisor bad reviews before we made up our mind to take the bus and I should have trusted the TA community to be right!!

Stay off the hop on bus. This was the down side to our stay in Istanbul. Sat on the bus waiting for the bus to fill up, even though we were told only 5 minutes before we leave. Audio was very poor, it was reset by the driver a number of times. Supposedly a 2 hour trip, most of which is going around the same circuit, not the circuit they sell you. Staff were very unprofessional, they tried a number of scams to get more money from each passenger, exchanging headsets then charging €5 for the "upgrade", taking your ticket to check it, then saying it was not the proper ticket. This was tried on a number of women travelling on their own. A total unpleasant experience.

Hop On and Hop Off Rip Off. This is the worst hop on hop off I have ever been on in the World. They dont stop at all the reported compulsory stops. They dont leave on time, make you wait until the bus is completly full. There is then not enough time to get around in 1 day as you could spend up to 4 hrs of your day just waiting for a bus. I gave up eventually - after waiting 1.5hrs for the first trip, hopping off at Sultanahmet, went and looked at some sights, came back and the bus was due to leave in 5mins, according to the printed timetable, I was then told it wouldnt leave for around another 45 mins as it wasn't full again. I asked for a partial credit as this again ruined the day, we had lunch plans in another location, and they would not budge at all. mThey just directed me to a taxis! Stick to the tram and the taxis.

Use the Tram.Don't waste your time and money, use the tram.. Don't waste your time and money, use the tram. The worse hop-on hop-off bus that i ever used.They passed on the same place 3 times on the same journey. Take more than a hour on the first departure place, because they are waiting to catch more turists.

Istanbul Night Bus tours. An absolute scam, 1 hours bus ride to the highest point in Istanbul (Asian Side) took 1 & 1/2 hours, traffic jam all over the city. Only to be taken to the ONLY cafe/ restaurant Mavera Cafe Restaurant There was no other option around the area.,Was informed by guides around the square,before paying €25 for a day & night bus tour. Told us there would be shops & cafe,s & restaurant,s for the 1 hour stop over, Mavera Cafe restaurant service extremely bad, food the worst I have every had. View was lovely .... Really Really awful ... Australian Tourist

RIP OFF BRICK OFF. Bad service incl leaving people on the stop and the English audio guide didn't work well. Staff was quite unprofessional and most them rude in the end. Bad experience, cannot recommend this at all.

Hideous, atrocious, barefaced, daylight robbery.. I've never felt moved to post on Tripadvisor before, but this experience was so horrific I feel it is my civic duty to warn others of this shockingly bad 'bus tour'. The only reason I've given it a star at all is because it is impossible on Tripadvisor to give no stars when writing a review. We went to Taksim Square hoping to get a red City Bus Tour, like those you see in cities all over the world. Having only 3 days in Istanbul we felt this would be the best way to orientate outselves and get an overview of the city. We found a red city tour bus at Taksim square and bought tickets from a red uniformed City Bus operator. They told us to wait as we would be going on a different bus. We waited for over half and hour and then they told us they would drive us to our bus which was stuck in traffic. That was ok and off we went. We met the other bus, which was not a red city tour bus but a blue City Windows bus, and got on. Unfortunately we'd already bought tickets so we just went with it. We crawled along in traffic on a motorway with very little to see and nothing coming out of the audio guide but what sounded like Turkish progressive rock for over an hour. Then the driver tried to take a short cut and almost crashed, pitching half the people on the bus almost out of their seats. Eventually we reached the bridge linking both sides of Istanbul, this would have been a great view but we went across at a terrific speed and could barely open our eyes on the open upper deck, let alone see anything! We went up a mountain road on the other side at which point our audio guides were abruptly taken back, we had heard a total of one piece of information. A short mention of a Naval museum which was on the opposite side of the road from the side indicated on the audio guide. There was no other info coming from the audio guides, just the Turkish music. When we got to the top of the mountain we were unceremoniously dumped out and told we'd be picked up in an hour. There were a series of cafes and restaurants in this spot but nothing else and no sign of any taxis. We were quite a long way from town at this point and completely at the mercy of the unbelievably rude tour operators with no option but to eat at one of the restaurants with whom they obviously have a scam going. We were more fortunate than some of the other passengers, as one English couple we spoke to had been on the "tour" for 1.5 hours before we joined it, also crawling through motorway traffic. These people were meant to be rejoining their cruise ship at 9.30 but it was already 9pm (on what was meant to be a two hour journey in total), the driver just shrugged when he was told about this. I was very reluctant to eat in any of the restaurants out of principle but we decided that since they had, at least, good views, we would have something small. We got desserts in Cafe Balcoon, where staff were at best completely disinterested and at worst horribly rude. When presented with the bill, we were charged the equivalent of 6 pounds sterling more than what we should have been charged. When we queried it we were told that this was for the bowl of nuts that were sitting on all the tables! We had, between two of us, a total of 5 pistachio nuts from this bowl. We paid it, but out of principle I took all the remaining nuts, bowl and all, and told them I would do this. They didn't put up much of a fight, probably because they knew they were already taking the mickey. We eventually made it back to Taksim Square, with another 90 mile an hour eye watering flight across the Bosphorus, at 11pm. The "tour" was a complete and utter waste of money and time in our 3 day otherwise wonderful trip to Istanbul. Please take my advice and avoid it at all costs! We learned absolutely nothing about Istanbul, were brought to no sights whatsoever (save the admittedly nice view from the mountain we were abandoned on and preyed upon), we were treated abysmally, and it left us and everyone else totally browned off. The bus passengers were unanimously unhappy in the extreme. Horrific experience. Don't take it if you know what's good for you.

Great arrangements from a 1st class agency. When I suggested this company to one of my colleagues I knew she was not going to be disappointed. I asked them to arrange round trip transfers from airport and a full day tour in Istanbul and they did a great job. In the same day she toured the city and she was able to catch her flight to Cyprus. I would definitely recommend them to my friends again.

Turkey is safe & Ahmet is great.. I am an American citizen and I just got back from Istanbul and Izmir in Turkey. Both places are safe and open for tourism. We booked a tour with Ahmet for Istanbul because we were unsure how safe we would feel walking around by ourselves. Having said that, we did several walks by ourselves and felt perfectly safe and found the people of Turkey very nice and helpful (some carpet and service people were a little annoying). We booked a guided tour with Ahmet and were not disappointed. He changed the booked schedule up because of one of the locations being closed the day we chose the tour and he was very accommodating with alternative locations and taking the tram for a location that was further away (we were on a walking tour). The professional tour guides in Turkey must go to university and do four years and pass an exam before they can get their license. The tour guides are very knowable and in particular if you choose Ahmet, you will not be disappointed. He knows Turkey of old and freely discusses the new Turkey. If you are interested in Istanbul and the excellent sites, please go and enjoy all that Turkey has to offer.

Summer vacation . This one day guided tour was excellent. It started with a short walk from hotel to the historical area of Sultan Ahmed or Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia and KopTopia place then we took a Bosphoru cruise. At the of tour we went the grand bazar where you do lots of shopping, here you must know how to bargain.

Incredible 2 Day Tour- Highly Recommend. I cannot recommend this tour enough. I took the opportunity to schedule a two-day city tour of Istanbul with Metin Yilmaz. The first day was a traditional day of touring the major sites of Istanbul, although we did deviate happily a few times to explore and do some things that were unique. The second day had us do some more traditional sites Spice Market, Palace, Bosphorus River Tour, but we again went off the schedule to explore some great eateries and sights as well.Metin was an absolute joy to be around during our tour. His command of the city, as well as his obvious love in what he does as a guide, was the highlight of our trip. One thing I am glad we did was to ask him where we might eat that he loves and dines at frequently, and not the traditional tourist dining options. I am so glad we did. We had some of the best food in out trip as a result.My recommendation to potential tourists would be to know what you absolutely want to do, but then work with Metin to do some things off the beaten path which will only enrich your experience and give you a true taste of Istanbul.We had such a wonderful time with Metin. I would definitely recommend my friends to book with him should they visit the city. Without a doubt, I would do it again the next time I travel to Istanbul.

A magical voyage in time. A magical voyage in time is how I describe our guided tour with Ahmet in Istanbul. Extremely knowledgeable about the sites and country's past and present. Though not my first visit, I still enjoyed it and learned more. A wonderful experience that I highly recommend.
Amazing tour. It wasn't our 1st time in Istanbul, But thanks to our guide Ahmet it was remarkable. He was knowledgeable, decent and very attentive. I highly recommend this tour.

Great Private Tour. We spent a full day touring with Ahmet. He was flexible, knowledgeable and took extra time to accompany us on our Bosphorus cruise. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Great full day tour!. We had a great experience with our tour guide Ahmet yesterday in Istanbul! He was extremely knowledgable about the sites and completely flexible to our schedule/interests. I'd highly recommend him and the company to those visiting for the first time!

Excellent 3 day tour with Ahmet. Guided Istanbul Tours was recommended by a friend and we arranged 3 day tour of Istanbul including old city, Bosphorus cruise and Asian side of the city. We really enjoyed the tour and our guide Ahmet was very informative and friendly. We would highly recommend Guided Istanbul Tours and Ahmet as a guide

Backstreets food tour. Yum!. It was a very good experience as this tour took us to the unusual spots of Istanbul. Our guide Rosa did not only inform us about food but also history. We made lots of tastings of traditional Turkish food such as kebap, kuskus meatballs, delicious appetizers and deserts. Food was great as well as our tour guide Rosa. Thanks again for the great day.

Best Way to Explore Istanbul!. This was a mother/daughter trip with my daughter and her best friend and friends Mom. Since we were only going to be in country for 3 days we wanted to see as much as we could see so asked out Hotel concierge to suggest a package. Before booking we a quick google to check out the reviews and they were not good. My daughter than found Guided Istanbul Tours and saw the many fantastic reviews for Ahmet. Best decision EVER!!!. My daughter's friend Mom had some walking challenges so we opted for the private tour with the trailing van to minimize the walking into between sites. We booked the tour late on Friday evening (moments before the office closed). My daughter phoned the office and explained our situation and put in a request for Ahmet for a next morning tour. We were so pleased that our request was honored. Ahmet met us at our hotel a few minutes before the appointed time. He was so personable and the four of us knew right off that this was going to be a great day of exploring. He was so very courteous, knowledgeable open to all types of questions and considerate especially for our traveling companion who had walking challenges. If you are planning to take a private tour, we highly recommend "Guided Istanbul Tours" and Ahmet as a guide. Can't say enough good things about this young man.

Well Spent 2 Days with Rosa. We took 2 day private tour with Guided Istanbul Tours and we truly enjoyed both days with our guide Rosa. On our first day we did the old city walking tour. Second day of tour was very interesting as well. We did Bosphorus cruise and visited Spice Market and Dolmabahce palace which was one of the highlight of our tour. Rosa was terrific and she knows great places of shopping. We learnt so much about the city. Guided Istanbul Tours did a great job keeping us informed, and I would definitely recommend using their services.

Wonderful tour with Ahmet. Ahmet met us at our apartment and discussed what sites we were interested in. He even helped us decide what tours to take over the next 10 days and how we should handle the tour if we decided to do a tour on our own. He was so helpful, carefully telling us about each of our ideas and how we might fit them in our timeline. As a family of 7 (parents and young adult children), our private tour with Ahmet took us to the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazar. This was our first full day in Istanbul and we wanted to get a "feel" for the city. Ahmet was everything we wanted and more!!! He told us DETAILS that are not found in any tour book or video. Being able to ask questions and get through intelligent / thoughtful answers was wonderful. The cost of our personal private tour was so much affordable than other tour agencies that charge by the person!The colleges in Istanbul have a major for "tour directors" and Ahmet was a graduate of one of these colleges. The curriculum includes not only English but thorough knowledge of the Istanbul and all of Turkey. Ahmet was excellent and I'd ABSOLUTELY use him again on future Turkey travels.

The best way to get to know Istanbul and the history. We met in the morning with tourguide Ahmet Yildirum not far from the Blue Mosque. He explained in a very compact and pleasant way the history of Turkey. We went with him to the Blue Mosque, to the Topkapi Palace, the Aya Sofia, visited the historic underground watersystem and had a Turkish lunch with a view over the Bosphorus. This guided tour gave good content to our trip.

Another great experience of culinary tour. This was the second tour I booked with this company and never a dull moment. Booking process was very easy with their website. And the travel consultant Melissa was a pro about creating great itineraries for our needs. Our energetic, passionate and knowledgable guide Rose met us at our hotel and we did an amazing food tour. We figured out that this was a must tour in Istanbul to be able to know each food on streets. The tour was very entertaining and Rose showed us the hidden corners of the city which were not in itinerary, off the beaten track, she made us feel so special and comfortable.At the end of the tours we said goodbye and we will definitely see each other again. I would highly suggest this company and Rose in Turkey.

A private and individualized tour of Istanbul and a Bosphorus river cruise - Wonderful!. This was a private tour of Istanbul combined with a cruise of the Bosphorus: Guided Istanbul tours greeted me at my hotel, and let me set the tone and the pace. I had completed some basic research and knew what I wanted to see. My guide Ahmet took this one step further and enabled me to assist him in determining what I sites I should experience to make the best use of my time. He did this by initiating a pleasant dialog that allowed me to communicate just what I wanted to gain from this personal and private tour.The tour company: Good communication, my tour was confirmed immediately by e-mail. Once I was in Turkey, I also spoke to a company representative just to re-confirm my tour arrangements. They were very friendly and helpful and let me know when and where my guide would meet me, they even let me know the name of my guide.My tour guide: He was early, in fact I was late - this tells you a lot about the tour guide and the tour company, Professional very easy going personality, immediately made me feel comfortable and welcome.Do you want someone who has rehearsed the facts and figures, or do you want a guide that sincerely knows what he or she is talking about. I felt that Ahmet was a student of his own craft, he learned the history behind places and historical figures he was showing me.I was made to feel welcome, as a tourist in an unfamiliar city and country, this is very important as well as comforting.The best thing about a private tour with Guided Istanbul Tours: They were professional, they were understanding of my needs and what I wanted to get out of this tour, they let me set the tone and the pace of my tour. Plain and simple, they gave me the Istanbul experience I was looking for. I highly recommend taking a private and personal tour with this company. You will not get the same kind of personal attention when you're shuffling around from site to site in a large group. I would book with them again, absolutely!

Istanbul and Ahmet - What a combination !!. We just returned from almost four days in Istanbul. Two full days were spent with our guide Ahmet - what a charming and gracious individual. He knows his way around all of the great sites and has resources for views and shopping that blew us away. Ahmet helped to make the wonderful city of Istanbul even more wondrous. Thank you so much, Ahmet, Michael and Anita.

Istanbul Tour from Port. We had a day in Istanbul via cruise ship and wanted to get the most out of the time available. I would definitely recommend this company that arranged for us and our friends a complete day tour of Istanbul. Our private guide Rosa was very knowledgeable and made the day trip well worth it!

Amazing tour of Istanbul. We contacted Guided Istanbul Tours by recommendation of a friend and were not disappointed at all. We booked two tours and had an excellent experience. Rosa, the initial contact, was very patient and informative in helping us determine what exactly we were looking for and our guide Ahmet was extremely knowledgeable of the historic sites that he brought us to. I would definitely use Guided Istanbul Tours again.

Excellent guided experience. I'm very glad I had the guiding services of Ahmet Yildirim for 2 days. His communication skills were excellent, as was his knowledge of the city and its history and culture. And I also have to mention how friendly, accommodating and helpful he was at all times. He also took us to a couple of great lunches where we enjoyed some tasty examples of the local food. It was so easy to visit the main sights of Istanbul with Ahmet as not only did he know the quickest ways to get to them but had even bought tickets in advance for the second day after he had confirmed what we wanted to see. Normally I'm happy to explore on my own and quite enjoy navigating with maps and even public transport but with limited time in Istanbul he helped to maximise my time there to see the various sights in this fascinating city.

Great day with Guide Ahmet. My husband and I took private tour of old city with Ahmet from Guided İstanbul Tours. It was amazing. Ahmet was knowledgeable, witty, engaging, and welcoming. It felt like we were walking through Istanbul's sights with friend. we had only one day otherwise we probably would have done another tour with Him. It was a great day and I would recommend this company and Ahmet to anyone going to Istanbul. Thanks again for setting us up with such a great guide!

Istanbul-Tour with Ahmet. Guided Istanbul Tours was recommended to us and all of our dealings with Rosa before our tour, were excellent. Our guide was named Ahmet and his knowledge of the city, the history of the sights and his insight to the art was outstanding. Everyone in our group of 6 was very pleased with his presentation and knowledge. I highly recommend Ahmet and Guided Istanbul Tours. Thanks to Ahmet!

Combined Istanbul Tour. Our guide Ahmet from Guided Istanbul Tours met us at the hotel. He was fantastic. He has a lot of knowledge. We combined this tour on one day, with a tour of old city and Bosphorus. We are all so glad with did the tour, and would for sure do it again. Guided Istanbul tour is highly recommended.

Ahmet Yildirim. Ahmet Yildirim was the phenomenal guide we used in Istanbul! His vast knowledge of the history, politics, architecture of the Ottoman Empire and Turkish culture is unsurpassed. Every question we had, throughout our educational day, was answered with great humour and intelligence. Ahmet has a degree from the University of Istanbul in Tour Guiding. We would highly recommend Ahmet to everyone who wants a spectacular day, in Istanbul, using a Professional Tour Guide!

5 stars to Rosa!!!!. We went on a guided tour of Istanbul old city with 'Guided Istanbul Tours'. Our tour guide was named 'Rosa' and she was literally amazing. She was very enthusiastic and really went into detail about everything to do with the history of the sites. Not only that but she spoke excellent English. Another benefit of the tour was that we were able to skip the line since we had a private tour guide. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our day, and we also learnt a lot too. 5 stars to Rosa.

Great 2 Day tour of Istanbul. We found Guided Istanbul Tours on Tripadvisor and we booked two tours with them. We had great time during both of the tours. Firstly we visited sites in the old city such as Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi palace. First day tour takes some walking so comfy walking shoes would be suggested. Second day was less tiring as we had a private van and Bosphorus Cruise was very enjoyable and relaxing. Istanbul became one of favorite cities. We really enjoyed the history and shopping opportunities. Special thanks to our guide Ahmet.

excellent. We had only a short time in Istanbul and we wanted to see as much as possible. After searching for a tour company on Tripadvisor we came across Guided Istanbul Tours. As they had excellent review, we decided to book our walking tour for old city with them. We were met by our guide Ahmet Yildirim at our hotel. Not only he had alot information about the places but also was excellent and efficient in his presentation. We really enjoyed the tour.

Istanbul Combo Tour. Via the review on Tripadvisor, we decided to go with Guided Istanbul Tours. We made a perfect choice. We did Istanbul combo tour and it included all the musts of Istanbul. We did Blue mosque, Hagia Sophia, Bosphorus cruise and local bazaars. It was a great experience and we will definitely use Guided Istanbul Tours again.

Istanbul attractions. The guide was excellent!!! He took us to a lot of the different attractions in Istanbul on foot. He gave us a lot of information about each attraction, the history behind it, history about the city and answered every question we had. He was very knowledgeable and I would highly recommend him.

Istanbul Walking Tour. Ahmet was a wonderful guide, arrived promptly at our hotel, and took very good care of us. His english is excellent, and he was very knowledgeable about the history of his city and country. We learned so much about the Roman Empire, the Ottoman Empire, and the modern Turkish Republic. Thank you Ahmet!

Fantastic Tour to See Istanbul city. The Guided Istanbul Tour was an incredible experience to see the city in great depth. Our tour guide Metin was fantastic, he was incredibly friendly and fun. He was very knowledgable regarding all the monuments and the Turkish history and geography. He was very helpful, organised and accommodating to our needs. I would highly recommend Metin as guide for the Istanbul Tours.

Ahmet was an incredible tour guide and shared what life in Turkey was really like.. Ahmet's English was perfect, his manners impeccable, and his patience with our energetic and animated family was limitless.Our family only had a few days in Istanbul before our cruise departed and we had lots we wanted to see. Ahmet found a wonderful driver who helped make sure we saw it all. Not only did he get us into every attraction with very little wait, he took us to a few places we never would have known to ask about. Thanks to Ahmet, we felt comfortable navigating the Grand Bazaar, we enjoyed authentic Turkish Cuisine, and were able to learn about and purchase some incredible Turkish tile pieces. He made sure we saw everything on our list and let us know about separate entrance fees, dress codes, and 'tourist traps" well in advance. Ahmet was incredibly knowledgeable about Turkish history, but was also willing to share with us about his life and what is was like to live in Turkey. I had no idea what to expect on my first trip to Turkey and thanks to Ahmet I can't wait to go back!!!

Amazing Walking Tour with Ahmet. The Guided Istanbul Tours team has done a wonderful job organizing tour of Istanbul old city . My Friends and I just came back from Istanbul and couldn't stop talking about how great our tour was. It is totaly worth it to do tour of old city Sultanahmet. We have seen and learnt alot with our guide Ahmet. He was fantastic and I would highly recommend requesting him. He made all the difference in the tour and was such a great person to learn from.

Amazing Istanbul Tour with Ahmet Yildirim. We had a fantastic tour with Ahmet. He was so knowledgable, fun, and made our two day trip to Istanbul worth it. He also took us to an amazing restaurant for lunch before we went to grand bazaar. Worth the money don't think twice. He is fantastic!!!

Vocation. The guide was amazing, extremely courteous, polite and funny. BOTH the guide and owner of company went out of their way to accommodate our extra needs. I definitely recommend them for all your travel needs. Will contact them on my return visit

Excellent in everyway. This was our second visit to Istanbul and like last time we contactedRose before traveling and asked her to plan our trip. We can't express enoughHow wonderful this company is to deal with and their guides are simply brilliant.We had 2 tours and everything was well organised, Our guide was Ahmet and he did a great job.We would recommend Guided Istanbul Tours to anyone who is looking for pfofessional and reliable company.

Guided Istanbul Tours: great choice for Ephesus and Istanbul Tours. We used Guided Istanbul Tours for Ephesus and Istanbul, the service was great, the guides were very knowledgeable and professional, we had very little time so they really showed us the best in each city. They booked our tours with a private van which helped us to get around and drivers were so friendly. we highly recommend them.

Very nice tour of Istanbul Old Town. Our group of four friends really enjoyed the full day tour with our guide Metin Yilmaz. He is fluently in English and a funny guy. We went to blue mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia and Basilica Cistern and Metin provided us with a lot of information in an energetic way. He loves, what he does and would always recommend Guided Istanbul Tours an Metin as guide.

Nice Tour, usefull informations & even better tour guide. We visited Istanbul as vacation with our employees and decided to do a guided tour. The tour was booked for a tuesday including a private driver for the six of us.Our tour guide (Metin Yilmaz) who speaks fluently english was very kind. He explaind us all what you need to know about Istanbul, he also took as to a very good restaurant next to the big mosque where you need to eat the beans and the rice who are absolutly amazing. The driver took as around and at the end he droped us off at the hotel.We look forvard to meet Metin again once we are back in Istanbul.Regards Sandro, Pepe, Steffi, Alfin, Amri and Charlotte from Switzerland

Brilliant Istanbul Tour with friends. Our group of eight friends truly enjoyed private old city tour arranged by Guided Istanbul Tours. Our guide, Ahmet , was excellent. He kept us going at a good pace, pointing out things that we would not have noticed and answering our questions in an informative and interesting way. He made the tour so delightful and fun. He is extremely knowledgeable and you can tell he loves what he does for a living. We had a great time and we wont hesitate to recommend Guided Istanbul Tour to our friends!

Best way to see the Old City. This was the first time my boyfriend and I booked a private tour. We chose to see old city part of Istanbul such as blue mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. We were unsure of visiting those sites on our own and we wanted to learn as much as we could. Ahmet, our guide met us at our hotel  and he could not have been more perfect. He was patient and courteous and very knowledgeable. (proffesional tour guide), and was warm and open to our questions. If you planning to take a private tour, we highly recommend "Guided Istanbul Tours" and Ahmet as a guide

Great Service. Rose and her team did a phenomenal job.They did not only arrange our travel to Cappadocia ,but also the Aegean and mediterranean coasts then istanbul..We would absolutely use their service again in a heartbeat! They are true professionals in tourism business

Most memorable trip!!!. Highly recommend our guide Ahmet who was extremely knowledgeable and presented a lot of information about his city. We would definitely recommend Guided Istanbul Tours! It was nice to access the museum without waiting in the lines. If you have an intention to take a tour Istanbul, this is the company to go with.

Thank you Rose and Ahmet. Thank you Rose and AhmetWe honestly could not have asked for better tours for Istanbul. The booking process with Rose is the easiest booking process you will ever do. She explains everything you need to do in great detail. We booked the Istanbul Combo Tour and our guide was Ahmet. He was very informative about the historical sites and the current life. we really enjoyed the tour and we would highly recommend this company anyone who has intention to take a private tour.

Nice tour and tour guide. Brilliant Tour of IstanbulWe thoroughly enjoyed our walking Istanbul with Ahmet on our first day in Istanbul. We took a private tour and had such a great time on this informative and super awesome tour. Ahmet was fun, enthusiastic and incredibly intelligent. Highly recommend this tour and ask for Ahmet! You won't be sorry!

Fabulous Day!. I don't write reviews very often but the tour made for a really fabulous day. I can't think of a thing which could have been done better by the tour company. We were picked up on time, the tour guides were very friendly and knowledgeable and they always made sure that we saw everything and were informed with history. We took two tours and we were so happy that we chose Guided Istanbul Tours. Thanks for great service and tour guides! Highly recommended.

Simply the best. We had an absolutely great day touring the old city. Thanks to our guide Rose who was energetic, enthusiastic, personable and very knowledgeable and very patient. She helped us to learn about Istanbul while enjoying the history and beauty of sites that are breathtaking. This tour was a highlight of our trip.

Great guided Tour of Istanbul with Ahmed!!. We did two Istanbul tours with Guided Istanbul Tours - Istanbul old city tour and Bosphorus Curise and Dolmabahce Palace. Both tours were led by Ahmet Yildirim. he was enthusiastic and knowledgeable . he had excellent English, and communicated really well with us. The tours allow you to skip the (long) queues, so you get straight to the action, no waiting around for an hour to get in. We had two great tours and we wont hesistate to recommend Guided Istanbul Tours to our family and friends.

Seeing Turkey for the 1st time. Tours with Ahmed - superiorly arranged! It was a pleasure having Ahmed as our Guide as he speaks English very well and is well educated in the history of his Country. He has a good grasp of current events too and knows where to take his guests. Would not hesitate to get him again to see the other parts of his beautiful Country.

Private tours of Istanbul, Ephesus and Cappadocia. We are so glad we did all the bookings of our Turkey tour with this company. The punctual transfers, private and customized tours were just what we wanted. We had the perfect guide to tour all aroun Turkey. Our guide was hugely knowledgeable in every aspect of Turkish story, culture and religion. Our vehicle was equipped with comfortable leather arm chairs, wi-fi, wonderfully comfortable for the transport of 800 km of travel. We had the pleasure to have a tour operator who fully understands our wishes and puts together an itinerary which fully covers our interests. We cannot recommend highly enough the services of Guided Istanbul Tours. We will definitely use their services again both for a re-visit to Cappadocia, Ephesus and for charter a Gulet on western coast of country.

Ahmed, Tour guide extraordinaire. We booked with Ahmed for a private full-day tour while in Istanbul. His tour included all of the important sight-seeing spots. He was a fountain of knowledge about history, culture, Islam and the economy. He answered every question we asked! Ahmed allowed as much time as we wanted to walk around freely and investigate on our own. He made us feel welcomed as visitors and is in large part the reason we fell in love with Turkey. If you want to see everything that Ahmed can show you, wear comfortable shoes, pack your umbrella and go lightweight! Cameras are a must! If you want a personal tour that is less demanding, just ask. You won't be disappointed!

Great tour & exceptional guide!. We used Ahmet a few years ago and he organised the most brilliant tour for us. I have always recommended him to friends travelling to Turkey and our holiday was one of the best we have experienced.We only had a short time in Istanbul and we wanted to see as much as possible. Guided Istanbul Tours has excellent reviews which led us to booking our walking tour for the old city with them. Ahmet meets you at your hotel and is a great guy! He knows a lot of information about the places we visited and he was so efficient and excellent in both his presentation and manner. We recommend Ahmet and this tour to everyone.

Culturally immersive experience!. Having no prior knowledge about Turkey, we set off from Singapore not knowing what to expect.. Our "concerns" were unfounded. Ahmet, who was our guide for the week-long trip, did a great job in showing us around Turkey, showing us the fabulous sights and filling us in on the rich culture of the beautiful country. Will highly recommend his services who wants to have a wonderful, safe and culturally immersive experience of Turkey!

An experience you won't forget!. I used Ahmet years back to organize what was one of my best trips to the west coast of turkey. Since then I have not hesitated to recommend him to family & friends. I was so happy when I heard he started his own tour company with his wife to offer even more of his knowledge and passion. His experience and love of the country comes through on his tours. Whether you have a short stay in Istanbul and want to see as much as possible or if you have a week in this beautiful country you will not be disappointed with Guided Istanbul tours, an experience unmatched.

Great way to learn about the city and see the highlights. We booked online for a day tour to see the highlights and a boat tour, and quickly recieved a confirmation email. Ahmet met us at our hotel to start the tour. Having never had a guide before, I was a little worried in case it would be awkward, but he was lovely, very friendly, spoke fluent English and never ran out of things to tell us about the city and country, but was also very mindful of giving us space as well. Professional tour guides in Turkey have 5 years of training (inc. English and the history of Turkey) and exams before being issued with their pass, which lets them skip the queues with their group to go straight to the kiosk to pay and then enter, which saved us a lot of time and meant we were definitely in the right hands when being shown around some of the most incredible buildings, seeped with thousands of years of history. It was very relaxed, Ahmet would give us time and space to go and see points of interest, and we learnt so much about the city. We had a couple of days left in Istanbul afterwards, and having learnt all we had from the tour and familiarised ourselves with everything, we felt right at home. I would definitely recommend to anyone going to Itsanbul- it's a great way to see the key sights with someone who knows everything about them, skip queues and save time, and make sure that you don't miss anything. Also great for a first visit around the sprawling Bazaar to get a sense of how it works! We were flagging a bit at the end of the day, but glad that we'd done it, as we saw and learnt so much. There are half day options available too though if 8 hours is too much. It was raining when we were walking around, but we picked up some umbrellas from the hotel, so it didn't impact on the experience at all.Lunch and entrance tickets weren't included in the price, so do account for that, although they were all very reasonable. Thanks Ahmet!

Great tour with Ahmet our english speaking guide, glad we made the time.. We were unsure about doing the tour due to the limited time we were spending in Turkey, but glad we did make it happen. It was very educational and efficient by avoiding lines. My wife and i enjoyed all aspects of the tour including the personalized service Ahmet provided. He event went above and beyond by advising us on options for money exchange and cell sim cards. Our lunch ((not included in the price) , was one of the better meals we have had here in Turkey.Key things to keep in mind: Wear comfortable shoes, and dress accordingly based on the temperature being slightly warmer or colder at the locations relative to your hotel.If you are traveling with someone who has any type of walking disability or is elderly , have that conversation with your tour company as some of the locations don't have handicap accessibility or elevators.Great tour guide and company...

Great Day with Rose. We booked a full day tour with our friends who are coming from Boston. I made a contact with Guided Istanbul Tours and they plannned a really interesting programme.
