I must say this is very trustworthy company to deal with. Our guide was Rose. She was so helpful and informative at every step of the tour. She was fun, professional, extremely informative and just brilliant! We highly recommend her.

Memorable trip with an excellent private tour guide. We had a smooth and not so pack tour in Istanbul city. Ahmet is a professional tour guide and had a good english; which make it easy for us to communicate.We travelled with a 3yrs old & 1yr old kids which sometimes needed a few stops and Ahmet patiently follow our needed.Will come again one day for sure!

Planning a trip to Istanbul?. Then please include Ahmet in your plans from day 1! Ahmet is a highly professional guide with an extensive knowledge of his country, history, culture and present! We also enjoyed the lunch at a sidewalk cafe in the Grand Bazar and finished the day with a ferry trip up and down the Bosporous. We truly enjoyed Ahmet’s knowledge as we passed all the historic sites. We highly recommended him.Ann, Eva, Iver & Anders

5 Amazing days in Istanbul and Cappadocia. We have just returned from a vacation in Turkey where we visited Istanbul and Cappadocia. Ahmet, Rose and their team are based in Istanbul and they are very knowledgeable about that region, but they were also able to arrange us a tour with an excellent guide in Cappadocia. What an amazing guide!. Ahmet was a walking coumputer! I have no idea how he kept so many dates, facts etc. all in his head. He went to college for five years and majored in tourism to be this knowledgeable. This was by far the best way to see the Old City. All walking distance from each other was thrilled to have Ahmet not only take us to each sight but tell us all about it. The time in each area was perfect not rushed and time on our own to take photos etc. This was a full day tour but you could have a cup of coffee or sit at different locations if needed. A full yummy lunch was also included!  I highly recomed Ahmet you will not be disappointed!

Ahmet Yildirim - Excellent Tour Guide! . Prior to our visit to the city of Istanbul we hired our private tour guide named, Ahmet Yildirim. He is a polite and educated young man who treated my family and I like his own. We arranged to be picked up at our hotel at 9 a.m. and were pleasantly surprised when he and his driver arrived early and were waiting patiently outside for us to come out. The vehicle that they chose was very spacious and the driver was very familiar with the area. We started our tour at the Hagia Sophia museum, then moved on to the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Prior to entering each of these locations, he would make sure to step aside with us and explain both the history behind the location and what special things we should be focusing on. He had a very comfortable and conversational way about him and shared lots of valuable information in a understandable and pragmatic way. He did a really great job of answering our questions, no matter how simple or complicated. He was patient and allowed my family and I to walk at a comfortable pace, never making us feel rushed. To conclude our time together we ask him to join us for lunch at a local restaurant, which he thoughtfully selected. The restaurant, Masal & Omar, was a cute little sidewalk cafe which offered a multitude of Turkish meals. He was able to assist us in ordering and went on to share with us some things about himself and his life in Istanbul. Essentially this man treated us as though we were part of his own family, which was of great relief being in an unfamiliar place. In closing, I would strongly recommend that you schedule time with Ahmet, should you ever decide to book a private tour in Istanbul. He is an amazing tour guide and lovely human being!

The best way to see the city. Istanbul is fantastic! Truly, there are many sights to see, many mouth watering foods to taste, and a dizzy amount of items calling you to buy them. It can be slightly daunting. Where should you go? What should you eat? Where are the best places to buy quality goods?Instead of running around town, frantic to fit everything in, with the guided day tour, Ahmet took me around to the all the major old town attractions (the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Bascilia Cistern, various monuments, and of course the Grand Bazaar). We set out from my hotel, early, and at a leisurely pace, beating the crowds. Ahmet brought the various places to life with the rich history of area. I had ample time to roam around taking pictures, and soaking in the history and culture. Ever patient, Ahmet guided me through the bazaar, making sure I knew how to get around, and get out. He was also able give me recommendations on where i could find higher quality items.All in all, it was a wonderful day, well worth the price, with wonderful company.

Great day in Istanbul. Rose met us as we departed our cruise. She was delightful and knowledgeable. We went to the cisterns, the Haga Sophia, the grand bazaar and my favorite the spice market. The lines were too long for the blue mosque so Rose took us to a beautiful little mosque right by the spice market. She was flexible and helped us arrange an itinerary to maximize our short visit before we flew home. She took us to a great restaurant and helped us order typical Turkish dishes. We can't say enough how much we enjoyed the day and how great Rose was. We highly recommend this company!

Istanbul City/Walking Tour. Our guide, Ahmet Yildirum, was incredible. He was genuine, gracious and extremely knowledgeable. Good walking pace and allowed our group of 8 (4 NZ and 4 OZ!!) time for photos and even took them of us so we all got in our photos. Ahmet's English is very good and we learned a lot about this amazing city. Eating spots and tips were also shared which we made use of. Ahmet was very professional and a young man we will always remember with fondness.

Amazing day in Istanbul!. We only had one day to spend in Istanbul before boarding our cruise ship and thank goodness we were lucky enough to have Guinaz Tuncer as our private guide. We had a lovely lunch of Turkish food with her and can't say how much we would recommend Guinaz if you go to Istanbul and want the best guide there is!!

A fantastic cap out Istanbul experience. We waited till the last minute to book our tour that included an hour and a half boat tour on the Bosphorus. The walk through the local market and the tour of the old mosque was informative and added to our appreciation of Istanbul and its culture. We would recommend Ahmet without reservation, or rather hesitation!

Istanbul old city tour review. The Istanbul old city tour was conducted by Ahmet in both, fully professional and extremely friendly manner. I can recommend this tour to all travellers, who have limited time at their disposal, but still do not want miss a thing in Istanbul´s old city heart.

Fantastic and Memorable Tour of Istanbul. Our guide Ahmet was absolutely amazing. He was very funny and informative and managed to avoid the crowds. I would definitely recommend this tour. Thank you again Ahmet! We hope to see you soon.

Fabulous Istanbul with Ahmet. Our tour guide Ahmet made the most of our limited time in Istanbul. His knowledge of Turkish history was entertaining as well as extensive. So many beautiful things to see in Istanbul. Ahmet met us on our first day in Istanbul and gave us excellent tasting to a beautiful city. Thanks Ahmet. We did a walking tour through Istanbul in October 2015. We were very fortunate to have a lovely young man, Ahmet, as our tour guide. His knowledge of Istanbul was comprehensive and entertaining. We highly recommend him for an enjoyable tour in this wonderful city.

If in Istanbul Go for Ahmet!(guided istanbul tours). We travelled as a couple & were on a cruise.We docked in the beautiful city of Istanbul on d 1st week of October & chosen to talk a private tour around the city & then we came across Guided Istanbul Tours.As we disembarked we were greeted by our tour guide 'Ahmet'.Initially we boarded our vehicle & we first visited the Blue Mosque.The monument was amazing & the architecture inside was beautiful.As we were not too interested in visiting any museums we were only busy taking some photo ops around the beautiful Mosques & the beautiful Hagia Sophia.Ahmet was a wonderful guy who helped & guided us through the city.He was quiet knowledgable & very informative.After checking all the major sights Ahmet took us to the Grand Bazaar!He gave us all the tips & things to do & go around The Bazaar!After some shopping we were taken for a grand & delicious Turkish meal!After lunch Ahmet took us to the Spice Bazaar!He took us to the best shop around the area & the locals helped us getting the best spices to take home.Do not forget to pack the delicious 'Turkish Delight.Unfortunately we only had a few hours before boarding our cruise.How we wish we could have spent more time in this wonderful & versatile city Istanbul!So I case if someone is looking for a tour around the city..do not look far..Go for The Guided Istanbul Tours & go for Ahmet..u will have a tour 2 savour

Excellent tour of Istanbul, Full of History. Istanbul is such a historical city and we really enjoyed our time whilst touring with our guide Gul ( Rose ). Awesome tour with Ahmet YILDIRIM. Brilliant Day. Karcigegi was amazingly knowledgeable and took unparalleled joy in showing us her city. An amazing spirit, she taught us so much about Turkey it was mind boggling. Fabulous day in Istanbul!. I only had one day free to see Sultanahmet and the old imperial area of Istanbul and I was very lucky to have found Ahmet Yildirim from Guided Istanbul Tours. Fun walking tour with Ahmed. Did a fabulous walking tour around the old city. The tour guide had great insight and we always had options of taking our time and stopping for breaks. Had lovely lunch at the authentic turkish food at The Han. 5 star day that ended at the grand bazaar.

They're the best!!!!. Well organized and well planned tour. Thank you for setting such a great guide. Gul ( Rose ), our guide made our day very interesting, she was knowledgeable and flexible with arrangements. We would highly recommend Guided Istanbul Tours.

Unforgetable!!. We were so happy that our trip turned out perfect with Guided Istanbul Tours!! Ahmet Yildirim, our guide, is the coolest guide ever!! Guided Istanbul Tours. Istanbul has been a city I've always dreamed of visiting - East meets West what could be more magical? With everything long wished for there is always the fear that it won't live up to the dream - our day with Ahmet ensured our expectations were met in all respects. Our knowledgable guided shared his spectacular city with us and provided a day we will always remember. None of our questions went unanswered and we felt our visit given his full consideration - not case with every tour guide we've ever met! Sunshine spilling through jewelled windows, the call to prayer ringing out over our heads, a palace cloaked in simmering blue tiles which went on and one, the scent of roses drifting through the hot summer day will resonate with us for years to come. In addition we gained an insight into another faith and wish the world could finally recognise the similarities in our great world traditions rather than the differences. Thank you so much for such a wonderful day!

We will be back for more . Booking the tour online was very easy and Guided Istanbul Tours were prompt with their email replies. We loved our tour in Istanbul. VERY VERY VERY VERY VERY PROFESSIONAL, EXPEREINCES, COURTEOUS, ETC.. Mr. Ahmet Yildirim isVery ProfessionalVery ExperienceVery KnowledgableVery CourteousVery PunctualVery PositiveVery FriendlyVery ++++++++++Very Excellent in everything !!!We just got back from our trip to Turkey a few days ago and it was by far the best packaged tour I have ever been on. Our small group of fifteen was given guided tours by Mr. Ahmet Yildirim - English speaking, and very knowledgeable guides. The drivers were courteous. Everything was arranged so that all I had to do, literally, was just breathe, walk, and learn the history and enjoy myself. I wish I could tell you every little thought and impression from my trip but I would have a novel written in no time. All I can say is that I wish I had had more time. I wish I could have stayed longer. People asked me again and again why I wanted to go to Turkey. . We had really good tour guides in Turkey, Mr. Atmet Yildirim which I do think that being a tour guide must give you such patience as some of the tourists are just so much hard work, but your guides were really good and gave us such good information. The trip was sensational. Ahmet was definitely a very knowledgeable, culture, Professional, our local tour guide.Thank you again, for the trip that we had a Great time!Thank you so much, Mr. Ahmet YILDIRIM !
Remarkable experience . Ahmet is a very knowledgeable person with excellent communication skills. We had a great time. Very punctual - Highly recommend.

Awesome host.....fantastic tour.....love Turkey!. We found Guided Istanbul Tours on Tripadvisor. After reading their good comments we decided to book a day tour. Excellent guide; great private experience.. I was introduced to Guided Istanbul Tours by a friend. We booked a walking tour and spent 7 wonderful and informative hours with Rose. Great tour!. I had a great time touring Istanbul with my guide. Best guide ever!. My guide, Gulnaz Tuncer, with with me for a week of intensive touring in the Istanbul area. First, she was energetic enough to keep with the long days I required. Gracious and Friendly Hostess. Rose was a friendly and professional hostess. She answered every question thoroughly and with a smile. We greatly enjoyed our tour and was very happy to meet Rose.

Excellent guide!. I did a walking tour around Istanbul with Ahmet Yildirim, which was informative, interesting and a great way to discover Istanbul. So much fun, rich history!. Such a fulfilling time and got to see many sights with great information provided. Well explained tours and guide had a great personality. Had a great time in Turkey! Don't forget to try the Turkish ice cream and it's tricks!

fun filled day covering all the main Istanbul magical attractions!. I must say our group of 7 experienced a very memorable, well-organised walking tour of the old city Istanbul. How to thoroughly enjoy Istanbul in a day. Our group of 4 had the funniest day in Istanbul with our amazing guide Ahmet. He was on time, and from the start we all clicked. Best option for guided tours. When we set up a tour of Istanbul for the first time through an app, we were referred to this company. Excellent & knowledgable guide, perfectly fluent in German. Mr. Huseyin picked us up from our accomodation, punctual. I live and work in Istanbul, but joined my friends on this tour so we could spend the day together.It was a long day, but we had such a great time! Our guide (Ahmet) was amazing! He answered all our questions, made sure all my quests were happy and made the day interesting and light. The company was well-organised and professional and even though I have visited all these sights before, I learned something new about nearly all of them. Moreover, my guests raved on and on about the day and regarded it as a highlight of their visit. I was so happy to have this work out so well and will absolutely use this company again for my visiting guests. Highly recommended.

What a wonderful tour!. I was looking for an experienced charismatic tour and guide for my day trip of Istanbul. And I sure found it! Ahmet was a kind and knowledgeable tour guide. I learned so much and felt as though he personalized the day for me. With my knee I was a little slow, but he kept checking in making sure the pace was good. I really enjoyed working with Guided Istanbul tour and will be recommending them to all my friends. And now that I am hooked on Turkey, I am going to plan an extended trip around the country and will be using Guided Istanbul tours to plan it!

I love Istanbul. What an amazing tour. Thanks to our guide Ahmet for everything. I've been to Istanbul before but never had a private tour. As it was my family's first visit to Istanbul we decided to have a private tour and use a guide. It was a bit tiring but definitely worth it. We visited Hagia Sophia, Blu Mosque, Topkapi Palace and couple more attractions. They are all breath taking and amazing spots. I think we have been lucky having Ahmet as our guide, he was very knowledgable about all these places and very friendly. We will definitely visit Istanbul again, next time we hope to explore more places as the city is vast. As the title says I love Istanbul, I most certainly did. What a great city !

Great tour of Istanbul and Ephesus. I purchased a tour in both cities through Guided Istanbul tours. I enjoyed them very much. The guides spoke very good english and took us to the places we wanted to see. I had been to Ephesus already so we made a short tour there and visited Mother Mary's house and some ceramic stores...Also, the town of Sirence was a treat. Unless you know your ceramics I would skip the stores or just stick to the port. Istanbul was fabulous with so much to see..a treasure and very enjoyable. I would recommend this tour company and be specific about what you want. They aim to please.

Wonderful!! This is the ONLY company to go with. You have found the ONLY tour company you need while visiting Turkey/Istanbul - don't bother going anywhere else.We took an Istanbul city day tour and it was fantastic! It was professionally organised, run and our guide spoke very good English, was well organised and not only had additional people helping out at various stages of our tour, but used things like remote ear piece headset for each guest which allowed everyone to wonder around and explore Hagia Sophia while still being able to hear our guide.... The tour felt very independent yet secure and group focused.Everything was well paced and organised. We also had plenty of time to independently explore each location we visited and felt we could ask our guide anything. I believe in Turkey, guides need to have tertiary qualification to operate tourist activities but the quality can obviously differ - however, I can honestly say that our guide was a real professional and a gentleman and exceeded our expectations.Highly recommended.

The best in 24 hours. with only 24 hours to spare, thanks to our amazing tour guide, we got a good sense on the city and its history, which only opened our apetite to all things Turkish and cannot wait to be back! We had time to chat about the importance of the Ottoman Empire and current events and even sneak in amazing shopping the Grand Bazaar
Recommended . Very nice service with great safety measures , friendly staff and accurate timing . Simply everything was perfect .

Amazing flight over Istanbul. This was something that was on my bucket list for a long time and I am very happy that I finally realized this dream. I would like to thank Istanbul Tour Studio for this experience. I can definately recommend anybody who is interested in this great experience to book it via them.

First Rate Guides and Service. Most of all, this company features knowledgeable and engaging guides. We took their one day in Istanbul tour, street art tour, and the full day trip to Ephesus. We were with a different guide each time, and all three were excellent. Our guides for the Istanbul and Ephesus tours had backgrounds in archaeology. All three guides were friendly, helpful, and very willing to tailor the tours to our interests and needs. Booking was clear and easy, and we received confirmations and updates for each tour the day before. Highly recommended!
Istanbul Tour Studio Day Tour. Loved our tour guide! She was very knowledgable, easy to understand, and tailored the tour to our needs.

Heart elating experience - Fener, Balat and Golden Horn. I came across a fantabulous recommendation on Istanbul Tour Studio on a travel blog and wanted a similar experience the writer had during her stay in Istanbul. I reached out to Istanbul Tour Studio right away.Regarding email correspondences:Istanbul Tour Studio is on the ball with communication! What I appreciated most was how they were willing to customize set tours on their website to fit our wants and wishes. Thank you for accommodating our wishes Sinan!Our Tour and guide experience: I HIGHLY recommend the 'Fener, Balat & Golden Horn'. We were able to customize this tour to include the Eyup neighbourhood. What an experience! I think I was on a complete high right from the start. Yasemin, our guide, met us by where we were staying in Sultanahmed neighbourhood. She is professional, friendly and a wonderful person. It felt like we have known her for years instead of just meeting her for the first time. We started with a boat ride from the Eminonu port to Eyup port. I can't swim and get sea sickness very easily, but both my husband and I found this boat ride so much fun!! We had taken a Bosphorus cruise the previous day, but found this fishing-boat ride far more fun for sightseeing on the Golden Horn and the overall feeling of adventure and exploration. Upon reaching Eyup, it was a short walk to the Funicular to the Pierre Loti Café. Mind-blown!!! - The view is spectacular, the famous graveyard is stunning, and the coffee house is oh-so-chic! It was a little busy, however we found a table for three with the perfect view. Yasemin and I got Turkish tea and my husband got Turkish coffee and we had a great conversation overlooking the Golden Horn. There was some construction in the graveyard I think, but even the noise didn't take away from our experience, it was just that spectacular. I am at a risk of writing a very long essay on our experience so I'll try to keep it short...We were able to experience the local life with Yasemin. She expertly guided us through the maze of Fener and Balat. We would have been lost otherwise. She was familiar with the local residents, which seemed to have made our presence in those neighbourhoods acceptable by its residents. (I would not want to see strangers walking around my home either, especially with kids around). The Chora museum was an experience in itself because of Yasemin. We had the most delicious lunch at a café were the Dervishes go to talk philosophy. It was so peaceful and atmospheric. The architecture of the Balat neighbourhood was stunning. The quaint narrow streets oh-so-beautiful . I can't even attempt at explaining our experience of the Patriarchate it was just that incredible. I don't know if it was pure luck or Yasemin's fabulous timing that we reached each of these sites at the perfect time - prayer time at Eyup mosque, the tomb and, especially, the prayer time at the Patriarchate in Balat. The chanting took me away to an "other-worldly" place. We saw the whipping post where Jesus Christ was constricted and flogged (As per the church at least). My husband and I are not religious at all, but this tour was a spiritual experience!My husband and I were in Istanbul for a week and every day was like a blooming flower filled with new experiences, however, this personalized tour was by far our favourite day. Thanks to Yasemin for being a wonderful guide. And thanks to Istanbul Tour Studio was organizing a wonderful itinerary. Thank you thank you thank you!

Fantastic!. This company is easy to do business with: clear information, guidelines on payment, confirmation of payment, reminder of the appointment the day before.The best was our tour guide, Yasmin. She arrived promptly on time. Friendly, competent, extremely knowledgeable, courteous and, when one of us took ill, very caring. This was a great experience and I can recommend them unreservedly.

Fantastic!. We had a day tour of Istanbul and it was tailored to our needs and our own pace which was wonderful. We were driven around, walked the streets, took the team...brought to fabulous places for our meals!Sinan did a great job of making us feel relax and checking with us on the places we wanted to visit.Thank you for a great day!

Nighttime tour of the Hagia Sophia. It was my second time at the Hagia Sophia, and I really appreciated Sinan's expertly guided tour - who knew I missed so many exciting details and stories during my first visit...

One Day Tour of Istanbul - Sergio Fernandes. Fantastic! Fantastic! Fantastic! to say the least.Would surely recommend to all my friends as this was a fantastically organised private tour keeping in mind the security and well being of the guest. The guide had all the historical knowledge and was very professional in sharing it. Guide knew which sites to visit at what time to avoid traffic and also for us to manage to see most of the attractions within the day. Was very courteous throughout the day and took us to great authentic places for breakfast and lunch where it was very clean. Overall great value for money and a fantastic experience.

Private historical tour in Cappadocia. I booked them for a private historical tour in Cappadocia because they have branched out into that district. I was a bit nervous as to who my guide would be but it turns out, he is a local of Cappadocia who speaks better English than I do and is a wealth of information about the historical timeline of the district. He even took me to Yuksek church which I'd never heard about and I consider myself quite knowledgeable about travel in Turkey. Look forward to hooking up with Cansu when I return to Cappadocia

Scavenger Hunt in Istanbul. We decided to organize a scavenger hunt in Balat for a mixed group of about 60 people (20 of them kids between the ages 8 to teen) and Istanbul Tour Studio helped us design and execute the event as the local partner to a gaming company. They were meticulous and creative from beginning to end, suggested new ideas (like crossing The Golden Horn with Dragon Boats), found locations for "missions", organized the meetings and the food, added signs for historical spots as needed and even helped find actors for the missions.I highly recommend them for any sort of company or big group event. Sinan personally took responsibility for everything in the tour, was knowledgable about the locations, was well connected and responded to all our (even difficult) requests with a smile.

Guided tour of Istanbul and Bosporus cruise. We had a long weekend in Istanbul and wanted to be guided around with our children to get the atmosphere and the details that we would miss alone. Sinan followed up our requests in a professional way and appointed Betül as our guide. She is a gem, knowledgable, adapted herself to our children (8 and 12) who needed short and clear explanations. The lunch breaks in typical restaurants, the recommendations for the Hamam, the museums or the places to have diner were just perfect. The Bosphorus cruise with breakfast was also a highlight. We visited Istanbul as with a friend who shared her passion for the rich history and also gave us the feeling that we were off the beaten track. Thank you Istanbul Tour Studio, it was a memorable weekend !

Like chatting to a knowledgeable friend. I was in Istanbul on a mixed visit of tourism, visiting friends and some business. It meant a packed day to see the important historical and heritage sites. And remember that Istanbul, historically, was the centre of the known world. The centre of the Roman Empire, the Ottoman Empire and a few others along the way. Sinan brought the whole complex picture alive. The orthodox, the Catholic as well as the Islamic are all represented here. So to be with someone who gently points out imagery. Adds detail as necessary and answer questions with assuring ease, it makes the crammed day an enthralling experience. I came away happy with amazing memories of one of the most wonderful cities in the world. I can't praise this team highly enough. Do research their website. Highly recommended. Thanks Sinan.

Best Way to Visit Turkey. We took 3 private tours with Istanbul Tour Studio (ITS): (1) One Day in Istanbul, (2) Food Tour of Istanbul, and (3) Ephesus. Without a doubt, this was the best thing we did to visit all the sites in Turkey. The organization, managed by Sinan, is excellent and all the individual tour guides were outstanding.First, the company is extremely service oriented. Communication was excellent with Sinan, and he personally answered the phone EVERY time I called from the US despite the time difference. Everything was handled professionally, and you do not have to worry at all about the company. In addition to the tours, Sinan handled all our transportation needs to and from the airports, and we were always greeted on time and courteously by the drivers. Sinan met us at our hotel when we arrived in Istanbul on a Sunday afternoon. Since the weather forecast called for rain and strong winds on our first day of the tour, Sinan suggested that we break up the tour into two days instead of one (first day would be for indoor sites). He did this without any additional fees, and it worked out great for our group.In terms of the individual tours, they were outstanding. All our tour guides (both in Istanbul and in Ephesus) were friendly, fluent English speakers, and extremely knowledgeable about the history of Turkey. For example, our guide in Ephesus (an extremely well-preserved Roman ruin) studied archaeology in college and gave us tremendous insights as we visited all the sites. In Istanbul, the guides were just as knowledgeable, and I couldn't see how we would have been able to see all the sites without their help. In addition, we were able to see all the things that only insiders would know (for example, the Viking graffiti at the Hagia Sophia).In summary, these are the guys to conduct all your private tours in Turkey. The best, period.

Fascinating journey through Istanbul's culinary delights!. A surprisingly heavy downfall of snow over the new year in Istanbul scuppered our first attempt at the tour, but it was well worth the wait when we ventured out early on 2 Jan 2016 from our cosy hotel, Ibrahim Pasha, in Sultanahmet. First stop was a hearty breakfast of turkish specialty bread, honey and creamy cheese with spicy scrambled eggs and tea or coffee. Our charming guide, Sinan, introduced the four of us to a handful of 'hole in the wall' cafes and delis throughout the morning that we would never have otherwise found, along with an informative trip to the Spice Souk. A great way to experience old and new Istanbul. Allow 5 hrs. Highly recommended!

A great walk through the old town of Istanbul. We were picked up from the hotel by Yesim. She has a nice personality and spoke excellent English.We had a long walk through the old town of Istanbul where she showed us... next to the tourist attractions... some hidden secrets.Very knowledgable and great company to spend the day with.

Off the beaten track. If you want to see the real Istanbul, you should book a tour with these guys! We had a food tour (great for foodies, but also for keen photographers) around Istanbul during which we explored little back streets and ate until we could eat no more.. The guide, Bethul, met us at the hotel and showed us the way to traditional breakfast spots for menemen, to kofte and pide shops, through souks, up staircases, around corners, until finally we succumbed to baklava and turkish coffee. She was tolerant of our photo stops, and made a special effort to accommodate my mother who couldn't climb many steps. In istanbul, that is no small feat! It was an excellent way to see Istanbul: the first-timers and the returning visitors agree.

I felt I knew Istanbul, it was a new discovery. I have decided to take my 2 daughters on the street photography walk organised by Istanbul tour Studio. Booking was super easy, just sent an email with date and selected tour and timing, they reverted to me in the next 30 minutes with confirmation. on the day, we were greeted by this charming lady Didem, remember this name.The weather was not on our side, but she bring us to few little streets to discover the deep secrets of Istanbul, place that you usually don't go. Having a turkish coffee in a very stylish cafe, during she explained the history of the buildings around, visiting the church and explained to the kids the difference between aperture and exposure with a lot of patience and inspiring the kids so much, they all get excited with photography. Didem has an amazing career background and she is not an ordinary guide, which makes the experience unique. she is flexible, knowledgeable and attentive and there is no doubt she will make anyone in her tour raving about this experience. I must add that i am a spoiled person, we lived in thailand, Madlives, Vietnam and travelled half of the world. now we have tried one package with istanbul Tour Studio and love it so much, we just want to do all the remaining ones. the weather was not there but we didn't care anymore, enjoy to listen Didem, discovering all the insight of Istiklal avenue, doing some shopping at the same time. what an amazing day!! thanks Didem and Sinan. I keep the title of the greatest daddy in the eyes of my daughters.Wishing you all the success and a of great shots.

Bling in the Bazaar!. I have visited Istanbul a couple of times so was looking for something different to do. I had the opportunity to enjoy time with Master jeweller Eren Ozler and Bahadir from Istanbul Tour Studios. I can't decide if I loved learning and making my gorgeous piece of jewellery or talking and laughing and discussing life with Eren & Bahadir more. The day started with Bahadir meeting me at my hotel, we then walked through Cihangir a wonderful bohemian pocket of Istanbul, we then caught the tram to the Grand Bazaar. Any question I threw at Bahadir he had an interesting and informed response. Eren was a relaxed and happy man that put me at ease as a novice jewellery, we drank coffee, ate baklava and listened to traditional and contemporary music throughout the day. He even treated me to a traditional Grand Bazaar lunch which we shared in his workshop discussing life, Turkey and my home country. I feel I have made two friends in such a unique fun way. It was a wonderful way to spend the day in the Grand Bazaar.

2 Great tours - tailored to our interests.. We had 2 tours over a weekend trip in Istanbul. The first one was Street Photography Walk. Didem was delightful and walked us through a number of historical and modern places around the central Istiklal avenue. We had a chance to learn some great tips on photography and enjoy the scenery! Highly recommendedOn the next day we booked "I Have One Day in Istanbul" with Selen. She gave us a bunch of very interesting historical information on the Sultanahmet sights. Also she planned us a surprise and brought us to a hidden roof from which an incredible view on whole Istanbul opened.Thank you Istanbul Tour Studio! You guys are the best!

Like having a (super-well-informed) cool new friend in Istanbul!. After having previously visited Istanbul for work, I only had two short days to spend in this incredible city ... yet I wanted to get a taste of what it's REALLY like. Sure, I wanted to visit couple must-see attractions, but mainly wanted to see neighborhoods, check out public transit, and dine at a typical city eatery. So I was thrilled when a manager at Soho House Istanbul told me about Istanbul Tour Studio -- and even more pleased to find out about its "I Have One Day in Istanbul" tour! And because I'm a foodie, Managing Director Sinan Sokmen offered to combine elements of "Flavors of the Old City." SOLD!What made the tour super-special was my guide Betül, who's both an actual archeologist (how cool is THAT?) and a food lover. She met me at Soho House, chatted with me upfront about what I most wanted to see/check out -- and then we set off. Despite the day's rain, the two of us covered SO much ground: the courtyard of the Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia Museum, Underground Cistern, Spice Market. Did a bit of scarf and jewelry shopping at the Grand Bazaar. Took a public ferry to the "Asia side" of the city, and ate at a locals-only restaurant where Betül knew the kind waitstaff. And she offered to spend even MORE time with me by walking me through one of Istanbul's hippest, trendiest districts. Not only is Betül super-smart and engaging, but it felt like spending the day with a like-minded "citizen of the world" who just happened to live in Istanbul and knew the city intimately. And the fact that I was the only person on the tour made it that much more special. I can't recommend Istanbul Tour Studio -- and Betül -- enough. Can't wait to return to Istanbul and take a much more in-depth tour with her next time! It was WELL worth the price, and then some.

3 Successful Tours!. I visited Istanbul last minute in October. I wanted to see the city with a guide, but I wanted a personalized and unique experience that was the opposite of a big bus tour. I'd read about Istanbul Studio Tour on a blog and it sounded like exactly what I wanted. After 3 tours - Street Art, Flavors of the Old City, & the Photography Tour - with them this week I would highly recommend them to anyone looking to take a unique tour in Istanbul. I am working hard to get better at photography, so the tour with Didem was my favorite. She took me around to a lot of great spots to photograph, taught me a lot about photography, and about the city. She was a wonderful guide. The others were good too, but I really enjoyed my tour with her. I highly recommend Istanbul City Tour!

A great way to spend the day! Insight to the real Turkey!. I was booked onto the Taste of the City tour on a Monday morning - and I was lucky to be the only one. I expected lots of people but I guess it's a well kept secret, so far! Betul Basak was my guide, and we had a really great day together, exploring the cuisine of Turkey in both knowledge and through our tastebuds. This also involved lots of close contact with the Turkish people, sellers, traders, makers, cooks, chefs and waiters. It's a real insight to the culture and the way things are done in this part of the world. We had a relaxed breakfast with a variety of foods, plus bread that we picked up from a local artisan bakery; we then tasted baklava in the original 'mother of all baklava houses'. Walking to the Spice market we explored all the stalls, stopping at Betul's favourite cheese, olive, pickle and fish stalls, dropping in to the kitchen supply shops, checking out the dried veggies hanging outside the spice kiosks....then in the covered part of the market we spent time drinking teas and tasting various products from pistachios to golden berries, and discussing saffron and pomegranates.....before heading onwards to eat lunch near Taksim Square at Bayvore, including a spinach/omelette/pastry/anchovy thing which was delicious! All ended at the Manda Batmaz coffee house where we had a rich, chocolatey Turkish coffee. I recommend this tour and especially my guide, Betul Basak.

Excellent Istanbul Tour. Since my husband & I were visiting Istanbul for the first time we decided to do a private tour of the city. Selen was our tour guide & she was very informative and gave us an excellent introduction to the history of Turkey. We were so happy to have her help us navigate the streets & transportation for the first time - her English is excellent as well. I would highly recommend any tour from this company but especially a tour with Selen!

Fantastic service, great guide, really fun day - well worth it. Two of us wanted to see the sights efficiently and Istanbul Tour Studio was the perfect solution. Recommended by our hotel, the lovely personably guide met us in the lobby and then took us on a whole day adventure. The really great thing about a private guide is that you can ask as many questions as you want, and taylor things to your own tastes as you go. By the end of the day, we'd done 20,000 steps, conquered the city's public transport system, seen a huge number of sights, and really felt like we'd got the lay of the land in Istanbul. Our guide even ensured that the lunchtime restaurant could cater to our clean-eating regime too. Would recommend to anyway.

Excellent introduction to Istanbul. My husband, two children (12 and 18) and I did the Magnificent Ottomans tour. It was an excellent introduction to the history of Turkey, and gave us a good feel for the city. Our guide, Betul Basak was great. She was very warm, engaging and knowledgeable, able to answer all our questions about Turkish history and about modern Turkey. I was worried about how my son (aged 12) would cope with about 6.5 hours of walking and history but he enjoyed the tour and seemed to learn a lot.

Street Art Tour From Those In The Know. Despite a tardy start due to transportation issues we headed off up Isttikal Caddesi on our adventure. We spent the next five hours exploring six different neighbourhoods in Istanbul. We were both on the European side and the Asian side.Kerem was our knowledgeable and personable tour guide. He was familiar with just about all of the artists that we viewed. He shared his views on Turkish culture, politics and sports. We tucked down alleyways, we ventured into roped off parks and lurked in locations we could bot have possibly found on our own. At the end of the tour we visited the offices and studio of the arts collective that this group runs. No hard sell, just exposing us to the work of a bunch of creative people in the city.In my humble judgement the street art scene in Istanbul seems to be in its early stages of growth. It is not quite as developed as say New York City or Buenos Aires. Some of the art might be a bit crude and not too refined. As a tourist also, you need a bit of the symbolism explained to you. So don't set your expectations to the notion that you'll see Banksy's throughout the city.Initially we thought the price tag of $95 was a bit pricey. But after our five hours with Kerem we thought otherwise. It was a great way to spend a Friday afternoon. He booked a table at Asmali Cavit for dinner for us and later joined us for a pre-dinner drink. Two thumbs up from this traveller for the Istanbul Studio Tour.

Bicycle tour to the Asian side. This was a half day cycle starting in Kadikoy, crossing over on the ferry to the Asian side. As our second trip to Istanbul it was good to discover new neighbourhoods and move away from all the main tourist spots we'd ticked of our list on the first visit. The pace was perfect - probably because we were a small group of similar ability. Most of the journey was very flat and smooth with a couple of small easy to climb slopes. Our host was very friendly and informative covering all sorts of topics relevant to the areas we went through. There are plenty of opportunities to stop to take photos, have a drink or find a toilet. He was able to respond to our interests which even took us sample local fast food we'd not tried before. It was the perfect way for us to discover this vibrant and colourful part of Istanbul.

Savour Turkey though the eyes of locals. This was my first trip to Turkey and as a solo travelling woman, it's sometimes nice to to have a local guide. I did three tours with ITS and they were fabulous. I was lucky enough to have archaeologist, Betul, all to myself for the 'Magnificent Ottomans' tour. Betul has an incredible knowledge of history and archaeology ... as I was the only one on the tour, there was some flexibility in terms of what I really wanted to see and what I could pass by. Next was the 'Flavours of the Old City' tour with Betel and another couple which was a real treat. Betul took us to authentic eateries and the Bazaar ... I had literally walked past some of these hidden gems.Not content with exploring Istanbul alone, I headed to Izmir for the 'Ephesus and Virgin Mary' tour with Gulden ... (or as I called her 'Golden' ;) Gulden had an amazing knowledge of Ephesus and, once again, I alone had the pleasure of her company, so we were able to go at our own pace. The pick up and drop off from the airport was seamless. At my request, we made an extra stop at the Temple of Artemis. Gulden also helped me get an earlier flight back to Istanbul so I wouldn't be stuck at Izmir for two hours. Both Betel and Gulden asked questions to ensure I was happy with how the tours were progressing plus they gave me time alone to explore temples, etc.I'd highly recommend Istanbul Tour Studios - Betel and Gulden were fabulous guides, illuminating Turkish treats that I'd otherwise have missed.

Morning Tour of Istanbul. My wife and I had a morning free in Istanbul before joining our cruise ship and we had organised a tour With Istanbul Tour Studio.Everything worked like a well oiled machine.Our guide, Munir Gokmen, met us at our hotel at 8.30 and took us on a most instructive tour of the tourist highlights. He was so impressive and erudite, particularly on the history of Istanbul and the background to the key buildings such as the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. He even took us back to our hotel via the new Underground system when we had a problem getting a taxi. A first class guide in every way -- the best we have had in many years.Brendan
Not for me.. Had we been on a different tour, I think things would have been a lot different. I won't go into the details of the day, but it didn't live up to the lofty price tag

Street art istanbul. AWESOME!!!!! I really Enjoy it and learned a lot about the arts in Istanbul! The guides had really good informations to give about the art and the city! They were really cool and friendly and they showed to me their workshop!!!

Excellent Day tour. My brief was to create a fun day for my family, 2 adults and 3 kids (15,15,12 yrs) and Istanbul Tour Studio and our wonderful guide Emre did just that! We started the day with a private bosphorous cruise including a yummy turkish breakfast. We then visited a selection of the tourist sites, including blue mosque, aya sophia and the underground cisterns. A delicious lunch followed and then a tour of the spice markets. We ended the day at the Hammam which was a highlight. I would definitely recommend this Company to anyone going to Istanbul. If we had longer, we would have definitely done the bike tour as well as others offered by them. They were so helpful, even booked our dinner that night at a place we couldnt get into. Thanks Istanbul Tour Studio and Sinan for a wonderful day.

One day in Istanbul and Magnificent Ottomans. After doing a little research and reading some reviews we opted to do private tours with this company and we were not disappointed. Betül was our guide for both tours. She collected us in the lobby, on time, each day, her English is excellent and she is a great guide (she even made a reservation at a restaurant for us!). No waiting in line, she gave us ample time at each attraction. The restaurants were good and the insights and history she provided was relevant and very interesting. Istanbul is a wonderful city and will impress by itself, and yes, one could do all these attractions by oneself but the experience was so much richer and gratifying when history, context and perspective is provided by a knowledgeable guide.5 star experience, highly recommend

Fabulous four days in Istanbul. All arrangements were very well done. Street art tour and day tour of historical/cultural highlights were perfect. We requested a separate shopping tour but could have combined with other experiences as we like to have an introduction then shop independently. Absolute highlight was day of two-hour boat charter with breakfast on the Bosphorus. It was so unexpectedly amazing. Perfect weather, fabulous boat, wonderful breakfast, lovely company. All views of Istanbul and experiences via street art, historical highlights, and water side were memorable. Until we can return again, we will remember...

A Turkish Delight. We contacted Sinan about a tour at quite short notice but he replied promptly and was very flexible. Betul, our guide for the day was great. We gaged how much we wanted to do as we got going as we wanted to take it all in rather than have a check-list. We got to fast-track queues for the more popular landmarks and being with a local in the Grand Bazaar was the best idea ever.

Fabulous morning rowing in Istanbul!. What an amazing way to start our day in Istanbul! We were picked up promptly from The Four Seasons Sultanhamet by Sinan, and were in a sculling boat rowing on the Golden Horn within 45 minutes. With a little direction by our knowledgeable instructor and a bit of practice, we rowed up and down the bay on a beautiful and calm morning. It was exhilarating to be on the water in the early morning watching the city come alive. We always felt safe and well cared for, and enjoyed hearing Sinan tell us about the historical sites from the water view. Most amazingly, we learned how to row in a sculling boat! If I lived here, I would spend every morning rowing in Istanbul; it is a FABULOUS tour.

Photo tour. I took the photo tour by myself. Guide was friendly. However, the tour only lasted 3,5 hours when I paid for 5. Tour focused on european architecture that you could see anywhere in Europe. Took much better and more typical pictures of Istanbul when I was by myself. I do not recommend the tour as it is right now.

A Magical Day and a Superb Guide. Betul has to be the best guide ever! She took us everywhere we wanted to go, introduced us to some great sites not on our radar, and showed kindness and compassion for our poor weary feet. The day was magical, full of history, beautiful architecture, history lessons, a trip to the fabulous spice market, and the opportunity to browse as long as we wanted at our favorite spots, and speed through some of the others. As a couple of senior ladies, we couldn't quite handle some of the venues, so she found us other sites of equal beauty and interest. What a wonderful way to spend the only day we will ever have in beautiful Istanbul!

Fantastic Tour. Our guide Betul was so knowledgeable and willing to conform the tour to meet our individual needs. (no rug buying ;)) We liked her so much we made a special request for her to be the guide for the tour the next day that I had arranged for my sister and her friend. The tour included a driver which is so much nicer so that the Betul had an opportunity to provide information regarding the city while we were driving. The van was very comfortable and lots of room rather than being crammed in as I have been on some tours. The company was easy to deal with and all was as promised. Definitely worth the money.

One great day in Istanbul. I could not have been happier. I cannot imagine a better day from start to finish. I felt almost like royalty. Selen was both knowledgeable and a perfect host. She accommodated all my requests and started my trip on I high note! I would defiantly recommend your company based on my experience.

Tour Guide is a necessity and very affordable. The concierge at the Ritz Carlton Istanbul arranged our one day tour. We had already toured on our own the Galato Tower, taken a one hour Bosphorus Strait cruise, and enjoyed all the offerings at the Spice Market and Grand Bazaar. We really wanted a guide to share the history of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern, etc. We were so fortunate to be assigned Selen Nur Caliskan as our tour guide. Our "Texas" ears had no trouble understanding her English. She was extremely knowledgeable on the history and customs of each attraction we visited. We have friends who are spending several days in Istanbul and we were thrilled to recommend Selen and Istanbul Tour Studios.

One-of-a-kin walking tour! Christianity, Islam, Judaism, Sufism, and more.. We had a group of 10 doing a private Spiritual Sunday Walk in the beginning of June. Ask for a discount if the price seems unaffordable! We were given the option of money or an extra tour for free do to the size of our group. I wish we had more times to experience some of their other tours. Highlights: - Sinan, the tour guide, was friendly, knowledgeable, and took the extra mile to answer questions or give us a good lunch recommendation in the area. Great at email communication! - Many of the churches, mosques, synagogues, or other areas of worship you could not find on your own. Even with a map they are hidden behind unexpected doors. - Even if you came to Turkey to look at Mosques, the Christian churches are worth the stop. The Roman Catholic Church we stopped at was jaw-dropping beautiful. - The best part of the tour was to see some of the stops during worship time. My only request would have been to talk more about the rituals we witnessed, or see more of the services in-session. We understood this is hard due to different holy days or overlapping service times. Note: You WALK the entire tour, which our group loved. As long as the day is not too hot this is great! You are going up some hills so people may get tired. Just know not to expect an AC tour bus between stops.

7 Days of Touring with Istanbul Tour Studio. Three of us family members (ages 58-66) thoroughly enjoyed our private touring with Istanbul Tour Studio in late April - early May. We toured in Istanbul for 5 days; Ephesus for 1; and Cappadocia for 2. All 3 guides were superb in their knowledge of their subject areas as well as fluent in English. They were pleasant and engaging and excellent ambassadors for Turkey. The drivers were also top-notch and saved us the anxiety of driving in an unfamiliar country.  We've had the opportunity through the years to do extensive world travel; and consider our decision to work with this company among our best. We were able to design the itinerary we wanted rather than the experience of a tour company telling us what stock package they provide. The owner, who served as our coordinator, was available whenever we had questions and provided immediate assistance when a flight from Izmir to Kayseri was cancelled. My only hesitation is with the food tour. Although we enjoyed it very much, it was pricey relative to all the other tours which we considered to be excellent value.

Street art tour. I took the street art tour, not just for the street art but also to get a different point of view of this amazing city. The tour guide Kerem was as good as it gets, a fun, nice and very social guy who answered all our questions, street art or none street art related. I can recomend this tour, you get to see some cool stuff that are not in any guide book!
Istanbul graffiti tour. The best graffiti tour I have ever have, it's worth every penny spent. I have in places in the heart of Istanbul that no one will ever see except in a tour like this.

Street art tour. Decided to take the street art tour with IST Street Tours. Had a great time with Guney seeing not only various types of graffiti but learning about the artists while visting different parts of town. Highly recommended!

Real art made with help from a master. I took my 2 daughterd 23 and 14. The artist spoke little English but we understood each other just fine. The company guide took us to a stone shop to pick out whatever stones we wanted to make into ring or necklace. I chose pendant the girls chose opal and turquiose stones. We used blowtorches flux and solder. We polished and adjust till just right pieces turned out perfectly wesrable. A very enjoyable time.

Extremely dissapointing. Regretfully, we found the description of the tour to be inaccurate. If the tour lived up to its description, it would have been quite good - but this wasn't the case. For example: "You are here to watch how simit... is made." - We had bread bought for us and we left without seeing anything being made."Here, you savor a typical Turkish breakfast..." - quite a good breakfast! Not as much option as in our hotel though."Taste the world-famous Turkish dessert: Baklava... Here, the baklava masters will give a brief on how it’s made" - They did not, but we at least got to eat some. However, it was the guide who gave a description of the making process, not a 'Baklava master'. "Turkish coffee... learn the tips for making the best Turkish coffee in the world." - we were referred to YouTube, with no other information. Yes, seriously. "Lunch time..." - the restaurant had very poor food hygeniene, and we both got very ill later that day (nothing else in Turkey has caused anything like this). As for the guide - quite friendly, but spent entirely too much time on his phone instead of talking to us. Made us feel quite uncomfortable by the end. Also talked quite a bit about Turkish culture, but not so much about food as you might expect. The tour would benefit from having lokum (Turkish delight) in it at some point. In conclusion, we can not possibly recommend paying so much for this experience.

Highly recommend.......Istanbul One Day Tour. Our family of 6 had one day to tour Istanbul. We were thrilled we chose Istanbul Tour Studio to plan our day. Sinan was very easy to work with via email. He was professional, responded to my emails quickly and created an itinerary that accommodated our requests. Everything went exactly as planned and the tour was very reasonably priced. Our tour guide was Yasemin, who was born in Turkey, but spoke English very well. She was extremely knowledgeable, great with our kids and a very easy person to the day with. Yasemin even helped me maneuver the Grand Bazaar, finding the items I was looking to buy. She was also able to manage the crowds and prepared us for what was coming next. We had a wonderful lunch where Yasemin was familiar with the staff and they had our table ready when we arrived. We were able to see much more of Istanbul during our short stay with Yasemin, than if we spent the day on our own. Not to mention, we were learning something new throughout the day. I will contact Sinan as soon as we book our next trip to Istanbul! A day we will never forget!

Rowing on the Golden Horn. I had a fantastic morning taking a rowing boat out in the Gooden Horn. A very different and unusual way to see the city and something I would recommend for someone that's staying in the city for a longer period of time and who wants to do something a bit different. The guides were excellent and the people at the club were very welcoming. It was an early start but worth it for the quiet water. Not too physically demanding so fine to do before a day of activities!

Special tours, special tour guides. We had four glorious days in Istanbul and two of them we spent with Aysham and Sinan. Not only were they super informative, but they were totally laid back. We learned a ton about Istanbul, it's history, people and neighborhoods. We ate in some fantastic places. If you go to Istanbul you MUST use Istanbul Tour Studio.

Incredible Way to Really Learn about Istanbul. Me and my girlfriend did the Street Art Tour and we had a fabulous time. We had three tour guides to ourselves who are all extremely impressive young people working to build up the street art scene in Istanbul. They work directly with artists to help them find walls to create new art in Istanbul.The tour itself was a great way to walk around Istanbul, learn about street art, but also just learn about Istanbul and what it is like living there. All three of our guides were very knowledgeable and also pointed out great places to eat, drink and visit. You get to see things you wouldn't have normally seen exploring the city on your own. This is definitely not a standard tour, but I came out of it having learned more about an evolving city than I would doing a typical old city tour.

I'm Rowing in Istanbul!. Fabulous way to wake up in Istanbul and learn lots from a different vantage point than I'd imagined! Truly an "off the beaten" path experience and wonderfully enjoyable. Sinan is both a terrifically informative guide and a formidable bow man; our coach/rowing guide made sure we pulled water together. Thanks for a great adventure!

Old City Tour in the snow!. We contacted Sinan Sökmen, the managing director of Istanbul Tours before we left for Istanbul. He arranged a private tour for us of the Old City. He was flexible with us about schedule and he provided us with an expert guide, a native born Turk named Yasemin. She surpassed our expectations. It was a challenging day to be tromping around in the slush and snow but Yasemin helped us make the best of it. She is fluent in English and Italian, knowledgeable, articulate and above all friendly. She not only gave us a sense of history but also insight into the political and religious challenges of current day Istanbul.

unmatched service, tours that make the word "boutique" meaningful. We worked with Istanbul Tour Studio for a very high maintenance, VVIP Discovery Channel event which took place in Istanbul. We had 80 top level executives flying in from all around the world and we had 4 coordinators working on the event at different time zones. For one thing; Istanbul Tour Studio REALLY bared with us. We had so many questions, requests and changes, working with us must not have been very easy to say the least. Never-the-less they delivered EXCEPTIONAL pre-sales service. Further more having seen so many tour proposals, I must say what Istanbul Tour Studio offered to Discovery really stood out both in terms of content and presentation. So a big thank you goes to their fantastic team who made our jobs a lot easier all along! Very highly recommended *****

Excellent service. We had the chance to collaborate with Istanbultourstudio for a very VIP group that we were welcoming, the service provided before and during their stay was just perfect. They are very professional, very flexible, solution oriented. As they know so well the city they were able to provide to any request within a very quick timing. For those who are looking to discover the real Istanbul spot from a local point of view they are the best..Just a pleasure to work with them

RICH EXPERIENCE !. I have been to Istanbul several time , with Istanbul Tour Studio- food tour - I got to see it in a different way , had so much fun walking around the old city, eating bites & meals :) , visiting historical sites and chatting with the tourist guide about history of this great civilization,for sure next time I will register with you for a new rich experience thank you for being professional and flexible
Best tourist guide in Istanbul. Very professionalvery flexibleexcellent Englishwell pricedhuge kwnoledgeIf visiting Istanbul, must call them!

Amazing experience. Istanbultourstudio is fresh and original way to visit the amazing Istanbul. If you want to go through the tradition, tastes and history in a young and friendly way Tourstudio Is what you are looking for.In particular with our guide we spent all day tasting typical food and visiting hidden Istanbul in a very familiar atmosphereI want to come back soon

Great day out. We had a fantastic day with Sinan and our fellow tourees. We learnt a lot about the area that we didn't know before. We were on the food tour and we were introduced to tastes we'd never experienced before despite previously living in turkey. The best thing I can say about the day was that it didn't feel like a tour but more like hanging out with a very knowledgable pal.

Felt Like a Local: Best Insider Tour in Istanbul. I had the pleasure of visiting Istanbul with my boyfriend over the New Year's Eve holidays. We decided to use Istanbul Tour Studio to discover the city over two days and we are so happy and thrilled with our experience. Our first tour was part of the traditional culinary walk mixed in with a bit of the day tour. Our guide treated us to the best Turkish breakfast we had in the city, in the gorgeous and up and comign neighborhood of Karakoy. What I really liked about the experience is that we were either just us or in a small group which definitely meant we could really go in-depth during our tour, really seeing areas of a very busy city that we would have never been able to find on our own. I felt like we had a really good friend taking us around his city and giving us a little taste to further discover even later on our terms. We also got to visit some neighborhoods like bebek (with a starbucks that had the BEST view of the Asian side!) don't worry, we had coffee elsewhere ;-). I discovered a top brunch spot and we were even able to take a historical boat on Bosphorus to visit 'Asia', seeing a beautiful panoramic point where many locals sip tea with friends. One of the highlights for me was checking out local street art, a topic I cover in my blog in Florence and wandering the Asian side, stopping to get local treats like semolina and salep, a warm drink that was so needed on these very cold weather days. I have been on a lot of tours all around Europe but this was by far one of the top ones, we met a stranger and ended up leaving a friend. I hope to be back in this beautiful city and I will definitely use them again!

Great Day Tour!!. I only had one day for sight-seeing in Istanbul and had a great tour thanks to Istanbul Tour Studio. My guide Engin was kind and knowledgeable. And his English was impeccable! He also does tours in Spanish and Portuguese. I highly recommend this tour company for anyone heading to Istanbul.

An inside view of Istanbul. I took the rowing tour and the newly offered Spiritual tour of Istanbul, both lead by Sinan Sökmen. As a newbie to rowing, the first tour was both a short course - nicely instructed by a local club trainer (and pop singer!) and translated by Sinan. The experience of learning to row on the Bosphorus can't be beat and the tour gave me the chance to experience the shores of Istanbul in a fascinating way. The Spiritual tour took me into the hidden spiritual spaces off Istanbul's main drag, Istiklal. The tour was like having a good friend with a deep knowledge of the area showing you the sites. Deeply informative, but just casual enough that it was also thoroughly enjoyable. I look forward to discovering more about the many layers of Istanbul and highly recommend the Istanbul Tour Studio.

Cappadocia Balloon Trip And Day Tour. i was recommended to use Istanbul Tour Studio to help organize a hot air balloon trip to Cappadocia. All arrangements were taken care perfectly. Sinan was very easy to deal with and he was able to cater to my needs as requested. Our balloon ride was with Royal Balloon and it was a fantastic experience. Our day tour guide Cansu was knowledgeable and brought us to see sights and not to places "selling stuffs". He explained a lot of the history and formations of the fairy chimneys.Overall a very satisfied experience in using Istanbul Tour Studio and would highly recommend using them.SaleemSingapore

Istanbul Tour Studio Street Art Tour. As a resident of Los Angeles, purportedly the "Mural Capital of the World," an art historian and street art/graffiti aficionado, I was thrilled to discover that this tour was available from Istanbul Tour Studio. Wanting to maximize the experience, I booked the tour on a private rather than group basis. And I was certainly glad that I did. I spent virtually all day with the knowledgeable curator/guide Erbil, exploring the street art that adorns the back streets, car parks and not-so-back streets of Beyoglu, Karakoy and, on Istanbul's Asian side, Kadikoy. Erbil was able to provide insight on the various artists, the evolution of their personal styles, their interrelationships with one another, and the history of this artistic medium from its roots in American rap-inspired graffiti to its more recent manifestation created by artists with fine art academic training. In addition to inspiring a number of personal projects, the more than 6 km we clocked was a great way to get some much needed exercise!

Istanbul Tour Studio Street Art tour. We went on the street art tour from Istanbul Tour Studio in late November. My only regret was because of the timing of our trip, we could only do this on our last day rather than at the beginning of the trip.I was a little nervous before about how the tour would be, but it was so much fun! Sinan answered my questions very quickly, and it was easy to book the tour online.Our guides Kerem and Gizem were fantastic (and the other people on the tour were lovely too). We really enjoyed chatting with them thru the day and getting to know them a bit and I loved that they did street art as well and knew many of the artists whose work we saw. I work in the fine art supply industry in the USA, including graffiti items (sprays, markers etc), so this tour was just awesome.They also had so many great suggestions for cafés, restaurants, bars etc, hence my regret that we couldn't go on the tour earlier! It was cool to have translations of some of the graffiti and hear the background and meaning of it. I'm looking forward to keeping up with their artistic pursuits via Facebook!Luckily we had a great day for our tour (after a week of rain and clouds) and enjoyed walking around all the streets off Istikal and near Galata tower, Beyoglu and Ortakoy. We had great fish sandwiches for lunch in ortakoy (much better than the one we had from the fancy boats near Galata bridge). We then got to take the ferry over to Kadikoy (which was great as I hadn't had a chance to go to the Asia side on my previous trip to istanbul two years ago) to see even more art.A lot of walking, but totally worth it to see such a vibrant side of Istanbul! I took so many photos!

Fantastic walking/photo tour. The guides from Istanbul Tour Studio were wonderful. Very energetic and friendly sharing their intimate knowledge of this great city. They knew a tremendous number of people along the route and it added so much to the quality of the experience to interact with those folks. They helped us explore parts of Istanbul that we would never have found on our own. Thank you Sinan and guides !!!

The best tour to discover the hide beauty in Istanbul. I was in Istanbul in August 2014 and I had a wonderful tour through this stunning city, but the unforgettable thing was the tour in Balat with Sinan, a guide who loves him work.Don't hesitate to call Istanbul Tour Studio if you wanna live a real Istanbul experience and if you want to see unusual places! :-)

Couldn't have been better!. Imagine going to a place far away from home, where you want to live all the "must do" experiences, but do it the local way. That's exactly what happened in our trip to Capadoccia. Everything was so easy, our guide was so knowledgeable and friendly. He totally knew how to manage our group and helped us pick up the best spots for what we were looking for, from the right company for the balloon, to a home made lunch, and local shopping!Maybe I should not say this, but honestly knowing how good it is, I'd be willing to pay more next time, highly recommended!

Istanbul Tour Studio put together an amazing trip for us. A big group of 10 of us recently wanted to visit Cappadocia. We did not want to sign up for a pre/Made itinerary. Luckily we met Sinan and Istanbul Tour Studio. They took care of everything for our trip, including finding an amazing guide, transfers, creating a custom itinerary and suggesting amazing dining options. I highly recommend working with them for both Istanbul and beyond.

VIP Day Tour!. We took the one day in Istanbul tour with Sinan as our Guide. Not only did we see all of Istanbuls highlights we also felt like VIPs for the day.It was so nice not to wait in line with all the other tourist which gave us more time to explore the hidden parts of Istanbul. Sinan was a true gentleman with a rich knowledge of Istanbul and its history.

Fantastic. A great way to see the unseen parts of Istanbul. The street art your showed the back streets and alleyways which are full of character and stories. The mix of old and new architecture along with modern street art was intriguing and beautifully unique. The guides knowledge was invaluable and certainly added to the experience of exploring the Istanbul streets. Would definitely recommend!

A Fantastic Tour of Istanbul. I have just got back from taking a group of 15 people to Istanbul; what an amazing city. I had never been to Istanbul before and was certainly feeling like 'a fish out of water'. However, having Skyped with Sinan a few times before our arrival, I was beginning to feel much more confident and rightly so.Sinan arranged and accompanied the coach transfer to our hotel, helped me exchange currency and explained and assisted me in the purchase of travel cards for the trams. He even went as far as arranging restaurants (extremely good ones) for the groups first 2 nights in the city.Sinan arranged a guide for us, Katerina,for 3 full days. She was fabulous! Her knowledge of Istanbul was extensive and she was also very friendly and helpful (also helping to arrange restaurants for us). We covered all of the major sites, took a trip to the Princes Islands and experienced a number of trams! The whole group fell in love with her!The whole experience, from first contact with Sinan to last, was very professional. He is charming, very knowledgeable and nothing seemed too much trouble. We will certainly be using Istanbul Tour Studio again! I couldn't recommend them more highly.

Excellent guide. Sinan is probably one of the most hip and intelligent guide I have ever encountered. His knowledge about the city is quite extensive and he will show you the city in and out with all of its hidden gems. From historical sites to hidden terrace garden patios that overlook the golden horn, he knows the city like the back of his hand. I would recommend his day tours to anyone. I cant wait to go back and visit Istanbul again.

Insider Istanbul. The one day tour of Istanbul takes you to all the highlights. I booked a one day tour for 2 people and it couldn't have been better. Our guide was friendly, knowledgeable and made our first day in Istanbul incredibly easy. Highly recommended!

The perfect way to see Istanbul. There's a reason why Sinan has received nothing but excellent reviews. He will offer you and your group an exceptional experience. Sinan's command of English is impeccable. He is kind, funny, charming and knowledgeable. He really takes exceptional care of everyone, young and older, making sure that all parties are enjoying the amazing sites. He led us through the Sultan's Palace, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Grand Bazaar expertly supplying detailed descriptions of what we were viewing. It was like taking a terrific college History course...without the quizzes! I recommend that you research no further...Sinan is the man to show you Istanbul.

Jewelry workshop at the Grand Bazaar. Since I had been to Istanbul before and seen the main tourist sites, I was looking for something different to do on this visit. Luckily, I found Sinan's website and signed up for the jewelry workshop. Instead of just spending the day hanging out shopping at the Grand Bazaar, I hung out in a real jewelry workshop with 2 very talented jewelers, and made my own piece of custom jewelry! Aran taught me metal cutting, welding, polishing, and everything it takes to create a unique pendant to take home with me. Much better than anything I could have bought in the bazaar! I was staying far from Sultanhamet, and Sinan even met me at the Hilton ParkSA and took me to the bazaar on the tram personally, pointing out the history of the area and giving me a mini tour of the bazaar as we walked through the back alleys to the workshop. Very cool experience, I would highly recommend it for anyone who wants something beyond the typical Istanbul tour!

Amazing day sailing to the Prices Islands / sightseeing. Sinan did a great job showing us around Istanbul as well as being our guide on a sail boat adventure out to the Princes islands. The wind was minimal the day we were out so the sailing was limited but Sinan was great. He also provided us with some fantastic recommendations for dinner and sights around Istanbul.

Great Tour Group. We did the Istanbul in a day tour and were extremely pleased. They showed up on time in a very nice Mercedes van with both a driver and a tour guide. I did not expect this luxury as I assumed the driver would just show us the sites and talk to us. Our tour guide was able to face us in the back seat and talk about everything we were seeing. Our guide was extremely knowledgeable and enthusiastic and we enjoyed all of his recommendations, including a fantastic gourmet lunch. I also had issues with using my credit card in Turkey, and Sinan could not have been more patient or understanding as we sought to resolve the issue.

Incredible experience!. You MUST check out Istanbul Tour Studio for the best way to see Turkey. We went on a sailing tour from Istanbul to the Princess Islands, which included lunch on the island and swimming in the Bosphorus. The tour was clearly one of the highlights of our trip! Sinan is extremely friendly and knowledgeable and did a great job pointing out the history of the area, general facts about Turkey, and information about sailing. The Captain was also very friendly and experienced. This is one of the best things you can do in Istanbul, Five Stars!
great visit to great city. Sinan did a great job of showing us Istanbul in a day. Very knowledgeable, easy to work with and accommodated our schedule.

Excellent guide service for every type of traveler!. We initially engaged Sinan Sokmen and his tour service, Istanbul Tour Studio, to provide a half-day tour of the Hagia Sophiya, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. We found him such a good guide and delightful companion that we engaged him for an additional day to give us a combined gustatory, shopping, historical tour of Istanbul. It was an extremely personalized tour and gave us the opportunity to see more of the 'non-touristic' part of Istanbul. We are big foodies and he was able to direct us to a large number of great meals, including our target: new Turkish cuisine. We are a family of 5, but it was clear that he can provide tours catered to every type of traveler and every taste. He's a sophisticated guide who can give you a good view of local culture. He speaks English and Spanish. We have friends coming to Istanbul in the near future and have already hooked them up with Sinan.
Photography tour. I had a great time exploring off the beaten track spots in Istanbul ... Definitely the best bespoke tour operator in town

The Only Way To Truly See and Feel Istanbul's Infectious Vibe!. Our time in Istanbul was limited and we were lucky enough to experience a fabulous taste of what makes this city so special thanks to the extremely professional, fun and interesting tailored tours that we did with Sinan from Istanbul Tour Studio! From historical sites - The Topakapi Palace, Blue Mosque , the amazing Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern and so much more thanks to the insightful information we received from Sinan! The Grand Bazaar was a highlight - could not have done this so well without Sinan's knowledge and help going to all the best vendors and having a truly Turkish (insiders experience). Sinan not only made our stay so much more interesting and rewarding thanks to his knowledge and local secrets but also went beyond to assist with turkish bath and restaurant bookings (that were truly amazing), private car pick ups and drop offs and even sending parcels to my home in Australia! He was amazing ! Thankyou, thank you thank you! You have left a thirst for Istanbul which will definitely have us coming back for more!!!
