Fabulous tour, food, and conversation!!. My parents and I booked a private day tour with Nesrin as our guide as my father uses a wheelchair and conventional tours do not work logistically for us. We arrived via cruise ship to Kusadasi port and called Nesrin as we were early. She happily accommodated our time change and we easily met up. We had all been to the more typical Kusadasi stuff a couple times before, Ephasus, the house of Mary, a rug factory, etc. so we arranged with Nesrin something more unique and different. Nesrin is a sweetheart - knowledgeable and passionate about her country. Our driver was friendly and extremely helpful, we enjoyed getting to know him. Both spoke great English! The vehicle was clean, comfortable, and easily accommodated the wheelchair. Nesrin took us first to the Basilica of St. John, where she gave us an excellent historical overview if the evolution of Ephasus and Selcek. Then, we went to the Ephasus museum - witch was fabulous and very well done. I wish I had know about it the last time I visited. Nesrin guided us in the museum and made sure we understood the importance of many of the pieces. Afterward. I mentioned that I loved Turkish pottery, so she brought us to a lovely place where they hand make the most intricately beautiful pottery where we received a private demonstration of pottery throwing and painting. Lastly, we visited a wonderful winery where we had a beautiful outdoor patio to eat on overlooking the rows of grapes. We invited our driver and Nesrin to join us and thoroughly enjoyed the conversation! Overall, our tour was one of the better experiences we've ever had travelling. It was well planned, yet flexible and accommodating. I could not have asked for more, it was also quite affordable. I highly recommend!

1/2 Day Istanbul & Bosphorous Cruise Tour. This was a very enjoyable tour with our guide who was very patient in explaining much to us. He was very flexible in what we wanted to do and despite the fact that the tour is advertised at 6 hours, the time didn't seem to matter to him. He spent an additional two hours with us, took us to a restaurant in the Spice Market area that had the best lentil soup I've ever had, and paid for us on the tram, metro and funicular. Thank you for a very good, albeit tiring, day. Very enjoyable! We slept well.

All You Would Expect and MUCH MORE!. When we decided to go to Turkey we started looking for a guide for Istanbul and one for Kusadasi and Ephesus. After reading lots of reviews we were fortunate to find and decide to hire Nesrin for our tour of Ephesus and the other wonders in that area. And we hired Emre for two days of guiding in Istanbul. Both Nesrin and Emre are amazing historians as well as understand how to allow you to pace yourself from place to place. Emre suggested using a car service for our time together in Istanbul and that turned out to be a great idea. The comfort of having a car there when you were ready to move on and also to be able to leave jackets and umbrellas and water was a great comfort. We visited so many major sites in two days as well as had some wonder meals together. His knowledge as an historian was just as everyone has described. And his personality is such that you want to leave the tour knowing he will be an acquaintance for life!Nesrin greated us at our hotel the day of our tour but also called us upon our arrival in Kusadasi to make sure we were settled and happy in our hotel. We met her for our tour of Ephesus and Sirince Village for lunch as well as Virgin Mary's house and St., John Basilica. The day was amazing and we had Mithat, her driver with us to help make our day complete.Nesrin arrange for us to be with Mithat the following day and we went to a Haman and then to a winery outside of Kusadasi. It was a special place with great wine and a wonderful meal; one of the best we had in Turkey! And Turkey has amazing food. I cannot recommend this couple enough and we are already thinking about our next trip so we can book them for Capadocia and more of the Aegean coast. They are busy so don't waste more time seaching and try to book them for your needs. I will recommend that both in Istanbul as well as in Ezmir, you utilize the taxi services to settle you in your hotel and save the money to use Emre's and Nesrin's drivers the day of your tours. Their vehicles are very comfortble and it's great to be able to talk with them while moving around. The savings is great and there are good taxi's in Turkey if you are going to a known hotel or have directions written in the Turkish language to pass the driver at the airports. The hotel can get your back to the airport in a taxi as well.

Istanbul Sultanahmet Historic Sites. We had originally arranged 2 half day tours with a guide on September 17th and 18th, 2015. When this person had to bow out to to family health issues, Emre Ozkara stepped in to help his friends and provide us with our tours. We were traveling with my elderly Mother in Law and we didn't want to over tire her. We reviewed what we wanted to do and Emre gave us some invaluable advise on what was possible in the time allowed. At the end of the day, Emre organized two excellent days of tours. We had some great talks on everything from history to current affairs in Turkey. Plus he managed to keep everyone in the family interested and together - which is like herding cats. As others have said his English is excellent and he's very professional. If our travels take us to Turkey again we would certainly contact Emre for his services.

Istanbul tour - Summer 2015. Serkan provided an excellent tour of the city and was very knowledgeable and patient as he explained all of the sights. We had a great time exploring Istanbul with him and learning all about the city's culture and history. We couldn't have asked for a better day or a better guide! Thank you.

Emre is Amazing! Would recommend to everyone!. Emre was by far one of my favorite tour guides and now friend. He knew everything about anything in Istanbul. We truly got to see the real Istanbul! He was great about accommodating our large family. He helped in the markets when making deals and negotiating prices, which stores were fair and which ones were shady. I use the spices that I bought in turkey almost everyday! Can't wait to go back.

Excellent tour of Istanbul. Emre proved a very professional guide, helpful and engaging, and with extensive knowledge. His English was excellent and we learnt a lot about Turkey and its history, rather than just about the places visited. He said he was a teacher - clearly a good one!Sadly traffic was such that we didn't manage all that we had planned, but he changed things round a little to cope better (he had warned us that we might be trying to do too much!). The minibus driver was also excellent, guiding the large vehicle through gaps in traffic we'd have worried about taking a car through. All of my group would be very happy to use Emre's services again.

Professional, knowledgeable and friendly. A definite recommend!. Nesrin was the utmost professional. She was on time, geared the tour toward our crowd, provided excellent and interesting information about the sites we visited and her excitement about her home country made us even more interested. I would recommend her services to friends without question and would hire her again if we return.

Highly recommend! This was a well organized and informative tour week.. This was an amazing experience! We never waited in a line and were well taken care of throughout our stay in Istanbul. We had wonderful food with memorable views of the city. We learned all about the history and culture taking our time to tour the city. If you are taking a trip to Istanbul this is the way to do it!

A great way to spend a day. Excellent tour by Emre. On the tour we managed to visit all the sites we had put together on our itinerary. Emre was very knowledgable, giving us all the local, historical and general knowledge we could have hoped for. The vehicle was very comfortable, and credit to the driver who negotiated the road network in a calm and easy manner. This was such a good way to start or visit to Istanbul. I would recommend Emre's tour to all wanting to see both the obvious and also the less obvious sites of Istanbul.

Tour of Istanbul. I enjoyed a whole day with Ahmet, one of the guides for Delightful. He was excellent. He was very knowledgeable, very interesting and very friendly. He adjusted the pace of the tour to suit me and had an excellent ability to avoid the worst queues. And most importantly he responded immediately to my suggestion that we might stop and take a break for lunch! An excellent day - though I still bought more spices than I meant to in the spice market!

Amazing tours of Ephesus & Istanbul. My wife and I visited Ephesus and Istanbul in early June. We used Delightful Tours for both locations and our guides for both days were amazing. Knowledgable, friendly and courteous. In both places, we asked to be be shown sites not on the beaten path. In Ephesus, we were taken o a fantastic Turkish winery that rivaled any in Napa, CA. In Istanbul, we were taken outside the old city and main sites and toured a number of Sultan Palaces as well as the Chora Church (a MUST if you go to Istanbul).

Fantastic guide. My partner and I enjoyed a full day tour of Istanbul with Emre. Emre was recommended by our Australian travel agent and he certainly lived up everything she told us. He is a very knowledgeable guide with great English skills and most importantly a genuine personality. As a Kiwi I was also delighted to see he wore a Silver Fern on his lapel badge! Thanks Emre - I will pass your details on to any friends who are travelling to Turkey, and hopefully will see you again one day in Kusadasi or Gallipoli.

Best Way to See Istanbul!. Nesrin is a great tour guide. She is a knowledgeable, self-assured young woman, with excellent English and interpersonal skills, and was a pleasure to be with from beginning to end. Nesrin was enthusiastic and creative as she showed me her city, and took extra time to take me on a customized tour of areas not originally part of the planned tour. She has very thorough knowledge of the Dolhmabache Palace, and after we visited there Nesrin steered me through the tram and funicular system all the way to Taksim Square, at my request, for a wonderful stroll through the Taskim, Tunel, Pera, and Galata areas of Istanbul. I had arrived in Istanbul alone, and because of Nesrin’s thorough insider knowledge of the city, I was able to see the passages and nooks and crannies which I wouldn’t have found in otherwise. Nesrin was able to answer all of my questions about historic buildings, and filled me in on the current political situation and other cultural things. I also enjoyed being guided through the Grand Bazaar with Nesrin, again because she is a native of the city I was never uncomfortable and she by example taught me to feel comfortable in Istanbul.Nesrin is a delight to be with and an excellent tour guide. A 5 out of 5 rating!

Fantastic Guide. We had 3 days in Istanbul and arranged for Emre to guide us the first 2 days. He was fantastic- really knowledgeable and very pleasant to be with; his English is also excellent. His knowledge of the history is incredible, we went to real Turkish places for lunch and he showed us how to use the trams. Overall an excellent experience that made the sights of Istanbul come alive for us.

Lots of praise!. I hired Nesrin after hearing lots of praise from my family's tour with Emre a couple months prior. My mother-daughter trip was made better not only because of Nesrin's flexibility and knowledge, but it was lovely to have a friend for the day. She's personable, kind, and very intelligent. I highly recommend this tour team, as they are great guides and great people. Will be sure to keep their contact information for future adventures! Thanks, Nesrin and Emre for taking care of my family!

Two Perfect Days!! - one with Emre and one with Nesrin. We were part of the guided tour in the previous review. Emre guided the five of us on the first day and Nesrin on the second. All I can say is that both days were just fabulous. Emre and Nesrin both speak excellen English and were so accomodating of all of our needs and desires for sites to see and they truly brought Istanbul to life for us!! Two days in Instanbul. We hired Emre for our first day of touring and Nesrin for the second day. We had a wonderful experience both days. They met us at our hotel and we walked to the metro. Walking Tour of Istanbul. Nesrin Özkara guided the six of us around town for the day. We started the day with a visit to gardens as well as the Topkapi Palace. After a stop for lunch it was off to see Ayasofya; the Basilica Cistern and Sultan Ahmed Mosque (aka Blue Mosque).Nesrin was prompt, very friendly and informative and I would recommend her as a guide. Her English is excellent. Everyone in our group was pleased with the tour.

Delightful Istanbul Tour. On May 2, 2015 we, six Canadians, contracted Nesrin for the 7 hour Istanbul Waking Tour. Nesrin is the most passionate professional guide we ever met. She speaks excellent English and delivers very well a nice presentation of the history of her country and particularly its historic sites. From our meeting time at cruise ship, 8:30 AM, she quickly enquired particular interest of everyone in the group as she spent time with each person while travelling to the main attractions.We walked about five minutes from the ship to the nearly tram station for the 15 minutes tram ride. We found ourselves in the middle of most important history sites of Istanbul: the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Underground Cistern and finally the Grand Bazaar. Except for the Blue Mosque all other sites were entered on a fast track system. She prepared us before entering a site and provided more information once in. While lines up existed in certain rooms of the compound she would make an effort to seek permission to cut lines with success in most situations. We had lunch with her at an excellent restaurant she recommended. Prices were reasonable on the terrace overlooking the city and the river from the roof of a hotel. She gave us more than the seven hours stated in the contract as she said goodbye past 5:00 PM. On our behalf, she also took care of all the transportation costs and entry fees at all venues. Back on the cruise we compared notes with others that bought similar tour from the ship. We found that, being a small group, we received far more benefits from Nesrin than those from the ship for half the price. We saw far more exhibits mainly because we walked from one venue to the other, while a large bus was used for the ship tour.

Fantastic!. Our family of five hired Nesrin to show us the main sights during our one day in Istanbul. Istanbul. Emre was very friendly with excellent English. He was very knowledgeable and open to any questions about Turkey and customs. Emre was very accommodating and adjusted tour to meet our wishes. His easy, make happen style, made this an outstanding day and tour.

Wonderful immersion in Turkish culture. The best use of a six hour layover. Using Delightful Istanbul Tours ( www.delightist.com ) to visit the Sultanahmet and Hagia Sopia was clearly one of the best decisions we could have made. Go with Nesrin!. My husband and I traveled to Turkey with a small group (11 people). Nesrin was our guide from start to finish as we explored Istanbul and many other cities/sites in Turkey. Emre = Excellent Tour Guide. Emre was my tour guide for Istanbul in September 2010. He was excellent: friendly and knowledgeable. I would definitely recommend him.

Two days in Istanbul. We traveled with daughter and son in law early November. One Day Istanbul. My parents, my husband and I booked a one day private tour in Istanbul with Emre including airport transportation the night before. Top notch tour guides and delightful experiences!. My husband and I traveled for two weeks in Turkey with Emre as our guide. Highly recommend. My wife and I had the pleasure of two days of touring Istanbul with Delightful Istanbul tours. Fantastic tour and advice for our subsequent independent travel. My wife and visited Turkey for 10 days over the 2013-14 new year period. Fantastic & Memorable Trip to Turkey. Delightful Istanbul Tours exceeded our expectations on all levels of our itinerary. Great personalized tour of Istanbul!. Emre was recommended to me by a fellow Cruise Critic member, and via email I arranged a customized 1 1/2 day tour of Istanbul for a group of 12 during our cruise ship stop there in October 2013. Through email exchanges over a period of several months prior to the cruise, Emre provided a number of suggestions and feedback about itinerary ideas, timetables and costs, and put together a custom tour schedule in response to the interests of our group. His guide price was quite reasonable, and a great value for such a complete and customized tour compared to what was offered by the cruise line -- since the transportation costs were fixed no matter the group size, it was more affordable to have a group of at least 8 people; we had 12 but a group of 8 or at most 10 is what I'd recommend. When we arrived in Istanbul, Emre met us right outside the ship Sunday morning with a clean, comfortable Mercedes van (and driver), and we headed out on tour immediately. Emre's command of English is quite good and we had no problem understanding him; as we drove around the city he provided us with a historical and cultural perspective to the area and the sights. In less than 2 full days, we were able to visit several palaces, mosques, and bazaars as well as the amazing underground cistern. Emre amazed us with his extensive in-depth knowledge of each location we visited, and generally gave us sufficient time to explore a bit on our own after guiding us through the main areas. In hindsight, we would have been better served to let Emre purchase all our entrance tickets as a group which would have saved us some time and aggravation-- it turned out we could not use our credit cards at all the sites as we had planned to do. We also ran into a problem with our visit to the Spice Market when holiday traffic combined with scheduling changes required that we cut short our tour there in order to get back to the ship on time -- it would have been better to visit there early in the day and spend a bit less time at the palace. Overall, I highly recommend a custom tour with Emre to anyone visiting Istanbul and Turkey.

Superb Day in the Old City. Last month my daughter and I hired Emre, the guide/owner of Delightful Istanbut Tours, to show us around the Old City, aka Sultanhamet. We enjoyed the whole thing tremendously.

Excellent - 2 day visit to Cappadocia. My wife and I planned for a 2 day trip to Cappadocia from Istanbul. We had planned this via Turkey Tours and Travels from INDIA. He was not just a driver, but a guide, explaining to us about the history, culture and nature of cappadocia. Taking us through the exotic trails on red valley, love valley, taking pictures and what not! He was a true entertainer. I am sure people would want to visit Turkey again because of his hospitality, kind and helpful nature. To give a jist of what we covered in the last 2 days - Uchisar Castle, Three beauties, Fairy Chimneys, Love valley, Red valley, Red river (Suspension Bridge), Goreme Panoramic View, Sultan's pottery, Underground city, Imaginary valley, Monk's valley and Devrent. We also took an optional Hot Air Balloon (Please dont miss this! It is worth every penny.) The tour agency start at 9 am and end the tour at 4 30 pm. Lunch is included and the restaurants were awesome. Vegetarians please specify to the tour guide so that they make necessary arrangements. I want to say a BIG THANKS to NEVZAT (Driver, guide, photographer), Kubra (Day 1 guide), OGUR (Day 2 guide) and last but not the least Ms. Tujan Cevik (Without her, these would not have been possible). We are very happy with their services and I would suggest these names and people to all my friends who would want to visit Turkey again!Thanks!Vijay Soundararajan

Well organized and small personal tour of Turkey. First of all, I would HIGHLY recommend this tour company. I had a very good experience with our one week visit to Turkey. A big part of this is due to the very organized yet personal/small group size tour provided by Chora and their partners. I normally do not use a tour package when traveling. I prefer to do my own thing and organize my trips. When my friend suggested this the first time, I admit I felt the walls closing in on me and thought this would be restricting and we would have to follow a stringent tour schedule and worse, we would be stuck with the big bus of large tour groups. That was FAR from our experience. I was pleasantly surprised how much I enjoyed my trip.We took the Istanbul, Cappadocia, Ephesus and Pamukkale tour package. This included transfers to and from airport to hotels, breakfast, lunch, transportation during tours and airfare between cities.We had our own personal guide, Metin Ylmaz during our walking tour of Istanbul. He was the best! He was very knowledgable, helpful, thoughtful, easy going, flexible and most of all, FUN! He gave us the standard sites PLUS local insights. We had so much fun, it felt like we were just hanging out with a friend we've known for a while. When you get a chance, request for him to show you around Istanbul!For our Cappadocia tour, we had varying groups but it ranged between 6-10 people. Our days were filled with hikes, cave house visits, underground city and panorama visits, and best of all, hot air balloon ride over Cappadocia mountain and valleys! And while you will have to wake up super early, the balloon ride is so memorable and worth it! Our super cool and fun driver Nevzat even shared with us his amazing photos of the hot air balloon from different seasons and points of view! During the hike, our guide was so helpful and patient with my friend who was struggling with the pace by the other folks. Kubra was also so pleasant and she and Nevzat made everyone feel at ease and safe.Our visit to Ephesus and to the Blessed Mary's house was amazing! Seeing this ancient city and walking and experiencing the scale helped us envision what life might have been like back then. Plus our knowledgeable guide pointed so many small details that we may have missed had we gone on our own.Pamukkale was another natural wonder worth seeing. The white terraces and blue hot pools looked unreal it was breathtaking. They let us decide how we would want to spend 2 hours of our time between the terraces and Cleopatra's Pool. Our guide, Octavio was entertaining with his own brand of sense of humor. He was also nice enough to let people rest during the 3 hour drive from Kusadasi to Pamukkale.If I have some pointers, be prepared to eat lots of Turkish meals! The food is practically the same in every city. Also, do not be afraid to voice out if you are not interested in seeing or participating in one or two activities or sites they offer. This is your vacation anyway and you paid for it!All that said, this was one country where joining the tour group was well worth it!

It's a beautiful day in Cappadocia. Wow! where to begin. As my 2 day Cappadocia Tour comes to an end... It's time to reminisce the amazing adventure. Nevzat was my driver for the tour. It'll all be arranged accordingly to your schedule/likings. The whole tour was through, on point and at ease for anyone including if you're traveling with kids/elderly. There's so much more to say about Cappadocia, something you have to experience for yourself however. However I will add a slight note to weather. Since I'm traveling in mid March, day 1 was sunny and vibrant... shorts/t-shirt is perfect. Day 2, wow what a change... slight rain and temperature dropped at least 10 C, coat/pants/GLOVES/Umbrella will be more suitable. *To anyone who wish to do the balloon ride, please make sure the weather/wind conditions are within launch range AT THE DAY You're traveling or else it'll be canceled.* with refund of course. All in all, an absolutely terrific experience. 5/5

Turkey Trip. Last summer i came to turkey for vacations. Istanbul and kapadocia was the best. Anyone visits these places should try Chora travels day trips because they're the best. Also, do ask them to give you a driver "nevzat". Fun loving and entertaining. Overall the trip was amazing.

Reliable, smooth sailing. I was apprehensive that we wouldn't get picked up, or no one would show up. Thankfully, everything turned out fine. The pick up car were all prompt and decent. Cappadocia,Pumakkale . Just outstanding experience. The driver Navzet & the tour guide Saut where just amazing. Thank you guys for a fun full tour. Enjoyed to the fullest :-)

Cappadocia to Pamukkale to Ephesus... AMAZING AND WORRY FREE. My husband and I recently returned from a week long tour of Turkey and it was absolutely INCREDIBLE. Our drivers and tour guides were extremely knowledgeable about all the sites, took special interest in making each traveler feel comfortable and were always prompt. They began each day with an overview of the activities for the day, preparing us for any long walks or drives, informing us of how much free time we would have at each location and when to conserve our cell phone/camera batteries for better shots up ahead. At the end of each day our tour guides would make sure that we had all the information we needed for our next transfer or the plan for the following day. All the hotels we stayed at were comfortable and the one specifically in Cappadocia absolutely charming. A special thank you to driver Navzat and tour guide Suat who created a playful, culturally informative and educational environment at the beginning which then continued for our entire trip. Bottom-line... had a blast... no wasted time standing in lines or worrying about luggage... even the long drives were accompanied by spectacular landscapes and sunsets... =)

Cappadocia was a delight!. Just came back from a week-long vacation in Turkey, and it was amazing! Chora Travel arranged for our trip and my husband and I spent a couple of days in Cappadocia for our second stop (after Istanbul).The place is unique - the landscape is nothing like any I've seen before so it was great to have had the hot air balloon ride to see and appreciate the natural beauty of the place from above.Just like the place, I must say that we also had a one-of-a-kind driver, Nevzat, who absolutely made this leg of our trip most enjoyable and amusing. He helps keep us going during the long hikes and directs us to the best spots to take photos (and he takes it for us too!) ... what more can you ask for? Thank you Nevzat for our fun trip!

North & South Cappadocia Tour. Spent 2 days in Cappadocia doing the South and North tours, both days with driver Nevzat and guide Suat. Our initial itinerary from Chora was to do North on the first day but some reason it was the South tour running that day but in hindsight the sequence doesn't really matter as we saw different things and the guide's explanations doesn't assume you've already been to other sites.The best parts of this trip however were: (1) the hot air balloon ride, which allowed us to appreciate the natural beauty of the place from above. It was already moving towards winter so the scenery was devoid of green (which would have been nice I imagine) but it was all beautiful nonetheless; and (2) our driver NEVZAT who made the tour a lot of fun -- he tags along with the group during the walks and is always more than glad to take your pictures -- he's a pro and took superb pictures that we otherwise wouldn't have been able to take with our amateurish skills! If you do these tours, see if you can have him as your driver and for sure it is going to be a very pleasant experience!

Cappodocia Day Trip. I did the day trip from Istanbul with Chora Travel, It was excellent from start to finish, I was picked up promptly from my hotel in Istanbul at 4:30 and driven to the airport for the flight. I was leaving at midnight to go to Entebbe so Chora made sure my return flight was to Anaturk airport with enough time to check in.I did the Southern tour with Nevzat as the driver and Suat as the guide. as Nevzat told me he was more than just the driver, he was also photographer,driver, comedian and very very helpful making sure everyone had what they needed. Istanbul -- amazing city. Chora Travels provides a great way to see the sites of Istanbul with its Old City Walking Tour. As advertised, our private tour with Metin included the Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar. The highlight was lunch at a small hole-in-the-wall eatery inside the Grand Bazaar where we scrunched shoulder-to-shoulder with locals for delicious beans, rice and meatballs. After we had viewed the obligatory "top five," Metin -- who was justifiably very proud of his native city -- escorted us on the trams and finicular to walk Taksim Square, Istiklal pedestrian street and the many "passages." When dark fell, this modern part of Istanbul came alive as its restaurants, bars and musicians spilled out on to the streets. If only we'd had more time in this wonderful city ... thank you Metin for showing us a superb time in Istanbul.

Awesome 10 day tour. Great tour. My girlfriend and I did a 10 day/9 night tour that included Istanbul, Cappadocia, Antalya, Pamukkale, and Ephesus in November. Fatih did a great job coordinating all the transfers and reservations. Our guide in Istanbul, Matin, gave us a nice tour with exercise along with some good shopping advice. The guide and driver in Cappadocia (Suat and Nezvat, respectively), were very patient with the group and kept a good sense of humor. In Antalya, Ferdi (I think I've got that right), was our guide and quite funny with his view of Roman times. The driver (Ali, maybe) kept good care of our stuff and provided excellent baklava. Redwan, our Pamukkale guide was also quite good at coordinating things and kept things in order. In Ephasus, Sedar was very knowledgable on the history of the region. Almost everything ran very smoothly with very few hiccups (there was a miscue with the transfer from the bus in Antayla, but they made up for it by providing much needed breakfast after the night bus). The hotels were all pretty decent and the locations were very good, especially in Istanbul and Antalya. Overall great tour and I'd recommend Chora to anyone considering.

Great company but get ALL the details first.... We did the 7 days Istanbul Cappadocia Pamukkale and Ephesus Tour (Comfort Tour) in Sept. The tour was really good but could have been better for us if Tujan had given us a DETAILED itinerary BEFORE booking. We ended up with 2 days in a row with 4.30am starts & on one of those days we didn't get to our next hotel till nearly midnight (that's a 20 hour day)! We are in our 60’s so that resulted in us being a little too tired to really enjoy the tour as much as we might have. If we had known the timing before the bookings were made, we would have added an extra day, so I strongly suggest you ask for ALL the details, before you actually book! We found (& another couple we spoke to did as well) that the company does not offer advice or alternatives, which is a real shame. That being said, things were organized well and we did enjoy the small group tours & the hotels. The Ferman Hotel in Istanbul is looking quite tired & my husband went through the suggested hotels in the other locations & we chose what we wanted (of a higher standard) so that was good. The lunches on tour were very good, particularly in Northern Cappadocia. On the whole is was a positive experience & Turkey is amazing! We would highly recommend doing a balloon flight as well - it was a standout for us!

Cappadocia tours. I joined the Northern tour and southern tour. Both of them were amazing but I preferred the southern tour much more as I got to hike in the beautiful Red Valley and explore the massive underground city. Initially I thought the tour was a bit slow but it is actually perfect to enjoy and appreciate the nature and the beauty of the city. Overall i was quite happy with the tour. The driver NEVZAT was really friendly and entertaining. He tagged along with us at most of the tourist sites making jokes and taking beautiful photos for the guests. He made the tour really enjoyable.

Istanbul old city walking tour. We booked the old city walking tour. We ended up being the only couple on the tour which was kind of nice.Our guide was 15mins late picking us up from hotel so we were a bit panicked. Started off at Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Place they were amazing. The tour started off great but our guide seemed to lose interest half way through and was talking and texting on his phone a lot. Lunch was included in the tour but was not very good, we had to share a water between the 2 of us. Turkey has wonderful food so opt to eat something better. The hippodrome is a waste of time since it doesnt actually exist you just see 2 obelisks in a park area which you see withour a tour. The tour ended at the Grand Bazaar but really the guide just took us in then the tour was over and he left? It seemed really abrupt. It was an ok tour but felt like it was lacking.
Great tour!. Our Cappadocia tour was great thanks to our driver Nevzat. He took us to the best sites and helped us take wonderful photos.

Best day in Turkey!. Nevzat was our driver for the North Cappadocia tour and he went above and beyond to ensure the best experience for us. In fact, he acted more like our tour guide than the actual tour guide. When we went on the hike, he was the one who led us while our guide waited at a cafe. Nevzat knew the best spots to take photos and repeatedly offered to snap photos of us. We really appreciated this as we were getting tired of awkwardly asking bystanders to take photos of us.Also, when we needed to exchange money and there was no currency exchange office nearby, he offered us liras at a very reasonable rate. We joked that not only was he a driver, a tour guide and a photographer but also a bank!I'm not sure if it's possible but try to request him as your driver! You'll go home with the best photos!

Best tour in Cappadocia . I spent two days in Cappadocia (spend more time if you can!) and had a wonderful time thanks to Chora Travel. 3D2N trip to cappadocia 🏞. Joined a 3D2N trip to Cappadocia. Booking was made with Fatih. He helped us with all the arrangements, from accommodation to flights and planning of itinerary. 3D2N Cappadocia. Booked a 3D2N trip to Cappadocia where the agency booked the accommodation, domestic flights (Keyseri) planned the itinerary including meals (breakfast & lunch). Wonderfull Turkey !!. We just arrived to Mexico from a 7 day trip around Turkey, we discover Istambul, its astonishing palaces, mesquites, and history. After that we take a tour with Chora Travel, very profesional agency that introduce us to Cappadocia, Pammukale, Konya and Ephesus.The service was on time, tourist guides very nice, the hotels ok, especially in Goreme, that was in a cave, I really love it.Then we take a trip to Pammukale via Konya by car, it was really nice to met Nevsat, who let us know how kind turkish could be."I am just a car driver", (Nevzat) guide us by Turkey in a free going way, especially loving what he does. We learn a lot about turkish culture, in a kind and funny. You must ask for him to guide you.We really recomend to travel with Chora Tours, and discover wonderfull Turkey.

Wonderful day out, especially with Neuzat.. It was day filled with fun, only made possible by the awesome Neuzat and the easy-going guide, Suat. You have to request for Neuzat as your driver and you get so much more in return!Neuzat was more than a driver. He came specially to hike with us through the Red Valley though he could have parked and waited at the end of the route. He made the journey so much more fun with little discoveries along the path peppered with his jokes. He also took loads of pictures for us and even ended the day with beautiful souvenirs made by his wife for all the ladies. A pleasant surprise from a driver.As we had a co-guide for the underground city, Suat did not share much. But he opened up and joked more during the Red Valley walk. Well, an unexpected wonderful day out with a great driver!

Terrific Turkey!. Our group (two couples) organised our whole trip in Turkey with Chora Travel through Nejo. We booked with them as their itinerary suited our dates and where we wanted to go however it was their reviews on Trip Advisor that ultimately make our decision for us to book through them and they well and truly lived up them! It was effortless to book through them, they were very responsive and informative and organised a very memorable trip for us.We booked the 16 day Turkey Package Tour-Istanbul/ Gallipoli/ Troy/ Pergamum/ Ephesus/ Pamukkale/ Fethiye/ Blue Cruise/Antalya/ Konya /Cappadocia (Exclusive Tour) and would definitely recommend it as a great way to see the key areas in Turkey. The Blue Cruise was the highlight of the tour and definitely something you should include in your Turkey holiday. We had different guides in each area and they were all really knowledgeable and informative. A special mention to two outstanding guides – Metin in Istanbul (we had a memorable 13 hour day with him which included a day walking tour of the Old City, a cruise on the Bosphorus and what turned out to be an early evening walking tour of Taksim) and Suat in Cappadocia. And our driver Nevzat who made the long drive from Antalya to Cappadocia very entertaining with his charming wit and personality, as well as his amazing photography skills! We booked the Exclusive tour which meant some amazing 4/5 star hotels however we found in some instances that these hotels were either away from the city centres or in an adjacent town. This meant you were away from restaurants and shops but you could easily take a taxi. When this occurred, we found that Chora had automatically included dinner in our booking which was nice (look for half board on the voucher). All the hotels were really good except for the Parion Hotel at Canakkale which although a nice hotel it was a way out of town, the food was not the greatest and the wait and bar staff were very inexperienced which caused some frustration.Some tips to look out for:- Always take note of the name of the travel operators on your vouchers, because it varies and it really helps to have your voucher when being picked from a bus station.- The inter-city bus gives you an insight into the joys of public transport in Turkey so sit back and enjoy it for what it is. Note it generally took longer than noted on the itinerary as well.- The sales people in shops and markets in the touristy areas can been quite aggressive. We found if you said “no thanks” too quickly they would get quite argumentative saying you didn’t even bother listening to them. So we found it easier to just go along with the banter (“where are you from, etc) and then let them do their sales spiel and then say a polite no.Overall, an outstanding holiday destination and Chora do a great job of helping you experience all that Turkey has to offer.

Two great days in Cappodocia, thanks Nevzat!. We had two days of touring in Cappadocia with this company. Our driver Nevzat was the highlight of the trip. He personally walked us through the many attractions, took tons of photos for us, shared some of his great collection of photos and told us a lot about the area. If you have a choice, ask for Nevzat as your driver. Our guide was Suat. He was informative but pretty laid back. He generally gave you an overview and then left you to walk the attractions on your own. His best work was at the underground city. The day two food at Aydede Cafe & Restuarant was great. The day one buffet was very average. Overall, a great experience and a really great driver!

Great two days in Cappadocia thanks to our awesome driver Nevzat!. We visited Cappadocia for two days after spending four days in Istanbul. We arrived very early at the airport and were soon greeted by Nevzat who whisked us off to the offices of Chora Travel Day Trips with great some music and a comfortable van. He accompanied us on our first day by not only safely driving us from place to place, but also by walking with us along winding paths, keeping us on time, taking our photos wherever we wished, and sharing his own photography tips and awesome photos. Turns out he's a professional photographer! His charisma and easy going nature really made the day memorable. We had a fine guide both days, Suat, who is very relaxed and informative. We especially enjoyed our time in the underground cave city on our second day and Suat shared some great insights there. Overall, we were quite satisfied with Chora, and would recommend them to anyone visiting this incredibly historic and unique area in Turkey.

16 Exclusive tour of Turkey. A big thank you and hats off to Nejo and all at Chora Travel for organizing our Fantastic 16 day tour. Special thanks to Metin Yilmaz - our passionate and informative Istanbul expert guide for taking us to all the top attractions and many places that tourists would not normally see (go Galatasaray!!!!). Also special thanks to Nevzat ("I am only the driver") Gundogdu who was much more than a driver on our very long trip from Antalya to Cappadocia via Konya and also our driver for Cappadocia tour. Nevzat's humour and good nature made our time with him so enjoyable. One of the big highlights was the Blue sea Cruise - a big thank you to the captain and crew of the Alaturka 81 for a great laid back and entertaining cruise which only added to the spectacularly awesome Turkish Riviera - a must do when you visit Turkey.Chora Travel put together a comprehensive and well organized itinerary which encompassed great accommodation, pickups and all modes of transport which was very reassuring to us non Turkish speaking tourists.You would be mad not to choose this wonderful travel agency for your Turkish experience.

The Wonderful drive to Pamukkale . Nevzat Gündoğdu drove our group from Cappadocia to Panukkale with a stop to Antalya. He was a wonderful driver and very kind to all of us. It was a very long drive and he kept it fun and light hearted. We stopped to this wonderful street stand off the road where they had fresh fruit for us to eat. It was a very enjoyable time! I am so happy that we had Nevzat Gündoğdu as our driver from Chora Travel Day Trips! I would highly recommend him! His service was exceptional! Thank you again!

Fabulous. We took a tour through Turkey in October 2015. Thanks to an exceptional guide it was a magical experience. 5 stars to Nevzat who was guide, superb driver, music coordinator, photographer and computer wizard. We cannot recommend him highly enough. Marianne and Peter, Vancouver Canada

Nil and Metin are fantastic. My husband and I booked our whole trip in Turkey through Nil and she was fantastic. Not only did she organise the trip exactly as we wanted to fit in with the places we wanted to visit in the time frame we had but she was completely professional and great to communicate with. Before arriving in Turkey we had been traveling for three weeks where we had to organise everything ourselves. It was so nice in Turkey to have everything done for us. All of our transfers and tours ran so smoothly, we had breakfast included everyday and lunch all but one day. We only had to organise dinner for ourselves, otherwise everything was done for us. I cannot thank Nil enough for the great effort she put in and for everything running so smoothly and stress-free.We had one day in Istanbul where we did a walking tour of the Old City and there was only one other person in our group. Metin, our tour guide, was awesome. He was so knowledgeable and passionate which made it much more enjoyable. He also gave us advice along the way about traveling around Istanbul and Turkey and knew the best way to get into and see every site. The place we stopped for lunch was great also (the best place for food we were taken to in Turkey by a tour).I would highly recommend using Nil to organise your holiday in Turkey and Metin to take you around Istanbul. A great choice for Turkey Tours. My husband and I planned a two-week honeymoon in Turkey and Greece and wanted to explore the highlights of Turkey in a short 3-4 day tour, and came across Chora Travels via Daily Istanbul Tours which had good reviews On TripAdvisor.Nil Yilmaz was our contact person, and she was very prompt in her email replies and put together a 4-day tour of Cappadocia, Ephesus and Pamukkale for us, and took into account our flight time into Turkey (which resulted in an extra night in Goreme) and our wish to watch the whirling dervishes and also the hot air balloon (an absolute MUST).We enjoyed our time in Cappadocia the most, and liked our guide and driver team there the most - Suat and Nevzat - and were very lucky to get them for both days in Cappadocia. Suat was pretty chill but certainly knew his stuff, and Nevzat went beyond his driver duties by accompanying us up some hikes and took photos for us. We later realized his passion for photography - he would tell us where to stand and took really great photos!Some tips to look out for:-Always take note the name of the travel operators on your vouchers, because it varies. If you're not sure what time they are coming to pick up (normally it's written in the itinerary) you can always get your hotel to call them first to check.-You can do your own Web check-in for the internal flights (Turkish Airlines) and not worry abt getting to the airport too early. The booking codes will be sent with the itinerary.-Be prepared to be brought for some shopping of local specialties. In our case, we went to an onyx/jewellery workshop, pottery workshop, carpet shop, leather outlet. They say no obligations to buy, so be firm if you really don't wanna buy, but they certainly stage it well that you will be tempted. But some were really interesting because they gave some demonstrations and it's really part of their local culture. Just heads up!

A perfect holiday with Chora Travel agency!. We went on a 10 day trip of Turkey in July this year, organized by Chora Travel Agency. We had the best time. It was very well organized. I absolutely recommend this travel agency.

Thanks Chora Travel for an awesome trip!. Thank you to the awesome people at Chora Travel - we had the trip of a lifetime. Fatih was kind enough to meet us at our hotel in Istanbul to go over the details of our five day trip to Cappadocia, Konya and Pammukule, and answer any questions we had. In Cappadocia, we did a hike, saw an underground city and churches from the early Christian era, and walked through valleys with the region's characteristic rock formations. The hot air balloon ride was definitely the highlight for us and a must do if you can, along with just walking around, people watching and playing with the cats :D in the small town of Goreme. One thing I would change though would be the time we spent at a couple shops they took us to during the trip. Both of us would have preferred to have more time enjoying Cappadocia's natural beauty - for example 15 minutes at the Pigeon Valley overlook wasn't enough. From Cappadocia we drove on to Konya and Pammukule with our driver Nevzat, who was an excellent host and did everything he could to really take care of us. Besides being nice, easy to talk to and funny, Nevzat truly treated us as his royal guests. Nevzat also offered us a glimpse into the local side of Turkey that we otherwise would have missed by answering questions and providing commentary on Turkish life and culture. He was more a host than a driver, and made our long car ride one of the highlights of our trip by teaching us things that we otherwise would have missed as tourists. Think Anthony Bourdain (but much more handsome and funny) in driver form. Ask for him as your driver and you won't be disappointed. Nevzat suggested stopping by the Caravanserai on the way to Konya which is not only beautiful but has some awesome history, and I recommend that as well. In Konya we had lunch and visited the Mavlana Museum and then headed on to Pammukule. Aside from slipping and dropping my cellphone in one of the pools, I still enjoyed Pammukule - especially the Cleopatra pool which lets you to actually swim in the water. Thanks Chora and Nevzat for an awesome trip! We hope to see you again the next time we come to Turkey.

Turkey, simply stunning! Thanks to Chora Travel!. I was lucky enough to find Chora Travel via trusty Google and from my initial enquiry to after I returned home the service I experienced was outstanding. My contact at Chora was Fatih who put together a great package that included Istanbul, Gallipoli (Canakkale), Kusadasi, Ephesus, Pamukkale, and Capadoccia over 12 days (including arrival and departure days). I Was very impressed with the email correspondence leading up to my trip, in particular the prompt replies to my queries and the detailed information provided. On top of that he met me at my hotel the day I arrived to sit down and go through the itinerary and then showed me around the area. The trip included 2 private transfers on the long legs between Canakkale and Kusadasi and Pamukkale and Cappadocia which were very comfortable with very experienced drivers. The tours included in the itinerary were a walking tour of Istanbul, guided tour of Gallipoli through Crowded House tours (this tour felt a bit rushed but was still a highlight being an Australian), the remaining tours to Ephesus, Pamukkale/Hierapolis and Cappadocia were through Shah Mat tours and were all outstanding. My tour highlights were all of the above but in particular the hot air balloon ride over Cappadocia (optional extra but worth every cent!). The accommodation they organised was another highlight, with very comfortable rooms provided through out the stay. Ferman Hotel in Istanbul, Grand ANZAC in Canakkale, Effe Boutique Hotel in Kusadasi (right on the water with every room having a balcony looking out over the bay), Tripolis Hotel in Pamukkale and the Dervish Cave Hotel in Gerome (Cappadocia). All hotels provided well appointed rooms in, great locations with very polite and friendly staff. Another bonus was that breakfast was included every day and most days lunch too. I cannot begin to effectively describe how memorable this trip was, met great people, saw stunning architecture and natural landscapes, was enveloped in incredible history and saw beautiful and rich culture that clearly demonstrates how multiple cultures and religions can work in harmony in the majority of instances. Chora Travel and Fatih I particular contributed to this through the great itinerary they put together. I would highly recommend them to those looking for a great experience in Turkey.

Lovely Turkey. This is the place to be. We took this tour because it had ancient buildings historical places and beautiful things to do. Best days in Turkey. Spent 15 days in turkey with friends. Had a wonderful experience in istanbul, kapadokya & Antalya. Anyone of you visit kapadokya do try to get Nevzat as your driver for the best tour. He's the man!

Metin Yilmaz - Best Tour Guide!. We booked a 2-person Istanbul tour with Metin in July 2015. He was hands down our favorite tour guide during our 2-week stay in Turkey. We had a fantastic time learning about the history and quirky fun facts about the sites we visited. His humor made everything much more interesting. I didn't think it would happen, but I actually really enjoyed learning about history for once! And he was really flexible when we wanted to add more sites to our program.Metin was also very resourceful. He is connected to a network of tour guides that quickly helped us locate some really obscure attractions we were interested in (eg Turkish coffee brewed in hot sad). We had a blast with Metin, and we would definitely recommend him to everyone!

Excellent tour with the best of Cappadocia. I had a tour organised by Chora Travel.The tour was well organised. We were picked up and dropped off after tour on time.Our driver Nevzat and guide Suat were helpful, friendly, well knowledged.We had a fantastic time.The program gave us some of the best travel experiences we have ever had.We have seen Kaymaklı underground city, three sisters rock, Goreme open air museum and fairy chimneys.ıt was a fantastic trip with Suat and Nevzat.I definetly recommend them and Chora!.

Excellent service. We had booked a two day Cappadocia tour and had an amazing time. Our guide Suat and driver Mr Nevzat were both incredibly informative, punctual and helpful. He was funny, cheerful and had a great vibe that made the whole experience of seeing this amazing place a lot better.

Day Tours!. I did 2 day tours in Cappadoccia which were both amazing. The land is truly beautiful and the best part was the balloon ride where you must bring a good camera with you because you will get amazing shots! All our tour guides were great and spoke very good English but a stand out for really good guest service was our shuttle driver Nevzat who I believe also takes tours. Thank you Nevzat!

Best guide/driver in Cappadocia.. Zuhal was our tour guide and Nevzat was our driver for two days in Cappadocia. Flawless . After reviewing 10 diffrent tour agencies in TripAdvisor I decide to go with Chora because it suits our itinerary (me and my cousin) ! Trip to Capadoccia. We had a 2 day trip to Capadoccia and it was amazing thanks to our so welcoming driver Nevzat and informative guide Zuhal. These two really are like family now! We also went to see the dervish, which I think is a must watch!! All in all amazing place and amazing people

Turkey travel . Great Trip. I would like to thank Fatih for his help in making this a memorable trip to Turkey for my brother and myself. I would definately use Chora for my next trip to Turkey. Excellent Service. My wife and I joined Capadocia tour on June 2015, very good communication from the start of planning, Good service, good food and hotel. Nejo always responses our email quickly. Good service and high commitment.

Book with Chora!. My brother (33 years old) and I (29 years old) just spent three weeks in Turkey. Fatih Dogan, a travel agent from Chora worked with me. Awesome Turkey tour with Chora Travels. Travelled to Turkey in July 2015 with Chora Travels and I cannot say enough good things about them. Dream Trip Around Turkey. Chora Travel lived up to all of it's 5 star reviews! From the start of our planning right through to our tour through Turkey, and finally our drop off at the airport, Chora was prompt and always willing to please. During our planning we had an idea of what we wanted to see and emailed Chora after a friend's recommendation, and looking at Trip Advisor reviews. Chora Travel was extremely prompt in replying and was able to guide a group of four through what we could do in the time frame available. 9 Days Economic Tour. My friend booked this tour with Chora Travel and we had a great time in Turkey. We decided to go for the economic option which turned out to be fine as the only economic aspect of the tour was the accommodation. The hotels were clean and staff were polite and helpful. The transfers provided by Chora travel were on time and made this trip stress-free. The only negative part of this trip was the transfer to Goreme which felt like forever with all the waiting and unnecessary transfers onto different buses. We went around Turkey in different vans with different small groups of other tourists (I think everyone booked under Chora travel). This provided us opportunity to meet different and interesting people. Chora travel's partner agencies were good too (Shah Mat in Cappadocia and Ephesus, Mislina in Pamukkale). Our guides were friendly, knowledgeable and made the trip more enjoyable- Metin in Istanbul, Suat in Cappadocia, Aysun in Pamukkale and Gokce in Ephesus - Thank you.

8 Day Turkey Trip. Our experience with Chora Travels who planned the trip for us really pleasant and wonderful. Erin Ercil, our main co-ordinator which whom we were corresponding is a true professional. She was prompt with her email replies and correspondence and addressed each and every concern and queries that we had - both during the trip and afterwards. We were travelling as a family and she planned the schedule so as to ensure that we did get adequate rest between the various places we visited (Istanbul, Cappadocia, Parmukkale, Ephesus and back to Istanbul for our return flight). The meet and greet arrangements were impeccable so too was the pick up and drop from the hotels. The guides (and I will name them - Metin at Istanbul, Octai at Parmukkale, Serder at Ephesus, Zuhair and Turkman at Cappodocia) were co-operative, well informed and accommodating to our needs and requests. We really had a wonderful time; memories that we will cherish.

Excellent service. Me & my family had a great time during my stayed under the guide of Mr Harun & Mr Nevzat. Well knowledge and well prepared guide. Highly recommended for traveller with young children.

Turkey Trip Vacation. My friend Michelle and I had a fabulous time touring Turkey nonetheless aided by our superb guide Metin Yilmaz. Make sure to look up Metin Yilmaz if you are going to Istanbul, Turkey. You will have a great time.

Amazing time in Turkey with Chora Travel Agency. We took a 7 day tour in Turkey with Chora Travel. The agent, Nil was always available to arrange things for us. Our tour guide in Instambul - METIN YILMAZ-was so energetic and passionated about his city that it was contagious. We could see the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi palace in few hours. You save time not doing long lines to get tickets. Metin was not only fun but very informative about the beautiful history of his country. People like him makes you come back for sure!.SUPER RECOMMENDED HOTEL IN INSTAMBUL: FERMAN HOTEL. Personnal hotel with the best view you can have from the city. Totally different places from each other, worth it to visit all of then.Capadoccia: Hot balloons tour are a MUST, $ 150 a ride but you will keep the memories of your life. Not only you go up to witness the beauty of Capadoccia but go down inside the valley almost touching the rock formations, ONLY THERE.Hotel Nostalgia was I_N_C_R_E_D_I_B_L_E as it is owned by a wonderful family and make you feel you are turkish. Amazing breakfast in an open terrace overviewing Gomere.I was really impressed with Turkey, mrs civilized, friendly and beautiful that I have ever imagine. Want to go back.

Dream Team. We've tended to avoid packaged tours in all of our previous travels, but decided to sign onto the 5-day Cappadocia-Ephesus tour with Chora, this being our first visit to Turkey. Chora travel. We have traveled quite a bit, but were wondering whether to book a tour in Turkey. We invested 5 days with Chora Travel, and had the time of our life. Amazing!. We had an amazing time in Turkey! We had a fabulous guide, Metin Yilmaz. He's extremely knowledgeable and was even able to answer our strange questions. Look him up if you make it to Istanbul!

A brilliant eight days with Chora Travel. Our group of four on a private tour laughed our way around a packed eight day itinerary largely organised with the expert help of Nejoo at Chora Travel. Gallipoli, Ephesus, Canakkale, Permakale, Kusadasi, Cappodocia and Istanbul. Astonishing beauty, history and culture. Beautiful clean and modern cities, services and attractions which amazed at every turn. 5 Day Turkey Tour. Never having booked a tour online before you wonder if you've made the right decision. Our 5 day tour of Turkey was a huge success. It was jam packed with exciting things to do. Istanbul old city tour. My wife and I came to Turkey for our honeymoon and spend the first 4 days of our trip in Istanbul! Would highly recommend this to anyone travelling to Istanbul!

Istanbul Walking Tour. We thoroughly enjoyed our walking tour of Istanbul. In one day we covered the most important aspects and learnt so much. Our guide Metin was WONDERFUL. Turkey Trips. Chora met our demands for seeing a lot of Turkey in a short period of time. Beautiful Capadoccia!. Capadoccia has an amazing landscape, beautiful people and hotels! My guide Suat and driver Nevzat were enthusiastic to share the details of each stop including the history, culture, tradition.

"Nevzat Gundogdu". Driver tour guide who pick us up from Pamukkale to Cappadocia. Excellent safe driver with great knowledge about his homeland and history. Truly a great experience. My friend and I went on a 2 day tour of cappadocia and had an amazing time. Fantastic experience. Chora organized our 3 night trip in Turkey. We had fantastic accommodation, and an incredible itinerary.Nevzat our driver was friendly, high energy and very accommodating. When my friend was ill Nevzat and our hotel both went out of their way to help and make her comfortable. A great experience!Our tour guide the first day, Mensure was also knowledgable and fun! Unfortunately the second day our guide Suat was less interested in the group although he still provided a lot of great and helpful information - he was just less engaged.Nejo from Istanbul Tours was our contact and he was very patient with our many questions and extremely helpful. He swapped our tour days to accommodate us getting a flight out via the right airport. Metin Yilmaz - Tour Guide in Istanbul. I would like to highly recommend Metin Yilmaz as a Tour Guide for a Tour in Istanbul. Metin was the perfect guide for a day tour as he knew all the history of Istanbul and was able to perfectly explain it to the clients without being boring. He was also funny and always there to help us if we had further questions about a nice coffee spot or restaurant for the evening. He also offered us to always call him if we have any further questions. He was very respectful but also like a very good and funny friends during the day tour :-) I would recommend him!

Prompt Service. We began our email inquires to Istanbul Daily Tours aka Chora Travel. That was very comforting for us.Go with Chora Travel for your ease of mind.

Great tour group. Chora coordinated a tour of Istanbul, Pamukkele, Konya, and Cappadocia for us. So far the experience has been great. Cappadocia to Pamukkale. Great agency. Ask for Nevzat gündogdu when you look for a driver. He is very knowledgable and well connected - important when you're going around and don't know anyone in town. Nice music mix.

Prompt replies and excellent service.. I booked my 7-day tour around Turkey through Chora because of the reasonable price. Moreover, I received prompt replies from the tour coordinator, Fatih. The tour agencies that Chora sublets their tours to are also very reliable and the tour guides are very informative. The hotels given for me to choose are also very safe and comfortable, especially for a solo traveller like me. Thank you Chora for making my trip to Turkey really enjoyable!

Cappadocia tour was the best part of our trip to Turkey!. Daily Istanbul Tours scheduled a private tour for a group of 10 of us to travel to Cappadocia. It was the best part of our trip to Turkey for many in the group! Highlights: - Tour guide was great. An agent came to our hotel the night before to review pricing, give us our flight tickets, and itinerary. - Easy since Daily Istanbul Tours planned the entire things from Istanbul and back. They even picked us up and dropped us off at different hotel locations!- The fairy chimney's and scenery in general seems like it's from a Dr. Seuss book. So beautiful it's unreal! Tips: - If you have enough people for a private tour, ask the guide to cater to your groups preference. Perhaps you want to schedule a two hour hike instead of more time at the museum. - Cave hotels can be expensive. We stayed at the Sha Maht Hotel. Cheaper, still beautiful, and great service! - Pay for the balloon ride! It was worth it 110%. Just know that you'll have to wake up at 3:30am. - Don't pay for any souvenirs (jewelry or pottery) at workshop stops with a tour guide. The sticker price is the price with a guide, with out a guide you should pay half, and locals pay 30% of that cost. Barter in town or local shops if you want gifts.

Fun filled day in Sultanahemet . We were introduced to most of the main attractions in the Sultanahmet area by Metin - who was energetic, informative and entertaining. He strategised the day so that we would avoid queues and crowds of people, when possible. Not only did he provide detailed information about the attractions, he also answered all Istanbul and Turkey related questions that we had, as well as providing extra tourist tips. Thank you Metin for making our first day in Istanbul a fantastic one! Kristen and Kent

Istanbul day tour......with Metin . The day tour of Istanbul was the beginning of our three week travels through Turkey. The tour was great and now at the end of our travels, after many tour guides, Metin is still our favourite! Great guy, informative and friendly. He went above and beyond to help us with some money issues we were having at the time . Now that we are back in Istanbul we have contacted him to see what other tours he is involved in.

Day tour with chorra. It was a nice day tour with chora travel agency we saw the silk factory and carpets also the clay factory where they make a wonderful plates
The tour guide Mr. Suat and the driver of the bus Mr. Nevzat are really nice

Great Istanbul tour with Metin Yilmaz from Chora Travel Day Trips!. I'd like to recommend Chora Travel Day Trips and especially Mr. Metin Yilmaz as tourist guide. You NEED to book this tour!. Whether you are in Istanbul for a day or a week you need to book a day tour with these guys! Excellent Day-trip to Pammukale. The trip was excellent!The arrangements were flawless and it went very smooth. Thanks a lot and we would surely recommend to any of our friends visiting Istanbul.

The best way to see Turkey is with " Chora Travel". My husband and I visited Turkey recently. It was 10 days trip and I decided to pick Chora after reviewing a few others on line. My judgement was not wrong. It was amazing service by them. I was given a few choices to fill up that 10 days and they suggested the best option. The agency is very accommodating to fulfill my request. The package that they gave us include most of the things that we wanted. They received us at the airport without any delay or waiting; which i'm really concern when come to time. We spent 2 days in Istanbul; a magnificent city of Turkey. The guide that they gave us has a excellent knowledge on history of Turkey; spoke English very well and very punctual. Stress-Free Travels. My friend and I partook in Chora's 9-day economic tour. The only economic aspect of the tour was the accommodation, which actually turned out to be perfectly adequate. (We particularly enjoyed our stay in Hotel Ilkay, Istanbul). All transfers were seamless and on time, apart from the one arranged by the bus company Nevsehir Seyahat to the bus station for our overnight bus to Goreme. It took 2.5 hours in total to actually get to the bus station but Chora is of course not to be blamed for this. Although we were on an economic tour, we went around Turkey in very small groups. In Istanbul there were only 3 in our group! Every group was different as well so it was a nice opportunity to meet new people. Chora's partner agencies were great too (Shah Mat in Cappadocia and Ephesus, Mislina in Pamukkale). Our guides were professional, friendly and knowledgeable - Metin in Istanbul, Suat in Cappadocia, Aysun in Pamukkale and Gokce in Ephesus - all excellent. I had a fabulous time in Turkey and can't wait to go back!

Awesome Driver - Nevzat. The trips were well planned in Cappadocia and that the pickups were usually on time. The best part is the entertaining and helpful driver - Nevzat who took the extra mile in helping us take photos and interacting with us. The guide was great too.

A Wonderful Private Tour. Chora Travel put together a wonderful private tour of Istanbul, Cappadoccia and Ephesus for our group of 10 friends. From the very first enquiry, email correspondence with Nejo was prompt & professional. He was able to accommodate special requests & multiple changes to the itinerary in the months before we traveled. It was also very reassuring that we could contact Nejo at any time during the trip itself.All arrangements were clearly outlined, with no hidden charges. The trip was excellent value for money--the hotels, meals, guides (Metin & Mr Ozkan), and service far exceeded our expectations.Our domestic flights were on Pegasus Airlines. The planes were fine & the flights were on time, but do note that included checked baggage is 15 kg, with 8 kg carry on.If you intend to do a lot of shopping, consider adding extra luggage allowance.Thank you, Nejo, for such a memorable trip!

First class service, THE way to see Turkey. We have just concluded an 8 day trip to Turkey covering Istanbul, Cappadocia and Izmir, arranged through Chora Travel. Nejo has been amazing from the start, working tirelessly to help us plan, and being available for any queries or problems. Ozkan in Cappadocia was superb, so knowledgeable and well-spoken.

A lovely experience. Firstly,Turkey is BEAUTIFUL.Secondly,do it with Chora Travels :)We are very glad to have done so. The owner Nejo helped us plan a private trip just my husband and myself, and we covered Istanbul, Ephesus, Pamukkale and Cappadocia. We were very lucky that he accompanied us throughout the trip. He arranged local guides at Istanbul,Troy & Pergamum, Ephesus, who were all knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. May Chora Travels grow up to be the most sought after travel agency. God bless !!

Outsanding. I can highly recommend Chora Travel (and Nil in particular) for their willingness to work with us in devising an itinerary covering the things we wanted to see and do during our recent stay in Turkey. Utter professionalism and efficiency - an absolute pleasure to do business with and recommend to other travellers!

An excellent service!. I'm a frequent traveler, and last year was the most memorable and joy able vacation my family and I had. We had a great trip in Turkey. After browsing the net to get informations on which tour agent will make our vacation a wonderful one, I finally chose Chora Travel and I must say that I have no regret about it. He was such a fine gentleman that will goes beyond his duty as a driver to serve Chora Travel. The guide MR SUAT was a very knowledgeable person that make us feel that we travel back against the time during the Roman Empire.Great job by NEVZAT that really care for my children. They really love him.I really recommend Chora Travel to whom who wishes to visit Turkey.Miss you Turkey and NEVZAT!

Amazing trip with Nevzat!. We had an amazing trip to cappadocia. ..unforgettable hot air balloon ride..day trip to south n north cappadocia with the agency. Very informative n interesting trip . Should recommend this agency to others.

Great Cappadocia Tour!. Well organised tour! From the efficient pick up and excellent guides Suat and Nevzat! Nevzat was really a delight and helpful with everything - pointing out sights, helping us take pictures and even giving us a mother's day gift! Had a great time visiting the sights too! Would recommend!
Excellent service!. Took a 2 day trip in Cappadocia organised by Chora travel. Our guide Suat and driver Nevzat were friendly, knowledgeable and profesaional. We had a wonderful time.

Amazing Holiday!!!. We booked a 14 day tour to Turkey and covered Troy, Pergamum, Ephesus, Pammukale, Antalya, Cappadocia and Istanbul. Choral Travel did an excellent job in planning our whole trip without any glitches. Tujan was our tour coordinator and she went an extra mile to keep in touch with us through whatsapp to answer our unending queries while all the time being patient and accommodating to our requests and changes. Thank you Fatih and Tujan of Chora Travel for making it a memorable holiday. I would definitely recommend you to others

Someone who appreciate excellent service.. I just wanted to say massive thanks to all staff who made our trip the trip of a life time in one of the most important and imposing religious city's in the world Istanbul.The massive historical centre and culture of the last 14 century. I was shown Istanbul like I have never seen it before. Maybe because that Chora Travel have provide me to see the blueprint for countless Ottoman-era mosques and buildings. Glittering with gold mosaics, ultimate Byzantine and Ottoman city. I couldn't recommend enough to go and enjoy this city with this company. Again thank you so much for our trip and I am sure we will be back soon.
Excellent service!. Amazing day trip in Cappadokia. Our tour guide Nevzat and Suat are very fun to be with. Good hospitality and very helpful.

Happy customer. As other reviews note, Chora is the overall organizer of multi day tours throughout Turkey. All flights, hotels and transfers were spot on and perfectly organized. In Cappadocia we had Shah Mat Travel as our 2 day hosts. Our hotel was wonderful (MDC Cave Hotel). I cannot say enough good things about our guide Suat and driver Nevzat. We had a wonderful time with them. They provided our best tours of our trip. Our breakfasts and lunches were included and all meals were good. Our other tours in Ephesus and Pamukkale were good but Suat and Nevzat were just so outstanding! Would definitely recommend Chora Travel to arrange a complete itinerary. If you are just going to Cappadocia, you could book your own flight and arrange directly with Shah Mat. One negative is flights on Pegasus. Seating is very tight. Flights on Turkish Air are more comfortable. Do not be afraid of using the "Metro" Bus system. We had a 2.5 hour bus ride from Ephesus to Pamukkale and service was excellent.

Great tour with Metin. We were only in Istanbul for two full days so it was a huge help to have Metin guiding us on Day 1.He had loads of great knowledge and knew just the right amount to share without bombarding us with dates & facts. He was also very friendly and helpful throughout the few hours we spent with the group.The tour itself included Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and a three-course lunch so comes highly recommended.

It could be better.. We purchased the 12 days Turkey Tour Istanbul Cappadocia Antalya Pamukkale Ephesus and Kusadasi (Exclusive Tour) with an extra day in Guzelyurt and Kusadasi. Chora travel subcontracts most of the tours out to other tour services in the various localities outside of Istanbul. It is a little hard to rate the travel agency apart from the services received from the local travel agencies and the hotels. That being said, if I were to rate the quality of the tours overall, I'd say good but not excellent. Sometimes our guides just gave large chunks of information and left us to sit down and wait for us at the end. I noticed that on other tour groups the guide would walk with the groups more to each portion of the attraction and then give the talk in smaller more frequent portions.The Istanbul walking city tour began late in picking us up due to "miscommunication because of the weekend." Everyone on our tour felt that the tour was very rushed. The guide tried to sell us the Bosphorous tour 3 times during the tour. We didn't get the Grand Bazaar tour because it was closed on Sunday. Our tour was over by 2:30pm.I would not recommend an extra day in Ihlara Valley as we had. It's very similar to what we already did the day before. I wish that Chora travel could have given me more information/advice on this. As a tourist whose never visited the area you really on your travel agency for this type of guidance.One of the best guides we had was during the Aspendos Perge tour from Blue Sea Garden. He was hilarious and knowledgeable.Of the five hotels we stayed in, we had a major issue with Mediterra Art Hotel in Antalya (clogged shower drain which caused water pooling all over the bathroom and hallway and bites from a mosquito in room; uncooperative service from staff to change room) and moderate issue with La Vista in Kusadasi (major backhoe digging up the whole street to lay down new sewer pipe right in front of hotel next to the swimming pool which caused closure of the street, dust clouds and very loud noise from 8:30am to 7pm. The driver dropped us off at the corner when we came into town. Since we were here for 3 nights, it wasn't as pleasant as it could have been. We had to walk by that mess to get to town. La Vista's views, rooms and food were superior but unfortunately, we didn't want to linger or use the pool because of the noise and dust. I wish that Chora Travel could have checked that out beforehand or had been alerted by the driver when he dropped us off at the end of the street.The other 3 hotels had very good food and amenities Dosso Dossi, Istanbul; Nostalgia Cave, Cappadocia; and Pam Thermal, Pamukkale.Regarding the transfers: We got to everywhere as promised but I think the transitions could have been smoother with a little more help from Chora. For example, when you have a non-english speaking driver just drop us off at a Bus Station with a ticket all in Turkish, it would be helpful to have a written note as to what number gate/zone we should go to and what number bus we are looking for and what time the bus will leave.Also, the ride to Kusadasi has a rest/toilet stop at a mini-mart that is swarming with mosquitos (got bit 3x) so let me warn you all now to put on insect repellent beforehand.The tour guide who took us to the Cleopatra Swimming Pool told us we could leave our stuff on the van. Instead she should have given us instructions to get our swim suits before the van drove away.

The most memorable vacation in my life. My family and I had the most wonderful trip in Turkey this year. We were so fortunate that we engaged Chora Travel that made this vacation the unforgettable ones. They are very professional and well organized company with good communication among the travel operator that make our transfer from one place to the other very smooth. We spent two days in Istanbul and definitely two days is too short to explore this beautiful city. Than we moved to Kusadasi, visited many interesting places. The vehicle they used is very clean with good driver and well learned guide. Then we spent three nights in Cappadocia, this was the peak of our vacation; from the moment we were picked up from the airport by our wonderful MR NEVZAT till the last day of our stay there, he continuously shower us with great care. He is very punctual and very concern with our wellbeing. He will make sure that our needs are well taken care off. The guide, MR SUAT is another person that we would like to congratulate for being able to transfer his knowledge of that ares to us. They are wonderful people. NEVZAT is not only a driver to us but also a photographer, a friend and a lovely companion. He was there for us for the whole of three days of our stay in Cappadocia, make us laugh the whole day. He is very careful driver and alert all the time, make me feel safe. I strongly recommend Chora Travel for those who are planning to visit Turkey.
