If I were to come again hopefully one day, I will definitely choose Chora Travel and of course NEVZAT...

Two-day tour to Cappadocia. I went online to book a tour to Cappadocia and couldn't be happier that I found Chora Travel. Nil answered all my questions and helped me book a two-day tour. She contacted me when I arrived in Istanbul and explained pick up, etc. From being picked up at our hotel and transported to the airport for the flight to Cappadocia and transported back to our hotel in Istanbul, everything was well organized and perfect. Both tour days were excellent. I had a bit of a problem with my credit card to complete payment for our trip. Nil was patient and helpful in arranging payment at the end of the trip. The balloon trip was totally awesome. Everywhere we went the scenery was amazing. We had seven people in our group the first day and only five the second, which made for a very personal tour.Nevsat, our driver, went above and beyond the duties of a "driver". Many parts of the hiking were quite strenuous, but Nevsat was there to assist me and others along the way. He is also an excellent photographer and was very willing to take photos of my husband and myself. Also, his friendly personality and sense of humor added to the enjoyment of our two days!

Two day Cappadocia tour. A great experience with a professional company. After booking on the Internet and paying a deposit, I arrived in Istanbul and was contacted prior to arrival for a meeting with Fatih. He gave me vouchers and explained my itenerary. Everything went very well flying to Cappadocia. The tour guide Suat was professional and knowledgeable. Nevsat was an asset to your company. He had a charming, fun personality and was helpful taking photos for me since I was on my own. He clearly loves his job and people. The scenery was amazing. I would definitely recommend this tour!

Great trip (NEVZAT, Metil and Suat were awesome). Overall well arranged tour. We just finished a 8 day trip in Turkey. We covered Istanbul, Cappadocia, Pamukkale, Kusadasi (Ephesus).Highlights of the trip:a) our driver NEVZAT in Cappadocia. He was awesome. Really took care of us like family - always conscious and concerned about our well being. Ensuring that we are having a good time, sad when we were a little less upbeat. He went the extra mile to make our stay in Cappadocia very good.b) our day tour guide Metil in Istanbul. Such a bubbly energetic and passionate lad. Has very good knowledge about Istanbul historic scene. Showed us all the important and good parts, and kept us entertained through his humor and energy. Great person to be around.c) Suat - our tour guide in Cappadocia. Very knowledgeable and well informed. Quite calm demeanor which suits some of the sights in Cappadocia.d) Hotel arrangements - overall very good, esp in Kusadasi (Hotel Ilayada Avantgarde) and Hotel Ferman in Istanbul. The reception in-charge VEYSEL in Hotel Ferman was very helpfule) overall coordination and transfers between different cities & to-&-fro to the airportAreas of improvementa) Chora knew our itinerary and that we were spending 4 days in Istanbul. I would have loved if they had suggested we stay an extra day in Kusadasi (which is a beautiful lively beach town) and spend 3 days in Istanbul. Of course, we should have also done our homework before the trip. b) We missed our balloon ride in Cappadocia, partly due to weather but partly due to some disorganized operations of Air Cappadocia. We had a window when almost 100 balloons went up one day (& 6 of our fellow Chora passengers got a ride) but we missed the ride because Air Cappadocia picked us up very late, by which time the weather had turned against us. c) Some transfers didnt meet expectation - for example, we were told that Cappadocia to Pamukkale takes 6 hrs, but it took us 8.5 hrs. The second leg from Konya to Pamukkale was almost twice the time we thought it would take (5.5hrs instead of 3).d) Hotel Tripolis in Pamukkale - it's a fancy nice hotel, but internet connection was very patchy and service was impersonal. Quite a different experience than other hotels Chora booked us inDespite the 4 areas of improvement, I think Chora did an excellent job in giving us a taste of Turkey. It is a beautiful country with awesome fun people and great food and most beautiful landscapes, monuments and history. Must visit for everyone.

Great experience. Since the beginning the communication with Nejo was excellent, he was quick to answer any question or comment.During the trip you could see all the experience that Chora Travel has organizing tours: everything worked perfectly! All the transfers, excursions and hotels were as planned.Nevzat, who drove us from Antalya to Capadoccia was incredibly nice and helpful. Also Harun was very professional and friendly during the tour in Capadoccia.My only recommendation for all travelers is to plan the trip during May, June, July, August or September. All the other months are incredibly cold in Turkey. We had snow during April!

Chora travel cappadocia - Nevzat. It's really great to have Nevzat as our driver in our cappadocia trip. He went beyond his duties and went with us on hikes to explore different routes and always ready with an offer to take professional looking pictures for us.On one occasion, he was supposed to drop the tour group off at the rose valley for an hour hike down and wait for us at the end of the valley. I was pleasantly surprised that he trekked uphill and met us halfway to continue the journey with us. He also made an effort to cheer me and my husband up when the hot air ballon trip got cancelled. And it did made my cappadocia trip memorable with a great and genuine guy like Nevzat. He looks a bit like George Clooney by the way.

Cappadocia Day Trip. My adult daughter and I used Chora Travel to set up a day trip to Cappadocia. I arranged this trip while still in the U.S. with Nejo, who was quick to answer all of my emails no matter what time I sent them. We were picked up right at 5 a.m. at our hotel and transported to the Istanbul airport for our 1-hour flight on Turkish Airlines to Cappadocia. [Nejo sent me the airline vouchers by email which were needed at the airport & don't forget your passport.]Once we landed in the Cappadocia area, we were greeted by driver Nevzat from Shah Mat Travel (Chora's sister travel company). Since we were only there for a day, we had to choose either North or South Cappadocia (we went to the North). Really fascinating area - lots of picture opportunities! We were in a group of only 7, which was nice, and we had a very knowledgeable tour guide, Zuhal.Being in my 60's, some of the terrain was pretty steep. Driver Nevzat was fabulous in helping me get up and down the hilly areas and I was very grateful for his help! 5 stars for him!!! I'd suggest going to Cappadocia for 2 days (lots of hotels in the area) if you have the time so you can see the whole area, but the one day trip worked out well for us, even though it made for a very long day.

Chora Travel - Nil. Traveling alone, I was a little reluctant to travel to Turkey, with all the negative political media. However, Nil at Chora Travel arranged 8 wonderful days in Istanbul and Cappadocia. What made the trip so easy were the prescheduled tours and transportation to and from the airports. I immediately felt comfortable with a driver waiting for me at the airport to transport me into the center of Istanbul. Nil was waiting for me at the hotel, with a full itinerary to review. Every day, either a tour guide or driver would pick me up for the next experience (tours or airport transport). The Ferman Hotel was very accommodating and eager to help. A delicious breakfast was served on the rooftop with a view of the Hagia Sofia and the Bosphorus. There is a lot of hiking in Cappadocia and I would recommend good hiking shoes to avoid slipping when walking downhill (or walking sticks). Otherwise, it was beautiful and an unmissable experience. Thank you!

Chorra Travels. Our first trip to Turkey was amazing thanks to Chora Travels and our wonderfull trip advisor Fatih Dogan . We had taken an eight day trip to Turkey starting at Ishtanbul, Cappadocia, Ephesus , Kossadassi , Pemmakule and back to Ishtanbul. The whole trip was so well coordinated every step of the way. All our tours were in small groups of not more then 8 people with English speaking tour guides who were very knowledgeable about the area. The buffets at the restaurants were amazing and all hotels were 5 stars except at Pemmakule which I would give a 4star. All domestic flights were very well coordinated. We even found some alone time to do things on our own, which was a pleasant surprise ! All the touristy business places were optional which made our trip more enjoyable, since we were more interested in seeing the places. All thanks go to Fatih Dogan of Chora Travels . We highly recommend Fatih Dogan for his extreme diligence in answering and addressing our concerns as soon as it arose. Our Turkey trip was memorable in every way with no glitches what so ever. We will certainly cherish our trip, thanks Fatih for a job well done, 5 stars all the way..
Very helpful. Ms. Nil was very helpful and she assisted us with airport pick up and drop off as well Bosporus tour.

The best agency, the best rest, the best friends!. I'd like to say thank you to my new friends Yusuf and Neco. Our honeymoon was perfect thanks to them. It's our first trip in Turkey. And It's wonderful. Thank you very very much

Friendly, Prompt and Well Organised trip. We travelled to Turkey in October 2014.This is the first time we have used a travel agent to book our trip and also Tripadvisor as a guide in choosing our travel agent, I was rather hesitant and worried at first. But after using Chora Travels, we were extremely happy. Fatih helped with arranging our tours. He was very prompt with his replies to all our questions. The tour was 11 day and customized to our needs which included all the sites I wanted to visit.When we reached Istanbul airport we were a bit confused as there were a lot of agencies picking up people and our names were written along with a lot of other names. But once we realised what we needed to do we were fine. Fatih came to collect the rest of the payment from our hotel in Istanbul and explained our tour itinerary. He also asked us to contact him on Whatsup at any time which was extremely useful as this helped us on two occasions.I need to specially mention the tour guide -Ufuk on the Istanbul walking tour and Shah Mat travels in Cappadocia. Suat and Nevzat were excellentThis trip was very reasonable priced and we were very happy with our decision in booking Chora Travels.
Great service. Thank you Fatih for making our time in Istanbul a wondeful experience. Your professional and curtious service was only a pleasure

A memorable customer service experience. The idea of traveling in a tour group with a tight schedule is unattractive. I was rather apprehensive with booking a tour. However, as I decided to join my friend at the last minute we had no time to plan for our travels. Ms Nil Yilmaz did the bookings efficiently and was patient with me with regards to the payment of the tour. The payment mode was flexible - cash, transfer or credit card. The tour group was small - the maximum it got was 11 people - and the guides were proficient in English. The accomodations at the various locations were pleasant and comfortable. We were able to walk around the town on our own after the day tour ended. In fact, even when my friend lost her wallet (one of a tourist's worst nightmare), Ms Nil rendered her assistance and called the relevant parties (e.g. airport, restaurant - as overseas calls are expensive) to enquire about the missing wallet. Her services were beyond words as she provided assistance even after office hours. I was touched by her efforts.The lines of communication with the various vendors throughout the trip was commendable. In an instance, after making a police report, Ms Nil managed to get in touch with our cab driver and informed him to drive us straight to the local tour agency so that we can begin our tour of the day.It was a memorable vacation even with the mishap. We enjoyed the sense of traveling independently without the fuss of researching and booking multiple tours, accomodations and transportations. What we assumed to be a rushed tour vacation in Turkey turned out to be a memorable trip full of adventures and excellent customer service. Thank you Ms Nil for your dedication and passion in the service/ travel industry.

Above-and-Beyond Customer Service. I would like to extend my gratitude to Ms Nil Yilmaz for her excellence and commitment to going above and beyond, and providing exceptional travel consultation. Nil and her amazing team at Chora Travel truly makes sure their customers are taken care of no matter what, and regardless of time of day.We booked a 9-day package covering Ephesus, Kusadasi, Pamukkale, Antalya, and Cappadocia. Part of what drew me was the intimate group size; it allows the freedom to move around and engage with the guides and surroundings. And as another reviewer mentioned, it is about as close as you can come to independent travelling while at the same time having someone take care of all of the arrangements. From the outset, Nil was patient, quick to respond, and pro-active with suggestions. Six days into the trip, we faced a travel blunder. And by "travel blunder", I mean I committed the ultimate rookie mistake of losing my wallet abroad. After checking into the hotel in Cappadocia - which is really lovely by the way - I had an awful realization that my wallet was four hundred over miles away at Sabiha Gökçen Airport. Nil was my hero - she was professional and ultimately saved the trip (and my sanity) by making genuine efforts to resolve the issue.I believe it was past business hours, but Nil took it upon herself to contact the relevant persons and provided regular updates on the status. She even rescheduled the balloon tour that was about to take place in the crack of dawn. Thankfully, my cash-strapped state was only temporary as Nil brought good news the following morning. This allowed me to put my anxieties to rest and enjoy the remainder of my trip.The excellent customer service did not end there. Shah Mat Travel, Chora's partner agency in Cappadocia, was informed by Nil of my predicament and kindly offered assistance if I found myself in financial difficulty. And though we were initially booked to fly out to Atatürk Airport, Nil re-booked our flights back to Sabiha Gökçen airport so I could retrieve my wallet - and at no additional cost! Thank you so much Nil for arranging our trip to your beautiful country. My friend and I had a fantastic time - we did and saw so much and we now have a treasure trove of special memories.

Trustworthy, Friendly, and Excellent. Since I had never really used a travel company to arrange my tours before, I was rather hesitant and worried at first. With Chora, Nejo helped with arranging our tours. Being someone who always wants to be in the know of every little detail, I asked Nejo tons of questions, I kept emailing him. He was patient and very responsive in answering all my emails and questions. I always got a response from him within a few hours. We booked 5 days Capadoccia, Pamukkale, and Ephesus. I have a friend who lives nearby Pamukkale, and I wanted to spend a night in Pamukkale instead of Kusadasi (which is about 2 hours away from Pamukkale). We had no problem at all with modifying the tour and Nejo got us an excellent location of hotel, right in front of Pamukkale. A Chora staff came to retrieve the rest of the payment from our hotel in Istanbul, a day before we started our tour, during which time he explained our tour itinerary. The next day, we were picked up from our hotel and brought to airport on-time.All of our guides were not only knowledgeable of their areas, but they were also very friendly, funny, and ready to answer any questions. And the drivers were also very nice and helpful. We spent one week in Istanbul after our 5 days tour in Capadoccia, Pamukkale and Ephesus.. Whenever I had questions or needed some advice on what to do or see in Istanbul, Nejo was always accessible via email, sms, or phone even though I didn't book anything else through Chora. This is definitely a big bonus!Oh also, the price is very reasonable, and no hidden fee at all!I am glad I booked out tours in Turkey through Chora. We had a wonderful time!

2 Day 1 Night Trip to Cappadocia arranged by Chora Travel. Ms Nil was very fast in responding to our queries. Much appreciated! The tour to Cappadocia was fine after reading some reviews from trip advisor and our shopping tours were cut down from 5 places to 3 places where we highlighted this to Ms Nil to have more time for sight seeing.I compared their prices with other agencies and find that it is a bit higher but decided to go for them based on the recommendations from the review. They also provided small group size of max 8 pax.Hiccups occurred during the booking of domestic flights as their website dailyistanbultours have preset boxes for us to enter all details of our name, family name, father's name to book our air tickets (unlike normal airline companies which only requested for our first & last name). As a far easterner, we do not include our father's name in ours and a mistake was made when our domestic air tickets were issued. We had to pay an amendment fee to change.We did not manage to take the hot air balloon due to weather conditions (now pending for refund). The rest of the tour is fun and enjoyable especially the small size group.

Good Travel Agency. We are a group of three travelling and my concern was for my 60 year old mom and the transportation transfers. Nil was most helpful and replied to all my email queries fast. We booked the gallipoli - troy - pergamon - pamukkale - ephesus and enjoyed our tours. Our tour groups were small and the biggest group was 11 people. We had friendly knowledgeable guides. Transportation was comfortable and our hotels were good. The agency calls to the hotels for reminders of our next day pick up time. I've previously travelled with another agency about 4 years ago and comparing, this is recommended. *Chora Office is located about 10mins walk from ayasofya

How to see and experience Turkey. When you travel to a new country, the usual starting questions are often what to see and experience, and how best to do that. For a country as large and diverse as Turkey those questions can be even more challenging if you have only a limited amount of time in which to do it. But the answers can come easily if you decide that you will be best served if you use the experience, knowledge, and connections of someone who knows the country intimately and who already has a reputation as an excellent guide. This is what lead our small group of 4 travellers from Canada to Chora Travel Day Trips - thanks in part to previous TripAdvisor reviews. In our initial inquiries and communications with Chora and its primary contact/owner Nejo, it became immediately clear that their/his primary interest was to satisfy OUR interests. In this regard, I must add that early on we came to the inescapable conclusion that Nejo is someone who must never sleep or else has a special relationship with his smartphone because our emails were always answered within hours if not minutes even though we were 10 time zones apart (do the math, our daytime = his nighttime). Our interests were not only to see, during a brief 2 week period, as many of the key historical, cultural, architectural, and geographical wonders that Turkey is famous for, but to have some opportunities to experience the local cuisine and way of life of the everyday Turkish resident. Rather than have these expectations simply acknowledged and covered over with an itinerary that could as easily be obtained from any number of other tour providers, Nejo undertook to personally become our primary escort and guide for the majority of our travels rather than assign our "file" to any of the other 30+ staff and contractors within the Chora network.Certainly we "hit" many of the highlights that are on the travel agenda of many if not most tourist visitors to Turkey including Istanbul, Troy, Pergamon, Kusadasi, Ephesus, Pamukkale, Hierapolis, Fethiye, Saklikent Gorge, Antalya, Kursunlu waterfall, Perge, Aspendos, Konya, Cappadocia, and back again to Istanbul. But we also had innumerable opportunities amongst these stops to experience an array of regional cuisines and out of the way local restaurants and eateries. Personal contacts and knowledge of local establishments by Nejo along with his advice and language interpretation skills made for an extraordinarily unforgettable experience. This included our introduction by Nejo to some of his own property and land where he, with his parents help, have a fledgling orchard. Furthermore, when opportunity or circumstance required (e.g. unexpected rainy weather) Nejo was quickly able to amend our travel plans to accommodate our desires. This included alternate tour sites as well as brief shopping stops at reputable shops and businesses.All in all, if the measure of a trip is the fond memories and remembrances one brings back and keeps, then our experience with Chora and Nejo was exceptional and they are highly recommended to anyone who wants to make their Turkish visit a unique and memorable one.

"Wonderful trip to Turkey". Wonderful trip to TurkeyMy husband and I recently returned from an unforgettable 14 day trip to Turkey. Previously, when we have travelled outside North America, we have had a local travel agent make most of the arrangements. For this trip, because of the very positive reviews of Chora Travel on Trip Advisor, we decided to contact them and have them organize our adventure. I was somewhat anxious but after my initial email to Chora Nejo responded promptly and from then on the process was easy and smooth. We travelled with two other good friends and a couple of our requests were that we have a ‘private’ tour and that we have a chance to experience great local cuisine. We flew into Istanbul. Though it was late in the evening Nejo met us and went over the itinerary to make sure that is still met our expectations. We then spent two whirlwind days with our guide, Mehmet, seeing all of the highlights. Mehmet was knowledgeable, personable, energetic and fun. A great introduction to Turkey!Nejo himself drove us on our private 10 day tour. After the first day he noticed that the seating arrangement in the van was not optimal and so changed vehicles. We travelled hundreds of kilometers staying in Kusadasi, Pamukkale, Fethiye, Antalya and Cappadocia. We had been undecided about going on a balloon ride in Cappadocia, Nejo arranged one for us last minute with a reputable company and it was a great experience.Nejo made sure that we saw as much as possible in our limited time. In Ephesus he arranged Serdar to be our guide. Serdar was a wealth of information which he shared in a thoughtful interesting way. In Cappadocia Nejo acted as our guide and had Nevzat drive us. Nejo is from Cappadocia so it was a pleasure to learn about the region from someone who loves the area. Nevzat was a friendly and charming.Each day at lunch we were treated to something different and wonderful, eating at places we could never have discovered on our own. Entrances to sites, checking into hotels was all simple and quick. The only ‘shopping’ excursions were ones that we requested.All in all a fabulous trip with no glitches thanks to Chora Travel.

8 days tour to turkey. I booked a 8 days tour to turkey wz chora trvl.chora trvl is a very reliable n trustworthy agency.Firstly we want to thank nejo for arranging our tours in turkey..it was a unforgettable experience for us..tk q nejo..on our 3rd day to cappadocia the driver drove us to the wrg airport. Luckily we manage to contact Fatih n things were sorted out immediately..hotels were ok..staffs at the hotels weren't friendly enough..we really had a gd time in cappadocia. Our guide was SUAT n driver was NEVZAT.they were really amazing guys.my 4 yrs old son really enjoyed NEVZAT company. A very special thanks to all the guides n drivers for making our trip a memorable one.Luv from Aftikhar Hussain n family..,

Experience Shows from Chora. My Turkey adventure was arranged last minute however Nil at Chora travel made it happen fabulously. A full schedule of travel along with efficient transfers made for a memorable trip.Good service/ strong local knowledge, thanks Nil, will use your agency againAll the places below you must seeCappadocia -hot air ballooning - must do!Pumakkale EphesusIsmirKashadashiGallipoli/TroiaIstanbulYes, you get the occasional carpet and pottery tour but nothing too invasive.Turkey you must go !

11days tour in Turkey. We recently visited Turkey. Ou itinerary was arranged by Yusuf Ozen from Chora Travel. We booked online and he personally came to meet us as soon as we arrived. We were impressed by the efficiency and punctuality of the agency. During our tour we experienced no problems and all the pick-ups, transfers and excursions went smoothly. We can highly recommend Yusuf Ozen and his agency.

Beware the sales pitches!. We were excited about our 3 day tour of capadoccia and ephasus and saw the great reviews of Chora. Unfortunately Chora has been working with a subcontractor in capadoccia that takes you on 5 shopping excursions in the 2 days that you're there. On day 2 of our tour, we spent more time in the carpet store, pottery shop and gaudy leather show than seeing sights. The owner of Chora is polite and says that you're not required to ship, but the bus goes there rather than seeing sights for more time. I spoke with the manager of Chora who tells me they are looking for a better subcontractor company in capadoccia. Perhaps they'll find someone better.

Great experience. We weren't really sure what we were getting into, having signed up and paid for part of our Turkey trip with Chora Travel online. But when we were in Istanbul, we stopped by the office, and it was actually an office, with very helpful and competent staff members. All the pick-ups, hotels, and excursions were great. We finally figured out that this type of travel is like an airport -- the planes (buses and guides) go in the same direction all the time; it's the passengers (tourists) who change. So you will switch out guides and co-tourists a lot. It works, and beautifully. We will have no hesitation to work with Chora Travel in the future.

Chora's 21day tour. We had a fantastic time! The program gave us some of the best travel experiences we have ever had. People ask us what were the highlights and our response is "everywhere we went". All the guides were great and the transfers went like clockwork. Many people who went on shorter tours missed out on cruising the Aegean or Cappadocia. We recommend you do both! Chora organised everything to perfection. We like small group tours and this is Chora's great strength. We highly recommend them.Monique and Chris

Awesome experience and service with customized itinerary and private transfers. Made my family vacation special!. I got to know of Chora Travels through a friend. Mr Fatih was very helpful and friendly through the various emails we exchanged in customizing my trip from hotels to the detailed daily itinerary. Fatih helped design an itinerary to best suit my requirements and was in touch with me in Turkey as well to check everything is going as planned and if anything is required.It's great customer experience, specially when you are with family at a new place.Very customer focused company and friendly staff.Our Kapadokya stay was amazing with the hot air balloon and cave hotel... Something they recommended and we all loved it. Great experience!

Wonderful trip to Turkey. My friend and I booked a 9 day tour through Turkey with Chora travel. We are not "tour bus" type travellers and this is as close as you can come to independent travel while at the same time having someone take care of all of the arrangements. Chora travel is a very reliable and trustworthy operation. We had a few glitches along the way and Nejo was just a phone call away and responded immediately to sort things out. The hotels were ok, some better than others but I do feel we got excellent value for our money. The trip is fast pace but a good way to see a lot in a short period of time. I only wished I had booked a longer tour. We spent a few days in Istanbul beforehand and did the walking tour which was quite good as well. Loved the Uyan hotel which Nejo recommended. Thanks, Nejo, for a great trip! Jill & Marcie

Let the clock tick. Wtih the huge number travel agents advertised on te net, finding a perfect organization becomes a srtike of luck. I was lucky enough, after reviewing comments on Trip Advisor, to select Chora Travel for my 5 days tour trip to Turkey. The planning and organization by Chora, and its sister company Shah Mat was top notch. Every think was well prepared, and organized, from pickup to final hotel transfer. It was amazing to see how those guys, would manage various groups of people with different plans, itineraries etc.. with a precision that is matched only by a Swiss Warch. Bit more expensive but highly recommended.My special thanks to Shah Mat guide Hamide, and driver Nevzat, from Cappadocia operation.

Excellent time in Turkey!. Firstly, We want to thank Nejo for all he did to make our time in Turkey such a positive, flawless and unforgettable experience. We are hoping someday he will come to Canada and we can do the same for him!Our trip with our dear friends Nile and Janice to Turkey was a wonderful experience from beginning to end. We spent 15 days with Nejo. He was our driver and guide for most of our time in Turkey and he was responsible for making it the excellent time it was. We travelled with him from Istanbul to Gallipoli, down the coast to Kusodasi and on to Fethiya, we spent 3 days/nights on a gullet then continued to Cappadocia . We did not have to concern ourselves with making arrangements, booking tickets, hotel reservations or even deciding restaurant choices. Nejo graciously did it all! He was always courteous, prompt and extremely helpful. All of the excursions were timely, interesting and well organized. We learned so much about the culture of Turkey through our time visiting and eating traditional ethnic dishes ( off the beaten track) with Nejo. Not only was he our guide, he became our friend!All of the guides we met were reliable, friendly and professional. While in Istanbul we had the pleasure of having Oslem as our guide. She was extremely knowledgeable and did an excellent job of explaining the history of Turkey while visiting the Blue Mosque, Hagis Sophia, Topkapi Palace and other places within the area of our walking tour. We were also able to avoid the long lines with her as our guide.At Gallipoli, Hassan our guide did a wonderful job of sharing his knowledge of the events that took place during WW1 at these memorial sites. Sardar, our guide at Ephesus was the best story teller I have heard. His passion for mythology and teaching was very apparent through his stories as we toured the beautiful ruins of Ephesus.Nejo demonstrated his love of his homeland of Cappadocia while visiting the Underground City, Open Air Museum and the many unique rock formations. He willingly answered all of our questions about the culture and traditions of Turkey. If you are considering a trip to Turkey, my recommendation is to contact Nejo. He will respond immediately and you can go from there. You will not regret it!

Exceeded All Expectations. I seldom write reviews but after experiencing Nejo and some of his team (Chora Travel and Daily Istanbul Tours), I felt compelled to say something hoping that others will find it useful, and comforting, so they can have a much fun as we did.I must say that I was a little concerned that we had went out on a limb as most of the reports we read were only about the day tours and not the cross country excursions we were planning but I knew from his prompt email responses I was receiving that all was going well and then the minute I met Nejo it was confirmed that we were in good hands. We put our trust into this company to give us a fun packed 20 day tour and man did they deliver.Nejo exceeded all my expectations regarding services provided to make this one of the best vacations I have ever experienced.So, what made it so great ??• everything went sooooo smooth and trouble-free• timely pickups for all tours• Nejo is very knowledgeable with information about Turkey or the sites and he has a great sense of humour• taking us to sites that we never would have found ourselves• taking us to restaurants off the beaten path that are only frequented by locals . . not tourists like us . . . that we would have never found• very economical considering the quality of services provided• new, comfortable and clean vehicles; for tours and airport transfersSo, that sums it up. If you want to experience a very interesting country, go to Turkey. If you want to ensure you have a great time, get in touch with Nejo.

Best way of discoverung Capadocia. We had 2 tours in Spanish at Capadocia to discover either the north and the south area and our experience was FANTASTIC :-))))).Very ontime hotel pick-up, brand new minibus, small group, very good speaking spanish guide (Harun) who was very informative, knowing lot of history culture and traditions of the area and always ready to help and answer all kind of questions.I will strongly recommend tjhis agency for those travelling to CapadociaJose BerdascoUNIQUE TRAVEL

Very Responsive and Professional Tour Company. I just returned from a 1 day tour of Istanbul and a 5 day tour to Cappadocia, Pamukkale and Ephesus organized by Chora Travel and happy to say that they did a fantastic job! When I initially started to look into tours there were a thousand and one tour companies and I had no idea which one to use so I went with Chora Travel who had a number of excellent reviews. I'm glad I did!! They were very responsive to my questions (responded well within 24 hours) and provided helpful suggestions to make my trip more efficient and effective. everything ran like clockwork - the drivers showed up on time, the tour guides were knowledgeable and fluent in English, the accommodations were top notch (they even upgraded me free of charge when the standard room was not available) and switched to a nicer hotel when my initial choice was not available. They also let a couple of friends who were with me in Istanbul ride to the airport free of charge! I highly recommend Chora Travel. They are honest, reasonably priced, straight forward, truly concern about you having an amazing trip and highly response. Nejo (owner) is amazing and very response. Thanks so much for an amazing time in Turkey - it is greatly appreciated

Professional & excellent tour company. As a solo traveller, I've contacted Chora Travel via text message and was given the full itinerary the very next day. The discussion was prompt and clear.Small and different group each and every single day with different local guides made my trip more interesting.All trips were well organized.The agent responded to every little request and questions made by me during the entire tour with professionalism & courtesy.I will definitely get back to Chora Travel for my next tour in Turkey.

Every Detail Covered. This was a great experience, especially as a single traveler. Chora Travel took care of every detail from arrival to departure and the seven days in between. The hotels, tours and airport pickups were excellent. Nejo was very helpful when I needed to cancel a day of touring and take a break. A small refund was even included! If you are booking online have no fear, everything is just as it appears. If I have a suggestion, pay a bit more and upgrade your flights to Turkish Airlines. The other local internal airlines are a bit unreliable and in the case of Pegasus even unfriendly which is very unusual for Turkey. If you can book the Dervish Cave Suites hotel in Cappadocia - fantastic!

A wonderful introduction to Turkey. With only 4 days in Turkey, we booked private guides for 2 days in Istanbul and 1 day each in Ephesus and Cappadocia. Nejo was extremely helpful in setting up the perfect tour. Our guides -- Mehmet in Istanbul, Serdar in Ephesus and Ozkan in Cappadocia -- were first class, very knowledgeable, sensed what our interests were and made the whole tour delightful.With hiking and horseback riding available, we will be returning to Cappadocia soon.One tip -- if you are spending only one day in various outlying areas, book a room at the TAV Airport hotel in Istanbul and do daily flights out to each city -- much easier than carting luggage to the various places.

Responsive & Genuine People!. we were initially a bit worried about booking everything through emails but the prompt and clear responses I got from Nejo helped ease our anxiety a bit. we book a private 5 days 4 nights for 6 people to Kapadokya, Pamukkale and Alacati. All the transportations (planes, mini buses, cars) were satisfactory, we were provided with an excellent driver (Nevzat) and good tour guides in every region. Nejo has always been responsive even when I inquire at odd hours (due to the flight times etc). Truly recommended!

Outstanding tour company!. My mom and I contacted Chora Day trips to book a tour to Cappadocia before our trip to Istanbul in July 2014. Right from the start, I was sure that this was the right company for us. All of my questions (and I had many) were answered promptly. Demir explained everything we would do and see. He made sure that we had all necessary vouchers before leaving on our tour. He was so helpful and kind. We were so pleased with the company that we booked a second tour around istanbul. Ali, our guide around Istanbul was one of the best I have ever had (and I have been on many guided tours throughout Europe). He was extremely professional and knowledgeable. He answered all of our questions and shared so many stories about the city as we walked around the old town. We never felt rushed (which was important because my mom loves taking pictures) and yet we still were able to see so much. Ali even spent an extra 2 hours with us at the end of our tour because we wanted to see the Underground Cistern. He saved us so much time and hassle because we didn't have to wander the city to find it and we didn't have to wait in line for tickets. He shared tips with me on how to best barter in the Grand Baazar, which i was able to put into practice as well. We had a wonderful time with Ali and learned so much and by the end of the full day, I felt like I had made a new Turkish friend. Thank you Ali for making such an amazing memory for us on our first day in Istanbul! Now if you are going to Turkey, Cappadocia cannot be missed! Especially with this tour company! Before we left we were a bit nervous being two women, but once we arrived we realized we were in good hands. The driver taking us to the airport was prompt and professional, the flight was comfortable, the Cave hotel where we stayed was clean and they even upgraded our room for us to the king suite. :-) Our guide was fantastic. He was so sweet and had a great sense of humour. He was extremely professional. I learned so much about Cappadocia from all of his stories as we hiked through the valleys. We saw so many things in two days I can't list them all on here but the highlights for me were the hikes through red and rose valley, the delicious tandoori chicken feast at lunch, the mushroom rock formations and the balloon ride at dawn above the beautiful landscape!. Thank you to everybody at Chora travel that made our trip unforgettable. You are the best! :-)

Chora Travel. I was looking to do a tour of Turkey and didn't want to get stuck with the same people for 3 weeks. I contacted Chora travel another company in Turkey and 2 companies in Australia.While looking at the itineraries there was something with all of them that didn't suit.All were inflexible to change the itinerary except Nejo from Chora travel. Nejo was prompt in replying to my emails and made the changes that I requested to the itinerary. He gave me a list of hotels and when I looked up the reviews on Tripadvisor 2 of them didn't have good reviews, so I told Nejo and he happily changed the hotels. I booked a 3 week tour with Chora. My husband and I felt like we were doing a private tour as most of the time we travelled on our own but when we were with a group there was never any more than 15 and that was only on 2 occasions. All the hotels were in excellent central locations. What I also liked about Chora was only 3 dinners were included and that gave us the opportunity to explore the local restaurants. The tour wasn't fast paced and we always had at least one free day in each city which gave us a chance to either relax, go to the beach or go exploring the city at our own pace. There was only one hiccup where one driver charged me for a transfer, I tried to tell him I had paid for it but he got aggressive so I paid him. When I got into the hotel I rang Nejo and he was very apologetic and the next morning there was an envelope waiting for me in reception with the money. Hubby and I were very happy with Chora travel and highly recommend using them.

Had the best time !!!!!. Our guide, Nejo, was so amazing. He picked is up from the airport and from that point on, my friend and I felt like we were going around Cappadocia with a good friend! He showed us all the good things and even showed us a lot of amazing beautiful things off the beaten path . We listened to traditional Turkish music while driving through the most beautiful countryside! It was the perfect trip ! Thank you so much !

Wonderful tours. Two of us had a 2-day tour in Cappadocia in early July. Everything was perfect, wonderful, and well-arranged.Thanks for Nejoo for the arrangements of flights, hotels, tour guides and transfer.Also thanks for Harun for the detailed explanations of "every single spot"!!We learnt a lot for sure!We will definitely be back, and recommend this company to other friends of ours.

Don't miss this. We booked 3 tours with Chora travel in 3 separate regions in Turkey. Upon our arrival to Istanbul we were greater and looked after by the friendly and knowledgeable staff. We also got to meet with owner Nejo and he personally took care of us. In fact he went out of his way to make sure we are satisfied. We got to visit many extra places outside of the scope and the itinerary. Also, everyone was always on time so we did not miss the beat on pickups and transportation. We also got to explore many none touristy restaurants and points of interest.

We enjoyed every minute of our trip!. Thanks to Chora Travel and Eren, we enjoyed five beautiful days of hiking in Cappadocia. Our hiking guide Ali was very friendly and charming. He knew his way around the valleys extremely well and we are most grateful to him for showing us so much wonderful scenery. He also made sure that we ate great food at lunch time (we especially liked that little place in Urchisar), and provided useful recommendations for diner. A troglodyte hotel in Goreme was booked for us by Eren. We were very pleased with her choice: majestic, romantic, peaceful, with a great view over the city and friendly owners. Eren accompanied us during our last day and she proved to be a wonderful guide herself. Everything went great and smoothly on this trip! We came back home with lots of cherished memories.

Excellant Service. Our first contact with Chora Travel was through Daily Istanbul Tours. Nejo was prompt and responsive to our inquiry. He was flexible with options and the booking process was smooth. Our itinerary was hand tailored to fit our needs and budget. We were greeted at our hotel by a representative who discussed our itinerary and was flexible when we added a last minute addition. Within our itinerary we had a domestic flight, private driver, several hotels, group and private tours. Each were exactly as described. Service was excellent. Wouldn't hesitate to book again.

amazing trip. everything wonderfullhotels, drivers, guides all was perfectwe choose our tour from colombia in internet,we choose chora because they have a nicewebsite diferent options and send us everything by mailorganizaion ok

Wonderful trip to Turkey thanks to Chora :). We chose Chora Travel Agency based on recommendations by friends and I am so glad we did it! Nil was very quick to respond to us and she booked everything for us and it was all so well-organised! We had such a fabulous time thanks to Chora :)

Exceptional service makes for great touring. Firstly let me say that the highlight of Chora is without a doubt Yusuf Ozen. We have been mailing him from South Africa for months before our trip, and he has always been patient and keen to answer all of our questions.We did three tours through Yusuf: - 3 day Istanbul tour- North Cappadocia tour- South Cappadocia tourChora organized all three, sorted all of our travel (including hotel transfers to airports, collections when we landed in Cappadocia etc). It was all arranged before the time, with Yusuf handling every detail, and nothing falling through the cracks.I would, absolutely recommend all tours we did. The Istanbul tour takes you through all the major sights, with the exception of the Basillica Cistern (this is also a really worthwhile thing to see).Yusuf also organized discounts on our behalf at places where he has a relationship with the owners. One story which truly shows the honestly and integrity of the man, is that we paid for our Cappadocia tours in cash when we arrived. Because we had people in our group from all over the show, we paid in lira, dollars and euros. We had calculated the amount using the exchange rates, and paid over a mixture of currencies. Yusuf calculated that we had paid $20 too much (note, in total on a +- $ 3,000 bill, so he brought our change to our hotel himself.

Perfect travel agency -- highly recommend for all Turkey trips!. This is an absolutely fantastic tour agency and Nejo is an amazing, world-class travel organizer. My family and I decided to take a nine-day trip to Turkey but wanted to spend some time in various cities across the country (Instanbul, Cappadocia, Ephesus, Izmir, and Pamukkale). After some preliminary research, I came upon this company based on its reviews on Trip Advisor. The reviews were stellar and deservedly so. I emailed the company to see what they might advise and they responded immediately. The company -- and Nejo, in particular -- was a dream to work with on our trip. They were incredibly responsive, resourceful, and patient with our shifting schedules, interests, and preferences. They even came to our hotel in Istanbul the day we landed to provide us our in-country orientation with all the tickets and vouchers and answer our questions. And despite adding on trips and requests in-country (all via email as we didn't get a cell phone), Nejo and his team always responded with the highest standards of customer service. We highly recommend this company to anyone who would like to travel in Turkey. Very reasonable pricing (especially relative to other travel companies) and amazing service!!!

11 Day Turkey tour. We booked this tour organised by Chora Travel and would highly recommend it. The tour was well organised and all bookings worked well. We were picked up and dropped off after tours and the accommodation booked was excellent (we ticked 4 star accommodation).The Blue Cruise was a standout, Omah, our captain, from ala Turka yachting and travel agency was an excellent host and the boat had just been renovated and refitted. All the tours were amazing and we are so glad we booked this trip - so much easier than navigating the tours on your own.Sue and Bob, Sydney, Australia.

Good Performance, Excellent Operator!!. I love local Tour and it seems to me that I choose the best tour in Turkey!! Nejo and Chora Travel are amazing. Everything was well manage and smooth. I can't thank you all enough for making my trip to Turkey such a memorable trip.

Excellent Tour Operator. Maybe it was just my lucky day but it seems that I picked one of the best tour operators in Turkey. Right from the getgo the communications with this company were fast and explicit. And that is what I look for in a good business. With Nejo and Chora travel my side trip to Hierapolis, Pamukkale and Ephesus went off without a glitch. The accommodation was excellent as was the food and so were the guides and transfer services. I just couldn't believe how smoothly this tour was run and I will certainly use Chora again if I return to Turkey. Highly recommended.

A Tour to remember forever and ever.. Although my fellow Malaysians usually like to take tours from Malaysia, I personally prefer to take a tour from a local tour agent in the country that I intend to visit. The main reason is that I get to meet people from all over the world. With no idea of which is a best tour agent in Turkey, I just googled and "wallah" I came across "Chora Travels" and Yusuf Ozen. It was God sent. Then a series of emails began between Yusuf and I to decide which tour was suitable for my girlfriend and I. We did a 10 day tour of Turkey and extended 2 more days in Istanbul. Yusuf was very prompt in handling my numerous queries and never once lost his cool when handling my demands. As a perfectionist, i always expect perfection and Yusuf's delivery was beyond expectations.The guides were very well informed and the daily pick up times were spot on. We made many new friends, from US, Canada, Pakistan, Singapore, Australia etc and many of them have become my facebook friends as well.I haven't stopped talking about Turkey since my return and have been recommending Chora Travels to all my friends. Turkey is a "must visit" country. History has been very well preserved.Yusuf, thank you again for making our visit memorable and for putting up with all my demands.Anusuyah Selvadurai

Professional helpful value for money amazing people. I was lucky to find Yusuf of chora travels he send us a quote and helped with the best possible travel plan. All the transfers and trips were really smooth and as per plan....wonderful experience and a wonderful country.. thanks to you yusuf and ur teams for making this such a memorable holiday

Excellent service. I wanted to thank you on three counts. Firstly the service you provided as we decided which tour suited us best, your patience in answering questions and the simple process of making our final booking. All this instilled confidence that we were dealing with a trustworthy and competent organisation.Secondly the tour itself; the organisation, drivers and guides were all one could ask for and we always felt we knew the next step. A very smooth and informative process. The way you manage to coordinate the intertwining paths of the various travellers in our group is a testament to your experience in your field.And thirdly the way you managed a last minute reschedule when my wife became ill was done so smoothly that we had no additional worries that arrangements had to be changed. You and your colleagues were calm, considerate and highly competent.Nejo, I hope you will feel free to use this an endorsement to reassure those hesitant to book on line with an unknown tour company, that Chora is a organisation you can rely on throughout the whole process. Thank you again.Michael Bailey

Our expectations were EXCEEDED!!!!. i DON'T KNOW WHERE TO BEGIN! We booked this trip a few months prior to arriving in Istanbul. Our contact was NEJO. The email communication between us was exceptional. Whenever we had a question, and these things come up, we would email and get an immediate response. That was comforting in that we were taking a trip to an unknown country. Our trip was to fly to Istanbul at our expense. After that, CHORA took over. We had the first day to ourselves, Day 2 with a full day Bosphorus Cruise tour with lunch and other sites. The cruise, no matter which company you book, is but a few hours, but informative, Back to the hotel at 5pm. Day 3 was a wlking tour of Istanbul, Day 4 we flew to tour Cappadocia, two-day north and south tour, then flying to Izmir for a Pamukkale and Hierapolis tour(s), then Ephesus. Fly back to Istanbul, Day 9 on our own: the Spice Market & Grand Bazaar for souveniers.HERE ARE THE IMPORTANT DETAILS: When we arrived at Istanbul, AND at IZmur, and KaDASKI AIRPORTS, THE DRIVERS WERE WAITING FOR US AND HAD OUR NAMES ON THE SIGNS. all HOTELS WERE BOOKED AS WE AGREED, The hotels had fantastic breakfasts, all lunches were above par (mostly big buffets), the tours were 1st class, hotel pickups were as promised to get to the sirports, We were able to review the hotels via TripAdvisor first and they were just as promised. The optional tours were more than expected! When we arrived at our 1st hotel, the Chora representative met us there and got the balance of $$ owed via credit card. Overall, we had NO negative events, which is almost unheard of for multiple hotels, multiple flights, multiple transfers, multiple tours and meals, etc etc. Eveything was on-time and as agreed. Thank you Chora for a wonderful vacation, fantastic memories, and what a beautiful country!!!!

Don't miss seeing Cappadocia with this wonderful travel agency!. I travelled to Istanbul in April but booked my Cappadocia day trip in February. From February to April, while booking the trip and anytime I had a question, I emailed Nejo who owns Chora Travel, and he responded to my questions directly and immediately so I was confident this would be a great trip and I was right. First of all, my husband and I booked the private one day tour to Cappadocia from Istanbul. Nejo made all the arrangements including private transfers to and from the airport, the flights to and from Keysari (the airport closest to Cappadocia), as well as the private guide for the day. To our great surprise, Nejo himself was our private guide and it made the day so special. Nejo is from Cappadocia and to have his perspective of this beautiful city made this tour even more wonderful. To really see all that Cappadocia has to offer in one day is difficult so I recommend if you have the time, make it a two day trip and stay in one of the cave hotels overnight. If you don't have the time to do two days (we didn't), don't shy away from it, just be prepared for a full day but don't miss it. It's well worth the time and money. Cappadocia is a fascinating and beautiful place. Nejo was so enthusiastic, knowledgeable, friendly, and fun. He went out of his way to show us everything possible - the Goreme Open Air Museum, the underground city, Pasabag, and beautiful points in between. Nejo has friends all over the area so we were able to see special sights off the beaten path and have an authentic Turkish lunch at a place you would never know to choose if you were on your own. Nejo did take us to a pottery place (again, one of his friends) at the end of the day but we didn't feel any pressure, it was really interesting and we did end up buying a piece because each piece was unique and beautiful. This was a highlight of our trip and Nejo was fantastic! Don't miss Cappadocia on your trip to Turkey and don't miss planning your experience with Chora Travel, you won't regret it!

excellent service. We booked the 8days tour of Turkey online. Yusef always answered my endless question very patiently and on time. When we arrived airport in the middle of night, driver picked us up and from then on, everything was smooth and well organized. Travelling with 7 years old son is not easy, but choral travel made it easier. We liked all the hotels, all tour guides were very friendly. We had a wonderful time. Also, Yusef helped us to get my son 'toy bag back. Thanks.

Keep going YUSUF. Great travel agency,very supportive,and friendly.Yusuf is a good person and will Advice you as a Friend.He has a good team in Capadoccia and Pamukalle.Highly recommendable.He made our Trip Memorable.

What an EXCELLENT company!!!!!. We booked a 10 day Turkey travel through Chora and NEJO to: Istanbul, fly to Cappadocia, fly to Izmir, tour Pamukkale & Hierapolis, then Ephesus, then return flight to Istanbul. We only handled the international flight to/from the USA. It was stress free. Tip: If you have a choice to fly or go overnight by bus, FLY. We spoke with other travelers and the bus trip is like a flight, only slight reclining seats & not too relaxing. We were thankful Nejo recommended the flights. The guides were excellent and always ON TIME. That is important to the aforementioned attribute: stress free. The communication before the trip was excellent and Nejo was quick to email and answer all questions. Thank you Chora and Nejo.

Excellent 4 day Cappadocia, Pamukkale and Ephesus Tour. Just got back from the 4 day tour of Cappadocia, Pamukkale and Ephesus tour starting and finishing in Istanbul. We booked this tour online before we went to Turkey and I must say it was the most exciting and well organised tour I have ever been on. Our hotels were all of a very high standard and the local tour guides were just excellent, very knowledgeable and welcoming. We took 6 flights in 7 days (!!) and each time there was a driver waiting for us at the airport. We paid extra to do the hot air balloon flight in Cappadocia and I must say it was the highlight of the trip. I would highly recommend this tour company and I am already planning to do another tour with them next year as there is so much to see! Thank you for a great holiday.

Well-organized, smooth trip. We used Chora Travel for the walking tour in Istanbul as well as for the 2 day Cappodocia & 2 day Ephesus/Pamukkale/Hierapolis tours. The organization was excellent. All airport transfers were on-time, hotels were good, and local guides were top-notch. Nejo was very prompt at responding to our emails and did a wonderful job organizing our small group tours in Turkey. I would strongly recommend Chora Travel for travel in Turkey.

One day Cappodocia Tour. We stopped by in Istanbul for 3 days and decided to do the 1 day trip to Cappodocia; we found Chora travels. Nejo was great to communicate with via email, he and his staff sent us everything we needed including our flights, tour schedule and pickup. Everything was planned very perfectly and on time. The tour was wonderful and our guide, Goran, was just great. He answered all our questions and was very knowledgeable. I would suggest to use them for any tour any day of the week. Just amazing service and wonderful people.

Turkey with Chora Travel. One of the best if not the best trips organised for us. We generally travel independent.The service from collection at the airport to dropping us off at the end was excellent. The guides are well qualified for their tasks and all arrangements worked smoothly.The hotel arrangements were flawless so that overall our tour experience was very enjoyable.Loved Turkey and will be back.Great stuff Nejo!

Day trip to Cappadocia from Istanbul. Somer at Chora travel organised many aspects of my Turkey holiday. We had booked our Istanbul tour through him and also booked a day trip to Cappadocia through Chora Travel as well. It was a last-minute decision and we wanted to book a trip on Thursday, giving less than 48 hours notice. Somer was able to organise all our flights, transfers, tours and itineraries within a few hours and payment was quick and simple. We also booked our hotel transfer back to Istanbul airport for our flight back through Chora Travel and got a very competitive rate. Overall the service from Somer was quick and really helpful, and made it very easy to enjoy the sights that Turkey has to offer. I would highly recommend!

Cappadocia Day Tours - Totally worth it. Cappadocia as a place has a lot to offer to tourists. We just had a day and a half to spend there and we wanted to maximize this time looking around the city. My husband had booked the tours through Chora Travels.From start till the end, the team was extremely punctual, provided excellent service to all of us (we were a group of 7 people). Harun is quite knowledgeable about the place and he told us many stories related to the various places he took us to. Overall, Harun & team made our experience worthwhile and we enjoyed every bit of our stay there. Harun is by far the best guide I have come across. I recommend Chora Travels to anyone planning a trip to Cappadocia.

Excellent Service and Very Good & Experience Tour Guide. This is our first trip to Turkey, and especially with my whole family and my 9 months baby girl (5 persons). And we really enjoyed ourselves very much, especially Cappadocia. All the tour guides are very knowledgeable, and through their details explanation, we can really understand better about the history of Turkey. We strongly recommend Chora Travel for their excellent service. And Nejo, thank you so much for an excellent planning that made our whole trip a enjoyable and memorable one, and also the recommendation of the Hot Air Balloon ride, that was a fantastic trip!

Enjoyed and Enlightened. We had gone there as a group of 7, and we had a fantastic tour of capadochia. The guide Harun was very friendly and most important a detailed information about every place we visited. Despite our itinerary getting affected due to Hot Air Ballon cancellation and losing the entire morning, we still managed to cover the important places to be seen in the city.Among all the guided tours I have taken in my life, I can vouch Harun was among the top 3 guide we ever had.

Excellent Service and Very experienced Tour Guide. We had booked cappadokia tour with Chora Travel, I had contacted few agancies but Chora was the most prompt in responding and with great detail. Once we reached Cappadokia we were toured by Harun who guided us throughout the trip. He was excellent in his knowledge of every place we visited and never rushed to complete his tour. He answered every question that we threw at him. He is one of the best Tour guides I have ever come accross in my trips.

Well-organized and prompt service. My husband and I were very impressed with the prompt services provided by Yusuf and his team. All arrangements were made according to our choice and the team was very accommodating to make changes. We received great guidance on places we wanted to explore on our own apart from our itinerary. Overall it was a great experience and we would surely like to visit Turkey again.

Chora Travel (Turkey Tour). Absolutely fantastic service from start to finish. Nejo and his team were prompt and always in contact during the duration of the trip. Our tour program was sent on a timely manner, clear and nicely arranged in a neat package. I admire Chora Teams flexibility as well. During one of those un-avoidable episode where our flight was cancelled due to bad weather, Nejo promptly sent his driver Nevzat (which by the way, I highly recommend and will request his service again on our next visit) to the airport, picked us up and find a hotel for us to spend the night. One thing that we hope changed is the Buffet restaurant (Hans) portion. It doesn’t meet the Turkish food standard. We felt like we were at an American fast food buffet. Other than that, the other restaurant set ups were all outstanding and highly recommended.We totally enjoyed our trip. We will definitely visit Turkey again in the future. A great part of this fabulous experience was due to the outstanding planning and execution by Chora Team. Thank you for the great memories.

Not calculative, excellent service, best in town!. I am surely a fussy traveler and I usually try to pick the best in town. Before liaising with Chora i was with another agent and all he asked was deposit payments ASAP. However with Chora, Yusuf particularly; their needs were to ensure that we as travelers are happy and accommodate whatever our request were. As much as skeptical as I was, he never disappoint me at any time. When we arrive, he made the initiate to explain in detail on our tour and finally spoke about payment. Yusuf particularly has great knowledge, patients and importantly he is very honest which assures you so many doubts whilst you are busy planning from far away in your country.My family kept complimenting how professional Chora travels were. Their organizing skills was excellent, great hotel location, very good vehicles used for tours and knowledgeable tour guides. Highly recommended for anyone who needs a tour in Turkey!
Excellent. A very well organized agency with a friendly staff .I had a nice time in Turkey . Thank you chora travel to make that happened .

Well worth every cent and well organized!. Just spent 4 days 3nights in Cappadocia,ephesus and pammukkale arranged by Nejo and yusuf of Chora travels. They reply very promptly and did everything very organized. The whole trip went smoothly, and transfers were of no delays. Tour guides speak good english however we could've preferred without the carpet workshop on both Cappadoccia and Ephesus as well, once will be enough. But all in all,this agency made every cent spent worth it!!

Excellent Organization. Perfect organization - No late pick ups, no missed transfers, everything worked like clock work on our jam-packed 14 day Turkey trip. Nejo is really awesome with making sure everything runs smoothly.Our favorite experiences:Trabzon and Sumela monastery: We had a private tour with a driver, who kind of doubled up as our guide as well. He was amazing - probably our favorite person in Turkey :)Nemrut - Hectic, but the sunrise at top of Mt Nemrut makes the 2:30 am wake up calls worth it.Cappadoccia Green Tour: Nejo had booked us a tour with Andromeda Travels for this one. OUTSTANDING! The guide Saygu was enthusiastic and funny.Fethiye: Lovely town, we loved walking up to the Lycian tombs located high above the city.

The only way to tour in Turkey. I wrote to three agencies for my wife and I to tour with while on vacation in Turkey. Only one responded, Chora Travel and Nejo. Nejo arranged for us to be transferred from the airport to our hotel, a one day tour of Ephesus, a walking tour of Istanbul and a Bosphorus cruise. Our drivers were waiting for us promptly everytime they were supposed to meet up with us. Our tour guides were very well versed in the history and facts of the places that we were visiting and their English was great! They provided for our every need throughout each of the days events. The provided meal on the one day Ephesus trip was actually very good and piping hot for a buffet. Everyone associated with Chora travel was friendly and sported smiles and laughter which seems to a rare thing with most of the people residing in Turkey. I would suggest Chora Travel for anyone touring the sites in Turkey!

perfect organızatıon and great crew. Me and my friends visited Turkey for the first tıme and we had a beautiful experience with Chora Travel. They organized a perfect private tour combining İstanbul & Cappadocia.From our arrival at the Airport we had the impression to come visit some friends. Drivers were always in time, guides always super professional and polite. Thanks to Nejo who arranged everything that perfect.In Cappadocia a special thank to Shah Mat for arranging a super balloon tour in this amazing land. We wıll reccomend Nejo and Chora staff to all of our friends.

Honest and Value For Money. I just returned from Turkey for a one week tour Nov 17 to 24. Istanbul, Ephesus, Cappadocia. I found Chora through trip advisor. I contacted several other agencies and Chora was by far the cheapest. I remember asking Nejo why his trip was US$600 or US$300 cheaper than everyone Including other Turkish agents and Canadian agents and he said that the others are ripping you off. I asked for small group tours but specified the hotels had to be 5-stars. So it was easy to compare prices. Nejo was also able to ensure that we timed the travel so we didn't have to go back through Istanbul after going to Ephesus by taking a local discount airline to Cappadocia.Even though we were leaving early mornings at 5:00am, we never missed a pickup or transfer. We did have a poor guide in Cappadocia due to sickness of the regular guide and a flight delay, but these things will happen and are beyond the control of Chora. Nejo was also able to book us into the MDC hotel--see our separate superb review--in Cappadocia when on line it was saying that the hotel was full. It also appears that the rates for the hotels from Chora are cheaper or as good as on line.If you want to save some money and still have someone with the experience and knowledge to make your Turkish holiday a delight, I would recommend Chora Travel.

Professional and very Honest. myself and my wife had an awesome honeymoon arranged by Chora Travel - 7 days itinerary (Istanbul- Cappadocia - Antalya). We enjoyed every minute in Turkey. Everything was perfectly as planed.

Chora Travel just EXCELLENT. We spent 20 days in Turkey in Sept. 2013. We were 2 couples.The trip was organized by Chora Travel, Nejo in particular. It was all perfect, the transfers, flights, guides, itineraries, hotels, etc. I recommend Chora Travel without any hesitation.Henri Farran (Canada)

Turkey in 12 days. We were in good care of Yusuf and his team all through the holidays . One must avail of his services which are well planned and co-ordinated . His tour included travel by plane, private car,bus, boat and balloon too . Every mode reflected a new view of Turkey . These images will linger in our memories for a very long time. Thanks Yusuf .. Wish you good luck and continue your good work ................Ramanathan

Go western Turkey Tour. We contacted many travel agents from home for quotes and itineraries and decided on Chora Travel who gave us a quote with a total package with no hidden costs. They were prompt and efficient with their responses. The whole trip was perfectly executed as our journey was tailored for us only. Overall the local tour guides were very informative and passionate, the bus drivers were prompt and efficient, accommodation was of a very high standard, the meals were buffet and the range of food was more than adequate and the numbers on the tours were small, sometimes just the 3 of us.We started our journey from Istanbul, picked up from the hotel for the 5 hour journey to Gallipoli. On arrival had lunch then the tour started, Dardenelles, Brighton Beach ,Anzac cove, Lone Pine and Chunuk Bair then were taken to Canakkale by ferry to accommodation. Breakfast inc.Day 2 Troy and Pergamum TourVisited the Acropolis, the Steepest theatre of the ancient world, Temple of Trojan, the library, Aslepion, the ancient medical, centre, the oldest known hospital in the world, then driven to Kudadasi to our hotel. All meals incDay 3 Ephesus tourEphesus ruins, temple of Artemis and Hadrian, Celsius library and also visit the house of the Virgin Mary. Returned to hotel in Kudadasi. All meals incDay 4 Pamukkale tourAfter a 3 hour drive we stopped at a little lake, not on itinerary ,then went to the roman health spa of Hierapolis where we spent the afternoon enjoying the hot spas. Taken to our hotel which was the Herakles Hotel which was a total,health resort. Inclusive was the thermal pool , saunas, jacuzzi all fabulous after all the touring. Also don't forget to take a walk thru the town which is very small but a height of activity of market type stalls and shops. No harassment and the prices were local. Loved it. All meals in incDay 5 Pamukkale to Antalya Taken to the local bus station for a trip to Antayla. Very mountainous journey, snacks and drinks provided, tv monitor with movies and games etc. picked up in Antayla and taken to accom, breakfast inc. tour. Ends .Hotel took us to the airport 45 lira. As everything was all inclusive the only financial outlay was a dinner in Cannakkale and our last day in Antayla which was our part of the journey. Total cost was euro 520 per person which included 5 nights, 2 were 2 rooms and 3 were triple rooms.Kelly, Lyn & Rachel (Melbourne, Australia).

Chora travel, Kapadokya wonderful. We visited Kapadokya with Chora travel. They connected to Shah Mat travel operator in Kapadokya and had our visit with Aysun (our marvelous Spanish/English speaking guide). We had the opportunity to feel not only the wonderful landscape but to share the experience of the visit with Aysun.It was a great two days visit and all the schedule was gracefully accomplish by the company.

Chora Travel is the best for Turkey. Yousef from Chora Travel and his team Are the most professional and organised Tour Operator in Turkey. Nothing was ever a problem and their.attention to detail was exemplarily. Their guides and drivers have so much knowledge mixes with a very dry sense of hour with perfect English everything went through without a hitch and always on time. Thank you Yousef for making this one of the best holidays ever.Peter & Monica Monk

Best way to experience Turkey is through Chora Travel. My friend and I have just finished our first ever trip through Turkey, booked entirely through Chora Travel. This was by far the best holiday I've ever had, largely due to the amazing country itself but this experience was further enhanced by Yusuf Ozen and Chora Travel. We communicated via email to organise our private holiday through Turkey and everything was organised with meticulous attention and to perfection. I couldn't ask for anything more. We travelled through Istanbul, Cappadocia, Konya, Pemukkale, Kusadasi and Ephesus in 10 days. Yusuf picked the best hotels in each location, ensuring they were central with easy access to all the sites and with great service. I especially liked Gulhane Park Hotel in Istanbul and Efe Boutique Hotel in Kusadasi (simply brilliant!). Chora's partner travel agencies in Cappadocia (Shah Mat Travel with our awesome guide Harun, brilliant drivers Shakir, Hussain and Jengis), in Pemukkale (Misilina Travel with another great guide Embry), and Ephesus with Hakan were all simply the best. For two girls travelling on their own to an unknown region we were a little uncertain about how we would find things but Yusuf and his amazing network of guides looked after us as though we were VIP's and at no stage did we have any troubles. We are so pleased with our trip to Turkey and with Chora travel that we are already thinking about another holiday in Turkey! If you're planning a trip to Turkey, you cannot go past Chora Travel. Yusuf and his team will surely look after you as they have looked after us. The prices are very competitive and the experience is simply priceless!

Amazing Experience with Chora Travel. Our 8 day trip around Turkey with Chora Travel has been the best travel experience we have ever had! I felt that I had made a right decision from the moment I got in touch with Nejo - he was very prompt with emails and patiently explained everything to me. He's also very accommodating and tailored the itinerary to suit our needs. Everything went very smoothly. Upon arrival in Istanbul, we were picked up from the airport and transferred to the hotel. Nil - one of the consultants from Chora Travel then came and explained the itinerary to make sure we understand and feel comfortable. As we had a couple of free days in Istanbul, she also recommended some nice places for us to visit. We also had a fabulous time in Cappadocia, Pamukkale and Kusadasi/Ephesus. I felt blessed that all hotels and transportation had been organised, and all we had to do was to enjoy ourselves. I would have spent one more night in Kusadasi if I knew the hotel - EFE Boutique Hotel was that nice! What could be better than overseeing the Aegean Sea while having breakfast! I would definitely recommend travelling with them. Thanks Chora Travel once again for everything!

Excellent experience. We Searched Chora travel through tripadvisor. They were very prompt with e mails and flexible to accommodate our schedule. We dealt with Yusuf Ozen. The hotel in Istanbul SultanAhmed was reasonable 3-4 stars and the staff were excellent (Gulhane Park Hotel). We did Old city tour and flew to Cappodicia and stayed through Chora with Dervish Cave hotel. We did the Hot air balloon (it is a must if you visit Cappodicia!). Haron the guide in Cappodicia was amazing.Any changes were accommodated and will arrange to travel with them in the future for sure.

Chora Travel/Istanbul Daily Tours. This company is fantastic to deal with both Nejo and /Yusuf (Owners) were amazing their customer service was outstanding nothing was too much trouble from the first day I contacted Nejo he answered all my emails within a few hours. We arranged our week's private tour through Nejo with a private car/English speaking driver (Engin who is Nejo's brother brilliant company so considerate and again his customer service was excellent ( he treated us like a member of his own family for the week) and each day a different English speaking guide. The cost was half the price to what a well known travel agency in Australia had quoted us for the week. From the moment we were picked up at Istanbul airport arriving at Tom Tom Suites Istanbul (fantastic hotel) our walking tour of Istanbul (very tiring day but one NOT to be missed) then we drove to Gallipolli/Anzac Cove/Lone PIne (NOT TO BE MISSED) very serine and emotional day. Koray was our guide for this day he was excellent and very informative (All our guides are professional teachers even Engin our driver). We stayed at Grand Anzac Hotel Cannakale (OK for 1 night stay central to everything) then we drove the following day with our guide Kenan to Troy then onto the ancient city of Pergamon, then onto Kusadasi where we stayed at the Hotel Charisma De Luxe (excellent hotel) then we drove onto Ephesus (on the whole this was an excellent trip (although a very tiring one - because you will be doing a lot of walking!!) - I would advise that you make room for at least 1 day of rest to recuperate during your trip) Pamukkale was amazing our guide here was Birol so knowledable and good company here we stayed at the Melrose Hotel very nice and comfortable. On the whole the trip was amazing and I can't thank Nejo and Engin enough for making it so enjoyable we finished up at Ovacik . Poor Engin then had to drive all the way back to Istanbul (Hope you got home safely Engin). I would certainly recommend this company to everyone as I said before their Customer Service was out of this world the best we have received in many years. WELL DONE Nejo & Yusuf regards Caroline & Gar

Felt rushed. We used Chora for our trip to Cappadocia. We weren't originally planning on going to Cappadocia, but we made a last minute decision and, after some quick research, decided that Chora would be the best bet to help us execute our plan. It is a stunning region and we are thankful to the company for assisting us in getting there. That being said, we could have used more time at a few of the sights. Part of this is our fault as we wanted to see as much as possible, but we now wish that we had been encouraged to do less. The guiding service could have felt a bit more authentic - allowing us to relax and enjoy the experience more than we were ultimately able to.
