Great Approach to Travel. In planning our holiday, most travel organisations did not have tours did that fit our interests or our timetable. Nejo from Chora Travel suggested a custom made 10-day tour with a starting date and destinations we specified.Nejo's approach was to use public transport: airplanes, buses (great quality!) and private cars to move us from place to place. By skillfully using a network of staff and links to professional sighseing services on the ground in all key cities, we were met at each juncture of our tour (to and from transport, accommodation, and sightseeing) and arrangements made for the next phase of our trip.This approach gave the impression of individual travel rather than tour travel without the headaches and made the tour interesting and memorable.The key to success was the high level of professionalism and organisation of Chora staff. If we needed assistance there was always someone that we could contact.The arrangements overall were exceptional and allowed us to see a great deal of the beauty, culture and antiquities Turkey has to offer, in a short time. We especiallly enjoyed our time in Cappidocia, Antalya, Ephesus and Pergumum.

A One Stop Shop for Turkey Vacation. Nejo (the owner of Chora Travel) asked me to write something about Chora Travel, and I am more than happy to give him a glowing review. Working with Chora Travel was like having your personal travel agent. He and his colleague in Istanbul were more than accommodating despite our numerous itinerary changes. (By the way, the reason why our plans kept changing was because we seriously underestimated how beautiful the rest of Turkey was outside Istanbul and didn't initially allot enough days for places like Cappadocia and Pamukkale.) If you are planning a trip to Turkey, I suggest you call Chora. Because there will undoubtedly be so much to see in this gorgeous country, Chora will give you the best options for managing the different pieces.Here are some examples: 1) Cappadocia wasn't in our initial plans, but when we told Nejo that we'd ilke to see it, he was able to quickly find us flights at reasonable prices; 2) While in Cappadocia, we decided at the last minute that we wanted to see a whirling dervish dinner show, and Nejo was able to find one instantly; 3) When we wanted to add one more person to the hot air balloon ride, Nejo was able to do that without a problem; and 4) When we told Nejo that we didn't want a tour in Pamukkale and instead preferred to drive ourselves around, he was able to locate a rental car in the area that fit our needs at a better rate than available on the web. Now, I understand that this wasn't altruism on his part, and that Chora Travel only stood to financially benefit from booking us on more events. Still, I was very appreciative of Nejo's and his partner's abilities to meet our requests quickly and effectively. I also got the sense that they sincerely wanted us to have a good time and enjoy the country that they are obviously very proud of. Not only that, I felt completely at ease giving Nejo my credit card information from the US because he runs a completely honest business, and often that is the biggest worry when planning a trip overseas.Our itinerary:1) 2 nights in Istanbul - All of the major sites were beautiful and deeply enriching, and just walking around in the historic area was a great time.2) 2 nights Cappadocia - Guided tour of rock formations were unforgettable; you MUST do the hot-air balloon ride; underground cities were worth seeing; dinner show was so-so.3) 1 night back in Istanbul to see the sites that we missed.4) Overnight train from Istanbul to Izmir - our first time on an overnight train was an interesting experience5) 1 night in Pamukkale - rented a car and drove ourselves; the walk up Pamukkale and the hot spring were well worth the drive.6) 1 night in Ephesus.7) Flew out of Izmir to Athens.If you want any specific tips, feel free to contact me via TA.

Outstanding. Despite purchasing our tickets for Turkey ten months prior to departure, pressure of work unfortunately meant we left organising our trip very late.Upon a recommendation of an acquaintance at Monash University in Australia, who highly praised Chora Travel based in Istanbul and Cappadocia, we contacted them.After much correspondence via email we settled on an itinerary we felt comfortable with, much of it based on the expert advice of Nejo at Chora. He choose a variety of key and less frequently explored sites both archaeological (our main interests) and natural. He arranged hotels, bus travel and tickets, someone to meet and return us to bus stations and hotels, private drivers, small intimate quality tours and many extras which we appreciated. We did, however, make some suggestions for hotel upgrades based upon reviews in trip advisor and booking.com which was organised for us. A couple of luxurious establishments in beautiful surrounds refreshed us on our travels.We relied upon Nejo's experience as a former tour guide and were thrilled with his and Chora office staff''s detailed and meticulous planning. During our five weeks , we spoke with numerous travellers and were so pleased and relieved that everything proceeded exceptionally smoothly.Amongst the many highlights arranged for us was a balloon ride over Goreme in Cappadocia, small group tours of Cappadocia, a three day trip to Mt Nemrut and Sanliurfa, the ruins of Hierapolis and the Pamukkale Terraces, Ephesus, Pergamum, Trios, Aspendos, Perge, Saklikent Gorge and some unusual sites suggested such as Karian Caves, Termessos, Telmessos, Xanthos, Kayakoy Ghost City, Antalya old town and places around Fethiyre. Perhaps we should mention that arrivals at bus stations can be stressful if no one is there to meet you but the bus sometimes arrives early, or at Istanbul, two hours late. We found the bus companies great as they would ring the hotel or arrange a free shuttle. In fact strangers offered to do the same thing in many places. Bus travel is an ideal and cheap way to see Turkey if you accept that things don't often go to plan. We were given a preprogrammed phone and charger from Chora Travel in Istanbul which, I think, we used once to check on bus tickets. It does give peace of mind to know you can ring in the event of the unforeseen occurring.We plan to return to Turkey with our grandchildren in a few years and will ask Nejo at Chora Travel to arrange a tour perhaps with a private driver and van. We covered a lot of territory during our time but there is so much to see. The Turkish people are amongst the warmest we have encountered in our visits to 30+ countries.If you are thinking of planning a trip or take tours for any length of time, please seriously consider Chora Travel. We can assure you that you will be thankful for their expert advice, careful organisation and wonderful warm and friendly service.

Great Travel Agency. My five friends and I recently used Chora Travel for our 10 day tour of Turkey and were extremely happy with their service. Excellent Travel Company. After about 20 emails back and forth, which were always replied to promptly and no question left unanswered. The Wow factor. Instead of joining standard package,we decided to search for a travel agent to tailor our Cappodocia,Pamukalle,Bursar and Istanbul trip.This is extremely risky if done thru internet and dealing with stranger.Mr Yusuf of Chora Travel passed all tests we set on him.He earned our trust and our journey began in December 2011.Mr Yusuf suggested we buy vodaphone's SIM card to manage phone bill.He arranged all hotels and transfers seamlessly.He even encouraged us to travel day time from Coppadacia to Pamukalle ..and guest what ..Mr Yusuf arranged 14 seaters minibus for us exclusively .From Pamukalle to Bursa we travelled by comfortable public coach.. a fun journey where we observed Turkish's life style hands-on.The ferry to bursar was a breeze with a driver waiting for us at Istanbul pier.Believe it or nor , Mr Yusuf monitored our trip closely,almost daily.Mr Yusuf responded instantly by SMS of all our inquiries.Though he is not physically there but he is always contactable.Thank you for visiting us in Istanbul and sincerely appreciate your impeccable and excellent services you and Chora Travel had provided and looking forward to deal with you again this coming December 2012 ..This time Eastern Turkey.

Great tour. Chora Travel organized a great tour for our group. Made connections from airport to airport easy for us. Greatly Organised Trip. Chora Travel did a great job in organizing the trip, great timing, flight connections and very knowledgeable guides. I will definitely use them again for my next trip to Turkey. Would recommend them any day.

The Best in Turkey. Istanbul is a great city with very friendly people. When I decided to visit with some friends, we had no idea where to go and who to call for anything. Best Tour Guide in Turkey!. Istanbul was the last stop in our visit to Turkey after Ephesus, Pamukkale, Fethiye, Cappadocia et all and this tour was the most informative by far! Tim, our guide, was extremely knowledgeable and went out of his way to show us places and give us as much insight into Istanbul as possible. We took this full day walking tour on our first day in Istanbul, in which Tim covered most of Sultan Ahment area for us. He covered Hippodrome, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque for us, and took us for a walk through Grand Bazaar and finally made us cross the Galata Bridge and showed us around Karakoy and dropped us there for a nice evening time. He gave us ample information at every spot, good enough time to go through and also took excellent pictures for us - including wonderful Panoramas of us with exquisite ceilings and frescos in the background. Tim also stayed extra time with us and showed us the underground cistern and did a complimentary visit to Karakoy for us (which is fabulous)! He made our itinerary for the next few days in Istanbul with detailed information & also about our next trip to Antalya! All in all an excellent guide, perfect English speaking and great photographer! Must do tour on the first day in Istanbul and recommend you plan the rest of your days with Tim as well.

A friend in a foreign land. When I visited Turkey we had Ozlem accompany us for a whole week! We felt so lucky to have her and her plethora of information. When she discovered I love art she took me to a local university to see the unique work they are doing. She found out about my favorite foods and she would take us to where I can try exotic foods with flavors I love. By far the best and most thoughtful guide I've ever had.

Amazing day in Istanbul. I had a wonderfull day with my tour guide Ozi, Another tourist Robin. Istanbul inside . Memorable Treasures. I visited Turkey back in 2 years in a group of university student leader. We finished our amazing 4 days in Turkey. Amazing cities, sites and people. Highly recommended tour of beautiful Istanbul.. I visit Turkey for business and on this trip had one day free in Istanbul, I booked PTI tours, via the hotel concierge. Istanbul city tour. Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Bagdad Street, Grand Bazaar. You need to spend at least one full day in Grand Bazaar

Great introduction to Istanbul . This was my first visit to Istanbul For 3 days he took us to all of the great sights of Istanbul. Classical Istanbul with Lunch. Thanks to incredible Tour Guide. Tim was a wonderful guide explained everything very interestingly and answered every questions which made it memorable experience . I would highly recommend Tim Kar to everybody who comes here to visit Istanbul

Strolling through Old Istanbul. When we visited Turkey during May 2016, we were fortunate to have booked a full day walking tour for the main highlights of Old Istanbul. Our local tour guide was Ozlem. She has a lot of knowledge and is extremely friendly and welcoming.The language barrier was no problem as Ozlem speaks excellent English. The best of Istanbul. A great guide makes all the difference when travelling. My family and I absolutely loved touring Istanbul with Ozlem. She was friendly and genuine, and showed us a wonderful side of the city and its people. Her knowledge (literature, culture and history...) and recommendations were on-point, including where the best leather jackets are sold. Always a win! Really looked after us. My wife and I had 3 nights in Istanbul, no time to orientate ourselves. Hotel organized for Tim look after us for two mornings. We had a list of attractions we wanted to see, Tim was able to take us to these with minimal effort, he is very knowledgeable about the attractions we wanted to see. He was booked for 4 hours each day but gave us more like 6, he helped us with transport, trams, ferries etc. He made getting to places so easy. Day two my wife became ill while out with Tim, he took her back to the hotel safely, he then came back to me and we continued to view wonderful sights like Grand Bazar, Spice Bazar, Ferry to Asia, Archeological museum, Sophia, the Palace - he was fantastic and we recommend him to anyone. His sister is also a licensed guide she guided and looked after two Aussie girls who reported her as wonderful. They both have standing invitations to visit us and the realise a dream of seeing the Australian Open.

One of our most memorable guides. My husband and I had only one full day in Istanbul and were lucky enough to find Tim. He was not only extremely knowledgeable, but genuinely friendly, personable and interested in us. We've traveled extensively through Europe, Africa and South America and Tim was one of the most memorable guides we've ever had. Some tour guides seem to be on auto pilot, but Tim really tailored the tour to our personalities and sensibilities.

Highly recomended!. Tim was our guide during our visit in Istanbul, with true knowledge of the city history he took us in all the places it worths to visit and know about! He will introduce you to the true taste of the traditional Turkish cuisine (amazing food in all the places we went)! Five Days in Istanbul. So we had a friend that recommended Ozlem to us from a vacation tour he took while on a cruise in the southern part of Turkey. We corresponded quite a bit and set up a date. The thing I liked about Ozi and I assume her brother Tim, is that the tour is VERY CUSTOMIZABLE. A lot of the tours are a set itin and we didn't want that.Ozi met us promptly int he hotel lobby on our first full day in IST. We didn't return until almost 700 that night. She gave us a wonderful into to Istanbul and how to get around on the tram and or ferry system. We were able to negotiate our way around for the next 4 days before our Black Sea cruise. My review date indicates May 2016, but the actual date was May 2014.I highly recommend Ozi for a local Ist. tour. She is very knowledgeable about the buildings and the history. One of the highlights of our tour was crossing back from the Asian side on a ferry. There were these three elderly women on board. One of them was actually a retired teacher of Ozi. They had a lot of questions for us Americans and Ozi translated. The funny thing is they wanted to know about the TV show Dallas. Too funny. So we were immersed in some local conversation thru Ozi. Little things like that make using them well worth it and the tour is a great value.We still occasionally contact each other as well. How many of your former tour guides do you stay in contact with?

A magic tour of Old Istanbul. My tour company did me a favour by forgetting to pick me up for a day tour so Tim stepped in at very short notice. What an interesting day we spent visiting the city highlights. I went to Istanbul having read Dan Brown's book "Inferno"especially to see the basilica cistern and Tim had read the book and did not disappoint with his knowledge of the novel and cistern. We also went shopping for carpets, silk scarf and zultanite jewellery! I highly recommend Tim as thoroughly professional, knowledgeable and a delightful young man!

Highly recommended. My visit to Istanbul was made fulfilling. I decided to take a tour, Tim was my tour guide. What you should about Tim: He is a very easy going fellow with a wealth of knowledge about Turkish culture. And most important patient.He is very professional in showing traditional old local stores around Grand Bazaar and he is very competent in his work

world in a day. I had wanted to visit Istanbul for decades and when I finally did get there I only had a few days so wanted to tick as many things off my bucket list as possible. My travel agent arranged a day tour with Ozi and what a great experience that was. Ozi was lovely and very knowledgeable and patient. I was travelling solo, female, am in my mid 60s and am fascinated by history and she constantly had to round me up as I got left behind by the group while I poured over things in Topkapi, Hippodrome, Aya Sofia etc. I would have got completely lost if she hadn't mother henned me!! We saw so much in one day AND had a very yummy lunch in a lovely old family owned restaurant that I would never have found alone. Thank you Ozi for bringing Istanbul to life for me and making my bucket list that much shorter. Would definitely recommend Ozi's as a tour guide par excellence, you won't find a better one.

Best guide for Istanbul! Thank you Tim. I was in Istanbul last November and Tim was my guide and he was absolutely great ! He is very professional , friendly great knowledge about history and Turkish Culture , he knows all the good local restaurants to eat , i highly recommend Tim as Guide for everyone who want to have a great exerience in the city .

Istanbul & The Aegean. Learned and charming female and male guides with academic credentials regarding classical ancient and modern history, culture and architecture. Fun, but educational. Insider information on Istanbul and the Near East in general.

Eight (Fantastic) Days with Ozi.. We had the absolute pleasure of meeting and spending eight days with Ozi in May 2014. Our trip was divided into two parts: two days in Istanbul and then reconnecting four days later for a driving tour of Turkey.What a wonderful, fun, educational, tummy-stuffing experience!Ozi was an absolute delight from beginning to end and we were very sad to part ways at the end of our Turkish adventure with her. In Istanbul we visited Bazaars, Mosques, Palaces, Museums and places of historical significance, such as, the Hippodrome, Basilica Cistern, Aqueduct of Valens and the magnificent Hagia Sophia.Our driving tour left from our accommodation in Istanbul and we travelled to Troy, the Gallipoli Peninsula (Ozi was a font of knowledge regarding the significant history here), Cannakale, Bergama and Selcuk to Ephesus visiting the numerous historical locations along the way.Ozi delighted in taking us to eating places of local cuisine, educating us about traditional Turkish coffee and goat’s milk icecream plus many, many more local customs and traditions.We highly recommend Ozi and would not hesitate to seek her out again if we are fortunate enough to visit her beautiful homeland again.

The Best of the Best Tour Guides!!. While in Istanbul, we thoroughly enjoyed the guidance that was provided by Tim. He is quite knowledgeable on everything tourist related and knows the complete history of that historic region of the world. I would recommend him to anyone coming to visit.

Fabulous Tour Guide!. My husband and I were lucky enough to have Tim as our private tour guide for 3 days while visiting Istanbul. His knowledge, friendliness,and great sense of humor added so much to our enjoyment of the city. We have continued to keep in touch with Tim over the years and would highly recommend him as a fabulous tour guide!

Super duper Fantabulous experience . Tim was our guide while my friends and I were in Istanbul. He made our trip a memorable one as he took us to most places worth visiting. His knowledge on the history of the palaces and culture made it an enjoyable experience for us. Whoever is in Istanbul make sure you get in touch with their tour company if you want an awesone experience in Istanbul. Keep up the fab work Tim.

Best tour guide you could ever ask for. . I can't say enough about my tour guide Tim. I felt when I first met him that I would not only be in good hands but I would have a new friend for life. He has spent time and has studied in the USA, so that made a huge difference for me. I'm a photographer and he knew where to take me for the best pictures. My shots are amazing. He was so cordial and good natured. Everyone knows him so I got treated like a king when we ate out. Turkish food is the best!....and Tim knows where to take you to eat as well! I feel like he is family and I still keep in touch. Book PTI now! Worth every penny!!

Amazing walking tour of Istanbul : ). First time traveller to Istanbul I wanted to see all the best bits of city & learn a bit more about the place. Ozi was super professional and friendly with an excellent knowledge of Istanbul. Saw the main attraction plus a few extra ones too!! She answered all my questions & made some wicked suggestions about what else I should do with my time in the city. Could not more highly recommend PTI walking tours for a local's perspective on Istanbul : ) A must do when you visit turkey!!

The Best Is Good Enough For You!!!. I've traveled the world and hands down, Istanbul is the most magnificent city in the world! The best way to experience sights, history, food and culture is with a guide! PTI Walking Tours is the creme de la creme!!!! The best!!! And I grew up believing that the "Best" is always good enough!!!

Outstanding tour guide. I was lucky enough to find Tim Kar, my tour guide, for Istanbul. Tim was exceptionally knowledgeable. I was in the city alone for 2 days until my husband could join me. I would not have be brave enough to tour alone. Thankfully I found Tim. He was recommended by the hotel i was staying at - Doubletree - Old Town. He picked me up at my hotel and we walked to Sultanahmet area for a half day tour. I was interested in Topkapi Palace and I didn't see any tours that just did Topkapi itself. There were tours that included it along with other tourist sites. Tim was amazing! I tried to stump him, but could not. A few days later, once my husband arrived we took a Bosphorus cruise. Again Tim was impressive and shared so much about his city.I highly recommend Tim as a tour guide for Istanbul.

Best Tour Guide for Istanbul. We were a group of ten ladies who went for a holiday to Istanbul for a friends 40th Birthday in June 2015.Tim was our guide through out our stay for 6 Days.We had the most pleasant and memorable stay in Istanbul all thanks to Tim.From the time we landed to the time we departed, Tim looked after us with such great hospitality.it was much more than what any family member would do.I would recommend everyone to book their trip with Tim and am sure you will all have the same experience as we did.All the Best Tim!!!

Super super. One of my most amazing tours ever (and I do many a year!!).....the service all through from airport pick up to sightseeing to taking my friends and I to some of Istanbuls finest spots was simply amazing .....awesome attention to detail, care of the clients, and extremely knowledgeable about Istanbul and Turkey ....we did all there was to do in Istanbul with Tim ....Bosphorus cruise, Dalmabahche palace, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Hippodrome, Topkapi....name it.....best night spots, carpet weaving, traditional foods, shopping,....we did it all thanks to our most wonderful tour guide Tim

Many days in Istanbul. Hi, a friend of ours had recommended Ozi from a previous cruise when they were in Turkey. So i contacted her via internet. Very fast response. After correspondence back and forth we knew she would be a match. Ozi was very prompt in meeting at our hotel. And all i can say is wow. This was our first time and first day in Istanbul. We had previously discussed itineraries and she arrived ready to go. I think we saw every piece of Istanbul that interest a tourist. She was fantastic. Returned back to hotel around 700 PM. We were pooped. Saw and learned enough that our next two days on our own were very easy. Ozi has a great commend of English, so don't feel that you won't be able to understand her. We still communicate periodically to just say hello. Unfortunately, we did not meet her brother, but some friends have used him before and were very happy.My review date below is incorrect. We were there in May 2014.I highly recommend PTI if going to Istanbul. You will not be disappointed.

Great way to know Istanbul. I visited Istanbul with the purpose of getting to know more about the turkish culture and history, so this tour is perfect for that. Ozi and Tim know the city and its history like the back of their hand.Istanbul is bedazzling with amazing hospitable people! I cannot wait to come back!

Istanbul Tour. I booked a tour back in November 2015 with Timucin  as a private guide. It was an interesting, entertaining and nice tour which I really enjoyed. The day was planned according to my interests and I saw all the main attractions without queuing at the entrances. It was so much better to have a guide "on my own" instead of visitingt with a thrown together group of other tourists. I especially enjoyed the Harem, the Sultan Ahmed Mosque and the view from Husnu Ala Kafe. I would definitely recommend him as a guide for visiting beautiful Istanbul
Excellent tour knowledge. Ozi's local knowledge was very impressive, I'd definitely recommend any of the tours but my personal favorite place was Ephesus.

Best tour guide ever!!!. First time in Turkey and I was so excited about going to Istanbul. I didn't know what to expect. Well it was better than I ever expected the tours were fab and the guides were very lovely and fun. They were also very professional. I would certainly recommend so if you want a professional quality service then use PTI Walking Tours.

Great informative english speaking guides.. We booked a full day city tour taking in the Mosques, and an afternoon Bosphorous cruise. We covered all the main mosques and our guide was very knowledgeable and could answer any questions put to him. The River cruise was half a day with one and half hours on the river and time at the Spice Bazaar again very informative. This company will pick you up from your hotel and on time.

The best service EVER!. This company picked us up 4 times during our 10 day stay, and everytime they were on time, helpful, clean cars. Fantastic service, friendly. Wonderful. Will use them everytime I am in Istanbul. Thank you so much! Blessings to your business.

Great little tour. Great tour to do and get your bearings around Istanbul.My wife and i booked the whole day tour to help us get our bearings and to help us hone in on other potential points of interest. The afternoon bosphorus cruise was not done on a private vessel due to low numbers so we were sent on the local ferry which stopped at numerous points to pick up and drop off passengers. Our guides were informative and spoke English well.
Beautiful and amazing country. Everyone must go their once in a lifetime best place for tourism couples or families all will have a great time I must say go to look a beautiful and peaceful country

Great service!. I contacted Adore for the transport of a group of people from the Airport to the hotel and back and we received great service at a great price. I would totally recommend them and will definitely call them back if we happen to be in Istanbul again for work.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. i used this company to order a taxi from the airport to my hotel and their website flagged up. I looked through the tours and there was an excellent choice. The tour was well organised and the drivers and tour guides had a good knowledge of English and were extremely polite and helpful. I would certainly use them again as I would like to return and go on other tours which unfortunately I did not have time to do.
perfect service every thing was satisfying. from start to arrival good cars and drivers coming on time next time i ll repeat the trial with you when we visit istanbul

Istanbul in a day. I booked my tour with adore tours online from the uk for a reasonable price of 59€ for a day tour including lunch. The tour guide was very knowledgeable of the history of the places we visited and very polite. had a wonderful lunch at the rooftop restaurant overlooking most of Istanbul. I would definitely recommend adore tours as I had a wonderful time on a layover flight. Very good value for money.

Professional service. The confirmation was quick, once we had booked the transfers and gave all the information we needed. From the airport - nice smooth service in a nice air conditioned vehicle. From our hotel - arrived earlier then our agreed time.. good smooth service. Cannot fault them. 10/10

Excellent. Excellent guide, tour and food. Would recommend it to anyone going to the city. The guide informed us of the history of different places, their roles and the myths as well as true history surrounding it.

Green Bursa Tour. I used their services last year and had a wonderful time. This year, I have decided to repeat the Green Bursa Tour. It was horrible. This tour should be called ''Shopping Tour for Arabs''. We didn't see anything. We spent more time in some random shops (we were left in some random shops three times, spending 1 hour and 30 minutes there - and only 30 minutes for the biggest attractions of Bursa which are Green Mosque, Turbe, and Silk House). We had two different guides - one on Arabic language and the other one on English. Unfortunately, we were the only ones on English and we had a guide who didn't even know who built the Green Mosque. Our guide was more than useless! The only thing he was good at was when forcing us to buy some random stuff and wasting our money. The only thing we were told all day was ''We are entering Bursa'', ''We are climbing on Uludag'', and some random talk about our guide's phone. Not a single word about anything related to attractions we were visiting. All the time you have the feeling like you're in some Arabic country, which I don't like! You are listening to Arabic music, visiting stores that are interesting for their shopping. I came to experience Turkey! As simple as that! When we finally climbed to Uludag, we were offered (forced) to take ATV's and this wasn't mentioned. It is a lot of money for some rude people who almost shout at us. We spent the most of time here and if we hadn't took the ATV's, we would be left alone with our guide up in the mountains (that is not much interesting for someone who had seen the trees and rocks before). I do understand that a mountain can be interesting for someone coming from a desert, but you should be careful and name this tour '' a shopping tour for Arabs''. Nobody else will be interested in spending more time looking at trees than hearing at least a couple of sentences about the Green Mosque! As I said before, I have booked this tour last year and the schedule was almost the same. However, our guide was more than amazing. He was telling us some interesting stories all the time. The guy was educated and polite. We spent enough time in the Mosque and Turbe. The guide was telling us everything there is to know about these (the most important) places in Bursa. And that is what I was expecting this year as well. Such a terrible waste of time and money. All in all - the worst experience ever! I wouldn't recommend this tour to anyone who is looking to see some culture and historical monuments or to hear some interesting facts about Bursa or anything else related to Turkey. This tour is not for Europeans or anyone else who doesn't find trees so fascinating! Uludag is definitely worth seeing, but this is not THE ONLY reason why people book this tour! After a day of torture, the only thing I feel is anger for wasting my money on some random shopping tour for Arabs and looking at trees! We have seen the Turkish delight store last year, as well. However, it was perfectly scheduled in our tour. This year, everything was about shopping and trees. Instead of advising me where to spend our money (like the amazing guide from the last year), this guide was almost forcing us to buy almost everything we have seen because he obviously knew the people selling the stuff. And the last thing, when we have returned to Istanbul, we were left with an extremely rude guide who didn't know English (...) and we couldn't understand what he was telling (to Arabs) at one of the stops on our way back. Luckily, there was a couple of Arabs who live in USA and translated that we had to get off the bus. Otherwise, we would be left in the bus (driving around for few more hours because of the traffic jam in Istanbul). The Arabic guide didn't even say ''hello'' to us all day! I can understand that someone doesn't speak English, but we speak enough of Turkish and we expected some basic manners from our guide. I have tried to ask him something in Turkish a couple of times and he would just turn away and keep ignoring us. Don't book this tour! Ever!

Great experience . Reservation super easy through their website I hired an airport transportation on 2 separate trips in Istanbul and on both times driver were on time very respectful On my 2nd trip I hired a Mercedes Vito for 8 hours for 2 days Driver Mr Ali very nice and helpful Thank you Mr Tarik Ozaktas for a great service Me and my family were really happy I'm sure we will call u again in our next trip to Istanbul Keep up the good work

Muhannad AL Radaideh . It's my pleasure to me and my family to  spent a fabulous Tour to princess island  with your team today 12 September, 2016 , and I would like to take a chance to thanks and appreciate Mr.Mohammed who's take care of us and he was a very nice , professional , responsible and very kind man.It's a  first time i reserved from ADORE TOUR Company,  but sure it will not be last time,  I will inform all my friends the great treatment and excellent service I had gotten. Again thank you very much for your Company and your staff specially Mr. Mohammed. Best regards, Muhannad AL Radaideh JORDAN

Airport Shuttle. Adore Tourism and Mr. Tarik were on the spot with pick up and communication for both our arrival and departure. We actually forgot an item in the pick on our arrival and only noticed it the day we were leaving a week later. They brought it over in a few minutes. The did not need reminding of our pick up for departure and all went well. Highly recommend them.

Excellent Experience... I would like share my experience by saying hats off to Mr. TARIQ for making this trip a memorable trip for my parents, at first i was hesitant due to the issues going on in istanbul, (political unrest) however Mr. Tariq provided me with proper info and assured me that it is safe and all tourist spots are open for visiting and hence i booked the following tours with him.1. Moonlight tour2. Heritage tour3. Green Bursa tour4. Princess island tour5. Airport pick and drop service.Let me tell you that this was a gift for my parents hence wanted to pay in advance for their trip. Mr. Tariq made everything so easy and smooth regarding booking confirmation for all the tours, now i had paid everything in ADVANCE and was worried for any uncertain circumstance. But on the contrary Mr. TARIQ was all along communicating with me and everything was spot on right from the airport pick up to drop off.My parents being a bit aged even missed the bus due to their delay on one tour, however this is where Mr. Tariq blew me away, he contacted me via whats upp and arranged the pick up for my parents again for the tour. I am very glad that i chose this company.I would highly recommend this to others as it was a very safe and memorable trip for my parents as they were happy with all the guides and their service.Thank you Mr. TARIQ for all ur support. May God bless you.Regards,Khalid.

Bosphorus Cruise. This is a reliable agency and good thing you will pay them once you reached or on the day of the tour you booked with them.We just purchased a Bosphorus cruise and airport transfer from Adore Agency coz the rest of our Istanbul Trip were DIY. Staffs were accomodating even in emails they replied fast! The Cruise was amazing :) such a lovely Istanbul will definitely come back!

Tourist Trap. DO NOT DO THE ISTANBUL BOSPHORUS TOURS CABLE CAR & BOSPHORUS ON BOAT.We thought the cable car would be nice tour with aerial views of the beautiful city, rather it was a minute trip to go down, definitely not worth the price and time wasted that could have been spent even walking around the city.Just buy a ticket to the boat if you want to ride along the Bosphorus.

Could have been so much better. We were picked up on time from our hotel (08.15), we then picked up a couple of more people then finally ended up at a car park waiting for about half an hour. We then transferred to another minibus and were eventually on our way this took about 1 hour 15 minutes from being collected.We enjoyed the visit to the mosque and the guided tour around the old sultan's palace. This was the highlight of the trip.What we did not enjoy was the unexpected visit to the leather shop. None of the group were interested in buying any leather but we still had to sit through a number of young girls parading around with leather jackets and were handed small paper pads and pencils to write down the ones we were interested in. This fiasco took up about 30 minutes of a valuable day and this detour was not mentioned on the itinerary otherwise I would not have booked the tour as I only had 2 days in Istanbul.After the leather shop tour we were taken to the restaurant for lunch where we stayed for 1 hour and 40 minutes. The whole thing could have been completed in an hour. It felt that we were simply sitting around killing time so that the afternoon tour people could be collected together.We then went on to the Bosphorus cruise part of the day. When we arrived we then found out that our boat was running 30 minutes late so more time we were just hanging around. The cruise itself was good and we enjoyed this.We then went onto the cable car and once again this was good but we did not have much time at the top as we was running late.In the end the whole trip was running so late that the stop at the spice bazaar was skipped if you wanted to be returned to your hotel (which we did). You could opt to be dropped off but find your own way back to your hotel which we did not want to do as we were staying a fair distance from the spice bazaar.It become apparent that Adore actually sub contracted out this city tour to a company called "Yes Tours" who to be honest have poor reviews on TA and I would not knowingly book them or recommend this tour unless you are happy to wait around for extended periods.Perhaps we were unlucky but after having a private tour the day before I really wished I had paid more and done the same on the second day.
Istanbul Tour. The city itself is magnificent. I think our guide was little weak not necessarily in his knowledge but his presentation and personal skills

Great airport shuttle service. We used this compamy twice now and they never fail to deliver great service. A representative meets us inside the arrivals terminal and takes us to our driver.We stay at Air BnBs in Istanbul cuz we like to do what the locals do but the places are so difficult to find (it's a maze). The drivers always finds a way to deliver us at the correct address. They are so patient. They are prompt and reliable.

Great professional service. I've used the service 4 times ...Very professional and punctual ... They made it easy to identity at the airport, drivers are really good and the whole service is wonderful

Good tour operator for Istanbul transfer and city tour.. Was waiting with sign on arrival in Istanbul, however, price of private transfer being able to be paid in USD, EUR or TLI for not true. Driver couldn't give proper exchange and change for a $50 US note so transfer cost me more than it should've. Other than that, company was fine. Local city tour the next day was able to accommodate me paying by credit card in Euro's. The guide on city tour was excellent. Only aspect not advertised to taking us captive into a carpet merchant as part of the tour. Didn't say anything about that in tour content.
princess iland tour. price was high compared to the facilities given moreover, food was below acceptable standards and I have to pay additional money to get enough and suitable lunch.

Good professional service. I used Adore Tourism for airport transfer from Sabiha airport to Sultanahmet Istanbul, and return. We booked it on their web site, the prices are fixed & competitive and you don’t have to pay until you get to your destination each way, also they give you choice of currency, useful if you don’t have Turkish Lira with you, (tip, take euro or dollar and change it in Turkey, you get much better rates). We arrived at the airport we were greeted at the arrivals, the driver was polite and courteous, he took our luggage and we followed him to a luxury Mercedes van. The long drive to the hotel was very comfortable, he was driving safely throughout and we had a very relaxed journey. Great start to a short break with the wife.On the way back to the airport, the pickup time was at 4.00 pm, the same driver came to pick us up, he was few minutes early all good and ready waiting at the reception, we got in the luxury van and started our journey back to the airport, 15 minutes later we were stuck in traffic due to an unexpected demonstration that started in the city. It could’ve been a nightmare, but thanks to Mr Ahmet (the diver) he made few detours, used the ferry, and got us to the airport in time, at one point we were sitting in the car waiting to get on the ferry for 40 minutes (and the air-condition was on just to make us comfortable). He was calm, professional, safe and competent, he really saved the day.The price was very reasonable and for the service we received it was really worth it, they gave us 110% service wise.
Excellent tour. The service is great and on time. We covered different locations and in all of them, the guides showed great knowledge of the topics. Unforgettable experience!

Superb. We took the cruise and it was an awesome experience. We enjoyed every moment. Our pickup from hotel was well in time and we were dropped at the hotel by midnight, I will surely recommend their service.

Simple and effective. With an excellent and intuitive online service, it was easy to book and the confirmation was Instant . The vehicle had excellent condition and was well maintained . We did a city tour , where we visit the main points of interest. The payment was made only at the end of the tour.

Reliable staff and un-friendly user booking platform. I tried to book Piere Lotti and Bosphorus Cruise Tour through site booking via cell phone, but it did not go through. Afterwards, I called their Viber phone and it went smoothly. Bosphorus cruise give you an opportunity to hear about Turkish history, European and Asian lifestyles, Sultan-Ahmet bridge facts. Piere Lotti has view on Golden Horn and it is must-take photo spot. Overall experience - very good.

Excellent Service. We went on the Bosphorus River Cruise which included Dinner. The atmosphere on board was quite good but the food need some improvement. Staff on board the cruise are very helpfull and efficient.Also we had the half day morning tour of Istanbul were we visited the Grand Bazaar, The Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia.. the Coach was really on time with very nice driver. Tour guide was extremely good with who explained very very well. Very well done.

Cannot Fault - Kept their commitment. We did five different Daily tours plus an airport transfer with Istanbul Daily City Tours and we were pleased will them all. On the Princess Island tour all other people cancelled because of the weather so they ran the tour with just the two of us. I think that is excellent service as I assume that they would lose money keeping their commitment. On our final tour on return to Istanbul three weeks later there were only three of us probably due to the worsening security and again they ran the tour for us at no extra charge.

Average. We booked for the trip in March, they came really early to pick us up from the Hotel and were on time everywhere. I just thought it was too expensive and would have been cheaper if I visited myself. Also the tour guide was really annoying to a point that I wanted to end the tour.
Asia side tour. Very nice tour ... Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and funny. The driver was also super nice to us. Keep up the good work guys.

2 Different 4-Hour Tours in Istanbul. The first thing I wanted to say is Turkish people are awesome. They are very generous and will make your business their business if you ask for help. The tour overall was good and very interesting since I had never been to Istanbul before. I was out and about for 8 hours total, so by the end I was drained. At the end of the last 4-hour tour, I somehow got lost and despite the rules stating that the tour doesn't wait for customers that are late, the tour guide was there waiting for me when I got un-lost. He then proceeded to ask me when my flight home was. He then told the bus driver to drive me to the ferry which would take me to the asian side of Istanbul. From there I planned to take a taxi. Long story short I ended up asking a Turkish woman for directions and she walked me (quite out of her way) to the exact bus I needed to ride to the airport. Both of these acts of kindness probably saved me over $100 in taxi costs.The tour itself was good. There were some obvious upsells...they tried to get me to buy stuff in the bazaar (prices are 1/5 outside the bazaar). I assume they have some kind of deal with the store(s) in there. Anyway, great tour company, generous Turkish people, and a new city to explore made this a great day.

Good choice to go around Sultanahmet. A plus was our guide Pinar and the coincidence that the streets of Istanbul were completely empty: 4/5; however itinerary 3/5. If that is your first time to Istanbul its worth taking that tour; you will visit the main historic attraction, have a quick look around the grand and spice bazar, a cup of tea/coffee overlooking the city and some background information on Islam (in a mosque).

Gallipoli tour. Excellent tour and thoroughly recommend it. The tour is a very long day (you get back to Istanbul close to midnight) but well worth it. Picked up punctually at 06:30. The driver was courteous and friendly. The tour itinerary was exactly as described online. The War Museum is well worth the visit especially the series of 11 rooms offering a terrific audio-visual and sensory experience (floors vibrate and roll etc).The english-speaking guide was excellent in both his knowledge of the Gallipoli history and in customer service.I was lucky with beautiful sunny weather making lunch by the sea at Eceabat very enjoyable watching the ships go by through the Dardanelles.
Family trip . Great service, picked up from airport to hotel and return really good service nice clean vehicle and on time

Top tourist agency.. I poked 2 daily tours for my wife and I during our visit to Istanbul for our honeymoon, we arrange our reservation over the net with easy, user friendly website, we get supported by WhatsApp from the company 24/7, we use it when we had to cancel one of tours we had booked.The bus driver show at our hotel in time and guide us along the street to the bus, we had the first tour “ASIA & BEYLERBEYI PALACE TOUR” an afternoon tour to Asia side of Istanbul, the bus was clean and modern, both the driver and the guide have an excellent English communication skills, they were helpful and knowledgeable.Thinks to be considered: trip value, discounts, stuff, and support.Special thanks: the bus driver, the guide, Mr. Tariq on whatsapp.ASIA & BEYLERBEYI PALACE TOUR, 22,September, 2015,

Great tour, great price. I was able to sign up online on the day of the tour. The bus was very prompt, payment was easy. The guide was very patient with slower walkers, and very good explaining everything for us in English. Then he left us on our own for 1 1/2 hours to see what we wanted, with a pre-arranged meeting point.

Great Tour and Great Experience. Hi, It was great to see Istanbul with Istanbul Daily City Tour, I booked my tour before my arrival. I got all the information quickly. Everything was on time , I visited all the places. Almost I saw all the City . Guide was great, lunch was super . I would love to come again and wana be with Istanbul Tour again Inshallah
Tourist. It was beautiful experience. Covered all most all places as itinerary. Lunch was not good. Guide was knowledgeable

Excellent Experience. Very punctual, reasonable tour price, modern buses/vans and excellent English speaking guides. I also had excellent experience with the company for to and from airport transfers.

Great tours. We've taken a Istanbul heritage tour and a Bosphore dinner tour and 1 Istanbul by night tour + airport transportations from adore, all of them was good and they have a professional team that helps us alot in our visit.

Beylerbeyi Palace Tour. A very good and short tour led expertly by Aziz who had a genuine interest in Turkish history and society. The our is short but exactly what it says in the advertisement. Good value for money
Day Trip to Cappadocia from Istanbul. An excellent overview of the place, the landscape and its history provided by the appointed tour leader, Hafuz.

Great service, beautiful tour!. The staff is really good and knowledgeable about places. Lunch was really nice and timings at each place to visit were reasonably enough. Transportation was really comfortable too.

Very exciting tour. We liked the moonlight tour very much.
The Tour Program was very exciting.
The fish that we ate for dinner was very tasty.
Strongly recommend the tour!

Be careful. In December, 2015, I booked an airport pickup through Adore tours online. It was great, successful the person was waiting with our names and was relatively inexpensive. A great service!I used Adore Travel services again a week or so later for a transfer to the high speed railway, this was arranged via email there were a few emails and call made just to clarify a few things, no problem and with a little help the driver found us and we were on our way. However the terms of the trip were that we paid for a private service just 2 people to Pendik station, along the way with no notification we stopped and collected 2 more passengers from a hotel. The other passengers had also paid for a private transfer, they were also quite upset. We got to the destination with plenty of time so no problems there, I refused to pay until we were picked up, this caused a little discussion but it was agreed upon. At this point I had lost my trust in the company to keep their end of the bargain.The pickup was great, the driver was there on time with my name and was a good driver. On arrival he asked for the full price of a private return transfer, which I paid to avoid argument, and it most probably was not the drivers concern anyway.There should have been monetary compensation and the courtesy of being asked if it was OK to do this. I only received an explanation on arrival at the train station after negotiating to pay upon the return. I did this to ensure that the company would honour the agreement.I wrote to the director of the company and have yet to hear back from him. I would hope that this is not their usual practice. I have read other reviews and they seem to be good.

Excellent Transfers. Arranged two transfers from Suadiye to Ataturk Airport. Both transfers went extremely smoothly - Adore representative rang the day before to check details and arrived on time in smart clean vehicles. Would definitely use this company again and would recommend to any family or friends visiting Istanbul
Great Tour guides. Very friendly. I took 2 tours with Adore. The half day Istanbul historical city tour and full day Bursa tour. Had a great time and really enjoyed the service.
nice tour. It is a nice tour, but with short duration, could include more attractions. Perfect logistics, with pick up and drop off.

Great day in Istanbul. Pick up at time , thank you Shakir and mozafer for great day
Most of Istanbul places
Great group of ppl
Istanbul tours. On time pick up, knowledgeable and personable guides, well organized informative, lunch was very good

Worth the day spent. We did a guided tour of Prince's Island in Turkey. This island. Is serene. No vehicles that run on fuel. So the fresh air was rejuvenating. The place is beautiful and clean. The food in Alibaba restaurant was delicious with a great hospitality. Our guide was a superb gentleman with good English and immense knowledge. It was really enjoyable Bosphorus river cruise and a great day full of sunshine and pleasant weather on the island. Though it was a group tour on that day it was only two of us. So it was a private tour for us.

Overrated half day tour. Pick up from hotel was at 8.20 and the return was at noon. So, 3 hours and 40 minutes were consisting of: visiting Spice market (1 hour, without guide), Bosphor boat tour (1 hour and 15 minutes). You are probably wondering what's happened with 1 hour and 25 minutes? Well, you spend this time in the bus - transfering from new European part of the city to the old one and getting back - either to Kabatas (as starting point for all boat tours) or to hotel.This half day tour costs (with "discount included") 29 euros! If you want to see Bosphor individually, you should spend ONLY 5 euros for the above mentioned boat trip. So, explore Istanbul on your own! It wouldn't be so expensive!!!

Gallipoli - a new perspective. Day trip to Gallipoli was eye opening and inspiring. Along with the historical significance, the tour was enhanced by our Turkish guide Cagri. Not only was he historically sound with both the political background of the time as well as the campaign itself, it was his perspective from the Turkish viewpoint that made the day. His pride in his country and his portrayal of the bond developed forever between Turkey and Aus/NZ was inspiring as it appears that both Australia and Turkey created their identities from that campaign. Only negative was choice of meal stop both going and coming back from Istanbul. With a 5 hour drive the stop was only 1 hour out of Istanbul at an expensive fixed buffet set price restaurant. Too early going down and too late coming back.
Excelent experience. Very kind tour guide Mr Shaban, flexible schedule, a lot of knowledge of The city, spectacular places (Galata Tower, Pier Loti Hill, .....

Nice city tour. We booked transport from airport and than the Imperial Tour and later in the afternoon transport back to airport. We were picked up a bit to early (our own fault) and dropped of at the pick up site2h before the tour started. When it started to rain I called them and then we were picked up and could go with the bus who were picking up the other persons who had book the same or different tours. The imperial tour was good. The guide had knowledge, sometimes his english was a bit hard to understand, but he repeated what he had told us so if you didn't get it the first time you got it the second or the third time. We wanted to go back to the airport earlier so I called again and they arranged for a earlier pickup. They were very friendly and helpful and always called back in time. I would use them again if I would visit Istanbul

Bunch of cheaters and liars!!!!. Attention to everyone who travels! If u are into paying for something u will never get, if u are ok to be treated without respect and be left alone in a strange city never the less u payed for being taken care of and like to get super rude feed back to your complaints about unsatisfactory service than welcome to TARIK OZAKTAS`Istanbul Daily City Tour!Super expensive one way ride around the city and absence of transfer to the hotel. They just left me and my parents in a middle of nowhere, so we had to get a taxi to get back to the hotel. If u want to get a Bosphorus Boat tour just go to the harbor, get on any boat and enjoy it for 12 lira instead of wasting half day of your time and 27 euros (around 90 lira). What they call city excursion is just driving from your hotel to another bus station, putting you on another bus that drives same way back and brings u to Egyptian market, leaves u there for 1 hour, and gets u to the boat. After 1 hour trip u are all alone on a left bank of the city and there is no one waiting for u to drive u back to the hotel, even though u payed for it! So good luck to wasting time and paying 10 time more than it costs!!!!Oh yes, If u feel like to call them after to get any explanation about your transfer to the hotel, be ready to hear that u are the one who found them, you are in their country and its your own fault!Latter on I got an e-mail from the owner that says that it was us who decided to stay and told to the driver to leave without us. We have never seen anyone waiting for us and never spoken to the driver. This is totally unacceptable way of treating people and pure disgrace. I would never recommend this company but would strongly advice avoid any services they provide. Super unpleasant experience!!!

Good experience. We were a group of 11 who toured with this company. We took the whole day tour which included lunch. We were able to see the highlights of Istanbul in 1 whole day. Our guide was very knowledgeable. We were given free time to tour the Grand Bazaar in our own.

Excellent Value and Tour. This was our second tour with Adore, and they really pack a lot into their tours. The bopat trip was delightful. Lunch was good, but a little rushed, and service could have been friendlier. Overall, a goof value. Thanks!
Excellent!. Very good itinerary and superb service. We took a full day sightseeing and enjoyed every minute of it.

Great Service from Adore. We have returned home to Canada after a wonderful holiday in Istanbul. We tooka whole day Bosphorus tour with tour guide Azizz, he was very knowledgeable and made sure we returned to our cruise ship on time. Pick up at the cruise port to take us to our hotel as well as our pick from hotel to airport was on time with courteous drivers. Adore is a great representative of your wonderful city.

"Wonderful full day Istanbul experience with Bosphorus cruise". We booked DOLMABAHCE PALACE & CABLE CAR & BOSPHORUS tour quite last minute and were very happy that our booking was accommodated within 12 hours. Pick-up time from our hotel was sharp on time and all tour logistics were very professionally done. Our guide was amazing - both entertaining and very interesting which made our touring of Istanbul experience very nice. Guide answered all practical questions about touring in Istanbul and even helped out in booking some non tour related activities. Tour arrangements were very flexible - we were allowed to decide where we wanted to end this tour instead of comming back to hotel which we were very grateful for. We will definitely will book our tours in Istanbul via this company next time!

Great trip. Well arranged and organised to make a wonderful day in Istanbul.Pick up arrangements from the port were easy and everything went to plan.We seen some wonderful sights and met some really nice people.
Moonlight tour. Very good food service and entertainment. Amazin views of Istanbul went on trip with young children was an easy four hours spent

Excellent cab service. Very professional... Spot on time and clean vehicle . Prompt response for any changes!!. Enjoyed cruise at Bosphorous. Had booked a day tour but missed due to miscommunication between the driver and the hotel reception ( It was the hotel reception who did not respond appropriately).Would use again, when in Istanbul !!!

A very good service. Took a day-trip to Troya With a Group of 13 friends. Got Our own bus, which I didn't expect but was excellent for us. The breakfast stop after an hour wasn't really a breakfast stop, so I suggest having breakfast before you start you long day.The lunchplace was beautiful og the service was Perfect. The visit to Troya was not as good as expected since the tour guide showed us out of the Troya site when he was finished so that the bus could take us to his shop outside the perimeters of the Troya site. This seriously reduced the experience and is something you should be prepared for. We actually missed the museum shop because of this.
Great experince. It was wounderfull tour with great guide , polite , good english , full of information and helpful.I hope to try it again with the great staff they have
Lovely day trip. Nice relaxing trip to Princes Island - great to get out of the City and experience another aspect of Istanbul ! Your guide was friendly & knowledgeable.
Great service!. Very professional, had a lot of fun in the tours chosen. The guides were knowledgeable. Would definitely recommend tourists to choose them.

Sight and Sound of Istanbul comes alive!!!. I took a full-day tour and both were well-organized, and reasonable for the services provided. I did extensive online research for Istanbul guides and found them to be very expensive. However, this company's tours were a good value for the money. On the full day tour, lunch at a hotel was included and it was a fine meal. The guides were well qualified especially Mehmet who was the tour guide on the day very insightful when it comes to the history of Istanbul and Turkey!!! He also has become my latest good friend.In the morning of the full-day tour each person got a set of headphones to carry/wear as we sat on the bus and as we walked about. This was a very good system to insure that people at the back of the bus or on the outer ring of the crowd could hear. I highly recommend this company and suggest that you avoid private guides that will charge as much as $200 to $300 per day I paid 59 Euros for one person for a full-day tour including lunch The tour covered the major sites in Sultanahmen (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, etc.) and also offered a wonderful ship tour of the Bosphorus.

great tour and guide. After a late start due to pickup going to wrong hotel we eventually joined our tour and were warmly welcomed by our guide MehmetIt was a full day walking tour of the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia ( Istanbul Heritage Tour) etc.Our guide was very informative and patient , almost like a friend even though we had only just met that day, he also had a good sense of humour and looked after us all. we had lunch in a lovely hotel, restaurant upstairs with a lovely view over the Bosphorus, food was typical Turkish and excellent value as was included in the tour price. Do wear comfortable flat walking shoes/sandals as streets are cobbled and you are on you feet most of the day, also Ladies do bring a scarf to cover head and shoulders and don't wear scanty clothing i.e. tiny straps on tops and shorts as you do need to cover up and it is respectable in their culture.Even men shouldn't wear shorts in the religious sites.After the tour was finished Mehmet made sure we went to correct transport for journey home. We stayed near the airport so had to pay extra for our taxi but didn't mind as were well looked after. Felt very safe all the timeWould recommend This Tour company to anyone , but as it was walking all day you need to have a good level of fitness.

Highly recommended.. I book three activities through Istanbul daily tour, including airport transfers. All the activities were arranged professionally. We did not experience any problems. Highly. Recommended.

Great experience. Very professional. Everything was just like promised. Especially loved the Green Bursa tour. Very friendly guide and a wonderful experience. I will definitely hire these guys again. Thanks

Bhosphorous Noon package!. It was our 1st day at Istanbul & were surprised that this package could be organised at short notice within 2 hours of us landing . The support from the local team was fantastic & punctual. The guide was good with detailed updates on all the sites we visited.The Bhosphorous noon cruise was awesome! A fantastic kick start to our holidays..THANKS TO TRIP ADVISOR FOR MAKING IT A MEMORABLE ONE! .

Airport to Cruise Terminal Pickup and Return. We used this company for transfers from Istanbul airport to the Cruise Terminal on 30th September 2015 and return on the 12th October.It was easy to reserve via the internet and we received clear instructions. The service we received was brilliant and the vehicles were in very good condition.Our return pickup was exceptional especially when its so chaotic at the port. the staff did a very good job getting us away and to the airport.

Well worth the money. We took two tours with this company, a half-day tour and a full-day tour and both were well-organized, and reasonable for the services provided. I did extensive online research for Istanbul guides and found them to be very expensive. However, this company's tours were a good value for the money. On the full day tour, lunch at a hotel was included and it was a fine meal. The guides were well qualified, although it was sometimes difficult to understand their English. In the morning of the full-day tour, however, each person got a set of headphones to carry/wear as we sat on the bus and as we walked about. This was a very good system to insure that people at the back of the bus or on the outer ring of the crowd could hear. I highly recommend this company and suggest that you avoid private guides that will charge as much as $200 to $300 per day. We paid 118 Euros for two people for a full-day tour including lunch The tour covered the major sites in Sultanahmen (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, etc.) and also offered a wonderful ship tour of the Bosphorus.

History Comes Alive. I went on a full day tour of Istanbul and enjoyed it very much. Our guide was extremely knowledgeable and explained things so well that it was like walking back through time. He made history come alive and greatly added to the tour. I would go again!

A great half-day tour. This was a very well-organised tour. A bus picked us up from the hotel right on time and we then drove to an interchange point and transferred to the appropriate buses for the various tours. Our guide (sorry I can't remember his name) was very informative and made it interesting - not only for me but also for my 16 year old granddaughter (not an easy task). When we came to the end I was wishing I'd booked for the full-day!

Wouldn't use them again. The tour company kept us waiting for 40 minutes outside a hotel in Istanbul for a couple despite the passengers complaining. The couple did not bother to apologize. The tour guide was helpful and very nice. The lunch in a special ‘Mixed Grill Restaurant’ on Kirazlıyayla was appalling. I could not eat it and I am not that fussy. Another instance of the couple who kept us waiting ignoring the guide who told them not to take the chairlifts to the top as there was no time, so another wait for them. We saw the Mosque and Green Tomb in pouring rain, which was not the tour companies fault.We met some lovely people on the coach

Excellent Service from Airport to Hotel. They Know The Ins and Outs at The Airport!. This team really knows their craft. And if you have traveled to the airport in Istanbul, you know what I mean by craft. There is an art to getting your car and getting out of there in one piece! This team has a system that is well organized and clever. Excellent pricing and great value. I would only consider them for my future trips to Istanbul. We used them on our way in and out for two trips. Imagine my surprise when on the second trip the person looking for us at the airport recognized us by face! I know they see a lot of travelers. I was so impressed that they would remember us. Our drivers were great and we were very comfortable in the Sprinter Van!

Airport Transportation Service. This company runs an airport transportation service (istanbulairportstransfer.net) and it is excellent. I made at least 3 separate mistakes (!) in booking the service for Istanbul's SAW airport (arriving and departing). Each time I wrote I got prompt replies confirming the necessary changes. We were met courteously and did not wait more than 5-7 minutes for our ride. We sat around a table in the vehicle and enjoyed much-needed water, not to mention the air conditioning! Good driver and on time. I wouldn't hesitate to use this service again.

Good value tour. The tour bus collected from the hotel, an interesting trip to the Spice Market, and a scenic boat trip for around an hour on the Bosphorus. Back to the hotel, all with an interesting commentary from our guide. All for around £25.

Good cultural insight. The best thing about the tour, was definitely the bazar. Super cool to meet the locals. The boat trip was very interesting, but not as exciting as expected. If you are young girls with blonde hair, here is a little tip for you: Cover up. We were two blonde girls at the age of 21, we had just been to Alanya(party place), and there is a big cultural difference. We hadn't given it any thought, that they would treat us differently from Alanya. But they do. So cover up. These men cannot handle it, they don't know how to act so they get all nasty or all loving. But thats just istanbul. The tour was great! Although our guide kinda felt the same way as the rest of the men, and asked for our telephone numbers and sending us cheeky faces.. But it is also a little funny. Didn't ruin the trip at all.If there was something they should change, it should be the information about starting location. We didn't know that there was a location where trip began. It would have been way easier to just go there, instead of going to the hotel to get picked up and then going to the starting point.

Fantastic value. This was a real bargain. Istanbul is not an easy place to navigate and time for us was tight. Our guide was not only very knowledgeable, entertaining and charming but he was also a master of the tourist site logistics. The whole was went very smoothly and was most enjoyable
4 days tours. Really I recommended to book with themExcellent job was beautiful and went smooth Great job and keep it upSpecial thanks to Aaliyah the guide

Excellent tour. Very well organised tour - picked us up in the morning on time, the guide was very friendly and knowledgeable and all of the sites we visited were worth going - apart from the carpet shop which we had no interest in. A full day was a great way to see the city and learn about its rich culture and history.
superb guide. The tour was good and well organized.We were especially impressed by Aziz the tour guide, who was very competent and very helpful.

Day Trip to Troy. I took a day trip to Troy. Because of limited time and my itinerary, I could not do the full tour which included the ANZAC commemorative tour to Gallipoli. In spite of that, the tour company provided me with a guide, van and driver just for my personal use for the extended trip to Troy at no extra expense.I was very impressed with the company's courteous, professional service as well as the excellent guide.
day trip to Gallipoli. very well organised. great tour guide. full of information, long day, but worthwhile  lovely lunch spot ,right on the waterfront.

Great Tours in a Wonderful City. Istanbul Daily City Tours provide the opportunity to visit all attractions, with expert guidance. In particular, I appreciated the hotel pick up and drop off and the great lunches included in the day tours. I would recommend these tours to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Unforgettable trip. It was my first trip abroad destination istanbul lovely place i took the full day tour with adore tourism our guide was Mr mehmet sakir karadibek amazing guide with a lovely english accent big like to this guy he made our day keep up the good and professional work and of course i'll visit back istanbul and i'll do the same tour with no regrets at all

Gallipoli and Troy tour 2 days. Guides and driver very helpful and lovely. Well organised. Informative. For all age groups. Would highly recommend. The selected hostel for this tour was the only let down but might be the better hostels in Cannokale.
Good Service. Adore provided good services to their client.Always on time and driver's were very polite.Highly recommended!

Excellent!. Really good tour! We did an all day istanbul city tour and the bosphorus too. Both tours in spanish, all mini buses with air conditioning. They picked us up from the hotel in time. Friendly staff. Good cominication via email before the trip. I highly recommend it.

Istanbul Trip. Our was very impressed with the services offered by this company.Even though no money was exchange before my trip , all obligations and tours was prompt. Airport pickup and drop off was done with a comfortable vehicle alone and not crowd with other passengers. i will highly recommend using the services of this company. we used that for multiple tours.

Wonderful Tour in Istanbul, Turkey. I booked a tour with Istanbul Daily City Tour last June 19 ,2015 on the last day of my visit in Istanbul . It was a full day tour that included a Bosphorous cruise, lunch included in the tour , a visit to Dolmabache Palace, a tour at a leather factory outlet & a cable car ride. I had a great & wonderful experience on my tour. The tour company ( Istanbul Daily City Tour ) did a great job, everything went well & I recommend this tour company to everyone

Our Holiday. We had a great time,and Adore Tourism were fabulous, picked up on time ,even though we booked a couple of months beforehand,and were very courtious,would recommend their service to everyone.
Gallipoli Troy tour. I had an amazing two day tour to troy and gallipoli with this agency. The tour guides were very kind and knew many things. Recommend them!
Istanbul City Tour. It was a very informative and well organised tour. We saw everything that we wanted to see. The guide was helpful and he could speak English which is what we asked for.
Very good tour. It was on time I paid cach on the same day of our tour and organized, we were happy with them 😃 I went two trips to princes island, phosphorus with dolma bahrdhta castel.

Excellent tour but the size of the crowds took a big bite out of enjoyment. The visit to the Hagia Sophia Museum,, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace were the star attractions but even very early on a Saturday morning the crowds were daunting- to the point that enjoyment was hard to measure. The guide was utterly fantastic- his knowledge of Turkish history and frankly English was impressive. But, it became impossible to see a fraction of the sights. The visit to Topkapi Palace alone lasted about 2 and 1/2 hours but the queues for the Treasury and the Imperial Harem were each over 90 minutes- in the heat! We did not get in.
excellent. its smart. I am a random tourist, visited many cities. this facility gave me a sense of confidence and reliability. every thing was intime and disciplined.

ISTANBUL HERITAGE TOUr. My wife and I spent a magnificent time in Istanbul; We bought daily city tour from adore tour agency which calls Istanbul heritage tour. We saw Imperial blue mosque; Romans hippodrome and the grand bazaar of Ottomans. The tour package price was very reasonable and the service was great; the vehicle was clean and air-conditioned. I can say that the tour guy, his name Shakir, was knowledgeable person, and his pragmatic view of history comes from years of working experience.

Ottoman Tour and Bosphorus Tour. 2 excellent tours , one half day and one full day; Aziz our guide (sorry if spelled wrong) was truly excellent; so informative but also hugely entertaining. We feel we have learned so much in such a short time and had good fun too. Transfers to and from tours excellent, although be prepared to be dropped in some odd places, it is ok and guides mindful of where you need to return to. i would thoroughly recommend these tours and good value too. Thank you so much Aziz (hope Swiss lady didn't chop your head off!!!) from the Irvines

Disappointed. I went to Istanbul daily tours which consists of imperial and ottoman. Yes this kind of tours is up to guides. I'm very disappointed. His English is poor so I couldn't understand his explanation. Even native speakers agreed this. How did I feel? I'm not a native speaker! Furthermore the guide explained very very briefly - only when in bus and in front of attractions. Then he said see you 1 hour later.I don't understand why I spent money for this tour. It is both waste of money and time.

Private pickup from the airport. First i have to say that i am giving this company a high rate even thought i asked for a 3 baby seats and had only 2 on the way to the hotel and on the way back even after confirming with the company that at least on the way back they will provide 3 baby seats. Saying all that i give the company high rate because 1) the booking process online was fast organized and i received a detailed confirmation email 2) the driver was waiting in time and a representative of the company was at the arrival hall waiting 3) the car was new very clean and we were given water on arrival 4) most important the driver was very polite , drove safely and excellently .. 5) the price was good .. I would recommend this company

Great! . Was only in Istanbul for the weekend and it was a perfect trip we did 2 a group of college students 1. Heritage tour (I would most recommend) 2. Bosphourus The guides were great, the days were good didn't get too tired and everything was perfect didn't need to worry about anything!

Excellent Service!!!. booked through them online 2 times, the 1st time was 2 years ago me my fiance and a friend, we did 1 full day tour (istanbul heritage) and 1 turkish night (dinner on boat) we had an unforgettable time.the driver came exactly on time with no delay at all the heritage full day tour is a must for any traveler who wishes to visit istanbul now the best part of the tour was Sakir Karadibek he was the guide of our tour this guy is super professional with a perfect english, so friendly and sooooo helpful of which he was the reason we came back to istanbul 2 months ago and took the same tour with the same company (adore tourism) just to see Sakir back, u guys are great. keep up the good work!

Avoid booking from this company at all costs! . So, my first impression of this company was great - I booked the full-day Istanbul Heritage Tour and within minutes I received a confirmation E-mail of my booking and the pick-up time (8:15 am), which I thought was excellent. I'm a big fan of companies with strong online organisation and right away I was impressed by their level of service. However, they didn't turn out to be so great. The driver showed up 15 minutes earlier than the agreed time; we were still having breakfast at that time and were rushed to finish earing. On the way to the bus, my dad made a comment to the driver, who was very unwelcoming of feedback, about how he had arrived 15 minutes before the stipulated time. The driver just nodded and told us to get on the bus.After getting on the bus, we drove for at least 20 minutes to 2 different hotels in order to pick up the rest of the people in the tour.
