We then drove a further 10 minutes to pick-up the tour guide, whose name I believe was Çakir or Shakir, and an additional floc of tourists. In total, we had 20-25 tourists squeezed into one bus with barely any room to move around - I had to sit 2 chairs away from my family, next to a woman who also was sitting away from her family. To make things worse, the guide started handing in radio headsets, which you wear to hear the guide in places where there's significant noise. When I made the booking, I was under the impression that the company runs small-group tours. But now, I did not only have to squeeze through the dozens of tourists to find our guide, I had to wear an old piece of equipment which has been worn a hundred time just to hear his commentary. This takes me to the worst part of the tour - the guide himself. As I mentioned earlier his name was Çakir (or something along those lines). While his English was acceptable, half of the time I had to concentrate so hard in order to understand what he was saying. He was trying too hard to put on an American accent, but it was only making his speech harder to grasp. Our first destination was the Blue Mosque. Here's my biggest complaint: instead of focusing on the history and architecture of the mosque, which is what I expected to learn about especially that I'm a student in those fields, the guide focused solely on Islamic practices in the mosque, as if he was on a mission to convert us! He completely ignored the fact that different tourists might be interested in different aspects of the building and instead started preaching us about religion. I even started to notice that some tourists were losing interest. Next, he took us to Hagia Sophia. Again, he made no single reference to the architecture of the building and how it inspired generations of designers and focused instead on comparing Islam and Christianity, which I found was offensive and aggregating for the Christian tourists in the group. He spoke about the Iconic movement and how Christians destroyed places of worship. Perhaps his biggest derogatory comment was his statement that Christians are similar to certain hostile groups operating in the Middle East today. These comments should not have been made to a group that is not there to indulge in religious discussion, but rather to see the historical significance of the buildings they were seeing. After that, Çakir took us to the Grand Bazaar. Well, not really; before he even showed us where the bazaar was, he took us into a building that belongs to a company that sells Turkish hand-made rugs for a "demonstration". He promised that it'd take 15 minutes at max, but ended up taking 1 full hour! So here's my experience: if you'd like to give this company a shot, then go ahead but be weary of this specific guide. There's other companies that offer the same tour, but in groups of 9. I can assure you that you'd have much more fun and education (without your guide rambling on and on about religion) if you were to take one of those small group tours.

Excellent service . I booked through them for my Istanbul visit, from airport pickup, sightseeing to the airport drop, everything went so smoothly. I just did the booking from their web, they didn't charge anything for the booking, i was initially worried whether they would show up at the airport to pick me up, but they did come with my name in the card... And their price is also good. I would recommend them to anyone who is planning their tour in Istanbul.

Excellent quality/price ratio. We took 2 tours with Adore - one 8h full city tour and one 4h cruise to Bosphorus tour, plus to and fro airport transfer. Everything was very well arranged, on-time, the guides were very friendly, comprehensive, helpful and funny. The buses, minibuses and boat very comfortable. Prices are very good for this level of service. We recommend it 100%!

First class service from Adore Tours, specially from Mr Ozaktas the manager. Before flying to Istanbul, I managed to arrange (from home, through email exchanges) all of our Istanbul tours, as well as a return taxi service from and to Sabiha Gokcen airport. I liked that the tours I could just book, with no credit card details given - we paid on the day of the tours. The tours also included free lunch. The shuttle (to pick us up from the hotel) always came within 15 min of the indicated pickup times. The tours were all great, the tour guides were particularly impressive, very knowledgeable, very hardworking people, they took their job seriously. We learnt a lot from them. The taxi service from the airport to Istanbul and then later back was very impressive. They waited for us at the airport with a sign with my name on it. The cars were high end cars, spotless, driver safe courteous. Over the period of the preparations and our stay there (in Istanbul) I must have sent a dozen emails to Mr Mehmet Ozaktas, general manager of Adore Tours, either asking questions, or modifying taxi pickup times. He always replied within a few hours and arranged what I asked for. Truly excellent customer service. I would use Adore tours again.

I would like to thank Adore for all the Tour arrangements; all the tours were on time and the guides were good. I had booked tours for Istanbul & Cappocodia thro Adore; the tours were well arranged, good guides and on time. Adore also takes the money only when you start the tour, which is unique. The airport transfers were also good.

Good and honest. I have an hour city tour with cars of this Institute. They are really kind.prices are real.driver was ontime (even came sooner and wait for us about half an hour)Driver was so kind and friendly. Furthermore he was a good and expert photographer and rook very nice picture from us and sceneries for us.i definitely advise you to choose them if you have short time and want to see more and more of istanbul.

Great daily city tour in Istanbul!. Last Saturday 23 May 2015 my friends and I joined a full-day “Istanbul Heritage Tour” of Istanbul Daily City Tours. We had a great day and we were very happy with the organization of this tour. It was done professionally. We were pleased with our English-speaking guide Ilker. His interesting stories carried us back in time to those historical moments of the Ottoman Empire. Thanks to Ilker and his professional and friendly attitude towards the tourists made our day unforgettable. I definitely recommend this tour and will take it again if I go another time to Istanbul.

Punctuality and friendly. I have book for my very first trip to Istanbul airport pick via Adore my family and I was very satisfied with the warm welcome and we booked with them day tour for three days as well airport drop the drivers are very polite despite challenge with English language , I was impress every thing is well organized and the price were very reasonable . I recommend their service to those who don't know their way in Istanbul like us . If ever happen that I visit Istanbul once again I sure use their service.

private airport transport and heritage tour. We were collected at airport our flight had been delayed but it was no problem journey to hotel took a while as we hit rush hour traffic.Return to airport really quick as not much traffic driver was on time minibus was clean and spacious cannot fault the service.The driver collected us on time from hotel,our guide throughout the tour was knowledgeable and helpful and very efficient. Loved the earphones and his red brolleythat he had e veryone following excellent meal the day was value for money.

Private Airport transfer. I booked this on line wondering if it was 'for real'. But they said I paid when I got there, so really didn't have anything to lose. Well, they were there, on time waving a sign with our names, and the transfer was what they said - a private transfer in a luxury mini van. No running around dropping people off here and there.
AMAZING EXPERIENCE!. Had a wonderful & memorable trip.... Highly recommend it! This was the second time I travelled with them... very good staffs and amazing tours!!

Don't ever book hotel transfer. I Booked a driver for the day which was pretty good accept that they said I would get a driver that speaks English. This driver didn't speak any English.I also booked a hotel transfer with them for 5:15am in the morning. 5 minutes before they had to pick up they phoned me on the hotel phone where I stayed and told me that I entered the wrong pickup location and that the fair will now be double the amount (yet they know which hotel to phone me on). This was a very cheap trick of profiting a business. They knew we had a plane to catch and we had to get to the airport so they tried their luck. If like they said we put the wrong hotel in, how did they know to contact us on the hotel that we stayed in, why only phone us 5 minutes before pickup and they knew exactly where we stayed since we booked a trip with them 2 days before that!! Luckily our hotel organized us another taxi for a 5th of the price.
Daily city tour. We were happy to go around covering places as mentioned and were very prompt in picking and dropping. Good lunch was provided. Overall very satisfying.
nice experience. tours are very well organized. the driver came on time.. we had lunch in a very nice cozy restaurant with superb food.. we super loved the experience..

Istanbul day tour. The tour was average but the tour guide was good. My average rating is because I was dropped off some distance from my hotel although the tour says customers will be picked up and dropped of at their hotels
Enjoyable and hassle-free experience. Fantastic guide, very well organised, excellent effeciency, hassle-free, convenient payment options and ample free time to enjoy the sights on your own.

excellent service and trusted commitment. I made booking for 5 tours on line without any advance payment. There were problems on pick up and drop because the hotel was far from Istanbul City center. The service team led by Mr. Tariq sorted out the problem and a private car with driver came to hotel on time to pick up us to the tour bus without extra charges because they were committed to the booking price. The same was for all the 5 tours.

Good Service. Booked transfers from and to Sabitha Gokcen Airport for our very recent stay in Istanbul. Did quite a bit of research beforehand (and was happy to pay more for a better service) as we had a very unpleasant experiences with a different company when we went to Bodrum, Turkey a few years ago.On the whole really pleased with this service and would book them again. I have not given an excellent rating for two reasons:- we were kept waiting when we arrived for about 20 minutes - admittedly our plane was late and it took us ages to get through passport control etc. We were just told to go and sit over by a cafe but it was not explained what we were waiting for. We were tired and thirsty and somehow it wasn't a nice welcome - however, the journey then to our hotel was absolutely fine and the little bottles of water supplied were just what we needed- the driver on the return journey spent a lot of time on the phone (holding to his ear) so therefore driving with one hand on the steering wheel. Why can't they have a hands free device fitted? Would be so much safer.Despite these two negatives, the service is good, the drivers polite and carry your luggage. The uniform and whole image is one of professionalism.

AS EXPECTED AND MORE. They picked me from the airport with a van car, clean and big enough. waited for me in the airport till I purchased a new sim card with no complain.After I tried different tour company for one day I really made a mistake so decided to go back to ADORE and this is what I did. I used ADORE for all my trip on line. just make your reservation one day ahead and in one second you recieve a conformation with no phone calls. They are punctual and with good rate and excellent employees , well trained.THANKS ADORE FOR EXCELLANT service. Next time fro sure I will try again ADORE

Excellent transfer service. We used the airport transfer services provided by this company and it was very good. There was someone at arrivals waiting for us and everything went smoothly. The return was pre booked and the driver was there promptly and took us a different route which gave us a nice view of some sites we had missed.

Great Tour Agency and Great Guides!. My wife and I had a short stay in Istanbul and wanted to see as much as possible so we booked airport transfer, two full day tours and one night tour with Adore Tourism. We normally don't group tour when traveling but on this visit our need for efficient and predicable outcomes was a must. We are so glad that we choose Adore Tourism. The inside staff (Tariq and Mehmet) were incredibly responsive and the guides ( Sakir and Aziz) were amazing! If you don't have a lot of time to stumble around or if you like group touring we would highly recommend this efficient and cost effective company!

Istanbul Visit. Excellent service on both inbound and outbound transfer to hotel in central Istanbul. Easy to book, detailed confirmation emails, with added value offers. Super clean and spacious vehicle and friendly and knowledgeable driver who knew his routes very well indeed to try and beat the traffic.Also super value for money against hotel transfer cost.If you want a professional, personal safe service then I recommend you only consider Adore, one of the best companies I have used in over 30 years on International travel.

Wonderful istanbul city tour.. I had a wonderful & comfortable vacation in istanbul, all that because i booked via the internet 3 tours with istanbul-daily-city-tour.The tour operator were on time. The tours were well organised. The itinerary was great, so was our guide who spoke English very well. We really had fun & i am happy that i deal with istanbul daily city tour.

Heritage full-day tour. Via the internet I booked a day-tour at this provider. My hotel is situated quite outside the city center but I was properly picked-up on time and also returned there as well.The itinerary was great, so was our guide who spoke English very well. We also had lunch which worked fine, too - nothing to complain about.The only thing on the criticism side would be that the tour is fast-paced - so the speed of walking around is I would say above-average. We did of course not "run" but don't expect lots of time for photo stops (e.g. you spend max 10 minutes in the mosques). The reason for this is the very good itinerary which covers lots of spots - so there is a trade-off between "seeing many things" and "spending time", since the overall tour time is only around 3hrs (in the morning, and then after lunch once again). But for me the tour-pace was compeltely fine.Definitely I can recommend the tour and would book there again.
Reliable taxi transfer. I used this service to pick me up from the airport and to take me there for my return flight. It was a very reliable service.

Airport Transportation Service. If you require transportation service between Istanbul and either of this city's major airports, you should contact and use Adore Tourism. The company has safe, punctual drivers; relatively new vehicles; and a very professional general manager.My wife, daughter, and I recently travelled from the Gulf Region to Istanbul for a five day trip. Prior to commencing this trip, I contacted several airport transportation services in Istanbul via the Internet. The General Manager of Adore Tourism, Tarik Ozaktas, impressed me by his timely and informative email responses. Unlike the other companies, Tarik's messages also made sense and demonstrated genuine professionalism.Tarik delivered on all of his promises. Moreover, when I needed him to revise previous plans based on changes in my family's schedule, Tarik readily adapted and implemented required actions. He also offered prices that are less than a commercial taxi and a comfortable van that is considerably larger than a commercial taxi.Bottom Line: If I ever travel to Istanbul again and require ground transportation, I will seek Tarik's assistance.
Thanks !!. very well istanbul daily tour. We are happy this experince Mr.Tarik help us our booking and tour He is interesting all about tour information..

Very well organised. I had a wonderful & comfortable vacation in istanbul, all that because i booked Taxi from airport-hotel & hotel-airport in addition 3 full days tours with istanbul-daily-city-tour. First,The taxi & tour operator were absolutely on time.Secondly, the tours were well organised, with good tour guides. We really had fun & i am happy that i deal with istanbul daily city tour.

Airport to Airport. Adore provided a very efficient transfer service for me from one airport to the other. The two airports are on different sides of the Bosporus and Istanbul traffic is horrendous! The driver was excellent and did everything possible to get me to my connecting flight - which I managed with about 20 mins to spare!

Adore Tours. I booked a taxi on arrival and on departure from Hotel Swiss-o-tel Bosphorus on the Internet before arrival. Similarly, I booked tours while in Istanbul on the Internet. I am pleased to state that I did not have to make a single phone call or reminder though the bookings were done about a month in advance. Taxis and the tour operator were absolutely on time.Secondly, the tours were well organised, with good tour guides.My wife and I were a couple, and both are senior citizens.

Nicely arranged interesting tours. I booked 5 tours online from home country and paid during the trips. There was pick up&drop problem because the hotel was far. The reservation team solved the problem and I found all my booked trips well arranged without any failure. That is in addition to friendly tour guides. Thanks to Tariq and Mehmet in reservation team

Heritage All Day Tour of Istanbul. We thoroughly enjoyed our day-long tour of Istanbul. The tour guides were fantastic – knowledgeable and helpful. The sites we visited were amazing. I was grateful for the explanations of the Blue Mosque, St Sophia and the Coliseum. The tour around the Bosporus was informative and fun. It was a day well spent. I would recommend the Heritage tour to anyone.

Very well organised. We were picked up close to the port and our cruise ship. The minibus then took us to a central meeting place where we were all transferred to buses for the individual tours we had booked. It was accomplished very easily and was well organised. Our tour consisted of the Spice Market and Bosphorus - it was interesting and our guide did give us very good tips about buying different items and spices at the Spice Market. All in all would recommend this tour - easy to arrange online and no hicups. Also the guide was happy to drop us off wherever we wanted to go. Excellent service.

Recommended Istanbul Tour. We took the half day "Imperial" tour, that should have taken in the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, St Sophia, and the Grand Bazaar. However, it was a Sunday, when the Grand Bazaar was closed, so a carpet "demonstration", more like a very soft sales pitch, was substituted. That was a bit of a disappointment, and it would have been better if this had been indicated beforehand so that we could have rearranged to another day.The guide we had was excellent. His English was perfect, and and he kept us very well informed throughout about what we were seeing plus plenty of background material on Turkish history, current politics, and even about forthcoming sporting events involving Turkish and British football teams! The length of the tour was just right for us. There was an option to add on a lunch and an afternoon tour, but we declined this. For others I think the full day would have been perfect.My wife made the mistake of not having suitable head covering for visiting the mosques. This was little problem as there were plenty of people selling shawls, but a word of warning in the tour description would have been helpful.All in all, we would recommend the tour.

Great Istanbul Tour!. We made all arrangements online and was surprised that everything turned out great. Bus was clean and the tour guide was very knowledgeable. Our tour included stops at Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, a carpet shop, lunch (delicious!) and a boat tour of the Bosphorus (quite a pleasant tour). Istanbul is a fascinating city and there is no way to see it all in one day! The only thing which was included was the Grand Bazaar that we did not have time for...

Excellent Airport Transfer. We pre-booked with Adore transfers from and to Ataturk Airport on both occasions the service wasexcellent . Our driver was waiting when we arrived at the airport and took us immediately to our hotel.On our return our driver was there waiting at the Cruiseport at 6.30am to take us back to the airport.We would recommend them to anyone visiting Istanbul.

VIP Airport transfer and rent a car with driver. I just wanted to say that we had as a driver Mr. Murat during our stay in Istambul and he was fantastic to us!!!!.I highly recommend him to any tourists as a rent a car driver for half day or full day as well as airport transfer driver.Thanking you for a wonderful service.Mr. &Mrs. López

Fantastic day!. We had an amazing full day Istanbul tour, extremely we organised!Our guide, Ilker, was amazing! His English was perfect and his knowledge of sites visited was fantastic.  He relayed the information in an easy and very interesting way, with humourous stories to go along.Your tour is well worth recommending!Thank you again for making this day extremely memorable!

very unprofessional. I arranged a tour and the guy on the phone, tarik tells me to be in the lobby at 8am, and they will pick us up at 8:15 - 8:30 am. at 7:45 am the lobby calls us and informs us that the guide is waiting. when we get down at 7:55am the guide has already left. very unprofessional wouldn't recommend them.

Most helpful !!. A big thank you to Mr. Mehmet. Before I landed in Turkey, he had confirmed everything without even payments, the airport transfers and tours to Bursa and Princess Island was excellent. He was always available on phone to hear and suggest. The trip to troy can be avoided. We really enjoyed everything!!! and will contact them again.My suggestion would be to have more upscale options if someone wants luxury experiences.

Gallipoli. It was the highlight of my trip. I was picked up on time at my accommodation - friendly service - travelling on my own got the front passenger's seat - great views - wifi. Great group of people to travel with - highly recommend.

Informative and Extremely well organised. Excellent Guide. Excellent English Guide (Mehmet). Knew the history of the city and history of all the sites. Very well organised tours. Pick up from the hotel and then the tour of Beautiful Istanbul. This was our first trip and we had booked the tours online (a bit hesitant). I am glad we booked on line. Everything was as we had read in the reviews. Get to know Istanbul first and then explore at your leisure. It was so good that we did all our Istanbul Tours with them. I give then 10/10.

A nice trip and a good admenstrator. We reserved a one day trip to Bursa through trip advisor as the price was the cheapest one and the program was very clear. First, everything written was correct except the return time. It was written that we will be back at 8 pm but actually we were in our hotel at 3 am in the morning.We enjoyed the trip and our host was very nice , helpful but a little bit stiff sometimes and noisy.I think the price was still high than the real cost of the trip or if you try to do it by yourself.

Tour of Istanbul. The whole day was well organised from start to finish. We were on a cruise ship visiting Istanbul.The pick up, very close to the port gate. was on time and we were assured that we would be dropped off before 5.00 pm - our latest time for boarding. We visited the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Grand Bazaar in the morning. Lunch was taken in a smart hotel. We then visited the Rustem Pasha Mosque - a real delight - before touring the Topkapi Palace.Our guide was very knowledgeable and took good care of all of the party.We were delivered back to the ship in good time.This was our first tour booked in a foreign country on the internet and we were a little concerned as to how it would work. We needn't have worried; it was excellent. Thoroughly recommend it.

Very fast service. Needed a private driver to go from Sabiha Gokcen to Ataturk. Easy, staff and driver were waiting when I arrived. Driver didn't speak English, I don't speak Turkish, but good thing we both kinda spoke German.
Good tour of Istanbul. Now that I have been, I would recommend a walking tour instead. But this was a good tour; above all, our guide got us into the Blue Mosque and Hafia Sophia quickly.
Great overall tour. If you have one day in Istanbul, I would recommend this tour as it insightful & informative. Guides are friendly & courteous. 5/5

Gallipoli Day trip. The tour was very informative and well worth it. I unfortunately allowed someone else to organize a trip I had wanted to do for years and as they had done it before they only allowed 1 day which was 18 hours in length - Istanbul to Istanbul. Far too long - 10 hours traveling was hard work. I would recommend overnight so that you are not wrecked by the experience and appreciate it for the place that it is.Excellent vehicles, excellent drivers and an excellent guide. Bonus was it was non-smoking! Good company and would recommend them.
Worth the time and money. The tour guides are very professional and knowledgeable. The tour was well organized, the entrance to the Hagia Sophia was included and a lunch was included.

Great City - Choose your Tour Carefully. After a late start due to combining various groups from a variety of hotels, we set off. The traffic made viewing from the bus difficult, but we did the obvious sights such as Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Castle in a rather frenzied way. However, we were shepherded into a carpet warehouse which took precedence over the visit to the Grand Bazaar which we were left to "discover" unaided. The carpet presentation was a complete waste of time and presumably held to gain commission for the guide. Istanbul is a wonderful city, so choose your tour company very CAREFULLY.

Istanbul Heritage Tour & Bosphorous Cruise. Adore Tourism was prompt to reply, I booked the afternoon Bosphorous cruise on that morning itself and they replied promptly and advised us where to wait for the bus. I think for those staying in area outside old city should consider this as they provide pick up service nearer to where your hotel is. For us that stayed in Taksim Square, this service is much appreciated.Bosphorous Cruise cost 29euros and the Istanbul Heritage Tour costs 59euros, both are relatively cheaper than those I have researched on (usually 35euros and 70 euros respectively)Bosphorous cruise is just something leisure where we cruise along the Bosphorous which seperates the Asia and Europe of Turkey. Before the cruise, we were brought to the Spice Market, just took a short walk and took some pictures, did not really have much time to shop but it is fine with us.Istanbul Heritage tour is a whole day tour which covers a number of sites such as The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sohpia, Grand Bazaar etc etc... The time in grand bazaar was relatively short, not much time to shop as well. But some requested to be dropped off at Grand Bazaar after the tour and the guide gladly agreed. Nothing really fanciful at grand bazaar so we were ok with the time given (about 30 minutes)Lunch provided was mediocre, try to avoid ordering drinks from the restaurant you were brought to as it can be quite expensive (7TL for a can of drink)All in all the tours are fine

nice tours of Istanbul area. I reserved several things through Istanbul Daily City Tours: airport transfers, a tour of Istanbul, and a day excursion to Troy. All were quite good, though perhaps things could be a little better organized at times. It would be easier to prepay the airport transfers, as the ground personnel do not have change, but I was not offered this option. My Istanbul guide was very good; the guide at Troy OK. In both cases, communication from the company could have been clearer. I was picked up in the morning at my hotel by drivers with no English, so it was initially not clear where we were going. I also think the Troy and Gallipoli tours could be organized a little more tightly; if they were, a tour to Troy could last from 7 am to 10 pm, for instance, rather than 6:30 am to 11:30 pm. But these are minor matters. On the whole, the tours were good and fairly well organized.

Bursa -another view of Istanbul. The trip was amazing compared to price,nice guide and nice to see other side of Istanbul,we even went skiing in the mountains, picnic was Turkish,different,but nice way to do it.So from hot to cold,and back,lots of interesting views over many hours.Trip will stay forever in my mind

fantastic well organised monlight cruise. we made reservation through internet, and with no pre payment. We were picked up from our hotel, and they went to some others to pick others as we were only 4, the trip at night as fantastic, and the reception at the boat too was gorgeous. Plenty of dishes to choose, the tour lasted 4 hours.. This was not a turistic tour there were many locals who participated in the dances, and it was so turkish simply amasing, to see the belly dancers being defied by other local dancers, all dances were typically turkisk and the best. The entertainers were fabulous.
Great option all around. Highly recommend! Great price, great guide, will definitely recommend to everyone and use them again!

A pleasant evening on board. The shuttle bus picked us up right on time. On board of the ship we were assigned seats and we got a welcome drink. The meal buffet was already prepared and we could start dining right away. It was a good buffet with Turkish food; the only remark I would make is that the food could have been a bit warmer. Drinks were served promptly on demand, no matter how often you would call the servant or go to the bar yourself. There was comment and explanation on every sight we sailed by; the acoustic quality of the sound system however was poor, which made it very hard to understand everything. The entertainment program was amusing, but not every act was of the same quality. However one cannot complain too much on a program with a magic show, singing and dancing. The belly dancer was charming and showed some great interaction with the (male) spectators. All in all I certainly would recommend this evening for a night out in Istanbul.

Nice spend of time,but minimum information. As a guide myself I wish to say that information we got from this "excursion" equals 0. The only u pay for is for stay in comfortable bus and nice boat. Alone in Istanbul without knowledge of turkish language,using taxi service or public transport would make us much more tired for same money. But it is not an excursion....so bring guide books with you ))))

Beautiful city, just OK tour guide. Very easy to book the 1 day tour. They picked us up early ( 8am), but then we went to another location to wait for other people and other bus...it took around 1.30 min while everything was ready to start. Istanbul is an amazing city, however the tour guide was just ok. I dont recall his name ( he didnt do anything extraordinary to remember him), just remembered he studied in the US. He didnt transmit anything, just talked, explained and shared some facts..maybe my expectations were higher than what he had to offer. A city like Istanbul deserves an enthusiastic, dynamic and reachable tour guide. I dont think I would use this company again for a tour. The visit to a carpet's store....totally uninteresting. Lunch ( included), was in a nice place, but nothing to die for, I would have prefered to pay more and get more as well.

Great people!. I had only one full day in Istanbul, and wanted to see as much as possible. The tour guides were knowledgable, friendly, polite and very accommodating. The Bosphorus and City Tours were well organised and fascinating. I also highly recommend using their airport pick up service as it is economical and reliable.
took 2 tours - daily istanbul with all the sights and bosphorous .5 day.. Our 2 guides were terrific! Pleasant, informative and very professional. On time, too. Highly recommend it!

Not good. As we were staying up the street from the hagia Sopia and Blue Mosque we were picked up early and picked up others along the way, then found ourselves other side of city to transfer and wait for another bus to go right back to where we were, a complete waste of time. It took over an hour to get there and then no one knew which bus to go on tour and we wasted another 30minutes finding right bus and leaving to go back to where we came from. The guide was informative but the two hours we wasted on pick ups and transfers was frustrating to say the least. Towards the end we then went to a carpet presentation which we didn't want as we wanted to see the city. It was supposed to end up showing us the bazaar which we thought would at least take us in for a quick look and point us in right direction. Instead guide showed us how to walk up to bazaar and check out by our selves, because we didn't want to do the carpet place.

OK but lots of time wasted. We booked a ½ day tour which included the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. The tour guide was friendly and knowledgeable, the busses were fine and everything was on time. At the end we were taken to a carpet sales presentation which was kind of interesting and – big compliment here – there was no pressure on us to buy anything. But nevertheless I would have preferred to see more of the city than sitting in a carpet shop.What we did not like is that it took almost 1 hour to tour through the city to pick up the other guests from their hotels. Then we were taken to a meeting point where it took almost another 40 min to distribute all people onto the correct busses. This was utter chaos and I had to ask several staff members several times until we found the right bus. The actual tour time was less than the rest (pick up time, waiting time and carpet sales).I booked a private tour the next day from a different company and that was tailor made for us and not much more expansive than this organised tour with a huge group.

Istanbul. Booking on line always begs the question, will someone actually pick us up? And they did, right on time. Once we were assembled with others the guide and driver were full of information about sites we were to visit. Our visit to the historical site were very busy as there were four cruise ships in port. However our guides were able to skirt around some of the line ups with prebooked entry tickets. The small air conditioned coaches were comfortable and able to manouver through traffic. Our first impression of Istanbul was "wow". This being our first trip to Istanbul we were impressed by the road side flowers that were everywhere. Our historical city tour of two continents was amazing and will be etched in our memory forever. Thanks to Adore Tourism and Tarik Ozaktas for arranging a wonderful day in Istanbul.

Excellent. I would definately advice my family and friends to contact this tour as it is more reliable and would save time and money.they were very honest and trust worthy. Our guide Mr Aziz was very kind and friendly person. We would definately contact them again if we go back to istanbul in our next trip.was a wonderful experience.

Tour to Princess Island. I booked the tour on line. Booking and confirmation was efficient.We were picked up at the appointed time.Guide professional and courteous.Princess island amazing BUTTTTTT ....... the horse carriage tour over the island was disastrous.Its something I will never forget! The two horses pulling our carriage were both in near 'death' condition. They were very badly cut from lack of food, lack of care, and a very hard harness that cut deep into their skin as they were skin over bone due to lack of care.. They were actually bleeding from their sores and their cuts...... IFFFFF I had seen this beforehand, I would NEVER ever have taken this tour. At the half way point on a very steep hill, there was a 10min stop, for the horses to be rested and watered......The driver did neither and had a coffee himself,.To be honest, i was disgusted and the worst case of animal abuse to date.This was reported to Adore Travel, and driver carriage advised. If anything was done by them, I have no idea. Even writing this and thinking about it, gives me the shivers.No money or tourism is worth this surely?!It left a very bad taste in my mouth every time I think of Adore and this particular tour.

Topkapi, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. We toured on two separate days. Day one was the Topkapi museum and the Rustem PashaMosque. Day two was the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. Our guide was knowledgeable andhelpful. His presentations were informative and interesting. Our only problem was the buses as we had to picked up and then switched to a second bus for the actual tours. This process wastes time better spent at the sites. However, we both are planning to return at a future date.

Convenient and Friendly. I only had 2 days in Istanbul and wanted to see as much as possible so I booked the full day Bosphorus curise and Asian side tour. I was picked up at my hotel on time in a small van and then we picked up 8-10 other people then went to a central meeting location to be distributed into the correct tour group. The full day group was in a large bus and we started at the Spice Market where he had an hour. That was not enough time for me but it was good to have an introduction to it. The Bosphorus curise was interesting and it was nice to see the shoreline and there was narration in English, French and German. After that we went to a restaurant that had a nice view of the city and was actually good food - normally tour food is not so great. Then we crossed the bridge to the Asian side to see a park with a view and a lovely palace. The tour guide was very informative and friendly.

Affordable and Satisfied. They're tour price is very affordable, their charge much less compared to other tour company. Im very much satisfied with the tour we booked. We actually booked a bosphorus night cruise and a full day istanbul classic tour. We loved it!

Bosphorus Cruise. This was a great tour and our guide May was excellent. The Spice Market was fascinating and May gave us a bonus visit to the adjacent mosque which was super. The highlight though was the Cruise which was really memorable. May could not have been more helpful. Our only niggle was that the pick up from the cruise port was delayed as our transport was parked outside the terminal but we found it eventually with help from the tour company HQ. We really maximised our morning in Istanbul.
Delivered as promised !. The three tours booked with Adore Tourism were more than perfect:  - pick up time: as promised. - guides: professional. - value of money: okay. - no hidden expenses.

Great !. I booked airport transfer, full day Istanbul tours and Bosphorus tour with Dolmabahce Palace, and everything was great. Launch was OK, guide speak English excellent. Recommended for all who want to see Istanbul in short time...

Love the sights!. The tour could have been more interesting! Limited information on sights visited. We have read so much on it in guide books. We had to ask to get the information out of our guide!
Restaurant where lunch was offered with this tour was clean with fresh food & lovely seaview setting however service was a hit & miss!

Great trip truogh Bosphorus. We were only in Istanbul for a short time so could only manage to go on the half day city tour and cruising trough Bosphorus. The pick up was very prompt and from the second we met our guide we knew it was going to be a great day. We visited the little bazzar, and Mosque, and then we went to Bosphorus cruising tour wich was amazing. Our guide was professional and very enthusiastic about showing us what Istanbul has to offer. As we went on Bosphorus and see the boath for our trip we have been delithed. The boath was big, new and luxury and it was cruise for all time remember. We were only sorry that we could not extend our time and visit more of Istanbul's treasures! We will definitely be back to Istanbul and will look forward to going on more organised tours with this company. Best regards!

Great Ground Transportation Service!. We had a great experience working with Adore Tourism. They are extremely response to last minute changes and wonderful to work with. The staff is nice and very accommodating. I would highly recommend them :)

1/2 day Istanbul tour. Unfortunately we were only in Istanbul for a short time so could only manage to go on the half day city tour. The pick up was very prompt and from the second we met our guide we knew it was going to be a great day. We visited the Blue Mosque and The Hagia Sophia - breathtaking! Our guide was knowledgeable, professional and very enthusiastic about showing us what Istanbul has to offer. As we went on a Sunday the Bazaar was closed but this did not spoil our enjoyment of the day. We were only sorry that we could not extend our time and visit more of Istanbul's treasures! We will definitely be back to Istanbul and will look forward to going on more organised tours with this company. Thanks!

Too much wasted time!. Staying in a hotel very close to the main tourist sites we did not appreciate being picked up at 08:15 to spend an hour touring round other hotels to end up where we started! Especially when our body clocks were two hours behind (i.e. it was 06:15). The tour was good but the food at lunchtime was awful. I would rather pay a supplement for a better choice - even the tour guide had better meal!

Quite informative and reasonable value. Value tours. Pick up was as agreed at the hotel, a bit too much waiting around while other pick ups joined at the start point.Tour guides were knowledgable , informative and all had reasonable sense of humour.Weather was shocking, cold and wet, but this was beyond the tour company's control.Overall good value and we would recommend them.

Excellent trip. The trip very well organized - They came on time to join us to the meeting pointThey started on timeTour guide was super (very informative, cooperative, good english speaking and friendly)Next time i will choose again with another plan or places in Istanbul
Amazing City & Experience. Value for money, nice trip to discover to Istanbul. Higly recommended (well organized, worked on time, gentle driver)

Holiday in beautiful Istanbul. It was a holiday with my friends and very pleased to be here in Istanbul. Really very professional and in the mean time very joyfull service. Drivers who do the transfers and the guides who do the excursions very friendly. They showed us all the beauty of Istanbul. Thanks to all of them. I advise everybody who visit here to enjoy.

The effort is not the biggest. Let's say it is ok that they pick you up at your hotel... But Istanbul is such a big city with full of places and tour is quite sad... Why? they dont show you many things but instead they take you to a building where you have to stay an hour listening to a guy selling carpets and jewels... pure luxury... obviously the guide takes comission... so sad, an hour lost for commercial interest... is nothing traditional, nothing special like a market,... is a luxury building where they sell carpets worldwide and guide has comission.Sad.

One day trip to Bursa. It was a great experience with excellent tour female guide. The bus was comfortable. Staff was on time for pick up and hospitable. The trip price was reasonable. They did very good service overall.

''excellent princess islands''. silence on the island, authentic phaetons, historic houses fascinated me ...
i m very pleased, thank you to everyone..( driver, guide , office staff )

Unforgettable impressions. After visiting different European cities, we decided to visit Istanbul. I didn't think that this city can eclipse such beautiful cities as Prague or Paris, but it was exactly so. I love this city!!! I can recommend to take excursions from Adore Tourism . Their guides are very professional, all excursions are according to the schedule, comfortable buses with air condition. Next time I think to go to Istanul for a week - there are so many places that I i haven`t visit yet. See you there)
Good tour!. This tour is very good. Beautiful places, nice bus, write time. The tour by Istambul show the beautiful city that it is: europe size, asia size, mesquitas, etc.

Super, helpfully and budget tour. i would like to say that city tour service excellent the drivers, guide and back up team where all %100 we recommend to anyone who is traviling to istanbul. Istanbul is really very nice city...

Would definitely advise against using this tour company. I was in Istanbul recently for the weekend only and wanted to take advantage of using a tour company to get an enjoyable experience from a tour company to give me some insights and make my experience of Istanbul even more interesting.I chose the DOLMABAHCE PALACE & YILDIZ ROYAL GARDEN 1/2 day tour. The guide that we had for this tour was rude - not to me personally - but definitely to some of the guests in our group. As an example when the group were moving between rooms in the Palace one member at the back of the group asked nicely if he wouldn't mind waiting for the full group to arrive into the room before he started explaining what was in that room. He responded by saying "I've been doing this for 20 years - I think I know what I'm doing". Which came as a bit of a surprise. The other thing about this tour is that they include a "fashion show" as part of the tour - which is just dodgy and seedy and then they take you on to the shop floor to buy the leather jackets from the fashion show at "amazing" super discounted prices. I was dumbstruck that a tour that I had paid for the service of were actually forcing me through a fashion show and to try and get me to purchase their goods. If it had been a free tour then I wouldn't have thought much of it - I've had these kind of things thrown at me before, but for a paid tour this was completely unexpected.Also the trip as a half day trip was advised to be 3 hours. In total it was 5 hours because the last 1.5 hours were spent in the fashion show and leather shop. Luckily I wasn't relying on the 3 hours to catch a plane, but it did leave it a little close for me.I did love Istanbul though and seeing the Dolmabahce Palace was a wonderful expereince.

Istanbul, perfect city, good experience. We had a good experience in Istanbul and saw all historical places,Everything was amazing, Our guide helped and detaily informed us about all things.They made what they promised. Hotel tranfer service is worked on time.Thanks for everything.....
Hidden gem. Far from tourists and giant busses, if you come to this mosque, complete silence will fall upon you. Small and historical, it is quite great I felt great for coming there.
A small historical mosque. This is a small historical church that was converted into a mosque after the conquest of Constantinople. A good place to visit.
Amazing Place . Really amazing and awesome and shows the greatest history of Islam. Lovers of arts they will like this place a lot

Exquisite . This 'small but perfectly formed' ex-church and now mosque was empty when we arrived and it was an extremely peaceful time that we had examining and enjoying the beauty of it - well worth a visit.

Very nice church. vey close to arasta bazar. The former church - now tzami- is very nice in the interior. Simple but elegant. With big but delicate marble stylus- called kionokrana. The outside of the church reminds so much Agia Sofia. Very well preserved. After visiting the church walk around to the neighborhood. Old but very beautiful buildings. Aroma of another era.
islamic architecture and Christians architectury come together.. I love this place because it was a church that changed to a mosque. The paintings that was belongs to byzantine was great.

Small Ayia Sophia. I believe that is the name on the map. It is worth the visit if you have some extra time. Few visitors there so not crowded. You might get the (payed and unplanned) tour by an old man speaking pretty good english and quite knowledgable of the history of the church and not only.

Tranquil hidden gem. Had fantastic days going to little hidden site which is older than the Ayasofya. Not many tourist know about it so there was no hussle or bussle, beautiful set and mantained excellent tranquil place to visit.

Beautiful building and peaceful area.. I stayed quite near tho this place. Almost each prayer time, i came here to pray. It used to be a church before converted to mosque. The people who come here to pray i guess they stay nearby. The imam and the jemaah were very nice and welcoming. Love the interior wall decoration.
BEAUTIFULL ARCHITECTURE. The place is great to visit, and shows a lot of mixture between CHRISTIAN and ISLAMIC architecture. you need to buy your ticket to enter and wait in along row of visitors .

Amazing. This is like a small replica of Saint Sophia. However, I was told that it was build before the Great Saint Sophia. This beautiful structure recently renovated dates back to Byzantine era as an Orthodox church, only after the Ottoman era it was converted to a mosque. A must see when you are in Sultanahmet district.
Small Ayasofya . Almost same to Ayasofya. Nice architectural mosque which was believed to be a church. The area is very simple and less visitors.

Old and beautiful former church . Very beautiful mosque with a long history as an orthodox church. Some traces all still found from 6th century from the relieves of pillars. There were kind man who told as about this church history and also times after Ottoman Empire.

Somewhat hidden historical church, now mosque. We used to know Hagia Sophia. Not many people know about Kucuk Aia Sophia, or Small Hagia Sophia. The former church is located down from Sultanahmet towards the seashore. It is not so glorious as the Hagia Sophia, but it is interesting to see its interior and trace remainings of the original church.

Little gem of a place. We visited this lovely little Mosque. Very beautiful. We met a man who showed us round as an informal guide. We realized he would expect payment, but he was interesting and answered our questions. Just be aware you might inadvertently start a conversation that leads to paying for a guide you didn't plan for. The also was a church before it became a mosque and is very beautiful. As it is a functioning Mosque there is no fee, but a donation box.

Always a highlight. Little Hagia Sophia (SS Sergius and Bacchus) was always an atmospheric place but is even better since the recent restoration. Great to combine with a visit to (the thousand years younger) Sokullu Mehmet Pasha Mosque, both only 5 minutes walk from the Hippodrome.

Oasis of calm. Even with the painters at work on the interior nothing could dispel the serene atmosphere of this delightful and very old building in a traditional part of Sultanahmet, a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque toward the Sea of Marmara.

Peaceful and Beautiful Respite from Busy Istanbul. Tucked away off the major tourist center of Sultanahmet, the Kucuk Ayasofya Camii (Little Ayasofya Mosque) is about a 7-8 minute walk from the main square. Built by Justinian in the 6th century, it is said to be the prototype for the much-larger Aya Sofia in Sultanahmet Square.The 7-8 minute walk will take you along well-traveled streets lined with a mix of shops and restaurants catering to both tourists and locals, and a few hotels.It was converted (as the Aya Sofia was) to a mosque after Constantinople fell to Mehmet the Conquerer in 1453. Kucuk Ayasofya is a working mosque; women are required to dress appropriately with headscarves; shoes are removed in the little alcove just inside the entrance - there's a convenient cubby-hole system along one wall to place your shoes until you are ready to leave. You'll see an older ablution fountain with a (non-working) hand pump on the inside - the current washing fountains are outside the structure in the courtyard.Elements of when the Greeks held the city are evident in the 'Greek key' architectural details, and you can climb the short flight of stairs to a platform and overlook the interior. Not many tourists, therefore very peaceful inside. Shades of cream and blue abound, and the interior design work of carvings, tiles, and paintings are not as overwhelming as some of the larger mosques. The cream and blue colors reminded us of Greece; as this was a Greek church for centuries, perhaps this is color scheme was an intentional choice.We can't say for certain if there was an entrance fee - we were so taken in by how lovely the mosque is - we recall leaving a 10 TL each donation (as of June 2016, ~$3.42), but due to our limited understanding of Turkish were not sure if that was an entrance fee or not.In many ways, we found Kucuk Ayasofya more beautiful than the better-known Aya Sofia because it is smaller, much less crowded, and it you can get much closer to see the beautiful tilework and architectural details. And, as long as there are no prayer services, you can sit as long as you like and enjoy the serenity.

Beautiful Byzantine Church now a Mosque again.. This is so like a small version of Aya Sofya, it was an obvious name to adopt ('kucuk' meaning small) and obvious that a story would develop that it was a model for the actual Aya Sofya. It is a beautiful example of a 6th century church, dedicated to 2 Christian Roman soldiers, although all the Byzantine mosaics and frescos were removed in the 16th century when it was converted into an Ottoman mosque. But the beautiful pillars and their intricately carved capitals, and the Greek friezes above them were left undamaged, either by the Ottomans or the more recent renovations. Although technically a museum since the Republic was formed in 1922, it seems to have again become a mosque after renovation, meaning ladies must now cover up and making viewing tricky on a Friday But definitely worth a visit. Make sure you go upstairs (but be careful on worn steps).

Underrated. It's not far from the Blue Mosque, and you get to wander around Sultanahmet on the way there. Originally a Greek Orthodox Church and also known as Little Hagia Sophia, it has the exterior architecture and some interior details of a church, but it's currently a Mosque and has Ottoman designs inside. As well as being beautiful, it's very peaceful and quiet

A gem that shouldn't be missed. If you are interested in Byzantine churches and architecture, make time to see this 6th-century church. You can walk to it from Hagia Sophia. Originally dedicated to Saints Sergius and Bacchus, it was built by Justinian before Hagia Sophia. It has many beautiful details. Be sure to climb the stairs to the gallery and look at the Greek inscriptions.
Visit this place ... Amazing place and amazing atmosphere .. Get the chance to sit beside one of the oldest spots in istanbul and also enjoy the service ;)

Don't Miss This when you leave Topkapi Palace. Little Hagia Sophia is stripped to the bone but because of that you see more. The dome, the balcony, the pulpit all seem to make the place appear more real that Hagia Sopia.

Not too many visitors. This is a transformed mosque, from an orginally in 6.th century built church. It is not on the main tourist routes, so if you get in there are not too many tourist. The original architecture is still to be seen. The locals call it "Little Aya Sofia".

A fine example of Byzantine-meets-Ottoman. We began our explorations today at the Kȕçȕk Ayasofya Mosque, built in the Sixth Century by the Byzantine Emperor Justinian as a church honoring Saints Sergius and Bacchus, the Fourth Century Roman Christian martyrs who appeared to the emperor in a dream. Because the “Little Hagia Sophia,” as it is known, retains the architectural features of the original church, it struck us as an example of the Ottoman practice of re-purposing Christian religious structures, often whitewashing over mosaics and frescoes, rather than tearing churches down to build mosques. Whether this practice demonstrated tolerance or frugality, it was a treat to see the surviving examples of Byzantine art.

Astonishing marble work. We were alone in this wonderful building on a holiday weekend in May. It is not more than 20 minutes walk from the crowded areas of Aya Sofia and The Blue Mosque but seems virtually unvisited. Anyone with any interest in architecture and history would be well advised to visit. The detailed marble work is of astonishing quality and in marvellous condition for its great age. I urge you to take the trouble to find it.

Another hidden gem. As with many architectural gems of Istanbul, the Kucuk Ayasofya (or small Hagia Sophia) is located out of the way. I wouldnt have known about its existence if not for an impromptu decision to join a tour to Topkapi Palace which includes a detour to the Kucuk Ayasofya.This mosque was a church built as a mock up for the real stuff hence some similarities in terms of architecture with the Hagia Sophia.
nice. nice place and important things its free :) if you near there also you can go visit.... nice to be there...

Old "Little Sophia". This ancient Church is now a mosque, but the beautiful greek words of holy Scripture (Bible ) are still carved in the facade inside. It is small and down by the shore of the Sea of Marmara, but it is really beautiful and peaceful. It is worth seeing and spending the time to walk there. From the tramline it is an 8 minute walk downhill.

Little Ayasofya. This Byzantine era church, built in the 6th century, like most other churches here was converted into a mosque.The single minaret mosque now stands just beyond the railway line along Kennedy Caddesi. I had to figure out a way to get to it on my morning walk because I found myself on the wrong side of the railway line. Nice church in typical Byzantine style architecture.

Away from the crowds. Little Aya Sofya (formerly SS Sergius and Bacchus church), is out of the tourist area (sorry not in Topkapi Palace area, that was a mistake). It was built at the same time as its big sister, and provides an interesting comparison for architecture buffs.

A miniature Ayasofya. A little church built by Justinian and Theodora just before they built the much grander Aya Sofya. After Constantinople was overrun by the Ottomans this small church was turned into a mosque. It is still a working mosque so it is still a matter of shoes off and dress modestly. We were fortunate to be there when the caretaker was vacuuming the carpets and he showed us a few things that we would have missed ourselves. The church is just down the hill from the Blue Mosque.
Small yet nice. The Kucuk hagia sophia was walking from our Sofia apartments. there is nothing much to see though. All the mosques in Istanbul look the same and are beautiful.
Excellent. Huge giant church which was converted to mosque and now converted it into museum. Neat and clean Area.

a place to visit after blue mosque visit , nice interiors for good photos and memories for ever. he detailed workmanship and great beauty are impressive plus we ended up with our own personal guide who had visited in the past and was more than happy to point out hidden treasures.
ayasofya. ayasofya ,a place to visit after blue mosque visit , nice interiors for good photos and memories for ever

Beautiful old church. A must see when you are in Istanbul. The detailed workmanship and great beauty are impressive plus we ended up with our own personal guide who had visited in the past and was more than happy to point out hidden treasures.

A Little Gem of a former Church now a Mosque. This little Church was one of the first churches built by Justinian around the early 500's AD. It also shows the the emergence of the new and distinctive Orthodox style of Architecture. (Also its is very near President Kennedy road which I found amusing for some reason.) Its dome for some reason was very hypnotic to me. I am glad that I know of it.

A small but very nice place. We were the only visitors on a Saturday morning. It is a small but very quiet place and it is worth a visit if you are in the neighborhood. We stayed about 10-15 minutes.It is free but we were asked to make a donation.
Magical!. I went on a Sunday morning early-ish (10h30) and had the mosque all by myself! It was truly magical! It's small and intimate and absolutely stunning. Highly recommend.
beautiful little mosque. these little mosques are just great masterpieces. Is just like when you walk into Rome and find smal unknown churches that are so nice and breathtaking

A small but magnificent building. Not the typical tourist attraction in Istanbul but it is just as incredible as others. It is very beautiful inside out. It is not crowded so you can a peaceful time appreciating this 1600 year old mosque

Great!. We visited this mosque with our group and guide. Perfect place, absolute silence and peace. No mosaics inside but you can see the columns and cross on them. Has a beautiful garden with little shops of old books and ceramics.

A charming Church - Mosque. This is another great sample of Byzantine art and architecture. If you have extra time in the Old Town, do visit this one. It is functioning as a mosque today. Be aware of the prayer times before visiting.

Must see; way older than Hagia Sofia and no lines!. This is a lovely little mosque that is much much older than the "Big" Hagia Sofia. It, too, as also a church that was converted to a mosque. However, the "little" Hagia Sofia is still a functioning mosque. It is set back away from all the major sites and has no line. It is quite small but pretty and has a lot of history. A lot of the original artwork/decoration was covered when it became a mosque. As with most mosques in Istanbul, you will be asked to cover your head/shoulders with a scarf (if you are a woman) and possibly you legs if they are bare (men and women) and to remove your shoes, all before you can enter the mosque. There was no entrance charge.

a church older than present st.sophia. it s just 10 minutes away from sultanahmet mosque on the sea shore direction and its one of the most important church in the city from early Byzantiun period.it s still being used as a mosque .you must use your imagination in order to recapture the the beautiful original conditions of the walls that were once revetted with marbles and mosaics.Beautiful marble columns and their capitals sculptured like lace work is trult amazing.its one of the must see places in istanbul.

Beautiful Byzantine Architecture. Due to a poor map, we had a hard time finding this mosque. But the former church stands only about a 10-minute walk from Aya Sofya. I think it is worth going out of one's way to visit because of the Byzantine architecture and the building's history. The red-brick structure features an imposing dome and an irregular octagon shape. Inside, big columns remain from the building's days as a church. Justinian and his wife, Theodora, built the little church at some point between 527 and 536, just before Justinian's massive Aya Sofya went up. The minaret and madrasah, now used for other purposes, date from the church's conversion to a mosque in 1500.The mosque proved to be extremely quiet. Only one other person joined us inside. We took about 10 minutes to look around and then left for the small tea room that occupies part of the former madrasah. The tea was good; the WC proved to be in deplorable condition.

Kucuk Ayasofya Camii (Little Hagia Mosque). Marvelous architecture, peace & calm atmosphere. Located in Kucuk Ayasofya Dist., very much close to Meydan Arkasi, st.# 15, Sultanahmet, Istanbul-34122, Turkey.

Small old church converted into mosque. Unless you got time to spare after you visited the major sites, this ex-church converted to mosque is nice to visit for as a peaceful alternative to other historical sites. Nice courtyard and a ultra-friendly cat awaits you there.

Church and mosque. Originally The Church of Sergios and Bachos. converted into mosque but you can see the traces of the church! It's really clear to see the Byzantine columns and the inscription all above the columns.

Amazing place!. Outstanding architecture, the size of everything inside, ranging from pillars, domes, candelabra is surprising and incredible. Very busy though. Try to be there well before 10am and preferably on a weekday.
The little Hagia Sofia. When you see this mosque it has similar architecture remeniscent of Hagia Sofia . The architect who did this is the same architect who designed Hagia Sofia
Hagia Sophia in miniature.. This small wonder of church architecture from the Byzantine period is certainly worth a visit. Is easy to find with the city map. Visit it every time I am in Istanbul.
Little Haghia Sophia. Kucuk Ayasofya Camii is a small mosque close to the Blue Mosque in Sultanahmet. Beautiful inside and well worth a visit. Open daily.
Small Hagia Sofia. already the walk from big Hagia Sofia is worth the trip. cute little mosque with nice decoration and beautiful carpet

Little Aya Sofia Mosque... A Little Gem near the Blue Mosque. This was a 2 minute walk from our hotel so we visited it a couple of times. Though opening hours state 9:30 onwards, when we got there around 10:00, there was no one there to open the mosque though the garden/cafe area was open.We made another visit a day or so later and were invited in. Small mosque but beautifully decorated. We were allowed to go upstairs where usually the muezzin (the person who makes the call to prayer) stands and take a few photographs from different angles.Usually very quiet as we didn't see many tourists there, so very different from the Blue Mosque in that way!If you're visiting the Blue Mosque, make your way here after (about a 5 minute walk) - it's worth it!
Worth a detour to visit. A nice little attraction tucked away from the main tourist trail of Istanbul. It is now a mosque, but was once a church. The neighbourhood around is also nice

Little Hagia Sophia. Close to the ruins of Great Palace and Sphendon, former Byzantine Orthodox church. Very cosy part of the city. Now is serving as a mosque. still you can see the columns and ornamentations.

A church turn Mosque turn museum. If you want to see where the Emperors of Rome were crowned..then you must visit this site. You will also see beautiful Christian motives super imposed by Islamic writings
Beautiful sight. if time to visit only one mosque in Istanbul, this is the one. The architecture, the mix of Catholic architecture and Islam is superb. The old wall mosaics are worth the visit.

One of the best places in Istanbul. Just 5 minutes downhill from the Hippodromes, this astonishing building, formerly a Byzantine church and now a mosque is breath-taking. The classical Justinian Byzantine Architecture may be admired here and if you can read Greek you may still read the inscription around the internal walls. Visit in the afternoon and take some time to also drink a cup of coffee or tea in the nearby places and admire the building. Ask the keeper to lift the carpet as you enter the main hall and see the original floor.

Delightful. "Little Hagia Sophia" was built in 527AD although constructed some five years before Hagia Sophia, the church earned its nickname because of its resemblance to the Great Church. The buildings are similar in design but each has their own individuality. The church has an irregular plan.Four octagonal pillars, around the top of which are inscriptions that honour Justinian, his wife Theodora and St Sergius, support the vaulted central dome. The gallery above affords an excellent view of the interior which was decorated with coloured marble facings and lavishly decorative golden mosaics. The church was converted to a mosque shortly after Mehmet's conquest of the city.The mosque is located beyond the southern end of the Arasta Bazaar, along Ayasofya Cadd. It can also be accessed from the sea front, past the Bucoleon Palace, via a tunnel under the railway line.

Stroll down the street and meet a gem. The Kücük Ayasofya Camii (als known as SS Sergus and Bacchus) is known as a precursor to the big Hagia Sophia.It is a building from around AD 530. The interior is sheer magic!

A hidden gem!. You may have a little bit of difficulty in finding this gem, but when you do, you will truly enjoy the structure and the serenity of its grounds. As a builder, I truly appreciate the imperfections of the structure i.e. the mezzanine construction. @instabuilt
Wonderful hidden mosque. You need to look for it, but once you find it is really worth, full of bizantine details in capitels and signs
Great. While you are in ayasofya many interesting points needs to be stop at in details reading the history and learning many things
A quick trip. It is a great place to visit but very limited in appeal. You can really take your time and still cover it in just 30 mins max.

A former orthodox church. The church was dedicated to the Saints Sergius and Bacchus,but turned into a camii at the Ottoman Empire. It is a small but lovely church, which although is not so famous to the tourists, however it is worth visiting.

Combination of Islamic and Christianity Architecture. Combination of Islamic and Christianity Architecture.nice and great. don't go there without tour guider. you ought to know alot of history story about it.

Great History of two faiths.. This was originally a church in Constantinople that they changed to a Mosk after the Otoman empire took it over. It still has some original church markings as well as Muslim Mosk markings. A must see.

A peaceful working mosque monument. Don't miss this small yet working mosque with beautiful neighbourhoods while you do the big ticket items in Istanbul. The carpet and decor is beautiful as is the mosque peaceful.

smaller agia sophia but just as beautiful!. after seeing the extrodinary agia sofia....walk further down straight pass the blue mosque on a bit of a down hill ask around and they will tell you!... its totally free and its beautiful and i think its older than the agia sofia its self...it was peaceful and absolutley beautiful....around the area there are a lot of little restaurants and good eats!...

Loved it - Baby Aya of Sophia. This is a good example of a mini Aya of Sophia - Built in the Byzantine period, older than Sophia, relatively close to the bigger Sophia, its free, and a short walk through the Arasta Bazaar then keep going a few more blocks. Very peaceful. When I was there, I was all alone and no other tourists. No food at the site, but around the site there are lots of cute places to eat.
good a place. great a place and free if you near there you must see this place when you going to istanbul we went to there many times great a place....
Keep time for this one. Smaller but older n tucked away so no crowds n line n big ticket enterance!!! Anf just the walk there will show u other stuff
Peaceful place. Fantastic place with a lot of history.Built during the byzantine period, Occupied by the ottomans who kept Christian paintings and mosaic intact.

A place to see for all Aya Sofya fans. Our guide informed us that this building was constructed as a sort of trial run for Hagia Sophia and you can really see it when you visit. As the others said, this is a mosque, so wear appropriate clothing and avoid prayer times.

A quiet peaceful visit.. A quiet visit to a beautiful, decorated mosque. It is worth seeking this place out as it is devoid of the crowds elsewhere. The small artisans' quarter nearby is interesting too. You can also get a glass of tea here too.
Nice and free. Nice camii and free we love it this place down küçük Ayasofya and beautiful place if you near there you must go see this place and free :) very good a place...

Wonderful Opportunity . This is an active mosque so be sure to check prayer times ahead of schedule and ensure appropriate clothing - safest with long trousers and a loose fitting top (for females), a scarf to cover your hair is also required (again, for the ladies). There are scarfs and cloaks available to borrow inside. Expect to remove your shoes too, I left mine outside with no issue.It was my first trip to a mosque and I was a little unsure (worried to ignorantly offend if I'm honest), but it is a quiet area away from the hustle and the 'process' for visiting is clearly marked out on helpful signs to allow you to get on with it respectfully.It's a beautiful building and quite old - I specifically visited in order to see the Byzantine frieze that runs beneath the gallery inside. Amazing.It was also a great education.There is no charge for visiting active mosques, but donations are welcome - there is a box for this just after the cloakroom.
Not a "must-go" place. Kuchuk Aya Sofya mosque is just nearby Ottoman Hotel Park that we stayed. Nice mosque but nothing to compare to Aya Soyfa in Sultan Ahmet square
Absolutely worth a visit - and it is FREE. Absolutely worth a visit. Entrance is free. You have a feeling that you are in a sanctuary. Clothes are provided for tourist for appropriate entry.
Hidden gem. Another hidden object from organize tourism, but if you want to see one of Istanbul gem - please visit it, small but very nice. Near is very good restourant
Ayasofya Mosque and church.. Where peace and love are present between the religions. Not to be missed a visit to such a beautiful peace of art.

Nice place conveniently located close to the Blue Mosque. This so-called "small Saint Sophia" is located at the southern border of Sultanahmet, close to the Marmara Sea, not far from the Blue Mosque. It is much less crowded than more central attractions, and it is really worth a visit: it's quiet and well kept, with a nice inside and an external colonnade.
Amazing architecture. This temple is a real human miracle. I think this is a place that everyone has to visit in Konstantinopolis.

Ancient "Church "Mosque. Behind the Blue Mosque and through the Arasta Bazaar you will come into KucukAyaSophia Caddessi. At the end of this road you will find a The small Ayah sophia Mosque which was originally a church. The design is based on the big Ayahsophia. The interior is as spectacular - white marble and beautiful artistry and architecture. Do go up the stairs for views from the top. even though the interior has been restored upstairs but covered with protective glass you can see parts of the original brick wall structure. Note the peculiar water pump and spout inside at the bottom of the stairs. Great architectural and historical significance. please spare the time to go and see this structure. you will not be disappointed. If you have more time to spare and then take a walk to Yenikapi fishing harbour not far.

A peaceful haven and a beautiful mosque. For a real spiritual feeling, visit this mosque that served as a model, they say, for the Aya Sophia. Once a church, it has been better converted to a mosque than many others. Not crowded and beautiful architecture.

A must to see before visiting. Sergios Bachos Church or Küçük Ayasofya Camii. Has the basic plans of Main Hygia Sophia and Many other cathedrals in Europe as well. I guess it is too far from its originality but is worth so see before visiting the main Wonderful One. If you have time ask Giritli Restaurant which is not too far and have a taste the plenty of mezes.
Eclectic interior.. Bright little mosque that offers eclectic interior. Some of the columns are particularly interesting as they date from Byzantine time.

Easy to Miss. We found this former church while searching for a recommended restaurant. It may lack the majesty and grandeur of its more famous sister and does not have any mosaic frescoes, most of the Christian symbols having been obliterated, but it still impresses with its original marble column and interior sereneness. Headscarves are mandatory but available on loan. Be sure to have a glass of tea in the courtyard which seems to be a bubble of calm, perhaps the legacy of centuries of faith & prayer.
I want to go there again. One of the main reasons i visited Istanbul was to visit Ayasofya, very beautiful indeed. I was unlucky the place was under maintenance, i have to go there again

Little gem of a mosque. I love this little mosque. I always go to it when I am in Istanbul, as it is a happy little building, light and bright with it's blue and white colors that make it look like delft blue and white pottery. There is a little tea garden in it's front yard, and several artists have set up their shops there. The art in the tea garden is exquisite, and you will not find such high quality pictures and jewelry in the bazaar.
An oasis of calm.. A hidden gem, near enough to the centre and yet uncrowded and peaceful. Helpful staff. Must go back again to this small but perfectly formed haven.

Lovely. A bit further from the big Aya Sofia and far from the crowd, the little sofya is one of the loveliest mosque to visit. It used to be formerly a christian church, superbly redecorated. One of our most touching visits in Istanbul.
Not to be missed. This mosque/church is not be missed when you travel to Istanbul. Also the site is beautiful at night if you go have a drink on the Four Seasons roof top.

thr most important building of the world. Its a little bad that is not quit finished restauration,considering that is one of the most important building of the world.Dont forget thats created in the V-th century,(with 1000 years older than Blue Mosque,another capodopera) and ist a litlle bad also the religional revendications,....that building is creeated from the bysantines,.....not ortodoxes or not muslims....

Best Kept Secret. Visited on 3 July 2015 and saw the evidence of coversion of the church into a mosque:-i.e. the prayer mat and the side walls were slanting. Normally a typical mosque will have side walls aligned to the "kiblat" - direction of Mecca.

if you have time please make the effort. not far from Blue Mosque and no crowds when we visited. A lovely building with a lot of history (a very different experience to the madness of Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque). If you can afford it, please leave a donation to upkeep this historic building.
Hmm, probably my favorite moscque. it is gorgeous but understated instead of the usual clash of patterns and colors. And it was less crowded too.

Multiple layers of history. One suggestion: take a guide. Make him take you to the second floor as well. There is so much history in this place that you need someone to guide you. Alternatively you could use the audio-guides available at the entrance.
Beautiful mosque. I very much like this tiny mosque however it looks very simple and quiet but has a lot to present. There are different type of architectures in this building.

Rich in History and still standing through the millenia.. Glad we hired a guide as she was able to circumvent the long lines. a lot of the interior was under scaffold annoying but necessary to make sure great buildings do not deteriorate. The size and history from Christian to Moslem to Museum make this a worthwhile visit.
